The festival creates a multi-day camping experience with diverse stages, food vendors, art installations, and cultural programming that extends beyond music into visual arts and interactive experiences.

name: Seoul Lantern Festival
desc: A stunning outdoor lantern festival illuminating Seoul's Cheonggyecheon Stream with thousands of elaborate floating lanterns.
details: The Seoul Lantern Festival transforms the Cheonggyecheon Stream into a glowing winter wonderland. Hundreds of handmade lanterns depicting themes from Korean history, folklore, and pop culture line the restored urban stream. The lanterns' reflections in the water create a magical atmosphere. K-pop themed lanterns and interactive installations appeal to international visitors.

name: Smukfest (Skanderborg Festival)
desc: Denmark's 'Most Beautiful Festival' — a non-profit, eco-minded celebration in a lakeside forest near Skanderborg with international music and family activities.
details: Named Denmark's Most Beautiful Festival, SmukFest takes over a forest outside the lakeside city of Skanderborg for four days of international music, family-friendly activities, and eco-conscious celebration. The non-profit festival is volunteer-driven and emphasizes sustainability. The natural forest setting beside the lake creates an unusually peaceful atmosphere for a major music event.

name: 14th Taipei Biennial: Whispers on the Horizon
desc: Curated by Sam Bardaouil and Till Fellrath, featuring 150 works by 72 artists from 37 cities exploring yearning as vital tension.
details: The Taipei Biennale at the Taipei Fine Arts Museum is one of Asia's most respected contemporary art exhibitions. Each edition features a different curator and theme, with works by international and Taiwanese artists exploring contemporary social and political themes. The museum's modernist building in Yuanshan provides an excellent exhibition space.

name: Toronto International Film Festival (TIFF)
desc: One of the world's most prestigious film festivals, considered the leading predictor of Oscar winners.
details: TIFF is one of the most important film festivals in the world, screening approximately 300 films from 60+ countries. The People's Choice Award has an remarkable track record of predicting Oscar Best Picture winners. The festival transforms Toronto's Entertainment District with red carpet premieres, celebrity sightings, and public screenings.

name: Malta Biennale 2026
desc: A global art showcase across stunning Maltese heritage locations, featuring 100+ artists and 29 national/thematic pavilions.
details: Malta Biennale 2026 is housed in over 90 museums protected by Heritage Malta, bringing contemporary art to historic spaces. Artistic Director Rosa Martínez oversees 80+ events with 100+ artists. The festival features 29 national and thematic pavilions across Malta and Gozo, positioning the islands as a Mediterranean cultural hub.

name: Waitangi Day
desc: New Zealand's national day celebrated with cultural performances at the historic Treaty Grounds.
details: Waitangi Day is New Zealand's national day, commemorating the signing of the Treaty of Waitangi in 1840. The main celebrations at the Waitangi Treaty Grounds feature Maori cultural performances, waka (canoe) ceremonies, speeches, live music, and community festivities.

name: Formosan Aboriginal Culture Village Harvest Festival
desc: Celebration of Taiwan indigenous harvest traditions with traditional music, dance, and rituals from 16 recognized tribes.
details: The harvest season brings celebrations across Taiwan's indigenous communities, with the Formosan Aboriginal Culture Village hosting a concentrated showcase. Traditional harvest dances, millet wine ceremonies, and rituals from multiple tribes including the Amis, Paiwan, and Bunun peoples highlight Taiwan's pre-Han cultural heritage.

name: Fuji Rock Festival
desc: Asia's premier outdoor music festival set in the lush mountains of Naeba Ski Resort with over 200 artists across 7+ stages.
details: Fuji Rock is Japan's premier outdoor music festival, held at Naeba Ski Resort in the mountains of Niigata. Despite its name, it's nowhere near Mt. Fuji. Over 200 domestic and international acts perform across multiple stages set amidst lush green forests. The festival is renowned for its clean, well-organized atmosphere and respectful audience. Past headliners include Radiohead, Bjork, and Kendrick Lamar.

name: Feria Nacional de San Marcos 2026
desc: Latin America's largest fair, featuring concerts, art, culture, gastronomy, sports, and local talent in emblematic spaces.
details: The 2026 edition offers over 2,000 events with 80% being free admission. Features include: Nissan Stars Forum with 23 free international concerts (Goo Goo Dolls, J Balvin, Andrea Bocelli, Foreigner, David Guetta, Empire of the Sun); Palenque concerts with regional and national artists; folklore dances; charreadas (rodeos); escaramuza shows. Madrid, Spain and Chihuahua state are guests of honor. General admission is approximately 60 pesos. Ticket sales begin February 20 through boleclick.mx.

name: Albuquerque Gathering of Nations Powwow
desc: The largest powwow in North America, bringing together over 3,000 Native dancers and singers from 700+ tribes.
details: Held at Expo New Mexico (Tingley Coliseum), the Gathering of Nations is the world's largest powwow, featuring over 3,000 Native American and indigenous dancers and singers from more than 700 tribes across the US and Canada. The event includes the Miss Indian World pageant, a Stage 49 contemporary music concert, and the Indian Traders Market with over 800 artisans.

name: Karneval der Kulturen (Carnival of Cultures)
desc: Berlin's vibrant multicultural street festival celebrating diversity with a colorful parade, music from five continents, and food from around the world.
details: The Karneval der Kulturen celebrates Berlin's multiculturalism with a colorful parade featuring over 70 groups with elaborate costumes, dance performances, and music from five continents. The four-day street festival in Kreuzberg features stages with world music, an international food court, and cultural workshops. It's a powerful expression of Berlin's identity as one of Europe's most diverse cities.

name: Feria de las Flores y del Café (Flowers and Coffee Fair)
desc: Annual celebration of Boquete's outstanding flower and coffee production featuring floral displays, dance performances, food, artisan markets, and amusement park attractions.
details: The Feria de las Flores y el Café de Boquete celebrates the region's exceptional flowers and coffee. Beginning in 1950 as the Coffee Festival and initially held sporadically, by 1973 it transformed into the Boquete Flower and Coffee Fair, emphasizing gardens and exceptional coffee. In the early 1990s, festival dates moved to January to take advantage of Panama's dry season. The festival features stunning floral displays, dance performances, delicious food, artisan markets, lively dance areas, and amusement park attractions for all ages. Live music performances by local and international artists, cultural shows celebrating Panamanian traditions, and illuminated gardens with scenic river paths enhance the experience. Hours run 9:00 am to 7:00 pm. Many vendors may not accept credit cards, so carry cash. Prepare for the cool evening climate and pack rain gear, as rain remains possible despite the dry season.

name: Barbados Crop Over Festival
desc: Annual 3-month-long festival of Barbadian music, arts, food, culture celebrating the official end of sugar cane season.
details: One of the most popular and colorful events in the Caribbean. Celebrates the official end of the sugar cane season with parties and festivities from dusk to dawn, arts and crafts markets, culinary-driven street fairs. Calypso is a main feature with calypsonians organized into "tents" competing for prizes: Party Monarch, Sweet Soca Monarch, Road March Monarch, Pic-O-De-Crop Monarch. Grand Kadooment Day (August 3, 2026) is the grand finale—a spectacular street parade featuring extravagant costumes, energetic soca music, and lively dancing starting early at the National Stadium with masquerade bands traversing city streets in sequin costumes with colorful feathers, jewels, and bright accents.

name: Virgen de Caacupé pilgrimage
desc: Major national pilgrimage and religious celebration to the Basilica of Caacupé.

name: Copenhagen Jazz Festival
desc: One of Europe's largest jazz festivals, transforming Copenhagen into a city of jazz across hundreds of venues.
details: For over a week, Copenhagen becomes a jazz city with concerts in clubs, squares, parks, and streets. From classic jazz to fusion and experimental, the festival presents both international legends and Danish talents. Many outdoor events are free. Historic venues like Jazzhus Montmartre host intimate evening sessions.

name: Art Basel Qatar (Inaugural Edition)
desc: The inaugural edition of Art Basel in Doha, marking Qatar's entry as a major global art fair destination.
details: Qatar launches a major new global art fair with the inaugural Art Basel Qatar, positioning Doha alongside Miami, Basel, Hong Kong, and Paris as a top-tier art market destination. International galleries, collectors, advisors, and media will converge for what promises to be a landmark moment in the Middle East art world.

name: World Art Dubai
desc: The premier international art fair in the Middle East, heavily featuring art from the Global South.
details: Art Dubai distinguishes itself by looking eastward and southward, bridging the art markets of the MENA region, Southeast Asia, and Africa. Its 'Bawwaba' section specifically highlights non-Western artistic practices.

name: Sada Festival (Fire Festival)
desc: Ancient Persian fire festival marking 100 days before Navruz with bonfires and traditional celebrations.
details: Ancient Persian fire festival marking 100 days before Navruz held at Iram Garden and Hippodrome. Features bonfires, traditional crafts, and traditional foods. Celebrates the ancient Zoroastrian heritage of Tajik culture.

name: International Poetry Festival of Granada
desc: Annual gathering of poets, writers, and audiences bringing together international voices for readings and public events in Granada's historic venues and public squares.
details: The International Poetry Festival of Granada takes place each February in the colonial city of Granada and is Nicaragua's best-known cultural event internationally. Founded in 2005, the festival brings together poets, writers, and audiences from Nicaragua and abroad for several days of readings and public events. Activities are held across Granada, including public squares, theaters, churches, and cultural venues, with many readings open to the public. Events typically include poetry readings, discussions, workshops, and tributes, often presented in Spanish with translations or bilingual formats. Over the years, the festival has hosted poets from dozens of countries, establishing Granada as a regional hub for literary and cultural exchange. The International Poetry Festival is also the largest poetry festival in the world, making Granada a significant destination for literature lovers and cultural enthusiasts.

name: Carnaval de Guaranda
desc: One of Ecuador's largest traditional events recognized as Intangible Cultural Heritage fusing sacred, social, and Andean traditions.
details: Programming extended over weeks with main celebrations February 13-17 and February 15-17 highlight days. Key events: Pregón of Carnaval Festivities (Fri, Jan 30), Entrada del Taita Carnaval (Sat, Feb 7), Pregón de la Confraternidad (Sun, Feb 15). Comparsas de la Alegría (Feb 15, 10 AM) with allegorical floats and dancing. Show Artístico Internacional de la Confraternidad (Feb 15, 3 PM) featuring Chino Willy, Living Rock, Las Musas del Vallenato, Los Búfalos, Andy Rivera, Corazón Serrano. Agenda includes parades, artistic shows, traditional coplas, comparsas, gastronomic festivals, Pawkar Raymi Intercultural 2026 featuring Andean traditions.

name: Festival Folklórico Nacional Guatemala
desc: National celebration bringing Guatemalans together to showcase indigenous beauty and Mayan cultural traditions with delegations representing all ethnic groups.
details: The National Folkloric Festival celebrates Guatemala's rich indigenous heritage. The festival held in Guatemala City in February features free admission and cultural performances at Plaza de la Constitución. The Cobán edition in July is considered the most important indigenous cultural celebration, bringing delegations representing all Mayan ethnic groups currently existing in Guatemala. Activities include street fairs, parades, concerts, and parties throughout the celebrations—the perfect opportunity to learn about and participate in diverse Mayan cultures and traditions.

name: Festival de las Máscaras de Hatillo (Hatillo Mask Festival)
desc: A celebration blending historical roots with vibrant cultural traditions rooted in the biblical Massacre of the Innocents story.
details: Every December 28, the town of Hatillo transforms into a riot of color, music, and chaos. Upwards of 30,000 people attend to see parade participants—human and equine—donning intricate ruffled costumes and beautifully decorated papier-mâché masks that are exceptional pieces of authentic Puerto Rican art. Townspeople historically dressed as soldiers wearing colorful masks to mock King Herod's soldiers, symbolically protecting children from harm. The festival traces origins back to the 1820s, rooted in a unique blend of religious tradition and local folklore. Book accommodations early in Hatillo or nearby towns like Arecibo, Camuy, or Isabela.

name: Art Basel Hong Kong
desc: Asia's definitive premier art fair, serving as the gateway between Eastern and Western markets.
details: Held at the HKCEC, this fair provides an unmatched overview of the Asia-Pacific art scene. It remains critical for global galleries looking to access deep pools of Asian wealth and for regional artists seeking international exposure.

name: Carnaval de Jacmel (Jacmel Carnival)
desc: A major showcase of Haitian cultural creativity featuring the famous papier-mâché masks that are emblems of Jacmel Carnival.
details: Carnivalgoers have gathered every weekend since Jan. 18, with festivities peaking on the final Carnival weekend. DJs, dance companies, artists, and models parade through the main streets of the tourist city. The famous papier-mâché masks—emblems of Jacmel Carnival—captivate the public with their originality, finesse, and symbolic significance, testifying to ancestral know-how passed down generation to generation. The Jacmel carnival showcases mythical figures from Haiti's collective imagination such as Chaloska, Lanset Kod, and Yawe. Jacmel is Haiti's cultural capital, boasting a rich artistic tradition particularly in papier-mâché.

name: Kamakura Fireworks Festival
desc: Beach fireworks festival with spectacular underwater fireworks off the historic Kamakura coast.
details: The Kamakura Fireworks Festival at Yuigahama Beach features a unique element: underwater fireworks (suichu hanabi) that burst spectacularly from the sea's surface. Combined with aerial displays, the fireworks illuminate both sky and ocean. The historic coastal setting and nearby temples make it a perfect summer evening destination.

name: Karatsu Okunchi Autumn Festival
desc: Spectacular festival with 14 massive elaborately painted float heads representing sea creatures and samurai helmets.
details: Karatsu Kunchi features 14 massive hikiyama floats, each topped with an enormous lacquered paper-mache head depicting sea bream, dragons, samurai helmets, and other figures. Weighing 2-5 tons each, the floats are pulled through the sandy streets by teams of chanters. The highlight is the Otabisho-shinko on November 3 when all 14 floats line up on the beach.

name: Ashura Commemoration
desc: Annual Shia religious commemoration of martyrdom of Imam Hussain with millions of pilgrims in Karbala.
details: Millions of Iraqi Shia participate in mourning rituals. Mosque sheikhs retell Battle of Karbala. Black-clad mourners flood streets. Traditional rituals and religious observance.

name: Wianki Festival
desc: Poland's enchanting Midsummer celebration on the Vistula River, where wreaths are set adrift, bonfires are lit, and fireworks light up the Kraków sky.
details: Wianki is a traditional Polish midsummer festival with roots in pre-Christian Slavic traditions. The name means 'wreaths' — girls make flower wreaths and set them adrift on the Vistula River to predict their romantic future. The modern festival includes concerts, dancing, bonfires, and spectacular fireworks. Kraków's version, set along the Vistula beneath Wawel Castle, is the most atmospheric.

name: Timkat Lalibela
desc: Timkat celebration at the iconic rock-hewn churches of Lalibela with ancient processional traditions.
details: The Timkat celebration at Lalibela's UNESCO rock-hewn churches is among the most atmospheric in Ethiopia. White-robed pilgrims and priests carrying tabots process through the extraordinary 12th-century carved churches, creating scenes that appear unchanged for centuries.

name: Electric Daisy Carnival (EDC) Las Vegas
desc: The largest electronic dance music festival in North America, a neon-lit spectacle at the Las Vegas Motor Speedway.
details: EDC Las Vegas transforms the Las Vegas Motor Speedway into a massive playground of electronic music, featuring over 200 DJs across 8+ elaborately designed stages. Known for its carnival rides, art installations, fireworks, and the iconic dusk-till-dawn schedule, EDC is a bucket-list experience for electronic music fans.

name: Laura Quinkan Aboriginal Dance Festival
desc: Major celebration of Indigenous culture with traditional dances, art, and storytelling on Cape York.
details: The Laura Aboriginal Dance Festival brings together Indigenous communities from across Cape York and beyond for a powerful celebration of Aboriginal culture. Traditional dances, corroborees, art, storytelling, and cultural sharing take place against the backdrop of ancient rock art sites.

name: Fiestas Patrias (Peru Independence Day)
desc: Peru's most important national holiday celebrating independence from Spain with military parades, concerts, fireworks, and patriotic festivities throughout the country.
details: Peru's Independence Day, known as Fiestas Patrias, celebrates Peru's declaration of independence from Spain on July 28, 1821. Celebrations begin on the evening of July 27 with serenades and cultural activities held in squares like Plaza de Armas or Parque Kennedy. July 28 begins with a 21-cannon salute and flag-raising ceremony in Lima, followed by a Te Deum service led by the archbishop and attended by the President. Thousands tune in to the President's Message to the Nation, then enjoy the traditional Military Parade held on Brazil Avenue on July 29. The Gran Corso, a massive parade with hundreds of people in bright costumes backed by energetic drum lines, occurs in Miraflores. Government offices, banks, and most businesses close. Cities nationwide come alive with concerts, flag-raising ceremonies, school parades, folkloric dances, and fireworks. Lima hosts the most elaborate festivities with lively nightlife, especially among younger crowds.

name: LA Art Show
desc: The most comprehensive international contemporary art show in America's entertainment capital.
details: Featuring over 100 galleries, the show leans heavily into pop surrealism, street art, and NFT integration, reflecting the unique tastes of the Hollywood and Silicon Beach collector bases.

name: ARCOmadrid
desc: The 45th edition of Spain's premier art fair, featuring a special focus on the Amazon.
details: ARCO serves as the primary bridge between the European and Latin American art markets. It is known for its strong institutional purchasing and its ability to highlight political and ecological themes within a commercial framework.

name: Festival de Santo Domingo de Guzmán (Santo Domingo Celebration)
desc: 10-day celebration honoring Santo Domingo de Guzmán, Managua's patron saint, featuring grand processions, carnival rides, bullfights, fairs, and traditional foods.
details: The Fiestas Patronales de Santo Domingo take place in Managua each year from August 1 to August 10 and represent Nicaragua's largest and most visible city festival. The celebrations honor Santo Domingo de Guzmán, the capital's patron saint. One of the most iconic events is the grand procession taking place on the festival's first and last days, involving carrying a statue of Santo Domingo, affectionately known as "Minguito," from the Church of Las Sierritas to the Santo Domingo de Managua Church on August 1 and back again on August 10. In addition to processions and masses, the festival features carnival rides including a giant Ferris wheel, equestrian parades, and bullfights that draw significant crowds. The event boasts numerous fairs where visitors purchase popular art, toys, and religious items while enjoying carnival food. The festival primarily takes place in and around the Church of Las Sierritas, located approximately 5 miles (8 km) from central Managua.

name: Feria de la Chinita
desc: Eight-day religious festival honoring Virgin of Chiquinquirá ("La Chinita") with gaitas music, parades, and traditional celebrations.
details: Festival blending religious reverence with lively music celebrating the Virgin of Chiquinquirá. Features colorful parades, folk dance displays with folkloric comparsas, bright costumes, traditional dances. Gaitas zulianas (Zulian musical genre) performances express devotion and tribute to the Virgin. Food stalls offering Zulian specialties: fried plantain, arepas, fresh Lake Maracaibo seafood. Activities: Masses, processions, concerts, bullfights, traditional baseball games. Book accommodations early as festival fills quickly.

name: VENDIMIA - Fiesta Nacional de la Vendimia
desc: Iconic harvest celebration honoring Mendoza's wine production with ceremonial blessings, royal court elections, and parades.
details: The 2026 edition marks the 90th anniversary under the theme "90 cosechas de una misma cepa" (90 harvests of the same lineage). The festival includes the Paseo Federal pre-celebrations, the Blessing of Fruits ceremony, the Vía Blanca nocturnal parade on March 6, the main Carrusel parade on March 7, the coronation of the new national queen, and the Central Act with performances. The festival celebrates Mendoza's viticultural heritage and features indigenous wine culture.

name: Busójárás (Busó Carnival)
desc: A UNESCO-recognized Hungarian winter festival where masked figures in sheepskin and carved wooden masks drive away winter with fire, bells, and thunderous noise along the Danube.
details: This extraordinary six-day folk tradition features hand-carved wooden masks, sheepskin costumes, and cowbells as busós parade through Mohács to chase away winter. Highlights include the dramatic Danube boat crossing, bonfires, craft workshops, and the burning of a winter coffin on Shrove Tuesday. UNESCO recognized it as Intangible Cultural Heritage in 2016. The tradition has pagan and South Slavic (Šokac) roots passed through generations.

name: Festival Internacional de Cine de Morelia (FICM)
desc: Mexico's second-largest film festival promoting Latin American cinema with international recognition.
details: The 24th edition features in-person screenings in Morelia and virtual options. Venues include Cinépolis Morelia Centro, Cinépolis Las Américas, Mariano Matamoros Theater, and others. The FICM positions itself as a practical platform for filmmakers, with Mexican cinema at its heart and visibility for works and directors of different generations. The festival supports independent and emerging filmmakers while celebrating established voices in Latin American cinema.

name: Nikko Toshogu Grand Spring Festival
desc: Spectacular procession of 1,000 samurai warriors at the ornate mausoleum of Tokugawa Ieyasu.
details: The Nikko Toshogu Grand Festival features the Hyakumono-Zoroe Sennin Gyoretsu—a procession of 1,000 men in samurai armor and traditional costumes recreating the funeral cortege of Tokugawa Ieyasu. Set against the incredibly ornate UNESCO World Heritage shrine complex in the mountains of Nikko, it is one of Japan's most visually stunning historical parades.

name: Paléo Festival Nyon
desc: Switzerland's biggest open-air festival with 250,000 attendees and 250+ concerts.
details: Paléo Festival brings 250+ concerts across 7 stages over 6 days, with rock, pop, electronic, rap, and world music. The 2026 edition features a 'Village of the World' exploring Scandinavian culture.

name: Óbidos International Chocolate Festival
desc: A chocolate lover's paradise in Portugal's fairy-tale medieval walled town, with chocolate sculptures, tastings, cooking demonstrations, and workshops.
details: Inside the whitewashed walls of medieval Óbidos, this festival fills the town's narrow cobblestone streets with chocolate sculptures, international chocolatiers, cooking demonstrations, and tastings. The setting — a perfectly preserved medieval walled town — makes it exceptionally atmospheric. Kids' activities, live entertainment, and ginjinha (cherry liqueur) in chocolate cups add to the charm.

name: Kazakh Eagle Festival (Altai Mountains)
desc: Multiple eagle hunting festivals celebrating the Kazakh berkutchi tradition in Mongolia's Altai Mountains.
details: Western Mongolia hosts three eagle festivals annually (Spring March, Altai September, Golden Eagle October). The Kazakh berkutchi demonstrate their ancient hunting partnership with trained golden eagles in competitions including eagle speed, accuracy, and traditional horsemanship. The Altai Mountain backdrop is spectacular.

name: Tenjin Matsuri Fireworks
desc: 3,000+ fireworks illuminate the Okawa River during the spectacular boat procession of Japan's greatest water festival.
details: The Tenjin Matsuri fireworks on July 25th are launched simultaneously with the Funatogyo boat procession, creating a unique combination of floating and aerial light. Over 3,000 fireworks reflect in the river while 100+ illuminated boats carry the deity and festival-goers upstream. The dual spectacle of fire on water and in the sky is unmatched.

name: Tenjin Matsuri (Osaka) - Land Procession
desc: Grand land procession with 3,000 participants in traditional costumes parading through Osaka's streets.
details: The Rikutogyo (land procession) on July 24 kicks off the Tenjin Matsuri with over 3,000 participants in traditional Heian-period costumes marching from Osaka Tenmangu Shrine to the riverfront. The procession includes ornate mikoshi, ceremonial oxen, and performers playing traditional gagaku court music.

name: Øyafestivalen
desc: Oslo's premier music festival set in the medieval ruins of Tøyenparken, known for its cutting-edge international lineup.
details: One of the most prestigious music festivals in the Nordic countries, Øya combines major international headliners with cutting-edge independent acts. The 2026 lineup features The Cure and Nick Cave and the Bad Seeds. Set in verdant parkland near Oslo's medieval quarter, the festival is known for its commitment to sustainability and exceptional food offerings.

name: Otaru Snow Light Path Festival
desc: Romantic winter festival illuminating Otaru's canals and streets with hundreds of snow lanterns and candles.
details: The Otaru Snow Light Path Festival transforms the historic canal city of Otaru into a fairytale landscape with hundreds of hand-crafted snow lanterns, floating candles on the canal, and warm light installations. Unlike the grand scale of Sapporo, this festival emphasizes intimacy and craftsmanship, making it a beloved romantic destination.

name: Fiestas de Palmares (Palmares Festival)
desc: Costa Rica's biggest and most widely attended festival featuring concerts, horse tope (parade), bull riding, sports races, and vibrant fairground atmosphere with food, rides, and entertainment.
details: The Fiestas de Palmares is Costa Rica's most anticipated and largest festival. The 12-day celebration combines multiple traditions into one extensive event, functioning as part town fair, part concert series, part horse parade, and part bullring show. Activities center on the campo ferial (fairground), a purpose-built temporary city of food stalls, bars, stages, and amusement rides. The famous Tope (horse parade) scheduled for January 17, 2026, features horse riders from across the country showcasing fancy cowboy hats, boots, gorgeous horses, and impressive stunts. The published music schedule includes opening-night boleros shows and performances by various artists. Art programming includes PalmarINK, featuring workshops, contests, and live activities tied to visual art and tattoo culture. Runners can participate in the Clásica Palmarín athletics event with two distance options.

name: Carnaval de Ponce (Ponce Carnival)
desc: Puerto Rico's oldest and most iconic carnival blending Spanish masquerade roots with Afro-Caribbean musical traditions.
details: Also celebrated: Carnaval de Vejigantes (pre-Carnival in Barrio Playa) February 6-8, 2026. The carnival features parades with elaborately decorated floats, people dressed in wild costumes, and large crowds of spectators. At its heart are vejigantes—masked figures dressed in bright, multi-colored costumes adorned with horns and sharp teeth made from papier-mâché. Main attractions include dazzling parades featuring floats, marching bands, and vejigantes; live music from bomba and plena to salsa; and cultural exhibits featuring the history and craftsmanship of vejigante masks. The carnival dates back to 1858 and unfolds primarily in Ponce's historic center, especially around Plaza Las Delicias.

name: NOS Primavera Sound
desc: Porto's edition of the prestigious Primavera Sound festival in coastal Parque da Cidade.
details: NOS Primavera Sound brings the acclaimed Barcelona festival's adventurous programming to Porto's Parque da Cidade, combining indie, electronic, and alternative artists with the city's unique cultural atmosphere.

name: Kurentovanje Carnival
desc: Kurentovanje Carnival — more carnival celebrations across Slovenia around the same time
details: Kurentovanje in Ptuj features the Kurent Jump at midnight—fur-clad figures with cowbells chase away winter in an ancient tradition. The 10-day carnival includes a main parade dating to 1873.

name: Confucius Birthday Ceremony
desc: Grand ceremony at the birthplace and ancestral temple of Confucius—a 2,500-year tradition.
details: The birthday celebration of Confucius at the Confucius Temple in Qufu is one of China's most solemn cultural events. Ancient ceremonial music and dance (Bayi Dance), Confucian ritual offerings, and scholarly commemorations take place at the UNESCO-listed temple complex that has been the spiritual home of Chinese philosophy for 2,500 years.

name: Semana Santa in Ecuador
desc: Holy Week celebration featuring indigenous-Spanish fusion traditions with street "carpets," traditional food, and religious processions.
details: Ecuador's Semana Santa blends Spanish Catholic traditions with local indigenous customs. The Jesus of Great Power procession in Quito draws 250,000 spectators featuring penitents in purple robes (cucuruchos) carrying life-size crosses through Old Town streets. Many communities create "carpets" on streets from colored sawdust, flowers, and materials in intricate patterns with religious themes. Traditional Fanesca soup (made with 12 grains representing apostles and salt codfish) is prepared. Indigenous peoples use the season to reconnect with heritage and celebrate cultural traditions through food, music, and dance.

name: Tapati Rapa Nui - Easter Island
desc: Ancestral Polynesian festival on the world's most remote inhabited island, with traditional competitions and the dramatic Haka Pei.
details: The 58th edition under theme "Vai Maŋaro" inspired by ancestral hydraulic complex. Two young women candidates compete for 'Ariki Vahine (Tapati Queen). Key competitions: Haka Pei (hill sliding), Tau'a (triathlon with swimming, running, sailing), horse racing, Takona (body art with natural pigments), Kai Kai (rope figure narration). Nightly stage performances at Hanga Vare Vare. Selection of queen culminates festival. Celebrates ancestral engineering wisdom.

name: Festival de Verão Salvador
desc: Major summer music festival at Arena Festival (formerly Wet'n'Wild) featuring 25,000 capacity, 20+ hours of programming with diverse Brazilian genres.
details: Festival de Verão Salvador marks the 25th year of the event opening Bahia's carnival season. Held at Arena Festival at Avenida Paralela, the 2026 edition accommodates approximately 25,000 people daily with 20+ hours of musical programming. The lineup features major artists including Ney Matogrosso, Caetano Veloso, Ivete Sangalo, Carlinhos Brown, Péricles, Léo Santana, and Luisa Sonza. Gates open 3 PM with Saturday shows at 5 PM and Sunday shows at 4 PM. Age rating: 16+.

name: Lavagem do Bonfim (Salvador, Bahia)
desc: Traditional religious ceremony and popular festival celebrating Lord of Bonfim with symbolic washing of the church steps by women in white Bahian dress.
details: Lavagem do Bonfim is one of Brazil's largest religious and popular manifestations. The festival transforms Salvador from January 8-17, with the main "Lavagem de Corpo e Alma" procession on January 15, departing from Conceição Church and traveling 9 km to Bonfim. About 200 traditionally-dressed Bahian women (baianas) wash the church steps and atrium with water from pots carried on shoulders while clapping, drumming, and singing African chants. The overall theme is "The Public Ministry Exercise of Jesus, the Beloved Lord of Bonfim" while the procession theme is "Give us peace, justice and harmony." Cultural programming spreads across multiple neighborhoods.

name: Festival de la Luz (Festival of Lights)
desc: Festive evening parade with beautifully illuminated floats, fireworks from rooftops, marching bands, and music signaling the start of Costa Rica's holiday season.
details: The Festival de la Luz is one of Costa Rica's most anticipated holiday events, transforming downtown San José into a glittering celebration. The festival begins at 6:00 pm with fireworks launched from rooftops of the city's tallest buildings. Since 2005, a "Pasacalle" precedes the main parade, starting at 3:00 pm with carnival groups, choreography, and bands. The illuminated parade features decorated floats, marching bands, music, and large crowds lining the streets. The event brings a festive, family-friendly atmosphere to downtown San José and signals the beginning of the holiday season throughout the country.

name: Feria Juniana (June Fair)
desc: One of Central America's most joyful gatherings honoring patron saint San Pedro, featuring parades, live concerts, artisan markets, food vendors, animal contests, rides, and nightly fireworks.
details: The Feria Juniana in San Pedro Sula is the city's biggest event and one of Central America's most joyful gatherings. Held since 1846 in June in honor of patron saint San Pedro, the festival typically begins in early June and extends into early July. The festival includes parades, live concerts, artisan markets, food vendors, animal contests, amusement rides, and nightly fireworks—all showcasing local culture and community spirit. The event's highlight is the parade, held on the last Sunday of the month, a colorful procession featuring floats, marching bands, and live entertainment that draws large crowds. The Plaza operates from early June to July 1st from 5 pm to 2 am, featuring many festive events, Honduras cuisine, live music, and drinks. San Pedro Sula consolidates itself as an epicenter of major events in 2026.

name: Fiestas Patrias Chile
desc: National holiday commemorating Chile's 1810 independence proclamation and formation as sovereign nation.
details: September 18 is constitutional national holiday along with New Year, Christmas, and Labor Day. Celebrates formation of Chile as independent nation through First National Government proclamation (Sept 18, 1810). Celebrates Chilean identity, culture, and national pride. Shorter holiday in 2026 compared to 2025 (ends September 20 vs longer period). Traditional celebrations include parades, local festivities, government ceremonies.

name: Lotus Lantern Festival (Yeondeunghoe)
desc: UNESCO-recognized Buddhist lantern festival with a spectacular nighttime parade of illuminated lotus lanterns.
details: Yeondeunghoe is a UNESCO Intangible Cultural Heritage celebration for Buddha's Birthday. The centerpiece is a mesmerizing evening lantern parade along Jongno, with thousands of participants carrying elaborate lotus lanterns. Jogyesa Temple becomes a canopy of colorful lanterns. Cultural programs include lantern-making workshops, traditional performances, and a temple food experience.

name: Frieze Seoul
desc: The massive Asian expansion of the Frieze brand, establishing Seoul as an art epicenter.
details: Operating alongside Kiaf Seoul, Frieze brings intense Western blue-chip galleries into direct contact with the aggressively expanding, youthful, and highly capitalized Korean collector base, fueled by K-pop and tech wealth.

name: Ayarichi Festival (Tarabuco - Dry Season Harvest)
desc: Celebrated by the Yampara people during the dry season, honoring Catholic saints while maintaining indigenous agricultural traditions and featuring ritualistic dances and music.
details: The Ayarichi is held during the dry season in honor of Catholic saints, celebrating alongside agricultural traditions. Both Pujllay (March, rainy season) and Ayarichi (September-October, dry season) are celebrated by the Yampara people and were declared Intangible Cultural Heritage of Humanity by UNESCO. The Ayarichi reflects identity and resistance of Yampara Culture. Dancers wear intricate costumes adorned with feathers and colorful textiles, performing ritualistic movements symbolizing fertility and harmony with the earth. Accompanying music, played on drums and wind instruments, echoes through the mountains. The festival demonstrates the continued vitality of indigenous practices within a framework honoring both Catholic saints and ancestral Andean deities.

name: Pujllay Festival (Tarabuco - Battle Commemoration & Harvest)
desc: An indigenous Bolivian celebration commemorating the 1816 Battle of Cumbate, honoring the liberation from Spanish forces while expressing gratitude to Pachamama through traditional dances and colorful costumes.
details: The Pujllay Festival, celebrated on the third Sunday of March (March 15, 2026 in Tarabuco), commemorates the March 12, 1816 Battle of Cumbate, during which the people of Tarabuco liberated their town from Spanish forces. Pujllay means 'play' or 'dance' in Quechua. The festival celebrates independence while memorializing those who died and expressing gratitude to Andean deity Pachamama (Mother Earth). The celebration begins with a Quechua mass followed by a grand procession where over 60 Bolivian communities carry banners identifying their origins. Each group wears elaborate traditional costumes and performs dances unique to their region. The Yampara people showcase intricate outfits featuring headdresses, ponchos, spurs, and wide-leg pants resembling Spanish conquistadors. Tarabuco is located 65 km outside Sucre, in Yamparáez province, Chuquisaca, approximately 2 hours from Sucre by public transport.

name: Toronto Caribbean Carnival (Caribana)
desc: North America's largest Caribbean carnival featuring a spectacular Grand Parade of costumed masqueraders on Lake Shore Boulevard.
details: Toronto's Caribbean Carnival is the largest cultural festival in North America, celebrating Caribbean culture with three weeks of events culminating in the spectacular Grand Parade. Over 10,000 costumed masqueraders dance along Lake Shore Boulevard accompanied by soca, calypso, and steel pan music in a dazzling display of Caribbean creativity and culture.

name: Toyama Owara Kaze no Bon (Extended)
desc: Pre-festival nights from late Aug offer a more intimate experience of this hauntingly beautiful dance tradition.
details: Owara Kaze no Bon is one of Japan's most atmospheric festivals. Held in the small hillside town of Yatsuo, dancers in deep straw hats perform slow, graceful movements to the accompaniment of shamisen, taiko, and the melancholic hu (kokyu) fiddle. The dances continue until dawn through the narrow, lantern-lit streets. It's a profoundly moving experience—the antithesis of boisterous summer matsuri.

name: Festival de la Marinera (National Dance Competition)
desc: National marinera dance competition at Chan Chan coliseum featuring contest winners, orchestras, musical ensembles, and renowned soloists.
details: Since 1986, Peru has officially designated Trujillo as the "National Capital of Marinera." The festival showcases the traditional Peruvian dance named to honor the country's navy. The 2026 festival includes the marinera dance contest, parades, and presentations of Peruvian Paso horse demonstrations. Queen Gabriela Benavides holds the 2026 Nuestra Soberana (Queen) title. The festival also features gastronomic fairs with local cuisine and displays showcasing Peru's distinctive coastal culture and traditions.

name: Envision Festival
desc: Seven-day immersive festival blending music, yoga, art, education, and wellness in one of Earth's most biodiverse locations where rainforest meets ocean.
details: Envision unfolds in the Osa Peninsula, one of the most biodiverse places on Earth, where rainforest and ocean create a sanctuary with rare wildlife and vibrant ecosystems. The 2026 edition will reduce capacity by roughly 2,000 people, bringing total attendance to approximately 5,500—reducing environmental impact while maintaining the festival's original spirit. For seven days, attendees experience music, yoga, movement, art, education, and wellness in a fully immersive experience. It's all-ages with families welcome, offering Jade (GA) and Ambar (VIP) pass options. The 2026 edition emphasizes "Back to our Roots" and will provide improved facilities with more port-a-potties and better placement. Onsite camping accommodates various comfort levels from bring-your-own-tent to luxury options, with vetted off-site accommodations also available.

name: Art Vancouver
desc: Western Canada's largest international contemporary art fair.
details: Set at the Vancouver Convention Centre, the fair connects the Pacific Northwest art scene with strong contingents from Asia, reflecting the city's deeply integrated trans-Pacific demographics.

name: Yerevan Wine Days
desc: Street festival promoting Armenia as ancient winemaking cradle with 100 wine types and food pairings.
details: Street festival promoting event tourism and recognition of Armenia as ancient winemaking cradle. Armenian winemakers present 100 wine types and food pairings. Free entrance; wine tasting packages 12,000 AMD.

name: Yokohama Triennale 2026
desc: Major international contemporary art exhibition in the port city of Yokohama—one of Asia's leading triennials.
details: The Yokohama Triennale is one of Japan's most prestigious contemporary art exhibitions. Held in multiple venues including the Yokohama Museum of Art and other waterfront spaces, it features works by international artists exploring contemporary themes. As a triennial, it would be due in 2026 (following the 2020 postponed edition's cycle).

name: Lantern Festival (Yuanxiao) 2026
desc: The glowing celebration marking the end of Spring Festival with elaborate lantern displays, riddles, and sweet tangyuan.
details: The Lantern Festival marks the 15th and final day of Chinese New Year. Streets fill with colorful lanterns bearing riddles for visitors to solve. Major displays in Nanjing (Qinhuai Lantern Fair), Xi'an (City Wall), Shanghai (Yuyuan Garden), and Zigong (famous for elaborate lantern artistry) draw millions. Traditional foods include tangyuan (sweet glutinous rice balls).

name: Sukkot Celebrations
desc: Weeklong Jewish harvest festival celebrated with outdoor booths, festivities, and pilgrimages to Jerusalem.
details: Features building of sukkahs (temporary booths), religious services, cultural events, and the famous Jerusalem March. Major tourism period.

name: Seollal (Korean Lunar New Year)
desc: Korea's most important traditional holiday featuring hanbok wearing, tteokguk, sebae bowing, and family gatherings.
details: Seollal is Korea's most important holiday. Families gather wearing hanbok (traditional clothing), perform sebae (ceremonial bowing to elders), play yutnori (board game), eat tteokguk (rice cake soup), and visit ancestral shrines. Traditional folk villages like Namsangol Hanok Village in Seoul host public celebrations with traditional games, performances, and food.

name: Adelaide Fringe
desc: The largest open-access arts festival in the Southern Hemisphere with 1,500+ shows across 500 venues.
details: Adelaide Fringe is a cultural juggernaut, running for a full month each autumn. With over 1,500 shows across 500 venues, it encompasses comedy, theatre, music, visual art, circus, cabaret, and everything in between. The Garden of Unearthly Delights and Gluttony hub create electric festival atmospheres.

name: Parrtjima - A Festival in Light
desc: Spectacular light art festival illuminating the MacDonnell Ranges with Aboriginal-inspired projections.
details: Parrtjima is the only Aboriginal light festival of its kind, projecting stunning light art onto the ancient MacDonnell Ranges in Alice Springs. Over 10 nights, visitors experience large-scale light installations, live music, workshops, and talks exploring Aboriginal art and culture through the medium of light.

name: Amsterdam Dance Event
desc: Global electronic music conference-festival hybrid; described as world-scale with very large visits.
details: ADE transforms Amsterdam into the global hub of electronic music for five days. Over 1,000 events span festivals, club nights, conferences, and networking across 200+ venues, attracting the entire electronic music industry.

name: Bergen International Festival
desc: The flagship cultural festival of the Nordic countries, under royal patronage since 1953, presenting music, theatre, dance, and opera.
details: For over 70 years this festival has been an international meeting place for creative forces. Under the patronage of King Harald V, it presents 15 days of music, opera, theatre, dance, debates, and family events. The 2026 edition features folk and chamber music on Hardanger instruments alongside international programming. Attendance reaches approximately 72,000.

name: Busan International Film Festival (BIFF)
desc: Asia's most prestigious film festival showcasing world cinema alongside red carpet events and celebrity appearances.
details: BIFF is the largest and most important film festival in Asia, screening hundreds of films from around the world at the Busan Cinema Center and other venues. The festival features red carpet events, outdoor screenings, industry forums, and is a major launching pad for Asian cinema. The architectural landmark Busan Cinema Center provides a striking venue.

name: Cannes Film Festival
desc: The world's most prestigious film festival returns to the Croisette for its 79th edition, showcasing world premieres and awarding the coveted Palme d'Or.
details: The 79th Cannes Film Festival brings Hollywood glamour, auteur cinema, and red-carpet spectacle to the French Riviera. World premieres compete for the Palme d'Or while the parallel Marché du Film is the world's largest film market. Expected premieres include works by James Gray, Pedro Almodóvar, Cristian Mungiu, and Nanni Moretti. Security zones, high hotel prices, and sold-out screenings — book early.

name: Spoleto Festival USA
desc: Premier performing arts festival featuring opera, theater, dance, and chamber music in historic Charleston.
details: Founded by composer Gian Carlo Menotti as the American counterpart to the Festival dei Due Mondi in Spoleto, Italy, this 17-day festival presents over 150 performances across opera, theater, dance, and chamber, symphonic, and choral music. Piccolo Spoleto runs concurrently with hundreds of additional events, making Charleston a cultural epicenter each spring.

name: Festival de Santo Tomás
desc: Syncretic Maya-Catholic festivities with dances and rituals honoring Saint Thomas.

name: Fiesta Nacional del Chamamé
desc: Celebration of the chamamé, Argentina's UNESCO-recognized cultural heritage music form, featuring live performances and traditional music.
details: Held at Mario del Tránsito Cocomarola amphitheater with 10 nights of performances beginning at 7:00 PM. Features prominent musicians, dancers, traditional groups, and MERCOSUR delegations. The 2026 theme is "Chamamé, refuge of our identity." Broadcast live online. Tickets available through weepas.ar and at Teatro Oficial Juan de Vera box office.

name: Carnaval Bakansote (Cuenca/Azuay)
desc: Over 160 events during carnival week with parades, concerts, and mega-events at Yunguilla eco-tourism complex.
details: The Prefectura del Azuay presents Carnaval Bakansote 2026 with 160+ events throughout the province. Cuenca's main celebration (February 12-17) includes the Four Rivers parade, Color Fest, Serrano Aguilar stadium concerts, and a Guinness record attempt for the world's largest mote pata. Yunguilla hosts Sunday, February 15 mega-concert with salsa, reggaeton, extreme sports fair, and international artistic shows. Featured artists: Nicky Jam, Trébol Klan, DJ Pablo Control, Gerardo Morán, Máquina Camaleón. The province has 12,000 hotel rooms and 600+ restaurants ready for visitors.

name: Navruz
desc: Ancient spring equinox celebration with fire jumping, music, horse races, and traditional sports.
details: Tajikistan's most important festival celebrating spring equinox with 3,000+ year-old traditions. Features fire jumping, music, horse races, traditional sports, and feasting. Nationwide celebrations centered in Dushanbe and Khujand.

name: Royal Edinburgh Military Tattoo
desc: A spectacular showcase of military music, dance, and pageantry at Edinburgh Castle Esplanade, celebrating its 75th anniversary with the theme 'The Heroes Who Made Us.'
details: Performed against the dramatic backdrop of Edinburgh Castle, the Royal Edinburgh Military Tattoo features precision military bands, highland dancers, bagpipers, drummers, and guest acts from around the world. The 2026 edition celebrates its 75th anniversary with the theme 'The Heroes Who Made Us.' The grand finale with fireworks lighting up the castle is truly spine-tingling. Nearly every performance sells out.

name: Calcio Storico Fiorentino
desc: Florence's brutal and spectacular historical sport combining rugby, wrestling, and football in Renaissance costume.
details: Calcio Storico is Florence's 16th-century predecessor to football, played by 27-man teams in medieval costume in a sand-covered Piazza Santa Croce. The violent, no-holds-barred match is preceded by a magnificent historical procession.

name: Way Out West
desc: Gothenburg's eco-friendly festival in Slottskogen park — all-vegetarian food, limited alcohol zones, and a curated lineup of 100 artists plus 25 films.
details: Since 2007, Way Out West has filled Gothenburg's leafy Slottsskogen park with three days of multi-genre music, film premieres, vegetarian food, and the 'Stay Out West' night club programme in venues across the city. The 2026 lineup includes Gorillaz, The Cure, Lorde, The xx, Nick Cave, Moby, Four Tet, and Zara Larsson. Known for its commitment to sustainability and all-vegetarian food.

name: Corpus Christi Granada
desc: Corpus Christi — colorful, often flower-centric festivities — especially big in Toledo and Valencia; many festivities take place before and/or after the holiday; closures in Madrid and Castile–La Mancha
details: colorful, often flower-centric festivities — especially big in Toledo and Valencia; many festivities take place before and/or after the holiday; closures in Madrid and Castile–La Mancha

name: Huamachuco Carnival (Food & Culinary Traditions)
desc: A unique carnival celebration emphasizing traditional gastronomy and ancestral knowledge through competitions for the best regional dishes and traditional carnival drinks.
details: The Huamachuco Carnival 2026 features a Concurso del Mejor Plato y la Mejor Chicha Carnavalesca (Contest for the Best Dish and Best Carnival Chicha) held on Saturday, February 7 at 10:00 a.m., on Serpiente de Oro street near Puente Grande bridge on the Río Grande. This activity highlights traditional gastronomy, ancestral knowledge, and local talent, strengthening culture and tourism. The focus on culinary competition makes this carnival distinct from water-and-foam-focused celebrations, celebrating the region's gastronomic heritage during carnival season.

name: Hwacheon Sancheoneo Ice Festival
desc: Wildly popular winter festival where visitors catch trout with their bare hands through holes in the ice.
details: The Hwacheon Sancheoneo Ice Festival is one of Korea's most popular winter events. Visitors fish for mountain trout through holes in the frozen Hwacheon River using rods or bare hands. Activities include ice sledding, bobsledding, ice sculpture exhibitions, and a night festival. The festival consistently ranks among Korea's must-visit winter experiences, drawing over 1 million visitors.

name: Dinagyang Festival
desc: One of the Philippines' most intense festivals with powerful choreography, sharp warrior dances, and thundering drum beats.
details: Dinagyang commemorates both the Santo Niño and the historic pact between Malay settlers and indigenous Ati people. Performers deliver some of the country's best festival choreography — sharp, powerful, and full of emotion. Warrior costumes, face paint, and synchronized movements create an electrifying spectacle that draws tens of thousands.

name: Inti Raymi (Ecuador)
desc: Indigenous solstice celebrations with music, dance, and ritual.

name: 18th Istanbul Biennial (2026 Leg)
desc: One of the most significant international biennials, organized by the Istanbul Foundation for Culture and Arts (IKSV).
details: The Istanbul Biennial is a major international art exhibition. Its cycle has varied between odd and even years. Previous editions have been highly influential in global contemporary art discourse. Specific details for a 2026 edition have not been widely announced.

name: Ivrea Carnival (Battle of the Oranges)
desc: Italy's wildest carnival features a massive three-day orange-throwing battle through medieval streets, re-enacting the town's revolt against a tyrannical lord.
details: The Battle of the Oranges is a unique and chaotic event where nine teams on foot battle teams on horse-drawn carts by hurling oranges at each other through the medieval streets. The tradition commemorates the town's rebellion against a tyrant. The festival also includes historical parades, the burning of the Scarlo pole, and celebrations with traditional food and mulled wine.

name: Nallur Festival
desc: Sri Lanka's longest celebration spanning 25 days of Hindu ceremonies, chariot processions, and devotional music at the Nallur Temple.
details: The longest festival in Sri Lanka takes place at Nallur Kandaswamy Kovil, one of the most prominent Hindu temples. Over 25 days, elaborate ceremonies honor Lord Murugan with chariot processions, devotional singing, traditional dancing, and nightly rituals. The atmosphere intensifies as the festival progresses toward its grand climax.

name: Jinhae Gunhangje Cherry Blossom Festival
desc: Korea's largest and most famous cherry blossom festival with 360,000 cherry trees creating pink tunnels.
details: The Jinhae Gunhangje Festival transforms the small naval port city into Korea's most spectacular cherry blossom destination. Over 360,000 cherry trees line streets, streams, and the famous Yeojwacheon Romance Bridge. The Gyeonghwa Station railway lined with cherry trees is one of Korea's most iconic spring images. Military performances, parades, and fireworks complement the natural beauty.

name: Ati-Atihan Festival
desc: The 'Mother of All Philippine Festivals' — a raw, chaotic week of face-painted dancers, pounding drums, and 'Hala Bira!' chants.
details: Dating back to 1212 AD, Ati-Atihan is regarded as the oldest festival in the Philippines and the inspiration for Sinulog and Dinagyang. Participants paint their faces with black soot, don elaborate costumes, and dance the Sadsad (dragging-foot dance) through Kalibo's streets to thundering drum beats. It's part Catholic devotion, part street rave, part tribal parade.

name: Kaohsiung Zuoying Wannian Folklore Festival
desc: Major southern Taiwan temple festival celebrating the Wannian folklore tradition with elaborate Taoist processions.
details: The Zuoying Wannian Folklore Festival is one of southern Taiwan's most important cultural events, celebrating the area's rich temple heritage and folk traditions. Events include elaborate temple processions, traditional performing arts, lion and dragon dances, opera performances, and a night market. The festival showcases Kaohsiung's distinct folk culture.

name: Kobe Ikuta Festival
desc: 1,800-year-old festival at one of Japan's most ancient shrines with mikoshi processions through modern Kobe.
details: Ikuta Shrine, one of Japan's oldest Shinto shrines (founded 201 AD), hosts its annual festival with mikoshi processions through Kobe's modern downtown—creating a striking contrast of ancient tradition and contemporary city life. Traditional music, dance, and shrine rituals mark the celebration.

name: Saaremaa Opera Festival
desc: Classical opera performances on Estonia's largest island, featuring international artists in a stunning Baltic setting.
details: The Saaremaa Opera Days bring world-class opera performances to Kuressaare Castle and other venues on Estonia's largest island. International singers and local Estonian talent perform in atmospheric settings that combine cultural excellence with island holiday relaxation.

name: Midsommar (Swedish Midsummer)
desc: Sweden's most iconic celebration—the summer solstice festival with maypole dancing, flower crowns, folk music, and traditional feasts.
details: On Midsummer Eve (June 19, 2026), Swedes across the country raise maypoles decorated with flowers and greenery, dance to traditional folk songs including the beloved 'Små Grodorna' (Little Frogs), weave flower crowns, and feast on pickled herring, new potatoes, strawberries, and aquavit. It is effectively Sweden's real national day—offices close and the country retreats to the countryside. Dalarna offers the most traditional celebrations; Stockholm's Skansen open-air museum is the go-to urban venue.

name: Procession of Our Lady of Fatima
desc: Catholic procession from St. Dominic's Church to Penha Hill—a rare Asian Catholic tradition.
details: The Procession of Our Lady of Fatima is one of Macau's most distinctive cultural events. A statue of the Virgin Mary is carried from St. Dominic's Church through the historic center to Penha Chapel. This Catholic tradition in the heart of Chinese Asia reflects Macau's unique Portuguese colonial heritage.

name: Bonnaroo Music and Arts Festival
desc: Multi-day camping festival on a 700-acre farm featuring diverse music across multiple stages.
details: Bonnaroo takes place on Great Stage Park, a 700-acre farm in rural Tennessee. The festival features over 150 performances across more than 10 stages, spanning genres from rock and indie to hip-hop, electronic, and jam bands. The communal camping experience and late-night sets that run until sunrise create a unique festival atmosphere that has earned it devoted fans.

name: Carnaval Internacional de Mazatlán 2026
desc: One of Mexico's most spectacular and longest-running carnivals featuring allegorical floats, parachicos, and cultural performances
details: The 128th International Carnival features the theme "Arriba la Tambora!" Over 550,000 people attended the first grand parade in 2025. Venue runs along the coastal promenade with 30 impressive allegorical floats. Hotel occupancy reaches 87% with economic impact of 1,100 million pesos.

name: Feria de las Flores (Flower Festival)
desc: Ten-day vibrant festival showcasing Medellín's world-renowned flower cultivation with parades, exhibitions, and the iconic Desfile de Silleteros.
details: The festival celebrates Medellín's status as one of the world's largest flower exporters. Key events include the Desfile de Silleteros (Silleteros Parade), where peasants from Santa Elena carry decorated flower arrangements called silletas on their backs; Classic Car Parade featuring vintage vehicles; Bird and Flower Show; and family-friendly activities throughout parks and venues. The city transforms into a floral wonderland with countless flower displays and cultural performances.

name: NGV Triennial
desc: A massive celebration of contemporary art, design, and architecture at the National Gallery of Victoria.
details: This triennial blurs the lines between fine art, high-tech design, and immersive environments. It is known for its spectacular, highly accessible installations that draw immense crowds and dominate the Southern Hemisphere's summer cultural calendar.

name: Festival Corona Capital
desc: Mexico City's major alternative and indie rock festival held annually at the Autódromo Hermanos Rodríguez.
details: Corona Capital is Mexico City's premier alternative and indie music festival, featuring major international headliners and emerging artists across rock, electronic, indie, and pop genres. Held at the Autódromo Hermanos Rodríguez racing circuit, the festival has become one of the most important music events in Latin America.

name: Mardi Gras
desc: Historic Gulf Coast Mardi Gras with parades and mystic societies—often considered America’s oldest Mardi Gras tradition.
details: A massive, historic parade predating New Orleans' festivities, deeply rooted in local Gulf Coast tradition.

name: Essence Festival of Culture
desc: The largest annual gathering celebrating Black culture, music, and empowerment in the United States.
details: Held at the Mercedes-Benz Superdome and throughout New Orleans, the Essence Festival combines world-class musical performances with empowerment seminars, marketplace vendors, and cultural experiences. Artists like Beyoncé, Janet Jackson, and Mary J. Blige have headlined, and daytime programming features leaders in business, politics, and wellness.

name: Nozawa Onsen Fire Festival (Dosojin Matsuri)
desc: Wild and dramatic fire festival where villagers attack and defend a massive wooden shrine structure.
details: The Nozawa Onsen Dosojin Fire Festival is one of Japan's most thrilling festivals. 25-year-old and 42-year-old men from the village defend a large wooden shrine (shaden) while others try to set it ablaze with torches. The chaotic battle between fire attackers and defenders creates an unforgettable spectacle in the snow-covered mountain village.

name: Tenjin Festival (Temmangu Shrine Boat)
desc: Over 100 illuminated boats in one of Japan's most spectacular river processions.
details: The Tenjin Matsuri boat procession on the Okawa River features over 100 boats carrying the deity, geisha, and musicians. Lit by traditional paper lanterns, the boats create a floating parade of light on the dark river, synchronized with 3,000 fireworks above.

name: Sumiyoshi Matsuri
desc: Ancient Osaka festival at Sumiyoshi Taisha with traditional processions and sacred dances.
details: Sumiyoshi Matsuri at Sumiyoshi Taisha is one of Osaka's most important shrine festivals. The highlight is the passage of portable shrines over the iconic Taiko Bridge. Sumiyoshi-odori dances and various traditional performances take place over three days. The shrine, one of Japan's oldest, was founded before Buddhism reached Japan.

name: Carnaval de Blancos y Negros
desc: UNESCO-declared Intangible Cultural Heritage featuring iconic Day of Blacks and Day of Whites celebrations with elaborate costumes and traditional music.
details: January 5 features the Day of Blacks starting at 2 pm with collective celebrations, games, and traditional "pintica" (harmless mud/dye). January 6 (Day of Whites) begins at 8 am with the Senda del Carnaval parade, Plaza del Carnaval rumba shows at 4 pm, and various musical performances. The celebration extends to January 7 with the Festival of Guinea Pig and Peasant Culture in surrounding villages.

name: Pátzcuaro Día de los Muertos
desc: Perhaps the most authentic and atmospheric Day of the Dead celebration, centered on the island of Janitzio.
details: The region around Lake Pátzcuaro is considered the spiritual heart of Día de los Muertos. On the night of November 1, the Purépecha indigenous community of the island of Janitzio creates a breathtaking scene as thousands of candles illuminate the hilltop cemetery while families maintain all-night vigils. Fishermen with butterfly nets create a magical scene on the moonlit lake.

name: Kanaval (national Carnival season)
desc: Haiti's unique traditional carnival season with Pre-Kanaval in January and main celebrations in February.
details: Carnival season always starts in January with Pre-Kanaval, and main carnival begins in February. The city of Jacmel launched the 2026 National Carnival festivities with a spectacular pre-parade organized by city hall in partnership with the carnival committee. Features traditional street parades with elaborate costumes, music, and celebrations. Jacmel opens carnival with a splash of splendor and creativity, showcasing Haitian cultural identity and artistic expression. The celebrations include music, dance, food, and community participation.

name: Carnaval de Quebec (Alternate events)
desc: Ice canoe racing across the frozen St. Lawrence River, one of the most extreme sporting events on Earth.
details: As part of Quebec Winter Carnival, the ice canoe race across the St. Lawrence River is a thrilling spectacle. Teams push and paddle canoes across ice floes and frigid water in one of the most extreme races in the world.

name: Carnival of Recife and Olinda
desc: Traditional Pernambuco carnival featuring distinctive frevo and maracatu traditions, with historic colonial atmosphere in Olinda's hillsides.
details: Recife and neighboring Olinda host one of Brazil's most culturally rich carnivals. The Galo da Madrugada in Recife holds the Guinness record for largest carnival bloco. Olinda's colonial hillside streets fill with giant puppets (bonecos) and frevo dancers with colorful umbrellas. Maracatu groups perform powerful Afro-Brazilian percussion processions. The music blends frevo, maracatu, mangue beat, and forró.

name: Iceland Airwaves
desc: Iceland's premier music festival showcasing Icelandic and international acts across Reykjavik's intimate venues — the perfect antidote to dark winter nights.
details: Iceland Airwaves transforms Reykjavik into a music lover's playground, with performances in churches, record shops, art galleries, and traditional concert halls. The festival is known for discovering new talent and for the intimate scale of its venues. Set against Iceland's dramatic November landscape, it offers a unique combination of cutting-edge music and Nordic atmosphere.

name: Carnival
desc: Historic carnival celebration featuring trio elétricos (mobile sound stages), blocos afros, and authentic Bahian music traditions including axé, forró, and samba.
details: Salvador's carnival represents the strongest African influence in Brazilian celebrations. The event features blocos afros like Olodum and groups performing along the circuit from Campo Grande to Barra. The Programa Ouro Negro supports over 95 cultural entities of African matrix heritage. Lavagem do Bonfim precedes carnival on January 15, adding to the festivities.

name: Diablos Danzantes de Corpus Christi (UNESCO)
desc: UNESCO-recognized tradition where masked "devils" (promeseros) perform backwards penitential dances celebrating triumph of good over evil.
details: 11 cofradías (confraternities) group 5,000+ participants including famous Diablos of Yare. Participants dress as masked devils and dance in penance as Catholic Church carries holy sacrament in procession. Ritual blends Catholic devotion with African and indigenous influences. The "Dancing Devils" symbolize penitence, spiritual commitment, and cultural resistance. UNESCO recognition (2012) celebrates this manifestation of intangible cultural heritage preserving ancestral traditions.

name: Santa Fe Indian Market (104th)
desc: The world's largest and most prestigious juried Native American art market, with 1,000+ artists from 200+ tribes.
details: SWAIA's Santa Fe Indian Market transforms the historic Santa Fe Plaza and surrounding streets into the world's premier showcase for Native American art. Over 1,000 artists from more than 200 tribes display and sell pottery, jewelry, textiles, paintings, sculpture, and other traditional and contemporary works. The market also features Native film screenings, fashion shows, and cultural events.

name: Cosquín Rock
desc: Latin America's most important rock festival since 2001, blending established icons with fresh talent.
details: Held at Aeródromo Santa María de Punilla with headliners including Abel Pintos, Airbag, Divididos, Las Pelotas, Fito Páez, Ciro y Los Persas, Lali, Trueno, and international acts Franz Ferdinand and Morat. Attracts 90,000 people daily with 50 billion pesos mobilized across the region.

name: São Paulo Biennial (36th Bienal)
desc: A major international contemporary art exhibition featuring over 120 artists exploring themes of humanity, temporal resistance, and global interdependence.
details: The 36th São Paulo Biennial, titled "Not All Travellers Walk Roads: Of Humanity as Practice," unfolds in Oscar Niemeyer's Ciccillo Matarazzo Pavilion at Ibirapuera Park. Curated by Bonaventure Soh Bejeng Ndikung, the exhibition reimagines humanity as an active, collective practice through art. The extended format spanning 16 weeks offers a research-based approach valuing process over product, featuring art as a tool for reimagining human relationships and planetary interdependence.

name: Spoleto Festival dei Due Mondi
desc: Spoleto's renowned Festival of Two Worlds — a three-week celebration of music, drama, opera, dance, and visual arts in the stunning Umbrian hill town.
details: Originally conceived to bridge American and European culture, the Festival dei Due Mondi has evolved into a three-week celebration of performing and visual arts. Spoleto's medieval theaters, churches, and piazzas provide extraordinary performance venues. The festival features world premieres, major opera productions, ballet, contemporary dance, concerts, and art exhibitions.

name: Takayama Autumn Festival (Hachiman Matsuri)
desc: Autumn counterpart to Takayama's spring festival with 11 ornate floats and stunning fall foliage.
details: The Takayama Autumn Festival at Sakurayama Hachimangu Shrine features 11 elaborate yatai floats with intricate wood carvings and karakuri puppet performances. Set against autumn foliage in the Japanese Alps, the evening procession of lantern-lit floats through the preserved Edo-era streets is exceptionally atmospheric.

name: Willkakuti (Aymara New Year)
desc: Indigenous Andean New Year at 3,000-year-old Tiwanaku ruins with sunrise ceremony during winter solstice.
details: Celebrated at UNESCO-listed Tiwanaku on Lake Titicaca. Ceremony welcomes the sun's first rays through the Puerta del Sol (Gate of the Sun). Thousands gather for bonfires, Pachamama offerings, traditional music, and Andean cosmology celebration.

name: Aymara New Year (Winter Solstice/Willkakuti)
desc: Holiest day for Aymara people celebrating the winter solstice and Aymara New Year with shamanic offerings, dawn ceremonies at the Gateway of the Sun, and cosmic energy celebrations at Tiwanaku ruins.
details: In 2026, Aymara New Year falls on Sunday, June 21. The Aymara keep vigil throughout the night until sunrise, with people heading to Tiwanaku ruins by 5:00 AM for main ceremonies. This ancient city comes alive with Aymara rituals celebrating the sun's return, powerful cosmic energy, and agricultural cycle commencement. Celebrations occur at over 200 locations in Bolivia, including Tiwanaku, Inka Raqay, Uyuni, and Samaipata. Shamans make offerings to sun and earth for abundance. Thousands of visitors gather for the winter solstice sunrise ceremony at the Gateway of the Sun, where the first rays pass through the gate's central opening. Festivities include craftsmen fairs, abundant Singani drink, coca chewing, and dancing until dawn.

name: Echigo-Tsumari Art Field (Year-round)
desc: World's largest open-air art park with 200+ permanent installations across 760 square km of Japanese countryside.
details: While the next Echigo-Tsumari Art Triennale is in 2027, the year-round Art Field features over 200 permanent installations across 760 sq km of Niigata's mountain countryside. Works by James Turrell, Christian Boltanski, Marina Abramovic, and others are integrated into rice terraces, abandoned schools, and forest paths. Museums like the Matsudai Snow-Land Agrarian Culture Center operate seasonally.

name: Carnival of Torres Vedras
desc: Carnival — a.k.a. Entrudo, particularly vibrant in Lisbon and Algarve towns, some closures on February 17 for Shrove Tuesday
details: Torres Vedras carnival is considered the most genuinely Portuguese carnival, famous for its matrafonas (men cross-dressing), satirical parades, and Rei (King) choosing traditions.

name: Kaziuko Mugė (Kaziukas Fair)
desc: Traditional crafts fair on St. Casimir's Day with artisan markets, handmade goods, and folk celebrations across Vilnius.
details: One of Lithuania's most beloved annual traditions, the Kaziukas Fair fills the streets of Vilnius Old Town on the feast of St. Casimir, the patron saint of Lithuania. Hundreds of stalls sell traditional handcrafted goods—palm bouquets, pottery, woodwork, woven textiles, toys, and traditional foods. It is a vibrant celebration of Lithuanian folk craft heritage.

name: Boun Bang Fai (Rocket Festival)
desc: A raucous festival where enormous homemade rockets are launched into the sky to pray for rain, with the losers taking a mud bath.
details: Celebrated across northeast Thailand, this wild festival features launching massive bamboo rockets into the sky as a prayer for the coming monsoon rains. The rocket that soars highest wins a cash prize; those that fail to launch are punished with a mud bath. Music, dance performances, processions, and copious amounts of local rice wine make it an unforgettable party.

name: Mid-Autumn Festival (Moon Festival)
desc: Poetic harvest celebration of family reunion under the full moon with mooncakes and lantern displays.
details: The Mid-Autumn Festival celebrates the autumn harvest and the legend of Chang'e, goddess of the moon. Families gather to share mooncakes and admire the full moon. Parks and streets glow with decorative lanterns. Major celebrations in Xi'an, Hangzhou's West Lake, and Hong Kong feature elaborate light shows. The festival emphasizes family reunion—second in importance only to Chinese New Year.

name: Sham el-Nessim (Spring Festival)
desc: An ancient spring festival dating back to Pharaonic times celebrated nationwide with outdoor picnics, colored eggs, and salted fish.
details: One of Egypt's oldest celebrations, dating back over 4,500 years to Pharaonic times. Celebrated the Monday after Coptic Easter, families take to parks and gardens for outdoor picnics featuring traditional salted fish (fesikh), colored eggs, and spring onions. It's a uniquely Egyptian national celebration that transcends religious boundaries, observed by Muslims and Christians alike.

name: Hidirellez Festival
desc: Ancient festival marking arrival of spring with fires, fortune-telling, and wishes. UNESCO ICH since 2017.
details: Celebrates prophets Hizir and Ilyas meeting on earth. Traditions include jumping over bonfires, writing wishes under rose bushes. Vibrant celebrations in Edirne, Istanbul, and Mediterranean coast.

name: Abu Simbel Sun Festival (October)
desc: The second annual alignment of sunlight in the inner sanctum of Abu Simbel, marking the anniversary of Ramesses II's coronation.
details: The October occurrence of the Abu Simbel phenomenon celebrates the anniversary of Ramesses II's coronation. Just as in February, sunlight pierces the temple to illuminate the inner sanctum statues. The event draws thousands of visitors for dawn viewing and is accompanied by cultural festivities in the surrounding area.

name: International White Truffle Fair
desc: International White Truffle Fair — between Turin and Genoa; cooking demonstrations, historical reenactments, truffles by the pound
details: The International Alba White Truffle Fair brings gastronomes worldwide to Piedmont for truffle auctions, tastings, cooking demonstrations, and wine pairings in one of Italy's finest culinary regions.

name: Nauryz Meyrami (Nawryznama Decade)
desc: Kazakhstan's most important festival celebrating spring equinox with 10 days of themed cultural events across 1,500+ venues.
details: Nauryz is Kazakhstan's biggest cultural festival with 10 themed days: Mercy Day (Mar 15), Day of Culture and National Traditions (Mar 16), Shanyrak Day (Mar 17), traditional dress day (Mar 18), National Sports Day (Mar 20). Over 1,500 events across all regions feature concerts, theatrical performances, traditional sports, folk poetry battles (aitys), and national cuisine. Sumalak and Nauryz-kozhe are traditional dishes.

name: El Rocío pilgrimage (Romería del Rocío)
desc: Spain's largest pilgrimage with 1 million devotees trekking to El Rocío.
details: A million pilgrims in Andalusian dress travel by horse, ox-cart, and foot to the remote marshland village of El Rocío for the dramatic midnight procession of the Virgin.

name: MassKara Festival
desc: The 'City of Smiles' turns resilience into a street party of smiling masks, upbeat music, and joyous dance competitions.
details: Born during an economic crisis, MassKara (mass of smiling faces) has become a symbol of Bacolod's resilience and joy. Performers wear elaborate smiling masks and colorful costumes while dancing through the streets. Food stalls and concerts keep the city alive, reinforcing its title as the 'City of Smiles.' The festival radiates pure Filipino optimism.

name: Defqon.1
desc: World's leading hardstyle festival with the 2026 theme 'Sacred Oath'.
details: Defqon.1 is the ultimate hardstyle experience with massive production, pyrotechnics, and the famous Endshow. 65,000+ fans gather for three days of harder electronic styles in an immersive themed world.

name: Les Vieilles Charrues
desc: France's largest music festival attracting 280,000 visitors to rural Brittany.
details: Vieilles Charrues transforms the small Breton town of Carhaix into France's biggest music gathering with rock, pop, electronic, and world music across multiple stages.

name: Festival Internacional de Cine de Cartagena (FICCI)
desc: Latin America's oldest and Academy Awards-qualifying film festival showcasing international and experimental cinema with focus on inclusion and free expression.
details: FICCI 65 features 11 film sections (10 Official + 1 Work-in-Progress). Academy Awards qualifying festival for Best Documentary Feature and Best Short Film.
