Focus on social vocation, cultural encounter, plurality, and human-centered perspectives. Free film festival emphasizing cultural democracy. 2026 submissions through festhome.com (August 25 - November 30, 2025). Selection notifications in March 2026. Strong agreement with Brazilian Cinema Culture Department of Rio Grande do Sul.

name: São João de Caruaru (Festa Junina)
desc: Celebrated throughout the northeastern region with traditional quadrilha dancing, giant foods, forró music, and regional celebrations.
details: Caruaru's São João is one of the largest celebrations of Saint John in the world, spreading festivities across neighborhoods from May through July. The festival celebrates northeastern identity with famous monumental versions of typical foods displayed throughout the city. Traditional music, quadrilha competitions, and street parties dominate the celebration.

name: Chachapoyas Carnival (Amazonian Carnival)
desc: An Amazonian-influenced carnival highlighting warrior dances, striking costumes, and regional culinary traditions reflecting Chachapoyas' unique cultural identity.
details: The Chachapoyas carnival takes place in the third week of February (approximately February 19-21 in 2026). This carnival highlights Amazonian culture with distinctive warrior dances and striking costumes. Typical dishes include Chachapoyas-style tamales, hen stew, purtumute (bean and corn stew), humitas, and cecina. The region offers attractions including Kuélap Fortress (an astonishing pre-Hispanic citadel), Gocta Waterfall, the Sarcophagi of Karajía, and the Condors Lagoon in Leymebamba. The carnival blends Amazonian cultural elements with Andean traditions, creating a unique celebration distinct from other regional carnivals.

name: Fiesta Grande (Fiesta de Enero) - Chiapa de Corzo 2026
desc: UNESCO Intangible Cultural Heritage festival honoring three Catholic saints with traditional parachicos dances
details: Announcement of Chuntas on Jan 8, main celebrations Jan 15-23. Parachico dancers wear painted wooden masks, sarapes, embroidered shawls, colored ribbons, play tin rattles (chinchines). Six parachicos processions: Jan 4 (children), Jan 15 (Lord of Esquipulas), Jan 17 (San Antonio Abad), Jan 18 (third), Jan 20 (San Sebastián), Jan 22 (fifth with flag lowering 3:00 PM), Jan 23 (sixth with farewell mass 9:00 AM). Traditional foods, folkloric dances, special masses, naval combat simulation with fireworks on Grijalva River.

name: Mitama Matsuri (Yasukuni Shrine Festival)
desc: 30,000 illuminated paper lanterns create a mesmerizing display at Yasukuni Shrine during Obon.
details: The Mitama Matsuri at Yasukuni Shrine features approximately 30,000 paper lanterns and 6,000 smaller lanterns illuminating the shrine grounds during the Obon period. The yellow glow of the lanterns creates an incredibly atmospheric scene. Traditional performances, bon odori dancing, and food stalls round out the festivities.

name: Rabín Ajau (Q'eqchi' Indigenous Beauty Pageant)
desc: Guatemala's most important indigenous celebration where 100+ young Mayan women compete emphasizing spiritual beauty, intelligence, leadership, and cultural knowledge over physical appearance.
details: Rabín Ajau translates to "the king's daughter" in Q'eqchi' Mayan language. More than 100 indigenous women from Maya communities throughout Guatemala gather in Cobán, the heart of the Verapaces region, to celebrate their rich traditions and cultures. The event emphasizes spiritual beauty, intelligence, leadership skills, and knowledge of cultural and historical traditions—focusing on substance over appearance. The festival features traditional marimba music, live performances, speeches in Q'eqchi' and other Mayan languages, colorful parades, and fireworks. The atmosphere is predominantly local families with adventurous travelers exploring Mayan culture. Entry tickets typically range from $10-20. The event is held in the center of this indigenous community.

name: Guizhou Dong Grand Song Festival
desc: UNESCO-recognized polyphonic singing traditions of the Dong people performed in ancient wooden villages.
details: The Dong people's Grand Song (Da Ge) tradition—a UNESCO Intangible Cultural Heritage—is a unique form of multi-part harmony singing performed without conductor or accompaniment. Festivals in ancient wooden Dong villages of southeastern Guizhou feature performances in the distinctive drum towers that serve as community centers. The songs cover themes of nature, love, and daily life.

name: Carnaval de Cozumel 2026
desc: 152-year-old tropical island carnival featuring three grand parades with free concerts and traditional Caribbean celebrations
details: Pre-Carnival events at Moby Dick Entertainment Center January-February. Three grand parades on Feb 14, 15, and 17. Free concerts featuring Gloria Trevi, María José, Lasso, Alexander Acha, Los Socios del Ritmo. Closes Feb 18 with burning of Juan Carnaval ceremony.

name: Bali Arts Festival (Pesta Kesenian Bali)
desc: A month-long celebration of Indonesian culture featuring traditional dances, theater performances, music, and handicraft exhibitions.
details: The Bali Arts Festival is the island's premier cultural event, held at the Taman Werdhi Budaya Art Center. A month of daily performances showcases traditional Balinese and Indonesian dance, gamelan music, shadow puppet theater (wayang), textile exhibitions, and cooking demonstrations. Opening day features a spectacular parade of performers from across the archipelago.

name: Diriyah Season
desc: A massive city-wide entertainment mega-festival transforming Riyadh into a hub of concerts, theater, sports, and cultural experiences across themed zones.
details: Riyadh Season spans multiple zones, each with a different theme. Boulevard Riyadh City features live theater, concerts, and e-sports. Boulevard World offers cultural parades, international cuisine, and boat rides. Winter Wonderland provides amusement rides and carnival games. The event draws millions of visitors from across Saudi Arabia and internationally, with world-class performers and immersive experiences reflecting Saudi Arabia's entertainment revolution under Vision 2030.

name: World Art Dubai
desc: The Middle East's flagship international art fair celebrating its 20th anniversary with 110+ galleries from 35+ countries at Madinat Jumeirah.
details: Art Dubai 2026 marks the fair's 20th anniversary with 110+ modern, contemporary, and digital presentations from over 35 countries, including 36 first-time exhibitors. Five sections—Art Dubai Galleries, Zamaniyyat, Bawwaba, Art Dubai Digital, and new Bawwaba Extended—showcase works across Madinat Jumeirah. Founded in 2007, it is the most significant global art gathering in the Middle East, serving as a catalyst for the region's art scene and creative economy.

name: Dubrovnik Summer Festival
desc: Croatia's premier cultural festival stages theater, opera, classical music, and dance performances in stunning open-air venues throughout Dubrovnik's medieval old town.
details: For over 70 years, the Dubrovnik Summer Festival has transformed the UNESCO-listed old town into a vast open-air stage. Performances take place in Fort Lovrijenac, Rector's Palace courtyards, and other historic venues. The festival features world-class theater, opera, classical music, ballet, and folk performances, all set against the dramatic backdrop of Dubrovnik's medieval walls and Adriatic coast.

name: Galway International Arts Festival
desc: Ireland's premier arts festival transforms Galway into a hub of theater, visual art, music, comedy, and spectacle along its charming medieval streets.
details: The Galway International Arts Festival features major theatrical productions, large-scale visual art installations, music performances, comedy shows, and free street events. Set in one of Ireland's most charming cities, the festival has established itself as a major fixture on the European arts calendar, with world premieres and headline acts alongside emerging artists.

name: Gentse Feesten
desc: Ten-day city festival of street performance, music, theatre; official portal lists dates.
details: The Ghent Festivities transform the medieval city centre into a massive celebration with 20 stages, 300 stalls, street theatre, comedy, circus, and free open-air concerts. Most events are free, creating an inclusive atmosphere.

name: Gifu Cormorant Fishing (Ukai)
desc: Ancient nighttime cormorant fishing on the Nagara River—a spectacular 1,300-year tradition.
details: Ukai (cormorant fishing) on the Nagara River has been practiced for over 1,300 years and is protected by the Imperial Household Agency. Master fishermen (usho) guide trained cormorants from wooden boats illuminated by blazing iron baskets. Spectators watch from pleasure boats as the dramatic firelit fishing unfolds on the dark river. The season runs from May to October.

name: Procissão do Fogaréu
desc: 280-year-old torch-lit procession beginning at midnight on Holy Thursday depicting search and arrest of Jesus, featuring fiéis dressed as Roman centurions.
details: The Procissão do Fogaréu begins at 00:00 from the Museum of Sacred Art of Boa Morte. Participants carry torches creating a solemn, dramatic atmosphere through historic streets of Goiás Velho. The tradition dates to approximately 1745 with roots in Seville, Spain. The procession symbolizes Christ's arrest and search through the night. Recognized as Intangible Cultural Heritage of Goiás through Law 21.855 (April 11, 2023), the procession programming extends beyond Goiás Velho to over 10 Brazilian states in 2026, emphasizing its cultural significance.

name: Timkat Festival
desc: Ethiopia's most significant Orthodox Christian celebration commemorating the baptism of Jesus.
details:
ssive city-wide sales, daily drone shows, and cultural performances across the Emirate.71

| Festival Name | Location | Dates (2026) | Cultural Mechanism & Focus |
| :---- | :---- | :---- | :---- |
| **Timkat Festival** | Addis Ababa/Gondar, Ethiopia | January | Ethiopian Orthodox Epiphany celebrating spiritual renewal with water blessings and processions. |
| **Carnival of Venice** | Venice, Italy | Jan 31 – Feb 17

name: Ice Lantern Festival
desc: Dazzling LED-lit ice lantern sculptures in Zhaolin Park complementing the main Ice and Snow Festival.
details: The Ice Lantern Art Fair in Zhaolin Park features intricate ice sculptures illuminated from within by colorful LED lights. Dating back to the 1960s, it is the original Harbin ice event and offers a more intimate experience than the massive Ice and Snow World. The park transforms into a glowing wonderland of small-scale ice artistry.

name: Batalla del Vino (Wine Battle)
desc: Haro's legendary wine fight — thousands douse each other with red wine in a hilarious, wine-soaked morning battle in the heart of Rioja country.
details: On the morning of June 29, thousands of people dressed in white climb to the Riscos de Bilibio cliffs above Haro and proceed to drench each other with red wine. Using buckets, water guns, and bottles, participants turn completely purple in what must be one of Europe's most enjoyable waste of good wine. The battle is followed by a traditional bullfight and celebrations in town. Declared a Festival of National Tourist Interest.

name: Hida Furukawa Festival
desc: Dramatic nighttime 'naked festival' and ornate float procession in a historic Edo-era town.
details: Hida Furukawa Matsuri features the dramatic Okoshi Daiko (rousing drum) where teams of near-naked men jostle a massive drum through the streets at night by torchlight. By day, elaborate yatai floats with mechanical karakuri puppets parade through the beautifully preserved Edo-era streets.

name: Perfume Pagoda Festival
desc: Vietnam's longest Buddhist pilgrimage featuring scenic rowboat trips through limestone mountains to sacred mountain caves.
details: Located in a stunning landscape of limestone mountains and rice paddies, the Perfume Pagoda pilgrimage is Vietnam's most important Buddhist journey. Visitors take scenic rowboat trips down the Yen Stream before hiking up to sacred caves and temples. The three-month festival season combines spiritual devotion with breathtaking natural beauty.

name: Fiesta de la Vendimia (Wine Harvest Festival)
desc: 61st International Wine and Pisco Festival celebrating the grape harvest with processions, traditional dances, live grape pressing, and pisco distillation demonstrations.
details: The festival begins with the traditional vendimia procession on March 6 featuring floats, typical dances, and public delegations heading to the Ica Fair Grounds for first grape pressing and live pisco distillation. The Harvest Queen coronation occurs February 28. From March 11-14, the "Ruta de los Lagares" allows tourists to experience traditional harvest activities in the countryside with grape pressing, Creole music, and family receptions at wineries. Sunday, March 15 features the grand vendimia parade with allegorical floats competing for the gold lion award. This celebration of cultural gratitude for the harvest represents Ica's agricultural heritage.

name: OCASO Festival
desc: Electronic music destination festival just outside Jacó featuring underground house, techno, and electronic music with 50%+ regional DJ talent.
details: OCASO is a two-day electronic music festival designed as an immersive underground electronic music experience. It showcases both regional and international talent, with a core focus on promoting Central American electronic music artists—over 50% of DJ bookings reserved for regional talent from Costa Rica and neighboring countries. The event takes place right by the coast, offering palm trees, salty sea air, warm breezes, and moody beach sunsets. This event is 18+ and operates on a cashless wristband system. Previous editions included beach-cleanup volunteer programs involving attendees, demonstrating commitment to preserving Costa Rica's natural beauty and environment.

name: Jinju Namgang Yudeung (Lantern) Festival
desc: Breathtaking river lantern festival with 70,000 floating lanterns commemorating fallen soldiers of the Imjin War.
details: The Jinju Lantern Festival is one of Korea's most beautiful autumn events. Approximately 70,000 lanterns float on the Namgang River, honoring soldiers who fell defending Jinju Fortress during the 1592 Japanese invasion. Elaborate lantern installations, traditional performances, and a fireworks finale create an unforgettable atmosphere. The reflections on the river make it incredibly photogenic.

name: FNB Art Joburg
desc: Africa's leading art fair in Johannesburg showcasing galleries from across the continent.
details: FNB Art Joburg is Africa's premier art fair, held at the Sandton Convention Centre. It features leading galleries from across Africa and the world, alongside a curated programme of talks, performances, and special projects highlighting contemporary African art.

name: Fiesta de la Pachamama
desc: Extended celebration of indigenous Andean traditions with Pachamama (Mother Earth) reverence and syncretist carnival traditions.
details: Carnival of Los Tekis (Feb 13-16), Carnival Grande (Feb 14-16), Descent of Devils in Uquía and Maimará (Feb 14), Martes de Chaya (Feb 17), Carnival Chico (Feb 21), Carnival of Flowers (Feb 28), Carnival of Remache (March 7). Quebrada de Humahuaca is UNESCO World Heritage Site and symbolic epicenter. Occupancy reached 98-98.9% hotel rates.

name: Rose Festival (Festival of the Roses)
desc: Bulgaria's century-old festival celebrating the blooming of precious Rosa Damascena oil roses, with rose-picking rituals, the Rose Queen coronation, and a grand parade.
details: Established in 1903 in the Valley of the Roses, this festival honors the Rosa Damascena. Visitors can join morning rose-picking rituals in nearby fields. Back in town, highlights include the Rose Queen beauty pageant, folk concerts, and the Grand Rose Parade on the first Sunday of June with folk dancers, musicians, and decorated floats rolling down Kazanlak's main street.

name: Rose Festival (Festival des Roses)
desc: A spectacular celebration of the Damask rose harvest in the Valley of Roses with parades, music, and a Rose Queen coronation.
details: Each spring, the Dades Valley turns pink with millions of roses. The three-day festival features the crowning of a Rose Queen, decorated floats, traditional Berber music and ahwash dancing, and streets filled with rose petals. Visitors can tour rose distilleries, buy rose water and cosmetics, and enjoy the stunning Atlas Mountain backdrop. Around 20,000 attendees descend on this small town, creating an intimate yet vibrant atmosphere.

name: Mitake Shimotsuki Matsuri
desc: Ancient winter solstice ritual with boiling water ceremony and masked dances in mountain shrines.
details: The Shimotsuki Matsuri in the Kiso Valley features ancient rituals including the yu-date ceremony where shrine priests splash boiling water in ritual purification, believed to be the origin of the yudate tradition. Masked performers dance in dimly lit mountain shrines during the longest nights of the year.

name: Alasitas Festival (Fiesta del Ekeko - Abundance Festival)
desc: An Aymara cultural celebration honoring Ekeko, the god of abundance, where miniature replicas of goods are purchased and given as gifts with the belief the recipient will acquire real items during the year.
details: The Alasitas Festival is a major cultural festival in Bolivia celebrating abundance and the god Ekeko in La Paz in honor of the Aymara deity. The preferia (pre-fair) runs January 16-23, 2026, with the official inauguration and mass occurring January 24. The fair features at least 5,000 exhibitors presenting innovative crafts and new miniatures while maintaining tradition. A demonstration of the Alasita ritual educates attendees on the spiritual background. The President of Bolivia participates by walking through to receive artisans' wishes. People travel to the capital to purchase miniature versions of goods from across Bolivia, given to friends with the belief the recipient will acquire the real object during the subsequent year. The tradition represents a syncretic blend of Aymara indigenous beliefs and Catholic practices, making this one of Bolivia's most significant cultural expressions.

name: Dominican Republic Carnival
desc: Vibrant national carnival featuring the terrifying Diablos Cojuelos with spectacular papier-mâché masks.
details: La Vega's Diablos Cojuelos (limping devils) wear spectacular papier-mâché masks and hit bystanders with vejigas (inflated pig bladders). Santiago features the Lechones. Santo Domingo hosts the grand National Carnival parade along the Malecón on the last Sunday. Blends African, Taíno, and Spanish traditions.

name: Señor de los Milagros (Lord of Miracles)
desc: One of the world's largest religious processions with over one million participants wearing purple tunics honoring the miraculous 17th-century Christ painting that survived earthquakes.
details: This historic festival traces origins to 1655 when a slave from Angola painted an image of Christ on an adobe church wall. A massive earthquake devastated Lima, but the mural remained untouched—a miracle sparking widespread devotion. During October, Lima transforms into a sea of purple as participants wear purple tunics with white sashes symbolizing penance and humility. The city fills with incense, sacred hymns, and the sound of marching feet. Participants carry rosaries or small images of the Lord, with some walking barefoot in devotion. Traditional "Turrón de Doña Pepa" (anise-flavored nougat) is found throughout street stalls and bakeries.

name: Carnaval de Limón (Limón Carnival)
desc: One of Costa Rica's biggest celebrations honoring Christopher Columbus' landing but now focusing on Afro-Caribbean culture with colorful floats, steel bands, and live performances.
details: The Limón Carnival is one of Costa Rica's biggest celebrations taking place every October in the port city of Limón on the Caribbean coast. A week-long event beginning in early October, the main day is "Día de las Culturas" on October 12. Started in 1949, the festival has grown into a week of music, dancing, and parades celebrating Afro-Caribbean culture, traditions, and community pride. The event features colorful floats, steel bands, and performers in bright costumes. Visitors have opportunities to participate in various cultural experiences throughout the week, including sampling traditional Afro-Caribbean foods and watching live music performances. October is the region's dry season, and increased tourist traffic occurs during the carnival, so book accommodations and transportation early.

name: 34th Macao International Fireworks Display Contest
desc: International pyrotechnics competition with teams from 10+ countries performing over Macau's iconic waterfront.
details: The Macau International Fireworks Display Contest is one of Asia's premier fireworks events. Teams from over 10 countries compete with spectacular displays launched from barges near Macau Tower. Held over multiple weekends in September and October, each evening features two competing national teams. The displays reflect beautifully off Nam Van Lake and the Macau skyline.

name: Fiestas de Santo Domingo de Guzmán
desc: Managua’s biggest traditional street festival with processions, music, and dancing.

name: Matsue Water Lantern Festival (Toro Nagashi)
desc: Thousands of floating paper lanterns on Lake Shinji at sunset to guide ancestral spirits.
details: On the final night of Obon, thousands of colorful paper lanterns are floated on Lake Shinji in Matsue to guide ancestral spirits back to the afterlife. The famous Matsue sunset over the lake, combined with the glowing floating lanterns, creates one of Japan's most photogenic Obon scenes.

name: Feria Xmatkuil/mérida Carnival
desc: Two major Yucatecan celebrations: February carnival with circus theme at Xmatkuil fairgrounds; November fair showcasing livestock, textiles, crafts, and entertainment.
details: Mérida Carnival 2026 ("Circo Carnaval"): February 11–18, transforming Mérida historic center and Xmatkuil fairgrounds into massive open-air circus. Family-friendly, safe, inclusive experience. Parades begin in Historic Center before moving to Xmatkuil "Ciudad Carnaval." Free family events at fairgrounds with circus shows. Feria Yucatán Xmatkuil (November–December): Approximately 24-day fair featuring livestock, textile, artisan, commercial industries plus entertainment/spectacle. Both events celebrate Yucatecan culture and traditions.

name: AQUA Art Miami
desc: The longest-running contemporary art fair in Miami, occurring alongside Art Basel.
details: Known for a slightly more accessible but still highly prestigious selection of modern and post-war art, Art Miami is a massive commercial engine that draws serious collectors who bypass the frenzy of the main convention center.

name: Nagasaki Lantern Festival
desc: A spectacular celebration of Chinese New Year with over 15,000 lanterns illuminating Nagasaki's historic Chinatown district.
details: Originally a Lunar New Year celebration for Nagasaki's Chinese community, it has expanded into a city-wide event featuring dragon dances, the dramatic Mazu Procession, acrobatic performances, and elaborate lantern displays throughout the city center. The festival celebrates Nagasaki's deep historical connections to China and continental Asia.

name: Naoshima Art Island (Year-round)
desc: World-renowned art island featuring museums by Tadao Ando, Yayoi Kusama's pumpkins, and site-specific installations.
details: Naoshima, the jewel of the Seto Inland Sea art islands, features the Benesse House Museum, Chichu Art Museum (housing Monets and James Turrells), and the Lee Ufan Museum—all designed by Tadao Ando. Yayoi Kusama's iconic yellow pumpkin and the Art House Project transform the village. While the Setouchi Triennale isn't until 2028, Naoshima is a year-round destination.

name: Nuremberg Christmas Market (Christkindlesmarkt)
desc: Germany's most famous and atmospheric Christmas market, dating to the 16th century, filling the medieval Hauptmarkt with traditional crafts, Glühwein, and Lebkuchen.
details: The Nuremberg Christkindlesmarkt is one of the oldest and most famous Christmas markets in the world, dating to at least the 16th century. The medieval Hauptmarkt fills with nearly 200 wooden stalls selling traditional handmade ornaments, Nuremberg Lebkuchen (gingerbread), Glühwein, roasted almonds, and local crafts. The Christkind (Christ Child) figure opens the market from the church balcony. Truly magical.

name: Carnaval de Oaxaca
desc: Vibrant pre-Lenten carnival with painted devil dancers, music, and mezcal in Zapotec villages.
details: Features celebrations in Central Valley villages with Zaachila's Zapotec roots being most notable. Men paint themselves and wear devil masks (Los Chachudos), dancing in traditions mixing Mesoamerican and Christian elements. Free-flowing mezcal accompanies parades and communal meals.

name: Recife & Olinda Carnival
desc: Celebrates frevo dancing, giant dolls (bonecos gigantes), maracatu traditions, and Afro-Brazilian heritage with unique regional flair.
details: Recife Carnival features the famous Galo da Madrugada street parade (recognized by Guinness as the world's largest carnival street party with 2+ million participants) and traditional frevo dancers with colorful umbrellas. Olinda's carnival includes the spectacular parade of nearly 100 giant dolls representing cultural figures including historical icons, musicians, and contemporary personalities like Wagner Moura and filmmaker Kleber Mendonça Filho. The celebration emphasizes regional traditions and Pernambuco's rich cultural heritage.

name: Tao (Yami) Flying Fish Festival
desc: Sacred fishing ceremony cycle of the Tao people on Orchid Island tied to the annual flying fish migration.
details: The Tao people of Orchid Island celebrate a four-month cycle of ceremonies tied to the flying fish season. Rituals include the blessing of boats, prayers for bountiful catches, and fishing cessation ceremonies. The Tao's distinctive carved boats and traditional dress make this one of Taiwan's most visually striking indigenous celebrations. Visitors must be respectful of sacred ceremonies.

name: Norwegian Constitution Day (Syttende Mai)
desc: Norway's most festive day, with children's parades, marching bands, traditional bunad costumes, and ice cream — a joyous celebration unlike any other national day.
details: May 17th is Norway's biggest celebration — but uniquely, it's a children's party rather than a military parade. Across the country, children march in parades wearing traditional bunad costumes, accompanied by marching bands, flags, and much ice cream. In Oslo, the parade passes the Royal Palace where the royal family waves from the balcony. The atmosphere is pure joy — families, friends, and communities celebrating together.

name: Oeshiki Festival (Ikegami Honmon-ji)
desc: Dramatic Buddhist memorial with 3,000 illuminated manto lanterns parading through the night.
details: The Oeshiki Festival at Ikegami Honmon-ji Temple commemorates the death of Nichiren, founder of the Nichiren Buddhist sect, in 1282. The climactic evening of October 12 features a procession of approximately 3,000 manto lanterns and cherry blossom-decorated floats through the streets, accompanied by enthusiastic drumming and chanting.

name: Lake Biwa Fireworks Festival
desc: Massive Obon fireworks display with 40,000 fireworks including a spectacular Niagara Falls cascade.
details: The Lake Suwa Fireworks Festival is one of Japan's largest fireworks events, launching an astonishing 40,000 fireworks in a single night during the Obon holiday. The two standout features are the 'Kiss of Fire'—simultaneous fireworks from both shores creating a heart shape—and the 2km-wide 'Niagara Falls' cascade effect over the lake.

name: Semana Santa
desc: Historic Holy Week celebrations in 18th-century colonial mining town with dramatic processions, liturgical reenactments, and decorative sawdust carpets through baroque streets.
details: The Procissão dos Passos (Wednesday) and Procissão do Enterro (Friday) traverse historic streets lined with baroque churches and colonial houses. The Procissão do Encontro reenacts Our Lady of Sorrows meeting Jesus carrying the cross. The Procissão do Fogaréu on Holy Thursday night features citizens dressed as Roman centurions carrying torches through darkened colonial streets creating emotional atmosphere. Decorative sawdust carpets created by residents, students, and visitors on Holy Saturday morning transform streets into artistic expressions. The Parish of Nossa Senhora da Conceição oversees celebrations. Ouro Preto's preservation makes it one of Brazil's most authentic Holy Week experiences.

name: Carnaval Ouro Preto
desc: Historic carnival in colonial mining town with preserved traditions and baroque architecture serving as stage for celebrations.
details: Ouro Preto's carnival blends street celebrations with preservation of colonial atmosphere. The historic center becomes a living stage with traditional blocos and reinventions. The town's baroque churches and cobblestone streets create an unforgettable backdrop for carnival festivities.

name: Festival de Parintins (Boi-Bumbá)
desc: World-renowned folkloric competition between two giant boi-bumbá (ox-bull) groups featuring elaborate theatrical spectacles based on Amazonian indigenous and riverine traditions.
details: The Garantido (red and white) and Caprichoso (blue and white) bumbás compete for supremacy at the Bumbódromo arena with three nights of presentations blending music, dance, theater, and mythology. Garantido's 2026 theme is "Parintins: Portal do Encantamento" (Portal of Enchantment). Caprichoso counters with its own narrative. The festival kicks off with Carnaboi in Manaus (February 20-21) as a preview event. The competition represents the highest expression of Amazonian folklore, combining indigenous wisdom with African rhythms and Portuguese colonial traditions.

name: Día de Muertos - Pátzcuaro and Janitzio 2026
desc: Candlelit boat processions and cemetery vigils on island with traditional Michoacán traditions
details: Main ceremony November 1 evening with candlelit boat processions from Pátzcuaro to Janitzio island. Families decorate tombs with candles and marigolds. Recommend staying entire week Oct 26-Nov 2. Families take boats to island and graveyard for all-night festive vigil.

name: Semana Santa Pátzcuaro
desc: Haunting lakeside Holy Week with Purépecha indigenous traditions and candlelit cemetery vigils on Janitzio Island.
details: Blends Catholic traditions with Purépecha indigenous customs. On Holy Saturday night, Janitzio island in Lake Pátzcuaro fills with candlelight as families hold grave vigils. Processions wind through colonial streets and around the lake. The combination of indigenous spirituality, Catholic passion plays, and mystical lakeside setting is extraordinary.

name: Naghol (Land Diving)
desc: The original bungee jump — young men dive from 30m wooden towers with vines tied to their ankles in an ancient ritual.
details: The Naghol land diving of Pentecost Island is one of the most extraordinary cultural experiences on Earth. Young men leap from tall wooden towers with forest vines attached to their ankles as a rite of passage and to ensure a good yam harvest. This ancient practice predates and inspired modern bungee jumping.

name: 59th Carnegie International
desc: North America's longest-running international art exhibition, titled 'If the word we,' featuring 61 artists from around the world.
details: The 59th Carnegie International at Carnegie Museum of Art runs May 2, 2026 to January 3, 2027. Curated by Ryan Inouye, Danielle A. Jackson, and Liz Park, it features 61 artists across multiple venues including the Children's Museum and Mattress Factory. Participants include Dineo Seshee Bopape, Torkwase Dyson, and the Silät collective from Argentina.

name: Festival del Cristo Negro (Black Christ Festival)
desc: Important religious event where thousands of pilgrims walk long distances to honor the Black Christ statue, with processions, prayer services, and devotional items for sale.
details: The Black Christ Festival takes place each October in the Caribbean community of Portobelo, one of Panama's most important religious events. The main pilgrimage day is October 21, when thousands travel to Portobelo to honor the Black Christ (Cristo Negro) statue housed in the Church of San Felipe. The statue is life-size, carved from heavy cocobolo wood of dark brown color. Activities build in the days before October 21, but the largest crowds arrive on the main day of devotion. Pilgrims walk long distances to reach Portobelo, many dressed in purple robes, while others arrive by bus or boat. The town fills with processions, prayer services, and informal gatherings centered on the church and surrounding streets. Religious ceremonies continue throughout the day and night, with the statue remaining the focal point. Vendors line streets selling food, candles, and devotional items. To Portobelo's inhabitants, especially those claiming African descent, the festival is more than religious celebration—it is a form of protest against Spanish colonialism which brought slavery and racism.

name: Festival de la Virgen del Mar (Virgin of the Sea Festival)
desc: Mid-July celebration honoring patron saint Nuestra Señora del Carmen featuring maritime processions with decorated boats, masses, parades, music, and sporting events.
details: The Fiestas de la Virgen del Mar honors Puntarenas' patron saint, the Virgin Mary venerated as Nuestra Señora del Carmen ("the Virgin of the Sea"). The festival commemorates a devastating storm of 1920 that caused widespread damage and loss of life in the port town, with celebrations giving thanks to the patron saint for protection. The festival is defined by decorated boats displaying religious symbols, flags, and flowers. On land, people gather for masses, musical performances, ox cart parades, dance performances, live music, and sporting events. The event attracts people from all over Costa Rica, making it difficult to find hotels, so book accommodations well in advance if you intend to attend.

name: Rock in Rio Brasil 2026
desc: One of the world's largest rock music festivals, featuring international and Brazilian rock, pop, and alternative artists across multiple stages.
details: Doors open at 2 PM, last entry at midnight, event concludes at 2 AM. The festival spans two weeks with the first set (4-7 Sept) coinciding with Brazilian Independence Day (Sept 7) and the second week (11-13 Sept). The event transforms Olympic Park into a massive concert venue with multiple stages, merchandise areas, and food courts. Rock in Rio is one of the largest and most influential rock festivals globally with attendance exceeding 700,000.

name: Baja Beach Fest 2026
desc: Massive beachfront Latin music festival featuring reggaetón, Latin trap, and regional Mexican stars.
details: One of the most important Latin urban music festivals on the beaches of Rosarito. Draws massive crowds for reggaetón, Latin trap, and regional Mexican headliners. Beachfront setting blends sun, sand, and bass-heavy beats, attracting fans from both sides of the US-Mexico border.

name: Carnaval Santa Cruz (Regional Carnival)
desc: Major Bolivian carnival celebration with precarnavaleras (preliminary parties), coronations, street carnivals, the Gran Corso parade with 267 comparsas, and water games (mojazón).
details: The ACCC (Cruceña Associations of Carnival Comparsas) announced the official 2026 agenda. Precarnavaleras begin January 10 (1st, Colonial theme), January 17 (2nd, Republican), January 24 (Street Carnival), and January 31 (4th, Carnival of the Future). February begins February 1 with Bandeao Carnavalero, February 5 with Queen of Carnival of Old Times coronation, and February 7 with Carnival Queen coronation. The central event is Saturday, February 14 with the Santa Cruz Corso from 5:30 PM to 1:30 AM at the Cambódromo, featuring 267 comparsas displaying carnival creativity. Traditional water games (mojazón) occur Sunday, February 15 through Tuesday, February 17, filling streets with water games, music, and celebration.

name: Lollapalooza Chile
desc: Three-day international music festival in Parque O'Higgins featuring global headliners and diverse genres.
details: Relocated to Parque O'Higgins with headliners Sabrina Carpenter, Tyler The Creator, Chappell Roan, Deftones, Skrillex, Lorde, Doechii, Turnstile, Lewis Capaldi, and Paulo Londra. Major international and regional artists across multiple stages. One of South America's largest music festivals with diverse programming.

name: Santiago a Mil - Teatro (International Theater Festival)
desc: Large summer theatre festival with local and international productions across venues and public spaces.
details: Theme: "SÍ IMPORTA" (Yes, It Matters) affirming culture and performing arts' role in democratic society. Features free and paid events in Metropolitan Region and throughout Chile. Notable performances include "Mister Shakespeare" at Centro Cultural GAM and "Gonawindúa." Performances across multiple venues. Run by Teatro a Mil International Festival Foundation (FITAM).

name: Fiesta del Fuego / Festival del Caribe
desc: One of Cuba's most important international cultural festivals celebrating Caribbean identity and heritage.
details: Also known as Festival del Caribe, this festival features music, dance, folklore, theater, visual arts, and popular traditions from across the Caribbean. Over 50 venues host activities in beautiful outdoor locations, transforming Santiago de Cuba into a lively celebration of color, music, and dance. The festival involves over 2,000 artists and intellectuals from approximately 18 countries. Each edition highlights a guest country or culture through concerts, performances, academic events, parades, and ceremonial activities. The traditional Burning of the Devil ceremony marks the official closing.

name: Feria de Abril (April Fair)
desc: Seville's signature celebration transforms the fairground into a temporary flamenco city of striped casetas, horse parades, and all-night dancing deep into the Andalusian night.
details: The Feria de Abril is pure Andalusian electricity. The fairground at Los Remedios becomes its own temporary city with over 1,000 casetas (private tents) where families, friends, and strangers gather for flamenco dancing, fino sherry, and tapas. Women wear spectacular trajes de flamenca; men in traditional Andalusian suits ride horses. The nightly illumination of the fairground entrance (portada) is breathtaking. Daytime features elegant horse parades.

name: Shikoku Pilgrimage (Henro) Season
desc: 1,200-year-old 88-temple pilgrimage circumnavigating the entire island of Shikoku.
details: The Shikoku 88 Temple Pilgrimage is one of the world's great spiritual journeys, covering 1,200km around Shikoku island visiting 88 temples associated with Kukai (Kobo Daishi). While year-round, spring and autumn are peak seasons. Modern pilgrims (henro) walk alongside traditional white-clad pilgrims in a tradition spanning 1,200 years.

name: Sauti Za Busara Festival
desc: Traditional African music festival in Stone Town with performances plus workshops/networking.
details: Sauti za Busara, meaning 'Sounds of Wisdom,' is East Africa's premier music festival held in February in the old forts, amphitheatres, and historic buildings of Stone Town, Zanzibar. It features music from across East Africa and beyond in a UNESCO World Heritage setting.

name: Yabun Festival
desc: Australia's largest one-day celebration of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander culture held on January 26.
details: Yabun Festival takes place in Victoria Park, Sydney each January 26, providing a space for Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander communities to celebrate survival, culture, and identity. The free event features live music, dance, stalls, workshops, and speeches from community leaders.

name: Taipei Lantern Festival
desc: Taipei's own spectacular lantern exhibition featuring cutting-edge light art and traditional lantern displays.
details: The Taipei Lantern Festival has evolved from traditional lantern displays into a cutting-edge light art festival. Multiple districts host themed installations combining traditional Chinese lantern craft with contemporary digital art. The main venue typically features an enormous illuminated zodiac animal sculpture, interactive light installations, and performances.

name: Yoshino Cherry Blossom Festival
desc: Japan's most sacred cherry blossom site with 30,000 trees covering an entire mountainside in pink.
details: Mount Yoshino is Japan's most revered cherry blossom location, with 30,000 trees planted over 1,300 years blooming in waves from the base to the summit. The mountain is divided into four areas that bloom sequentially, extending the viewing season. UNESCO World Heritage temples dot the mountain paths. Night illuminations add magic.

name: Fiesta San Roque (Tarija - UNESCO Heritage)
desc: One of Bolivia's most emotional religious and cultural celebrations declared UNESCO Intangible Cultural Heritage, honoring Saint Roque, protector of the sick, with 10,000+ "Chunchos" devotees dancing in processions.
details: From August 15 through the second Tuesday of September, Tarija transforms into a celebration of faith, music, dance, and tradition. The Chunchos are the festival's undisputed protagonists—adorned with feather-filled turbans and mirrors, colorful ponchos, and arrows—fulfilling promises by dancing in each procession. More than 10,000 devotees dress as Chunchos, quenilla players, cane players, and drummers paying homage to San Roque. The festival originates from colonial times when city inhabitants invoked the saint to cure epidemics and diseases, protecting loved ones. Notably, it's the only religious festival in Bolivia where alcoholic beverages are NOT consumed—distinguishing it as a unique spiritual celebration.

name: International Festival of Carthage
desc: Northern Africa's largest entertainment festival held in the ancient Roman 7,500-seat amphitheater of Carthage.
details: First held in 1964, this festival takes place in Carthage's ancient Roman amphitheater and has grown into one of Northern Africa's largest entertainment events. The program features international and Arab musicians, dancers, theater performances, and cultural programming. The spectacular setting of the ancient ruins overlooking the Mediterranean makes every performance unforgettable.

name: Festival de la Leyenda Vallenata
desc: 59th edition celebrating vallenato accordion music with competitions, performances, and tributes to legendary artists including El Binomio de Oro.
details: The festival honors Israel Romero, Rafael Orozco, and El Binomio de Oro de América with three nights of performances. Featured artists include Silvestre Dangond with Guayacán Orquesta and Jean Carlos Centeno (May 1), and J Balvin alongside El Binomio de Oro de América with El Churo Díaz and Elder Dayán (May 2, coronation night). Activities include accordion competitions across categories, unpublished vallenato songs, piquería (improvised verse competitions), painting contests, piloneras parades, and the traditional Jeep Willys Parranderos tour. Pre-sale tickets with Davivienda began December 17-20, 2025.

name: Carnevale di Viareggio
desc: Spectacular carnival with enormous satirical papier-mâché floats parading along the seafront.
details: Viareggio's carnival features gigantic moving floats (up to 20m tall) crafted by master artisans, lampooning politicians and public figures. Five corso parades along the seaside promenade create an unforgettable spectacle.

name: Wuzhen Theater Festival
desc: Acclaimed theater festival in an ancient water town featuring avant-garde performances in stunning canal-side venues.
details: The Wuzhen Theatre Festival brings international and Chinese avant-garde theatre to the ancient canals and courtyards of Wuzhen water town. Founded by renowned Chinese theatre director Stan Lai and producer Huang Lei, the festival features indoor and outdoor performances, workshops, and the famous fringe performances along the canals and bridges of this atmospheric town.

name: Yamaga Lantern Festival
desc: Mesmerizing festival where 1,000 women dance with illuminated paper lanterns balanced on their heads.
details: The Yamaga Toro Festival features the mesmerizing Senningata (Thousand Women) Dance where 1,000 women in yukata dance through the streets with elaborately crafted paper lanterns (toro) on their heads. The golden glow of the lanterns against the night sky creates an ethereal scene. The lanterns are made entirely of paper and paste using techniques dating back to the Muromachi period.

name: Tainan Yanshui Yimin Festival
desc: Traditional Taiwanese folk temple processions with spirit medium performances and elaborate religious rituals.
details: Temple processions during Ghost Month in Tainan feature colorful parades with spirit mediums (jitong), elaborate deity statues, traditional music, and firecrackers. Yanshui and surrounding areas are particularly known for their devotional intensity. These processions represent Taiwan's living folk religion tradition blending Taoism, Buddhism, and local beliefs.

name: Todos Santos (All Saints' Day)
desc: Celebration welcoming returning souls of deceased loved ones with elaborate altars (mast'akus), food offerings, and cemetery visits honoring the dead through combined indigenous and Catholic traditions.
details: Celebrated November 1st as the day when Bolivian families believe deceased loved ones' souls return to earth for 24 hours. Families make altars (called "mast'akus") in homes with drink and food (bread, fruit, biscuits—often favorites of the deceased) to nourish arriving souls. On November 2 (Día de los Difuntos/Day of the Dead), cemeteries throughout Bolivia host thousands decorating graves with flowers and elaborate food spreads. Families visit tombs with feasts prepared the night before. These celebrations blend indigenous customs with Christian (Catholic) religious beliefs unique to Bolivian culture.

name: Carnaval Haïtien (Haiti Carnival) - National
desc: Haiti Carnival 2026 features vibrant first-day parades nationwide with street bands, vibrant costumes, papier-mâché masks, and thousands of revelers.
details: Traditional celebrations begin across multiple cities with lively parades featuring street bands, vibrant costumes, and papier-mâché masks. The carnival showcases Haitian creative genius and cultural heritage through elaborate costume designs and street performances.

name: Yalda Night / Shab-e Yalda
desc: Ancient Persian celebration of winter solstice celebrating light over darkness. UNESCO ICH since 2022.
details: Families gather to share stories, poetry of Hafez, and traditional foods including pomegranates and watermelons. Rooted in Zoroastrian traditions symbolizing togetherness and hope.

name: Carnaval Andino Con la Fuerza del Sol
desc: Third largest carnival in Latin America with 20,000+ musicians and dancers from Chile, Peru, Bolivia, and beyond.
details: Street circuit parade through downtown Arica: Avenida Chile, Comandante San Martín, Pedro Montt, 18 de Septiembre, Arturo Prat, San Marcos, 7 de Junio, General Arteaga. Main stage at Comandante San Martín. Represents largest multicultural event in Chile's north. Broadcast live on Municipality of Arica YouTube channel. Features indigenous Andean and Afrodescendant cultural heritage.

name: Sonsbeek
desc: A historic, pioneering exhibition of public and outdoor sculpture and installation art.
details: Operating on a quadrennial/fluid schedule, Sonsbeek utilizes the parks and public spaces of Arnhem. The 2026 edition promises to continue its legacy of challenging the boundaries of public art and civic engagement in Europe.

name: Oregon Shakespeare Festival
desc: One of the oldest and largest professional non-profit theaters in the US, presenting 11 plays in repertory.
details: The Oregon Shakespeare Festival presents approximately 11 plays in repertory across three theaters in the charming town of Ashland. While Shakespeare is central, the repertoire includes classics, new plays, and musicals. The season runs from February through November, making it one of the longest theater festivals in the country.

name: St. George's Day / Diada de Sant Jordi
desc: Diada de Sant Jordi — St. George's Day), Catalunya (special flower markets in Barcelona, other events across the region); Aragón Day; and Castile and León Day (closures in each region
details: On April 23, Catalans celebrate their patron saint in what has become a magical literary and romantic tradition. Traditionally, men give women roses and women give men books. Book and flower stalls line La Rambla and streets across Catalonia. Authors sign books, publishers launch new titles, and the atmosphere is wonderfully festive. A uniquely Catalan celebration of literature and love.

name: Carnaval de Barranquilla (main Carnival days)
desc: UNESCO-listed carnival featuring Batalla de Flores, parades, cumbia and folkloric performances.

name: VOLTA Basel
desc: A key satellite fair during Basel Art Week, focusing on international mid-tier galleries.
details: VOLTA provides a crucial platform for highly professional galleries that are not yet admitted to the main Art Basel fair, offering collectors high-quality contemporary art at more accessible price points.

name: Bergenfest
desc: Western Norway's largest music festival in the stunning surroundings of a medieval fortress in Bergen's city centre.
details: Bergenfest takes place at the historic Bergenhus Fortress, one of the oldest and best-preserved fortresses in Norway. Over four days, it features a mix of international and Norwegian artists across genres. The 2026 lineup includes David Byrne, Devo, and DataRock. The medieval setting creates a uniquely atmospheric concert experience.

name: Gallery Weekend Berlin
desc: A city-wide decentralized art event celebrating Berlin's powerful gallery ecosystem.
details: Instead of a central fair, over 50 top-tier galleries host major openings simultaneously. It transforms the city into a massive, highly curated exhibition, drawing intense international collector traffic to the European capital of cool.

name: Festival Iberoamericano de Teatro de Bogotá (FITB)
desc: Biennial international theater festival transforming Bogotá with 100+ performing arts from 17 countries including dance, theater, circus, and music.
details: The 30th edition of the Festival Iberoamericano de Teatro (FITB) is recognized as the largest performing arts festival globally. Features over 100 works in theaters, streets, parks, and public spaces throughout the city. Includes international performances, street theater (teatro callejero), classical dance, children's and youth theater. The festival brings diverse audiences closer to culture across multiple city neighborhoods with free and paid events.

name: The Great Escape
desc: Europe's leading new music festival and conference showcasing 450+ emerging artists across 35 venues.
details: The Great Escape celebrates its 20th anniversary in 2026. Brighton's venues host 450+ breakthrough artists from around the world, making it the premier showcase for discovering tomorrow's headliners.

name: Art Brussels
desc: Europe's leading contemporary art fair focused intensely on discovery and emerging talent.
details: Renowned for its 'Discovery' section, Art Brussels attracts a dense concentration of influential European collectors looking to acquire works by artists before they hit the blue-chip secondary market.

name: Calgary Stampede
desc: 'The Greatest Outdoor Show on Earth' — 10 days of rodeo, chuckwagon races, concerts, and western festivities.
details: The Calgary Stampede is one of the world's largest rodeos and western celebrations. Over 10 days, the event features world-class rodeo competitions, spectacular chuckwagon races, a massive midway, agricultural exhibitions, First Nations cultural events, free pancake breakfasts across the city, and nightly Grandstand Show concerts. The entire city of Calgary transforms with western wear and celebration.

name: Stampede Breakfast Culture
desc: Uniquely Calgarian tradition of hundreds of free pancake breakfasts served across the city during Stampede.
details: During the Calgary Stampede, hundreds of businesses, organizations, and community groups host free pancake breakfasts across the city. This uniquely generous tradition means you can eat free pancakes every morning of Stampede week - a distinctive expression of Western hospitality.

name: Hay Festival Cartagena de Indias
desc: Prestigious literary festival with 180+ participants from 25 countries exploring literature, journalism, philosophy, film, theatre, and music.
details: One of the most important literary events in the Hispanic world. Features discussions with writers, journalists, poets, musicians, and artists from Colombia and Latin America. Includes adult seminars/discussions, children's activities (Festivalito), National Short Story Competition, and workshops. Free admission for university community (10 free tickets per student). Celebrates intellectual exchange and cultural dialogue.

name: La Romería (Pilgrimage to Virgin of Los Ángeles)
desc: Costa Rica's most important religious pilgrimage attracting up to 2.5 million devotees to honor La Negrita, the country's beloved patron saint.
details: The Romería is one of the world's most significant religious pilgrimages, held on August 2, the feast day of Nuestra Señora de los Ángeles (Our Lady of the Angels), Costa Rica's patron saint. The pilgrimage draws up to 2.5 million people—nearly half the country's population—to honor La Negrita. Devotees walk 22 kilometers from San José to the Basílica de Nuestra Señora de los Ángeles in Cartago, with many kneeling for the final meters as an act of devotion. The walk blends Catholic tradition with Tico culture, representing community, resilience, and celebration. A mass is held on August 2, often led by the Archbishop and attended by high-ranking officials, priests, and the public. The square outside the Basilica fills with vendors, first aid stations, and volunteers offering water and snacks.

name: Chautauqua Institution Season
desc: Historic lakeside community offering a nine-week summer program of arts, education, religion, and recreation.
details: Chautauqua Institution has provided a unique blend of performing arts, visual arts, lectures, and interfaith worship on the shores of Chautauqua Lake since 1874. The gated community's summer season features symphony concerts, theater, opera, dance, bestselling author talks, and political leaders in a Victorian village setting.

name: World Nomad Games 2026
desc: A spectacular gathering of traditional nomadic sports including horseback games, eagle hunting, archery, and wrestling near Lake Issyk-Kul.
details: The 6th World Nomad Games brings together 70+ countries competing in 37 nomadic sports including Kok-Boru (horseback polo), wrestling, archery, eagle hunting, yurt-building, and falconry. Opening ceremony at Bishkek Arena August 31, main competitions September 1-6 at Issyk-Kul Lake. Ethno Village in Kyrchyn Gorge hosts cultural programming. Closing ceremony September 6.

name: Art Cologne
desc: The world's oldest art fair, deeply rooted in the Rhineland's massive collector base.
details: Founded in 1967, Art Cologne remains a titan of the European market. It balances blue-chip post-war German art with a vibrant contemporary sector, supported by one of the densest populations of private collectors in the world.

name: Edinburgh's Hogmanay
desc: One of the world's greatest New Year celebrations with torchlight processions, a massive street party, and midnight fireworks over Edinburgh Castle.
details: Edinburgh's Hogmanay is a multi-day festival marking the Scottish New Year. Events include a Torchlight Procession with 15,000+ torch bearers through the Old Town, one of the world's largest outdoor street parties with 45,000 revellers, a Concert in the Gardens beneath Edinburgh Castle, spectacular midnight fireworks, and the Loony Dook—a New Year's Day polar swim in the Firth of Forth.

name: Carnaval de El Callao (UNESCO)
desc: UNESCO-recognized carnival where 40,000+ visitors experience 170+ years of calypso, madamas, and masked devils celebrating freedom and mestizaje.
details: Declared UNESCO Intangible Cultural Heritage in 2016. Features up to 3,000 participants parading in historical/imaginary character costumes. Central figures: "Madamas" (representing matriarchy), "Medio Pinto" (mischievous character), "Diablos" (devils). Runs January-March with 2026 celebrations from February 12-17. Traditional Mass of the Madamas honors Isidora Agnes. Calypso and music/dances celebrate freedom and cultural mestizaje integrating Martinique, Saint Lucia, Grenada influences.

name: Madeira Carnival
desc: Europe's biggest street party with samba parades and dazzling costumes in tropical Madeira.
details: Madeira Carnival features the main Cortejo Alegórico samba parade, Trapalhão comedy parade, and five nights of shows in Funchal's tropical setting, rivalling Brazil for colour and energy.

name: Gangneung Danoje Festival
desc: UNESCO-listed shamanistic festival with traditional rituals, mask drama, and swing competitions.
details: The Gangneung Danoje is a UNESCO Intangible Cultural Heritage festival with over 1,000 years of history. It features shamanistic rituals (gut), traditional Gwanno mask drama, ssireum wrestling, swing competitions, and the washing of hair in calamus-infused water. The festival preserves Korea's ancient shamanistic traditions alongside Buddhist and Confucian elements.

name: St. Dominic's Fair (Jarmark Świętego Dominika)
desc: One of Europe's oldest and largest open-air fairs, running since 1260 in Gdańsk's historic streets with 1,000+ market stalls, concerts, and revelry.
details: Dating back to 1260, St. Dominic's Fair is one of the oldest trading events in Europe. Over 750 years later, it fills Gdańsk's beautiful reconstructed old town with over 1,000 market stalls selling crafts, amber, food, and antiques. Street performers, concerts, and theater add to the festive atmosphere. The fair spans three weeks and draws visitors from across the Baltic region.

name: Glasgow International
desc: Scotland's largest festival for contemporary art, bringing local and global artists together.
details: GI showcases the dynamic, gritty, and highly collaborative nature of Glasgow's renowned art scene. It blends institutional exhibitions with artist-run spaces and pop-ups, creating an energetic and accessible festival environment.

name: Melt Festival
desc: Festival at 'City of Steel' with colossal mining machinery creating a spectacular industrial backdrop.
details: Melt at Ferropolis features electronic, indie, and pop music amid giant decommissioned mining excavators, creating one of Europe's most visually striking festival settings.

name: Maha Shivaratree
desc: Mauritius's largest Hindu pilgrimage with devotees walking to the sacred lake of Grand Bassin.
details: Maha Shivaratree is the largest Hindu celebration in Mauritius, with hundreds of thousands of devotees making a pilgrimage on foot to the sacred lake of Grand Bassin (Ganga Talao). Dressed in white, they carry kanwars (decorated wooden arches) along the roads in a stunning display of devotion.

name: Hamamatsu Festival
desc: Spectacular kite-fighting festival by day and gorgeous float processions by night.
details: The Hamamatsu Festival features two distinct celebrations: by day, massive kites (some over 3.5m wide) are flown on the beach, with teams using their lines to cut down rival kites in fierce aerial battles. By night, beautifully illuminated yatai floats are pulled through the downtown streets with traditional music. Over 170 neighborhood teams participate.

name: Flow Festival
desc: Helsinki's premier 90,000-visitor music and arts festival in a former power plant, blending popular and experimental culture with sustainability.
details: Flow Festival has evolved from a small 2004 club event into one of Europe's most respected music and arts festivals. Set in the industrial Suvilahti power plant area near Helsinki's centre, it features 150 artists across ten venues. The 2026 lineup includes Florence + The Machine, Nick Cave & The Bad Seeds, Zara Larsson, PinkPantheress, and Honey Dijon. Known for exceptional food, sustainability, and its unique post-industrial atmosphere.

name: Ravinia Festival
desc: The oldest outdoor music festival in North America, serving as the summer home of the Chicago Symphony Orchestra.
details: Ravinia Festival, established in 1904, is the oldest outdoor music festival in North America and the summer home of the Chicago Symphony Orchestra. The park setting allows for picnicking on the lawn while enjoying world-class classical, jazz, pop, and dance performances.

name: FotoFest Biennial
desc: The preeminent international photographic arts festival in the United States.
details: FotoFest transforms Houston into a hub for lens-based media, featuring extensive exhibitions, portfolio reviews, and symposiums. It is crucial for discovering emerging photographic talent and examining visual culture's role in society.

name: Untitled Art Houston
desc: An expansion of the critically acclaimed Untitled fair franchise into Texas.
details: Known for its rigorous curatorial selection, Untitled brings its edgy, highly intellectual approach to Houston, engaging with the city's massive institutional wealth and diverse demographics.

name: Amis Harvest Festival
desc: Seven-day indigenous celebration of the millet harvest with ancestor worship, song, and dance across 40 communities.
details: The Amis Harvest Festival is the most important cultural event for Taiwan's largest indigenous tribe (190,000+ members). Held across 40 communities along the east coast from Hualien to Taitung, the week-long festival features ancestor worship ceremonies, traditional songs and dances, communal feasting, and competitions. Each village celebrates on different dates throughout summer.

name: Boom Festival
desc: Legendary biennial psychedelic trance and arts festival celebrating transformation and sustainability.
details: Boom Festival is a biennial gathering at Idanha Lake blending psychedelic trance music, visionary art, conscious living workshops, and permaculture. Known for stunning stage design and its commitment to sustainability.

name: Ivrea Orange Battle / Carnival
desc: Italy's most anarchic carnival where teams on foot battle horse-drawn carts by hurling oranges — a tradition commemorating a medieval rebellion.
details: The three-day Battle of the Oranges is one of Italy's most spectacular and unique carnival events. Nine teams on foot (aranceri a piedi) hurl oranges at teams riding on horse-drawn carts, re-enacting the people's revolt against a feudal lord. The streets run with orange juice as thousands of participants engage in the massive citrus battle. It's messy, chaotic, and unforgettable.

name: Jakarta International Java Jazz Festival
desc: One of the world's biggest jazz festivals attracting top musicians from the US, Europe, and Asia.
details: Java Jazz has grown into one of the largest jazz festivals in the world, held at the Nusantara International Convention Exhibition in Jakarta. The three-day festival features an incredible lineup spanning jazz, soul, R&B, and fusion, attracting top international and Indonesian musicians across multiple stages.

name: Jeddah Season
desc: A vibrant summer festival in Jeddah filled with music, food, sports, art, and performances along the Red Sea coast.
details: Jeddah Season transforms the Red Sea coastal city into a hub of entertainment with concerts, food festivals, sporting events, art exhibitions, and family activities. Along the Jeddah waterfront and across multiple venues, the festival showcases both Saudi and international talent, attracting millions of visitors during the summer months.

name: Jerash Festival of Culture and Arts
desc: One of the oldest cultural festivals in the Middle East, set among the spectacular Greco-Roman ruins of ancient Gerasa.
details: Set in the remarkably preserved Greco-Roman city of Jerash, this festival brings together artists, musicians, and performers from around the world. Concerts, dance performances, theatrical productions, and poetry readings take place against the backdrop of ancient columns, theaters, and plazas. Founded in 1981, it's one of the region's most established cultural events.

name: ART X Lagos
desc: West Africa's premier international art fair, functioning as a massive cultural catalyst.
details: Far more than a trade fair, ART X features immersive installations, live music, and talks. It is the beating heart of the contemporary African art market, drawing heavy international attendance to engage with the continent's most vital creators.

name: Festival Internacional de Artes Vivas
desc: 11th edition bringing international artists to Loja celebrating live arts, theater, dance, circus over 300+ activities in public spaces.
details: Permanent annual November event since 2018 when Ecuador's National Assembly recognized it as platform for live arts and cultural rights. 10th edition (November 2025) featured 300+ activities in theaters, plazas, public spaces (Nov 13-23). Municipality planning 11th edition with street decorations, plaza improvements. Declared platform promoting live arts and cultural rights at national/international levels. Official website: festival.loja.gob.ec.

name: Trooping the Colour
desc: The British monarch's official birthday ceremony — a spectacular military parade with 1,400 soldiers, 200 horses, and the Royal Family on the Buckingham Palace balcony.
details: Trooping the Colour is the British monarch's official birthday celebration featuring a spectacular military parade down The Mall to Horse Guards Parade. Over 1,400 soldiers, 200 horses, and 400 musicians participate in the precision ceremony. The highlight is the Royal Family's appearance on the Buckingham Palace balcony for the RAF flyover. Free to watch from The Mall, though seats require ballot entry.

name: PAD London
desc: The London edition of the iconic design fair, located in upscale Mayfair.
details: Coinciding with Frieze Week, PAD London caters to the extreme wealth concentrated in the city, offering a highly vetted selection of design objects aimed at furnishing luxury global real estate portfolios.

name: Kentucky Derby Festival
desc: Three-week celebration leading up to the Kentucky Derby with Thunder Over Louisville, parades, and hot air balloons.
details: The Kentucky Derby Festival is a weeks-long celebration leading up to the world's most famous horse race. Highlights include Thunder Over Louisville (one of the largest annual fireworks displays in North America), the Pegasus Parade, the Great Balloon Glow, steamboat races, and concerts. It culminates on the first Saturday in May at Churchill Downs.

name: Fiesta de la Virgen de Luján
desc: Religious celebration honoring Argentina's patron saint with pilgrimages and masses at the basilica.
details: The Virgin of Luján is Patroness of Argentina. Papal coronation of the Holy Image occurred in 1887 by Pope León XIII. Celebrations include multi-day pilgrimages with faithful walking to the basilica as acts of faith, gratitude, or supplication. Thousands gather on May 8 for masses presided by high-ranking Catholic Church members, choirs, and musicians. Historic significance to Argentine Marian devotion.

name: Lukang Dragon Boat Festival
desc: Traditional dragon boat races in one of Taiwan's best-preserved historic port towns.
details: Lukang—one of Taiwan's most beautifully preserved historic towns—hosts traditional dragon boat races during the Duanwu Festival. The races on the old port waterways, combined with the town's incredible Qing-era architecture, traditional temples, and artisan workshops, offer an authentic experience of old Taiwan culture.

name: TEFAF Maastricht
desc: The premier global fair for fine art, antiques, and collectible design.
details: Known as 'The Connoisseur's Fair', TEFAF is unrivaled in its rigorous vetting process and the museum-quality of its Old Masters, antiquities, and jewelry. It attracts private aviation traffic from elite global collectors and major institutional curators.

name: MTN Bushfire Festival
desc: Award-winning conscious festival named top African festival by BBC with eclectic music across multiple stages.
details: MTN Bushfire 2026 at House On Fire in the scenic Malkerns Valley of Eswatini offers music, artistic and performance-based experiences across multiple stages. Named Top African Festival by the BBC and one of CNN's 7 African music festivals you really have to see. Tickets have sold out 14 years running. Profits go to NGOs.

name: Carnaval de Mérida
desc: Yucatecan carnival blending Maya and colonial traditions with parades and jarana dancing.
details: The Carnival of Merida features colorful parades of comparsas, live music stages, traditional jarana dancing, and the unique Yucatecan tradition of painting festivalgoers with confetti eggs. The warm tropical setting and Yucatecan cultural distinctiveness set it apart from other Mexican carnivals.

name: Feria del Sol
desc: 55th International Sun Fair celebrating Andean traditions with horse parades, beauty pageants, and bullfighting consolidating Mérida as premier Andes festival.
details: 2026 edition surpassed expectations with 120,000+ attendees at inaugural parade, consolidating Mérida as main Andean cultural festival. Most attended activities: horse parades, beauty pageants, float parades, cultural groups. Bullfighting program held February 14-15-16, 2026 featuring Rancho Grande cattle. Crowns: Reina del Sol (Sun Queen), Reina Dorada (Golden Queen), Mini Reina del Sol. Represents vital boost for regional economy with all sectors participating. Organized by Mayor's office (Libertador municipality), State Government, and private sector.

name: CONTEXT Art Miami
desc: The sister fair to Art Miami, dedicated entirely to emerging and mid-career artists.
details: CONTEXT provides a critical platform for primary market galleries to showcase the cutting-edge of contemporary painting, sculpture, and new media to the massive crowds generated by Miami Art Week.

name: Design Miami / Miami Beach
desc: The global forum for collectible design, occurring alongside Art Basel Miami Beach.
details: This highly exclusive fair presents museum-quality 20th and 21st-century furniture, lighting, and objets d'art. It blurs the line between functional design and high art, catering to ultra-high-net-worth individuals furnishing massive estates.

name: Montréal en Lumière
desc: Multi-faceted winter festival combining gastronomy, performing arts, and an all-night outdoor celebration.
details: Montréal en Lumière is a unique winter festival combining haute cuisine events with top international chefs, performing arts programming, and the spectacular Nuit Blanche à Montréal — an all-night celebration of free activities, art installations, concerts, and experiences throughout the city center.

name: Nairobi Fashion Week
desc: Major African fashion event featuring the Decarbonize Edition cementing Nairobi on the global fashion calendar.
details: Nairobi Fashion Week 2026: The Decarbonize Edition cemented the city on the global fashion calendar, featuring sustainable fashion from African designers and redefined the continent's fashion narrative with eco-conscious collections.

name: TEFAF New York
desc: The American outpost of the Dutch connoisseur fair, focusing on modern and contemporary art.
details: Held at the Park Avenue Armory, it features breathtaking booth designs and a rigorously vetted selection of art, antiquities, and jewelry, aimed squarely at Manhattan's elite collecting class.

name: Independent New York
desc: An invitation-only, highly curated fair that eschews the traditional trade-show format.
details: Known for its 'anti-fair' aesthetic, Independent utilizes open sightlines and natural light. It is heavily favored by curators and critical collectors seeking avant-garde, thought-provoking presentations over pure commercial spectacle.

name: NADA New York
desc: The New Art Dealers Alliance fair, the ultimate incubator for emerging talent.
details: A critical counterpoint to the blue-chip fairs, NADA is where new trends are forged. It is essential for discovering young artists and supporting younger, experimental galleries operating outside the mega-gallery system.

name: The Armory Show
desc: New York's foundational autumn art fair, showcasing modern and contemporary works.
details: Kickstarting the American fall art season, The Armory Show at the Javits Center provides a massive platform for international galleries. It remains a crucial bellwether for the health of the US art market.

name: Governors Ball Music Festival
desc: NYC's premier outdoor music festival at Flushing Meadows Corona Park in Queens.
details: Governors Ball brings together an eclectic mix of rock, electronic, hip-hop, and indie artists to Flushing Meadows Corona Park. The festival pairs major headliners with excellent NYC food vendors, creating an urban festival experience unique to New York City.

name: Festival of Lights
desc: Canada's largest illumination festival with 3 million lights along the Niagara Parkway and illuminated falls.
details: The Winter Festival of Lights illuminates 8 km of the Niagara Parkway with over 3 million lights while Niagara Falls itself is lit in spectacular colors. The free festival includes seasonal fireworks, concerts, and events throughout the holiday season.

name: Epcot International Flower & Garden Festival
desc: Disney's spectacular floral festival with topiaries, garden tours, and the Garden Rocks concert series.
details: Epcot's Flower & Garden Festival transforms the theme park with millions of blooms, stunning Disney character topiaries, Outdoor Kitchens serving seasonal dishes, gardening seminars, butterfly gardens, and the Garden Rocks concert series featuring classic rock bands.

name: Festival Bandas (Brass Band Festival - Oruro)
desc: Pre-Carnival music festival featuring 6,000 musicians and brass bands performing Bolivian traditional music, celebrating Oruro's bicentennial with participation of national rock groups.
details: Held on Avenida Cívica Sanjinés Vincenti with around 6,000 musicians (over 5,000 in some reports), the festival was organized by the Federación Departamental de Bandas de Músicos Profesionales de Oruro. The 2026 edition dedicated to celebrating the Bicentennial of Oruro department featured national rock groups Los Signos and Los Ovnis de Huanuni joining traditional brass bands. The program included prayer to Virgin of Socavón, the National Anthem, compositions dedicated to 200 years of the department, with musicians performing "La Voz del Saracho" and "Canto al Sainz," followed by traditional cuecas and marches. The festival serves as a prelude to Carnival of Oruro.

name: Voodoo Festival (Fête du Vodoun)
desc: National celebration of Benin's traditional vodoun religion at the historic slave port of Ouidah.
details: On January 10th each year, Benin holds a national celebration honoring its traditional religion. Thousands of adepts, traditional chiefs, and fetish priests gather in Ouidah for rites and rituals including traditional dance and animal sacrifices at shrines, with some devotees entering trance states.

name: Oulu 2026 Opening Festival
desc: Grand opening of Oulu's European Capital of Culture 2026 year, with the world premiere of the first Sámi-language opera.
details: Oulu kicked off its year as European Capital of Culture with around 200 events across the city centre, attracting over 250,000 visits. Highlights included the world premiere of Ovvlá, the first full-length opera in Northern Sámi language, alongside music, workshops, and cultural performances celebrating Arctic and indigenous heritage.

name: Art Palm Beach + Contemporary
desc: A high-end modern and contemporary fair catering to ultra-wealthy winter residents.
details: The fair offers a highly vetted selection of art aimed directly at the immense, concentrated wealth of Palm Beach, featuring blue-chip secondary market sales and luxury design.

name: Parintins Folklore Festival (Boi-Bumbá)
desc: A massive theatrical competition featuring two competing ox groups (Boi Garantido in red, Boi Caprichoso in blue) performing elaborate retellings of the Bumba Meu Boi legend.
details: The Parintins Folklore Festival is one of Brazil's largest cultural events, second only to Carnival in attendance. Held at the Bumbódromo arena accommodating 35,000 spectators, this three-day festival celebrates Amazonian indigenous culture through theatrical performances, music, dance, and spectacular floats. The competition between the red (Garantido) and blue (Caprichoso) groups features extended performances attempting to outdo each other with flamboyant choreography, traditional instruments, and indigenous storytelling traditions.

name: Art Basel Paris
desc: Hosted at the Grand Palais, bridging global art with elite French cultural industries.
details: Capitalizing on Paris's resurgence as the cultural capital of post-Brexit Europe, this fair integrates deeply with the city's historic institutions and fashion houses. It represents the pinnacle of European elegance and high-end contemporary collecting.

name: Art Paris
desc: A major spring art fair housed in the spectacular Grand Palais.
details: Focusing heavily on modern and contemporary art, Art Paris champions regional French scenes alongside a strong international presence, offering a more accessible and eclectic atmosphere than the ultra-exclusive Art Basel Paris.

name: Paris Photo
desc: The world's largest and most important international art fair dedicated entirely to photography.
details: Returning to the Grand Palais, it traces the history of the medium from 19th-century vintage prints to cutting-edge contemporary digital image-making, attracting a highly specialized, deeply knowledgeable collector base.

name: Rose Parade (Tournament of Roses)
desc: Iconic New Year's Day parade featuring elaborate flower-covered floats, marching bands, and equestrian units.
details: The Rose Parade has been a New Year's Day tradition since 1890, showcasing breathtaking floats decorated entirely with flowers, seeds, and natural materials. Over 40 floats, 20 equestrian units, and marching bands from around the world process down Colorado Boulevard in Pasadena. Millions watch on television, and hundreds of thousands line the 5.5-mile route in person.

name: Patras Carnival (Πατρινό Καρναβάλι)
desc: Greece's largest and most spectacular carnival features giant satirical floats, masquerade balls, a treasure hunt, illuminated night parades, and the dramatic burning of the Carnival King.
details: The Patras Carnival is a major cultural event lasting over six weeks with elaborate float parades, the Night Parade, a children's parade, masked balls, and the iconic Treasure Hunt game. The climax on the final Sunday features the Grand Parade with massive satirical floats, followed by the burning of the Carnival King.
