Part of the broader Greek Apokries season, Patras stands out for its community-driven spectacle.

name: Carnaval de Playa del Carmen 2026
desc: Caribbean-style family-friendly carnival with free concerts at Plaza 28 de Julio and colorful parades
details: Free plaza shows from 9:00 p.m. featuring reggaeton and 90s Pop artists. Includes Bellakath, Santa Fe Klan, NSQK, and 90's Pop Tour (JNS, Kabah, Magneto). Arrive 2 hours early for good seating.

name: Kurentovanje (Kurent Festival)
desc: Slovenia's extraordinary carnival features the shaggy, bell-wearing Kurent figures — UNESCO-recognized folk characters who dance to drive away winter in Europe's oldest city.
details: During this 10-day carnival, the medieval streets of Ptuj fill with Kurenti — shaggy masked characters wearing sheepskin garments, heavy cowbells, and feathered headdresses. The tradition kicks off with the mystical Kurent Jump at midnight. UNESCO declared it Intangible Cultural Heritage. Parades, folk performances, music, and costume contests draw thousands. Ptuj's medieval setting makes it feel like stepping into a living folklore museum.

name: Festival d'été de Québec (Quebec City Summer Festival)
desc: 11-day music festival on the Plains of Abraham featuring 300+ shows across 10 stages for all genres.
details: The Festival d'été de Québec is one of the largest music festivals in the world by attendance, featuring 300+ shows on 10+ stages across the historic walled city. Headliners play on the massive Plains of Abraham outdoor stage, while intimate venues host everything from jazz to world music. The festival's single wristband gives access to all shows.

name: Ras Al Khaimah Fine Arts Festival
desc: A multi-site art exhibition stretching from an 18th-century fort to coastal and mountain-view locations in RAK.
details: This festival turns RAK's historic core into a multi-site exhibition, with artworks and installations placed in an 18th-century fort, coastal settings, and mountain-view locations. It represents the growing cultural ambitions of the northern emirates beyond Dubai and Abu Dhabi.

name: Rio de Janeiro Carnival (Carnaval)
desc: Samba parades in the Sambadrome plus blocos (street parties) across the city in Brazil’s most famous carnival.

name: Unseen & Art Rotterdam
desc: A major Dutch art week combining a photography fair with a broader contemporary art fair.
details: Housed in the iconic Van Nelle Fabriek, the event is heavily attended by European curators and collectors. Unseen focuses entirely on new, unreleased contemporary photography, driving trends in the medium.

name: FOG Design + Art
desc: A highly refined fair celebrating modern art, architecture, and design in the Bay Area.
details: FOG brings together 45 leading international galleries, capitalizing on the immense tech wealth of Silicon Valley. It focuses heavily on mid-century modern design integrated with contemporary fine art.

name: Art Santa Fe
desc: A vibrant fair set in the second-largest art market in the United States.
details: The fair reflects Santa Fe's unique blend of contemporary art, Native American heritage, and high-end Western aesthetics, drawing heavily from the lucrative summer tourism crowd.

name: Frieze Los Angeles
desc: A dynamic fair celebrating Los Angeles's profound global contributions to the visual arts.
details: Held at the Santa Monica Airport, Frieze LA leverages the city's unique intersection of entertainment, celebrity, and serious contemporary art production. It has successfully established LA as a primary node in the global art market calendar.

name: World DJ Festival
desc: World-class EDM in a Korean theme park with artists like Zedd and Marshmello — a uniquely Korean festival experience.
details: Held at the Seoul Land amusement park, World DJ Festival combines world-class EDM with Korean pop-culture elements. The 2026 lineup includes Zedd, Amelie Lens, Marshmello, and I Hate Models. The unique venue allows festivalgoers to ride rollercoasters between sets, creating a high-energy, visually spectacular experience.

name: Singapore Art Week
desc: Southeast Asia's premier visual arts festival with 200+ free programs, major art fairs, and city-wide exhibitions.
details: SAW 2026 features over 200 programs including the major ART SG contemporary art fair co-presented with S.E.A Focus, landmark exhibitions at National Gallery Singapore, the Ibrahim Mahama Southeast Asian debut, a traveling Art Bus, and public art installations across the city. The 10-day festival positions Singapore as Asia's creative capital with events spanning museums, galleries, hotels, and public spaces.

name: Art Sg
desc: Southeast Asia's largest and most ambitious international art fair.
details: ART SG cements Singapore's status as a wealth-management and cultural hub in Southeast Asia. It brings top-tier global galleries into contact with a rapidly growing base of ultra-high-net-worth collectors from Indonesia, Malaysia, and the Philippines.

name: Sinhala and Tamil New Year
desc: New Year celebrated with rituals, traditional games, and special foods; timing guided by astrology.

name: Double Ten National Day
desc: Taiwan's National Day with spectacular military fly-overs, parades, and fireworks at the Presidential Building.
details: Taiwan's National Day (Double Tenth Day) features a grand ceremony at the Presidential Office Building in Taipei with military parades, cultural performances, aerial demonstrations, and evening fireworks. The celebration marks the anniversary of the Wuchang Uprising of 1911 that led to the founding of the Republic of China.

name: Toronto Biennial of Art
desc: A city-wide event that commissions artists to explore Toronto's complex cultural topography.
details: The TBA makes contemporary art highly accessible by offering free admission across numerous venues. It frequently focuses on Indigenous histories, environmental concerns surrounding Lake Ontario, and the city's hyper-diverse immigrant populations.

name: Bali Spirit Festival
desc: One of the world's most inspiring yoga, dance, and music festivals set in the spiritual heart of Bali.
details: Celebrating global community, dance, world music, and wellbeing in Ubud, the Bali Spirit Festival features yoga classes, interactive workshops, seminars, a community market, healing centre, and children's activity zone. International and Indonesian instructors and performers create a transformative experience in the spiritual heart of Bali.

name: Vienna Contemporary
desc: A highly focused fair highlighting the art scenes of Central and Eastern Europe.
details: Capitalizing on Vienna's historic role as a cultural bridge, the fair offers unparalleled access to galleries from post-socialist states, providing a distinct, heavily intellectual flavor compared to Western European fairs.

name: ImPulsTanz Festival
desc: Europe's largest contemporary dance festival with performances and workshops.
details: ImPulsTanz Vienna brings the world's leading contemporary dancers and choreographers for a month of performances, workshops, and research projects across Vienna's theatres and public spaces.

name: Chaharshanbe Suri (Fire-jumping Festival) 2026
desc: An ancient Zoroastrian fire-jumping festival on the last Wednesday before Nowruz celebrating purification and renewal.
details: On the last Wednesday evening before Nowruz, Iranians gather to jump over bonfires in a ritual of purification dating back to Zoroastrian traditions. Families sing 'Give me your beautiful red color and take back my sickly pallor,' symbolizing the casting off of winter's negativity. Firecrackers, street celebrations, and communal gatherings make this one of Iran's most energetic cultural moments.

name: Meskel Festival
desc: Orthodox Christian festival marking the finding of the True Cross; known for Demerra bonfires and ceremonies.
details: Meskel has been celebrated for six centuries, marking the discovery of the True Cross. Hundreds of thousands of Orthodox Christians in white robes converge on Meskel Square in Addis Ababa for the lighting of the Demerra bonfire. The direction the bonfire falls is believed to predict the year's fortunes. A UNESCO Intangible Heritage item.

name: Fiesta del Agua (Water Festival - Ayacucho)
desc: Pre-Hispanic water festival honoring water divinity and ensuring good rainfall and agricultural fertility through community rituals and traditional dances.
details: Known as Yaku Raymi in Quechua, this ancestral celebration brings the entire community to cultivated fields to clean irrigation channels before the rainy season, ensuring adequate water supply. The main dance featured is the Danza de Tijeras (Scissors Dance), a traditional performance with spiritual significance. The festival combines practical water management with spiritual rituals honoring water's importance for agricultural communities in the Ayacucho region, representing an important ancestral tradition of the Andes.

name: Matsu Pilgrimage
desc: Alternative Mazu pilgrimage route—a grassroots 400km walking pilgrimage along Taiwan's western coast.
details: The Baishatun Mazu Pilgrimage is Taiwan's other great walking pilgrimage, covering approximately 400km along the western coast. Unlike the more organized Dajia pilgrimage, Baishatun's route is determined by the goddess herself through divination, making each year's journey unpredictable. Followers walk day and night, hosted by communities along the way.

name: Belize Carnival 2026
desc: Vibrant carnival with a shift from September timing to align with broader Caribbean carnival season, incorporating Maya and Mestizo elements.
details: Belize City streets fill with colors and energy, featuring street shows, live music, and typical gastronomy. The festival begins months before actual parade days with communities gathering in "mass camps" where costumes are handcrafted and dance routines perfected. Unlike other Caribbean carnivals, Belize Carnival uniquely incorporates Maya and Mestizo elements alongside African-Caribbean traditions, creating something distinctly Belizean. Jouvert begins before sunrise with bodies covered in paint and mud.

name: Berlinale (Berlin International Film Festival)
desc: One of the world's three major film festivals alongside Cannes and Venice, showcasing politically engaged cinema and awarding the Golden Bear.
details: The Berlinale is the world's largest publicly attended film festival, known for its politically and socially engaged programming. The 2026 edition featured works by international directors competing for the Golden Bear. The European Film Market runs alongside as a major industry event. Set in February, it brings cinematic warmth to Berlin's winter. Screenings take place at the Berlinale Palast and venues across the city.

name: Oktoberfest Blumenau
desc: The world's second-largest Oktoberfest celebration outside Germany, honoring German immigration traditions and beer culture in colonial-style town.
details: The 41st Oktoberfest Blumenau at Parque Vila Germânica features multiple beer gardens, traditional Bavarian cuisine, cultural parades, and live folk music. The festival celebrates German heritage brought by 19th-century immigrants with authentic beer brands and traditional crafts. The park recreates a Bavarian village atmosphere with beer gardens, concert stages, and restaurants serving authentic German food alongside Brazilian adaptations.

name: West Indian American Day Carnival (Labor Day)
desc: Massive Caribbean carnival along Eastern Parkway in Brooklyn with costumed bands, steel pan, and soca music.
details: The West Indian American Day Carnival is one of NYC's largest cultural events, with over a million spectators lining Eastern Parkway in Crown Heights as Caribbean masquerade bands, steel pan orchestras, and soca DJs parade in a spectacular celebration of West Indian culture. J'ouvert celebrations begin before dawn.

name: Shinju Matsuri
desc: 16-day multicultural festival celebrating Broome's pearl fishing history with a stunning floating lantern ceremony.
details: Shinju Matsuri (Festival of the Pearl) celebrates Broome's multicultural pearling heritage. The 16-day festival features the iconic floating lantern ceremony on Cable Beach, a grand parade with elaborate floats, dragon boat races, outdoor concerts, art exhibitions, and cultural performances reflecting Broome's Asian, Aboriginal, and European heritage.

name: Ceramics Brussels
desc: A specialized contemporary art fair focused exclusively on sculptural ceramics.
details: Reflecting the massive resurgence of ceramics in contemporary fine art, this fair brings together specialized galleries to showcase the boundary-pushing ways artists are manipulating clay in the 21st century.

name: Primavera Sound Buenos Aires
desc: The long-awaited return of Barcelona's iconic independent music festival to Buenos Aires.
details: After a cancelled 2024 edition, returns for its third edition at Parque Sarmiento. Brings signature eclectic curation blending international headliners with emerging artists. The ongoing Primavera Club concert series has featured Teenage Fanclub, Helado Negro, Bloc Party, and Otoboke Beaver.

name: Sant'Efisio Festival
desc: Sardinia's most important festival features a four-day procession of thousands in traditional costumes and on horseback from Cagliari to Nora and back.
details: One of Italy's most elaborate religious processions, featuring thousands of participants in stunning traditional Sardinian costumes, decorated ox carts (traccas), and horse parades stretching for miles. The saint's statue is carried on a 65km journey from Cagliari to the ancient Roman city of Nora and back. Each Sardinian village sends its own delegation in distinctive local dress. The procession honors a vow made in 1656 during a plague.

name: Carnaval de Cajamarca (Happiest Festival of Peru)
desc: Five-day celebration of color, music, dance, and tradition combining water games, parades, and traditional music performances in Peru's "Happiest Festival."
details: The carnival features the Entrada de Ño Carnavalón (Feb 14), a contest of colorful parades and comparsas with elaborate costumes (Feb 15), Gran Corso parade through city streets (Feb 16), Velorio de Ño Carnavalón ceremony bidding farewell to the carnival spirit (Feb 17), and the burial of the King of Joy (Feb 18). Coplas (witty poetic compositions) are sung throughout, expressing feelings and social commentary. Traditional games with water and paint symbolize purification and renewal. The city fills with music, dances, and festivities that showcase Cajamarca's unique cultural identity.

name: Carnaval de Cajamarca (main days)
desc: Peru’s best-known Carnival celebration with comparsas and water play.

name: Investec Cape Town Art Fair
desc: Southern Africa's leading art fair showcasing contemporary African and international art.
details: The Cape Town Art Fair is Southern Africa's leading contemporary art fair, featuring galleries from across the continent and internationally. It includes a curated programme of talks, performances, and exhibitions alongside the main commercial fair.

name: St. Lucia Carnival (Lucian Carnival)
desc: One of the Caribbean's top annual party events with elaborate costumes, intoxicating rhythms, parades, and pure Caribbean energy.
details: The island turns into a massive celebration each July with celebrations beginning in days leading up to main event (street parade), with variety of parties and celebrations across entire island. Carnival includes competitions such as Power and Groovy Monarch, Senior and Junior Panoramas (Steel Pan Competitions), culminating in exciting two-day street parade of live bands and DJ music with stunning carnival costumes. Under leadership of the Cultural Development Foundation, Saint Lucia Carnival is recognized as one of the Caribbean's top carnivals, becoming more vibrant and creative each year. Many tour operators already offer packages including accommodations, costumes, fete tickets, and various activities.

name: Cheonan Independence Hall Cultural Festival
desc: National celebrations on Independence Movement Day (March 1st) at Korea's largest independence memorial.
details: March 1st is Korea's Independence Movement Day, commemorating the 1919 uprising against Japanese colonial rule. The Independence Hall of Korea in Cheonan hosts the nation's largest commemorative ceremony with historical reenactments, cultural performances, and patriotic gatherings.

name: Chingay Parade
desc: Asia's largest street performance and float parade featuring dazzling multicultural performances along the F1 pit building.
details: Chingay is Singapore's biggest annual street parade and one of Asia's largest, featuring elaborately decorated floats, international performers, cultural troupes, stilt walkers, and LED displays. The multicultural spectacle reflects Singapore's diverse heritage with Chinese, Malay, Indian, and Western performance traditions.

name: Anozero'26 - Coimbra Biennial
desc: A contemporary art biennial situated within a UNESCO World Heritage university city.
details: Anozero integrates provocative contemporary artworks into the ancient architecture of Coimbra. The juxtaposition creates a unique dialogue between Portugal's profound historical legacy and modern conceptual practices.

name: Guizhou Dong New Year
desc: Dong ethnic minority New Year celebrations in ancient wooden drum tower villages.
details: The Dong people of southeastern Guizhou celebrate their New Year with elaborate communal feasts in iconic drum towers, Grand Song polyphonic singing (UNESCO heritage), lusheng playing, and bullfighting. The ancient wooden villages with their wind-and-rain bridges provide an extraordinary architectural backdrop.

name: Kadayawan Festival
desc: Thanksgiving harvest festival celebrating indigenous cultures with street dances and floral floats.

name: Design Doha
desc: A major showcase of design excellence from the MENA region and globally.
details: Part of Qatar's strategic vision to become a regional design hub, the event features exhibitions, talks, and installations. It highlights the intersection of traditional Islamic craftsmanship and cutting-edge contemporary industrial and graphic design.

name: International Festival of the Sahara
desc: Tunisia's oldest and most famous festival—a four-day kinetic storm of Bedouin horse races, poetry duels, and camel marathons in the Sahara.
details: Dating back to 1910 as a Bedouin marriage market, this is now a massive four-day celebration of traditional desert culture. The H'naiech Stadium hosts camel marathons, fantasia horseback shows with daring riders, traditional Bedouin wedding ceremonies, sloughi dog races, wrestling, poetry contests, and colorful dancing. Over 50,000 people attend from across the Maghreb, making it one of North Africa's most authentic cultural experiences.

name: Edmonton Fringe Festival
desc: North America's largest fringe theater festival with 1,600+ performances across 40+ venues.
details: The Edmonton International Fringe Theatre Festival is the largest fringe festival in North America, featuring over 1,600 performances in 40+ venues along Old Strathcona's Whyte Avenue. The non-juried, non-censored festival showcases theater, comedy, music, dance, and performance art from artists worldwide, with 100% of box office revenue going to performers.

name: Fiesta de la Virgen de El Cisne
desc: Ecuador's oldest and second-largest pilgrimage (after Virgin of Guadalupe, Mexico) where sacred image travels 74 km in 3 days from sanctuary to Loja.
details: August 17 pilgrimage departure from El Cisne (70 km to Loja), arriving approximately August 20. Image stays in Loja until November 17 return. Journey: 74 km in 3 days of devoted pilgrimage. Estimated to be one of Latin America's most attended pilgrimages. Sacred image ("Churonita") honors the Virgin with deep faith and devotion. Pilgrims include faithful from different sectors, accompanied by priests/police ensuring security. Return journey (Nov 17) celebrates spiritual connection between El Cisne sanctuary and city of Loja.

name: Fiestas de la Vendimia (Wine Harvest Festival) - Valle de Guadalupe 2026
desc: Celebration of the grape harvest season with wine tastings, workshops, concerts, and pairing dinners in Mexico's wine country.
details: Events spread across Ensenada and nearby wine valleys featuring tastings, wine appreciation workshops, concerts with internationally renowned artists, family parties, wine tours, and pairing dinners with renowned guest chefs. 80 wineries participate with tastings of 160+ wine labels distributed by grape variety. Highlights include inauguration, wine show, and "Dr. Ramón García Ocejo" paella competition. Activities sell out quickly; advance ticket purchase through Provino organization recommended.

name: Xiangxi Miao Drum Festival
desc: Thunderous drum performances by the Miao people in the ancient riverside town of Fenghuang.
details: The Miao Drum Festival near Fenghuang Ancient Town features thunderous performances of traditional Miao drums, accompanied by silver-adorned dancers and folk singers. The ancient town of Fenghuang, built along the Tuo River with stilted houses, provides a dramatic backdrop. The festival coincides with Chinese New Year celebrations.

name: Kurayami Matsuri (Darkness Festival)
desc: Ancient festival where massive portable shrines are paraded through the streets in near-total darkness.
details: The Kurayami Matsuri at Okunitama Shrine in Fuchu is a dramatic festival where eight enormous mikoshi are carried through darkened streets. The main event on May 5th involves the shrines being transported with all electric lights turned off, harking back to when the festival was held entirely in darkness. Taiko drum competitions and traditional performances accompany the processions.

name: Hakata Dontaku Festival
desc: One of Japan's largest festivals with over 2 million spectators watching colorful parades through Fukuoka.
details: Hakata Dontaku is one of the biggest festivals in Japan by attendance. Performers in elaborate costumes parade through Fukuoka's streets, dancing and playing shamisen. The festival's origins date back over 800 years. Multiple stages are set up across the city for performances ranging from traditional Hakata culture to contemporary dance.

name: Open'er Festival
desc: Poland's biggest alternative rock and pop festival near the Baltic coast, consistently booking major international headliners.
details: Open'er Festival in Gdynia is Poland's leading music festival, attracting top international headliners alongside Polish artists. Set near the Baltic coast, the festival combines rock, pop, electronic, and alternative music across multiple stages. The nearby beaches and historic port city of Gdańsk add to the appeal.

name: Fête de l'Escalade
desc: Geneva celebrates its 1602 victory over the Duke of Savoy with costumed parades, torch-lit processions, and the smashing of a chocolate cauldron.
details: This unique Geneva tradition commemorates the night in 1602 when citizens repelled the Duke of Savoy's surprise attack. The festival features costumed historical parades through the old town, torch-lit processions, and the traditional smashing of a chocolate marmite (cauldron) — the oldest woman present breaks it and all share the chocolates inside. A wonderful blend of history and celebration.

name: Chalandamarz (Swiss Spring Festival)
desc: A centuries-old Romansh spring festival where children parade through Alpine villages ringing enormous cowbells, cracking whips, and singing to chase away winter.
details: On March 1, children and young people in the Romansh-speaking valleys of Switzerland parade through villages in colorful costumes, ringing large cowbells and cracking whips to drive away evil spirits and the cold. Songs in the Romansh language, playful skits, and community gatherings give the festival a deeply local, authentic character. One of Switzerland's most charming and least-known traditions.

name: Feria Internacional del Libro de Guadalajara (FIL)
desc: The largest Spanish-language book fair in the world and the most important publishing event in the Americas.
details: FIL Guadalajara is the most significant literary event in the Spanish-speaking world, attracting over 800,000 visitors. The fair features thousands of publishers, author talks, literary prizes, academic forums, and cultural performances. Each year a Guest of Honor country is featured. It is the largest book fair in the Americas by attendance.

name: Quema del Diablo (Burning of the Devil)
desc: Ancient tradition symbolizing triumph of good over evil through burning of devil effigies and household rubbish in preparation for Christmas season.
details: This 400+ year tradition honors the eve of the Feast of the Immaculate Conception. Throughout Guatemala, parades carry piñatas shaped as the Devil through towns, with official burning at 6:00 pm. Firecrackers and traditional music accompany the festivities. The ritual includes burning household waste in bonfires as a symbolic cleansing of evil spirits before the Christmas season. Children wear devil horns in playful celebration. Environmental impact is significant, with estimates suggesting 500,000 bonfires across the country, making it both culturally important and environmentally notable.

name: Nada no Kenka Matsuri (Fighting Festival)
desc: Intense festival where teams violently crash massive portable shrines into each other.
details: The Nada no Kenka Matsuri (Fighting Festival) at Matsubara Hachiman Shrine is one of Japan's most aggressive festivals. Teams carrying three massive yatai (festival carts) weighing over 2 tons crash them repeatedly into each other in a show of strength and devotion. The violent collision of ornately decorated shrines accompanied by thunderous drumming and roaring crowds is viscerally thrilling.

name: Hirosaki Neputa Festival
desc: Hirosaki's variation of the Nebuta tradition with fan-shaped illuminated floats depicting warriors and myths.
details: Not to be confused with Aomori's Nebuta, Hirosaki's Neputa features distinctive fan-shaped (ogi-shaped) floats rather than three-dimensional figures. Up to 80 neputa floats parade through the castle town streets. The largest floats span 10 meters wide and 8 meters tall. Warriors and mythological scenes are painted in vivid watercolors on the translucent paper.

name: 54th Hong Kong Arts Festival
desc: Multi-genre performing arts festival featuring theatre, dance, music and international productions.
details: The Hong Kong Arts Festival is one of Asia's longest-running and most prestigious performing arts festivals. The 54th edition features international ballet companies, orchestras, theater troupes, and Chinese performing arts. Venues across the city host hundreds of performances ranging from classical to contemporary, attracting renowned artists from around the world.

name: Hong Kong Mid-Autumn Festival
desc: Beautiful lantern displays in Victoria Park and the legendary Tai Hang fire dragon dance under the full moon.
details: Hong Kong's Mid-Autumn Festival celebrations center on Victoria Park's massive lantern display with thousands of illuminated lanterns in creative designs. Families gather for mooncake feasts and moon-gazing. The festival combines with the Tai Hang Fire Dragon Dance, creating a unique Hong Kong double celebration. Neighborhoods like Sha Tin and Tsuen Wan also host lantern carnivals.

name: Carnaval Huejotzinga 2026
desc: Traditional carnival with 12,000 costumed residents and 30,000 visitors
details: Historical reenactments and parade battalions. Attracts 30,000+ visitors.

name: Imilchil Marriage Festival
desc: A centuries-old Amazigh matchmaking festival in the High Atlas Mountains where young Berbers choose their life partners.
details: Deep in the High Atlas Mountains, Berber tribes gather for this centuries-old festival born from a tragic love legend. Young men and women from surrounding villages freely choose their partners at this unique event. The festival features traditional music, dancing, a large market for local crafts and produce, silver jewelry, and elaborately dressed participants. Around 30,000 attendees from the mountain region converge on this remote village, making it one of Morocco's most authentic cultural experiences.

name: Ishigaki Island Star Festival (Tanabata)
desc: Southernmost Tanabata celebration under Japan's darkest skies on subtropical Ishigaki Island.
details: Ishigaki Island's Tanabata celebration takes on special meaning as the island offers some of Japan's darkest night skies. The subtropical island's Star Festival combines traditional Tanabata customs with stargazing events, making the legend of Orihime and Hikoboshi feel particularly real.

name: Día de Muertos (key days)
desc: Altars, cemetery vigils, parades, and rituals honoring the dead; major visitor draw in several regions.

name: Jerusalem Light Festival
desc: Spectacular light art installations throughout the Old City of Jerusalem transforming ancient walls and streets.
details: Features international light artists creating installations, projections, and interactive light works along the walls and alleys of Jerusalem's Old City.

name: Xishuangbanna Songkran (Water Splashing)
desc: The main Water Splashing Festival celebration in Xishuangbanna's capital Jinghong.
details: Jinghong, capital of Xishuangbanna Dai Autonomous Prefecture, hosts the largest Water Splashing Festival celebrations. The entire city participates in three days of water fights, dragon boat races, and temple ceremonies. The tropical setting, Mekong River atmosphere, and Dai cultural performances make it one of China's most joyful festivals.

name: Miao New Year Festival
desc: Grand post-harvest celebration of the Miao people with elaborate silver costumes, lusheng music, and bullfighting.
details: Miao New Year is the grandest festival of the Miao ethnic minority, best experienced in Leishan County, Guizhou. The celebration features festival parades with women in spectacular silver headdresses and embroidered costumes, traditional Lusheng (reed pipe) music, bullfighting, horse racing, and communal singing and dancing. Multiple villages celebrate on different dates throughout the season.

name: Tsurugaoka Hachimangu Reitaisai
desc: Grand festival at Kamakura's most important shrine featuring the spectacular yabusame mounted archery.
details: The annual festival at Tsurugaoka Hachimangu in Kamakura features the spectacular yabusame—mounted archery where archers in hunting costume gallop past three targets, shooting arrows at each. The tradition dates to the founding of the Kamakura Shogunate. The festival also includes mikoshi processions and traditional dance.

name: Arbaeen Pilgrimage
desc: World's largest annual public gathering with millions walking from Najaf to Karbala (80km).
details: 40 days after Ashura. Pilgrimage to shrine of Husayn ibn Ali. Many walk 80km from Najaf to Karbala over three days reciting religious verses. Tour operators offer packages.

name: Kawazu Cherry Blossom Festival
desc: Japan's earliest cherry blossom festival featuring 8,000 trees of the early-blooming Kawazu-zakura variety.
details: Kawazu on the Izu Peninsula is famous for the Kawazu-zakura variety that blooms a full month before Tokyo's Somei-yoshino. Over 8,000 trees line the Kawazu River for 4km, creating pink tunnels. The extended bloom period (about a month) and the coastal Izu setting make it a popular early-spring destination. Night illuminations highlight key sections.

name: Kochi Yosakoi Matsuri
desc: The original high-energy street dance festival with 200+ teams performing creative choreography through the streets.
details: The original Yosakoi Festival in Kochi features over 200 dance teams performing energetic choreography through the city streets. Teams incorporate naruko wooden clappers into creative routines ranging from traditional to modern fusion styles. Each team designs unique costumes and performs atop decorated trucks. The four-day event culminates in a grand awards ceremony.

name: Pinkpop
desc: World's oldest annual pop and rock festival drawing 60,000+ daily.
details: Pinkpop has been running since 1970, making it the world's oldest continuously running annual pop festival. It brings major international rock and pop headliners to Landgraaf over three days.

name: Saga Dawa Festival
desc: Holiest month in the Tibetan Buddhist calendar celebrating Buddha's birth, enlightenment, and nirvana.
details: Saga Dawa is the most sacred month in the Tibetan calendar, marking the birth, enlightenment, and parinirvana of the Buddha. In Lhasa, pilgrims perform the Lingkhor (circumambulation) around the city and Barkhor around Jokhang Temple. At Mt. Kailash, the massive prayer flagpole is ceremonially replaced. Thousands of pilgrims prostrate around holy sites.

name: Yi Torch Festival
desc: The largest Yi Torch Festival celebration in China's Liangshan region with massive bonfires and bull fighting.
details: Liangshan Yi Autonomous Prefecture in Sichuan hosts the largest Torch Festival in China. The Yi people celebrate with three days of bull fighting, horse racing, beauty pageants, wrestling, and enormous communal bonfires. On the final night, thousands of torches create rivers of fire flowing through the mountain villages. Xichang city hosts the main events.

name: Festas de Lisboa (Santo António)
desc: Month-long citywide celebration honouring Saint Anthony with parades, sardines, and street parties.
details: On the night of June 12th, Lisbon's historic neighbourhoods like Alfama and Mouraria explode with life. Locals grill sardines on every corner, build decorative arches, and dance in the streets until dawn. The Marchas Populares parade fills Avenida da Liberdade.

name: Pahiyas Festival
desc: Houses decorated with colorful kiping rice wafers and harvest produce honoring San Isidro Labrador.

name: 1-54 Marrakech
desc: The leading international art fair dedicated entirely to contemporary African art and its diaspora.
details: Held at the luxurious La Mamounia hotel, 1-54 provides a localized, highly curated platform for the booming African art market. It pairs seamlessly with the city's vibrant cultural scene and private museums like MACAAL.

name: NADA Miami Art Fair
desc: A specialized fair dedicated exclusively to contemporary works on paper and fine art publishing.
details: Organized by the New Art Dealers Alliance, this fair is famously chaotic, energetic, and indispensable for finding young, aggressively avant-garde talent before they are absorbed by mega-galleries.

name: Kurokawa Onsen Fire Festival
desc: New Year fire ceremony at one of Japan's most atmospheric hot spring villages.
details: Kurokawa Onsen's New Year fire ceremony features huge bonfires and traditional performances in one of Japan's most beloved hot spring villages. The riverside village of thatched-roof ryokan, outdoor baths, and forest creates an idyllic setting for the winter ritual.

name: Día de Muertos - Mixquic 2026
desc: Most traditional Day of the Dead celebration in Mexico City with mystical candlelit cemetery vigils
details: "Alumbrada" ceremony on Nov 2 at 7:00 PM when candles light up graves decorated with marigolds. Altars with offerings set up from Oct 31. Most touching, authentic celebration in Mexico City. Truly mystical atmosphere in this historic town.

name: Mombasa Carnival
desc: Kenya's biggest street festival with two parades converging on Moi Avenue showcasing Mombasa's diverse cultures.
details: The Mombasa Carnival features two parades converging on Moi Avenue displaying Mombasa's diverse cultural heritage. Street performers, elaborate floats, traditional dancers, and modern acts create a vibrant celebration of the coast's Swahili, Arab, Indian, and African cultures.

name: Tecate Pa'l Norte 2026
desc: Mexico's premier music festival featuring rock, alternative, pop, and electronic acts at Parque Fundidora.
details: Over 150 national and international acts perform across multiple stages with world-class production and monumental screens. Headliners include The Killers, Guns N' Roses, Kygo, Interpol, Halsey, Jackson Wang, Zoé, and Grupo Frontera. Three days packed with non-stop performances and surprises. Tickets include General, General+, Ascendente, VIP, and add-on options available through Ticketmaster (sales began November 11).

name: Carnaval de Montevideo - Longest in the World
desc: World's longest running carnival with street parades, candombe drums, and afrodescendant cultural celebrations.
details: Desfile Inaugural (January 22), Desfile de Escuelas de Samba (January 23), Concurso Oficial (January 26), Desfile de Llamadas (February 6-7, Isla de Flores street). Official carnival holidays February 16-17. Children's Carnival Parade December 14 (preparatory). Parades and neighborhood stages throughout downtown and residential areas. 44 comparsas with 3000+ candombe drums. UNESCO Intangible Cultural Heritage (candombe).

name: Festival Juste pour Rire (Just for Laughs - French)
desc: The French-language component of Just for Laughs featuring Francophone comedy from Quebec and beyond.
details: Juste pour Rire runs alongside the English Just for Laughs festival, presenting French-language comedy galas, shows, and street performances. Francophone comedians from Quebec, France, Belgium, and the broader Francophonie world perform across Montreal venues.

name: Osheaga Music and Arts Festival
desc: Montreal's premier outdoor music festival on Île Sainte-Hélène with indie, rock, electronic, and hip-hop.
details: Osheaga takes place on the stunning Île Sainte-Hélène in Parc Jean-Drapeau, with the Montreal skyline as a backdrop. The three-day festival features top indie, rock, electronic, and hip-hop artists on multiple stages, complemented by art installations, visual art exhibitions, and an eco-friendly ethos.

name: Morioka Sansa Odori
desc: World-record-holding taiko drum parade with over 10,000 dancers and drummers filling Morioka's streets.
details: Morioka Sansa Odori holds the Guinness World Record for the largest taiko drum ensemble. Over 10,000 participants dance through the streets beating taiko drums in unison. The festival celebrates a local legend about a demon who was driven away by the people's joyful dancing. The thunderous sound of thousands of drums creates an unforgettable sonic experience.

name: Karnival ta' Malta
desc: Malta's colourful carnival with competing float parades and grotesque masks.
details: Malta's carnival features elaborate float competitions in Valletta and the more raucous Nadur carnival in Gozo, known for its grotesque and irreverent costumes.

name: Nagaoka Fireworks Festival
desc: One of Japan's top three fireworks festivals with massive phoenix-shaped fireworks symbolizing post-war recovery.
details: The Nagaoka Fireworks Festival is one of Japan's 'Big Three' hanabi taikai. Born as a memorial for WWII bombing victims, its signature phoenix fireworks symbolize the city's recovery. Over 20,000 fireworks are launched including giant sanshakudama shells spanning 650 meters across the sky. The two-night event along the Shinano River draws hundreds of thousands of spectators.

name: Nagasaki Kunchi Festival
desc: Unique festival blending Japanese, Chinese, and Dutch cultural influences with dramatic dragon dances.
details: Nagasaki Kunchi reflects Nagasaki's history as Japan's window to the world during isolation. The festival at Suwa Shrine features spectacular performances including Chinese-style dragon dances (ja-odori), Dutch-inspired ship floats, and Japanese traditional arts. Each of Nagasaki's neighborhoods takes turns presenting elaborate performances on a rotating seven-year cycle.

name: Okunchi Festival
desc: Unique festival blending Japanese, Chinese, and Dutch influences from Nagasaki's trading port history.
details: Nagasaki Kunchi features spectacular Chinese dragon dances, Dutch-influenced ship floats, and Japanese shrine processions—reflecting the city's unique role as Japan's only international trading port during 200+ years of isolation. Each of Nagasaki's 77 neighborhoods performs on a seven-year rotation cycle.

name: Nara Tokae Lantern Festival
desc: 20,000 candles illuminate the grounds of Nara's ancient temples and the famous deer park.
details: Nara Tokae features approximately 20,000 candles placed throughout the grounds of Todaiji, Kasuga Taisha, Kofukuji, and surrounding areas of Nara Park. The warm candlelight illuminates the ancient architecture while Nara's famous deer roam freely among the lights. It creates a magical atmosphere combining nature, history, and gentle illumination.

name: Bolas de Fuego (Fireballs Festival)
desc: Distinctive annual fireball-throwing celebration commemorating 1658 San Salvador volcano eruption, featuring cotton balls drenched with turpentine and oil.
details: The Bolas de Fuego festival is held in the small town of Nejapa each August 31 during the celebration of "La Recuerda" (The Remembrance). The festival commemorates local history and legend: in 1658, a violent eruption of the San Salvador volcano destroyed the old settlement of Nixapa, sending flaming stones into the sky. The "fireballs" are cotton balls drenched with turpentine and oil, thrown between groups of participants wearing protective gear. The only requirement is damp clothing and canvas gloves to avoid burns, with spectators kept at safe distances. The battle of the fireballs is known as "La Recuerda," representing the flaming stones that emerged from the historic eruption. This is one of El Salvador's most distinctive and visually striking traditions, making it an unforgettable experience for adventurous travelers.

name: St. Patrick's Day Parade NYC
desc: The world's oldest and largest St. Patrick's Day Parade, marching up Fifth Avenue since 1762.
details: New York City's St. Patrick's Day Parade has been held annually since 1762, making it the oldest and largest in the world. Over 150,000 participants march up Fifth Avenue past St. Patrick's Cathedral, accompanied by bagpipe bands, Irish step dancers, and community organizations. Millions line the route in a sea of green.

name: Newport Folk Festival
desc: Legendary folk music festival at Fort Adams State Park where Bob Dylan famously went electric in 1965.
details: One of the most storied music festivals in American history, Newport Folk takes place at the scenic Fort Adams State Park overlooking Narragansett Bay. Known for surprise collaborations and genre-defying lineups, it has hosted everyone from Joan Baez to Brandi Carlile. The intimate setting and tradition of musical discovery make it a bucket-list event for music lovers.

name: Shaw Festival
desc: World-class theater festival in a picturesque Niagara wine region town, specializing in Shaw-era plays.
details: The Shaw Festival presents approximately 12 productions across three theaters in the charming town of Niagara-on-the-Lake. Dedicated to the works of George Bernard Shaw and his contemporaries, the festival has expanded to include modern works. The beautiful wine country setting adds to the cultural experience.

name: Feria Internacional del Mezcal (international Mezcal Fair)
desc: Celebration of mezcal spirits featuring 70+ brands, tastings, traditional dances, music, and cultural activities.
details: Held at Oaxaca Cultural and Convention Center. Showcases 125+ companies and 70+ brands with tastings of tepeztate, tobalá, and espadín mezcals. Entry: 100–150 MXN (free for seniors/children under 12). Features music, traditional dances, social activities celebrating Oaxaca's most famous spirit. Coincides with Guelaguetza festival period.

name: Oaxaca Food & Wine Festival 2026
desc: High-end gastronomic festival celebrating Oaxacan cuisine, local mezcals, and Mexican wines through tastings and demonstrations.
details: Brings together chefs, mezcaleros, and food lovers. Events include cooking demos, mezcal tastings, market tours, mole workshops, and multi-course dinners featuring Oaxaca's seven legendary moles. Coincides with Oaxaca's vibrant food scene — from street-side tlayudas to fine-dining reinterpretations of pre-Hispanic cuisine.

name: Hadaka Matsuri (Naked Festival)
desc: Wild festival where 10,000 men in loincloths scramble to catch sacred lucky sticks thrown by a priest.
details: Saidaiji Eyo (Hadaka Matsuri) at Saidaiji Temple is one of Japan's most intense festivals. Around 10,000 men wearing only fundoshi (loincloths) pack into the temple grounds in freezing February weather. At midnight, a priest throws two shingi (sacred sticks) into the crowd, and the men scramble ferociously to catch them, believing the sticks bring a year of good fortune.

name: Biennale Gherdëina 10: (Future) Paradise Gardens
desc: The tenth edition curated by Samuel Leuenberger explores paradise gardens in the UNESCO-listed Dolomites landscape.
details: Biennale Gherdëina 10, curated by Samuel Leuenberger, takes place in Ortisei and Val Gardena in the Dolomites. Features environmental projects and public programming with new commissions including three Lithuanian artists. Maintains strong connection to cultural, historical, and linguistic roots of the Alpine Ladin region.

name: Carnaval de Oruro (main parade)
desc: UNESCO-listed carnival centered on folkloric dance entries and devotion to the Virgen del Socavón.

name: Toka Ebisu Festival
desc: Boisterous New Year commercial festival at Imamiya Ebisu Shrine praying for business prosperity.
details: Toka Ebisu is Osaka's most important business festival where over a million visitors come to pray for commercial success at Imamiya Ebisu Shrine. The shrine distributes fuku-zasa (lucky bamboo branches) decorated with good-luck charms. 'Lucky maidens' (fuku-musume) are selected annually. The atmosphere captures Osaka's merchant culture spirit.

name: Inti Raymi - Otavalo (Multiple locations)
desc: Ancient Inca festival of the sun celebrating summer solstice with purification ceremonies, offerings, music, dancing, and gratitude to Pachamama.
details: Originally Inca religious ceremony (June 22), now celebrated June 21 (summer solstice) across Andes. In Otavalo: celebrations begin with midnight ritual cleansing at sacred Peguche Waterfall. Main day (June 21): dawn ceremony with offerings to sun/Pachamama, yachaks (shamans) leading purification rituals using coca leaves, flowers, food. Celebrations include spiritual purification in rivers/waterfalls, cultural expressions (dance, costumes), traditional gastronomy. Otavalo march into central plaza decorated with striped flags (unity/diversity), followed by hours of music/dancing celebrating life. Festival represents gratitude for harvest and spiritual renewal connecting ancient Inca traditions with modern Andean identity.

name: Ottawa Bluesfest
desc: Major 10-day music festival at LeBreton Flats featuring blues, rock, pop, hip-hop, and electronic acts.
details: Despite its name, Ottawa Bluesfest has evolved into one of Canada's largest and most diverse music festivals, featuring major headliners across blues, rock, pop, hip-hop, electronic, and world music. Set at LeBreton Flats near the War Museum, the 10-day festival features six stages and draws attendees from across Ontario and Quebec.

name: Tar Barrels of Ottery St. Mary
desc: A unique and thrilling centuries-old tradition where locals carry flaming barrels of tar through narrow Devon streets on Guy Fawkes Night.
details: On November 5, residents of this small Devon town carry large flaming barrels of tar through the narrow streets in a centuries-old tradition linked to Guy Fawkes Night. The barrel rollers shoulder enormous blazing barrels while crowds press close in the tight lanes. It's raw, dangerous-looking, thrilling, and utterly unique. The event has resisted all attempts at modernization or health-and-safety intervention.

name: Festival de las Flores y las Palmas (Flowers and Palms Festival)
desc: UNESCO-recognized tradition honoring Virgin Mary featuring colorful palm-frond decorations, traditional dress, folk dances, and fireworks tied to local heritage.
details: The Festival de las Flores y las Palmas of Panchimalco was recognized as UNESCO Intangible Cultural Heritage, representing El Salvador's first-ever inclusion of a tradition in the Representative List of Intangible Cultural Heritage of Humanity. The procession of palms takes place during the first Sunday of May to receive the rains and honor the Virgin Mary. This festival highlights colorful decorations, band music, traditional dances, fireworks (especially vara rockets), artistic palm decoration with flowers, and devotion to the Virgin Mary. Throughout the weekend, Panchimalco comes alive with sounds of live music, traditional folk dances, and the excitement of handmade fireworks. The tradition brilliantly combines indigenous pre-Columbian traditions with Catholic religious observances, making it one of El Salvador's most important and celebrated cultural events. The town itself is called "Panchimalco" (meaning "place of flowers and palms" in Nahuatl), reflecting its deep connection to this tradition.

name: Design Miami / Paris
desc: The Parisian iteration of the collectible design fair, set in a historic mansion.
details: Aligning with Art Basel Paris, this fair capitalizes on France's deep historical reverence for the decorative arts. It features incredibly rare, expensive pieces of modernist and contemporary design in an intimately scaled, luxurious environment.

name: Semana Santa de Popayán (UNESCO)
desc: 467-year-old Holy Week tradition featuring candlelit nighttime processions recognized by UNESCO as Intangible Cultural Heritage.
details: Five processions (Tuesday through Saturday, 8-11 PM) dedicated to Virgin Mary, Jesus Christ, Holy Cross, Holy Sepulcher, and Resurrection. Processions cover 2 km through colonial city center. The festival combines deep religious devotion with rich artistic and cultural heritage. Participants wear traditional robes and carry religious statues through candlelit streets in solemn ceremony. Days: Domingo de Ramos (Mar 29), Jueves Santo (Apr 2), Viernes Santo (Apr 3), Domingo de Resurrección (Apr 4).

name: Carnaval des Fleurs (Carnival of Flowers)
desc: An annual summer carnival celebration featuring colorful parades, music, dance, and elaborate costumes showcasing Haiti's exotic fauna.
details: First held in 2012 when President Michel Martelly revived the festival to boost tourism and rejuvenate national morale following the 2010 earthquake, Carnaval des Fleurs draws thousands of participants annually. The event showcases colorful parades, music, dance, and elaborate costumes. According to Haiti Ministry of Tourism statistics, 20,000+ people traveled to Haiti during the 10-day Carnaval des Fleurs festival period, becoming a significant event in Haiti's cultural calendar.

name: CH'UTILLOS (Festival of San Bartolomé and San Ignacio de Loyola - Potosí)
desc: A UNESCO-recognized festival representing the meeting of cultures, featuring gastronomic fairs, dance performances, and a procession to a natural sanctuary with rock formations.
details: Ch'utillos, or the Festival of San Bartolomé and San Ignacio de Loyola, is celebrated in Potosí during August. The festival is characterized by gastronomic fairs, dance performances, and processions to the sanctuary in the Mullu Punku gorge, a natural site with rock formations. The Autochthonous and Folkloric Dancing Parade of Ch'utillos brings parishioners, musical groups, and rural communities wearing traditional clothing. Some travel up to 200 kilometers from towns bordering Argentina, contributing traditions and oral expressions to the dancing parade. Dance groups from other Latin American countries participate, transforming Potosí's streets into a platform for cultural exchange. On December 6, 2023, the UN Intergovernmental Committee inscribed "Ch'utillos, the Festival of San Bartolomé and San Ignacio de Loyola, the meeting of cultures in Potosí" in UNESCO's Representative List of the Intangible Cultural Heritage of Humanity.

name: Fiesta de la Candelaria (Festival of the Virgin of Candelaria)
desc: UNESCO-recognized festival honoring the Virgin of Candelaria with 40,000 dancers, 5,000 musicians performing traditional Andean dances including the famous Diablada.
details: Over 200 dance troupes reinterpret traditional Andean dances during fortnight-long festivities. The festival blends ancestral pre-Hispanic traditions with Catholicism, paying tribute to both the Virgen de la Candelaria and Pachamama. Principal activities include competitions of traditional dances (January 31-February 1), elaborate costume competitions (February 8), and the grand Parade of the Virgin with traditional veneration (February 9-10).

name: Manif d'art 12 - La Biennale de Québec
desc: A major winter biennial in Canada's historic francophone capital.
details: Embracing its unique climatic context, Manif d'art disperses cutting-edge contemporary art throughout the historic and modern spaces of Quebec City. It serves as a vital bridge between Canadian artists and the international scene.

name: Staro Rīga Light Festival
desc: Annual light festival transforming Riga's historic architecture and public spaces with spectacular illuminations.
details: Staro Rīga (Shine Riga) transforms the Latvian capital with light installations, projections, and performances that illuminate the city's Art Nouveau architecture and medieval Old Town. The festival turns dark November evenings into magical explorations of light and creativity.

name: Rio de Janeiro Carnival (Rio Sambadrome)
desc: The world's largest carnival celebration featuring samba schools competing at the iconic Sambadrome with elaborate costumes, floats, and performances.
details: Rio Carnival is a spectacular five-day celebration that transforms the city into an open-air stage. The main Sambadrome parades showcase 32 competing samba schools performing intricate stories through dance, music, and visual spectacles. Pre-carnival street parties (blocos) begin weeks earlier, with post-carnival festivities extending through the weekend.

name: Dominica Carnival (Mas Domnik)
desc: "The Real Mas" holding true to carnival traditions of the past with calypso music, competitions, and activities.
details: Full carnival season spans weeks of lively events including calypso competitions, J'Ouvert celebrations with revelers covered in paint, and grand Carnival Parade featuring elaborate costumes and vibrant floats. Uniquely intertwines traditional dances like Bélé and Quadrille, providing profound connection to island's cultural heritage. In months leading up to Carnival, there are Calypso shows, village feasts, and pageants. Carnival serves as platform for promoting Dominica's cultural preservation and artistic expression.

name: Feria de la Primavera y Paz (spring & Peace Fair)
desc: San Cristóbal de las Casas celebration of spring, peace, and indigenous culture in historic Pueblo Mágico.
details: 156th edition approved by municipal government with preparations underway. Held at iconic Parque de Feria Eloy Cavazos. Brings together local families and national/international visitors in festive celebration of Chiapaneca culture. A week of activities prior to fair strengthens tourism, culture, and local identity. Colonial mountain town atmosphere with indigenous influences creates unique cultural experience.

name: Noche de San Juan (Saint John's Night)
desc: A beloved Puerto Rican tradition celebrating honor of Saint John the Baptist, the island's patron saint, rooted in Catholic and pagan solstice customs.
details: As the sun sets on June 23, beaches around Puerto Rico come alive with picnics, bonfires, and music. At exactly midnight, crowds rush into the ocean, walking backward into the waves to perform important rituals: three backward plunges cleanse the spirit and bring good luck. Some take seven or twelve plunges symbolizing stronger protection, abundance, or personal spiritual reset. Main locations include Ocean Park Beach, Isla Verde, Condado Beach, El Escambrón Beach near Luis Muñoz Rivera Park, and Balneario de Carolina. The event is free and family-friendly.

name: Procesión del Silencio (procession of Silence)
desc: One of the world's two best processions, a solemn silent march through historic center honoring Christ's passion.
details: Begins at Templo de Nuestra Señora del Carmen, lasting over 4 hours, covering 3.5+ kilometers through historic center streets. Silent procession of hundreds carrying heavy wooden stretchers with images representing Christ's Passion. Sounds of drums and bugles present, but no participant or spectator speaks—hence "Procesión del Silencio." 2026 special: twinning with similar Seville, Spain celebration (internationally recognized for Holy Week traditions). Festival San Luis en Primavera (5th edition) runs concurrently with expanded cultural programming.

name: Festival del Caribe (Fiesta del Fuego/Fire Festival)
desc: The annual Cuba Fire Festival features Caribbean music, dance, and culture with musical venues at 50 locations throughout the city.
details: Celebrates Caribbean cultural identity focusing on the African diaspora's contributions through music, dance, theater, religious ceremonies (Santería and Vodú), academic conferences, and art. Santiago's status as Cuba's 'most Caribbean' city and birthplace of son music makes it the perfect host.

name: Sapporo Snow Festival (Sapporo Yuki Matsuri)
desc: One of the world's largest snow festivals featuring massive ice and snow sculptures up to 15 meters tall across three venues.
details: The Sapporo Snow Festival is one of Japan's most iconic winter events, drawing over 2 million visitors annually. Held across three sites—Odori Park, Susukino, and Tsudome—it showcases hundreds of snow and ice sculptures ranging from life-sized replicas of famous buildings to beloved anime characters. The festival also features food stalls, concerts, and illuminated nighttime displays.

name: Savonlinna Opera Festival
desc: World-renowned opera festival staged inside a spectacular medieval castle on a lake island in eastern Finland.
details: Set inside the dramatic 15th-century Olavinlinna Castle on an island in Lake Saimaa, the Savonlinna Opera Festival is one of the world's most atmospherically staged opera events. Founded in 1912, it presents full-scale opera productions featuring leading international singers in an intimate 2,200-seat auditorium within the castle courtyard. The midnight sun provides an ethereal backdrop.

name: Shirakawa-go Doburoku Festival
desc: Sake-tasting harvest festival in the UNESCO World Heritage thatched-roof village.
details: The Doburoku Festival in the UNESCO-listed Shirakawa-go village celebrates the autumn harvest with traditional unfiltered sake (doburoku) offered at local shrines. Visitors can taste the sake while enjoying the iconic gassho-zukuri thatched-roof farmhouses surrounded by autumn foliage.

name: Ultra Europe
desc: A major electronic music festival on Croatia's stunning Adriatic coast, combining world-class DJs with beach parties and island afterparties.
details: Ultra Europe brings the globally renowned Ultra brand to the Adriatic coast of Split. The combination of electronic music headliners, the stunning coastal setting, and Croatia's summer vibe make it a top destination for EDM fans. Additional events include afterparties on nearby islands like Hvar and Vis, extending the festival experience across the Croatian coast.

name: Antigua Carnival (Antigua and Barbuda)
desc: Twelve-day steelpan, soca, pageants, and mas bands celebration transforming St. John's with color and sound.
details: Theme: "Feel the Rhythm." Annually commemorates emancipation of slavery. Pre-events include Rhythm Fridays (May 29, 2026) and Rising Sun Grounds event (April 11, 2026). Features elaborately costumed mas bands parading through St. John's, accompanied by infectious soca and calypso rhythms, plus steel band performances, beauty pageants, and food fairs highlighting rich cultural heritage and Antiguan creativity.

name: Tsubaki Grand Shrine Setsubun
desc: One of Japan's most important Setsubun celebrations at the 'first shrine' of the Ise region.
details: Tsubaki Grand Shrine's Setsubun features elaborate bean-throwing ceremonies, traditional performances, and fire-walking rituals. The shrine's ancient cedar forest setting and its status as one of the oldest shrines in the Ise region add spiritual gravitas.

name: Taif Rose Festival
desc: A celebration of the famous Taif rose harvest with rose-based culinary competitions, traditional events, and flower exhibitions.
details: Coinciding with the rose harvest season in al-Hada and al-Shafa farms, this festival attracts hundreds of thousands of rose enthusiasts. It features traditional entertainment events, flower exhibitions, and displays of rose products that Taif is renowned for. The city's cool mountain climate provides a perfect setting for the blooming Damask roses.

name: Iriya Asagao Matsuri (Morning Glory Festival)
desc: Charming morning glory market and festival near Sensoji Temple with 100+ vendors selling rare varieties.
details: The Iriya Asagao Matsuri features over 100 vendors selling beautiful morning glory plants in the streets near Sensoji. The tradition dates to the Edo period when the area was known for morning glory cultivation. Early risers see the flowers at their most beautiful before they close in the afternoon heat.

name: Fiesta de San Roque (San Roque's Great Feast - Tarija)
desc: A UNESCO-recognized festival running approximately one month, featuring thousands of "Chuncho" pilgrims in colorful costumes, religious processions, music, dances, and competitions.
details: The Fiesta Grande de Tarija takes place August 15 through the second Tuesday of September, with the city of Tarija transforming into a scene full of faith, music, dance, and tradition. The festival was declared Intangible Cultural Heritage of Humanity by UNESCO. The Chunchos are the undisputed protagonists, wearing turbans full of feathers and mirrors, colorful ponchos, and carrying arrows. Over 5,000 chuncho pilgrims make processions through different places in Tarija, with the Church of San Roque opening its doors to thousands of faithful. The festival's origins date to the Spanish colonial period when inhabitants made prayers to San Roque seeking protection against epidemics and diseases. The celebration showcases rich Bolivian Andean and Amazonian cultural fusion with religious elements.

name: Aymara New Year (Willkakuti)
desc: Winter solstice ceremonies at Tiwanaku marking the Aymara New Year.

name: Sumida River Fireworks Festival
desc: Tokyo's most atmospheric fireworks display illuminating the Sumida River, dating back to 1733.
details: The Sumidagawa Fireworks Festival dates back to 1733, making it one of Japan's oldest hanabi taikai. Over 20,000 fireworks are launched from two sites along the Sumida River, with the glowing Tokyo Skytree as a dramatic backdrop. The giant 'sky chrysanthemum' fireworks span 600 meters across. Nearly a million spectators line the riverbanks and bridges.

name: Nordlysfestivalen (Northern Lights Festival)
desc: World-class music festival above the Arctic Circle blending classical, jazz, opera, and contemporary performances with aurora viewing.
details: Set in Tromsø, deep above the Arctic Circle, this festival combines exceptional music programming with the chance to witness the Northern Lights. Performances take place in historic churches, intimate cultural venues, and modern concert halls. The emphasis is on quality and immersive experiences that complement the stark beauty of the polar night.

name: Spring Eagle Festival
desc: Winter eagle hunting festival near Ulaanbaatar for visitors unable to reach remote western Mongolia.
details: The Spring Eagle Festival near Ulaanbaatar provides a more accessible opportunity to witness Kazakh eagle hunting traditions. While smaller than the western Mongolia festivals, it features eagle demonstrations, traditional Kazakh music, and cultural displays against a snowy landscape. Ideal for winter visitors to Mongolia.

name: Danshig Naadam (Tsam Dance Festival)
desc: Buddhist cultural festival combining sacred Tsam mask dancing with traditional Naadam-style games.
details: The Danshig Naadam combines Buddhist ceremonies with traditional Mongolian games. The centerpiece is the spectacular Tsam dance—lamas wearing ornate masks and costumes representing deities and spirits perform ritualistic dances to ward off evil. The festival also includes traditional wrestling, archery, and horse racing. It dates to the enthronement of the first Bogd Jebtsundamba in 1639.

name: Biennale Gherdëina 10
desc: An open-air contemporary art exhibition set against the dramatic backdrop of the Dolomites.
details: This unique biennial takes art out of the white cube and places it in the public spaces and natural landscapes of Val Gardena. It emphasizes deep connections with nature, local traditions, and the phenomenology of the landscape.

name: Regata Storica
desc: Venice's most spectacular waterborne event — a historical boat parade in Renaissance costume followed by intense gondola races along the Grand Canal.
details: The Regata Storica opens with a magnificent historical water pageant of ornate 16th-century boats rowed by participants in period costume along the Grand Canal. The parade recreates the welcome given to Caterina Cornaro, Queen of Cyprus, in 1489. Following the pageant, competitive races feature gondoliers in different boat classes. The Grand Canal banks are packed with spectators. A uniquely Venetian spectacle.

name: Festival Internacional de la Canción de Viña del Mar
desc: Chile’s iconic televised music festival at Quinta Vergara, combining concerts, comedy, and competition.

name: Folklore Festival Východná
desc: Slovakia's oldest and largest folklore festival since 1953 with 1,500+ performers.
details: Východná's open-air theatre overlooking the village hosts 1,500+ folklore performers from Slovakia and international guests. Folk dance schools, singing workshops, and craft demonstrations celebrate living traditions.

name: Winnipeg Folk Festival
desc: Iconic folk festival at Birds Hill Provincial Park, one of the most beloved music festivals in Canada.
details: The Winnipeg Folk Festival is a pilgrimage for folk music lovers, held in the beautiful Birds Hill Provincial Park. The festival features an incredible array of folk, roots, world, and traditional music on multiple stages, with evening main stage concerts, daytime workshops, a crafts village, and campground jam sessions that last until dawn.

name: Yamagata Hanagasa Festival
desc: Vibrant dance festival where 10,000+ dancers perform with flower-decorated straw hats through the streets.
details: The Yamagata Hanagasa Festival features over 10,000 dancers in colorful yukata performing synchronized dances while waving hanagasa (flower-decorated straw hats). The parade stretches 1.2 km along the city's main street. Different groups perform unique dance styles, from traditional to creative contemporary interpretations. It is one of the four great Tohoku summer festivals.

name: Tainan Beehive Fireworks (Yanshuei District)
desc: Millions of bottle rockets fired into willing crowds—one of the world's most dangerous festivals.
details: The Yanshui Beehive Fireworks (Feng Pao) is truly one of the world's most extreme festivals. Enormous racks of bottle rockets—called 'beehives'—are ignited to fire millions of rockets horizontally into the crowd. Full protective gear (helmets, wet towels, thick clothing) is essential. The tradition has continued for over a century despite the obvious dangers.

name: Yangtze River Dragon Boat Races
desc: Dragon boat races at the birthplace of Qu Yuan, the poet whose death inspired the Dragon Boat Festival.
details: Zigui County in Hubei Province—birthplace of the poet Qu Yuan—hosts some of China's most authentic and atmospheric dragon boat races. The competition on the Yangtze tributaries near the Three Gorges is particularly scenic and historically significant, as this is where the tradition of racing to save Qu Yuan is said to have originated.

name: Phagwah (Holi) Festival
desc: The Guyanese name for Holi, the ancient Hindu festival of colors, celebrating triumph of good over evil, good harvest, and fertility.
details: Phagwah in Guyana has evolved from a religious observance into a truly national celebration embraced by Guyanese of all backgrounds, where strangers become friends, differences dissolve in a rainbow of colors, and the entire country joins the joy of spring. While rooted in Hindu origins, it's celebrated by Guyanese of all religions and backgrounds, embodying Guyana's multicultural spirit. Celebrations begin the evening before with Holika Dahan (bonfire) and continue throughout the following day. Phagwa is celebrated by singing special songs called Chowtaals and spraying colored powder and water.

name: Obon Festival
desc: Japan's festival of the dead where communities dance in circles to welcome ancestral spirits, culminating in Kyoto's grand bonfires.
details: Obon is one of Japan's most important traditions when ancestral spirits are believed to return to the earthly world. Families visit graves, light mukaebi (welcoming fires), and participate in bon odori dances. The Kyoto Gozan Okuribi (Daimonji) on August 16 features giant kanji characters set ablaze on five mountains surrounding Kyoto to guide spirits back to the afterlife.

name: Shogatsu (New Year Celebrations)
desc: Japan's most important holiday featuring hatsumode shrine visits, traditional foods, and family gatherings.
details: Shogatsu is Japan's most significant holiday. Millions visit shrines for hatsumode (first shrine visit of the year), enjoy traditional osechi ryori cuisine, and participate in customs like mochitsuki (rice cake pounding). Meiji Jingu Shrine in Tokyo alone receives over 3 million visitors during the first three days.

name: Día de Muertos/todos Santos (Day of the Dead)
desc: All Saints' Day and Day of the Dead celebration combining indigenous Andean traditions with Catholic customs to honor deceased loved ones.
details: Families visit cemeteries to decorate graves with flowers, bringing food, beverages, and flowers as gestures of love for deceased relatives. Traditional music is played as a sign of respect. Peruvian bakers prepare special breads including achachis (representing grandparents), horses (signifying transfer from Pachamama to Alaxpacha), and crowns (representing flowers and health). The celebration blends indigenous Andean traditions with Catholic customs unique to Peru's cultural heritage.

name: Carnaval de Venezuela (General)
desc: National Carnival celebration with regional variations including meat festivals, parades, and King Momo celebrations.
details: Venezuela's Carnival features diverse regional traditions including Maturín's King Momo celebrations, Puerto Cabello's meat festivals, Coro's historical parades, and Isla de Margarita's celebrations. Traditional music, colorful comparsas, street food, and costumes define the celebration across different states, each maintaining unique cultural expressions while celebrating the broader Carnival tradition.

name: Abu Dhabi Festival
desc: A premier arts and culture festival featuring world-class performances in music, dance, visual arts, and theater.
details: Abu Dhabi Festival brings international artists and cultural organizations to the UAE capital for a month of world-class performances spanning classical music, contemporary dance, visual arts, and theater. The festival has become one of the Gulf region's most important cultural events, bridging Eastern and Western artistic traditions.

name: Adelaide Festival
desc: World-class festival of music, arts, and dance with 700+ artists from 30+ countries in Botanic Park.
details: WOMADelaide is one of the world's great world music festivals, held in the beautiful Botanic Park. Over four days, 700+ artists from 30+ countries perform across seven stages, creating an extraordinary celebration of global music, dance, and culture in an intimate garden setting.

name: Pasifika Festival
desc: The world's largest celebration of Pacific Island cultures with 200,000+ visitors across themed village stages.
details: Pasifika Festival is a massive free one-day celebration of Pacific Island cultures in Western Springs, Auckland. Eleven themed villages represent different Pacific nations, each with stages, food stalls, and cultural displays. It's the largest Pasifika event in the world.

name: Avignon Theatre Festival (Festival d'Avignon)
desc: The world's oldest and most prestigious performing arts festival celebrates its 80th anniversary with groundbreaking theater in the majestic Papal Palace courtyard.
details: Founded by Jean Vilar in 1947, the Festival d'Avignon celebrates its 80th anniversary in 2026 under director Tiago Rodrigues. The official 'In' program features productions in the legendary Cour d'Honneur of the Palace of the Popes. The parallel 'Off' festival fills hundreds of venues across the city. The 2026 edition focuses on the future, 'asking the questions of the next eighty years.' The city-wide scale makes you feel like you're inside a festival, not just attending one.

name: Baalbeck International Festival
desc: The oldest and most prestigious cultural event in the Middle East, featuring world-class performances in ancient Roman temple ruins.
details: Spanning six decades, Baalbeck is the Middle East's oldest and most prestigious festival. Held in the stunning ancient Roman ruins of Baalbeck—among the best-preserved in the world—it features classical music, opera, jazz, and contemporary performances. Past performers include Sting, Ella Fitzgerald, and the Lebanese Philharmonic Orchestra. The colossal temple backdrop creates an unmatched atmosphere of grandeur.

name: Panagbenga Festival (Baguio Flower Festival)
desc: A month-long celebration of Baguio's flower industry with spectacular float parades, street dancing, and a vibrant garden show.
details: Panagbenga celebrates Baguio City's flower industry and its resilience after the 1990 earthquake. The Grand Float Parade features enormous floats covered entirely in fresh flowers, accompanied by street dancing groups in floral costumes. Session Road transforms into a pedestrian zone for the festivities, with market stalls, food, and cultural performances.

name: Carnaval de Barranquilla (Lectura del Bando)
desc: Ceremonial kickoff of Barranquilla’s Carnival season.

name: Yak Festival
desc: Celebration of the yak—cornerstone of Mongolian nomadic life—with yak racing, milking, and cultural events.
details: The 17th Mongol Yak Festival celebrates Mongolians' historical reliance on yaks for survival and self-sufficiency. Features beautifully decorated yak parades, yak catching and taming competitions using traditional roping techniques, yak racing, and best yak contest judged on strength, appearance, and harmony. International visitors attend from Germany, France, Australia, Netherlands, USA, and Japan. Serves as a trading hub for nomads.

name: Lowlands Festival
desc: Three-day paradise with 200+ acts spanning music, theatre, cinema, and literature.
details: Lowlands, officially 'A Campingflight to Lowlands Paradise', offers an exceptionally diverse programme across 10+ stages including indoor cinema, street theatre, cabaret, ballet, and literature alongside major music acts.

name: Green Man Festival
desc: Music, arts, and literature festival set in the Black Mountains of Wales.
details: Green Man Festival offers an intimate, alternative experience in the stunning Brecon Beacons. Known for its eclectic indie and folk lineup, literary talks, science discussions, and the legendary Green Man burning ceremony on the final night.

name: Queima das Fitas
desc: Queima das Fitas — "burning of the ribbons": colorful graduation processions and festivities
details: Queima das Fitas (Burning of the Ribbons) sees Coimbra's university students celebrate with parades, Fado serenades, concerts, and burning the ribbons of their faculty colours.

name: Candelaria (Copacabana, Bolivia)
desc: Vibrant celebration of the Virgin of Candelaria at the sacred Lake Titicaca pilgrimage town.
details: Bolivia's most important pilgrimage town on Lake Titicaca celebrates with colorful dances, religious processions, and Aymara rituals. Traditional dance groups perform Morenada, Diablada, and others. The basilica houses the famous Dark Virgin of Copacabana, Bolivia's patron saint.

name: Ozora Festival
desc: Legendary 12-day psychedelic trance gathering in the Hungarian countryside.
details: Ozora is one of the world's most renowned transformational festivals with 5 thematic stages, workshops on consciousness, art installations, and a community focused on transformation and interconnection.

name: National Western Stock Show
desc: One of the world's premier livestock shows and rodeos, a 16-day celebration of Western heritage.
details: The National Western Stock Show has been a Denver institution since 1906, featuring PRCA rodeo competitions, livestock shows, horse shows, trade shows, a parade of breeds, and Western art exhibitions. The Mexican Rodeo Extravaganza and Martin Luther King Jr. African American Heritage Rodeo are popular specialty events.

name: TradFest Dublin
desc: Ireland's largest traditional music festival with 200+ free events across historic Temple Bar venues.
details: TradFest Dublin brings world-class traditional musicians to historic Dublin venues including Christ Church Cathedral, City Hall, and Temple Bar pubs with 100+ events over five days.

name: Festival Nacional de la Mejorana
desc: Panama's most important folkloric event featuring traditional folk music competition, tamborito dances, float parades, and queens in traditional costume.
details: The Festival Nacional de la Mejorana is the most important folkloric event in the Republic of Panama, held annually in the town of Guararé (approximately 277 km from Panama City). Since 1949, the village has devoted a festival to the mejorana around September 24, during the patronal festivities of the Virgin of Las Mercedes. During the festival, musicians and singers perform Panamanian folk music and compete in a contest to choose the best mejorana performer. The festival also includes traditional dances such as tamborito, and carnival-style parades featuring folk music concerts, float parades, and queens in traditional costume enlivening the celebrations. It's a showcase of Panama's musical and cultural traditions in their most authentic form.

name: Takao Fire Walking Festival
desc: Dramatic fire-walking ceremony at Mt. Takao where yamabushi mountain monks walk across burning embers.
details: The Hiwatari Matsuri at Mt. Takao's Yakuoin Temple features yamabushi (mountain ascetic) monks walking barefoot across a bed of burning embers. Participants can also walk on the embers after they cool slightly. The ceremony purifies and protects against misfortune.

name: Virgen de la Altagracia celebrations
desc: Pilgrimages and masses honoring the patroness of the Dominican Republic.

name: Hoi An Lantern Festival
desc: An ancient town that switches off electric lights under thousands of silk lanterns floating on the river — pure magic.
details: On each full moon, Hoi An's ancient town turns off electric lights and is illuminated solely by silk lanterns in every color.
