Paper lanterns are floated down the Thu Bon River, traditional music fills the air, and special cultural demonstrations and markets create an enchanting atmosphere. The May and September full moons feature particularly special celebrations.

name: Feria de Huamantla 2026
desc: Spectacular nocturnal carpet festival and running of the bulls through streets decorated with sawdust tapestries.
details: Huamantla's annual fair features the extraordinary Noche que Nadie Duerme (Night Nobody Sleeps) when the town's streets are covered with elaborate sawdust and flower tapestries. A midnight running of bulls through these decorated streets is unique in all of Mexico.

name: Izumo Kamiari Festival
desc: Sacred gathering where Japan's 8 million gods convene at Izumo Taisha for their annual divine meeting.
details: While October is called Kannazuki (month without gods) across Japan, in Izumo it's Kamiarizuki (month with gods) because all deities gather at Izumo Taisha Grand Shrine. The Kamimukae-sai welcoming ceremony at Inasa Beach features bonfires and rituals. For two weeks, gods hold meetings deciding the coming year's marriages and fortunes.

name: Festival Nacional Indígena (National Indigenous Festival)
desc: Major cultural celebration honoring Puerto Rico's Taíno legacy and heritage through multiday festivities in the central mountain town.
details: One of the most important cultural celebrations in Puerto Rico, held at Nemesio R. Canales Recreation Plaza in Jayuya during the November 19 weekend (Discovery of Puerto Rico celebration). Features cultural, educational, and recreational activities for all ages: traditional music, folk dances, handicrafts, typical food, and cultural presentations. Highlights include indigenous parade, costume contests, indigenous pageants, and recreation of traditional Taíno village showing how the island's first inhabitants lived, worked, and celebrated through thatched homes, wooden tools, and ceremonial spaces.

name: Nyege Nyege Festival
desc: Four-day music and arts festival on the banks of the Nile celebrating African electronic and traditional music.
details: Nyege Nyege, meaning 'an irresistible urge to dance,' is a four-day celebration by the Nile River in Jinja featuring electronic, Afrobeat, and traditional sounds. Multiple stages showcase genres from across Africa and beyond, creating a paradise for music lovers in a lush tropical setting.

name: Lusheng Festival
desc: Massive gathering of 30,000+ Miao people for traditional reed-pipe music, dancing, and bullfighting.
details: The Lusheng Festival in Zhouxi Town near Kaili is the most famous Miao gathering, attracting over 30,000 participants. The lusheng (a traditional reed-pipe instrument) is central to Miao culture, and the festival features competitive playing, synchronized group dances, bullfighting, horse racing, and traditional singing. Women wear their finest silver jewelry and embroidered garments.

name: Nature One
desc: Iconic electronic festival at a former Cold War missile base with 20+ stages.
details: Nature One's 25th anniversary brings 350+ DJs to a decommissioned Pydna missile base. The juxtaposition of Cold War bunkers and euphoric dance music creates an unforgettable setting.

name: Keelung Ghost Festival
desc: Taiwan's most elaborate Ghost Month celebration with water lantern ceremony and spirit parades.
details: The Keelung Ghost Festival is Taiwan's grandest Ghost Month celebration, with a history of over 170 years. The water lantern ceremony at the harbor—where lit lanterns are floated out to sea to guide lost spirits—is the atmospheric highlight. Elaborate temple rituals, processions, and communal feasts continue throughout the ghost month.

name: Tanabe Festival
desc: Picturesque coastal festival in northern Kyoto prefecture with boat processions and fireworks over the sea.
details: The Tanabe Festival in the Tango Peninsula area features illuminated boat processions along the coast, shrine ceremonies, and fireworks over the Sea of Japan. The rural coastal setting and intimate scale offer a contrast to the grand urban festivals, providing an authentic local festival experience.

name: Christmas in Ethiopia (Genna)
desc: Ethiopian Orthodox Christmas at the rock-hewn churches of Lalibela with ancient liturgical traditions.
details: Genna at Lalibela is one of the most extraordinary Christmas celebrations in the world. Tens of thousands of white-robed pilgrims gather at the 12th-century rock-hewn churches for all-night services with ancient liturgical chanting, incense, and candlelight.

name: Fusion Festival
desc: Immersive counterculture festival blending electronic music, theatre, art, and performance.
details: Fusion at the former Lärz military airfield is a non-commercial arts commune featuring 20+ stages, performance art, sculptures, art cars, and 60,000 participants creating a temporary alternative society.

name: Fiestas Patronales de León (Virgen de la Merced Celebration)
desc: Month-long festivities honoring Virgen de la Merced with processions, masses, alboradas (dawn celebrations), and devotional ceremonies in Leon's plazas.
details: The Virgen de la Merced was declared the Patron Saint of León on July 17, 1912. These festivities last the entire month of September, with key celebrations around the saint's feast day. On September 24 of each year, thousands of worshippers accompany the grand procession of the image of the Virgen de la Merced through the main streets of León. On the night of September 23, in Catholic homes across León, candles are lit and placed in doorways and windows in the tradition called "la noche de las velas" (the night of candles), where the faithful reaffirm their faith in the Virgin. The most attended traditions include the solemn procession of the image on the 24th and the subida (ascent) on September 30. Masses, visits of the Virgin to schools, universities, and parishes, alboradas (dawn celebrations), fireworks, serenades, religious chants, and solemn processions are some of the most notable aspects of León's patronal festivals.

name: Tibetan New Year (Losar)
desc: Tibet's most important holiday featuring masked Cham dances, prayer ceremonies, and vibrant cultural celebrations.
details: Losar is the most significant festival in Tibetan culture, lasting up to 15 days. Celebrations include elaborate Cham dances with lamas wearing intricate masks and costumes, pilgrimage walks around sacred sites, butter sculpture displays at Jokhang Temple, prayer flag raising, and feasting. The atmosphere in Lhasa is electric as devotees from across Tibet converge on the holy city.

name: MISTURA (International Food Festival)
desc: One of Latin America's largest gastronomic festivals bringing together nearly 200 vendors offering traditional and contemporary Peruvian cuisine from every corner of the country.
details: The Mistura Culinary Festival is one of the largest gastronomic festivals in Latin America, typically held in the first half of September at Costa Verde in the Magdalena del Mar district. The festival lasts for 10 days and attracts over 500,000 attendees annually. Mistura features a wide range of traditional and contemporary Peruvian cuisine, from street food to dishes prepared by acclaimed chefs, offering the latest food trends. Nearly 200 vendors showcase delicacies from every region of Peru. The festival is easily accessible by public transport. For the most current information about exact 2026 dates and ticket prices, check official festival sources as dates may shift annually.

name: Fiesta de Santiago Apostol
desc: Vibrant Afro-Puerto Rican festival with vejigante masked dancers honoring the patron saint of Loiza.
details: The Fiestas de Santiago Apostol in Loiza is one of the most important Afro-Caribbean cultural celebrations in Puerto Rico. Colorful vejigante masked dancers in coconut shell masks represent the Moors in a centuries-old tradition blending African, Spanish, and Taino cultural elements.

name: 73rd Macau Grand Prix
desc: Legendary street racing event through the narrow streets of Macau—one of the world's most challenging circuits.
details: While primarily a motorsport event, the Macau Grand Prix is a major cultural happening. The Guia street circuit winds through the narrow streets of the city, past the famous Lisboa Bend. It features F3, touring cars, and motorcycle races. The entire city transforms during race weekend with entertainment, dining events, and an electric atmosphere.

name: Menton Lemon Festival (Fête du Citron)
desc: The Côte d'Azur town of Menton constructs enormous sculptures and tableaux made entirely from citrus fruits in this unique and colorful winter festival.
details: Menton's Lemon Festival is unique in Europe — enormous sculptures and themed tableaux constructed entirely from lemons and oranges fill the Biovès Gardens and parade through town. Each year has a new theme. The festival also features nighttime illuminated parades, confetti battles, and craft markets. It's a bright burst of Mediterranean color in winter.

name: Virgen de Guadalupe pilgrimage
desc: Massive pilgrimage and celebrations honoring Our Lady of Guadalupe.

name: Virgin of Guadalupe Day 2026
desc: Massive pilgrimage to Basilica of Guadalupe with millions honoring Mexico's patron saint
details: Draws millions of Catholics from Mexico and other countries yearly. Eve of Dec 12: thousands in processions ending at Basilica. Mañanitas (traditional congratulatory songs) at Basilica. Festivities include: dance presentations, parades, fireworks. Children dressed in traditional costumes blessed in churches. Basilica in Villa de Guadalupe Hidalgo (northern Mexico City neighborhood).

name: Día de los Muertos Megaprocesión
desc: Massive Day of the Dead parade through Mexico City inspired by the James Bond film Spectre.
details: What began as fiction in the James Bond film Spectre became reality in 2016 when Mexico City launched a massive Day of the Dead parade. The Megaprocesión features giant alebrijes, skeleton floats, thousands of costumed participants, and elaborate Catrina figures processing from Chapultepec to the Zócalo before millions of spectators.

name: Tokyo Bay Grand Fireworks Festival
desc: Historic Tokyo fireworks festival returning after 11 years with 12,000+ fireworks over Tokyo Bay.
details: The Tokyo Bay Grand Fireworks Festival is returning in 2026 after an 11-year hiatus, making it one of the year's most anticipated events. Over 12,000 fireworks will illuminate Tokyo Bay, visible from waterfront areas across the city. The autumn timing is unusual for Japanese fireworks, making it a unique experience.

name: Just for Laughs Festival
desc: The world's largest comedy festival, launching careers and showcasing international comedic talent.
details: Just for Laughs is the world's biggest and most prestigious international comedy festival, presenting over 1,600 shows in 10 days. The festival features galas with A-list headliners, new talent showcases, street performers, and the famous Just for Laughs Gags. Many major comedy careers have been launched or defined here.

name: Ugandan Martyrs Day
desc: Massive Christian pilgrimage commemorating the Uganda Martyrs at Namugongo shrine.
details: Uganda Martyrs Day draws millions of pilgrims to Namugongo shrine near Kampala, where 32 young Christian converts were burned alive in 1886 on the orders of Kabaka Mwanga. It is one of the largest Christian pilgrimages in Africa.

name: Nara Shika no Tsunokiri (Deer Antler Cutting)
desc: Centuries-old tradition of ceremonially cutting the antlers of Nara's sacred deer.
details: The Shika no Tsunokiri is a unique 350-year-old tradition where the antlers of Nara's sacred deer are ceremonially cut to prevent injuries during the rutting season. Deer are herded into a special arena and handled by Shinto priests and local volunteers in traditional dress.

name: Isle of Wight Festival
desc: Historic festival mixing legendary artists with emerging talent on the Isle of Wight.
details: The Isle of Wight Festival continues the legacy of its legendary 1970 predecessor with camping, diverse music stages, and a unique island atmosphere.

name: Rock am Ring
desc: Iconic rock festival at the legendary Nürburgring racing circuit.
details: Rock am Ring brings 80,000+ rock fans to the Nürburgring for three days of major rock, metal, and alternative acts. The 2026 edition sold out faster than ever.

name: Bonfire Night / Night of the Radishes equivalent - Oaxacan Comparsa
desc: Christmas Eve calendas and comparsas processing through Oaxaca's streets with giant puppets and fireworks.
details: On Christmas Eve, Oaxaca City comes alive with calendas - musical processions through the streets featuring giant papier-mache figures (monos de calenda), brass bands, fireworks, and dancing. Each neighborhood has its own procession heading to midnight mass, creating a joyous citywide celebration.

name: NOS Alive
desc: Portugal's biggest music festival on the banks of the Tagus River — consistently booking major international headliners in a stunning riverside setting.
details: NOS Alive has become a major stop on the European festival circuit, attracting top international headliners alongside Portuguese artists. The riverside setting near Lisbon, combined with the city's excellent food scene and vibrant nightlife, makes it a complete summer festival experience. The festival spans rock, indie, electronic, and pop.

name: Colours of Ostrava
desc: Diverse festival at a former industrial steelworks with 350+ shows across multiple stages.
details: Colours of Ostrava at the stunning Dolní Vítkovice industrial complex blends music, theatre, art, workshops, and discussions. The juxtaposition of blast furnaces and live music creates a unique atmosphere.

name: Winterlude (Bal de Neige)
desc: Three-week celebration featuring the world's largest natural skating rink on the Rideau Canal.
details: Winterlude transforms Canada's capital into a winter playground with the iconic Rideau Canal Skateway (a UNESCO World Heritage Site), Snowflake Kingdom playground, Crystal Garden ice sculpture competition, and musical performances. The canal becomes a 7.8 km skating highway where commuters, families, and tourists glide past Parliament Hill.

name: Panama Jazz Festival
desc: XXIII edition of Panama's most internationally recognized music event, paying tribute to legendary Panamanian saxophonist Gladstone "Bat" Gordon.
details: The 23rd edition of the Panama Jazz Festival takes place January 15-17, 2026. This perhaps Panama's most internationally recognized music event, founded in 2003 and now a major annual gathering for jazz musicians and audiences. The 2026 edition pays tribute to legendary Panamanian saxophonist Gladstone "Bat" Gordon. The Gala Night features the "Legacy of Wayne Shorter" project, led by Danilo Pérez, John Patitucci, and Brian Blade, with special guest Ravi Coltrane. Other performers include international stars Terri Lyne Carrington, Tia Fuller, Nadia Washington, and Gregory Groover. The festival concludes with the traditional Family Outdoor Concert on Saturday, January 17, a free public event in the Central Quadrangle dedicated to honoring Ismael Rivera, "El Sonero Mayor." Visit the official website at www.panamajazzfestival.com for information and tickets.

name: Papantla Flyers (Voladores de Papantla) Festival
desc: UNESCO ceremony of the Voladores, ancient Totonac pole-flying ritual, with cultural festivities.
details: The Ritual Ceremony of the Voladores is a UNESCO Intangible Cultural Heritage. Five men climb a 30-meter pole; four launch themselves attached by ropes, spinning 13 times each (totaling 52 rotations representing the Mesoamerican calendar cycle), while a fifth plays flute and drum at the top. The Papantla festival celebrates this tradition with Totonac cultural events.

name: Cumbre Tajín 2026 (Festival at El Tajín Archaeological Zone)
desc: Festival celebrating ancestral Mexican culture with Voladores performances, ceremonies, workshops, concerts
details: Three venues: Parque Takilhsukut, El Tajín archaeological zone (UNESCO site), Papantla de Olarte. Features 50+ experiences: pre-Hispanic ceremonies, healing workshops, world-class concerts, Voladores performances. Thematic park with niches and plazas 1.5 km from El Tajín (Cultural Heritage of Humanity, UNESCO 1992). Connects visitors with Mexico's cultural roots.

name: Solidays
desc: Major music festival at ParisLongchamp raising awareness about AIDS with 80+ concerts.
details: Solidays combines a diverse music lineup with social activism, raising funds and awareness for the fight against AIDS. 200,000 attendees enjoy concerts across multiple stages at the historic racecourse.

name: Virgen del Carmen
desc: Vibrant festival honoring "Mamacha Carmen," the patron saint of mestizos and protector of travelers, combining pre-Hispanic Andean music with African-influenced rhythms.
details: Located 110 km southeast of Cusco at 2,906 meters altitude, the festival declared Cultural Heritage of the Nation (2006) features pilgrims and dancers arriving July 15, filling the town with music and colorful processions. The main day (July 16) begins with the Fiesta Mass including songs based on traditional Andean and African music. The celebration expresses Peruvian identity combining faith, history, customs, and dances of indigenous people, Spanish conquerors, and African slaves brought to the country. Multiple dance groups perform in elaborate traditional costumes with spiritual significance.

name: Kendal Calling
desc: Family-friendly music festival in the Lake District known as the mini-Glastonbury of the North.
details: Kendal Calling offers a welcoming festival experience in the stunning Lake District with camping, diverse music stages, comedy, workshops, and a legendary fancy dress tradition.

name: All Together Now
desc: Ireland's largest independent festival with 18 stages on a stunning Waterford estate.
details: All Together Now at Curraghmore Estate features an eclectic mix of music, comedy, spoken word, and art across 18 stages. It won IMRO Festival of the Year and is celebrated for its intimate atmosphere and diverse programming.

name: Prague Spring
desc: Prestigious international classical music festival now in its 81st edition.
details: Prague Spring presents 60+ concerts featuring 97 artists from 28 countries in Prague's finest concert halls and churches. One of Europe's most venerable classical music institutions.

name: Prague Christmas Markets
desc: Prague's fairy-tale Old Town Square transforms into one of Europe's most enchanting Christmas markets, with a massive tree and wooden stalls beneath Gothic spires.
details: Prague's Christmas markets, centered on the Old Town Square and Wenceslas Square, are among Europe's most photogenic. The Gothic backdrop of the Týn Church, the astronomical clock, and a massive decorated Christmas tree create a magical setting. Traditional Czech treats include trdelník (chimney cake), svařák (mulled wine), and klobása (sausage). Carol concerts and nativity scenes add to the atmosphere.

name: Saijo Festival
desc: Wild Shikoku festival with over 150 elaborately decorated danjiri floats and river-crossing processions.
details: The Saijo Festival features over 150 decorated danjiri and mikoshi—one of the largest numbers in Japan. The highlight is the dramatic kawari (river crossing) where bearers carry floats through the river at dawn. The sheer number of floats and the energy of thousands of participants make this one of Shikoku's grandest celebrations.

name: International Balloon Festival of Saint-Jean-sur-Richelieu
desc: Canada's largest hot air balloon festival with 100+ balloons, night glows, and entertainment.
details: The International Balloon Festival of Saint-Jean-sur-Richelieu is the largest hot air balloon gathering in Canada, featuring over 100 colorful balloons, night glows, rides, concerts, family activities, and spectacular mass ascensions over the Richelieu River.

name: Positivus Festival
desc: Latvia's largest and most anticipated music festival on the Baltic Sea coast.
details: Positivus on Salacgrīva beach features 20,000 attendees across 3 stages plus cinema, art, and theatre, with international indie, pop, and electronic artists against a Baltic Sea backdrop.

name: Salem Haunted Happenings
desc: Month-long Halloween celebration in America's most bewitching city, site of the 1692 witch trials.
details: Salem transforms into the Halloween capital of America every October, drawing visitors with haunted houses, psychic fairs, witch-themed tours, costume parades, and the Grand Parade on Halloween night. The city's real connection to the 1692 witch trials adds an authentic historical dimension to the festivities.

name: Salzburg Easter Festival
desc: Prestigious spring festival with the Berlin Philharmonic performing Wagner's Ring.
details: The Salzburg Easter Festival features the Berlin Philharmonic in residence, performing Wagner opera alongside concerts and chamber music in an intimate spring setting.

name: Fiestas de la Calle San Sebastian
desc: Massive street festival in Old San Juan with live music, artisan crafts, and traditional food.
details: The Fiestas de la Calle San Sebastian transform the cobblestone streets of Old San Juan into one of the Caribbean's biggest parties. Multiple stages feature salsa, reggaeton, bomba, and plena music, while artisans sell traditional crafts and food vendors offer authentic Puerto Rican cuisine under the colonial-era buildings.

name: Seoul Drum Cat Performance Festival
desc: World-famous all-female Korean drumming performance combining traditional samulnori with modern beats.
details: NANTA (Cookin') and Drum Cat are Seoul's iconic percussion shows combining traditional Korean samulnori drumming with comedy and modern beats. While year-round shows rather than festivals, they represent Korean rhythm culture at its most entertaining and are major tourist attractions.

name: Siwa Festival (Siyaha)
desc: Annual Sufi harvest festival in the remote Siwa Oasis featuring communal feasts and reconciliation rituals.
details: Three-day festival where all Siwan men gather at Dakrour Mountain for communal prayers, feasts, and traditional reconciliation. Unique isolated desert oasis culture.

name: Latitude Festival
desc: Multi-arts festival celebrating 20 years of music, theatre, comedy, poetry, and dance.
details: Latitude at Henham Park offers a diverse arts programme alongside its music stages, featuring theatre in the woods, comedy, poetry, dance, and literary talks. It's known for its family-friendly atmosphere and boutique camping options.

name: Gladmat Food Festival
desc: Scandinavia's biggest food festival brings together amateur and professional foodies for four days of culinary celebration in Norway's food capital.
details: Gladmat transforms Stavanger's harbour into a massive open-air food festival. Restaurants, producers, and chefs from across Norway and beyond serve dishes, run cooking demonstrations, and host tastings. The festival celebrates Norway's rich culinary heritage, from fresh seafood to artisan cheeses. Free to attend with food and drink available for purchase.

name: Stratford Festival
desc: North America's largest classical repertory theater festival, anchored by Shakespeare productions.
details: The Stratford Festival is one of the most respected theater festivals in the world, presenting a season of approximately 15 productions across four theaters. While Shakespeare remains central, the repertoire includes musicals, contemporary drama, and new Canadian works. The charming town on the Avon River completes the English village atmosphere.

name: International Folklore Festival Strážnice
desc: Europe's largest and oldest international folklore festival with UNESCO-registered traditions.
details: Strážnice brings traditional music, dance, singing, and costumes from Czech regions and abroad to its open-air museum setting. Features the UNESCO-registered Slovácký verbuňk folk dance.

name: Sturgis Motorcycle Rally
desc: The largest motorcycle rally in the world, a 10-day gathering of riders and music in the Black Hills.
details: Since 1938, Sturgis has been the mecca for motorcycle enthusiasts, drawing hundreds of thousands of riders to the Black Hills of South Dakota. The rally features concerts, races, stunt shows, custom bike competitions, and rides through scenic landscapes including Mount Rushmore and the Badlands.

name: Sun Moon Lake Swimming Carnival
desc: Iconic open-water swimming event where 25,000 swimmers cross Taiwan's most beautiful alpine lake.
details: The Sun Moon Lake Swimming Carnival is one of the world's largest open-water swimming events, with approximately 25,000 participants swimming 3.3km across Taiwan's most scenic lake. Set at 748m elevation surrounded by mountains, the annual event combines athletic challenge with stunning natural beauty. Registration fills within minutes of opening.

name: Souq Okaz Festival
desc: A revival of the ancient pre-Islamic poetry and trade market in Taif with art, performances, and literary competitions.
details: Reviving the legendary pre-Islamic marketplace where poets and traders gathered, this festival in Taif features poetry competitions, theatrical performances, art exhibitions, and traditional crafts. It celebrates Arabia's deep literary heritage while showcasing contemporary creative arts, set against the backdrop of Taif's cool mountain climate.

name: Carnaval Tampico Alto 2026
desc: Regional carnival in Huasteca Alta region

name: PHUJLLAY/PUJLLAY (Tarabuco Indigenous Festival)
desc: Indigenous celebration commemorating the Battle of Jumbate (1816) during Bolivian War of Independence with vibrant traditional dances, colorful costumes, and ceremonial offerings.
details: Around 60 surrounding indigenous Yampara communities participate in this annual festival 65 km outside Sucre. The festival features the construction of a "pukara," a ceremonial tower/altar standing over 3 meters tall, adorned with fruits, bread, meat, and offerings symbolizing gratitude to Pachamama (Mother Earth). The celebration displays traditional dances, colorful costumes, and rich indigenous culture. On March 12, 1816, villagers from Tarabuco attacked a Spanish battalion in a resounding independence victory, liberating the town. Tarabuco is located in Yamparáez province, Chuquisaca, easily accessible from Sucre (2-hour public transport).

name: Ofune Matsuri (Boat Festival)
desc: Colorful sea festival in Toba where enormous wooden boat floats are carried by locals in fishing-village processions.
details: Ofune Matsuri in Toba celebrates the maritime heritage of the Ise-Shima region. Large decorated wooden boat floats are carried through the streets and to the harbor by teams of locals. The festival reflects the deep connection between the community and the sea, with prayers for safe fishing and abundant catches.

name: Canadian National Exhibition (CNE / The Ex)
desc: Canada's largest annual fair featuring midway rides, food innovations, air show, and exhibitions.
details: The CNE, affectionately known as 'The Ex,' is a Toronto tradition dating to 1879. Held at Exhibition Place on Lake Ontario, the 18-day fair features a massive midway, innovative food creations, a world-class air show, concerts, agricultural exhibits, and the iconic Food Building. It marks the end of summer for Torontonians.

name: Pohoda Festival
desc: Slovakia's biggest festival celebrating its 30th anniversary with diverse arts programming.
details: Pohoda's 30th anniversary at Trenčín Airport features rock, pop, electronic, classical, folk, theatre, literature, film, and dance. Known for exceptional curation and community atmosphere.

name: Khoja Ahmed Yasawi Pilgrimage
desc: Year-round pilgrimage to the UNESCO World Heritage 14th-century Timurid mausoleum of Sufi poet Ahmad Yasawi.
details: UNESCO World Heritage site and major pilgrimage destination. Islamic holidays draw thousands of pilgrims. Spiritual and cultural observances at 14th-century Timurid architecture complex honoring 12th-century Sufi poet Ahmad Yasawi (1093-1166). Peak visitation during Eid al-Fitr, Eid al-Adha, and Nauryz.

name: Fiestas de la Vendimia (wine Harvest Festival - Parras)
desc: Celebration of wine harvest tradition in Mexico's oldest wine region with live music, wine selections, and gastronomic experiences.
details: Festival Parvada 2026 features musical star Duelo performing May 16. Pre-sale through arema.mx (starting January 30). Offers house wines and first-class gastronomic proposals. Ticket options: Jardín Central ($2,200+, 10+ hours music, food access, PlayDoit Chill shade); Zona Fan ($3,500+, includes fan zone); Zona Nido ($4,450+, private table/waiter); Terraza Surman ($5,000+, preferential access). Parras: Mexico's oldest wine-producing region with wineries dating centuries.

name: Carnevale di Venezia (Venice Carnival)
desc: Iconic masquerade carnival with elaborate masks and costumes, parades, balls, and events across Venice.

name: Verona Arena Opera Festival
desc: World-class opera in a 2,000-year-old Roman amphitheatre under the stars.
details: The 103rd Arena di Verona Opera Festival presents spectacular productions in the ancient Roman amphitheatre seating 15,000. The candlelit atmosphere and perfect acoustics make it one of the world's great opera experiences.

name: Folklorama
desc: The world's largest and longest-running multicultural festival, showcasing 40+ cultural pavilions.
details: Folklorama is a two-week celebration of Winnipeg's extraordinary cultural diversity, with 40+ cultural pavilions across the city. Each pavilion offers authentic cuisine, cultural performances, and displays from a different world culture — from Filipino to Ukrainian to Brazilian to Ethiopian. Visitors travel between pavilions experiencing the world without leaving Winnipeg.

name: Festival du Voyageur
desc: Western Canada's largest winter festival celebrating French-Canadian and Métis fur trade heritage.
details: Festival du Voyageur celebrates the joie de vivre of the French-Canadian voyageurs and Métis people who were central to the fur trade. Events include traditional jigging and fiddle competitions, snow sculpture contests, voyageur canoe races, historical reenactments, and a kitchen party atmosphere in the Festival Chalets, all set in Fort Gibraltar.

name: NAIDOC Week
desc: National week-long celebration of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander history, culture, and achievements.
details: NAIDOC Week celebrates the history, culture, and achievements of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples. Events are held across every state and territory, including marches, flag-raising ceremonies, cultural performances, art exhibitions, and community gatherings. It is one of Australia's most important cultural observances.

name: Fiesta de Cuasimodo
desc: Traditional campesino horse procession delivering sacraments to sick and elderly unable to receive communion during Easter.
details: Horse-based procession escorts priest carrying sacred vessels in decorated cart. Called cuasimodistas, escorts wear white kerchiefs honoring Christ. Modern adaptations include bicycle and motorized processions in cities. Recognized as intangible cultural heritage. Blends Catholic and rural Chilean traditions. Historic significance to rural Chilean religious practices.

name: Lenca Festivals & Celebrations - Various Locations
desc: Indigenous Lenca celebrations including Guancasco (peace & friendship renewal), Gran Romería Lenca pilgrimage, Lempira Day, and Artisan Fairs.
details: The Lenca people of Honduras maintain rich cultural traditions through multiple annual celebrations. Guancasco is a traditional Lenca celebration where indigenous communities gather to renew bonds of peace, friendship, and solidarity. This deeply spiritual event involves the exchange of symbolic gifts, carrying of sacred flags, and vibrant processions through streets, with participants in traditional attire and ancestral music and dances. The Gran Romería Lenca (pilgrimage) is held in Comayagua on the 24th. Lempira Day on July 20 honors a Lenca indigenous leader who led resistance against Spanish conquistadors in the 1530s. The Lenca Route Artisan Fair highlights celebrations in February, while June features the Guancasco between San Antonio and Yarumela. The western highlands (La Esperanza, Intibucá) offer Lenca cultural events, artisan markets, and traditional dances set against mountain scenery, providing opportunities to connect with communities maintaining centuries-old crafts and culinary traditions.

name: Vesak (Buddha Day)
desc: The most important Buddhist holiday celebrated across Asia with candlelit processions, lantern ceremonies, and temple gatherings.
details: Vesak commemorates the birth, enlightenment, and death of the Buddha. Celebrated across Southeast Asia, highlights include candlelit processions at Borobudur in Java, lantern-lighting ceremonies in Malaysia, and special temple services throughout Vietnam, Thailand, and Sri Lanka. Each country adds unique cultural traditions to the observance.

name: Chuseok (Mid-Autumn Festival)
desc: Major Korean harvest festival with ancestral rites, family feasts, and traditional foods like songpyeon.

name: Tantora Festival / Winter at Tantora
desc: A seasonal arts and culture festival at the UNESCO site of Hegra featuring world-renowned musicians at the mirror-clad Maraya Concert Hall.
details: Set against the dramatic desert backdrop of AlUla, this seasonal festival celebrates music, nature, and luxury travel. The iconic Maraya Concert Hall, a mirrored structure reflecting the rocky desert landscape, hosts world-renowned performers. The festival also features heritage experiences, hot air balloon rides, stargazing, and culinary events, making AlUla a premier winter cultural destination.

name: Fiesta de las Flores y las Frutas
desc: 75th anniversary edition ("Diamond Wedding"/Bodas de Diamante) celebrating with flower/fruit floats, comparsas, dancers, and international delegations.
details: Unlike water carnivals, Ambato emphasizes creativity with allegorical floats adorned with fresh flowers/fruits, traditional comparsas, dancers, national/international delegations. Main event Sunday, February 15 (9 AM) with Grand Parade through city. Extended programming February 13-25 includes flower, fruit, crafts fairs at Parque Montalvo and Central Market with free exhibitions, cultural workshops, artistic presentations for all ages (10 AM). Notable: Miss Universe Fátima Bosch from Mexico participated on allegorical float. Celebration emphasizes natural beauty and regional agricultural pride.

name: Baisakhi
desc: The Sikh New Year and harvest festival celebrated with processions at the Golden Temple, folk dances, and community feasts.
details: Baisakhi marks the Sikh New Year and the 1699 founding of the Khalsa by Guru Gobind Singh. The Golden Temple in Amritsar is the epicenter, with massive processions (Nagar Kirtan), bhangra and gidda folk dances, communal langar meals, and agricultural fairs. It coincides with the harvest, creating a double celebration.

name: Aomori Nebuta Museum & Year-round Experience
desc: Year-round museum experience showcasing the giant illuminated nebuta floats with live demonstrations.
details: While the main Nebuta Matsuri is in August, the Nebuta Museum (Wa Rasse) in Aomori city offers year-round access to the giant illuminated floats. The museum displays several full-size nebuta from the most recent festival and features workshops on nebuta construction and painting. Live taiko performances and hayashi music sessions are held regularly.

name: Garma Festival
desc: Australia's most significant Indigenous cultural gathering held in remote northeast Arnhem Land.
details: Garma Festival is a four-day celebration of Yolngu life and culture held at Gulkula, a significant ceremonial site in northeast Arnhem Land. It brings together Indigenous leaders, politicians, business leaders, and visitors for traditional dance, music, art, storytelling, ceremony, and important policy discussions.

name: Atlanta Art Fair
desc: A major new addition reflecting the exploding cultural cachet of the American South.
details: This fair seeks to anchor the booming contemporary art scene in Atlanta, heavily highlighting African American artists, hip-hop cultural influences, and the region's rapidly growing creative economy.

name: Te Maeva Nui
desc: Cook Islands' major independence celebration with spectacular traditional dance, drumming, and cultural competitions.
details: Te Maeva Nui is the Cook Islands' biggest cultural event, celebrating independence with a week of traditional dance competitions, drumming, singing, float parades, and cultural displays. Each island group competes in spectacular performances showcasing unique styles and traditions.

name: Novruz Bayram
desc: Azerbaijan's most significant holiday with 5 days off, folk concerts, symbolic foods, and cultural quests.
details: Azerbaijan's most significant holiday celebrating the Lunar New Year and spring. Workers receive 5 days off. International Novruz Festival (March 17-23) offers traditional celebrations, folk games, workshops, and museum visits. Elaborate Novruz tables with special dishes symbolizing renewal.

name: Loy Krathong
desc: Thailand's enchanting water lantern festival where decorated offerings are floated on rivers and waterways to honor the water goddess.
details: One of Thailand's most beautiful festivals, Loy Krathong involves floating decorated baskets (krathongs) made of banana leaves, flowers, candles, and incense on waterways. Sukhothai's historic park provides the most atmospheric setting. The festival combines Buddhist merit-making with romantic legend, creating magical scenes along rivers, canals, and beaches throughout the country.

name: Carnaval de Barranquilla (UNESCO)
desc: The Caribbean's most vibrant four-day celebration featuring parades, comparsas, and iconic Battle of Flowers parade leading UNESCO-recognized festival.
details: Pre-carnival festivities run January 17 - February 17 with 40+ large-scale events and 50+ cultural activities. Main events: La Batalla de Flores (Feb 14), Gran Parada de Tradición y Folclor (Feb 15), Gran Parada de Comparsas (Feb 16), La Muerte de Joselito Carnaval (Feb 17). The festival draws 400,000+ spectators with elaborate costumes, live music, and street parties throughout the city.

name: Barunga Festival
desc: Three-day celebration of Aboriginal culture, music, art, and sport in a remote bush setting.
details: The Barunga Festival has been running since the 1980s and is one of Australia's most important Indigenous cultural events. Held in the small community of Barunga, 80km southeast of Katherine, it features traditional dance, music, didgeridoo competitions, spear-throwing, and community celebrations.

name: Thaipusam
desc: An awe-inspiring Hindu festival of devotion where devotees carry elaborate kavadi structures and perform acts of faith at Batu Caves.
details: One of the most visually dramatic religious festivals in Asia. Hindu devotees undergo extraordinary acts of devotion — carrying elaborate kavadi structures attached to their bodies with hooks and skewers — during a procession to the Batu Caves near Kuala Lumpur. The 272-step climb to the cave temple, accompanied by chanting and drumming, creates an intensely spiritual atmosphere.

name: Beaujolais Nouveau Day
desc: The annual midnight release of the year's new Beaujolais wine, celebrated simultaneously worldwide with tastings, parties, and the cry 'Le Beaujolais Nouveau est arrivé!'
details: At midnight on the third Thursday of November, the year's new Beaujolais wine is released simultaneously worldwide. In the Beaujolais region itself, the celebration is most authentic — villages and towns hold tastings, dinners, and parties. The tradition has become a global phenomenon, but experiencing it in the vineyards where the grapes were grown is something special.

name: Jacob's Pillow Dance Festival
desc: America's longest-running international dance festival in the Berkshire Hills.
details: Jacob's Pillow is a National Historic Landmark and America's premier dance festival, presenting ballet, modern, jazz, tap, and global dance traditions over 10 weeks each summer. The Berkshire Hills campus includes indoor and outdoor theaters, free performances, exhibits, and classes.

name: Matsu Pilgrimage
desc: Major pilgrimage to the Beigang Chaotian Temple—one of Taiwan's holiest Mazu temples.
details: The Beigang Chaotian Temple is one of Taiwan's most important Mazu temples, drawing massive pilgrimages during the goddess's birthday celebrations. Elaborate processions with firecrackers, spirit mediums, and religious performances create an intense atmosphere of devotion.

name: Charangas de Bejucal
desc: Havana's oldest traditional festival featuring two rival conga groups with dancing, lively music, delicious food, and memorable parades.
details: Based on rivalry between "La Ceiba de Plata" (scorpion symbol, blue color) and "La Espina de Oro" (rooster symbol, red color). Each side puts on shows with dancing, traditional music, vibrant colors, and fireworks. Large crowds watch impressive float structures as both sides try to outdo each other. Features main "characters" like the Macorina, Mojiganga, Bollera, Kulona, and Yerbero. This year marks 1820 since the first celebration, solidifying its place as a cornerstone of Cuban holiday traditions.

name: Festival Micarê Brasília
desc: Two-day off-season carnival celebration offering authentic micareta experience with traditional blocos and cultural programming.
details: Festival Micarê Brasília provides experiential celebration for those seeking authentic carnival joy outside traditional season. May dates offer alternative to major February carnivals while celebrating similar traditions and cultural expressions.

name: BRAFA Art Fair
desc: One of Europe's oldest and most prestigious art and antiques fairs.
details: Known for its eclectic mix, BRAFA seamlessly blends ancient tribal art, classical antiquities, Old Masters, and post-war contemporary art, attracting serious, old-money European collectors.

name: Festival de Inverno de Campos do Jordão
desc: 55th edition of Latin America's largest classical music festival featuring 76 free performances of classical, chamber, jazz, and dance music across eight stages.
details: The festival spans July and August with performances at venues in Campos do Jordão and São Paulo. Programming includes works by Strauss, Rachmaninov, Beethoven, Tchaikovsky, and Brazilian composers like Villa-Lobos and Pixinguinha. Chamber music, jazz, and the Paulista Dance Journey enrich the programming. The festival offers full scholarships to young musicians participating in classes, masterclasses, and collective practices during the month-long event. Free performances make classical music accessible throughout the region. Eight stages provide intimate and large-scale performance venues.

name: Celtic Colours International Festival
desc: World-class Celtic music festival timed to the spectacular fall foliage of Cape Breton Island.
details: Celtic Colours presents over 50 concerts in communities across Cape Breton Island, timed to coincide with the spectacular autumn colours of the Cape Breton Highlands. The festival features Celtic musicians from Scotland, Ireland, Brittany, and Atlantic Canada, plus cultural workshops, community events, and scenic bus tours through the Cabot Trail.

name: Two Oceans Marathon
desc: One of the world's most scenic ultra-marathons through the Cape Peninsula.
details: The Two Oceans Marathon is billed as the world's most beautiful marathon, taking runners on a 56km route through the Cape Peninsula, touching both the Atlantic and Indian Oceans. The route passes through iconic locations including Chapman's Peak and the Constantia Winelands.

name: Spoleto Festival - Piccolo Spoleto
desc: Free companion festival to Spoleto USA with 700+ events celebrating local and regional artists.
details: Piccolo Spoleto runs alongside Spoleto Festival USA, presenting over 700 events including concerts, theater, dance, art walks, poetry readings, and children's programming. Most events are free, making world-class arts accessible to all.

name: Charlottetown Festival (Anne of Green Gables)
desc: Summer theater festival featuring Anne of Green Gables – The Musical and other Canadian productions.
details: The Charlottetown Festival at the Confederation Centre of the Arts presents a season of musicals and plays including the world's longest-running annual musical production, Anne of Green Gables – The Musical, which has been performed every summer since 1965. Additional productions showcase Canadian theatrical talent.

name: Fiestas de Enero
desc: Ancient Chiapaneco celebration with UNESCO-recognized Parachicos dancers and dramatic river battle reenactment.
details: The Fiesta Grande features UNESCO-recognized Parachicos dancers in carved wooden masks and elaborate costumes dancing in honor of saints. Culminates in a dramatic nighttime battle re-enactment on the Grijalva River with boats, fireworks, and simulated colonial battle. Chuntá dancers and traditional food complete the display.

name: Fiesta Grande de Chiapa de Corzo (san Sebastián)
desc: Historic Pueblo Mágico celebration honoring San Sebastián Mártir with parachicos dancers, naval combat reenactment, and traditional music.
details: January 20 is the largest day (San Sebastián Mártir saint day) with thousands of parachicos (masked dancers) and women dancing. January 21 night: spectacular Naval Combat reenactment on Grijalva River with illuminated pyrotechnics. Features parades, processions, concerts, cultural meetings near Grijalva River. Parachicos (dancers in masks, sarapes, and distinctive movements) remain symbolic axis of celebration. Blends centuries-old tradition with contemporary scenic and musical proposals.

name: Expo Chicago
desc: The International Exposition of Contemporary & Modern Art, anchoring the Midwest market.
details: Held at Navy Pier, EXPO draws major international galleries to the heartland. Its alignment with Chicago's vast institutional framework makes it a critical stop for curators and Midwestern mega-collectors.

name: San Juan Bautista festivals
desc: Drumming, dancing, and processions in Afro-Venezuelan communities.

name: 3 Days of Design Copenhagen
desc: Scandinavia's premier design festival, celebrated for its intimacy and focus on sustainability.
details: Operating as a highly curated, city-wide event, it showcases the best of Danish and international design. The festival has surged in popularity as a more relaxed, pleasurable alternative to the overwhelming scale of traditional trade fairs.

name: SANTURANTICUY (Christmas Market - Cusco)
desc: Traditional Christmas market featuring around 500 artisans selling religious figures, nativity scenes, textiles, and traditional food in Cusco's Plaza de Armas.
details: The name means "sale of saints" in Quechua. This temporary market is the only day annually that the Plaza de Armas is allowed for commercial purposes. Sculptors and craftsmen offer diverse figures to brighten holidays and accompany cribs (births) constructed in homes and parishes. Declared Cultural Heritage of the Peruvian Nation (September 22, 2009), Santurantikuy represents one of the most emblematic and traditional festivities celebrating Catholicism in the Andean region. The market brings together artisans from Cusco and other regions, featuring religious figures, nativity scenes, textiles, traditional food, and beverages.

name: SANTURANTIKUY (Cusco Christmas Market)
desc: One of Latin America's oldest and most iconic Christmas fairs, derived from Quechua words meaning "sale of saints," held in Cusco's Plaza de Armas.
details: The Santurantikuy, held annually on December 24 (with preparations December 22-24), is one of Latin America's oldest and most iconic Christmas fairs in Cusco's Plaza de Armas, gathering artisans from across the region. The fair is available from early morning on December 24 (from 06:00 am), with the busiest time between 17:00-19:00. The event features skilled artisans selling religious figures in wood or ceramics, handicrafts, ornaments, manger elements such as animals and saints, food, drinks, and souvenirs. Representations of the Virgin Mary, baby Jesus, and many saints are central offerings. Entrance is completely free, intended as a cultural meeting point for all visitors during this time of year. The event preserves Andean Christmas traditions while drawing both locals and tourists.

name: Fiesta de la Cruz (Festival of the Cross)
desc: A religious celebration uniting Catholic and Andean traditions where decorated crosses from churches, houses, and hills are carried in processions with traditional dances.
details: The Fiesta de la Cruz, also known as Cruz Velacuy, celebrates at the beginning of May with May 3rd as the central date. Many neighborhoods in Cusco and surrounding districts such as San Jeronimo, San Sebastian, Santiago, and Saylla celebrate on different days, extending the festival throughout the first week. Crosses from churches, houses, and hills are decorated with flowers and carried in procession. Celebrations include masses, music, dances, and often fireworks. Members of mostly rural communities prepare large wooden crosses and decorate them with flowers and traditional fabrics, carried in processions to neighboring churches accompanied by folk music and traditional dances including the famous scissors dancers.

name: Dak'Art – 16th Biennale of Contemporary African Art
desc: Africa's longest-running grand-scale contemporary art event returns for its 16th edition, anchoring contemporary practice within African-led discourse.
details: Organized by the Ministry of Culture of Senegal, Dak'Art is the continent's premier art biennale since 1996. The democratic OFF programme transforms Dakar into a canvas for artistic intervention. Previous editions launched careers of Fabrice Monteiro and Omar Victor Diop. The 2026 edition faces challenges from digital transformation and climate concerns reshaping international travel.

name: Bai March Fair (San Yue Jie)
desc: Ancient trade fair and cultural festival at the foot of Cangshan Mountain bringing together multiple ethnic groups.
details: The March Fair (San Yue Jie) is the grandest festival of the Bai people in Dali, held at the foot of Cangshan Mountain by Erhai Lake. Originally a Buddhist festival, it evolved into western Yunnan's largest marketplace. The week-long celebration features horse racing, traditional Bai and Yi dances, folk singing, and a massive open-air market where multiple ethnic groups trade goods.

name: Dali March Fair
desc: Ancient trade fair in Dali's Bai ethnic region combining horse trading, ethnic performances, and cultural exchange.
details: The Dali Third Month Fair (Sanyue Jie) dates back to the Nanzhao Kingdom era. Originally a Buddhist gathering, it evolved into one of Yunnan's largest ethnic minority trade fairs. Bai, Yi, Hui, and Tibetan peoples converge for horse trading, traditional medicine sales, ethnic music and dance, and the famous Bai tie-dye crafts.

name: Dallas Art Fair
desc: A sophisticated, boutique fair catering to elite Texas collectors.
details: Located in the Fashion Industry Gallery, the fair draws major New York and European galleries. It is highly prized by dealers for the aggressive purchasing power and deep institutional support of the Dallas collecting community.

name: Phi Ta Khon (Ghost Festival)
desc: A surreal regional celebration where people don colorful ghost masks with long noses and parade through the streets.
details: Unlike Western Halloween, the Phi Ta Khon festival features participants wearing elaborate handmade ghost masks with elongated noses on which they paint creative designs. Set in the agricultural Dan Sai district, it combines Buddhist tradition with animist folk beliefs. The three-day celebration includes parades, music, dancing, and Buddhist sermons.

name: Shangri-La Horse Racing Festival
desc: Thrilling Tibetan horse racing festival in the stunning highlands of Yunnan with traditional horsemanship displays.
details: The Shangri-La Horse Racing Festival brings together Tibetan communities from across Diqing Prefecture for three days of exhilarating horse races showcasing centuries-old horsemanship traditions. Riders in vibrant traditional dress perform daring stunts at high speed. The fair also features singing, dancing, archery, and a bustling market in one of China's most scenic highland settings.

name: Emirates Airline Festival of Literature
desc: The 18th edition of the Middle East's largest literary festival bringing together writers, creatives, and thinkers from around the world.
details: Opening Dubai Art Season 2026, this festival features writers, creatives, and thinkers in programming including Desert Stanzas and Arabian Nights: Poetry and Law. Dubai Culture sponsors the BilEmirati and Translation strands supporting Emirati writers and cultural exchange. Held at InterContinental Dubai Festival City.

name: Dunhuang Silk Road Cultural Festival
desc: Cultural festival at the legendary Silk Road oasis celebrating the Mogao Caves and ancient trade routes.
details: The Dunhuang cultural festival celebrates this legendary Silk Road oasis city and the UNESCO-listed Mogao Grottoes with their 1,600 years of Buddhist art. Events include Silk Road cultural exhibitions, traditional music and dance performances, camel treks, and desert activities. The festival highlights the city's role as a cultural crossroads between East and West.

name: Mehregan (Autumn Harvest Festival)
desc: Ancient harvest festival with agricultural exhibitions, folk sports, and traditional food.
details: Ancient harvest festival with agricultural exhibitions, folk sports, and traditional food. Celebrates the bounty of the agricultural season with nationwide festivities.

name: Edinburgh Art Festival
desc: The UK's largest annual festival of visual art, running alongside the Fringe and International Festival.
details: Edinburgh Art Festival presents the best in contemporary and historical visual art across the city's galleries, museums, and public spaces. The festival commissions new work and curates a programme that connects local and international artists. Many exhibitions are free to attend.

name: Festival de la Cumbia
desc: 41st edition celebrating cumbia birthplace with 1,500+ artists, 193 dancing couples, and traditional folklore performances on Magdalena River banks.
details: Recognized as Cultural Heritage of the Nation, this festival honors cumbia's roots. Participation includes 193 cumbia dancing couples, 39 cumbiamba groups, 15 original songs, 35 artisans, 12 entrepreneurs, and 15 traditional cooks. Activities feature cumbia competitions, folkloric dances, artisan displays, and traditional gastronomy. El Banco's location on the Magdalena River adds scenic beauty to the celebration of Colombia's most representative dance.

name: Fortal (Fortaleza, Ceará)
desc: A major off-season carnival festival celebrating Fortaleza's 300-year anniversary with top artists, blocos, and traditional northeastern culture.
details: Fortal, held at Cidade Fortal venue on Av. Aldy Mentor, repositions carnival as a summer celebration featuring top-tier Brazilian and international artists. The 2026 edition is especially significant as it marks Fortaleza's 300-year anniversary and reaffirms Fortal's status as a cornerstone tourism product. The festival combines tradition with innovation, featuring diverse music genres, cultural performances, and street celebrations. Ticket sales begin March 3, 2026.

name: Gamagori Fireworks Festival
desc: Japan's premier competitive fireworks festival where master pyrotechnicians compete for national honors.
details: The Omagari (Daisen) National Fireworks Competition is Japan's most prestigious fireworks event, where the country's top pyrotechnicians compete. Unlike typical displays, this is judged on artistry and innovation. It features both nighttime fireworks and unique daytime displays with colored smoke. Over 18,000 fireworks are launched along the Omono River. It consistently ranks as Japan's #1 fireworks festival.

name: Gangneung Coffee Festival
desc: Unique Korean coffee culture festival in the 'Coffee City' of Gangneung.
details: Gangneung, known as Korea's 'Coffee City' for its extraordinary density of specialty coffee shops, hosts a festival celebrating Korean coffee culture. Events include barista competitions, latte art shows, coffee tastings from local roasters, and cultural performances along Anmok Beach's famous coffee street.

name: Festival de Inverno de Garanhuns
desc: 34th edition of Latin America's largest multicultural event featuring diverse artistic expressions across 20+ cultural poles with completely free programming.
details: The FIG reunites various artistic expressions on 13 of 18 days at Praça Mestre Dominguinhos with thematic nights featuring pop, forró, rock, MPB, romantic, reggae, brega, samba, pagode, rap, hip-hop, trap, and other genres. Confirmed artists include Luísa Sonza, Alcione, Paula Fernandes, Alexandre Pires, Detonautas, Capital Inicial, Cheiro de Amor, and Edson Gomes. Free programming ensures accessibility to all economic levels. The festival celebrates cultural diversity while supporting emerging artists and established performers.

name: Biennale de l'Image en Mouvement (BIM'26)
desc: A historic collaboration between Geneva's Centre d'Art Contemporain and the Kamel Lazaar Foundation, expanding to Tunis for the first time.
details: BIM'26 marks an unprecedented collaboration with Jaou Tunis. Co-directed by Lina Lazaar and Andrea Bellini, featuring 16 artists including 13 women, with strong MENA representation. Founded in 1985, BIM was among the first events devoted to artists' moving images. This edition opens in Tunis before touring Geneva, Venice, and other cities.

name: Goa Carnival
desc: A vibrant pre-Lenten celebration with parades, floats, masquerade balls, and street parties reflecting Portuguese colonial heritage.
details: Goa Carnival is India's most colorful pre-Lenten festival, featuring elaborate parades with decorated floats, masked dancers, and live music along Panaji's streets. The festival reflects Goa's unique Portuguese-influenced culture with masquerade balls, street food festivals, and the crowning of King Momo who decrees everyone to eat, drink, and be merry.

name: Carolina Renaissance Festival
desc: Multi-month outdoor Renaissance fair featuring jousting, artisan crafts, and period entertainment on 50 acres.
details: Operating since the late 1980s, this sprawling festival recreates a 16th-century village with over 150 artisans, live combat demonstrations, falconry shows, and stage performances. Visitors enjoy jousting tournaments, musical performances, traditional crafts, and period-appropriate food across 13 themed stages and acres of themed grounds.

name: Natal Luz (Christmas Light Festival - Gramado)
desc: Brazil's largest Christmas light festival transforming the mountain town into an illuminated wonderland with theatrical performances and holiday attractions.
details: Natal Luz transforms Gramado into an enchanted Christmas destination with elaborate light displays, theatrical performances, and holiday attractions spread throughout the city. The extended season runs from late October through mid-January, allowing extended celebration of Christmas traditions blended with summer season in southern Brazil. The event features musical shows, light displays, and family activities celebrating the holiday season.

name: Hakodate Port Festival
desc: Hokkaido's premier summer festival with the energetic Wasshoi Hakodate dance parade and fireworks.
details: The Hakodate Port Festival features the famous Wasshoi Hakodate dance parade where 20,000 dancers perform through the city streets over five nights. Fireworks displays over Hakodate Bay, with the famous night view from Mt. Hakodate as backdrop, create a spectacular setting.

name: Bienal de La Habana (Havana Art Biennial)
desc: One of Latin America's most important art biennials, showcasing contemporary art from around the world with priority to Latin American and Caribbean artists.
details: Founded in 1984, the Havana Biennial is organized by the Wifredo Lam Contemporary Art Center. The 15th edition (2024-2025) featured 400+ artists, curators, and historians across 80+ locations. The biennial transforms Havana's avenues and public places into artistic spaces with large-format works, performances, and community collaboration emphasizing mediation, collaboration, and interdisciplinarity.

name: Festival del Nuevo Cine Latinoamericano (Havana Film Festival)
desc: The International Festival of New Latin American Cinema promoting Latin American filmmakers and films with Latin American themes.
details: Held every December in Havana, this prestigious festival showcases contemporary Latin American cinema. The 46th edition (2025) was scheduled December 4-14 and opened with Argentine film "Belén." Typically includes sections dedicated to major regions (BRICS countries highlighted), guest countries of honor, and prestigious award ceremonies. Features documentaries, feature films, shorts, and experimental cinema.

name: Feria Internacional del Libro de La Habana (Havana International Book Fair)
desc: The 34th International Book Fair of Havana celebrating literature with Russia as the guest of honor country.
details: Scheduled for the Parque Histórico Militar Morro-Cabaña, this fair was planned to feature more than 1,200 new editorial releases, seminars, the "Tesoro de Papel" Children's Pavilion, presentation of the Biblioteca del Pueblo, and diverse artistic programming. The 2026 edition was dedicated to the centennial of Fidel Castro Ruz. However, it was postponed in February 2026 due to Cuba's fuel deficit. New date to be announced.

name: Festival del Habano (Havana Cigar Festival)
desc: The world's most famous event dedicated to premium Cuban cigars, celebrating the 60th anniversary of Cohiba.
details: Around 1,200 people typically enjoy this luxury event, which features the most outstanding cigar launches of the year. In 2026, it was scheduled to celebrate Cohiba's 60th anniversary. However, the festival was postponed in February 2026 due to Cuba's energy crisis and fuel shortage. Organizers stated they are "working on setting a new date, which will be announced in a timely manner."

name: Naadam Festival
desc: Mongolian cultural showcase of the 'Three Manly Sports'—wrestling, horse racing, and archery on the grasslands.
details: The Inner Mongolia Naadam Festival celebrates traditional Mongolian culture with competitions in wrestling, horse racing, and archery. Held on the vast grasslands, the festival also features Mongolian chess, lassoing, tug of war, and performances of traditional music and dance. It's the best way to experience authentic nomadic culture within China. Major venues include Hohhot and Hulunbuir.

name: Hong Kong Chinese New Year Night Parade
desc: Spectacular night parade through Tsim Sha Tsui with elaborate floats and international performers.
details: Hong Kong's Chinese New Year Night Parade features elaborate floats, international performers, marching bands, and dragon and lion dances along the neon-lit streets of Tsim Sha Tsui. The event draws performers from around the world and is broadcast live. Combined with the Victoria Harbour fireworks, it creates one of Asia's most spectacular New Year celebrations.

name: Hong Kong Chinese New Year Celebrations
desc: Spectacular New Year festivities including the famous night parade, Victoria Harbour fireworks, and horse races.
details: Hong Kong celebrates Chinese New Year with world-famous events: the International Chinese New Year Night Parade in Tsim Sha Tsui features elaborate floats and international performers; the Victoria Harbour fireworks display is one of the world's most spectacular; and the CNY horse races at Sha Tin are a beloved tradition. Flower markets across the city sell lucky plants and decorations.

name: Hungry Ghost Festival (Yu Lan)
desc: Hong Kong's version of Ghost Month with Cantonese opera, burning offerings, and elaborate community rituals.
details: The Yu Lan Festival in Hong Kong is a UNESCO-listed Intangible Cultural Heritage. Communities across the territory set up temporary bamboo theaters for Cantonese opera performances, burn elaborate paper offerings (including paper mansions and luxury goods), and prepare communal feasts for wandering spirits. The Chiu Chow community's celebrations are particularly elaborate.

name: Saisiyat Pas'ta'ai (Ritual of the Short People)
desc: Mysterious biennial ritual of the Saisiyat people honoring a legendary lost tribe—held only in even years like 2026.
details: The Pas'ta'ai is the most important ceremony of the Saisiyat indigenous people, held once every two years. It honors the ta'ai—a legendary tribe of short people who taught the Saisiyat agriculture but were killed after angering them. The all-night ritual features haunting traditional songs, dancing, and millet wine drinking. It alternates between locations in Hsinchu and Miaoli counties. 2026 is a celebration year.

name: Onam
desc: Kerala's spectacular harvest festival featuring snake boat races, intricate floral carpets, and a 26-dish traditional feast.
details: Onam celebrates Kerala's culture and heritage with Athachamayam processions featuring extravagant floats and elephants, Vallam Kali snake boat races on rivers and backwaters, traditional Kathakali dance performances, and Pookalam (intricate floral carpets). The highlight is the Onam Sadya — a legendary 26-dish vegetarian feast served on banana leaves.

name: Festival de Jesús María - Doma y Folklore
desc: Prestigious festival combining traditional gaucho horse riding competitions with folklore music performances.
details: Held at the José Hernández Amphitheater, this 60th edition features National and International Horse Riding Championships, traditional gaucho skills, established Argentine artists' performances, and dance shows. The festival is broadcast live online and televised on Channel 10 (Córdoba) and Argentina's Public Television, making it one of the most important folklore and horse-riding events in Latin America.

name: Feria de Jocotenango
desc: 400+ year-old fair honoring the town's patron saint San Bartolo with colorful parades, traditional foods, artisan crafts, mechanical games, and live marimba music.
details: Officially established in 1928 by President Lázaro Chacón via decree, the Feria de Jocotenango has been celebrated for over 400 years in honor of the Virgen de la Asunción. The vibrant fair features food stalls with traditional Guatemalan cuisine, artisan crafts, dancing, and marimba performances. Modern additions include mechanical games, raffles, and tours through the Mapa en Relieve relief map. The streets come alive with the sounds of traditional music and the aromas of typical foods. This accessible event is located in Jocotenango, near Guatemala City, making it easily reachable for travelers.

name: Festival de Dança de Joinville
desc: World's largest festival by number of participants (4,500+ dancers per Guinness Book) featuring diverse dance genres from classical ballet to hip-hop.
details: The 43rd edition features the Mostra Competitiva (July 21-25, July 27-Aug 1) at Centreventos Cau Hansen with categories including Classical Ballet, Neoclassical Ballet, Contemporary Dance, Brazilian Popular Dances, International Popular Dances, Urban Dances, Jazz, and Tap. Palcos Abertos (Open Stages) run July 20-Aug 1 for non-competitive performances. Festival Meia Ponta runs July 28-Aug 1. A new Festival de Teatro Musical (Musical Theater Festival) debuts in 2026. Registration deadline is March 24, with first choreography submission March 31 and second deadline April 1-6.

name: Kagoshima Ohara Matsuri
desc: Kyushu's biggest dance festival with 20,000 dancers performing the Ohara Bushi folk dance.
details: The Kagoshima Ohara Matsuri is southern Kyushu's largest festival, with approximately 20,000 dancers performing the Ohara Bushi folk dance through the streets against the backdrop of smoking Sakurajima volcano. The volcanic setting and energetic dancing make it unique among Japanese city festivals.

name: Hokkaido Lavender Festival (Furano)
desc: Rolling hills of purple lavender in Hokkaido's heartland—Japan's most beautiful summer flower landscape.
details: Furano and Kamifurano's lavender fields are Japan's most iconic summer landscape. Farm Tomita and others create a mosaic of lavender, poppies, and sunflowers across rolling hills. The peak lavender bloom in mid-July attracts photographers and travelers from around the world. Lavender-flavored soft serve ice cream is a must.

name: Kampala City Festival
desc: Uganda's largest street festival celebrating Kampala's diverse cultures with parades and performances.
details: The Kampala City Festival is Uganda's biggest street celebration, featuring colorful parades, traditional dance performances, live music, food stalls, and carnival rides through the capital's streets. It celebrates Kampala's status as a melting pot of Uganda's diverse cultures.

name: Durga Puja
desc: Kolkata's grandest festival honoring Goddess Durga with thousands of artistic pandals, cultural performances, and community feasting.
details: UNESCO-recognized as an Intangible Cultural Heritage, Durga Puja transforms Kolkata into an open-air art gallery. Thousands of pandals feature stunning artistic installations ranging from replicas of world monuments to cutting-edge contemporary art. Street food, cultural performances, and late-night pandal-hopping create an electrifying atmosphere over five days.

name: Akwasidae Festival
desc: Ashanti royal ceremony honoring ancestors and the sacred Golden Stool at Manhyia Palace.
details: Held every six weeks at Manhyia Palace in Kumasi, the Akwasidae features the Asantehene (Ashanti King) presiding over lavish ceremonies. Chiefs dressed in magnificent kente cloth and gold jewelry pay homage to ancestors and the sacred Golden Stool. Drumming, dancing, and ritual offerings create an unforgettable spectacle.

name: Kataklysmos (Festival of the Flood)
desc: Unique Cypriot water festival with roots in ancient Greek and Christian traditions celebrated at seaside towns.
details: Combines ancient pagan, Greek, and Christian traditions. Features water-splashing games, boat races, cultural performances, and food stalls along the seaside promenade. Especially vibrant in Larnaca.

name: Lijiang Ancient Town Naxi New Year
desc: UNESCO World Heritage Naxi Old Town celebrations blending Naxi and Han Chinese New Year traditions.
details: Lijiang's Ancient Town comes alive during Chinese New Year with a unique blend of Naxi ethnic and Han Chinese celebrations. Traditional Dongba ceremonies, bonfire dances, and the ancient Naxi orchestra perform alongside Chinese lion dances and fireworks in the atmospheric cobblestone streets.

name: London Art Fair
desc: The UK's premier destination for Modern British and contemporary art.
details: A more accessible, domestically focused alternative to Frieze, it champions mid-market galleries and provides an excellent overview of the British artistic landscape from the 20th century to the present.

name: Luoyang Peony Festival
desc: Spectacular celebration of China's 'king of flowers' with over 1,080 peony varieties in bloom.
details: The Luoyang Peony Festival celebrates 1,500 years of peony cultivation dating to the Tang Dynasty. Over 1,080 varieties bloom across venues like the National Peony Garden and International Peony Garden. The 2025 edition drew 10.16 million visitors. Cultural performances include traditional Chinese music, folk dances, Hanfu demonstrations, calligraphy, and painting workshops alongside the stunning floral displays.

name: Maebashi Biennale
desc: Inaugural contemporary art biennale promoting art, architecture, and poetry in a revitalized city.
details: The inaugural Maebashi Biennale will showcase contemporary art, architecture, and poetry across multiple venues in Maebashi city. This new addition to Japan's growing art festival circuit aims to revitalize the city through cultural programming. The timing overlaps with the Asian Games, creating a cultural corridor in the greater Kanto region.

name: Chumash Intertribal Powwow
desc: Native American gathering at the Chumash land near Malibu with traditional dance and cultural sharing.
details: The Chumash Intertribal Powwow brings together Native communities for traditional dance competitions, drumming, indigenous art vendors, and cultural demonstrations in the beautiful coastal setting near Malibu, on ancestral Chumash territory.

name: Carnaboi
desc: Boi-bumbá pre-carnival celebration at Sambódromo marking opening of cattle breeding season and kickoff to Festival de Parintins preparations.
details: The 25th edition draws over 20,000 participants celebrating Amazonian cultural identity with 40+ musical and cultural attractions. Free admission with completely free programming. Celebrates bumbás Caprichoso and Garantido with blue and red colors dominating streets. Features handicraft fair, gastronomic space, and Instagram-worthy attractions. Symbolic delivery of city key by carnival court to bumbás marks official conclusion of Carnival in the Forest and opening of Parintins festival season.

name: Festival Amazonas de Ópera
desc: 26th edition of Latin America's largest opera festival at Teatro Amazonas featuring three operas, three concerts, and two recitals with international cooperation.
details: The opening April 15 at 7 PM features "La Vorágine," a contemporary opera based on Colombian historical novel set during the rubber cycle. The festival marks beginning of international cooperation creating "Corredor Criativo da Amazônia" (Creative Corridor of the Amazon) involving cultural institutions from Brazil, Colombia, Portugal, and Austria. Programming includes inclusive initiatives such as ASD-adapted performances and public school programming. Performances occur at Teatro Amazonas and Centro Cultural Palácio da Justiça. Tickets (R$100-200) go on sale January 15, 2026.

name: Feria de la Chinita (Virgen de Chiquinquirá)
desc: Massive celebrations honoring La Chinita with music and processions.

name: Matsu Island Pilgrimage
desc: Religious pilgrimages to temples on the remote Matsu Islands—namesake of the sea goddess.
details: The Matsu Islands, named after the sea goddess Mazu, host pilgrimages to their numerous temples, particularly during the goddess's birthday celebrations. The remote, fog-shrouded islands off the coast of mainland China offer a unique cultural experience combining military history, Minnan architecture, and deep religious devotion.

name: Edc Mexico (electric Daisy Carnival)
desc: Mexico City's largest electronic dance music festival featuring world-class DJs, art installations, and spectacular light shows.
details: Held at Autódromo Hermanos Rodríguez with over 100 world-class artists and DJs performing across stages: kineticFIELD, wasteLAND, neonGARDEN, and Bionic Jungle. Festival features house, techno, dance, and trance music. The 2026 edition attracted over 110,000 attendees on opening day. Parking available at Gate 15 and preferred parking at Estadio Harp Helú. Notable closers include DJ Hardwell and Alesso.

name: Untitled Art Miami Beach
desc: A highly curated, architecturally designed fair set in a tent directly on the beach.
details: Favored by curators and critical collectors, Untitled is renowned for its excellent use of natural light, wide aisles, and a strict curatorial process that ensures a high-quality, thought-provoking presentation.

name: São Vicente Carnival
desc: Africa's most vibrant carnival in Mindelo, nicknamed 'Little Brazil', with samba-influenced parades.
details: São Vicente Carnival transforms Mindelo's streets into a spectacle of movement and sound. Drawing from Brazilian samba, Portuguese festivities, and Cape Verdean heritage with morna, funana, and batuque rhythms. The unique Mandinga tradition features men painted in oil and tar in warrior costumes.

name: Reggae Sumfest
desc: The largest music festival in Jamaica and the Caribbean, known as "the greatest reggae show on earth."
details: Sumfest brings together international stars, Jamaican legends, and rising talents for a week of pure energy. The festival includes Sumfest Beach Party, free Street Dance, All White Party, and two nights of the Main Festival with live performances featuring Dancehall and Reggae Artists. Held annually in mid-July in Montego Bay, it's a premier Caribbean musical event showcasing reggae and dancehall music from Jamaica and the world.

name: Monteriggioni Medieval Festival
desc: A perfectly preserved medieval walled town in Tuscany comes alive with knights, dancers, fireworks, and period entertainment for an immersive time-travel experience.
details: The tiny, perfectly preserved medieval fortress-town of Monteriggioni (mentioned by Dante) hosts an atmospheric medieval festival with costumed parades, jousting demonstrations, period music, dance performances, artisan markets, and fireworks. The intimate scale — the walled town is tiny — makes the immersion in medieval atmosphere incredibly convincing.

name: The India Art Fair
desc: The definitive platform for discovering modern and contemporary art from South Asia.
details: This fair is crucial for understanding the rapidly expanding Indian art market. It showcases established masters alongside emerging talent, heavily reflecting India's complex socio-political dynamics and immense economic growth.

name: Artexpo New York
desc: The world's largest fine art trade show, aimed heavily at interior designers and publishers.
details: Unlike the highly curated critical fairs, Artexpo is a massive volume-driven event. It is essential for the commercial decor industry, poster publishing, and independent artists seeking massive wholesale distribution.

name: Festa dei Gigli
desc: UNESCO-listed festival featuring towering wooden structures carried through streets with music honoring St. Paulinus.
details: Eight teams of 128 men carry massive decorated wooden obelisks (gigli) weighing 2.5 tonnes through the streets of Nola in honour of San Paolino. UNESCO Intangible Heritage since 2013.

name: Festival del Huaso de Olmué
desc: Four-day folklore festival celebrating Chilean huaso culture with music, horse riding, and traditional contests.
details: Held at Anfiteatro El Patagual. Featured artists included Myriam Hernández and Nicole (Jan 15), Luck Ra and Alanys Lagos (Jan 16), Américo, Gepe, León Murillo (Jan 17), Ráfaga, Entremares, Felipe Parra (Jan 18). Central folkloric competition features authors and performers competing for Guitarpín de Oro. Transmitted by TVN and TV Chile at 21:30 hours, marking first televised festival of the season.

name: World Carnival Oslo (Verdenskarneval)
desc: Oslo's celebration of global folk culture featuring a spectacular World Folk Parade, outdoor dance performances, concerts, and workshops exploring community through dance and music.
details: World Carnival highlights Norway's and the world's rich folk culture and dance traditions in the heart of Oslo. The 2026 theme is 'Community,' explored through dance, music, and folk culture.
