Features include the World Folk Parade on June 6, indoor and outdoor dance performances, concerts, workshops, and panel discussions.

name: Bluesfest International Ottawa
desc: Major 10-day music festival featuring blues, rock, pop and electronic headliners.
details: Ottawa Bluesfest has grown into one of Canada's largest music festivals, presenting major international headliners across six stages at LeBreton Flats.

name: Oulu 2026 European Capital of Culture
desc: Year-long European Capital of Culture programme in Arctic Finland.
details: **European Capital of Culture: Oulu** Oulu, Finland Opens Jan 16–18 Focuses on "Cultural Climate Change" and the preservation of Indigenous Sámi culture through extensive regional art programming.

name: Papantla Voladores (Danza de los Voladores) 2026
desc: UNESCO-recognized ritual ceremony with five men performing aerial acrobatics from 18-40m pole
details: Fertility dance/ritual expressing respect for natural and spiritual worlds. Caporal stands on platform playing flute/drum, invokes sun, four winds, cardinal directions. Other four men fling themselves off platform, twirl on ropes as pole spins, gradually lower to ground. Now popular tourist attraction in Puerto Vallarta, Playa del Carmen, Mexico City's Chapultepec Park. Annual Encuentro de Voladores at El Tajín, Veracruz, historic Papantla center, Cuetzalán, Puebla.

name: Philadelphia Mummers Parade
desc: Unique New Year's Day tradition of elaborately costumed comic, string band, and fancy brigades marching through South Philly.
details: The Mummers Parade is a Philadelphia tradition unlike anything else in America. Comic divisions, string bands, and fancy brigades in spectacular sequined costumes perform choreographed routines and play banjos while strutting up Broad Street. The tradition has roots in European folk customs brought by Irish and Italian immigrants.

name: Hung Kings Temple Festival
desc: Vietnam's most sacred national ceremony celebrating ancestral pride with temple processions and formal ceremonies.
details: The Hung Kings Temple Festival honors the legendary founders of Vietnam at their temple complex in Phu Tho province. It's one of the most important national celebrations, featuring formal government ceremonies, traditional rituals, temple processions, and cultural performances. The site draws enormous crowds of Vietnamese paying homage to their ancestors.

name: Festa Pomerana
desc: 41st edition celebrating German immigration with theme "Nossa Pequena Alemanha" (Our Little Germany) featuring traditional music, dance, food, and Pomeranian culture.
details: The festival at Municipal Events Pavilion attracts tens of thousands for rescue of settler traditions, competitions, pageants of Pomerode royalty, folk dance presentations, and handicraft sales. 2026 menu features only Catarinese breweries (Maestro, Karsten, Königs Bier) alongside microbrewery association offerings. New 2026 features include 27 evaporative air coolers for thermal comfort and security upgrades (facial recognition, drone monitoring, dogs). The festival celebrates cultural preservation and contemporary comfort in equal measure.

name: Carnaval de Ponce
desc: Puerto Rico's oldest and largest carnival featuring iconic vejigante masked characters.
details: Ponce Carnival dates to 1858 and features the iconic vejigantes in papier-mache horned masks and colorful bat-winged costumes chasing children through the streets. The carnival includes floats, music, dance, and the unique traditions that make Puerto Rican carnival distinct from other Caribbean celebrations.

name: Carnaval de Puerto Vallarta 2026
desc: Diverse, inclusive Caribbean-style carnival celebrating LGBTQ+ pride with colorful floats and seven stages
details: Parade starts 5:00 p.m. in front of Sheraton Hotel Zone, travels south along Malecón. Features seven different stages along route, live music, DJs, drag queens. Draws 30,000 spectators.

name: Belize Chocolate Festival
desc: Festival honoring the sacred relationship between Maya culture and cacao, celebrating Belize's chocolate heritage.
details: Takes place in Toledo District, honoring Maya cultural heritage and the island's cacao production. Celebrates the sacred relationship between Maya people and chocolate through cultural presentations, food tastings, and educational activities.

name: Festival d'ete de Quebec - free outdoor shows
desc: The free outdoor component of FEQ on the Plains of Abraham features massive headliner concerts.
details: The Plains of Abraham outdoor stage at FEQ hosts massive free concerts with major headliners, creating one of the largest free outdoor concert experiences in the world with the historic fortified city as a backdrop.

name: Frevo Dancing (Recife Carnival)
desc: Traditional Pernambucano dance and music style featuring dancers with colorful umbrellas moving to syncopated rhythms during carnival celebrations.
details: Frevo is a distinctive Pernambuco carnival tradition featuring energetic dancers with colorful umbrellas (sombrinhas) performing acrobatic movements to syncopated music. The last day of Recife Carnival 2026 highlighted frevo with performances by Geraldo Azevedo, Elba Ramalho, and Alceu Valença, ending with the Orquestrão closing the celebration. Frevo represents regional cultural identity and musical traditions unique to Pernambuco.

name: Afropunk Brasil
desc: World's largest festival of Black culture relocating to Rio de Janeiro after five editions in Salvador with two-day epic celebration of Black music, arts, and culture.
details: After successful run in Salvador (40% of attendees from outside Bahia, with visitors from 28 countries), AFROPUNK Brasil moves to Rio de Janeiro in 2026. The festival celebrates Black culture through music, visual arts, fashion, and lifestyle. Previous Salvador editions demonstrated significant tourism impact and cultural influence globally. As the world's largest celebration of Black culture, the festival provides crucial platform for Black artists, creatives, and entrepreneurs.

name: Altai Eagle Festival
desc: More intimate alternative to the October eagle festival in the scenic Sagsai Valley.
details: The Altai Eagle Festival in Sagsai village offers a more intimate experience than the larger Olgii festival. Set in a scenic valley, it features the same eagle hunting competitions but with fewer tourists and more genuine cultural exchange. Local Kazakh families often host visitors in their gers (yurts), providing an authentic cultural immersion experience.

name: Salalah Tourism Festival (Khareef)
desc: A unique monsoon season festival when Salalah transforms into a lush green paradise, the only place in Arabia to experience the khareef.
details: During the khareef (monsoon) season, Salalah transforms from arid desert into a lush, green paradise—the only place on the Arabian Peninsula to experience this phenomenon. The tourism festival features cultural performances, traditional markets, family entertainment, and nature activities amid the misty, verdant landscape. It draws hundreds of thousands of Gulf visitors escaping the summer heat.

name: Salvador Carnival
desc: Known for massive street parties with trios elétricos (decorated sound trucks), blocos de corda, and blocos afro celebrating Afro-Brazilian culture.
details: Salvador's carnival emphasizes participatory street celebrations rather than formal parades. The main circuits include Osmar, Dodô (Barra-Ondina), and Batatinha (Pelourinho), featuring prominent artists like Ivete Sangalo, Daniela Mercury, and Carlinhos Brown. The event attracts over 2 million participants celebrating with energetic music, dancing, and local culture.

name: Día de los Boyeros (Oxcart Drivers' Day) - Escazú
desc: UNESCO-recognized celebration honoring Costa Rica's oxcart drivers and the national symbol of labor, featuring colorful oxcart parades and traditional folk festivities.
details: Día Nacional del Boyero takes place on the second Sunday of March in San Antonio de Escazú. In 2026, this falls on March 8th. The celebration honors Costa Rica's oxcart drivers and the traditional oxcart, both declared by UNESCO in 2005 as Intangible Heritage of Humanity. The "Boyeo y la Carreta" (Oxcart and Driver) have been national symbols of labor in Costa Rica for generations. The main day features a grand parade of oxcarts beginning in downtown Escazú and continuing to the San Antonio district. Throughout the two-day festivities, different activities include fireworks, masquerades, music, and traditional Costa Rican folk dances, plus tastings of typical gastronomy. The event celebrates rural heritage and community traditions in a family-friendly atmosphere.

name: Diablos Danzantes de Yare
desc: UNESCO-declared Intangible Cultural Heritage featuring ritual devil dances celebrating the triumph of good over evil.
details: Preparation for Corpus Christi begins immediately after the previous celebration, with fraternity members creating intricate devil masks and maintaining traditions year-round. The celebration involves devil dancers worshipping the Holy Sacrament, performing ritualistic dances through town streets before different altars, and concluding at the church. This centuries-old tradition (275+ years) celebrates the struggle between devils and Jesus in the Eucharist.

name: Santa Fe Opera
desc: World-renowned open-air opera house presenting five productions against stunning desert sunsets.
details: The Santa Fe Opera is one of the most acclaimed opera companies in the world, performing in a stunning open-air theater that frames the Sangre de Cristo Mountains and spectacular sunset skies. Five productions per season feature world-class singers, innovative stagings, and annual world premiere commissions.

name: Festival de la Chacarera
desc: Historic celebration of the chacarera, a traditional Argentine folk dance, featuring regional artists.
details: Founded in 1971 by Agustín and Carlos Carabajal. Features Abel Pintos (30-year career celebration), Dúo Coplanacu, Cuti and Roberto Carabajal, and emerging regional artists. Held at Plaza Añoranzas along the Río Dulce. Tickets $25,000. Organized by cultural heritage and folklore preservation.

name: São Paulo Carnival (Sambadrome)
desc: Features 32 competing samba schools parading at the Anhembi Sambadrome with elaborate presentations combining music, dance, and cultural themes.
details: São Paulo's carnival showcases samba schools from different competition groups competing with spectacular floats, costumes, and choreographed performances. Mocidade Alegre won the 2026 championship, bringing their total to 13 titles. The celebration also includes numerous blocos de rua (street parties) throughout the city, extending carnival festivities beyond the formal parades.

name: 36th Bienal de São Paulo
desc: The world's second-oldest art biennial, curated by Bonaventure Ndikung, reimagines humanity as an active, collective practice.
details: The 36th Bienal de São Paulo, titled 'Not All Travellers Walk Roads – Of Humanity as Practice,' features 120+ artists at the Ciccillo Matarazzo pavilion in Parque do Ibirapuera. Curated by Bonaventure Soh Bejeng Ndikung, it explores humanity through global perspectives. Founded in 1951, it is the second-oldest biennial after Venice.

name: Saratoga Performing Arts Center (SPAC) Summer Season
desc: Summer home of the NYC Ballet and Philadelphia Orchestra in beautiful Saratoga Spa State Park.
details: SPAC hosts the New York City Ballet, Philadelphia Orchestra, and Chamber Music Society of Lincoln Center alongside major rock, pop, and country concerts in its outdoor amphitheater. Set in Saratoga Spa State Park, the venue combines world-class performing arts with natural beauty.

name: St. Patrick's Day
desc: The second-largest St. Patrick's Day celebration in the US, famous for dyeing the city's fountains green.
details: Savannah's St. Patrick's Day celebration is the second-largest in the US, with a massive parade through the historic squares, green-dyed fountains, and a festival atmosphere that takes over the entire city. Savannah's Irish heritage and charm make this an especially atmospheric celebration.

name: Seattle Art Fair
desc: A boutique fair bridging the Pacific Northwest with the global art market.
details: Founded by the late Paul Allen, the fair capitalizes on the immense tech wealth of Seattle. It features strong programming focused on Native American contemporary art and massive public installations.

name: Selcuk Camel Wrestling Festival
desc: Elaborately decorated camels compete in wrestling matches near the ancient Roman theatre of Ephesus.
details: Held since 1982 with approximately 120 camel contestants. Dates back 2,400 years to Turkic tribes. Includes camel beauty pageant, local food, and main wrestling. Growing tourist numbers.

name: Seoul Jazz Festival
desc: Korea's premier jazz festival featuring international headliners and Korean jazz artists.
details: The Seoul Jazz Festival at Olympic Park brings world-class jazz, soul, R&B, and fusion artists to Korea. Past headliners have included Norah Jones, Jamie Cullum, and Herbie Hancock. The outdoor setting in the expansive Olympic Park grounds creates a relaxed concert atmosphere.

name: Shanghai Bund Light Show
desc: Spectacular light shows on the iconic Bund waterfront contrasting colonial and futuristic architecture.
details: The Shanghai Bund Light Show illuminates both the historic colonial buildings on the west bank and the futuristic Pudong skyline across the Huangpu River. Special holiday shows during National Day and Chinese New Year feature synchronized light and music displays across dozens of skyscrapers. The visual contrast of old and new Shanghai is unmatched.

name: Sydney Gay and Lesbian Mardi Gras
desc: Iconic LGBTQI+ celebration culminating in a spectacular parade and party along Oxford Street.
details: The Sydney Gay and Lesbian Mardi Gras is one of the world's great pride celebrations. The festival spans three weeks of events culminating in the famous Parade along Oxford Street, featuring spectacular floats, costumes, and community groups, followed by a massive after-party.

name: Taipei 101 New Year Fireworks
desc: Iconic midnight fireworks launched from the Taipei 101 skyscraper welcoming the new year.
details: The Taipei 101 New Year fireworks are one of the world's most watched celebrations, broadcast globally. Fireworks launch directly from the 508-meter supertall skyscraper, creating a spectacular vertical display visible across the city. Hundreds of thousands gather at nearby Elephant Mountain and Xinyi district for the countdown.

name: Taipei Lunar New Year Events
desc: Taipei's Chinese New Year celebrations including temple visits, flower markets, and the iconic Dihua Street market.
details: Taipei comes alive during Chinese New Year with visits to Longshan Temple and Xingtian Temple, the famous Dihua Street market selling traditional New Year goods, and flower markets. The Taipei 101 New Year fireworks (from Dec 31) kick off the festive season. Traditional performances, lion dances, and temple fairs continue through the Lantern Festival.

name: AfrikaBurn
desc: Africa's regional Burning Man event featuring art installations, mutant vehicles, and a gifting economy in the Karoo desert.
details: AfrikaBurn is South Africa's official Burning Man regional event held at Quaggafontein in the remote Tankwa Karoo. The 2026 theme is PRISM. Participants build a temporary creative community with ephemeral artworks, some burned at the end. No money changes hands. The harsh desert environment with extreme temperature swings makes this a true adventure.

name: Semana Santa processions
desc: Famous penitential processions through Taxco’s steep streets during Holy Week.

name: Feria del Caballo Texcoco (horse Fair)
desc: Largest horse fair in central Mexico with 43+ years tradition, featuring equestrian events, concerts, and cultural activities.
details: Venue: Rancho El Consuelo, Texcoco (over 1 hour from Mexico City). 2026: 500,000+ visitors expected. Features: Palenque (main stage) with international/national artists including Alejandro Fernández, Gloria Trevi, Christian Nodal, Banda MS (tickets 500–22,000 pesos through BoletiWorld, sales began January 30); 30 free concerts; folklore dances; charreadas; escaramuza shows; gastronomic showcase with traditional restaurants. General fairground admission: 60 pesos.

name: Thimphu Tshechu
desc: Major Bhutanese tsechu with cham dances, blessings, and colorful attire in the capital.

name: Tottori Shanshan Festival
desc: Colorful umbrella dance festival with 4,000 dancers performing with painted Japanese umbrellas.
details: The Tottori Shanshan Festival features 4,000 dancers performing the Kasa Odori (umbrella dance) with colorful traditional Japanese wagasa umbrellas. The synchronized movement of thousands of brightly painted umbrellas through the streets creates a uniquely photogenic summer scene.

name: Festival de la Marinera (Marinera Dance Festival)
desc: Peru's official national marinera dance competition, featuring the traditional courting dance named after the Peruvian navy, with international participation and horse exhibitions.
details: The Festival Trujillo es Marinera 2026 is scheduled for February 14-15, with events at the Chan Chan coliseum including gastronomic fair, presentations by dance groups, orchestras, musical groups, and renowned soloists. In 1986, Peru officially declared Trujillo the "National Capital of Marinera" through Law Nº 24447. The festival is built around marinera dance contests but often includes parades and Peruvian Paso horse presentations, making it a complete coastal-culture experience. The festival draws thousands of tourists from around the world, with dance partners from different parts of the country and foreign guests coming to compete in various categories.

name: Tsinandali Festival
desc: Prestigious classical music festival at historic Chavchavadze estate with Pan-Caucasian Youth Orchestra.
details: Features symphonic orchestras, chamber ensembles, and opera soloists. Pan-Caucasian Youth Orchestra unites young musicians from across Europe and Caucasus. Purpose-built music hall (900 capacity). Combines classical music, historic architecture, and wine culture.

name: Tsuruoka Shonai Festival
desc: Colorful festival in Shonai region featuring the dramatic 'black lion dance.'
details: Tsuruoka's Shonai Festival features the unique 'black lion dance' (kuro-jishi) where a massive lion head puppet is carried through the streets along with colorful floats and traditional music.

name: Venice International Film Festival
desc: The oldest film festival in the world, serving as the premier autumn launchpad for Oscar contenders.
details: Organized by La Biennale di Venezia, the festival brings intense Hollywood glamour to the Lido. It seamlessly blends high-art auteur cinema with major studio premieres, acting as a crucial validator of cinematic prestige and artistic excellence.

name: Crankworx Whistler
desc: The ultimate mountain bike festival featuring the world's top freeride and downhill athletes.
details: Crankworx is the premier freeride mountain bike festival in the world, with jaw-dropping slopestyle, downhill, and enduro competitions on Whistler's legendary trails. Live music, film screenings, and outdoor exhibitions complement the cycling action.

name: Hong Village & Xidi Autumn Festival
desc: Autumn foliage and harvest celebrations at the UNESCO-listed ancient Hui-style villages.
details: The UNESCO World Heritage villages of Hongcun and Xidi in southern Anhui are at their most beautiful in autumn, when ancient white-washed buildings with grey tile roofs are framed by golden ginkgo and red maple trees. Harvest celebrations, Hui opera performances, and traditional craft demonstrations take place among the preserved Ming/Qing architecture.

name: Festival de la Lluvia de Peces (Rain of Fish Festival)
desc: Unique festival built around the phenomenon of fish appearing on ground after intense storms, featuring carnival activities, parade, and women's beauty competition.
details: The Lluvia de Peces Festival takes place in June in the town of Yoro in northern Honduras, built around the local tradition of lluvia de peces ("rain of fish"). The festival is held after the first heavy rains of the season and draws visitors from across the region. Festival activities combine religious observances with public celebrations, including processions, prayers, church services alongside food fairs, music, and community events. Additionally, activities include carnival rides, a parade, and a competition amongst women for the title of Señorita Lluvia de Peces (Miss Fish Rain). The date of the festival is variable, coinciding with the first major rainfall in May or June, so the exact 2026 date depends on when the first significant rains occur. The phenomenon of small freshwater fish appearing on ground after intense storms has been documented locally. Beginning in 1998, residents of Yoro have held an annual Festival de Lluvia de Peces to celebrate this phenomenon.

name: Torch Festival (Yi/Bai Ethnic)
desc: Spectacular fire festival of southwest China's ethnic minorities with massive bonfires, torch parades, and dancing.
details: The Torch Festival is the most important celebration for the Yi, Bai, and other ethnic minorities in southwest China. For three days, communities light enormous bonfires and carry blazing torches through villages and fields to repel insects and pray for good harvests. Young men and women sing and dance around the fires. Shilin (Stone Forest) near Kunming and Liangshan in Sichuan host the largest celebrations.

name: Maracatu (Recife/Olinda Carnival)
desc: Afro-Brazilian dance procession originating from enslaved peoples' traditions, featuring elaborate costumes, African percussion, and symbolic dance movements.
details: Maracatu originated in the 17th-18th centuries when plantation owners allowed enslaved people to elect and celebrate kings and queens during holidays. After abolition in 1888, this tradition was incorporated into Carnival celebrations. Maracatu groups like Sol Brilhante do Recife and Nação Raízes de Pai Adão preserve this heritage through musical performances and storytelling. The tradition combines African spiritual elements, cultural resistance, and community social support, making it a vital symbol of Afro-Brazilian culture and identity.

name: Fiesta de San Pedro - Fishing Communities
desc: Traditional celebration of patron saint of fishermen with maritime processions and seafood celebrations.
details: Celebrated June 29 at different ports and fishing coves throughout Chile. Includes maritime processions, prayers for sea protection, and seafood tastings. Recent 2026 activities: "Gran Fiesta de la Macha" at Caleta San Pedro with food vendors, crafts, live music attracting hundreds. Organizations may apply for festival financing February-March 2026. Deepens maritime and fishing heritage traditions.

name: Hanukkah Festival of Lights
desc: Eight-day Jewish festival of lights celebrated with menorah lightings and cultural events across Israel.
details: Public menorah lightings, special events at the Western Wall, cultural performances, sufganiyot (donuts), and family celebrations nationwide.

name: Shavuot / Feast of Weeks
desc: Jewish holiday celebrating the giving of the Torah and the harvest, with all-night study sessions.
details: Features all-night Torah study (Tikkun Leil), dairy food traditions, agricultural celebrations, and pilgrimages. Kibbutzim hold special harvest ceremonies.

name: Día de la Independencia (independence Day Celebrations)
desc: Mexico's national holiday celebrating independence from Spain with parades, fireworks, traditional foods, and flag displays nationwide.
details: National celebration begins evening of September 15 when Mexican President rings Hidalgo's Bell (kept at National Palace) at 11:00 PM, repeating Hidalgo's historic words. September 16: military parade in Mexico City. Zócalo (world's largest city square) hosts 500,000+ attendees. Celebrations include bullfights, rodeos, parades, traditional Mexican dances. Streets filled with music, festivities, traditional foods: pozole, tacos, tamales. People dress in national colors—green, white, red. Celebrated throughout Mexico with regional variations and local traditions.

name: Ghost Month Festival (Zhongyuan)
desc: Taiwan's elaborate Ghost Month celebrations with temple rituals, floating lantern ceremonies, and spirit appeasement.
details: Ghost Month is one of Taiwan's most culturally significant periods when the gates of the underworld are believed to open. The Keelung Ghost Festival features elaborate float parades and a stunning water lantern ceremony. Temples across the island perform pudu rituals offering food to wandering spirits. Hsinchu and Toucheng also host major celebrations. The 15th day (Zhongyuan) is the main festival.

name: UAE National Day Celebrations
desc: A nationwide celebration of the UAE's founding with fireworks, concerts, cultural shows, and patriotic displays across all seven emirates.
details: Celebrated on December 2nd, UAE National Day marks the formation of the seven Emirates in 1971. Every emirate hosts firework displays, concerts, theater shows, and heritage programmes. It's a day of national pride with large-scale community events, patriotic displays, and cultural celebrations throughout the country.

name: Chale Wote Street Art Festival
desc: West Africa's biggest street art festival transforming Jamestown with murals, live performances, and installations.
details: Chale Wote has become one of West Africa's biggest and most popular events with over 100,000 attendees and 200+ Ghanaian and international artists. It transforms the historic Jamestown neighborhood in Accra into a hub of street art, live performances, interactive installations, and creative workshops.

name: 2026 Adelaide Biennial of Australian Art: Yield Strength
desc: The 19th Adelaide Biennial curated by Ellie Buttrose explores how materials, selfhood and society are tested and transformed under pressure.
details: Fresh from curating Australia's first Golden Lion at Venice 2024, Ellie Buttrose curates 24 artists pushing mediums to build visual complexity. Exhibitions span the Art Gallery of South Australia, Samstag Museum of Art, and Adelaide Botanic Garden. A vital component of the Adelaide Festival since 1990.

name: Albuquerque International Balloon Fiesta
desc: 54th iteration of the world's largest ballooning event featuring mass ascensions and balloon glows.
details: Each October, Balloon Fiesta Park becomes the launch site for over 500 hot air balloons in spectacular mass ascensions. Special shape balloons, evening balloon glows, fireworks shows, and the Dawn Patrol (balloons launching in darkness) create magical moments. The clear October skies and unique 'Albuquerque Box' wind pattern make it the premier ballooning event globally.

name: Antigua Carnival
desc: Dubbed 'The Caribbean's Greatest Summer Festival' featuring non-stop action with vibrant colors and pulsating soca beats.
details: The streets of Antigua come alive with vibrant colors, music, and cultural celebrations. Antigua Carnival is one of the Caribbean's premier carnival events.

name: Tambores de San Juan
desc: UNESCO-declared Intangible Cultural Heritage celebrating Saint John the Baptist with drums, music, and processions.
details: The Parranda de San Juan Bautista celebrates the night of June 23 and morning of June 24 with constant drumming, repetitive songs of African heritage, and processions carrying the image of Saint John. The tradition involves thousands of devotees annually, primarily in Aragua, Miranda, Vargas, and Carabobo. UNESCO declared the festive cycle of San Juan Bautista as Intangible Cultural Heritage in 2021.

name: Festival Teatro de la Mujer (Women's Theater Festival)
desc: Significant theatrical festival framed within International Women's Month, bringing together theatrical productions centering feminine experiences and perspectives.
details: The fifth edition of this established theatrical proposal at Teatro Braulio Castillo features productions centered on feminine voices from the Puerto Rican stage. Schedule: March 6-8, "Tata y Mela tienen un show" (OPM Events production); March 14-15, "Ozana y sus emociones" (Girasol Productions); March 27-29, "Noches de Impro en Panties" (Teatro Breve production featuring Isaira Noriega, Maurim Chiclana, Helena Ramírez and invited improvisers).

name: Beijing International Music Festival
desc: One of Asia's major film festivals showcasing Chinese and international cinema in the capital.
details: The Beijing International Film Festival has grown rapidly to become one of Asia's most significant film events. It features hundreds of film screenings, industry forums, a film market, and red carpet galas. The festival promotes both Chinese cinema and international co-productions, reflecting Beijing's ambitions as a global film capital.

name: Taiwan Hot Spring Festival
desc: Island-wide celebration of Taiwan's abundant hot spring culture across dozens of geothermal areas.
details: Taiwan's Hot Spring Festival promotes the island's rich geothermal heritage with events at hot spring areas including Beitou (Taipei), Wulai, Jiaoxi (Yilan), and Guanziling (Tainan). Activities include outdoor hot spring baths, spa experiences, local food festivals, and cultural performances. Taiwan has over 100 hot spring sites ranging from acidic sulfur to alkaline bicarbonate springs.

name: Bethlehem Christmas Celebrations
desc: Christmas celebrations at the birthplace of Jesus Christ in Manger Square and Church of the Nativity.
details: Thousands gather in Manger Square for midnight mass at the Church of the Nativity. Features parades, scouts, cultural performances, and religious observances.

name: La Morisma de Bracho
desc: Theatrical colonial-era performance with 30,000 participants reenacting historic Battle of Lepanto (1571), declared Intangible Cultural Heritage in 2014.
details: Three-day celebration honoring martyrdom of Saint John the Baptist. Brings together approximately 30,000 participants (historically 12,000 attendees, expanded participation over time). Spanish tradition maintained since 1622 with religious processions, colonial music, horses dancing, historical reenactments. Central theme: 1571 Battle of Lepanto. Declared intangible cultural heritage of Zacatecas state (2014). Brotherhood of San Juan Bautista coordinates participation.

name: D-CAF (Downtown Contemporary Arts Festival)
desc: Egypt's cutting-edge arts festival transforming downtown Cairo with immersive installations and avant-garde theatre.
details: D-CAF is Egypt's most innovative creative event, transforming downtown Cairo each spring into an experimental cultural playground. It features immersive installations, avant-garde theatre, digital art, dance, and live music across iconic buildings many of which are not usually open to the public.

name: Cape Town International Animation Festival
desc: Africa's premier jazz festival featuring world-class international and local jazz musicians across multiple stages.
details: The Cape Town International Jazz Festival is one of the largest jazz festivals in the world and the biggest music event in sub-Saharan Africa. The 2026 lineup includes international acts Jacob Collier and Yellowjackets alongside local hero Sipho Hotstix Mabuse. Multiple stages host diverse jazz genres from swing to Afrobeat fusion.

name: Romería de la Virgen de los Ángeles
desc: Major national pilgrimage to the Basilica of Our Lady of the Angels in Cartago.

name: São João / Festa Junina
desc: One of the world's longest São João celebrations combining rural and urban festivities with production of "world's largest couscous" (verified by Guinness Book).
details: The Caruaru festa begins with rural festivities (April-May) and extends through urban celebrations in June. The famous cuscuzeira (couscous maker) measures 3.3 meters tall and 1.5 meters in diameter, capable of preparing 700 kilos of mass. Alto do Moura, the district of ceramic artists, offers traditional figurines and crafts. The city becomes a stage for forró, maracatu, and traditional Pernambuco culture with the production of the "world's largest couscous" as a hallmark event.

name: Fiesta de San Pedro y San Pablo
desc: Festival merging indigenous Inti Raymi and Catholic celebration of patron saints June 29 with bonfires, dances, and traditional music.
details: Festivities begin night before June 29 with bonfires in streets. Festival at end of June in Cayambe, Pichincha Province. Combines indigenous Inti Raymi traditions with Catholic Saint Peter and Saint Paul celebration. Honors patron saints and winter solstice. Men and women dress in colorful Andean costumes, dance to traditional folk music rhythms. Indigenous communities thank harvest while paying tribute to patron saints through dance/music. Celebrations across highland/coastal Ecuador regions, with Cayambe hosting major festivities.

name: Festival de Curitiba (theater/performing Arts)
desc: 34th edition with 435+ attractions spanning theater, dance, circus, music, comedy, and workshops across decentralized venues throughout city and metro region.
details: One of Latin America's largest cultural events with more than 435 attractions at theaters, cultural spaces, streets, and squares. Confirmed artists include Malu Galli, Du Moscovis, Herson Capri, Natália do Vale, and Walter Casagrande Júnior. Established groups like Grupo Galpão and Corpo perform alongside new productions. The festival returns to Ópera de Arame and debuts at Pedreira Paulo Leminski. Tickets range from free to R$85. The festival integrates diverse artistic expressions and promotes emerging artists alongside established names.

name: Dubai Shopping Festival
desc: A month-long shopping and entertainment extravaganza with citywide discounts, drone shows, raffles, and supercar giveaways.
details: Running from mid-December through mid-January, DSF is a shopping-meets-entertainment phenomenon with city-wide sales up to 90%, nightly drone shows, and raffles giving away supercars. Downtown and Jumeirah Beach accommodations hit 95% occupancy during opening weekend. It's a signature Dubai event drawing millions of visitors globally.

name: Gnaoua World Music Festival
desc: UNESCO-heritage Gnawa music festival blending spiritual healing traditions with jazz, blues, and world music.
details: Dating back to 1998, the Gnaoua Festival is the largest of its kind in the world, showcasing Gnawa music rooted in West African spiritual healing traditions. Over three days, 300+ performers play across seven stages, with the main stage at Moulay Hassan Square. The festival also features Human Rights forums, beach performances, cultural exchanges, and workshops. Free admission to many shows makes it accessible, and the entire coastal city transforms into one giant venue.

name: Puro Sabor (Nicaraguan Cigar Festival)
desc: 13th edition premium cigar festival featuring factory tours, tobacco farm visits, tastings, pairings, and gala celebrations in Nicaragua's cigar capital.
details: The Puro Sabor Nicaraguan Cigar Festival (13th edition) captivates enthusiasts and international visitors with an immersive program of factory tours, tobacco farm visits, tastings, pairings, and gala celebrations. The festival runs January 18-24, 2026, offering exclusive access to renowned factories, farms, and cigar-making legends. Core cigar activities center in Estelí, Nicaragua's undisputed cigar capital, with the festival itinerary spanning multiple cities: January 18 (arrival in Managua), January 19-20 (Granada with cultural heritage walks and islet boat tours on Lake Cocibolca), January 21-23 (Estelí with cigar and coffee pairing at AJ Fernández's farm and factory tours), and January 23 (grand closing gala). Pricing: $2,600 for a single ticket and $5,000 for a shared double ticket. The all-inclusive experience includes accommodations, meals, drinks, transfers, group insurance, welcome gifts, and unlimited cigars and beverages during events. Visit purosaborcigarfest.com to register.

name: Martinique Carnival
desc: French-Caribbean carnival blending powerful symbolism with characters like Neg Gwo Siwo (covered in molasses) and dramatic visual contrasts.
details: Each day has a distinct theme: Dimanche Gras features Kings and Queens, Lundi Gras brings Vaval with marriages burlesques, Mardi Gras has everyone in red (diables), and Mercredi des Cendres features black/white mourning as Vaval is burned. The Neg Gwo Siwo characters — covered in molasses and charcoal — symbolize resistance and African heritage.

name: Fiesta Nacional de la Manzana
desc: National festival honoring apple production in the Alto Valle region with music and cultural performances.
details: Held at Municipal Fair Grounds (Tronador Street 260). Headliners included YSYA and NEO PISTEA (Feb 20), EMANERO and DAMAS GRATIS (Feb 21), LALI and CAZZU (Feb 22). Free entry. Festival origins date to 1964; national status achieved in 1966. Wide variety of food stalls including vegetarian and gluten-free options. Attracted 150,000+ people.

name: Fiestas de Octubre - Guadalajara 2026
desc: Month-long celebration in Guadalajara featuring mariachi, charrería, concerts, and cultural exhibitions.
details: The Fiestas de Octubre transform Guadalajara into a month-long party featuring mariachi concerts, charreadas (Mexican rodeo), bullfights, art exhibitions, carnival rides, and concerts by major Latin artists. The celebrations reflect Jalisco's identity as the heartland of mariachi and tequila culture.

name: Guča Trumpet Festival
desc: World's largest brass band festival with 300,000+ visitors celebrating Serbian trumpet culture.
details: Guča explodes with the sound of competing trumpet orchestras, street parties, roast meat, and rakija. The festival is an overwhelming sensory experience celebrating Serbian Romani and folk brass traditions.

name: Gwangju Kimchi Festival
desc: Major kimchi festival in the city considered the capital of Korean cuisine.
details: Gwangju's Kimchi Festival celebrates the city's reputation as the capital of Korean food culture. The festival features kimchi-making competitions, tastings of hundreds of regional varieties, cooking demonstrations, and cultural performances. Gwangju's kimchi is considered among the best in Korea due to the region's agricultural abundance.

name: Harbin International Ice and Snow Sculpture Festival
desc: World's largest ice and snow festival featuring massive illuminated ice sculptures from the Songhua River.

name: Jazz Plaza (Havana International Jazz Festival)
desc: Cuba's premier jazz festival with 120+ musicians across 15+ venues from grand theatres to intimate clubs.
details: This festival weaves together jazz with traditional Cuban music forms like rumba, son, and Afro-Cuban rhythms. Features over 70 international artists confirmed from the United States, Brazil, Spain, France, and the United Kingdom. The festival expands to multiple cities including Santiago de Cuba, Santa Clara, and Holguín. Opening concert features maestro Frank Fernández with music students; festival closes with Roberto Fonseca performance. Theme: "La Rumba Me Llama" (The Rumba Calls Me).

name: Hong Kong Wine & Dine Festival
desc: Outdoor tasting festival showcasing global cuisine, wine and spirits with harbor views.
details: The Hong Kong Wine & Dine Festival on the Central Harbourfront features over 300 food and wine booths, celebrity chef demonstrations, and live entertainment against the spectacular Victoria Harbour backdrop. The four-day festival celebrates Hong Kong's position as Asia's gourmet capital.

name: Houston Livestock Show and Rodeo (RodeoHouston)
desc: The world's largest livestock exhibition and rodeo, with 20 days of rodeo and star-studded concert performances.
details: RodeoHouston at NRG Park is the world's largest livestock exhibition and richest regular-season rodeo. Each night of rodeo action is followed by a major concert headliner at the 70,000+ capacity NRG Stadium. The event also features livestock competitions, a massive carnival, championship BBQ, and western art exhibitions.

name: 45th Istanbul Film Festival
desc: Turkey's largest film festival screening close to 200 titles from around the world.
details: The 45th Istanbul Film Festival features three competitive sections: the international Golden Tulip Competition, New Visions for domestic features, and national Short Film Competition. Multiple venues across Istanbul.

name: Feria del Caballo (Horse Fair)
desc: Jerez's spectacular Horse Fair combines world-class equestrian shows with flamenco dancing, sherry tasting, and pure Andalusian culture.
details: The Feria del Caballo showcases the Andalusian horse in all its glory. Elegant riders in traditional dress parade thoroughbred horses through the fairground. Features include dressage exhibitions, carriage competitions, flamenco performances, and sherry tastings from Jerez's famous bodegas. The atmosphere blends aristocratic equestrian tradition with popular fiesta.

name: Kerrville Folk Festival
desc: America's longest-running folk festival, an 18-day campground celebration of songwriting and acoustic music in the Texas Hill Country.
details: Set on the Quiet Valley Ranch in the Texas Hill Country, Kerrville is unlike any other music festival. Over 18 days, songwriters and musicians from across North America perform on outdoor stages while attendees camp on-site, creating a tight-knit musical community. The festival includes the New Folk competition, which has launched the careers of many artists, and late-night campfire song circles that are legendary.

name: Ice Festival
desc: Festival on frozen Lake Khuvsgul—Mongolia's 'Blue Pearl'—with ice sports, horse sledding, and shaman rituals.
details: The Khuvsgul Ice Festival takes place on the frozen surface of Lake Khuvsgul, Mongolia's largest freshwater lake. Activities include ice skating, horse-drawn sleigh rides on the ice, ice sumo wrestling, and traditional games. Shaman rituals and traditional music performances add cultural depth. The stunning alpine setting—often called Mongolia's 'Blue Pearl'—provides a breathtaking backdrop.

name: ALASITAS (Festival of Ekeko - Aymara God of Abundance)
desc: Month-long cultural fair honoring Ekeko, the Aymara god of abundance, where miniature objects given as gifts are believed to manifest as real items within the following year.
details: The Alasitas fair sprawls along many streets and parks in central La Paz with smaller events in neighborhoods throughout the city. Attracting people from across Bolivia, at least 5,000 exhibitors present innovative handicrafts and new miniatures maintaining this important tradition. At mid-day on January 24, the Catholic Church joins celebrations by blessing gifts at La Paz's main cathedral. Ritual journeys during Alasitas were added to UNESCO's Representative List of Intangible Cultural Heritage (2017). The tradition believes that gift recipients will obtain the real version of miniature objects during the coming year.

name: Festiblues Bolivia
desc: A blues music festival held in La Paz at Teatro Nuna Espacio Arte, bringing international and local blues musicians for performances and cultural exchange.
details: Festiblues Bolivia 2026 is scheduled for April 10-12 at Teatro Nuna Espacio Arte in La Paz. The festival celebrates blues music in a South American context, featuring international and local blues performers. The event provides a platform for cultural exchange and appreciation of blues traditions in the Andean setting of Bolivia's capital.

name: Gran Poder (Festival of the Most Holy Trinity of Jesus of Great Power)
desc: Bolivia's largest festival and one of the country's most important cultural expressions, honoring El Señor del Gran Poder (Jesus Christ), featuring massive numbers of dancers, musicians, and spectators.
details: The Fiesta del Gran Poder is a religious celebration honoring El Señor del Gran Poder or Jesus Christ, considered the largest festival in Bolivia and one of the country's most important cultural expressions. In the last entrada, around 92,000 dancers and 33,000 musicians participated, while spectators exceeded 200,000 people. The Gran Poder generates approximately 67 million dollars economy in a single day. The festival is celebrated annually on the last Saturday of May or first Saturday of June. On December 13, 2025, 36 fraternities participated in the official launch of 2026 Gran Poder celebration. The festival blends Catholic devotion with indigenous Andean traditions, creating a uniquely Bolivian expression of faith and culture. UNESCO recognizes it as Intangible Cultural Heritage.

name: Lake of Stars Festival
desc: Intimate lakeside festival called the world's finest festival blending music with cultural exchange.
details: Lake of Stars takes place on the shores of Lake Malawi, blending local Malawian musicians with international bands and DJs. Called the world's finest festival, it uses cultural tourism to generate revenue for Malawi. The intimate setting with fewer than 5,000 attendees creates a magical atmosphere.

name: Maulidi Festival
desc: Spectacular celebration of the Prophet's birthday on Lamu Island with dhow processions and Swahili music.
details: The Maulid Festival on Lamu Island is one of East Africa's most impressive celebrations of the Prophet Muhammad's birthday. Thousands gather for religious chanting, dhow processions, traditional Swahili Taarab music, sword dancing, and donkey races in the narrow streets of this UNESCO World Heritage town.

name: Desfile de las Mil Polleras (Thousand Polleras Parade)
desc: Celebrates Panama's traditional national dress with 105 delegations in elaborate embroidered polleras, generating major cultural and economic impact for the nation.
details: The Desfile de las Mil Polleras is held in Las Tablas, Los Santos province, celebrating Panama's traditional women's dress. The 15th edition of 2026 featured 105 delegations. The parade started January 17, 2026, at 1:00 pm. The pollera, the parade's central symbol, is an artisanally elaborated traditional women's dress of Panama featuring fine fabrics and hand-embroidered work, considered one of the most beautiful typical dresses in the world. The event marks the start of the summer season in Panama, becoming the first major cultural event of the year. The 2026 Desfile de las Mil Polleras left an estimated economic impact of $43.3 million and an approximate attendance of 288,750 people, consolidating itself as one of Panama's cultural events with the greatest capacity for tourist and commercial mobilization. Culture Minister María Eugenia Herrrera served as the official flag bearer, recognizing the patrimonial and cultural value of this manifestation that ennobles Panamanian identity.

name: Reading & Leeds Festival
desc: Twin music festivals featuring the same lineup on alternate days across two iconic UK locations.
details: Reading & Leeds is a British institution running since 1961. The twin festivals share lineups across rock, indie, hip-hop, electronic, and alternative genres with over 100,000 attendees at each site over the August bank holiday weekend.

name: La Purísima / La Gritería
desc: Neighborhood singing, altars, and call-and-response celebrations honoring the Immaculate Conception.

name: Anniversary of Lima (Lima Foundation Day)
desc: Lima celebrates its 491st anniversary with week-long festivities featuring the "Serenata de Lima," gastronomic fairs, military parades, and free cultural events.
details: Lima was founded on January 18, 1535, and celebrates its anniversary annually. While the official date is January 18th, festivities span several days, creating an electric atmosphere throughout the capital. The most important event is the "Serenata de Lima," held on the night of January 17th, leading up to midnight with fireworks and concerts. A week-long schedule includes open-air serenades, massive gastronomic fairs, and spectacular parades showcasing the cultural tapestry of South America's gastronomic capital. The heart of celebrations beats in the Plaza de Armas, where official ceremonies are attended by political figures, followed by grand military and school parades. Marching bands and colorful traditional costumes fill the streets. While a major celebration in the capital, it is a non-working day specifically for Lima Province, not a national holiday. The vast majority of events organized by the Municipality of Lima are completely free, including Serenata, projection mapping light shows, and folklore parades.

name: Luxor African Film Festival
desc: African cinema screenings at ancient temples and historic sites in Luxor, including open-air shows at Karnak Temple.
details: Showcasing African cinema against the backdrop of Egypt's most spectacular archaeological sites, this festival features open-air screenings at Karnak Temple and other historic venues. It brings together filmmakers from across Africa for screenings, workshops, and cultural exchanges in one of the world's most magnificent historical settings.

name: Fête des Lumières
desc: Citywide light-art festival; official site says annual around 8 December; Lyon tourism reported 2M+ visitors in 2025.
details: The Festival of Lights draws 3+ million visitors who marvel at 70+ light art installations projected onto Lyon's iconic buildings, squares, and rivers. Dating from 1852, it's a magical four-night celebration of light art and technology.

name: Carrera de los Muertos
desc: Massive Day of the Dead celebrations including the grand Desfile de Día de Muertos parade and ofrendas across the capital.
details: Mexico City's Day of the Dead has grown into a massive cultural event, partly inspired by the James Bond film Spectre which depicted a fictional parade that then became reality. The Desfile features giant skeleton floats, thousands of costumed participants, and live music on Paseo de la Reforma. Traditional observances continue in neighborhoods like Mixquic and Coyoacán.

name: Summerfest
desc: The world's largest music festival by Guinness World Records, with 800+ acts on 12 stages over three weekends.
details: Summerfest holds the Guinness World Record as the world's largest music festival, featuring over 800 acts on 12 stages across three weekends at the Henry Maier Festival Park on Lake Michigan. Genres span everything from rock and country to hip-hop and electronic, with headliners on the American Family Insurance Amphitheater.

name: Mino Washi Akari Art Exhibition
desc: 1,300-year-old washi paper tradition illuminated through artistic lantern displays in the historic town.
details: The Mino Washi Akari Art exhibition transforms the historic udatsu-lined streets of Mino into an open-air gallery of washi paper light art. Hundreds of handcrafted washi lanterns and installations line the Edo-era merchant quarter, celebrating 1,300 years of Mino washi papermaking—a UNESCO Intangible Cultural Heritage.

name: Day of the Dead
desc: One of the most authentic and atmospheric Day of the Dead celebrations near Mexico City.
details: The town of Mixquic (San Andres Mixquic) hosts one of the most traditional Dia de los Muertos celebrations in the Mexico City metropolitan area. The cemetery comes alive with thousands of candles as families maintain all-night vigils at graves adorned with marigolds and offerings.

name: Montreal Jazz Festival (Festival International de Jazz de Montréal)
desc: The world's largest jazz festival, featuring 3,000+ artists in 650+ concerts over 11 days.
details: Recognized by Guinness World Records as the largest jazz festival on Earth, the Montreal Jazz Festival transforms downtown into a jazz lover's paradise. Over 650 concerts (most free outdoor shows) on 10+ stages feature 3,000+ artists from 30+ countries. The Quartier des Spectacles becomes a pedestrian zone filled with music, art installations, and culinary experiences.

name: FLIP - Festa Literária Internacional de Paraty
desc: 24th edition of prestigious international literary festival transforming historic colonial town into major center for literature, bringing together authors, readers, and artists.
details: The 24th FLIP honors poet Orides Fontela (1940-1998), a pioneer of contemporary Brazilian poetry known for formal linguistic rigor updating Modernism. Literary curator Rita Palmeira (PhD in Brazilian Literature from USP) curates the program. During five days, Paraty hosts literary tables, author encounters, book launches, and artistic performances in the Authors' Tent at Praça da Matriz and throughout the historic city. The festival celebrates Brazilian literature alongside international works with readings, discussions, and cultural exchanges.

name: Wawa Welcome America
desc: Supersized Juneteenth to July 4th festival for the US 250th.
details: The birthplace of American independence hosts an expanded series of concerts, historical reenactments, and civic festivals.

name: EDC Thailand
desc: The iconic Las Vegas EDM carnival experience comes to tropical Phuket with five themed stages and immersive art installations.
details: Electric Daisy Carnival Thailand brings the legendary Las Vegas festival experience to Rhythm Park in Phuket. Five major stages, each with unique themes and creative technology, feature top international DJs including Swedish House Mafia's Axwell and Sebastian Ingrosso. Surreal art installations, carnival rides, and roaming performers create a fully immersive experience.

name: Baisakhi / Vaisakhi
desc: Harvest festival and Sikh New Year; major celebrations at the Golden Temple and across Punjab with bhangra.

name: Hay Festival Querétaro 2026
desc: Mexican edition of the prestigious Hay Festival of Literature & Arts, bringing global thinkers to Queretaro.
details: The Hay Festival brings international authors, thinkers, journalists, and artists to the colonial city of Queretaro for debates, workshops, and conversations about literature, science, politics, and the arts. It is one of the most important literary events in Latin America.

name: Festival Internacional de las Artes (International Arts Festival)
desc: 37th edition bringing 450+ international and national artists to Parque La Sabana with Mexico as guest country of honor, featuring 70 cultural activities.
details: The Festival Internacional de las Artes (FIA) celebrates its 37th edition at Parque Metropolitano La Sabana in San José. For the first time, Mexico serves as the guest country of honor, presenting notable artistic and cultural programs including folk and contemporary dance, music, theater, cinema, literature, visual arts, gastronomy, and academic spaces. More than 450 artists from 12 countries participate, offering approximately 70 cultural activities open to the public. Confirmed international artists include Mau y Ricky, Ivy Queen, Fonseca, and Ovy On The Drums, joining presentations by orchestras, national groups, and contemporary music proposals. The closing performance features the Spanish company La Fura dels Baus with the work RECONEC. FIA37 maintains a cultural access policy establishing that 95% of activities will be free or low-cost.

name: Virada Cultural
desc: 21st edition of free, decentralized cultural marathon offering 24-hour access to music, dance, theater, visual arts, and popular cultural manifestations across all city regions.
details: Virada Cultural distributes free programming across macro-regions of São Paulo in public spaces and municipal cultural equipment. Presentations include music, dance, theater, visual arts, literary readings, and popular cultural manifestations. Artist submissions are open through the Porta de Entrada platform until March 23, 2026 at 11:59 PM. The event reaches all neighborhoods with diverse artistic programming celebrating cultural pluralism and expanding access to arts beyond traditional venues.

name: Festival Sayulita
desc: Film, music, and culture festival in Pacific beach town featuring live DJs, cinema, cuisine, and international surf competitions.
details: Three-day festival celebrating art of film and tequila. Features live music from renowned DJs worldwide, cinema, food, traditional surf competition with international athletes. Concludes with electronic music party with chill-out music until dawn on beach. Draws area residents, visitors, business/film community members, officials, students, academics. Follow festival on Facebook (facebook.com/FestivalSayulita) and Instagram (instagram.com/festivalsayulita).

name: Shanghai International Film Festival
desc: China's largest state-sponsored arts festival showcasing international performing arts and visual exhibitions.
details: The China Shanghai International Arts Festival is the country's most significant annual arts event, featuring world-class opera, ballet, theater, and music performances from China and abroad. The festival includes outdoor performances, art exhibitions, and cultural forums. As a state-level cultural event, it attracts top international companies and artists.

name: Stanthorpe Apple and Grape Harvest Festival
desc: 60th anniversary of the Granite Belt's harvest celebration with grand parade, grape crushing, and food fiesta.
details: Celebrating its diamond jubilee, the Stanthorpe Apple and Grape Harvest Festival showcases the Granite Belt's agricultural bounty. Events include the grand street parade, grape-crushing competitions, wine tastings, cooking competitions, art exhibitions, and a food and wine fiesta.

name: Cannstatter Volksfest
desc: One of the world’s biggest Volksfeste; official site reports 4.2M in a recent edition and publishes 2026 dates.
details: The Cannstatter Volksfest is Germany's second-largest beer festival with beer tents, rides, and a unique 26m-tall fruit column symbolising a good harvest.

name: Taos Pueblo Feast Day / San Geronimo Day
desc: Traditional feast day at the 1,000-year-old Taos Pueblo World Heritage Site with ceremonial dances and trade fair.
details: San Geronimo Day at Taos Pueblo is one of the most spectacular and accessible traditional feast day celebrations at a Native American pueblo. The day features sacred ceremonial dances, including the iconic pole climb, a traditional trade fair, and food vendors — all set against the breathtaking multi-story adobe structures that have been continuously inhabited for over 1,000 years.

name: Feria de la Virgen de Suyapa
desc: Pilgrimage and celebrations honoring Our Lady of Suyapa, the country’s patroness.

name: Thessaloniki Documentary Festival
desc: A major documentary film festival in Thessaloniki featuring restorations and new works.
details: The Thessaloniki Documentary Festival 2026 has announced first titles spanning restorations of works by Faithfull, Novak, Welsh, and Brookner. A significant event for documentary cinema in Southeast Europe.

name: Voodoo Day (Fête du Vodoun)
desc: National voodoo holiday celebrations at the spiritual center of Togoville on Lake Togo.
details: Togoville, on the shores of Lake Togo, is one of the spiritual centers of West African voodoo. On January 10, the same day as Benin's celebration, elaborate voodoo ceremonies take place with priests, devotees, drummers, and spectators gathering at sacred shrines.

name: Festival Balonismo
desc: 36th International Hot Air Balloon Festival at Parque Odilo Webber Rodrigues celebrating Torres' status as Brazilian Capital of Hot Air Ballooning with competitions and shows.
details: Four-day celebration of ballooning spectacles, musical shows, cultural events, competitions, night glow displays, children's activities, craft fairs, and gastronomic attractions. Torres is the largest reference for hot air ballooning throughout Latin America. The festival attracts tourists from across Brazil and internationally. Programs include competitive balloon races, fireworks, and traditional Night Glow display.

name: Festival Internacional de la Primavera (International Spring Festival)
desc: An annual celebration honoring Trujillo's nickname "City of the Eternal Spring," featuring beauty pageants, Peruvian Paso horse contests, and grand spring parades.
details: The Festival Internacional de la Primavera is held between the final days of September and the first days of October annually, honoring Trujillo's nickname "City of the Eternal Spring." The first festival was held in 1950, organized by the Lions Club of Trujillo. Main attractions include the coronation of the Spring Queen, Peruvian Paso horse contests, parades of international beauty queens, majorettes, and folkloric dance performances. The grand spring parade features allegorical floats adorned with local flowers and participation of international beauty queens. Most festival events are free, including the Grand Spring Parade, crafts and gastronomy fairs, art exhibitions, soccer tournaments, children's theater, folkloric dances, and literary events.

name: Day Zero Bali
desc: The inaugural Asian edition of the renowned global electronic music and arts festival inspired by ancient Mayan prophecy.
details: Curated by Damian Lazarus and his Crosstown Rebels label, Day Zero Bali is the first Asian edition of the acclaimed festival previously held in Tulum, Mexico. Inspired by ancient prophecy and Bali's spiritual energy, it features cutting-edge house and techno, visionary art, and performances at the iconic GWK Cultural Park in Uluwatu.

name: Festival de Viña del Mar - Canción
desc: Chile's most prestigious music and entertainment festival featuring international and Latin American performers.
details: Held at Anfiteatro de la Quinta Vergara with 2026 lineup including Gloria Estefan, Pet Shop Boys, Juanes, Mon Laferte, Jesse & Joy, Paulo Londra, Matteo Bocelli, Bomba Estéreo, NMIXX, Yandel (Sinfónico), and comedians Stefan Kramer, Rodrigo Villegas, Esteban Düch. Performances begin 8:45 PM with doors at 6:00 PM. Hosted by Karen Doggenweiler and Rafael Araneda. Tickets through Punto Ticket.

name: Windhoek Karneval (WIKA)
desc: Namibia's largest carnival with Germanic heritage featuring parades, costumes, and Oktoberfest-style events.
details: WIKA (Windhoek Karneval) is Namibia's largest carnival, reflecting the country's Germanic colonial heritage. It features costume balls, parades, the election of a carnival prince and princess, and beer-fueled festivities that rival European carnival traditions in this unexpected African setting.

name: National Indigenous Peoples Day Celebrations
desc: Pan-Canadian celebrations honoring First Nations, Inuit, and Métis peoples with cultural events nationwide.
details: National Indigenous Peoples Day on June 21 (Summer Solstice) features celebrations across Canada honoring Indigenous cultures. Events include powwows, traditional drumming and dancing, Indigenous art markets, storytelling, traditional games, and community feasts. Major celebrations take place in Ottawa, Winnipeg, Vancouver, and communities nationwide.

name: Mid-Autumn Festival 2026
desc: A poetic moonlit celebration centered around family reunions, mooncakes, and lantern-lit walks under the harvest moon.
details: One of China's most important traditional festivals, centered around moon gazing, sharing mooncakes, and family togetherness. Victoria Peak in Hong Kong, West Lake in Hangzhou, and Xi'an's ancient quarters offer spectacular settings. Children carry colorful lanterns, and cities host cultural performances and traditional storytelling events.

name: Fête Gédé (Haitian Day of the Dead)
desc: A sacred celebration in Haitian Vodou tradition honoring ancestors by communing with the gédé loas (spirits representing death and fertility).
details: Fèt Gédé is a raucous, bawdy, fiery festival embodying essential elements of Haitian culture—splashed with bright paint, spicy food, strong drinks, and rhythmic feet on pavement. Gede shows are notoriously loud and extravagant seen nearly everywhere across Haiti. Vodou practitioners dress elaborately to represent gede spirits—"the dead." Rituals include altars, veves (ground drawings to attract gede), special food and drink offerings, and sacred dances with polyrhythmic drumming. The biggest and brashest parade happens in Port-au-Prince at the Grand Cemetery (Grand Cimetière). Although rooted in Vodou, Fèt Gédé has become a broader Haitian cultural celebration.

name: Epiphany Celebrations (La Befana)
desc: Italian Epiphany celebrations with bonfires, processions, and La Befana tradition.
details: Epiphany across Italy features La Befana (the good witch) bringing sweets to children, spectacular bonfires, torchlit processions, and colourful parades in cities like Rome, Venice, and Florence.

name: Abbots Bromley Horn Dance
desc: England's most ancient dance tradition dating back to medieval times.
details: Six dancers carry reindeer antlers through Abbots Bromley in this mysterious medieval dance tradition, accompanied by a fool, hobby horse, bowman, and Maid Marian.

name: Festival d'Aix-en-Provence
desc: Prestigious international opera and classical music festival in Provence.
details: The Festival d'Aix presents world-class opera, orchestral, and chamber music performances in stunning venues including the Archbishop's Palace courtyard. Young artist programmes nurture the next generation of opera talent.

name: Liwa Date Festival
desc: Traditional festival celebrating the date harvest in the Liwa oasis with competitions and heritage events.
details: Celebrates Emirati date-farming heritage with date quality competitions, camel beauty contests, traditional crafts, and Bedouin cultural displays in the desert oasis.

name: Al Dhafra Festival
desc: Heritage festival featuring camel beauty contests, falconry, and traditional Emirati culture in the desert.
details: One of the region's largest heritage festivals showcasing Bedouin traditions including camel beauty pageants, falconry, saluki racing, date competitions, and traditional arts.

name: Unity Day
desc: Celebration of Kazakhstan's ethnic diversity and peaceful coexistence of 130+ nationalities.
details: Celebrates Kazakhstan's ethnic diversity and peaceful coexistence of 130+ nationalities. Cultural fairs display crafts, carpets, and handmade goods from various ethnic communities including Korean, Uighur, Uzbek, and German diaspora.

name: Holland Festival
desc: Netherlands' largest and oldest international performing arts festival celebrating its 79th edition.
details: The Holland Festival presents cutting-edge opera, theatre, dance, and music from international artists at venues across Amsterdam. Known for adventurous programming and world premieres.

name: WorldPride Amsterdam
desc: The world's premier LGBTQ+ celebration with the famous Canal Parade and 2-3 million visitors.
details: WorldPride comes to Amsterdam in 2026, combining the legendary Canal Parade through Amsterdam's historic waterways with the WorldPride March, opening concert, conferences, and two weeks of cultural events celebrating LGBTQ+ rights and culture.

name: La Luz Dance Festival
desc: International Latin dance festival featuring Bachata, Salsa, Kizomba at a 5-star resort.
details: Held at 5-star Limak Limra Hotel featuring Latin styles, shows, DJ sets, and themed parties attracting dance enthusiasts worldwide.

name: Aomori Nebuta Warasse Museum
desc: Year-round museum showcasing actual Nebuta festival floats with live music demonstrations.
details: The Nebuta Museum Wa Rasse displays actual giant illuminated nebuta floats from the most recent festival year-round. Regular taiko and hayashi music demonstrations bring the festival spirit alive outside the August festival period.

name: Les Rencontres d'Arles
desc: World's most important photography festival with 40+ exhibitions in historic Arles venues.
details: Les Rencontres d'Arles presents photography exhibitions in stunning venues including ancient churches, industrial spaces, and Roman monuments. For three months, Arles becomes the global capital of photography.

name: Nowruz Bayram
desc: Spring equinox celebration with folk music, traditional foods, and open-air festivals.
details: Turkmenistan's biggest cultural celebration of spring equinox. Features folk music, traditional foods, and open-air festivals across the country.

name: Wisteria Festivals (Ashikaga/Kawachi)
desc: Breathtaking tunnels and curtains of cascading wisteria blooms at Japan's most famous flower parks.
details: Ashikaga Flower Park in Tochigi and Kawachi Wisteria Garden in Fukuoka feature spectacular wisteria displays. Ashikaga's 150-year-old Great Wisteria tree creates a 1,000 sq meter canopy of purple blooms. Tunnels of white, pink, purple, and yellow wisteria create an otherworldly atmosphere, especially during evening illuminations. CNN named Ashikaga one of the world's dream destinations.

name: Festa Nacional do Morango - Atibaia & Jarinu
desc: 40th edition of strawberry and flower festival celebrating spring harvest with family atmosphere, rural music, and regional cuisine at Parque do Morango.
details: Free admission at Parque do Morango "Duílio Maziero" in Campo dos Aleixos, Atibaia (Rodovia Edgard Máximo Zambotto, Km 77). Hours: 10am-11pm Saturdays, 10am-7pm Sundays. Featured regional foods include polenta and fried chicken, Bolognese pasta, fried potatoes, Japanese food, and strawberry desserts. Amusement park, regional music performances, and family atmosphere attract multiple generations. Organized by Association of Strawberry and Horticulture Producers of Atibaia, Jarinu and Region in partnership with city halls.

name: Planeta Atlântida (Atlântida, Rio Grande do Sul)
desc: One of South America's largest and longest-running summer music festivals celebrating 30 years with diverse Brazilian music genres.
details: Planeta Atlântida celebrates its 30th anniversary in 2026 with the concept "O Sentimento Não Muda" (The Feeling Doesn't Change). The festival has brought over 1,400 national and international attractions totaling 900+ hours of music over three decades. The 2026 lineup includes Anitta, Matuê, Jota Quest, João Gomes, Ludmilla, Luísa Sonza, and others, spanning pop, reggae, trap, funk, electronic, and rock genres. The festival represents democratic music celebration bringing artists from Rita Lee to Anitta.

name: Huey Atlixcáyotl Festival - Atlixco, Puebla 2026
desc: 60+ year-old festival honoring Quetzalcoatl with indigenous pre-Hispanic traditions
details: Named Cultural Patrimony of Puebla in 1996. Established 1965. Honors Quetzalcoatl.

name: Schwäbisch-Alemannische Fastnacht
desc: Ancient Swabian-Alemannic carnival with carved wooden masks and centuries-old costumes.
details: This carnival tradition features terrifying hand-carved wooden masks (Larven), elaborate costumes passed down through generations, and wild processions through Black Forest towns. UNESCO Intangible Heritage.

name: Grec Festival Barcelona
desc: Barcelona's 50th anniversary performing arts festival across 50 venues.
details: The Grec Festival celebrates 50 years with theatre, dance, circus, and music at the Teatre Grec amphitheatre on Montjuïc and 50 venues across Barcelona.

name: Nooruz (Kyrgyz New Year)
desc: Spring equinox celebration with Kok-Boru competitions, traditional music, and Nooruz Kedje soup.
details: Spring equinox celebration featuring Kok-Boru competitions at Bishkek stadium, traditional music and dance, food stalls with traditional Nooruz Kedje soup and sumolok, horse racing, and Kyz Kuumay (chasing game on horseback). Celebrations centered at Ala-Too Square.

name: Fiestas de Reyes
desc: Epiphany celebration honoring the Three Wise Men with traditional games, music, and regional food.
details: In Barrio Egipto, celebrations have occurred for over 100 years with thousands gathering for concerts, theater, contests, traditional games, and regional food from the Cundiboyacense region. The actual holiday is January 6, but observed on January 12 due to the Emiliani Law, creating a long weekend from January 10-12.

name: Couleur Café
desc: Brussels' celebration of global music and culture in Osseghem Park.
details: Couleur Café brings world music, hip-hop, reggae, and electronic beats to Brussels' Osseghem Park alongside global food, art installations, and a vibrant multicultural atmosphere.

name: Bunkyo Ume Matsuri (Yushima Tenjin)
desc: 300 plum trees bloom at Yushima Tenjin Shrine in central Tokyo with tea ceremonies and haiku classes.
details: Yushima Tenjin Shrine's plum blossom festival is one of Tokyo's finest, with about 300 plum trees blooming against the shrine's elegant architecture. Cultural events include haiku classes, tea ceremonies, and traditional dance performances.

name: Buyeo Seodong Lotus Festival
desc: Beautiful lotus festival in the ancient Baekje kingdom capital with historical ruins.
details: Buyeo, the ancient capital of the Baekje kingdom, celebrates the summer lotus bloom at Gungnamji Pond—Korea's first artificial pond, created 1,400 years ago. The combination of pink lotuses, ancient ruins, and Baekje historical reenactments creates a uniquely atmospheric cultural experience.

name: Buyeo Baekje Cultural Festival
desc: Festival celebrating the ancient Baekje Kingdom's cultural heritage at its former capital.
details: Buyeo's Baekje Cultural Festival recreates the splendor of the ancient Baekje Kingdom (18 BC - 660 AD) at its former capital. Historical parades, traditional performances, and reenactments of court life take place among UNESCO World Heritage sites including the Busosanseong fortress and Jeongnimsa temple ruins.

name: Dominican Republic Jazz Festival
desc: Jazz festival spread across the Dominican Republic's north coast offering a distinct jazz ambience with local and international artists.
details: Held in Cabarete, Sosúa, and Puerto Plata, featuring performances by local and international artists over several days. Creates a relaxed musical atmosphere attracting music lovers from all walks of life. Part of the broader Dominican Republic cultural calendar celebrating music traditions.

name: Cairo International Women's Film Festival
desc: The oldest and most prestigious film festival in the Middle East and Africa, transforming Cairo into a cinematic hub for two weeks.
details: Established in 1976, CIFF is the oldest and most prestigious film festival in the Middle East and Africa. It attracts international stars, directors, and film professionals, transforming Cairo into a cinematic hub with competition screenings at venues throughout the city. The festival holds FIAPF (International Federation of Film Producers Associations) accreditation.

name: Calabar Carnival
desc: Africa's biggest street party blending traditional masquerades with modern music and international performances.
details: Known as Africa's Biggest Street Party, the Calabar Carnival features up to 50,000 costumed participants and 2 million spectators. Launched in 2004, it blends traditional masquerades with modern music, colorful costumes, and international performances, broadcast on television stations across Nigeria.

name: Cambridge Folk Festival
desc: Renowned contemporary folk festival at Cherry Hinton Hall with intimate performances.
details: Cambridge Folk Festival has been a pillar of the UK folk scene since 1965. Set in Cherry Hinton Hall, it features international folk, roots, and acoustic artists in an intimate garden setting with workshops and sessions.

name: Cape Town Carnival
desc: Free-entry street carnival with performers, floats, and headline acts celebrating Human Rights Day.
details: The Cape Town Carnival is a free-entry event coinciding with Human Rights Day, featuring elaborate floats, costumed performers, dance troupes, and live music acts. It celebrates South Africa's diverse cultural heritage through creative expression and community participation.

name: Festival de la Candelaria
desc: Religious and cultural celebrations honoring the Virgin of Candelaria with community activities and cultural preservation.
details: In Medellín's Commune 10 La Candelaria, 17 neighborhoods celebrate through a week of activities honoring memory, struggles, and cultural diversity. In Cartagena, the "Candelaria es Tradición" initiative includes the XXVI Festival of Cumbia, Popano Encounter, Salsa Collectors Encounter, and multiple cultural events preserving religious customs and collective memory.

name: Concurso Nacional de Belleza - Cartagena
desc: Annual beauty pageant since 1934 where new Señorita Colombia is crowned to represent the nation in Miss International.
details: 72nd edition held November 17, 2025, crowned María Antonia Mosquera Carvajal (Valle del Cauca) as Señorita Colombia 2025-2026 to compete in Miss International 2026 (Tokyo, Japan). Cartagena has hosted this pageant since 1934, founded by Ernesto Carlos Martelo coinciding with maritime dock inauguration. Pageant celebrates Colombian beauty, culture, and national unity.

name: Jinhae Cherry Blossom Night Festival
desc: Magical nighttime illumination of cherry blossom tunnels along streams and railways.
details: The nighttime experience at Jinhae transforms the cherry blossom festival into a magical scene. Illuminated blossoms along Yeojwacheon Stream and Gyeonghwa Station create one of Korea's most romantic spring night scenes. The reflections of lit cherry trees on the water are particularly stunning.

name: Chengdu Jinli Ancient Street Festival
desc: Atmospheric New Year celebrations in the recreated ancient street beside the Wuhou Temple.
details: Jinli Ancient Street beside Chengdu's Wuhou Temple comes alive during Chinese New Year with traditional Sichuan performances, street food, face-changing opera (bian lian), shadow puppetry, and traditional craft demonstrations. The lantern-lit street with traditional architecture creates old-world atmosphere.

name: Taste of Chicago
desc: The world's largest food festival, showcasing Chicago's diverse culinary scene in beautiful Grant Park.
details: For five days in Grant Park, Taste of Chicago brings together dozens of the city's top restaurants, pop-ups, and food trucks serving everything from deep-dish pizza to global cuisines. The festival also features free concerts on the Petrillo Music Shell, cooking demonstrations, and family activities against the stunning lakefront and skyline backdrop.

name: National Wine Day Moldova
desc: Two-day celebration with 90+ Moldovan wineries, masterclasses, and folk music.
details: Moldova's National Wine Day showcases 90+ wineries at an open-air festival with tastings, sommelier masterclasses, and folk music concerts celebrating the country's wine heritage.

name: Fiestas de los Santos (all Saints Fair - Colima)
desc: State's largest and most anticipated festival celebrating tradition, culture, and fun with concerts, rides, crafts, and cultural activities.
details: 87th edition of Colima's signature festival. Features live concerts with top artists, thrilling mechanical rides, craft exhibitions, cultural performances. Draws thousands of national and international visitors. Local food specialties: quesadillas, tamales, churros, gorditas, plus regional dishes. Mechanical rides, artisanal exhibitions, cultural performances throughout. Traditional celebration marking end of October/early November season.

name: Córdoba Patios Festival (Festival de los Patios)
desc: A UNESCO-recognized festival where Córdoba's hidden private courtyards burst open to the public, revealing stunning displays of flowers, fountains, and centuries of Andalusian architecture.
