details: Each May, residents of Córdoba compete by decorating their private patios with cascading flowers — geraniums, jasmine, carnations — in a tradition dating back centuries. The historic centre's whitewashed courtyards, usually hidden behind heavy wooden doors, open to visitors who can wander from patio to patio through atmospheric cobblestone streets. UNESCO Intangible Cultural Heritage since 2012.

name: Dali March Street Festival
desc: Ancient Bai people's trade fair and cultural festival at the foot of Cangshan Mountain.
details: The March Street Festival is the grandest celebration of Dali's Bai people, held since the Tang Dynasty. Originally a Buddhist festival, it has evolved into western Yunnan's largest market and cultural event. Horse racing, traditional Bai dances, singing competitions, and a massive open-air market attract ethnic groups from across the region.

name: Datong Ancient City Cultural Festival
desc: Cultural festival in the shadow of the Yungang Grottoes celebrating northern Chinese historical heritage.
details: Datong's cultural festival celebrates the city's rich heritage as a capital of the Northern Wei dynasty and home to the UNESCO-listed Yungang Grottoes. Events include traditional performances, historical reenactments, Buddhist cultural programs, and exhibitions in the magnificently restored ancient city walls.

name: Ngondo Festival
desc: Sacred water festival of the Sawa people with underwater spirit ceremonies and canoe races on the Wouri River.
details: The Ngondo is a traditional and ritual feast of the Sawa coastal people of Cameroon, established in 1949. The highlight is a ceremony where a devotee enters the Wouri River to visit the underwater kingdom. Events include canoe races, music concerts, beauty pageants, street painting, and a half marathon.

name: Dujiangyan Beer & Water Festival
desc: Summer water festival at the UNESCO-listed ancient irrigation site combining water activities with beer culture.
details: Dujiangyan's Beer & Water Festival combines water sports and activities at the UNESCO-listed 2,200-year-old irrigation system with Sichuan beer culture. Water splashing, river activities, and outdoor beer gardens create a summer party atmosphere at one of China's most important engineering heritage sites.

name: Feria Nacional Durango 2026
desc: Northwestern Mexico's major fair celebrating regional culture with shows, exhibitions, and world-class artists.
details: 74th edition of Feria Nacional Francisco Villa. Features amazing shows, exhibitions, and artists of international stature. Wide range of cultural, sports, and culinary activities. Takes place at Feria Nacional Durango venue. For specific details, dates, lineups, and tickets, visit ferianacional.durango.gob.mx or check Viagogo/SeatGeek platforms.

name: Beltane Fire Festival
desc: Modern revival of ancient Beltane with fire performances, drumming, and procession on Calton Hill.

name: Edmonton Folk Music Festival
desc: Beloved four-day folk and roots music festival in Gallagher Park overlooking the North Saskatchewan River valley.
details: The Edmonton Folk Music Festival is one of the most respected folk festivals in North America, known for its welcoming community atmosphere and eclectic programming. Set in Gallagher Park with stunning views of the river valley, the festival features workshops, evening main stage concerts, and a tarp-laying tradition that has become a cultural ritual.

name: Galle Literary Festival
desc: A world-class literary festival set in a UNESCO World Heritage Dutch colonial fort overlooking the Indian Ocean.
details: The Galle Literary Festival brings renowned authors, poets, and journalists to the historic Galle Fort, a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Over four days, literary discussions, readings, workshops, and cultural performances unfold in the atmospheric setting of colonial-era buildings with the Indian Ocean as a backdrop. One of Asia's most prestigious literary events.

name: 4th Cayman Islands Biennial: Archipelago
desc: A multi-sited exhibition across all three Cayman Islands exploring culture, social dynamics, and ecological legacies.
details: The 4th Cayman Islands Biennial, co-curated by Joseph L. Underwood and Davin Ebanks, was juried from 165+ submissions by 100+ artists. Subthemes include Culture Shift, Social Dynamics, and Ecological Legacies. Spans Grand Cayman, Little Cayman, and Cayman Brac, showcasing rapid cultural growth since the first biennial in 2019.

name: Mashramani (Republic Day)
desc: An annual festival celebrating Guyana becoming a Republic in 1970, with the theme "Expressing our Culture through Innovation and Creativity."
details: The 2026 Mashramani celebrations have an extended schedule with festivities kicking off on Friday, January 23rd with Banks Mash in de Avenue on Main Street, Georgetown, followed by a Pop-Up Concert in New Amsterdam on January 24th. Highlights include Guinness Pan in de Avenue returning to Main Street on January 30th, regional jamborees in Linden (January 31st) and Tapachinga Ground in Region 9 (February 7th), and Pop-Up Concerts in Essequibo's Anna Regina Car Park and Moruca in Region 1. Celebrations crescendo during the final weekend with Masharama at the National Park and Splashramani at Providence National Stadium on February 21st and 22nd respectively.

name: Guyana Independence Festival
desc: Celebrates Guyana's independence from the British on May 26, 1966, with week-long celebrations and a two-day Guyana Food, Arts, and Music Festival.
details: Festivities include fireworks, flag-raising ceremony, crafts, music, fashion shows, and a message from the president. In Canada, the Guyana Festival is celebrated with a Gala on May 2nd, Launch Party on July 10th, and Guyana Independence Festival and Cultural Day on July 11th, 2026. The Guyana Festival was initiated in 1995 in Toronto to commemorate Guyana's independence anniversary and has emerged as the premier activity promoting Guyana and its culture within the Guyanese community in Canada.

name: Gimje Horizon Festival
desc: Harvest celebration in Korea's breadbasket featuring rice-planting competitions and straw art against sweeping plains.
details: The Gimje Horizon Festival celebrates Korea's agricultural heritage in the country's most productive rice-growing region. Set against the vast Gimje plains, activities include rice harvesting, straw craft demonstrations, traditional farming competitions, and enormous straw art sculptures. The festival preserves Korea's rural traditions and offers a glimpse into the country's agrarian past.

name: Goroka Show
desc: One of the world's great cultural spectacles with 100+ tribal groups in extraordinary body paint and costume.
details: The Goroka Show is one of the most visually stunning cultural events on the planet. Over 100 tribal groups from across Papua New Guinea converge wearing elaborate headdresses, body paint, and traditional costumes to perform sing-sings (traditional dances and songs). It's an unparalleled display of cultural diversity.

name: Festival de Gramado (Cinema)
desc: Brazil's longest-running and most traditional film festival (since 1973) at Palácio dos Festivais with over 1,378 films submitted in 2026.
details: The 54th edition features record submissions with 44% increase from the previous year, indicating growing international recognition. The curatorial team includes film critic Marcos Santuário, actress Camila Morgado, and actor-director Caio Blat. The festival screens feature films, shorts, and documentaries with public screenings, national and international premieres, debates, and tributes to cinema legends. The event transforms Gramado's mountain landscape into a hub for film lovers, critics, and industry professionals.

name: ESNS (Eurosonic Noorderslag)
desc: Europe's most important showcase festival for emerging talent — 300+ acts from 39 countries performing across 40 venues in four days.
details: ESNS is where European music careers are launched. The 40th anniversary edition in 2026 features over 300 acts from 39 countries across nearly 40 venues. For talent scouts and industry professionals, it's essential; for travelers, it's a chance to discover Europe's most exciting emerging music before it hits stadiums. The ESNS Art programme adds visual arts across the city.

name: Canton Tower Light Show
desc: Spectacular light shows on the 600-meter Canton Tower—one of Asia's most striking buildings.
details: The Canton Tower (600m), one of the world's tallest structures, hosts spectacular LED light shows especially during Chinese New Year, National Day, and other holidays. The tower's twisting design and millions of LEDs create dramatic visual displays visible across Guangzhou.

name: 24th Bienal de Arte Paiz
desc: Central America's premier and world's sixth-oldest contemporary art biennial, curated by Eugenio Viola, uniting five continents for the first time.
details: The 24th Bienal de Arte Paiz, curated by Italian curator Eugenio Viola, spans three months and for the first time includes artists from all five continents. Founded in 1978, it is Central America's premier contemporary art event and Latin America's second-oldest biennial. This edition represents a major international expansion.

name: Festa dei Ceri
desc: Ancient race carrying 400kg wooden structures through Gubbio's steep medieval streets.
details: Teams of ceraioli carry three 4-metre, 400kg octagonal wooden structures (ceri) topped with saints through Gubbio's medieval streets in a frantic race up Monte Ingino. Dating to the 12th century.

name: Festival International de Hammamet
desc: A month-long celebration of music, dance, and performing arts in the picturesque coastal community of Hammamet.
details: This festival features dozens of jazz and international musicians along with French theatrical plays in the picturesque coastal setting of northeast Tunisia. Running for over a month, it has evolved from a pure music festival into a broader performing arts celebration that draws visitors from across the country and internationally.

name: Hong Kong International Literary Festival
desc: Asia's leading English-language literary festival attracting world-renowned authors.
details: The Hong Kong International Literary Festival brings together internationally acclaimed and Asian authors for readings, panel discussions, workshops, and cultural events across the city's venues. It is the leading English-language literary event in Asia, reflecting Hong Kong's position as a meeting point of Eastern and Western cultures.

name: Clockenflap Music & Arts Festival
desc: Hong Kong's biggest international music and arts festival featuring world-class headliners.
details: Clockenflap is Hong Kong's premier music and arts festival, featuring an eclectic lineup of international headliners and Asian artists across multiple stages. The festival also includes art installations, comedy, film, and workshops. Its harbourside setting provides one of the world's most spectacular music festival backdrops.

name: Noche Que Nadie Duerme (the Night When Nobody Sleeps)
desc: Unique tradition of creating ephemeral art with 7+ kilometers of flower and sawdust carpets throughout city streets.
details: Central to Feria de Huamantla (two-week August celebration featuring bull runs, dances, traditional food). On August 14, Virgin procession passes through streets covered with elaborate alfombras (carpets) and tapetes made from dyed sawdust with glitter and multicolored flowers. Community groups spend months planning, contributing materials, working 18+ hours creating designs. Carpets elaborate from central religious images framed with flower decorations; tapetes are pure artistic compositions. Intangible Cultural Heritage of Mexico (certified October 11, 2023). UNESCO recognition sought.

name: Danshig Naadam & Khuree Tsam
desc: Mongolia's grandest religious and cultural festival blending ancient Buddhist Tsam masked dances with Naadam sports.
details: Danshig Naadam is Mongolia's most important religious and cultural festival, connected to the enthronement ceremony of Zanabazar (1635-1722), spiritual head of Mongolian Buddhism. Features Tsam masked dance ceremonies (sacred morality plays to remove evil), the Three Games of Men (archery, wrestling, horse racing), and open-space sacred rituals with seven concentric chalk circles. First held in 1786 at Erdene-Zuu monastery; revived in 2015 after communist suppression.

name: Vendimia de Ica (Ica Wine & Pisco Harvest Festival)
desc: Peru's premiere wine and pisco harvest celebration featuring grape-stomping, winery tours, parades with allegorical floats, and performances of traditional Afro-Peruvian dances.
details: The Vendimia International Festival, which began in 1958, celebrates the grape harvest during the first week of March in the Ica region. The festival features the selection of the Queen of the Harvest, a contest symbolizing cultural importance, typically occurring in the first days. The Grand Parade travels through Ica's main avenues with allegorical floats, processions, and institutional delegations. Typical regional dances including festejo and Afro-Peruvian dances are performed at cultural evenings in plazas and temporary venues. Concerts with local and national artists perform Creole music and folkloric shows. Grape-stomping is carried out as a symbolic representation connecting to the region's wine-making history. The festival offers both locals and visitors an experience of Ica's wine-making heritage and authentic Peruvian culture.

name: Icheon Rice Cultural Festival
desc: Harvest festival celebrating Korea's finest rice region with traditional farming and cooking activities.
details: Icheon, famed for producing Korea's best rice (historically reserved for royalty), celebrates its harvest with a festival featuring rice harvesting, traditional rice cake making (tteok), rice wine tastings, and rural cultural experiences. The annual 'golden paddy field' landscape is particularly photogenic.

name: Isfahan Nowruz & Artisan Displays
desc: Isfahan's celebration of Nowruz with elaborate displays from 60,000 artisans in the UNESCO Creative City.
details: World Heritage sites prepared for Nowruz and Ramadan. Traditional crafts like Qalamkari and Khatam displayed in temporary markets. Rose-Water Festivals follow in May-June.

name: La Pasión de Cristo - Iztapalapa 2026
desc: UNESCO-recognized Intangible Cultural Heritage reenactment with 182 years of continuous tradition
details: Traditional representation of Passion, Death, Resurrection of Christ in Iztapalapa borough. UNESCO certification recognizes 182 years of history and community organization. 2026 will have alcohol ban (Ley Seca) April 2-3, 00:00-23:59 in eight original neighborhoods.

name: Kaifeng Chrysanthemum Festival
desc: Massive chrysanthemum display in the ancient Song Dynasty capital featuring millions of blooms.
details: Kaifeng, the ancient capital of the Northern Song Dynasty, celebrates its city flower with displays of over 3 million chrysanthemum plants in hundreds of varieties. The festival takes place around the reconstructed Song Dynasty theme park (Qingming Shanghe Yuan), recreating scenes from Zhang Zeduan's famous scroll painting.

name: Kaohsiung Lantern Festival
desc: Major southern Taiwan lantern celebration featuring spectacular waterfront installations at Love River and Lotus Pond.
details: Kaohsiung's Lantern Festival transforms the Love River and Lotus Pond areas into spectacular illuminated wonderlands. Massive lantern installations float on the water and line the riverbanks. The southern city's warm climate, waterfront setting, and elaborate light shows create a different atmosphere from northern Taiwan's celebrations.

name: Kashgar Sunday Market
desc: Legendary Central Asian bazaar at the crossroads of the Silk Road—one of the world's great markets.
details: The Kashgar Sunday Market (Yekshenba Bazaar) is one of the world's most extraordinary markets, a living remnant of Silk Road trade. Thousands of Uyghur, Tajik, Kyrgyz, and other Central Asian traders sell everything from livestock to dried fruits, carpets, and traditional instruments. The livestock market is particularly dramatic. While technically weekly, it's a cultural institution spanning centuries.

name: Kanamara Matsuri (Festival of the Steel Phallus)
desc: Colorful and quirky fertility festival featuring phallus-shaped floats and raising awareness for sexual health.
details: The Kanamara Matsuri at Kanayama Shrine is one of Japan's most unusual festivals. Giant phallus-shaped mikoshi are paraded through the streets in a celebration of fertility, sexual health, and marriage. The festival has become internationally famous and now raises funds for HIV research. Visitors can enjoy phallus-themed candy, souvenirs, and photo opportunities.

name: Kiel Week (Kieler Woche)
desc: World's largest sailing festival combining maritime events with concerts and cultural programmes.
details: Kiel Week draws over 3 million visitors for nine days of sailing regattas, live music across multiple stages, cultural events, and one of Northern Europe's biggest funfairs along the harbour promenade.

name: Jamaica Carnival
desc: Jamaica's unique fusion of soca road marches with dancehall influence and Kingston's global music identity.
details: Blends soca-powered road marches with dancehall influence, high-energy fetes, and massive after-parties. The fusion of Caribbean Carnival culture with Jamaica's global music identity creates a vibe both Caribbean-wide and unmistakably Kingston. Bacchanal Jamaica is the biggest carnival event on the island.

name: Klaipėda Sea Festival
desc: Lithuania's biggest annual event celebrating maritime culture with 100+ events since 1934.
details: The Sea Festival fills Lithuania's port city with sailing races, maritime processions, sea creature carnival, fishermen's contests, street theatre, and concerts. A floating concert stage debuts in 2026.

name: Yunnan Mushroom Festival
desc: Celebration of Yunnan's extraordinary wild mushroom diversity—the province produces 80% of China's edible fungi.
details: Yunnan produces approximately 80% of China's edible mushroom varieties, and summer festivals celebrate this extraordinary fungal diversity. Events feature mushroom markets, foraging tours, cooking competitions, and tastings of rare species. Nanhua County (self-proclaimed 'World Capital of Wild Mushrooms') hosts the largest celebration.

name: Kutztown Folk Festival
desc: America's oldest continuously operating folklife festival, celebrating Pennsylvania Dutch culture and traditions.
details: The Kutztown Folk Festival has celebrated Pennsylvania Dutch (German) heritage since 1950. The nine-day event features traditional crafts demonstrations, quilting, hex sign painting, folk music, square dancing, authentic Pennsylvania Dutch cooking, and the famous quilt auction. It is a living museum of this unique American cultural tradition.

name: Kuwait Liberation Day
desc: Celebrates liberation of Kuwait in 1991 with patriotic events and cultural celebrations.
details: Commemorates the liberation with military displays, cultural performances, and community celebrations across the country.

name: Kiyomizu-dera Night Illumination
desc: Stunning night illumination of Kyoto's most iconic temple with seasonal cherry blossoms or autumn foliage.
details: Kiyomizu-dera Temple—perhaps Kyoto's most famous site—opens for special evening illuminations during cherry blossom and autumn foliage seasons. The wooden stage, lit dramatically against the night sky with cherry blossoms or red maples, is one of Japan's most breathtaking seasonal scenes.

name: KOLFEST Music & Arts Festival
desc: Central Asia's major music and arts festival on Lake Issyk-Kul's south shore with 3,000+ international guests.
details: Features contemporary and traditional musicians, electronic music, art installations addressing environmental and cultural preservation, food court, yoga, dance, language lessons, yurt camping, and nomadic workshops (yurt-building, archery, cooking, felt-making). Shuttle buses from Bishkek, Tashkent, and Almaty.

name: East Gippsland Winter Festival
desc: Month-long festival with 80+ events including lanterns, workshops, and winter feasts across East Gippsland.
details: East Gippsland transforms during winter with a month-long festival featuring lantern parades, art workshops, winter feasts, live music, market events, and cultural activities spread across the beautiful Gippsland Lakes region.

name: Lijiang Sanduo Festival (Naxi)
desc: The grandest festival of the Naxi people celebrating their patron deity Sanduo with horse racing and dancing.
details: The Sanduo Festival is the most important celebration of the Naxi ethnic minority in Lijiang. Held at Beiyue Temple on Jade Dragon Snow Mountain, the festival features sacrificial ceremonies to the warrior deity Sanduo, horse racing, traditional Dongba music and dance, and communal feasting. The spectacular mountain setting adds to the atmosphere.

name: Limassol Carnival
desc: Largest carnival in Cyprus with elaborate parades, masquerades, and festive revelry over 10 days.
details: One of the Mediterranean's most vibrant carnivals with colorful parades, satirical floats, masquerade balls, and street performances. Culminates in Grand Parade on final Sunday.

name: Carnaval de Limoux
desc: World's longest carnival running 10 weekends from January to March.
details: Limoux's carnival is unique for running every weekend for nearly three months. Masked Goudils and Fecos bands parade through the central square each Saturday and Sunday.

name: Lisdoonvarna Matchmaking Festival
desc: Europe's largest singles event running for 150+ years with music, dancing, and matchmaking.
details: For the entire month of September, the tiny spa town of Lisdoonvarna becomes Ireland's romance capital. Europe's last traditional matchmaker, Willie Daly, plies his trade alongside live music, dancing, and social events.

name: London Festival of Architecture 2026
desc: A month-long celebration of architecture and city-making exploring the theme 'Belonging' across London neighbourhoods.
details: The London Festival of Architecture invites architects, designers, and creatives to engage with the theme 'Belonging' through installations, discussions, and events across various London neighbourhoods. Provides a platform for exploring dynamic interplay between architecture and community.

name: V&A Design and Disability Exhibition
desc: A groundbreaking V&A exhibition showcasing contributions of disabled, deaf, and neurodivergent people to contemporary design.
details: The Victoria and Albert Museum presents Design and Disability, exploring contributions of disabled, deaf, and neurodivergent people to design from the 1940s to today. A landmark exhibition for inclusive design discourse.

name: Taitung Hot Air Balloon Festival
desc: Colorful hot air balloon festival over Taiwan's stunning east coast valley with night glow events.
details: The Taiwan International Hot Air Balloon Festival at Luye Highland features dozens of colorful and novelty-shaped balloons against the stunning backdrop of Taitung's East Rift Valley. Dawn mass ascensions and evening Night Glow concerts (balloons lit up like giant lanterns to music) are highlights. Tethered rides are available.

name: Feast of the Drunken Dragon
desc: Unique Macanese tradition where performers dance with wooden dragons while drinking rice wine until inebriated.
details: The Feast of the Drunken Dragon is a uniquely Macanese UNESCO Intangible Cultural Heritage tradition. Fish sellers and performers dance through the streets with wooden dragon heads, drinking copious amounts of rice wine until they're 'drunk'—mimicking the legend of a drunken hero who slayed a dragon. The combination of religious ritual and revelry makes it one of Macau's most distinctive celebrations.

name: Paseo del Chagra
desc: Traditional Andean celebration where hundreds of chagras (highland horsemen) display finest attire, horses, and equestrian skills in colorful procession.
details: Machachi comes alive with hundreds of chagras on horseback parading through streets displaying best attire and horses. Festival selects chagras of the year and beautiful chagra women from highlands/valleys. Floats and allegorical cars showcase cultural/scenic wealth of Mejía canton. Recognized as Intangible Cultural Heritage of Ecuador. Historical origin: 1877 eruption of Cotopaxi volcano, locals organized to round up scattered livestock; mounted herders successfully corralled cattle, establishing tradition. Celebrates horsemanship, Andean culture, agricultural heritage.

name: Penghu Sea Fireworks Festival
desc: Weekly fireworks over the beautiful Penghu Islands creating a months-long summer celebration.
details: The Penghu International Fireworks Festival runs for nearly three months with weekly displays over the stunning turquoise waters of this offshore archipelago. International pyrotechnic teams compete alongside local displays. The combination of island beaches, basalt landscapes, and brilliant fireworks creates Taiwan's most photogenic summer event.

name: Atlas Bayrami (Silk Festival)
desc: International festival celebrating Margilan's renowned ikat silk-weaving traditions with UNESCO recognition.
details: International festival held biennially since 2015, celebrating Margilan's renowned silk-weaving traditions and ikat textile heritage. Features artistic exhibitions, fashion shows, live silk-making workshops, and master classes on traditional dyeing and weaving. UNESCO-recognized intangible cultural heritage event with participants from 20+ countries.

name: Púca Festival
desc: Ireland's festival celebrating the ancient roots of Halloween through Samhain, with parades led by the mythical Púca creature, fire shows, and storytelling.
details: The Púca Festival celebrates the ancient Irish festival of Samhain — the true origin of Halloween. Highlights include a parade led by the Púca (a mythical creature from Irish folklore), storytelling sessions, fire shows, live music, and dance performances. It's a atmospheric immersion into Ireland's deep connection with mythology and the supernatural.

name: Melbourne Cup Carnival
desc: Australia's most famous horse racing carnival culminating in the race that stops a nation.
details: The Melbourne Cup Carnival is a week of world-class thoroughbred racing at Flemington Racecourse, featuring Derby Day, Melbourne Cup Day, Oaks Day, and Stakes Day. The Cup itself is a national institution — the race that stops a nation — with fashion, food, and entertainment.

name: South Beach Wine & Food Festival
desc: Star-studded culinary festival featuring celebrity chefs, wine tastings, and beachside dining in South Beach.
details: SOBEWFF brings together the world's most acclaimed chefs, wine and spirits producers, and culinary personalities for four days of tastings, demonstrations, dinners, and parties across Miami Beach. The festival benefits the Chaplin School of Hospitality at FIU and has become the premier culinary event in the Southeast.

name: Congadas and Folias de Reis
desc: Traditional folk processions honoring the three wise men (Folias) and celebrating African Catholic syncretism (Congadas) with singing, instrumental music, and theatrical elements.
details: Folias de Reis (celebrated early January around the Epiphany) involves groups of cantadores (singers) and instrumentalists performing verses honoring the three wise men (Baltazar, Belchior, Gaspar). Originating from Portuguese tradition, the practice was registered by IPHAN as intangible heritage with over 1,600 groups in Minas Gerais alone. Congadas, celebrated in September, blend Catholic traditions with African heritage, featuring theatrical processions and dance competitions celebrating the coronation of African kings and queens.

name: Mitsuke Tenjin Hadaka Matsuri
desc: Wild naked festival in Niigata where men in loincloths battle in mud and water to cleanse the community.
details: Mitsuke's Hadaka Matsuri is one of several naked festivals across Japan where men wearing only fundoshi (loincloths) participate in ritual purification involving mud, water, and physical competition. The communal spirit and primal energy make these among Japan's most visceral cultural experiences.

name: Fantasia International Film Festival
desc: North America's largest genre film festival specializing in horror, sci-fi, fantasy, and action cinema.
details: Fantasia is the most important genre film festival in North America, screening over 400 films across horror, science fiction, fantasy, animation, and action categories. The three-week festival attracts filmmakers and fans from around the world to Montreal.

name: Montreux Jazz Festival
desc: One of the world's most legendary jazz festivals on the shores of Lake Geneva, drawing legendary performers since 1967 from Miles Davis to modern icons.
details: Since 1967, the Montreux Jazz Festival has drawn legends including Miles Davis, Ella Fitzgerald, Nina Simone, and Frank Zappa to the shores of Lake Geneva. Today the lineup spans jazz, blues, soul, rock, and electronic music. The lakeside setting with the Alps as a backdrop is unmatched. Free outdoor stages complement ticketed concerts in the legendary Stravinsky Auditorium and Miles Davis Hall.

name: East Africa Art Biennale (EASTAFAB)
desc: The 11th edition transforms Nairobi into a focal point for East African creativity, with satellite shows across five countries.
details: EASTAFAB 2026 features 120+ artists from Tanzania, Kenya, Uganda, Rwanda, Burundi, and neighboring nations. Themed 'Common Grounds, New Horizons: Reimagining East African Futures,' it includes satellite shows in Dar es Salaam, Kampala, Kigali, and Bujumbura. Known for inclusivity and regional artistic unification.

name: Cappadocia Techno Festival
desc: Electronic music festival set against Cappadocia's otherworldly landscape of fairy chimneys.
details: Five days of electronic music, art installations, and cultural experiences among Cappadocia's ancient cave dwellings and volcanic rock formations create a truly unique festival setting.

name: Nihonmatsu Lantern Festival
desc: Magnificent festival with seven ornate yatai floats illuminated by 300+ lanterns parading through a castle town.
details: The Nihonmatsu Lantern Festival features seven elaborate yatai floats, each illuminated by over 300 red and gold paper lanterns, paraded through the historic castle town. The combination of the ornate floats, hundreds of swaying lanterns, and the autumn atmosphere creates one of the Tohoku region's most beautiful festival scenes.

name: Abare Matsuri (Violence Festival)
desc: Wild Noto Peninsula festival where giant torches are flung into the sea and mikoshi are smashed and burned.
details: The Abare Matsuri in Ushitsu, Noto Peninsula, is one of Japan's most chaotic festivals. Giant kiriko lantern floats are paraded through the streets before enormous torches are hurled into the sea. Portable shrines are deliberately thrown into rivers, smashed against the ground, and even burned—all to please the deities through destructive energy. Not for the faint-hearted.

name: Guelaguetza (Los Lunes del Cerro)
desc: Oaxaca’s signature Indigenous cultural festival with regional dances, music, and traditional dress.

name: Ovlla Opera
desc: Opera confronting the historical oppression of the Sámi people.
details: A vital joint production by Oulu Theatre and the Sámi National Theatre exploring indigenous roots and state violence.

name: Oulu Symphony: Beyond the Sky
desc: An innovative orchestral experience blending science and art.
details: Utilizes advanced projection technology to bring distant nebulae within the audience's reach while accompanied by live symphonic music.

name: Paphos Aphrodite Festival
desc: Opera festival in the medieval Paphos Castle celebrating the birthplace of Aphrodite.
details: The Paphos Aphrodite Festival presents opera against the stunning backdrop of Paphos Castle and harbour, celebrating the birthplace of Aphrodite with world-class performances.

name: Taste of Paris
desc: Paris's premier food festival with top chefs and gourmet markets.
details: Taste of Paris brings Michelin-starred chefs and gourmet producers to the Grand Palais for tastings, cooking demonstrations, and culinary discovery.

name: We Love Green
desc: Eco-conscious music festival in Bois de Vincennes powered by 100% renewable energy.
details: We Love Green combines cutting-edge music programming with environmental commitment, featuring 100% renewable energy, vegetarian food options, and sustainability workshops alongside international artists.

name: Chhath Puja
desc: An ancient Hindu sun worship festival with thousands standing in rivers at dawn, creating one of India's most photogenic spiritual moments.
details: Chhath Puja is one of India's most devotional festivals, dedicated to the Sun God. Devotees fast for 36 hours and stand waist-deep in rivers at dawn and dusk to offer prayers. Patna's Ganga ghats become crowded with thousands of worshippers holding offerings of fruits and sweets on bamboo trays. The sunrise prayers create breathtaking photographic moments.

name: Pingyao International Photography Festival
desc: Major photography festival set within the UNESCO World Heritage ancient walled city of Pingyao.
details: The Pingyao International Photography Festival, held in the beautifully preserved Ming/Qing Dynasty walled city, has become one of Asia's most important photography events. Exhibitions are mounted in ancient courtyard houses, temples, and along the city walls, creating a unique dialogue between contemporary photography and centuries-old architecture.

name: Gioco del Ponte
desc: Gioco del Ponte — colorful parade and "battle" for control of the Ponte di Mezzo
details: Teams from Pisa's north and south sides push a 7-tonne cart across the Ponte di Mezzo bridge in a fierce contest preceded by a magnificent historical procession with 700 participants.

name: Corpus Christi
desc: Eight-day festival mixing Christian Holy Communion celebration with Inca sun god Inti and harvest traditions featuring El Danzante parade.
details: Declared Intangible Heritage of Ecuador. Festival runs 8 days with Sunday culmination. Mix of Christian and indigenous traditions: celebration of Holy Communion combined with Inti (Inca sun god) and harvest thanksgiving. Main attraction: El Danzante parade with elaborate costumes, traditional dances, live music, visual feast of colors/movement. Celebration honors Andean condor. Highlights: Indigenous groups, religious processions, cultural performances combining colonial Christian elements with pre-Columbian Andean traditions.

name: Manif d'art 12 – Quebec City Biennial
desc: North America's only winter biennial, themed 'Splitting Ice,' explores embodied practices rooted in water and its seasonal forms.
details: Manif d'art 12, curated by Didier Morelli under the theme 'Briser la glace / Splitting Ice,' presents over 100 local, national, and international artists. The biennial commemorates intergenerational legacies of performance across embodied practices rooted in water. Artistic Director Claude Bélanger oversees this unique winter event.

name: Parrandas de Remedios
desc: Cuba's oldest and largest festival featuring two rival neighborhood groups competing with elaborate floats and spectacular fireworks displays.
details: Held for the first time in 1820, this UNESCO heritage-protected festival divides the town into two groups: the Carmelitas (eagle emblem, blue color) and the Sansaries (rooster emblem, red color). Each group secretly builds massive floats and elaborate structures packed with thousands of multicolor lightbulbs showing moving figures (Trabajos de Plaza). The highlight on December 24 features synchronized fireworks, music, dancing, and street celebrations extending through the night. Traditional foods include pan con lechón, popcorn, churros, and cotton candy. Now celebrated by 18 communities in central Cuba.

name: Janadriyah / National Heritage & Culture Festival
desc: Saudi Arabia's most iconic cultural festival celebrating heritage with camel races, Ardah sword dances, regional crafts, and traditional cuisine.
details: Launched in 1985, Janadriyah is one of Saudi Arabia's oldest and most significant cultural celebrations. The two-week festival showcases traditional arts, crafts, music, dance, and cuisine from every Saudi region. Highlights include camel races, falconry demonstrations, Ardah sword dances, poetry recitals, and working displays of carpet-weaving, pottery-making, and woodcarving. The festival draws over one million visitors annually and features a guest country pavilion each year.

name: Dia de los Muertos
desc: Multi-day Day of the Dead celebration along the River Walk and at La Villita with altars, music, and cultural programming.
details: San Antonio's rich Mexican-American heritage shines during its Dia de los Muertos celebrations. The River Walk and La Villita Historic Arts Village host elaborate altar displays, live music, traditional dance, face painting, and culinary events honoring departed loved ones.

name: San Francisco Pride
desc: One of the largest LGBTQ+ Pride celebrations in the world, centered around Market Street and Civic Center.
details: San Francisco Pride features a massive parade down Market Street with hundreds of contingents, followed by a two-day celebration at Civic Center Plaza with multiple stages, community booths, and cultural events. SF's deep connection to LGBTQ+ history makes this one of the most significant Pride events globally.

name: International Architecture Biennial Costa Rica 2026
desc: Titled 'Arquitectura Esencial' (Essential Architecture), inviting reflection on fundamental architectural values.
details: The International Architecture Biennial Costa Rica 2026 runs May 27-30 in San José. Titled 'Arquitectura Esencial,' it reflects on identity, function, and meaning in architecture. A key event for Central American and Latin American architectural discourse.

name: Noche de San Juan
desc: Midsummer night traditions including beach gatherings and nighttime rituals.

name: Festival de Cine Pobre (poor Film Festival)
desc: Festival celebrating independent and low-budget cinema in mountain community, promoting filmmaking without major resources.
details: Held in mountain community of San Mateo Río Hondo, Oaxaca. Three-day festival showcasing independent films made with minimal resources. Emphasizes creative storytelling over production budgets. Promotes democratic filmmaking ideology. Intimate mountain setting creates unique festival atmosphere.

name: Belize Lobster Fest - San Pedro, Caye Caulker, Placencia
desc: Summer kickoff celebration coinciding with first lobster harvests, featuring seafood stalls, beach parties, DJs, pageants, and local music across island communities.
details: Lobsterfest is an official summer kickoff event celebrated in three main locations: Caye Caulker, San Pedro, and Placencia. In 2026, Placencia's Lobsterfest runs July 3-5, while San Pedro traditionally runs July 1-12. The festivals celebrate the start of the annual lobster fishing season with food, music, cultural traditions, and community celebration. In San Pedro on Ambergris Caye, festivities often begin with a week-long "Lobster Crawl," where restaurants and bars serve creative lobster dishes and culminate in a lively block party with live music and dancing. On Caye Caulker, Lobsterfest features beach parties, DJs, pageants, seafood stalls, and local music, making it a distinct island experience. Placencia's Lobsterfest is famous for its massive beach parties with food booths dishing out lobster tacos and chowder, steelpan music, and games making it super family-friendly.

name: Feria Nacional del Mole (mole Festival)
desc: Mexico's premier gastronomic celebration of mole sauce with hundreds of restaurants serving traditional varieties.
details: San Pedro Atocpan produces 60% of mole pastes used nationwide and 89% of mole consumed in Mexico City. The 48th edition features hundreds of restaurants offering different mole varieties accompanied by ideal drinks, plus concerts, dances, craft sales, rides, and rodeos. Families, tourists, and mole enthusiasts gather for this important culinary celebration honoring Mexico's most complex and revered sauce.

name: Tsubame-Sanjo Factory Festival
desc: Open factory festival in Japan's metalworking capital where workshops open their doors to visitors.
details: Tsubame-Sanjo, Japan's center of metal craftsmanship (producing 90% of the country's cutlery), opens its workshops and factories to the public. Visitors can watch artisans at work, try their hand at metal forging, and purchase products directly. It's a rare glimpse into Japan's industrial craft heritage.

name: 12th SITE Santa Fe International
desc: Curated by Cecilia Alemani, 'Once Within a Time' focuses on visual storytelling across SITE Santa Fe and New Mexico venues.
details: The 12th SITE Santa Fe International, curated by Cecilia Alemani, extends beyond SITE's building into New Mexico state museums and local businesses. Launched in 1995 to bring global contemporary art to the Southwest. Features 71 international artists in a sprawling exhibition focused on the art of visual storytelling.

name: Festa de São Pedro (Fishermen's Festivals)
desc: Traditional celebrations honoring Saint Peter, the patron saint of fishermen, with maritime processions, oar auctions, and local gastronomy.
details: Festa de São Pedro is celebrated annually in Brazilian coastal communities honoring the patron saint of fishermen. These regional festivals feature religious processions, traditional maritime rituals, oar auctions, canoe races, and "Rainha dos Pescadores" (Fishermen's Queen) contests. Events blend Catholic tradition with Caiçara culture, showcasing local heritage through music, typical gastronomy, and community celebrations across multiple coastal cities.

name: Bienal do Livro de São Paulo
desc: The largest international book fair in Latin America featuring publishers, authors, and book lovers with cultural programming and literary events.
details: The 28th International Book Fair of São Paulo takes place at Anhembi District Pavilion, recognized as the largest multicultural event in the publishing sector. The ten-day festival features author talks, debates, book launches, immersive experiences, children's activities, and professional programming for publishers and booksellers nationally and internationally. Novel topics for 2026 include debates on artificial intelligence and editorial accessibility, plus dedicated spaces for indigenous and Afro-Brazilian literature.

name: Sapporo Autumn Harvest Festival
desc: Major food festival in Odori Park showcasing Hokkaido's world-class agricultural and seafood bounty.
details: The Sapporo Autumn Harvest Festival transforms Odori Park into an open-air food market celebrating Hokkaido's legendary produce. Fresh seafood, lamb, dairy, vegetables, and wines from across the island are available. The festival captures Hokkaido's identity as Japan's culinary breadbasket.

name: Sarajevo Winter Festival
desc: Major international arts festival themed 'AI Artificial Intelligence & IA Intelligence in Art'.
details: The 41st Sarajevo Winter Festival explores the relationship between art and new technologies across visual arts, performance, music, film, literature, and multimedia.

name: Gwangjang Market Food Festival
desc: Seoul's oldest traditional market and street food paradise—a year-round culinary festival experience.
details: While Gwangjang Market operates year-round, special festivals celebrate this 119-year-old market's incredible food culture. The market's Meokja Golmok (Let's Eat Alley) serves iconic Korean street foods: bindaetteok (mung bean pancakes), mayak gimbap (addictive rice rolls), yukhoe (raw beef), and tteokbokki. It's a continuous culinary festival experience.

name: Feria de Abril de Sevilla
desc: Seville's spectacular spring fair with flamenco dancing, horse parades, and over 1,000 casetas.
details: Two weeks after Semana Santa, Seville erupts into the Feria de Abril. Women wear stunning flamenco dresses, families gather in ornate casetas (tents) for dancing and sherry, and horse-drawn carriages parade through illuminated streets.

name: Sidmouth Folk Festival
desc: Week-long celebration of folk music, dance, workshops, and storytelling in a seaside Devon town.
details: The 72nd Sidmouth Folk Festival transforms this charming seaside town with folk music, Morris dancing, ceilidhs, workshops, and storytelling across multiple venues and outdoor stages.

name: Fiestas del 20 de Enero
desc: Historic celebration honoring the Dulce Nombre de Jesús with corralejas (traditional cattle events) at the world's largest bullring.
details: The 2026 edition is historic as Sincelejo will feature the world's largest bullring (370 meters in the redondel with 9 ranchers participating). Festivities include parades of comparsas, queen coronation with free concerts, bullfighting, traditional cattle events, and colorful processions. This could be the last official bullring festival before new national regulations.

name: Delheim Harvest Festival
desc: Family-friendly wine harvest celebration with grape stomping, tractor rides, live music, and a harvest feast.
details: The Delheim Harvest Festival invites guests to join the Delheim winemaking families for traditional festivities including grape picking, stomping, live music, cellar tours, and a harvest-style lunch. Set in the stunning Stellenbosch winelands, it's a quintessential Cape experience.

name: Royal Easter Show
desc: Australia's largest annual ticketed event celebrating agriculture, food, entertainment, and rural life.
details: The Sydney Royal Easter Show has been held since 1823, bringing the country to the city. Over 12 days, it features agricultural competitions, animal exhibitions, showbag pavilions, carnival rides, live entertainment, food displays, and woodchopping — attracting nearly a million visitors.

name: Fiesta Patria Gaucha
desc: National gaucho festival celebrating rural heritage with competitions and traditional performances.
details: Held at Laguna de las Lavanderas grounds. Theme: "Pilchas gauchas: símbolo de identidad y tradición" (Gaucho garments: symbol of identity and tradition). Features traditionalist society competitions recreating rural scenes pre-1920, competing for Grand Prize. Includes "Prof. Uruguay Nieto" National Folklore Dance Competition, National Guasquería (leather work) Competition, jineteadas and rein tests, Creole cuisine competitions, fried pastries, silverware exhibitions. "Miguel Ángel Ortiz" stage with artists: Ke Personajes, Karina "La Princesita", Destino San Javier, Campedrinos, Lucas Sugo, others.

name: Tai Hang Fire Dragon Dance
desc: Spectacular mid-autumn tradition where a 67-meter fire dragon studded with incense sticks dances through narrow streets.
details: The Tai Hang Fire Dragon Dance is a UNESCO Intangible Cultural Heritage tradition. During the Mid-Autumn Festival, a 67-meter dragon embedded with over 70,000 incense sticks is carried through the narrow streets of Tai Hang by 300+ participants. The tradition dates to the 1880s when villagers performed the dance to ward off a plague. The combination of glowing incense, smoke, and drumming is mesmerizing.

name: Tai O Dragon Boat Water Parade
desc: Unique waterborne parade in the atmospheric stilt-house fishing village of Tai O.
details: Tai O's Dragon Boat Festival celebration is unique—deity statues are carried on dragon boats through the waterways of this atmospheric stilt-house fishing village on Lantau Island. The intimate scale and traditional fishing village setting make it one of Hong Kong's most authentic cultural experiences, far from the city's gleaming towers.

name: Sisters' Meal Festival (Miao)
desc: The 'oldest Oriental Valentine's Day' where Miao young women use colored rice to communicate romantic intentions.
details: The Sisters' Meal Festival in Taijiang County is the Miao people's unique love festival. Young women prepare multi-colored glutinous rice and present it to suitors—hidden symbols in the rice convey romantic messages. The three-day celebration includes dragon boat races on the Qingshui River, elaborate silver costume parades, lusheng dancing, and bullfighting competitions.

name: Asakusa Samba Carnival
desc: South America meets Tokyo—Japan's biggest samba parade with 5,000 dancers in Asakusa.
details: The Asakusa Samba Carnival is the largest samba event outside Brazil. About 5,000 dancers in spectacular costumes parade through Asakusa's streets, watched by half a million spectators. Teams compete in categories judged on dance, music, and costumes. The incongruity of Brazilian samba against the backdrop of Sensoji Temple is uniquely Tokyo.

name: Bombing of Master Handan
desc: Wild Taiwanese folk tradition where a near-naked man is bombarded with firecrackers to bring prosperity.
details: During the Lantern Festival in Taitung, a man wearing only red shorts and a face mask portrays Master Handan (God of Wealth) standing on a sedan chair while crowds throw firecrackers directly at him. The louder and more explosive the bombardment, the more wealth is believed to come. Participants believe the pain brings prosperity. It's one of Taiwan's most extreme folk traditions.

name: Taos Pueblo Powwow
desc: Intertribal powwow at one of the oldest continuously inhabited communities in North America.
details: The Taos Pueblo Powwow takes place against the stunning backdrop of the 1,000-year-old multi-story adobe pueblo and the Sangre de Cristo Mountains. Traditional dance competitions, drumming, and cultural demonstrations celebrate Native traditions.

name: 2nd Hengshan Calligraphy Biennale
desc: Featuring 87 works by 45 artists from Taiwan, China, and Japan, re-centering calligraphy as an act of writing.
details: The 2nd Hengshan Calligraphy Biennale at Taoyuan Museum of Fine Arts, curated by Professor Lin Chun-chen, titled 'Calligraphy in Movement: From Literati's Desk to People's Streets.' Challenges the trend of viewing calligraphy purely as visual form, spanning traditional hanging scrolls to cross-disciplinary collaborations.

name: Judo Grand Slam Tashkent
desc: Second stop of the IJF World Tour judo season at Humo Arena.
details: OTP Group Tashkent Grand Slam 2026, second stop of the IJF World Tour judo season. Features international judoka competing at the highest level of Olympic sport with world-class athletes and judging standards at Humo Arena.

name: 41st Fajr Intl Music Festival
desc: Iran's largest annual film festival celebrating art and cultural identity on anniversary of 1979 Revolution.
details: Founded 1982, supervised by Ministry of Culture. Features award categories including Crystal Simorgh. President Pezeshkian attended closing ceremony at Vahdat Hall.

name: Ger (Yurt) Festival
desc: Celebration of Mongolia's iconic nomadic dwelling with ger building, decoration, and nomadic life experiences.
details: Mongolia's ger (yurt) festivals celebrate the iconic felt tent that has been home to nomadic peoples for millennia. Events include competitive ger-building (teams race to erect full gers), traditional felt-making demonstrations, nomadic cooking, and overnight stays in decorated gers. The celebration honors the ingenuity of nomadic architecture.

name: 9th Thessaloniki Biennale of Contemporary Art
desc: Titled 'everything must change,' this edition confronts AI and radical intelligence through art, curated by Nadja Argyropoulou.
details: The 9th Thessaloniki Biennale opened October 31, 2025 with preliminary events, building to main exhibitions May 23–July 5, 2026. Organized by MOMUS, it explores intelligence beyond the typical technological binary. Venues include Thessaloniki International Fair and the Axios Delta National Park. Co-financed by the European Union.

name: Festival Gastronômico de Tiradentes
desc: 29th edition selected as one of world's best places to eat in 2026 by Condé Nast Traveller, uniting gastronomy, culture, and local producers.
details: Created in 1998 as Brazil's pioneering event combining gastronomy with culture, the Festival reunites major chefs, sensory experiences, special menus, classes, and workshops. Festival promotion from Condé Nast Traveller (only Brazilian representative among 26 global destinations) highlights international recognition. Bradesco and Gasmig confirm as sponsors. The festival celebrates regional cuisine, local producers, and invited internationally-recognized chefs in historic colonial town atmosphere.

name: Toyohashi Gion Festival
desc: Spectacular festival featuring hand-held fireworks (tegata hanabi) performed dangerously close to spectators.
details: Toyohashi's Gion Festival is famous for its dangerous tegata hanabi—performers hold large fireworks by hand while sparks fly directly over their bodies and the crowd. The event also features ornate float processions and traditional performances.

name: Rose of Tralee
desc: Ireland's largest festival featuring an international pageant, parades, music, and fireworks.
details: The Rose of Tralee celebrates Irish culture worldwide through its televised rose selection, street entertainment, concerts, circus performances, and spectacular fireworks display.

name: Tsushima Tenno Matsuri
desc: Spectacular evening river festival with illuminated boats carrying makiwara lanterns.
details: The Tsushima Tenno Matsuri features elaborately decorated boats on the Tenno River. On the first evening (yoimatsuri), boats carry makiwara—circular formations of 365 (or 400+ on leap years) paper lanterns representing the days of the year. The reflected lights on the river create an ethereal scene. Day two features karakuri puppet performances on the boats.

name: Feria Internacional de la Pirotecnia (pyrotechnics Fair)
desc: The world's premier pyrotechnics festival showcasing fireworks displays, competitions, and traditional "torito" (bull) parades.
details: Held at Avenida de los Parajes 17 in San Antonio Xahuento, Tultepec. The Concurso Nacional de Piromusicales (national pyromusical competition) inaugurates the fair on February 28. Over 400 pyrotechnic "toritos" (movable pyrotechnic bulls) parade through streets on March 6 in honor of San Juan de Dios. This unique festival blends Mexican traditions with explosive artistry. Tultepec is traditionally known as Mexico's fireworks capital.

name: Winter Solstice Lantern Festival
desc: Community winter solstice celebration with handmade lantern procession through Vancouver's parks.
details: This community-driven celebration marks the shortest day of the year with a magical lantern procession. Participants carry handmade lanterns through darkened parks, accompanied by fire spinners, musicians, and performers. The event celebrates light's return and community togetherness.

name: Stara Planina Fest Balkan Folk
desc: Europe's leading traditional folk arts festival with groups from 30+ countries.
details: The 29th Stara Planina Fest attracts 8,000-15,000 musicians, singers, and dancers from 30+ countries. It simultaneously hosts the Bulgarian National Championship Euro Folk and World Cup of Folklore.

name: Verona Opera Festival (Arena di Verona)
desc: World-class opera performed in a spectacular 2,000-year-old Roman amphitheater under the stars — one of the most magical performance settings on Earth.
details: The Arena di Verona's summer opera festival stages grand productions of classic operas (Aida, Carmen, La Traviata) in a superbly preserved 1st-century Roman amphitheater that seats 15,000. Audience members traditionally light candles at dusk, creating a sea of flickering lights. The combination of world-class singing, the ancient setting, and warm Italian summer nights is genuinely spellbinding.

name: Viareggio Carnival
desc: Tuscany's spectacular carnival features enormous satirical papier-mâché floats — some five stories tall — parading along the seaside promenade.
details: Viareggio's carnival is famous for its gigantic satirical papier-mâché floats, some reaching five stories tall, that parade along the town's broad seafront promenade. Master craftsmen spend months building these enormous moving sculptures that often lampoon politicians and celebrities. The parades take place on selected Sundays and the final Fat Tuesday throughout February.

name: Vienna Ball Season (Wiener Ballsaison)
desc: 450+ lavish balls including the legendary Vienna Opera Ball.
details: Vienna's ball season sees 450+ balls in venues from the Hofburg Palace to the Vienna State Opera. Waltzing couples in white tie and ballgowns make it Europe's most elegant social season.

name: Vienna Festival (Wiener Festwochen)
desc: Vienna's largest performing arts festival celebrating 75 years with international premieres.
details: Wiener Festwochen is one of Europe's most important performing arts festivals, presenting international theatre, opera, dance, and new performance works across venues throughout Vienna over five weeks.

name: Fiesta Nacional de la Cerveza
desc: The third largest beer festival in the world, celebrating craft beer culture with music, food, and entertainment.
details: Features 3 beer taps per day, new VIP space with privileged seating, and a prestigious lineup including Soledad, Estelares, Turf, Los Palmeras, Los Abuelos de la Nada, and Airbag. Tribute bands include The End (Pink Floyd), El Cuarto Soda (Soda Estéreo), and Salieris de Charly. VIP packages include food, beer, beverages, and parking.

name: Vilnius Light Festival
desc: Free three-day light art celebration transforming UNESCO Old Town for the city's 703rd birthday.
details: Vilnius Light Festival turns the UNESCO-listed Old Town into an open-air gallery of contemporary light art installations each evening, celebrating the city's founding anniversary.

name: Salute to America 250 Fireworks
desc: Peak Semiquincentennial event with presidential remarks and the "largest pyrotechnics display in the history of the world."
details: Promises the largest pyrotechnics display in global history alongside a keynote address by the President on the National Mall.

name: Great American State Fair
desc: Master-planned celebration on the National Mall with beaux-arts pavilions for every US state and territory.
details: Held on the National Mall, featuring elaborate beaux-arts pavilions for innovation, agriculture, civic history, and local cuisine.

name: Smithsonian Folklife Festival
desc: Free outdoor cultural festival on the National Mall celebrating living cultural heritage from communities worldwide.
details: Produced by the Smithsonian Center for Folklife and Cultural Heritage, this festival transforms the National Mall into a living showcase of cultural traditions. Each year features different cultural programs highlighting music, crafts, cooking, storytelling, and rituals from specific communities or countries. It is the largest annual cultural event in Washington, D.C., and completely free to attend.

name: National Cherry Blossom Festival
desc: Celebration of the blooming of 3,700+ cherry trees gifted by Japan, featuring parades, cultural performances, and fireworks.
details: Commemorating the 1912 gift of 3,000 cherry trees from Mayor Yukio Ozaki of Tokyo, this festival celebrates the enduring friendship between the US and Japan. Events include the spectacular Blossom Kite Festival, a Japanese street fair, fireworks, the National Cherry Blossom Festival Parade, and the iconic Peak Bloom watch along the Tidal Basin.

name: Xi'an Silk Road International Tourism Festival
desc: Cultural festival celebrating Xi'an's role as the eastern terminus of the ancient Silk Road.
details: Xi'an's Silk Road Festival celebrates the city's historical importance as the start of the ancient trade route. Events include cultural exhibitions, traditional music and dance from Silk Road nations, food markets featuring Central Asian and Chinese cuisine, and activities at the ancient city wall and Muslim Quarter.

name: Zigong Lantern Festival
desc: China's premier lantern art festival featuring enormous, intricate illuminated sculptures in the 'Lantern City.'
details: Zigong has been known as China's Lantern City for centuries, and its annual lantern festival is the most elaborate in the country. Thousands of handcrafted lanterns—some spanning entire parks—depict scenes from Chinese mythology, nature, and modern themes. The festival uses traditional techniques like porcelain-bound lanterns and silk-draped frames alongside modern LED technology. The displays tour internationally after the festival.

name: Midsummer (Baltic States)
desc: Major celebration across all Baltic states with bonfires, singing, dancing, and ancient traditions.
details: Midsummer (Jaanipäev/Jāņi/Joninės) is the most important summer celebration across the Baltic States. Bonfires are lit and jumped for prosperity, forest fern flowers are sought, and communities gather for all-night singing and feasting.

name: Rara Festival
desc: Unique traditional carnival celebration separate from pre-Lent festivities, featuring parades and traditional Rara music.
details: Rara processions take place during day and sometimes night during Lent, culminating in a week-long celebration at the end of Lent during Catholic "Holy Week" including the Easter holiday. Rara celebrations include parades with musicians playing drums, tin trumpets, bamboo horns (vaksens), and other instruments. Rara music style and performances are distinctive to Haiti. Little Haiti Kanaval Block Party takes place March 7, 2026 at the Little Haiti Cultural Center 6-11 p.m., featuring live music and performances, RaRa-style parade with traditional street chanting, and food vendors serving classic Haitian dishes.

name: Mehregan / Autumn Festival
desc: Ancient Persian harvest and thanksgiving festival dedicated to Mithra, the deity of light.
details: One of Iran's oldest celebrations honoring Mithra. Features family gatherings, traditional foods, and gratitude ceremonies. Particularly observed in Isfahan and Shiraz.

name: Sadeh / Fire Festival
desc: Ancient Zoroastrian midwinter festival celebrating the discovery of fire.
details: Zoroastrian festival marking 50 days before Nowruz. Communities light large bonfires, celebrate with music and dance. Particularly observed in Yazd and Kerman.

name: Passover / Pesach
desc: Week-long Jewish festival commemorating the Exodus from Egypt with Seder meals and celebrations.
details: Features Seder dinners, matzah eating, spring festivals, concerts, and cultural events. Major holiday with school breaks and family gatherings.

name: Purim Celebrations
desc: Festive Jewish holiday with costumes, parades, parties, and street celebrations across Israel.
details: Features massive street parties, costume parades, carnivals, megillah readings, and mishloach manot gift exchanges. Particularly vibrant in Tel Aviv.

name: Feast of the Assumption / Ferragosto
desc: Italy's most important summer holiday when the entire country stops for beach celebrations, processions, and fireworks marking the Assumption of Mary.
details: Ferragosto on August 15 is Italy's most important summer holiday. The entire country essentially shuts down as Italians head to beaches, mountains, and family gatherings. Religious processions mark the Assumption of Mary while fireworks displays light up coastlines nationwide. Many businesses close for the surrounding week. It's the heart of Italian summer — when the country collectively relaxes.

name: Aarhus Festuge
desc: One of Scandinavia's largest cultural events—a 10-day multidisciplinary arts festival transforming the entire city of Aarhus.
details: The Aarhus Festival is a massive celebration of music, visual arts, theatre, street performances, art installations, and gastronomy. It showcases local, national, and international talent and transforms the city into a playground of creativity. Community projects and workshops involve entire neighbourhoods, giving the festival a genuinely local feel.

name: Qasr Al Hosn Festival
desc: A festival centered around Abu Dhabi's oldest standing structure with storytelling, exhibitions, and cultural performances.
details: Centered around Abu Dhabi's oldest standing structure, this festival offers a deep dive into the emirate's history through storytelling, exhibitions, workshops, and cultural performances that highlight the city's roots and traditions. It connects visitors with Abu Dhabi's heritage in an intimate and educational setting.

name: Tasting Australia
desc: Premier food and wine festival showcasing South Australia's world-class produce and culinary talent.
details: Tasting Australia is a 10-day celebration of South Australian food, wine, and culinary creativity. Events range from immersive dining experiences and masterclasses to market events and regional tours, spotlighting the state's renowned wine regions and food producers.

name: Aizuwakamatsu Autumn Festival
desc: Samurai festival in the 'last stronghold of the samurai' with processions in full feudal armor.
details: Aizuwakamatsu's autumn festival honors the city's samurai heritage as the last stronghold of feudal loyalty. Processions of men in authentic samurai armor march to Tsurugajo Castle. The historical significance of the Byakkotai (White Tiger Force) tragedy adds emotional depth to the celebration.

name: Games of the Future 2026
desc: International phygital sports tournament combining physical and digital competition with $10 million prize pool.
details: The Games of the Future is an annual phygital (physical + digital) sports tournament featuring 1,500 athletes from 100+ countries. 13 disciplines include Phygital Football, Basketball, Dancing, Shooter, Hockey, and Fighting (MMA/Boxing). Each discipline combines a physical match with its gaming equivalent. Includes Games of the Future City fan zone with exhibitions and immersive technology. $10 million prize pool.

name: Oraza Ait (Eid al-Fitr)
desc: Islamic holiday marking end of Ramadan with pilgrimages to the Khoja Ahmed Yasawi Mausoleum.
details: Islamic holiday marking the end of Ramadan. Pilgrims visit the UNESCO World Heritage Mausoleum of Khoja Ahmed Yasawi in Turkestan and other religious sites. Community prayers and family gatherings nationwide.

name: Festival d'Avignon OFF
desc: World's most prestigious theatre festival with performances in the Palais des Papes and across the city.
details: Founded in 1947, the Festival d'Avignon presents 42+ productions in 40 venues including the magnificent Cour d'honneur of the Palais des Papes. Alongside, the OFF festival features 1,000+ independent companies in 130 venues.

name: Ballarat Begonia Festival
desc: Historic flower festival showcasing 1,000+ begonias alongside live entertainment and sustainable garden displays.
details: Ballarat's Begonia Festival is one of Australia's oldest flower festivals, celebrating the spectacular begonia displays in the Botanical Gardens. The event includes horticultural competitions, sustainable gardening workshops, live music, food stalls, and family activities.

name: Banff Mountain Film Festival
desc: The world's premier mountain film festival, screening adventure films in the stunning Canadian Rockies.
details: The Banff Centre Mountain Film and Book Festival is the world's most prestigious mountain culture event, screening cutting-edge adventure, environmental, and mountain sports films. The festival also features book competitions, speakers, and workshops in the breathtaking setting of Banff National Park.

name: Tamunangue
desc: 400-year folk dance tradition celebrating San Antonio de Padua with ancestral Afro-Venezuelan music and rituals declared Cultural Heritage.
details: Declared Cultural Heritage of the Nation (2014). Held June 13 annually honoring San Antonio de Padua, venerated patron saint. The most complete folkloric manifestation of Venezuela featuring traditional music and dance. In 2026, Divina Pastora appeared in unprecedented tamunanguera dress on January 14, honoring this beloved regional cultural expression. Represents spiritual and cultural resistance of Afro-Venezuelan communities.

name: Festa do Peão de Barretos
desc: Latin America's largest rodeo festival at Parque do Peão celebrating cowboy traditions with rodeos, sertanejo music, and cultural performances.
details: The 71st edition spans 10 days with the theme "O Brasil se Encontra Aqui!" (Brazil Meets Here!). Parque do Peão covers over 2 million square meters with complete infrastructure including traditional rodeos in multiple categories, four stages with musical shows, cultural presentations, commercial fair, and camping. The festival is part of the TV Globo Circuito Sertanejo (Country Music Circuit) ensuring top-tier Brazilian country artists perform. Partnerships with Hospital de Amor raise funds for cancer treatment, providing social responsibility alongside entertainment.

name: Bayreuth Festival
desc: Opera festival dedicated to Wagner repertoire; official festival pages list 2026 season dates.
details: The Bayreuth Festival marks its 150th anniversary in 2026, presenting Richard Wagner's operas in the Festspielhaus he designed. Tickets are among the hardest to obtain in the performing arts world.

name: Beiteddine Art Festival
desc: Ballet, classical music, and theater in the stunning 200-year-old Beiteddine Palace in the Chouf Mountains.
details: Hosted in the magnificent 200-year-old Beiteddine Palace nestled in the breathtaking Chouf Mountains, this festival is a celebration of Lebanese and international arts and culture. Ballet performances, classical music concerts, and theatrical productions take place against the palace's stunning architecture. It's consistently ranked among the top festivals in the Middle East.

name: Fleadh Cheoil na hÉireann
desc: World’s largest celebration of Irish music and culture; host city and dates announced in report.
details: Fleadh Cheoil na hÉireann brings together 500,000+ visitors for competitions, concerts, sessions, and workshops celebrating Irish traditional music. Musicians from across the globe compete and perform in what is the Super Bowl of Irish music.

name: Birdsville Big Red Bash
desc: Three-day music festival at the foot of Big Red sand dune in the Simpson Desert — the world's most remote festival.
details: The Big Red Bash is held at the base of Big Red, the largest sand dune in the Simpson Desert. Thousands of music fans make the epic journey to this remote outback location for three days of live music featuring top Australian artists, creating an utterly unique festival experience.

name: Festival Brasileiro da Cerveja (Blumenau, Santa Catarina)
desc: A beer festival featuring tastings, technical seminars, and business networking for brewing industry professionals and enthusiasts.
details: Festival Brasileiro da Cerveja takes place in Blumenau, Germany's beer capital in South America, during early March. The festival showcases Brazilian craft beers with tastings, technical seminars for industry professionals, and roundtables discussing brewing trends. The event attracts beer enthusiasts and industry leaders discussing innovation and heritage in Brazilian beer production.

name: Festival Estéreo Picnic
desc: Colombia's most important music festival with 70+ international and Latin artists including Lorde, Tyler the Creator, and The Killers.
details: 15th edition at Parque Simón Bolívar features diverse genres from electronic to indie rock. 2025 edition drew 170,000 attendees and 51,000+ international tourists. Three-day format returns with family zones, rest areas, playgrounds, children's activations, improved visibility platforms, expanded food options, and enhanced restrooms. Major headliners: Lorde, Peso Pluma, Young Miko, Turnstile, Tyler the Creator, Peggy Gou, Interpol, The Killers, Sabrina Carpenter, Swedish House Mafia, Deftones, Kygo, and Tom Morello.

name: Highland Games (Braemar Gathering)
desc: Scotland's most famous Highland Games attended by the Royal Family.
details: The Braemar Gathering features caber tossing, Highland dancing, pipe band competitions, and tug of war. The Royal Family's annual attendance makes it the most prestigious of 60+ Scottish Highland Games.

name: Festival de Cinema de Brasília
desc: 59th edition of Brazil's oldest film festival (founded 1965) dedicated exclusively to Brazilian cinema promoting national film culture and industry.
details: The Festival de Brasília celebrates Brazilian cinematography with screenings, debates, and premieres of Brazilian films. As the country's oldest and most traditional film festival, it provides crucial platform for emerging and established Brazilian filmmakers. The festival connects cinema professionals, critics, and audiences in focus on national film production and development.

name: Buena Vibra
desc: Annual summer music festival with political and cultural messaging through contemporary Argentine artists.
details: Held at Ciudad Universitaria with "La Previa" pre-event February 20. 2026 lineup includes Wos, El Kuelgue, Conociendo Rusia, Marilina Bertoldi, and others. Festival collaborates with "Ningún pibe con hambre" nonprofit, collecting food for community kitchens. Exclusive for 18+ attendees. Features diverse contemporary music genres.

name: Feria Internacional del Libro de Buenos Aires
desc: The world's largest and most-attended book fair in the Spanish language, celebrating 50 years with international publishers and authors.
details: Covers 45,000 square meters at La Rural with over 1 million annual visitors. Peru as guest country of honor (first time a country vs. city). Opening ceremony features conversation between Leila Guerriero, Selva Almada, and Gabriela Cabezón Cámara. Includes author readings, cultural activities, educational programs, and professional publishing industry sessions.

name: São João / Festa Junina
desc: World's largest São João festival celebrating Brazilian June traditions with forró music, regional food, and cultural performances in Parque do Povo.
details: Campina Grande claims the title "World's Largest São João," hosting 33 consecutive days of festivities. Parque do Povo features a scenic city reproducing historic buildings of Campina Grande with over 200 barracas (stalls) and quiosques. Traditional cuisine includes buchada de bode, cuscuz com carne guisada, pamonha, tapioca, and pé-de-moleque. The festival fills the streets with badeirolas (decorative flags) and promotes forró pé-de-serra music, a UNESCO-recognized cultural expression.

name: O Maior São João do Mundo
desc: Huge Festa Junina season with forró, quadrilhas, food, and nightly shows.

name: Floriade
desc: Australia's biggest celebration of spring with over a million flowers in bloom across Commonwealth Park.
details: Floriade transforms Canberra's Commonwealth Park into a spectacular floral wonderland each spring. More than a million bulbs and annuals create breathtaking displays alongside live entertainment, workshops, NightFest (an after-dark spectacular), and community events.

name: Fiesta de San Blas - Paraguarí
desc: Regional patron saint festival celebrating Saint Blaise with religious and bullfighting traditions.
details: 78th edition officially recognized as cultural and tourist interest through Congressional Declaration 5/2026. Held at community complex. Religious component includes novena prayers and central mass February 8 with saint adoration as part of popular religiosity. Bullfighting festival held at chapel side. Two-day celebration blending religious tradition with popular festivities. Authorities committed to dissemination and promotion of event through Economic Affairs Commission of San Blas Chapel.

name: Festival de Cine de Cartagena (FICCI)
desc: The 65th edition of Latin America's oldest film festival (founded 1960) featuring films from around the world.
details: FICCI is a free cinematographic event with social and cultural goals promoting inclusive cultural exchange and free expression. The five-day festival presents films from Latin America and worldwide, with industry events, technical sessions, and awards. It's an Academy Awards qualifier for documentary feature and short film categories. Over 630,000 attendees expected.

name: Carnaval de Guyane (season)
desc: Long Carnival season with parades and masked balls, culminating before Lent.

name: Cheyenne Frontier Days
desc: The 'Daddy of 'Em All' — the world's largest outdoor rodeo and western celebration since 1897.
details: Cheyenne Frontier Days is one of the most iconic western events in the world, featuring the world's largest outdoor rodeo, nightly concerts by major artists, free pancake breakfasts, Native American cultural programs, a massive parade, and an old west museum. The 10-day celebration has been a cornerstone of Western heritage for over 125 years.

name: Equinox Celebrations (chichén Itzá & Teotihuacán)
desc: Spectacular astronomical phenomenon where light/shadow creates illusion of serpent descending pyramid, celebrating Maya/Aztec cosmology.
details: Chichén Itzá: "Descent of Kukulkán" light-shadow effect on El Castillo pyramid at sunset lasts approximately 45 minutes. March and September between 3–5 PM attract thousands worldwide. Teotihuacán: spring equinox draws thousands to absorb cosmic energy, participate in renewal rituals. Sensory experience with drums, copal incense, people in white clothing. Both sites are major destinations for equinox celebrations with Chichén Itzá famous for dramatic visual spectacle.

name: Fiesta de los Patios de Córdoba
desc: A UNESCO-listed tradition where Córdoba's residents open their flower-filled courtyards to the public.
details: Each May, Córdoba's hidden courtyards burst into bloom as residents compete to create the most beautiful patio displays. Walking through the whitewashed neighbourhoods to discover these secret gardens overflowing with geraniums and jasmine is magical.

name: COSQUÍN - Festival Nacional del Folklore
desc: One of Argentina's most prestigious folk music festivals celebrating regional artists and emerging talent across nine nights of performances.
details: The festival features over 200 competing artists, live folk music performances by established and emerging artists including Abel Pintos, Luciano Pereyra, El Chaqueño Palavecino, Los Manseros Santiagueños, Jorge Rojas, and Soledad Pastorutti. The 2026 edition introduces the Terraza Gastronómica Próspero with regional Argentine cuisine. The event attracts thousands of folk music enthusiasts to Plaza Próspero Molina.

name: Nowruz Celebrations Syria
desc: Newly recognized national holiday in Syria following 2025 decree by President al-Sharaa.
details: Following the 2025 ceasefire and political changes, Syrian President Ahmed al-Sharaa issued a decree recognizing Kurdish identity and Nowruz as a national holiday.

name: Darwin Festival
desc: Multidisciplinary festival featuring music, theater, and community programming in the Top End.
details: Darwin Festival celebrates the Top End's dry season with 18 days of arts and culture. The outdoor festival stage at the Darwin Amphitheatre, evening markets, theatre, dance, music, comedy, visual art, and cabaret create a uniquely tropical festival atmosphere.

name: Pow Wow (Multiple - Denver March)
desc: Denver March Powwow, one of the largest powwows in the country with 1,600+ dancers from 100+ tribes.
