details: The Denver March Powwow at the National Western Complex is one of the largest competitive powwows in the country, featuring over 1,600 dancers, 40 drum groups, juried arts and crafts, and traditional food from 100+ tribal nations. Grand Entries are spectacular showcases of regalia and tradition.

name: Iowa State Fair
desc: One of the oldest and largest state fairs in America, the inspiration for the novel State Fair and a presidential campaign tradition.
details: The Iowa State Fair is a quintessential American experience with agricultural competitions, the famous Butter Cow sculpture, grandstand concerts, unusual food-on-a-stick creations, and carnival midway. It is also a critical stop for presidential candidates, making it a unique intersection of agriculture, culture, and politics.

name: Sikka Art & Design Festival
desc: Dubai Culture's flagship festival for visual arts, performance, design, and public art in the Al Shindagha Historic Neighbourhood.
details: Now in its 14th edition under the theme 'Imagining Dubai: Identities of...', Sikka transforms Dubai's historic Al Fahidi and Al Shindagha neighborhoods into temporary galleries of local and regional art, design, and performance. It's a community-centered festival that blends heritage architecture with contemporary creativity.

name: Semanas Musicales de Frutillar
desc: Nine-day classical music festival featuring 700 musicians, seven orchestras, and international soloists.
details: Main concerts at Teatro del Lago's Espacio Tronador - Sala Nestlé. Opening Jan 27 by Symphonic Band of Chilean Air Force (FACH) with Beethoven. Closing Feb 4 features Symphonic Orchestra and Choir of University of Chile performing Händel's Messiah. Includes orchestras, chamber ensembles, and soloists from Chile, Germany, Italy, Brazil, Poland, Austria. Motto: "Music is lived here." Consolidates Frutillar as southern Chile's cultural music epicenter.

name: Emancipation Day
desc: Observed on August 1, Emancipation Day marks the abolition of slavery in Guyana and commemorates freedom and African heritage.
details: Emancipation Day in Guyana celebrates everything from culture to people to freedom—the most treasured quantity of them all. The festivities typically span a day or two, with Georgetown as the main hub, transforming the streets into a lively tapestry of dance, food stalls, and cultural displays. Locals, tourists, families, and backpackers all come together to celebrate freedom and heritage. It honors the emancipation of all enslaved people across the British Empire in 1834, though full freedom wasn't achieved until August 1st, 1838.

name: Festival de Cultura e Gastronomia de Gramado
desc: Celebrating regional culture and gastronomy with cultural performances, food tastings, and artistic presentations in the mountain town.
details: The 18th edition of Gramado's Culture and Gastronomy Festival celebrates the region's culinary traditions and cultural heritage. The ten-day festival features regional food tastings, cultural performances, artistic presentations, and celebrations of Gramado's identity as a cultural destination. The festival showcases local chefs, artisans, and cultural performers promoting regional traditions.

name: Festival Cultural de Mayo (may Cultural Festival)
desc: Guadalajara's month-long celebration of performing arts with theater, music, dance, cinema, and street performances.
details: Canada is guest of honor for 2026. 44 activities include film projections and premieres, theater and contemporary circus, musical performances, dance, photography, visual arts, exhibitions, conferences, workshops, masterclasses, cinema, street performances, literature, and gastronomy. Features 463 artists from Jalisco, Mexico, Canada, USA, Spain, Austria, and Poland. Expected attendance of 1.4 million visitors. Venues include Teatro Degollado, Liberation Square, Founders Square, Universidad Market, Juárez Plaza, and Cabañas Cultural Institute. Funded by Ministry of Culture (7.5 million pesos).

name: Guangzhou Canton Fair
desc: World's largest trade fair attracting 200,000+ buyers from 200+ countries—a cornerstone of Chinese commerce.
details: The China Import and Export Fair (Canton Fair) is the world's largest trade exhibition, held twice yearly in Guangzhou since 1957. While primarily commercial, its massive scale, cultural exhibitions, and role in Chinese economic history make it a significant event. Over 25,000 exhibitors and 200,000 international buyers attend each session across the enormous Pazhou Complex.

name: Guilin Cormorant Fishing Festival
desc: Traditional cormorant fishing demonstrations on the Li River against the backdrop of iconic karst mountains.
details: While cormorant fishing on the Li River occurs year-round, summer festivals celebrate this ancient tradition with demonstrations, competitions, and cultural events. Fishermen on bamboo rafts use trained cormorants to catch fish in a technique dating back 1,300 years. The dramatically lit nighttime performances against Guilin's karst peaks are among China's most iconic images.

name: Hainan Tropical Carnival
desc: Month-long tropical festival on China's southern island with beach activities, cultural shows, and food events.
details: Hainan's Tropical Carnival is a month-long celebration of the island's tropical culture, featuring beach festivals, surf competitions, coconut-themed food events, Li and Miao ethnic performances, and international cultural exchanges. The warm November weather makes it an ideal escape from northern China's winter.

name: Hail International Rally
desc: An international desert rally race through the dramatic landscapes of the Hail region in northern Saudi Arabia.
details: Part of the broader Saudi motorsport calendar, the Hail Rally draws international competitors through the dramatic desert landscapes of northern Saudi Arabia. The event combines competitive motorsport with cultural celebrations and heritage experiences in a region known for its rock art and ancient trading routes.

name: Bermuda Heroes Weekend
desc: Carnival-style events with J'ouvert and Parade of Bands combined with raft-ups honoring Bermudian heroes.
details: Combines J'ouvert and Parade of Bands with uniquely Bermudian raft-ups and cultural programming. Honors national heroes while blending Caribbean Carnival energy with Bermuda's distinct island identity.

name: Festival Internacional de Ballet de La Habana (International Ballet Festival of Havana)
desc: A biennial ballet festival featuring the National Ballet of Cuba and international companies celebrating 75 years of Cuban ballet.
details: The 29th Anniversary of the International Ballet Festival of Havana Alicia Alonso takes place at the Great Theatre of Havana, Karl Marx Theatre, and Mella Theatre. The festival celebrates the 75th anniversary of the creation of the National Ballet of Cuba. Attendance includes companies from Norway, Berlin, Rome, Mexico, and Argentina, as well as Cuban dance groups such as Mi Compañía, Mal Paso, Acosta Danza, and Danza Contemporánea de Cuba.

name: Afro-Cuban Dance Festival
desc: Festival celebrating Afro-Cuban dance traditions and contemporary dance forms rooted in African heritage.
details: The Afro-Cuban Dance Festival showcases the rich tradition of Afro-Cuban dance, connecting dancers and choreographers with audiences interested in Caribbean and African-diaspora dance traditions.

name: Ritmo Cuba (International Cuban Dance Festival)
desc: The 8th edition of an international gathering bringing dancers, students, and teachers from around the globe to share their passion for Latin dance.
details: Held at Hotel Nacional de Cuba in Vedado. The festival offers 100+ hours of dance workshops with intensive classes across three simultaneous rooms, exploring Cuban Salsa, Rueda de Casino, Reggaeton, Cha Cha Cha, Bachata, Hip Hop, Kizomba, Rumba, and Afro-Cuban Folklore. Features over 60 of the best salsa and Latin dance teachers from Cuba and around the world, including principal instructors from Havana's top salsa schools. Evening activities include vibrant nightly parties with live Cuban bands, professional dance performances, the famous Ritmo Cuba beach party, dance tours, and cultural excursions.

name: Yam Festival (Ghana)
desc: Traditional harvest festival celebrating the yam crop with rituals, dance, and communal feasting.
details: The Yam Festival celebrates the harvest season across multiple communities in Ghana. It involves rituals of thanksgiving to the gods, traditional dances, drumming, and communal feasting on newly harvested yams prepared in various traditional dishes.

name: Festival Internacional de Títeres Rosete Aranda
desc: International puppet theater festival celebrating 40+ years with performances from national, international, and guest country companies.
details: Takes place in Tlaxcala, Huamantla, Apizaco, Chiautempan, and 21 other localities. Organized by Instituto Tlaxcalteca de la Cultura (ITC). 40th+ edition features 12 festivals, 22 local groups, 11 national and international companies. Spain, Canada, and Argentina as guest countries. Promotes puppet theater artistry among children, youth, and adults, fostering creativity, learning, and enjoyment. Includes workshops, conferences, roundtables strengthening artist community through knowledge exchange and collaboration.

name: Universo Paralello
desc: Biennial electronic music and alternative culture festival on paradise beach featuring 500+ artists across 6 stages, 9 days of celebration.
details: Held every two years at paradisiacal Praia de Pratigi in Ituberá municipality. The 18th edition returns to biennial schedule after gap. Over 500 artists orchestrate electronic and psychedelic soundtracks across 6 stages with different styles. Nine days feature slackline, yoga, juggling, drug awareness, healing therapies, cinema, theater, art exhibitions, performances, workshops, and talks. The festival celebrates peace, love, union, and respect within electronic and psychedelic music community. Tickets available in March 2026.

name: Jaipur Literature Festival
desc: The world's largest free literary festival attracting Nobel laureates, Booker Prize winners, and literary figures from around the globe.
details: Set against the stunning backdrop of Diggi Palace in Jaipur, this literary extravaganza brings together some of the world's most acclaimed authors, thinkers, and cultural commentators. Over five days, hundreds of sessions cover literature, politics, art, and culture. The festival atmosphere blends intellectual discourse with Rajasthani hospitality and cuisine.

name: Feria Primavera Jerez
desc: Spring festival in magical colonial town celebrating regional traditions with music, horses, and Holy Saturday festivities.
details: Zacatecas shares traditions, music, equestrian activities during spring season. Holy Saturday (April 4, 2026) becomes region's busiest day with parades, street bands, horse exhibitions, attracting thousands. Town fills with visitors enjoying colonial architecture, cultural events, regional cuisine, and traditions celebrating spring renewal.

name: Jounieh International Festival
desc: A diverse summer festival in the vibrant coastal city of Jounieh featuring Lebanese and international artists.
details: The vibrant coastal city of Jounieh comes alive during summer with its International Festival, featuring concerts by Lebanese and international artists, theatrical performances, and cultural exhibitions. The beautiful seaside setting adds to the atmospheric cultural celebration north of Beirut.

name: Kanazawa Hyakumangoku Festival
desc: Celebration of Kanazawa's golden age with a grand samurai procession to Kanazawa Castle.
details: The Hyakumangoku Festival commemorates Lord Maeda Toshiie's entry into Kanazawa Castle in 1583. The main parade recreates the lord's arrival with thousands in period costume marching from Kanazawa Station to the castle. Tea ceremonies in Kenrokuen Garden, geisha performances, and traditional crafts exhibitions celebrate the city's cultural wealth.

name: Kashgar Sunday Bazaar
desc: Historic 2,000-year-old bazaar attracting 100,000+ visitors weekly with livestock, textiles, and spices.
details: Historic bazaar with 2,000+ year history. Largest international trade market in Northwest China. Two sections: livestock district (Sundays only) and ordinary district (daily). Features textiles, spices, tea, pottery, and extensive livestock trading with Uyghur, Tajik, Kazak, and Kyrgyz merchants.

name: Entrada Universitaria (Student Folklore Parade - la Paz)
desc: Organized by Universidad Mayor de San Andrés (UMSA) students since 1988, featuring 80+ fraternities from 13 faculties defending, revaluing, and promoting La Paz's cultural heritage through folkloric dances.
details: At least 80 fraternities organize into dance groups and comparsas, dancing primarily indigenous and folkloric dances. Representative dances include wititis, moceños, tata danzante, sicuris, ticca, danza arete, carnaval tupiceño, llamerada, antawaras, potolos, chapaqueada, chacarera, pujllay, tinkus, jula julas, tobas, calcheños, and tonadas. The parade travels through La Paz city center, transforming the city with dance, folklore, and youth energy. The Entrada Universitaria objective is defending, revaluing, and promoting La Paz's cultural heritage while celebrating student participation in preserving Bolivian traditions.

name: Gran Poder (Festival of the Santísima Trinidad)
desc: Bolivia's largest festival with 92,000+ dancers and 33,000 musicians creating cultural and economic impact generating $67 million in a single day, honoring Jesus Christ (Señor del Gran Poder).
details: Celebrated around the end of May/beginning of June honoring the Day of the Holy Trinity and Jesus Christ. More than 30,000 dancers representing La Paz neighborhoods and folkloric groups dance along a 6 km route. Iconic dances include the Diablada (Devil's Dance), Morenada (Dance of the Black Slave), and Waca Takhori (Dancing Bulls). The festival includes fraternities of morenadas, tinkus, caporales, kullawadas, and heritage dances like negritos. Around 40,000 devotees dance and sing in offering to the patron saint. The festival declared UNESCO Intangible Cultural Heritage transforms La Paz's social life, employing those who sew costumes, style hair, sell food, and perform music.

name: Mama Negra (Sept edition)
desc: Second annual cycle of the Mama Negra festivities with parades and performances.

name: EXPOALIMENTARIA (Food and Beverage Expo)
desc: International food, beverages, and culinary accessories exhibition showcasing Peru's food industry and gastronomic innovations.
details: Held annually in Lima at the Jockey Exhibition Centre, this expo displays Peru's culinary heritage and modern food innovations. The festival highlights regional specialties and gastronomic achievements from Peru's diverse regions, celebrating the country's position as a world-class culinary destination.

name: Ars Electronica Festival
desc: A pioneering festival exploring the intersection of art, technology, and society.
details: Ars Electronica is a globally renowned festival for digital art and media culture. Exhibitions, performances, concerts, and symposia explore how technology transforms art and human experience in the futuristic Ars Electronica Center.

name: Festa de Santo António / Santos Populares
desc: Lisbon's most beloved festival fills the Alfama district with grilled sardines, paper garlands, music, dancing, and spontaneous street parties honoring the city's patron saint.
details: The Festas de Lisboa celebrate Lisbon's patron saint with a month of festivities peaking on June 12–13. Streets of the Alfama district burst with music, traditional marchas populares parades, paper garlands, and the irresistible smell of grilled sardines. Couples exchange manjerico (basil plants) with love poems. Spontaneous street parties spill through the medieval cobblestone lanes deep into the night.

name: Festival Nacional de la Canción
desc: National songwriting festival with winners representing Ecuador at the Festival Internacional de la Canción de Punta del Este.
details: Open to authors, composers, and performers from throughout Ecuador in symphonic-vocal format for unpublished songs. Registration closes May 24, 2026. The Final Gala is held June 26 at Teatro Benjamín Carrión Mora with the Loja Symphony Orchestra. The winning work represents Ecuador at the international competition in Punta del Este, Uruguay.

name: RHS Chelsea Flower Show
desc: The UK's most prestigious horticultural exhibition at the Royal Hospital Chelsea, famous for headline Show Gardens, cutting-edge planting trends, and celebrity attendees.
details: Organised by the Royal Horticultural Society since 1913, the Chelsea Flower Show features stunning Show Gardens, innovative planting trends, new plant launches, and high-profile visitors. Designers compete for coveted gold medals with gardens that push boundaries of landscape architecture. The Great Pavilion showcases specialist plant growers from around the world.

name: Desfile de Silleteros
desc: The most spectacular element of the Flower Festival featuring 500+ flower carriers in the iconic Silleteros parade.
details: The 69th edition features campesinos from Santa Elena displaying elaborate floral arrangements on their backs, with each silleta weighing up to 70 kg. The parade showcases the region's flower cultivation tradition and cultural heritage, with participants representing over 500 silleteros demonstrating their agricultural artistry through city streets.

name: Fiesta de la Vendimia
desc: Argentina's most prestigious wine harvest festival celebrating its 90th anniversary with the crowning of the Vendimia Queen.
details: Dating to 1936, the 2026 edition marks the 90th anniversary. The Central Act at the Greek Theatre features 1,000+ artists and crowning of the National Vendimia Queen with fireworks. Pre-events span months: departmental festivals, Paseo Federal (Feb 23-25), Blessing of the Fruits (Feb 27), Carrusel parade, and Vía Blanca. Wine flows from fountains.

name: XI Intl Folk Dance & Music Festival Bodrum
desc: International folk dance festival featuring traditional and contemporary dance performances.
details: Brings folk ensembles, choral groups, orchestras, brass bands, modern dance groups from around the world for cultural exchange.

name: Nuit Blanche Montreal
desc: All-night celebration of arts, culture, and urban play across Montreal from dusk till dawn.
details: Montreal's Nuit Blanche is an epic all-night party with hundreds of free events, art installations, performances, and experiences across the city. From sunset to sunrise, the city becomes a playground for cultural exploration, with indoor and outdoor venues keeping the energy going until dawn.

name: Festival de Música de Morelia 2026
desc: Music festival featuring jazz, opera, orchestral performances, conferences, and workshops
details: The Festival de Musica de Morelia presents classical music performances in the magnificent colonial churches, plazas, and theaters of Morelia, a UNESCO World Heritage city. International and Mexican orchestras, soloists, and ensembles perform in acoustically stunning historic venues.

name: Moussem of Moulay Idriss
desc: Sacred pilgrimage to the tomb of Morocco's most venerated saint in the holy city of Moulay Idriss.
details: The Moussem of Moulay Idriss is a major religious pilgrimage to the tomb of Moulay Idriss I, founder of the first Moroccan dynasty. The holy city comes alive with Sufi music, prayers, processions, and traditional markets. Until recently, non-Muslims were not allowed to stay overnight.

name: Muscat Nights 2026
desc: A month-long cultural extravaganza across eight Muscat venues blending heritage, entertainment, circus, and international programming.
details: Organized by Muscat Municipality, Muscat Nights 2026 transformed eight venues across the city including Qurum Natural Park, Al Amerat Public Park, and the Royal Opera House. Features included heritage villages, international circus performances with hologram technology, a dramatic musical fountain and light symphony, drone shows, fashion events, and a symbolic 'Siraj' character—an Omani child of light. The festival attracted over 2 million visitors and supported 1,000+ SMEs.

name: Nanjing Qinhuai Lantern Fair
desc: One of China's oldest and most elaborate lantern festivals along the historic Qinhuai River.
details: The Qinhuai Lantern Fair along the Qinhuai River in Nanjing dates back over 1,700 years and reached its peak during the Ming Dynasty. Thousands of intricate lanterns illuminate the riverbanks and traditional buildings of the Confucius Temple area. Night boat rides along the illuminated river are a highlight. The fair features lantern riddles, folk performances, and traditional crafts.

name: EXIT Festival
desc: Influential Balkan festival; report states 2026 framed as “Global Tour,” implying reconfigured footprint.
details: EXIT, born from a student movement in 2000, is launching a global tour in 2026 following government pressure in Serbia. Events planned across Egypt, India, Malta, Croatia, and Macedonia.

name: Fiestas de la Calle San Sebastián (SanSe)
desc: Puerto Rico's largest festival and the unofficial closing to the longest holiday season in the world.
details: An annual event on Calle San Sebastián in Old San Juan since 1970, this festival has grown from a community fundraiser to the island's premier event. Old San Juan is completely taken over by live music, impromptu dancing in every street corner, and circus performances. Large stages set up at Plaza del Quinto Centenario, Plaza de Armas, Plaza Colon, and Plaza de La Barandilla feature live concerts from 5-11 p.m. Some 350 local artisans set up stalls offering traditional handmade jewelry and food. Colorful parades showcase traditional Puerto Rican cultural figures including the famous vejigantes. The event is free to attend.

name: Klein Karoo Nasionale Kunstefees (KKNK)
desc: South Africa's premier Afrikaans arts festival with over 100 theatre, music, and visual arts productions.
details: KKNK is held annually in the charming town of Oudtshoorn, nestled among the Swartberg mountains. For over a week, the town transforms into a cultural hub with more than 100 productions spanning theatre, music, dance, visual arts, and literary events, plus artisan markets and family entertainment. It is the largest Afrikaans cultural festival.

name: Fiesta de San Fermín (Pamplona Bull Run)
desc: The legendary festival featuring the world-famous running of the bulls through Pamplona's narrow streets.
details: Each morning at 8am, six bulls charge through Pamplona's cobblestone streets as daring runners sprint ahead of them. Beyond the encierros, San Fermín is nine days of non-stop celebration with parades of gigantes, fireworks, folk dancing, and all-night parties.

name: Festival da Cachaça, Cultura e Sabores (Paraty, Rio de Janeiro)
desc: Celebrating cachaça (Brazilian distilled spirits), culture, and regional gastronomy with tastings, distillery tours, workshops, and music.
details: The 44th Festival da Cachaça, Cultura e Sabores celebrates Paraty's famous cachaça production and local culture. The festival features tastings from the region's main alambiques (distilleries), gastronomic workshops, lectures on regional food and beverage traditions, live music, and folk dances. Visitors experience authentic local production methods and cultural performances celebrating Brazilian spirits and regional culinary heritage in the historic colonial town.

name: White Night (Nuit Blanche)
desc: Paris stays up all night for this free contemporary art event, with installations, performances, and exhibitions transforming the city from dusk to dawn.
details: Nuit Blanche is a free all-night contemporary art event where museums, galleries, parks, and public spaces across Paris host exhibitions, installations, and performances from dusk to dawn. Launched in 2002, it has inspired similar events worldwide. The pleasure of discovering art while wandering Paris's illuminated streets at 3 AM is hard to beat.

name: Rock en Seine
desc: Major late-summer festival near Paris; official festival site lists 2026 dates.
details: Rock en Seine brings major international headliners to the beautiful parkland of Saint-Cloud just outside Paris. Five days of rock, indie, electronic, and alternative music in an elegant setting.

name: Parkes Elvis Festival
desc: Iconic tribute to Elvis Presley with 200+ events in rural NSW featuring street parades and look-alike contests.
details: Each January the small town of Parkes transforms into an Elvis wonderland. Started in 1993, the festival draws 30,000+ visitors for five days of music, parades, gospel breakfasts, tribute competitions, and themed events. The highlight is the Grand Parade featuring hundreds of Elvis impersonators.

name: Saint Maarten Carnival
desc: Multi-week carnival on the dual-nation island with concerts, calypso competitions, and costumed road marches.
details: Spanning weeks with concerts, calypso competitions, costumed parades, and J'ouvert on this unique Dutch-French island. The melting pot creates an underrated but vibrant carnival drawing from both Caribbean and European traditions.

name: Port Fairy Folk Festival
desc: One of the world's great folk festivals held in a picturesque fishing village on the Great Ocean Road.
details: The Port Fairy Folk Festival is consistently rated among the top folk festivals globally. Over the Labour Day long weekend, the historic fishing village hosts hundreds of performances across multiple venues. The intimate atmosphere, stunning coastal setting, and world-class folk, roots, and world music make it unforgettable.

name: Quebec City New Year's Eve
desc: Spectacular outdoor New Year's Eve celebration in front of the Chateau Frontenac.
details: Quebec City's Place d'Armes transforms into a magical New Year's Eve celebration with live music, fireworks, and revelry in front of the iconic Chateau Frontenac. The historic walled city's winter atmosphere creates one of the most enchanting NYE settings in North America.

name: Black Hills Powwow & Art Expo
desc: Major competitive powwow near Mount Rushmore and the Black Hills sacred lands.
details: The Black Hills Powwow brings together Native dancers, drum groups, and artists from across North America for a weekend of competitive dancing, traditional music, and indigenous art. The proximity to sacred Black Hills sites adds deep cultural significance.

name: Secret Solstice
desc: Music festival under 24-hour sunlight near the summer solstice.
details: Secret Solstice takes place during Iceland's midnight sun, with 96 hours of daylight allowing parties that never see darkness, plus exclusive events inside glaciers and lava tunnels.

name: Festival de Inverno Rio
desc: Winter music festival featuring acclaimed Brazilian and international artists performing at Marina da Glória venue.
details: Festival de Inverno Rio 2026 takes place at Marina da Glória, one of Rio's most beautiful landmarks. The festival features diverse Brazilian music genres and artists, transforming summer months into a musical celebration. While complete 2026 lineup details are pending, previous years featured artists like Caetano Veloso, Gloria Groove, Alceu Valença, and other acclaimed performers.

name: Registan Square Laser Shows
desc: Daily spectacular laser and 3D light shows at Registan Square telling Samarkand's history.
details: Daily spectacular laser and 3D light shows featuring stories of Samarkand's history, rulers, and architectural marvels with traditional Uzbek melodies blended with modern compositions. Visible from free public viewing platform. No shows November 21 - February 20.

name: Fiesta Nacional del Sol
desc: Provincial celebration of the sun with regional gastronomy, artistic performances, and local culture.
details: Held at Estadio del Bicentenario under theme "San Juan mi tierra querida." Represents a change from traditional February timing to November. 2025 edition attracted 320,000 attendees over 4 nights. Planning addresses infrastructure improvements for rest and dining. Features regional cuisine, creativity, and talent of local, national, and international artists.

name: Festival de la Novilla (Heifer Festival)
desc: Celebration of Puerto Rican agricultural heritage and traditions featuring a cow decorated with flowers leading a parade.
details: The 48th Festival de la Novilla celebrates the history of Puerto Rican agricultural practices. A novilla (heifer) is the main focus of this popular celebration held in San Sebastián on the island's west side. Serves as a fundraiser for local scholarships. Live bands perform everything from folk music to salsa, artisans and fried food vendors occupy the town square, and amusement park rides are set up. The pinnacle is the official parade where a cow decked out in a crown of flowers leads a procession of floats through town. Parade usually starts Sunday at 1 p.m., but activities begin in the morning. Many local vendors don't accept credit cards.

name: Semana Grande
desc: San Sebastián's biggest week — huge summer crowds, international fireworks competitions over La Concha bay, and the modern energy of Basque celebration.
details: Semana Grande is built around big summer crowds, nighttime energy, and the spectacular international fireworks competition that lights up La Concha bay. Music and events are spread across the city center. The festival blends traditional Basque celebration with a modern festival feel. Incredible Basque cuisine adds another dimension — pintxos bars are at their most vibrant.

name: Festival de Merengue (Santo Domingo Merengue Festival)
desc: Two-week celebration of the world's top merengue dancers and bands performing throughout the Caribbean city.
details: Held on the Malecón, celebrating the vibrant national rhythm of the Dominican Republic. Festivities combine outdoor concerts, folkloric parades, typical cuisine, and dance workshops. Most action happens on the Malecón, but visitors can attend related events across Santo Domingo. The festival celebrates merengue as a symbol of Dominican identity and cultural pride.

name: Bloco do Reggae - São Luís (Carnival)
desc: 20th anniversary celebration of one of Brazil's few reggae carnival blocks honoring Bob Marley and Jimmy Cliff legacies.
details: The Reggae Block celebrates reggae music and culture during São Luís carnival season. As one of the few reggae-focused carnival blocks in Brazil, it underscores São Luís' status as reggae capital. The block honors reggae legends while promoting contemporary reggae artists and maintaining Caribbean musical traditions in Brazilian carnival context.

name: Rasta Reggae Festival
desc: Reggae festival celebrating 55 years of reggae in Maranhão at Ceprama with international and Brazilian reggae legends.
details: Starting at 5 PM with featured attractions including The Heptones, Don Campbell, The Itals, Dub Brown, Capital Roots, George Gomes, Banda Barba Branca, and multiple DJs. São Luís is officially recognized as National Capital of Reggae, making this festival central to the city's cultural identity. The festival celebrates reggae's roots while promoting contemporary reggae artists.

name: Bumba Meu Boi (season)
desc: Bumba-meu-boi performances and celebrations across Maranhão, peaking in June.

name: Mostra Internacional de Cinema de São Paulo
desc: 50th edition of Brazil's major film festival screening over 300 films annually, serving as main gateway to world cinema in Brazil.
details: The Mostra Internacional screens more than 300 films including feature films, shorts, and documentaries representing diverse national cinemas and genres. The festival brings together critics, filmmakers, industry professionals, and film enthusiasts. Parallel exhibitions, retrospectives, and tributes complement film screenings. The 2026 edition marks a significant milestone in Brazil's cinematographic culture with expanded programming and international participation.

name: Aniversário de São Paulo (São Paulo City Anniversary)
desc: Citywide celebration featuring 200+ free cultural attractions including concerts, theater, cinema, and artistic performances across all city regions.
details: São Paulo's 472nd anniversary features more than 200 free attractions with programming in municipal and state cultural spaces, libraries, and parks. Events include the "Mitos Sonoros – FilarMônica" concert on January 25 honoring Maurício de Sousa's 90th anniversary (conducted by Experimental Orchestra), electronic music at Parques do Povo and do Carmo, free cinema sessions, free museum admission, storytelling sessions, and writing workshops. The celebration transforms the city into a cultural stage.

name: Monsters of Rock
desc: Major hard rock and heavy metal festival at Allianz Parque featuring international rock legends and contemporary metal acts.
details: The 9th edition features headliners including Guns N' Roses, Lynyrd Skynyrd, Halestorm, and Extreme. The lineup also includes Yngwie Malmsteen, Dirty Honey, and Jayler. A Monsters 2026 Web Series with eight documentary episodes was launched, with new episodes released Fridays and Tuesdays on the official YouTube channel. Official transportation is available with pickup points throughout São Paulo, Campinas, and Jundiaí.

name: Shiraoi Ainu Cultural Festival
desc: Celebration of Ainu indigenous culture at the Upopoy National Ainu Museum and Park.
details: The Upopoy National Ainu Museum and Park in Shiraoi hosts cultural festivals celebrating the indigenous Ainu people. Events include traditional Ainu dance (UNESCO Intangible Cultural Heritage), music, crafts, and mukkuri (mouth harp) performances. The facility opened in 2020 to preserve and share Ainu culture.

name: Son-Kul Lake High-Mountain Festival
desc: High-altitude jailoo festival with yurt races, Salburun hunting shows, and nomadic cultural immersion.
details: Celebration of nomadic traditions at high-altitude summer pastures featuring yurt setup races, traditional Kyrgyz dances and music, horseback games, and Salburun (spectacular hunting show with golden eagles, taigan dogs, and archers). Ticket: 2,500 KGS (lunch included).

name: Infiorata di Spello
desc: A breathtaking overnight creation where Spello's streets are carpeted with intricate mosaics made entirely from fresh flower petals for Corpus Christi.
details: On the night before Corpus Christi, teams of artists work through the night to create more than sixty large flower murals using only fresh flower petals. By morning, Spello's narrow medieval alleys are paved with stunning carpets of floral art. The tradition dates to 1831. Similar infiorate occur in Noto (Sicily) and Genzano (Lazio). A must-see for photographers and art lovers.

name: Antigua Carnival (Carnifest)
desc: Ten days of Caribbean celebration marking Emancipation with J'ouvert, Parade of Bands, and calypso monarch competition.
details: Held around Emancipation Day (Aug 1). Includes J'ouvert, Parade of Bands, Calypso Monarch competition, and Pan Around the Town. Uniquely celebrates freedom from slavery, adding deep historical significance.

name: Stockholm Culture Festival
desc: Stockholm's largest free cultural festival with 1 million+ visitors over five days.
details: Kulturfestivalen transforms central Stockholm with free music, dance, theatre, comedy, and art from around the world. Over 600 events across multiple stages and venues make it Scandinavia's largest free cultural event.

name: Pongal (Tamil harvest festival)
desc: Harvest festival honoring the Sun God with sweet pongal, kolam designs, and community celebrations.

name: Gasparilla Pirate Festival
desc: Tampa's signature pirate invasion festival featuring a massive parade, ship invasion of the harbor, and citywide celebrations.
details: Dating back to 1904, Gasparilla commemorates the legendary pirate Jose Gaspar with a full-scale pirate ship invasion of Tampa Bay. The Jose Gasparilla ship leads a flotilla into Hillsborough Bay, followed by a massive parade of krewes down Bayshore Boulevard. The festivities include air shows, live music, and a family-friendly atmosphere throughout downtown Tampa.

name: Tashkent International Marathon
desc: Uzbekistan's largest international running event with World Athletics Label and 15,000+ athletes from 30+ countries.
details: Country's largest international mass running event with World Athletics Label status since 2022. Features marathon (42 km, 6:00 AM), half-marathon (21 km, 7:30 AM), 10 km run, Fun Run 5 km, children's run, and closing ceremony. Pre-event includes children's run, festive concert, and cultural program at HUMO Arena. 15,000+ athletes from 30+ countries.

name: Carnival of Flowers
desc: Australia's longest-running horticultural event with stunning floral displays across the Garden City.
details: Toowoomba's Carnival of Flowers has been running for over 70 years, transforming the Garden City with spectacular floral displays, open gardens, floral parades, live entertainment, food events, and art exhibitions. It's the centrepiece of the city's identity as Australia's garden city.

name: Fiesta a la Chilena
desc: Regional festival celebrating Chilean traditions with rodeos, cattle work, folklore, and music.
details: Activities include jineteadas (rodeos), aparta de ganado (cattle separation), typical foods, folklore performances, and artists. Features A los Cuatro Vientos (Chile's representatives to Viña del Mar) and Sharon y los Caperos del Chamamé from Argentina. Expects large regional audience from Magallanes and Argentine province of Santa Cruz. Celebrates Chilean countryside traditions and gaucho culture.

name: Patagonia Running Festival - Torres del Paine
desc: International trail running festival in Patagonia featuring multiple distance options in pristine wilderness.
details: Held in Torres del Paine National Park with 6th edition. Limited to 500 participants ensuring personalized attention. Distance options: Ultra 50K, Marathon, Half-Marathon, 11K, 5K. Spectacular Patagonian landscape backdrop. Combines athletic challenge with nature immersion experience.

name: Palio dei Ciuchi (Donkey Race of Torrita di Siena)
desc: A delightful Tuscan donkey palio where eight town districts compete in a race preceded by impressive flag-throwing parades, honoring St. Joseph.
details: Rather than horses, this charming palio in Torrita di Siena features jockeys on donkeys! Eight districts compete in a race preceded by an impressive flag-throwing parade. Held annually since 1966 to commemorate St. Joseph (patron saint of carpenters and workers). Like Siena's famous Palio but more intimate, more absurd, and arguably more fun.

name: Carnaval de Veracruz (main days)
desc: Major Gulf Coast carnival known for comparsas, music, and street dancing.

name: Wacken Open Air
desc: Global flagship heavy metal festival; official ticketing lists 2026 dates.
details: Wacken transforms a small village into heavy metal's holy land with 85,000+ fans, 8 stages, medieval battles, and epic feasts. The 35th anniversary features landmark performances across 360 hectares.

name: Jazz in the Gardens
desc: Free weekly jazz concert series in the Sculpture Garden of the National Gallery of Art.
details: Every Friday evening from May through September, the National Gallery of Art's Sculpture Garden hosts free live jazz performances. Visitors enjoy world-class jazz musicians while surrounded by major sculptures and the garden's beautiful fountain. The series draws a mix of locals and tourists for a quintessential D.C. summer experience.

name: Curaçao Carnival
desc: One of the Caribbean's longest carnivals featuring the Gran Marcha, Tumba Festival, and a symbolic Farewell Parade.
details: Curaçao Carnival runs nearly two months. Highlights include the Tumba Festival (musical competition for the year's carnival anthem), the Gran Marcha (grand parade through Willemstad), the Marcha di Despedida (farewell parade), and the burning of King Momo. The Tumba music genre blends Caribbean rhythms with Latin influences in a unique Curaçaoan sound.

name: Navajo Nation Fair
desc: The world's largest American Indian fair, celebrating Navajo culture with rodeo, powwow, and traditional arts.
details: Held at the Navajo Nation Fairgrounds in Window Rock, the capital of the Navajo Nation, this fair is the largest Native American gathering of its kind. Events include an all-Indian rodeo, powwow, traditional song and dance competitions, a parade, Miss Navajo Nation pageant, traditional food booths, and an extensive arts and crafts market.

name: Wynyard Tulip Festival
desc: One-day celebration of tulips with live music, food stalls, and fireworks in Tasmania's Tulip Capital.
details: Wynyard's Tulip Festival celebrates the spectacular tulip fields of Tasmania's northwest coast. The one-day event features live music, food stalls, garden displays, kids' activities, and a fireworks finale, drawing 20,000 visitors to this small coastal town.

name: Sámi National Day Celebrations
desc: Annual celebration of Sámi culture, heritage, and identity across northern Scandinavia and Finland.
details: Sámi National Day celebrates the first Sámi congress held in Trondheim in 1917. Across northern Norway, Sweden, and Finland, the indigenous Sámi people celebrate with traditional joik singing, reindeer racing, lavvu gatherings, traditional food, and cultural performances. The celebrations are most prominent in Sámi heartland communities like Tromsø, Karasjok, Kautokeino, and Jokkmokk.

name: A-Ma Festival
desc: Celebration at Macau's oldest temple honoring the sea goddess A-Ma, namesake of Macau itself.
details: The A-Ma Festival at the 500-year-old A-Ma Temple—the oldest temple in Macau and inspiration for the territory's name—honors the sea goddess Mazu (known locally as A-Ma). Devotees bring offerings, burn incense, and participate in traditional ceremonies. Lion dances, Cantonese opera, and folk performances fill the temple complex. The festival reflects Macau's deep connection to maritime heritage.

name: Abu Dhabi Poetry Festival
desc: A multi-day festival celebrating classical and contemporary verse with poets, readings, workshops, and performances at ADNEC.
details: Hosted at the ICC Hall of ADNEC, this festival brings together poets from around the world for readings, workshops, and performances showcasing both classical and contemporary voices in Arabic and other languages. It celebrates the rich traditions of verse central to Arab cultural identity.

name: Middle East Film & Comic Con
desc: A celebration of comics, gaming, cosplay, anime, TV, film, and entertainment culture drawing fans from across the Middle East.
details: MEFCC brings together fans and creators of comics, gaming, cosplay, anime, TV, film, and entertainment culture from across the Middle East and beyond. The three-day event features celebrity appearances, artist alley, cosplay competitions, and exclusive merchandise.

name: Abu Dhabi International Book Fair
desc: A major cultural fixture since 1981 with author talks, panels, children's programming, and an extensive book marketplace.
details: Returning for its annual edition, this book fair is a major cultural fixture for readers and publishers worldwide. The lineup includes author talks, panels, children's programming, workshops, and an extensive marketplace of books across genres. It draws publishers, authors, and literary enthusiasts from across the Arab world and beyond.

name: Homowo Festival
desc: Traditional harvest festival of the Ga people celebrating triumph over hunger with sprinkled kpokpoi.
details: The Homowo Festival is the grandest festival of the Ga people of Accra. The name means 'hooting at hunger' and it celebrates a historical triumph over famine. The climax involves chiefs and family elders sprinkling kpokpoi (a special food) around their communities to feed the spirits of ancestors.

name: Acre (Akko) Festival of Alternative Theatre
desc: Alternative theatre festival in the UNESCO World Heritage Old City of Acre/Akko.
details: Groundbreaking alternative and fringe theatre performances in the atmospheric medieval streets and buildings of the ancient Crusader city.

name: Ethiopian New Year (Enkutatash)
desc: Ethiopian New Year celebration marking the end of the rainy season with flowers, songs, and feasting.
details: Enkutatash falls on September 11 (or 12 in leap years) and marks the start of the Ethiopian calendar year. Children go door to door singing songs and giving flowers. The celebration coincides with the end of the heavy rainy season when the countryside is lush and green with blooming wildflowers.

name: Timitar Festival
desc: A major four-day celebration of Amazigh heritage through music, blending traditional Berber folk with global artists in seaside Agadir.
details: Established in 2004, this festival in the seaside city of Agadir is a tribute to Amazigh (Berber) heritage through the universal medium of music. Multiple stages present performances ranging from traditional Amazigh folk groups to contemporary electronic musicians. The festival also hosts artisan markets, interactive workshops, and cultural activities, attracting diverse audiences from around the globe.

name: Navratri & Durga Puja
desc: Nine nights of non-stop dancing (Garba/Dandiya) in Gujarat and breathtaking artistic pandals in Kolkata.
details: Navratri (Nine Nights) in Gujarat features massive outdoor Garba and Dandiya dance events where entire cities dance through the night in colorful traditional dress. Simultaneously, Kolkata's Durga Puja creates thousands of artistic pandals (temporary temples) that function as open-air art galleries, drawing millions for five days of community celebration.

name: Almaty Day
desc: Celebration of Kazakhstan's largest city with parades, concerts, Kitap Fest, and fireworks at Koktobe.
details: Almaty Day celebrates the founding of Kazakhstan's largest city with parades, concerts, exhibitions, cultural activities, artist displays, craft fairs, Kitap (Book) Fest, and concludes with fireworks at Koktobe Park.

name: Central Asia Fashion Spring
desc: Central Asia's largest fashion industry event with 220+ companies from 16 countries.
details: The 37th International Fashion Exhibition features 220+ participating companies from 16 countries. Attracts 7,000+ buyers from Kazakhstan, Uzbekistan, Kyrgyzstan, Azerbaijan, Turkmenistan, Tajikistan, and Russia. Held at Atakent International Exhibition Centre.

name: Solana Festival Almaty
desc: Large-scale music festival featuring Flo Rida, Nicole Scherzinger, Tyga, Busta Rhymes, and Timbaland.
details: The Solana Festival is a first-time event combining music, visual technologies, and premium audience experience at Almaty Central Stadium. Features global artists including Flo Rida, Nicole Scherzinger, Tyga, Busta Rhymes, Timbaland, and Keri Hilson with a special guest TBA.

name: Almaty Half Marathon
desc: Central Asia's largest running event with 5,000-10,000 participants from 60+ countries.
details: The Almaty Marathon is the largest running event in Central Asia, part of AIMS International Association since 2013. Offers five formats: Marathon (42km), Half Marathon (21km), Companion Run (10km), Nordic Walking (10km), and Ekiden Corporate Relay Race (42km). Registration September 25-26. Annual charitable event attracting runners from 60+ countries.

name: Iditarod Trail Sled Dog Race Start
desc: The 'Last Great Race on Earth' — a 1,000-mile sled dog race from Anchorage to Nome through Alaska's wilderness.
details: The Iditarod is a 1,000-mile sled dog race across the Alaskan wilderness from Anchorage to Nome. The ceremonial start in downtown Anchorage draws massive crowds, and the official start in Willow sends mushers into some of the most extreme and beautiful terrain on Earth. It is Alaska's most iconic sporting and cultural event.

name: La Quintana Palio
desc: Ascoli Piceno's medieval jousting tournament with armored knights, trumpet fanfares, historical parades, and passionate neighborhood rivalries.
details: La Quintana features knights in armor competing in a jousting tournament, accompanied by elaborate historical parades with flag throwers, trumpeters, and drummers in medieval costume. The competition between Ascoli Piceno's six neighborhoods (sestieri) generates passionate rivalries. Evening celebrations continue into the medieval quarter with outdoor dining and fireworks.

name: Turkmen Horse Day (Akhal-Teke Festival)
desc: National celebration of the Akhal-Teke horse breed with races at Ashgabat hippodrome (Year of Heavenly Horses).
details: Major celebration as part of 2026's official 'Year of Purposeful Heavenly Horses' theme. Akhal-Teke horse races at Ashgabat hippodrome, equestrian celebrations, and recognition of Turkmenistan's world-famous horse breeding traditions.

name: Melon Day
desc: National festival honoring Turkmenistan's 400+ varieties of sweet melons with exhibitions and music.
details: National melon festival celebrating Turkmenistan's famous muskmelons (400+ varieties). Features exhibitions, music, dance, traditional foods, and melon-themed activities.

name: Astana Opera Season 2026
desc: World-class opera and ballet season including La Bayadere premiere and Bolero X contemporary ballet.
details: Regular opera and ballet performances including grand La Bayadere premiere, national ballet Qyz Jibek, and 'Bolero X' contemporary ballet reinterpretation (March 27-28). Features world-class productions mixing academic traditions with modern choreography.

name: Republic Day
desc: Three-day celebration of Kazakhstan's declaration of sovereignty with sports, concerts, and fireworks.
details: Republic Day celebrates the declaration of sovereignty of the Kazakh SSR from the Soviet Union with a three-day public holiday. Features sports competitions, concerts, environmental and patriotic events, festivals, cycling tours, creative contests, volunteer and charity events. Evening fireworks display concludes celebrations.

name: Asunciónico
desc: Paraguay's largest music festival with international headliners and regional artists.
details: Held at Parque Olímpico. Featured headliners: The Killers, Sabrina Carpenter, Deftones. Day 1: Deftones, Skrillex, Turnstile, Interpol, Viagra Boys, local artists (Villagrán, Kuazar, Steinkrug). Day 2: Sabrina Carpenter, Lorde, Doechii, Peggy Gou, Addison Rae, The Warning. Day 3: The Killers (reuniting after 8 years), with regional and local musicians. Presented by Banco Ueno and Bud66. Transforms festival landscape with diverse international offerings.

name: Austin City Limits Music Festival
desc: Two-weekend music festival in Zilker Park featuring 130+ acts across multiple stages in the heart of Austin.
details: Set in the beautiful Zilker Park along Lady Bird Lake, ACL brings together over 130 musical acts spanning every genre imaginable across eight stages. The festival is named after the legendary PBS music TV show and has become one of the most anticipated annual events in the live music capital of the world.

name: Bahrain National Day
desc: Two-day national celebrations commemorating Bahrain's independence with festivities across the kingdom.
details: Features fireworks, cultural performances, parades, heritage events, and community celebrations marking Bahrain's establishment as an Arab state.

name: Cascamorras
desc: Wild festival of chasing and grease where a human effigy runs between two towns.
details: Cascamorras involves a messenger running between Baza and Guadix, with residents of Baza trying to prevent him reaching the Virgin by covering him in grease and paint.

name: Beijing Temple Fair (Ditan / Longtan)
desc: Massive traditional temple fairs during Chinese New Year with folk performances, food stalls, and cultural activities.
details: Beijing's temple fairs during Spring Festival are among the city's most beloved traditions. Ditan Park and Longtan Park host the largest fairs, featuring traditional folk arts like stilt-walking, lion dances, Peking opera, cross-talk comedy, and calligraphy. Hundreds of food stalls serve traditional Beijing snacks. The fairs attract millions of visitors during the holiday week.

name: Círio de Nazaré (main procession)
desc: One of the world’s largest Catholic processions honoring Nossa Senhora de Nazaré.

name: Eurockeennes de Belfort
desc: One of France's longest-running and most prestigious rock festivals, drawing major international headliners to the lakeside Malsaucy peninsula.
details: Les Eurockéennes, held on the Malsaucy peninsula near Belfort, is one of France's biggest and most respected rock/pop festivals. The beautiful lakeside setting and consistently strong lineups have made it a summer staple since 1989. The festival combines rock, pop, electronic, and hip-hop acts across multiple stages.

name: Belize September Celebrations (Battle of St. George's Caye & Independence Day)
desc: Month-long observances including Battle of St. George's Caye Day (September 10) and Belize Independence Day (September 21) with parades, concerts, talent shows, and patriotic celebrations.
details: September is the most important period in Belize's event calendar, known as the September Celebrations. Rather than a single day, celebrations unfold throughout the month and are observed nationwide with parades, street parties, concerts, cultural showcases, and public ceremonies. Belize City hosts some of the largest and most visible events. The celebrations center on two main holidays: Battle of St. George's Caye Day (National Day) on September 10, and Independence Day on September 21. Annual traditions include the Queen of the Bay pageant, concerts, talent shows, the Citizens Parade on the Tenth, and Uniform Parade on the 21st. The Battle of St. George's Caye is celebrated on September 10 with radio stations playing patriotic music, people proudly wearing the country's colors, and crowds gathering at town squares for family picnics and public dances. Belize's Independence Day on September 21 features numerous local parades and marches throughout large and small towns with floats, bands, marchers, and people dressed in cultural attire and the country's colors of red, white, and blue.

name: Berlin International Film Festival (Berlinale)
desc: A highly political and progressive European film festival, one of the 'Big Three'.
details:
Eastern European filmmakers and Western capital.

name: Palo de Mayo (Maypole Festival)
desc: Month-long Afro-Caribbean festival built on heavy drums, soca, calypso, and Creole rhythms, with dancers in bright handmade costumes performing in different barrios throughout May.
details: Palo de Mayo is a month-long Afro-Caribbean festival built on heavy drums, soca, calypso, and Creole rhythms, with dancers winding through streets in bright costumes. Both the festival and dance are Afro-Nicaraguan traditions originating in Bluefields, Nicaragua in the 17th century. Palo de Mayo takes place in May in Bluefields on Nicaragua's Caribbean coast and is the country's most visible Afro-Caribbean cultural celebration. Events occur throughout the month, with music, dance, and public gatherings centered in the city and nearby communities. May 1st launches the annual Palo de Mayo, held every weekend in a different barrio, attracting people from across the country. The festival is best known for street performances and open-air dances set to Caribbean rhythms. Public spaces fill with live bands, dance groups, and informal celebrations, with much activity outdoors during evenings and weekends. Costumes, parades, and dance competitions form part of the program, alongside food stalls and community events highlighting Caribbean-influenced cuisine.

name: Salsa Fest Veracruz 2026
desc: One of largest and most celebrated salsa festivals in Latin America with free general admission
details: Venue: Salsódromo in Boca del Río. Three-day event with free general admission concerts, VIP zones, live performances by top salsa artists. Waterfront atmosphere. Recognized worldwide, promotes tourism. Affirms Veracruz as major musical festival reference.

name: Feria del Libro de Bogotá (FILBo)
desc: The 38th edition of Latin America's largest book fair with India as Country of Honor.
details: FILBo 2026 will occupy 23 pavilions at Corferias with over 630,000 attendees expected. India participates as Country of Honor with the thematic axis "Escucharnos es leernos." Professional activities occur April 27-28 with international agents and publishing experts. "FILBo Ciudad" brings programming to public libraries, bookstores, and cultural centers across Bogotá neighborhoods.

name: Sculpture by the Sea
desc: Spectacular free outdoor sculpture exhibition along the stunning Bondi to Tamarama coastal walk.
details: Sculpture by the Sea transforms the iconic Bondi to Tamarama coastal walk into one of the world's largest free outdoor sculpture exhibitions. Over 100 sculptures by artists from around the world are installed against the dramatic ocean backdrop, attracting 500,000+ visitors.

name: Boseong Green Tea Festival
desc: Celebration of Korea's premier green tea region with tea picking, tastings, and cultural performances among terraced plantations.
details: The Boseong Green Tea Festival celebrates Korea's largest green tea-producing region. Set among the photogenic terraced tea plantations, visitors can participate in tea picking, traditional tea ceremonies, green tea cooking, and cultural performances. The emerald-green terraces against misty mountains create one of Korea's most beautiful landscapes.

name: Haeundae Sand Festival
desc: International sand sculpture festival on Haeundae Beach with world-class artists creating enormous sand artworks.
details: The Haeundae Sand Festival showcases magnificent sand sculptures created by world-renowned artists on Korea's most famous beach. Visitors can admire towering sand artworks, participate in sand sculpture workshops, and enjoy beach activities and performances. The combination of art and beach culture makes it unique.

name: Busan Fireworks Festival
desc: One of Korea's most spectacular fireworks displays over Gwangalli Beach with the Gwangan Bridge as backdrop.
details: The Busan Fireworks Festival is one of Korea's most visually stunning events. Fireworks are launched from barges in the sea, the Gwangan Diamond Bridge, and the shore simultaneously, creating a 360-degree spectacle. The bridge becomes an integral part of the display as fireworks cascade from its spans. Over a million spectators line Gwangalli Beach.

name: Busan Sea Festival
desc: Major summer beach festival at Haeundae and other Busan beaches with concerts, water sports, and nightlife.
details: The Busan Sea Festival takes place across the city's famous beaches, including Haeundae and Gwangalli. Events include beach concerts, night pool parties, fireworks, street performances, sunset surfing, beach yoga, and Zumba sessions. It's the ultimate Korean summer beach experience, celebrating Busan's coastal culture.

name: Cairo International Book Fair
desc: One of the largest and oldest book fairs in the Arab world, held annually since 1969.
details: The Cairo International Book Fair is one of the world's largest and oldest book fairs, attracting millions of visitors over two weeks. It features publishers from across the Arab world and internationally, with thousands of titles, author events, and cultural programming.

name: Fest Nacional da Música
desc: Latin America's largest musical gathering celebrating all Brazilian Popular Music (MPB) trends with shows, debates, equipment exhibitions, and jam sessions.
details: The Festa Nacional da Música (National Music Festival) is reborn from the 1980s Festa Nacional do Disco, bringing musicians, artists, and industry representatives to discuss current music scene and future directions. The festival features all styles including axé, sertanejo, and MPB. Programming includes debates, equipment exhibitions, jam sessions, and exchange meetings facilitating industry networking.

name: Rhythm and Alps
desc: Epic New Year's Eve music festival in the stunning Cardrona Valley with mountain views.
details: Rhythm and Alps is New Zealand's premier New Year's Eve music festival, set in the spectacular Cardrona Valley near Wanaka. Multiple stages host electronic, drum and bass, hip-hop, and live acts as festival-goers ring in the New Year surrounded by snow-capped mountains.

name: Changbaishan Ice & Snow Festival
desc: Winter festival at the volcanic Changbai Mountains near the North Korean border with hot springs in snow.
details: The Changbai Mountains, home to the legendary Tianchi (Heaven Lake) crater lake on the China-North Korea border, host winter festivals featuring skiing, ice activities, and the surreal experience of bathing in natural hot springs surrounded by deep snow. The volcanic landscape adds drama to the winter scenery.

name: Chengdu International Finance Square Lantern Show
desc: Massive modern lantern installations in Chengdu combining traditional craftsmanship with contemporary art.
details: Chengdu's lantern shows combine Sichuan's rich lantern-making tradition with modern technology. Zigong-crafted lanterns are displayed in Chengdu's parks and public spaces, creating immersive light environments. The installations often feature giant panda themes and Sichuan opera elements alongside traditional mythological scenes.

name: Chiquitos Baroque Music Festival
desc: One of the world's most important classical music festivals featuring over 1,000 musicians performing 13th-18th century compositions by Jesuit missionaries and native "Chiquitanos."
details: The International Chiquitos Baroque Music Festival takes place April 17-26, 2026. It is one of the most important cultural meetings in Bolivia and among the world's most internationally projected music festivals. Over 1,000 musicians from around the world perform music written in the XIII and XVIII centuries by Jesuit missionaries and native "Chiquitanos" living in old Jesuit missions. The festival is enrolled in the circuit of the world's most important musical festivals and is sistered with the Festival of Sarrebourg in France. It celebrates a unique musical heritage blending European classical traditions with indigenous Bolivian expressions, preserved in colonial mission sites.

name: Three Gorges International Tourism Festival
desc: Tourism and cultural festival celebrating the stunning Three Gorges of the Yangtze River.
details: The Three Gorges Festival promotes the spectacular Yangtze gorges with cultural performances, river cruises, photography competitions, and ethnic minority showcases from the Tujia and Miao communities living in the gorge area. The dramatic scenery of sheer cliffs and the mighty Yangtze provide a memorable setting.

name: Chuncheon Dakgalbi Festival
desc: Festival celebrating Chuncheon's signature spicy stir-fried chicken rib dish with giant wok cooking.
details: Chuncheon's Dakgalbi Festival celebrates the city's iconic dish—spicy stir-fried chicken ribs with vegetables and rice cakes. The highlight is cooking dakgalbi in enormous woks. The festival includes eating competitions, cooking demonstrations, K-pop performances, and a parade. Chuncheon, the 'City of Dakgalbi,' attracts food lovers from across Korea.

name: Wolfkop Weekender
desc: Boutique electronic music festival in the Cederberg mountains combining nature, wellness, and music.
details: Set against the dramatic backdrop of the Cederberg mountains near Citrusdal, Wolfkop Weekender is a boutique festival that blends electronic music with outdoor adventure, wellness activities, and art installations in a pristine natural environment.

name: Clare Valley Gourmet Weekend
desc: Australia's longest-running wine and food festival with long lunches and winemaker dinners in the Clare Valley.
details: The Clare Valley Gourmet Weekend is a cherished tradition, celebrating the region's world-class Rieslings and food. Visitors travel between cellar doors enjoying long lunches, winemaker dinners, tastings, and live music in one of Australia's most picturesque wine regions.

name: Festival de Máscaras - Coscomatepec 2026
desc: Festival celebrating traditional Mexican masks

name: Crow Fair
desc: Known as the 'Teepee Capital of the World' with over 1,500 teepees, a massive celebration of Crow and Native culture.
details: Crow Fair transforms the Little Bighorn Valley into the largest Native American encampment in North America, with over 1,500 teepees creating a breathtaking sight. The celebration features a grand parade, rodeo, powwow dancing competitions, horse racing, and traditional feasts. It offers an unparalleled immersion into Plains Indian culture.

name: Olhar de Cinema - Festival Internacional de Curitiba
desc: 15th edition of important independent cinema festival celebrating artistic film with expanded program for feature films and shorts of all genres.
details: Olhar de Cinema has grown to prominence among independent film festivals in Brazil with 15 years of history. The 2026 edition features expanded programming across feature films, shorts, and all genres. Film submissions close February 26. The festival attracts independent filmmakers, critics, and cinephiles supporting artistic and experimental cinema outside mainstream industry frameworks.

name: 16th Bienal Internacional de Curitiba
desc: One of Latin America's main art events returns in person after its online 2021 edition, with over 30 years of history.
details: The 16th Bienal Internacional de Curitiba marks the return of in-person programming. Created in 1991, it has featured artists like Marina Abramović and Louise Bourgeois. The 2019 edition attracted around 1 million visitors with 461 artists from five continents. Includes CUBIC university circuit for emerging generations.

name: Dakar Off Biennale
desc: Hundreds of independent art exhibitions and pop-up galleries across Dakar during the Biennale.
details: The Dakar Off Biennale runs parallel to the official Dak'Art, featuring hundreds of independent exhibitions in homes, shops, rooftops, and unexpected spaces across the city. Many consider the Off programme to be the most exciting and authentic art experience.

name: Dali Butterfly Festival
desc: Magical natural phenomenon when millions of butterflies gather at Butterfly Spring near Dali's Erhai Lake.
details: The Butterfly Festival celebrates the annual gathering of millions of butterflies at Butterfly Spring near Dali. According to Bai legend, the butterflies are the transformed spirits of two lovers. The festival combines the natural spectacle with Bai ethnic singing, dancing, and the Raosanling walking festival through scenic spots around Erhai Lake.

name: Sharqiah Season
desc: Seasonal entertainment festival in Saudi Arabia's Eastern Province with cultural and entertainment events.
details: Part of Saudi Seasons initiative featuring concerts, cultural exhibitions, food festivals, and family entertainment along the Gulf coast.

name: Tamar Festival
desc: Music festival at the Dead Sea during Sukkot featuring Israeli artists in a spectacular desert setting.
details: Israeli music performances at the lowest point on earth, set against dramatic Dead Sea desert landscapes during the Sukkot holiday.

name: Imbolc International Music Festival
desc: Derry celebrates the ancient Celtic festival of Imbolc (the start of spring) with a week of music, fire, and cultural events in this vibrant walled city.
details: This week-long festival in Derry marks the Celtic spring festival of Imbolc with music, fire events, and cultural celebrations. Set within the UK's only completely walled city, the festival blends ancient Celtic traditions with contemporary performances, creating a unique atmosphere as winter gives way to the first hints of spring.

name: Dhaka Art Summit 2026: Tondra
desc: A non-commercial research and exhibition platform for South Asian art, drawing over 500,000 visitors to its previous edition.
details: The Dhaka Art Summit, founded in 2012 by the Samdani Art Foundation, is hosted biennially at Bangladesh Shilpakala Academy. Themed 'Tondra,' this edition continues connecting art histories across the Global South from Bangladesh. The 2023 edition drew over 500,000 visitors across nine days, making it one of the most visited art events in Asia.

name: Dieng Culture Festival
desc: Highland cultural festival with music, lanterns and traditional rituals (including hair-cutting ceremony).

name: Katara International Dhow Festival
desc: Festival celebrating traditional dhow sailing heritage with exhibitions, crafts, and maritime culture.
details: Showcases Qatar's diverse culinary scene with food stalls, cooking demonstrations, celebrity chef appearances, and cultural entertainment at various venues.

name: H.H. The Amir's Sword Equestrian Festival
desc: A prestigious equestrian festival in Doha featuring leading international horses and riders in showjumping and dressage.
details: A prestigious equestrian festival featuring leading international horses and riders competing in top-level showjumping and dressage events. Held at the Qatar Racing and Equestrian Club, it attracts elite equestrian competitors and spectators from around the world.

name: Download Festival
desc: UK's premier rock and metal festival at the legendary Donington Park.
details: Download Festival hosts 75,000+ rock and metal fans across five days at Donington Park, home of rock since the Monsters of Rock era. Multiple stages feature headliners and emerging bands across rock, metal, punk, and alternative genres.

name: Dresden Striezelmarkt
desc: Germany's oldest Christmas market (1434) featuring the world's largest Stollen.
details: Dresden's Striezelmarkt, running since 1434, features the famous Stollenfest with a 4-tonne Christmas Stollen paraded through the city and sliced for visitors.

name: Dubai Art Season
desc: A citywide cultural season under the theme 'Take a Walk on the Art Side' connecting literature, design, art fairs, and exhibitions.
details: Launched by Dubai Culture under the patronage of Sheikha Latifa bint Mohammed, Dubai Art Season 2026 runs from January 21 to April 26 and brings together the Emirates Airline Festival of Literature, Sikka Art & Design Festival, Al Quoz Arts Fest, Art Dubai, and World Art Dubai under one umbrella season themed 'Take a Walk on the Art Side.'

name: Al Quoz Arts Fest
desc: A vibrant weekend of exhibitions, music, live creative showcases, and family programming at Alserkal Avenue.
details: Hosted at Alserkal Avenue, Dubai's premier creative district, this weekend festival brings galleries, independent spaces, and studios together for a dense schedule of experimental art, music, performance, and food trucks. It's a snapshot of how contemporary culture has reshaped this former industrial area into a campus of creative energy.

name: Dubai Design Week
desc: The region's largest design festival with 200+ events including exhibitions, outdoor installations, talks, and the Global Grad Show.
details: Held in Dubai Design District (d3), this week features exhibitions, large-scale outdoor installations, talks, workshops, and the influential Global Grad Show. Downtown Design, a leading fair for contemporary furniture and textiles, anchors the week. It positions Dubai as a platform for design production and collaboration.

name: El Gouna Film Festival
desc: Premier Egyptian film festival in the Red Sea resort of El Gouna attracting international and Arab cinema.
details: The El Gouna Film Festival in the upscale Red Sea resort town screens a diverse selection of Arab and international films. It features red carpet premieres, workshops, and panels with industry professionals alongside the glamorous beach resort atmosphere.

name: Bakatue Festival
desc: Historic fishing festival in Elmina dating back to 1847 with a ceremonial opening of the lagoon.
details: The Bakatue Festival in Elmina, dating to 1847, features a ceremonial opening of the Benya Lagoon to mark the start of the fishing season. The chief casts the first net, followed by a mass fishing event. It includes colorful processions, traditional music, and cultural displays.

name: Carnaval Encarnaceno
desc: Samba-inspired parades and costume competitions in southern Paraguay.

name: Fiesta Nacional de la Flor
desc: South America's largest floriculture event celebrating flowers, gardening, and regional culture.
details: Held at Ciudad Floral (Mateo Gelves 1051) with 120+ nurserymen and producers. The 62nd edition features sunflowers representing happiness, vitality, and energy. Traditional float parade on Saturday October 11 with educational institutions and community groups. Includes gardening workshops, sustainable production talks, children's activities, and gastronomic fair. Admission: $10,000 (general), $8,000 (seniors).

name: Palio della Rana (Frog Race)
desc: A charmingly absurd Italian palio where seven town districts compete by racing frogs transported on wheelbarrows through the streets of picturesque Fermignano.
details: Residents of Fermignano compete in this annual frog race where seven contrade (districts) race frogs transported atop cariole (flat-topped wheelbarrows). The three-day event also involves a feast, a mass, and the Benediction of the frogs. It's wonderfully absurd, deeply local, and thoroughly Italian. Takes place on the first Sunday after Easter.

name: Calcio Storico (Historic Football)
desc: Florence's brutal and beautiful historic football — a wild mix of soccer, rugby, and wrestling played in 16th-century costume in Piazza Santa Croce.
details: Calcio Storico is a ferocious ancestral sport dating to the Renaissance, combining elements of football, rugby, and wrestling. Four teams representing Florence's historic quarters compete in period costume in the sand-covered Piazza Santa Croce. The finals on June 24 (St. John's Day, Florence's patron saint) are preceded by a stunning historical parade in Renaissance costume. Raw, passionate, and absolutely unforgettable.

name: Foshan Autumn Color Parade
desc: 400-year-old Cantonese folk parade featuring lion dances, dragon dances, and traditional performing arts.
details: The Foshan Qiuse (Autumn Color) Parade dates back over 400 years and is a showcase of Cantonese folk culture. The procession features Foshan's world-famous lion dances, dragon dances, martial arts demonstrations, and elaborately decorated floats. Foshan is the birthplace of Wing Chun kung fu and Cantonese lion dance traditions.

name: Kenka Matsuri (Iizaka Onsen)
desc: Fierce fighting festival in a hot spring town where teams clash massive floats.
details: The Iizaka Kenka Matsuri features teams violently crashing elaborate wooden floats in competition. After the wild festival, participants can soak in the town's ancient hot springs—a uniquely satisfying combination of adrenaline and relaxation.

name: Eurosonic Noorderslag (ESNS)
desc: Europe's premier winter music showcase with 300+ acts from 39 countries across 40 venues in four days.
details: ESNS is where European music careers are launched. Over four days, more than 300 acts from 39 countries perform across nearly 40 venues in Groningen's compact centre. The non-stop rotation of pop, electronic, indie, folk, hip-hop, and experimental sounds makes it the continent's most important music discovery event. The ESNS Art programme adds visual arts across the city.

name: Mariachi Festival Guadalajara 2026
desc: World's largest mariachi festival with public concerts, workshops, and cultural programs
details: Features visiting mariachi groups worldwide. Public concerts with workshops and lectures on mariachi music history and culture.

name: Guangzhou Flower Fair
desc: Guangzhou's legendary Lunar New Year flower market—the largest in southern China.
details: The Guangzhou Flower Fair (Huashi) is a centuries-old tradition where massive flower markets operate 24/7 in the days before Chinese New Year. Millions pack the streets to buy auspicious flowers—kumquats for prosperity, peach blossoms for romance, narcissus for good fortune. The electric atmosphere and scale make it one of China's most vibrant New Year traditions.

name: Gujo Hachiman Bon Odori
desc: Japan's longest dance festival spanning 30+ nights, including four all-night dance sessions in August.
details: Gujo Hachiman's Bon Odori runs for over 30 nights throughout summer, with the climactic Tetsuya Odori (all-night dancing) on four nights in mid-August. Unlike many Japanese festivals, visitors are actively encouraged to join the dancing. The authentic folk dances, traditional mountain town setting, and welcoming atmosphere make it one of Japan's most participatory festival experiences.

name: Gyeongju World Culture Expo
desc: Cultural exposition in the ancient Silla Kingdom capital showcasing Korean and world heritage.
details: Gyeongju—the ancient capital of the Silla Kingdom and one of Asia's most historically significant cities—periodically hosts world culture expos. The city's extraordinary concentration of UNESCO World Heritage sites including royal tombs, temples, and observatories provides an unparalleled historical setting.

name: Guam Liberation Day
desc: Commemoration of the liberation of Guam in 1944 with carnival, parade, and cultural festivities.
details: Guam Liberation Day commemorates the island's liberation from Japanese occupation on July 21, 1944. The celebration features a carnival running for weeks prior, a grand parade, cultural performances, and community events.

name: Grampians Grape Escape
desc: Premium food and wine festival set in the stunning Grampians featuring 90+ wineries and gourmet producers.
details: Set against the dramatic backdrop of the Grampians ranges, this festival brings together over 90 wineries and gourmet food producers for tastings, long lunches, winemaker dinners, and live music in one of Victoria's most beautiful natural settings.

name: Pukkelpop
desc: Major Belgian pop/rock/electronic festival with multi-stage headliners across four days.
details: Pukkelpop in Kiewit park near Hasselt features an adventurous lineup spanning indie, hip-hop, electronic, and punk across multiple stages with a passionate young audience.

name: Festival de Cine de La Habana (International Festival of New Latin American Cinema)
desc: Latin America's premier film festival featuring 283+ films from 40+ countries selected from 2,152+ submissions.
details: The 46th International Festival of New Latin American Cinema opens at the Cine Chaplin, an emblematic Havana venue. The festival featured approximately 400 artists, curators, and historians participating across 80+ locations throughout Havana. Films from the festival have been nominated for Goya Awards in the Best Iberoamerican Film category.

name: Helsinki Festival
desc: Finland's largest multidisciplinary arts festival featuring music, dance, film, theatre, and visual art.
details: The Helsinki Festival is a major cultural event spanning over two weeks with hundreds of events across the city. It presents an eclectic programme of classical and contemporary music, theatre, dance, visual arts, and film. The festival's Night of the Arts, a free all-night cultural celebration, is a particular highlight.

name: Picnic Festival
desc: Central America's largest music gathering on consecutive Saturdays featuring international headliners and spanning four stages with workshops and cultural activities.
