details: Picnic Festival 2026 takes place at Centro de Eventos Pedregal in Heredia on consecutive Saturdays, March 14 and 21. The festival features headliners Christina Aguilera, Maná, and Christian Nodal, drawing fans from across the region. Christina Aguilera makes her debut in Costa Rica, performing hits from her decades-long career. Maná returns after more than 10 years away from local stages, while Christian Nodal adds regional Mexican sound to the bill. Programming spans four stages: Picnic Stage, Jogo Stage, Hideout Stage, and Klan Destino. The event provides food and drink options, workshops, cultural activities, and camping. As Central America's largest music gathering, Picnic continues to expand, offering a platform for established stars and rising talents.

name: Hiratsuka Tanabata Festival
desc: One of Japan's largest Tanabata celebrations with enormous colorful streamers over shopping streets.
details: Hiratsuka's Tanabata is one of the Kanto region's biggest, with enormous decorations spanning shopping streets. Over 3 million visitors come to see the spectacular displays, enjoy festival food, and participate in Tanabata wish-writing.

name: Festival of Voices
desc: Unique celebration of the human voice with concerts, community singing, and performances across Tasmania.
details: The Festival of Voices is Australia's only festival dedicated to the human voice in all its forms. Over 10 days, it presents concerts, workshops, community sing-alongs, pop-up performances, and choral events, celebrating the universal power of singing.

name: MONA Foma
desc: Boundary-pushing arts festival curated by MONA featuring experimental music, art, and performance.
details: MONA FOMA (Museum of Old and New Art's Festival of Music and Art) is one of Australia's most adventurous arts festivals. Curated by MONA, it presents provocative and experimental music, visual art, and performance across venues in Hobart and Launceston, challenging artistic boundaries.

name: Hong Kong Seven-a-Side Rugby (Hong Kong Sevens)
desc: The world's premier rugby sevens tournament and one of Asia's biggest sporting parties.
details: The Hong Kong Sevens is the most prestigious stop on the World Rugby Sevens circuit and one of Asia's biggest sporting and social events. The three-day tournament at Hong Kong Stadium features international rugby, but is equally famous for its carnival atmosphere, costumed fans, and legendary after-parties.

name: Horsens Medieval Festival
desc: The Middle Ages come alive for two days with traders, craftsmen, musicians, knights, and jousting tournaments at FÆNGSLET.
details: Within the walls of FÆNGSLET (a former prison turned cultural venue) in Horsens, the Middle Ages are resurrected with market stalls, musicians, street performers, craftspeople, and grand jousting tournaments. It is one of the largest and most popular medieval festivals in Scandinavia.

name: Inuyama Festival
desc: UNESCO-listed festival with 13 elaborate three-tiered floats and karakuri puppet performances near Inuyama Castle.
details: The Inuyama Festival features 13 magnificent three-tiered yama floats, each topped with karakuri (mechanical puppet) performers. The floats are pulled through the streets near the scenic Inuyama Castle and Kiso River. Evening processions with 365 paper lanterns illuminating each float are particularly magical. UNESCO Intangible Cultural Heritage since 2016.

name: Toonik Tyme Festival
desc: Arctic spring festival celebrating Inuit culture with dog team races, igloo building, and traditional games.
details: Toonik Tyme is a weeklong celebration of the return of spring in the Arctic, featuring traditional Inuit games, dog team races, igloo building competitions, snowmobile races, throat singing, drum dancing, and community feasts of country food. It is the premier cultural festival of Canada's newest territory.

name: Jangheung Water Festival
desc: Fun-filled summer water festival featuring mudflat activities and seafood on Korea's southern coast.
details: Jangheung's water festival takes advantage of the Jeollanam-do coastline's extensive mudflats. Activities include mudflat walking, clam digging, water slides, and fresh seafood markets. The festival combines summer fun with Korea's unique tidal flat ecology—recognized by UNESCO as a World Heritage tidal flat.

name: Jeju Olle Walking Festival
desc: Walking festival along the famous 425km Olle Trail network circling Jeju Island's stunning coastline.
details: The Jeju Olle Walking Festival celebrates the island's famous 425km coastal walking trail network (26 routes). Thousands of walkers from Korea and abroad walk festival routes past volcanic craters, sea cliffs, fishing villages, and tangerine orchards. The festival includes cultural performances, local food, and environmental awareness programs.

name: Jilin Rime Ice Festival
desc: Natural rime ice formations on trees along the Songhua River create one of China's four great natural wonders.
details: Jilin's rime ice (wusong) along the Songhua River is considered one of China's four great natural wonders. When warm river water meets frigid air, moisture crystallizes on riverside trees creating spectacular white ice formations. The festival celebrates this phenomenon with ice activities and photography tours.

name: Jindo Sea Parting Festival
desc: Miraculous natural phenomenon where the sea parts to reveal a 2.8km land bridge between two islands.
details: The Jindo Sea Parting (Mysterious Sea Road) Festival celebrates a tidal phenomenon where the sea retreats to reveal a 2.8km-long, 40-meter-wide land bridge between Jindo and Modo islands. Thousands wade across the exposed seabed. The event, compared to Moses parting the Red Sea, includes folk performances and traditional Jindo dog shows.

name: Jinju Silk Festival
desc: Celebration of Jinju's traditional silk-weaving heritage with fashion shows and cultural performances.
details: Jinju has been Korea's silk capital for centuries, and its silk festival showcases traditional weaving techniques, silk fashion shows, and cultural performances. The festival often coincides with the more famous Jinju Lantern Festival, creating a double cultural experience.

name: Jokkmokk Winter Market
desc: Over 400-year-old Sámi market above the Arctic Circle combining traditional trade, reindeer racing, and Sámi culture.
details: The Jokkmokk Winter Market has been held above the Arctic Circle since 1605. Sámi artisans sell traditional handicrafts (duodji), reindeer meat, and furs. The market features reindeer racing, joik performances, and cultural exhibitions celebrating Sámi heritage. Set against a snow-covered Arctic landscape, it draws visitors from around the world.

name: Golab-giri Rose Water Festival
desc: Annual rose water distillation festival in the rose-growing villages near Kashan and Isfahan.
details: Traditional rose water distillation (Golab-giri) in Damask rose fields. Visitors participate in rose picking and witness centuries-old distillation process. Major tourist attraction.

name: Sawara Grand Festival
desc: UNESCO-listed float festival in a beautifully preserved Edo-period riverside town with enormous puppet-topped floats.
details: Sawara's festivals feature massive dashi floats topped with 4-5 meter tall figures of samurai, gods, and mythological characters—among the largest float decorations in Japan. The floats parade through the perfectly preserved Edo-period merchant quarter along the Ono River. The summer festival (July) and autumn festival (October) are both UNESCO Intangible Cultural Heritage.

name: Katsuyama Sagicho Festival
desc: Flamboyant float festival where elaborately decorated floats are dramatically burned at night.
details: Katsuyama Sagicho features 12 ornate floats decorated with silk paintings paraded through town before being dramatically set ablaze in a communal bonfire at night—symbolizing driving away evil spirits and welcoming spring. The floats represent each neighborhood's artistic pride.

name: Kawagoe Festival
desc: Spectacular float festival in 'Little Edo' with 29 towering floats and dramatic nighttime encounters.
details: The Kawagoe Festival in 'Little Edo' features 29 elaborate floats, each topped with a life-size figure of a historical or mythological character. The highlight is hikkawase—when floats encounter each other at intersections and their musicians compete with escalating volume. The evening festival against the preserved Edo-era warehouse district is magical.

name: Lazgi International Dance Festival
desc: Six-day celebration of the UNESCO-recognized Khorezm Lazgi dance with dancers from 30+ countries.
details: Celebrates the iconic Khorezm 'Lazgi' dance, a UNESCO-recognized cultural treasure. Features international dance competition, concerts, exhibitions, masterclasses, and scientific conference. Six-day program with Grand Prix of $7,000 and multiple prize categories. Dancers and delegations from 30+ countries. Applications open until March 10, 2026.

name: Kishiwada Danjiri Festival
desc: Heart-stopping festival where teams race 4-ton wooden carts at breakneck speed through narrow streets.
details: The Kishiwada Danjiri Matsuri is one of Japan's most dangerous and exhilarating festivals. Teams from 34 neighborhoods race 4-ton danjiri carts through narrow streets at high speed, with the highlight being the yarimawashi—dramatic high-speed turns at intersections. Carpenters (daiku-gata) perform acrobatic dances atop the carts while they careen around corners.

name: Kitchener-Waterloo Oktoberfest
desc: The largest Bavarian festival outside of Germany, celebrating German-Canadian culture.
details: K-W Oktoberfest is the largest Bavarian festival outside of Germany, with over 40 events including festhallen with oompah bands, a Thanksgiving Day Parade, barrel-rolling races, traditional German food, and of course plenty of German beer. The region's strong German heritage makes it an authentic celebration.

name: Silence Festival
desc: Unique arts festival in Finnish Lapland exploring the relationship between silence, sound, art, and the Arctic landscape.
details: The Silence Festival in Kittilä, Lapland, is built around the concept of silence as a creative force. In the vast, quiet landscapes of northern Finland, the festival presents performances, installations, and experiences that explore the boundary between sound and silence, nature and art. Under the midnight sun, it offers a profoundly contemplative cultural experience.

name: South Gippsland Garlic Festival
desc: Victoria's biggest garlic celebration with cooking demos, garlic braiding, and artisan market stalls.
details: The South Gippsland Garlic Festival is a one-day celebration of all things garlic, featuring cooking demonstrations, garlic braiding workshops, artisan food producers, live music, and family activities in the charming town of Korumburra.

name: Rainforest World Music Festival
desc: A unique Borneo rainforest setting blending indigenous instruments with global music acts and traditional instrument workshops.
details: Set at Mount Santubong's base in Sarawak, this festival blends indigenous Bornean musicians with international artists in an extraordinary rainforest setting. Daytime workshops teach traditional instruments while evening performances mix global sounds. The festival naturally leads to exploration of Sarawak's food, museums, and nature reserves.

name: Kunming Flower Festival
desc: Celebrating the 'Spring City's' year-round blooms with massive flower exhibitions and garden displays.
details: Known as the 'Spring City' for its eternal mild climate, Kunming celebrates its botanical heritage with elaborate flower exhibitions featuring camellias, azaleas, and cherry blossoms. The World Horti-Expo Garden and Kunming Botanical Garden host the largest displays. Traditional ethnic minority performances and flower markets complement the floral exhibitions.

name: Kunming Water Splashing at Green Lake
desc: Kunming's version of the Dai Water Splashing Festival at the scenic Green Lake Park.
details: While the main Water Splashing Festival takes place in Xishuangbanna, Kunming's Green Lake Park hosts a vibrant urban version where Dai and other ethnic minorities celebrate alongside Han Chinese residents. The accessible city location makes this an easy way to experience the tradition.

name: Nabana no Sato Winter Illumination
desc: Japan's largest illumination event with 8.5 million LEDs creating spectacular themed light displays.
details: Nabana no Sato at Nagashima Resort features Japan's largest seasonal illumination with approximately 8.5 million LEDs. The centerpiece is a massive animated LED tunnel and themed main display that changes annually. A 200-meter illuminated tunnel, cherry blossom lane, and river of light are permanent features. The scale is staggering.

name: Kyoto Sakura Season
desc: Cherry blossoms frame Kyoto's temples, shrines, and geisha districts in Japan's most atmospheric setting.
details: Kyoto's cherry blossom season is arguably the most atmospheric in all of Japan. Blossoms frame iconic sites like Kiyomizu-dera, Philosopher's Path, Maruyama Park, and Arashiyama. Night illuminations at temples create unforgettable scenes. The combination of ancient architecture and ephemeral blossoms embodies mono no aware (the beauty of transience).

name: Higashiyama Hanatouro (Eastern Hills Illumination)
desc: 2,500 lanterns illuminate the path from Shoren-in through Gion to Kiyomizu-dera.
details: The Higashiyama Hanatouro places approximately 2,500 lanterns along the 5km path through Kyoto's most atmospheric temple district. From Shoren-in through the geisha quarter of Gion to Kiyomizu-dera, the warm lantern light transforms already beautiful streetscapes into magical scenes. Temples along the route hold special evening openings.

name: Daigoji Hanami (Cherry Blossoms)
desc: Toyotomi Hideyoshi's legendary cherry blossom party recreated at the beautiful Daigoji Temple.
details: Daigoji Temple's cherry blossoms gained fame when warlord Toyotomi Hideyoshi held a legendary hanami party here in 1598 with 1,300 guests. Today the temple grounds feature weeping cherry trees against the five-story pagoda. The historical significance and UNESCO World Heritage status make it a premier viewing spot.

name: Miyako no Nigiwai Festival (Nijo Castle)
desc: Special cultural performances at Nijo Castle celebrating 400th anniversary of Emperor Go-Mizunoo's visit.
details: In 2026, Kyoto commemorates the 400th anniversary of Emperor Go-Mizunoo's visit to Nijo Castle—one of the most elaborate events of the Edo period. Special performances, exhibitions, and ceremonies will recreate this historical moment at the UNESCO World Heritage castle.

name: Gran Poder
desc: Large folkloric parade featuring dance troupes, brass bands, and indigenous traditions.

name: Fiesta de la Mama Negra
desc: Most emblematic Intangible Cultural Heritage celebration featuring the Mama Negra parade—representation of Virgin combined with African deities on horseback.
details: Also known as Fiesta de la Capitanía, Fiesta de la Santísima Tragedia, or Fiesta de la Virgen de las Mercedes. Two seasons: September (religious gratitude for granted favors) and November (civic commemoration of Latacunga's independence). Parade includes striking characters: Moorish King, Angel of Stars, Los Huacos (pre-Colombian heritage), dancers, musicians, marching bands. Culmination: Mama Negra on horseback—symbol of Latacunga identity blending religious and civic elements, Catholic devotion and patriotism in complex cultural spectacle preserving traditions, characters, rituals, and artistic expressions.

name: Festival Internacional del Globo (balloon Festival)
desc: World-renowned hot air balloon festival with hundreds of balloons rising at dawn, creating spectacular aerial displays.
details: Held at Parque Metropolitano de León over approximately 4 days in November. Features massive balloon launches beginning at 6:30 AM, cultural activities, interactive zones, night shows including the famous "Magic Night" illuminated balloon display, and concerts with national and international artists. Attracts over 400,000 visitors annually from around the world. Hundreds of hot air balloons from different parts of the world inflate and rise simultaneously, offering an unforgettable visual spectacle.

name: Lhasa Saga Dawa (Buddha's Month)
desc: Holiest month in Tibet when pilgrims perform countless prostrations and circumambulations.
details: During Saga Dawa, pilgrims perform the Lingkhor circumambulation around Lhasa and the Barkhor around Jokhang Temple. The most devoted perform full-body prostrations around the entire route. At Kailash, the massive prayer flagpole is replaced in a major ceremony. Generosity increases dramatically with alms given freely.

name: Lhasa Butter Lamp Festival
desc: Spectacular display of intricate butter sculptures illuminated by thousands of yak butter lamps at Jokhang Temple.
details: On the 15th day of the first Tibetan month, Lhasa's Jokhang Temple and Barkhor Street are illuminated by thousands of yak butter lamps. Monks create extraordinary butter sculptures—some several meters tall—depicting Buddhist deities, flowers, and mythological scenes. The flickering lamplight and chanting create a deeply spiritual atmosphere.

name: Potala Palace Butter Lamp Festival
desc: Thousands of yak butter lamps illuminate the Potala Palace and Jokhang Temple on the 15th of the first Tibetan month.
details: On the 15th of the first month of the Tibetan calendar, the area around Jokhang Temple and the Barkhor becomes illuminated by thousands of butter lamps. Monks create extraordinary yak butter sculptures depicting Buddhist deities and scenes. The warm glow of the lamps against the night sky and the chanting of monks creates a deeply spiritual atmosphere.

name: Shoton Festival (Yogurt Festival)
desc: Tibet's greatest cultural festival featuring the enormous Drepung Buddha unveiling and Tibetan opera.
details: The Shoton Festival is Lhasa's most important cultural event. The highlight is the spectacular unfurling of a giant thangka painting of Buddha (500 square meters) on the hillside at Drepung Monastery at dawn. Throughout the week, Tibetan opera performances take place at Norbulingka Palace, and horse racing and yak racing competitions are held. Originally a religious event for offering yogurt to monks after meditation retreats.

name: Señor de los Milagros (procession season)
desc: Major Lima religious processions associated with the Lord of Miracles devotion.

name: Macau Arts Festival
desc: Month-long arts festival blending Portuguese, Chinese, and international performing arts in the historic city.
details: The Macau Arts Festival is a month-long celebration featuring theater, dance, music, and visual arts from Portugal, China, and international companies. Performances in historic venues—Portuguese colonial churches, Chinese temples, and contemporary theaters—reflect Macau's unique cultural fusion. The festival is a cornerstone of Macau's identity as a creative city.

name: Side Intl Culture & Art Festival
desc: Cultural and arts festival in the ancient city of Side with performances in the Roman theatre.
details: Features performances in the ancient Roman amphitheatre of Side with music, dance, and theatre against a spectacular Mediterranean backdrop.

name: Holi
desc: Festival of colors celebrating spring and the triumph of good over evil; powder-throwing and community feasts.

name: Nowruz
desc: Afghanistan's most significant celebration with the Jahanda Bala banner-raising at Mazar-i-Sharif's Blue Mosque.
details: Afghanistan's most significant cultural celebration marking the New Year and arrival of spring. Major gathering at Mazar-i-Sharif's central park with the Jahanda Bala (banner raising) ceremony at the Blue Mosque. Celebrated with traditional Haft Mewa (seven fruits), home cleaning, flower decoration. The first 40 days coincide with red tulip blooming.

name: Nakameguro Cherry Blossom Festival
desc: Hip neighborhood festival along the cherry-lined Meguro River with food stalls and lanterns.
details: The Nakameguro Cherry Blossom Festival adds festival stalls and paper lantern illuminations along the river's cherry blossom-lined paths. The combination of trendy Nakameguro's boutiques and cafes with traditional paper lanterns creates a uniquely Tokyo atmosphere where old and new Japan coexist beautifully.

name: Festival de las Animas
desc: Merida's unique Yucatecan Day of the Dead celebration blending Maya and colonial traditions.
details: Merida celebrates Hanal Pixan, the Yucatecan version of Day of the Dead derived from Maya traditions. Unlike mainland Mexico's celebrations, Hanal Pixan features mucbil pollo (underground-cooked tamales), elaborate cemetery decorations, and cultural events blending Maya and Spanish colonial traditions.

name: Fiesta de la Guadalupe
desc: Mexico's most important religious festival with millions of pilgrims converging on the Basilica de Guadalupe.
details: Millions walk (many for days or on their knees) to the Basilica de Guadalupe — one of the most-visited Catholic shrines globally. Dec 12 features midnight serenatas, matachines dances, masses, and celebrations. The devotion is central to Mexican national identity, blending indigenous and Catholic traditions since the reported 1531 apparition.

name: Soma Nomaoi (Wild Horse Chase)
desc: Extraordinary 1,000-year-old samurai horse-riding festival with armored horsemen racing and capturing wild horses.
details: Soma Nomaoi is one of Japan's most spectacular historical reenactments. Over 400 horsemen in full samurai armor race across a field, chase flags launched by fireworks, and capture wild horses with bare hands in an ancient ritual dating back 1,000 years. The thundering hooves and armor-clad riders create scenes straight from a historical epic. The festival survived even the 2011 Fukushima disaster.

name: Mohe Arctic Village Ice Festival
desc: Ice festival at China's northernmost town where temperatures drop to -50C and the Northern Lights appear.
details: Mohe, China's northernmost town near the Russian border, hosts its own ice festival at temperatures reaching -50C. The remote Arctic Village offers China's only chance to see the Northern Lights. Ice activities, winter survival experiences, and the extreme cold make it an adventure destination.

name: Mount Hagen Show
desc: Massive tribal gathering with spectacular sing-sing performances by Highland warrior groups in full ceremonial regalia.
details: The Mount Hagen Show rivals the Goroka Show as PNG's most important cultural event. Highland warrior groups perform sing-sings in extraordinary ceremonial dress — elaborate wigs, face paint, feathered headdresses, and shell ornaments. The display of cultural pride and artistry is breathtaking.

name: San Benito Festival (Mucuchies, Mérida)
desc: Regional celebration honoring San Benito de Palermo (El Moro) with elaborate costumes and energetic dancing.
details: The two-day festival in the Andean town of Mucuchies celebrates the patron saint with elaborate costumes representing San Benito, known as El Moro—a venerated black saint. The celebration involves energetic traditional dances. Additionally, San Benito is the patron saint of Lake Maracaibo, and celebrations occur in that region as well with late December timing.

name: Okinawa Cherry Blossom Festival
desc: Japan's earliest cherry blossoms—Okinawa's unique kanhizakura variety blooms months before the mainland.
details: Okinawa's cherry blossoms are the first in Japan, blooming in late January. The kanhizakura variety produces deeper pink flowers than mainland varieties. Nago Castle ruins, Nakijin Castle, and Yaedake Park are prime viewing spots. The subtropical setting with castle ruins and ocean views creates a completely different hanami experience from mainland Japan.

name: Nagoya Festival
desc: Major city festival featuring a historical parade led by the Three Heroes of Nagoya—Oda Nobunaga, Toyotomi Hideyoshi, and Tokugawa Ieyasu.
details: The Nagoya Festival features a spectacular procession of 700+ participants dressed as samurai and court attendants, led by men portraying the Three Great Unifiers of Japan who all hailed from the Nagoya area. Floats, marching bands, and flower-decorated vehicles parade through the city center. Traditional performing arts demonstrations and a night festival round out the weekend.

name: Nanning International Folk Song Festival
desc: Major international folk music festival showcasing the singing traditions of the Zhuang and other ethnic groups.
details: Nanning's International Folk Song Festival celebrates the rich musical heritage of the Zhuang ethnic group—China's largest ethnic minority—and folk music traditions from around the world. The festival features concerts, song competitions, cultural exhibitions, and a grand opening ceremony. It has become one of China's most significant music events.

name: Nara Uneme Festival
desc: Elegant festival with dragon boats and floating flower offerings on Sarusawa Pond.
details: The Uneme Festival at Sarusawa Pond in Nara features a beautifully decorated dragon boat ceremony and floating flower offerings. The tradition commemorates a court lady who drowned herself in the pond. The evening ceremony with lanterns reflected in the water is hauntingly beautiful.

name: Wakakusayama Yamayaki (Mountain Burning)
desc: Spectacular burning of an entire hillside in Nara followed by fireworks.
details: Wakakusayama Yamayaki involves setting fire to the entire hillside of Mt. Wakakusa in Nara. Before the burning, fireworks are launched from the hillside. The sight of an entire mountain ablaze against the night sky, with the silhouettes of Todaiji and Kofukuji pagodas in the foreground, is breathtaking. The tradition reportedly dates to a boundary dispute between temples.

name: Verbier Festival
desc: Prestigious classical music festival in the Swiss Alps.
details: Verbier Festival brings world-class musicians and promising young artists to perform in the spectacular Alpine setting of Verbier, combining classical excellence with mountain beauty.

name: Niihama Taiko Festival
desc: Spectacular festival where 53 massive taikodai drum floats are paraded and dramatically lifted overhead.
details: The Niihama Taiko Festival features 53 enormous taikodai floats, each weighing about 3 tons and decorated with elaborate gold-threaded embroidery. Teams of 150 men lift these massive structures overhead and parade them through the city. The 'kakikurabe' competition—where teams lift their floats highest—is the dramatic climax.

name: Nauryz (Kazakh Spring Festival)
desc: Kazakh spring equinox celebration in western Mongolia marking renewal and new life.
details: Nauryz is celebrated by the Kazakh minority in western Mongolia's Bayan-Olgii Province, marking the spring equinox. Traditional ceremonies include preparing Nauryz kozhe (grain soup), horse games, and cultural performances. The celebration reflects the vibrant Kazakh culture maintained in Mongolia's westernmost province.

name: Osun-Osogbo Festival
desc: Sacred two-week celebration honoring the Yoruba goddess Osun at a UNESCO World Heritage Sacred Grove.
details: The Osun-Osogbo Festival dates back over 600 years and is dedicated to Osun, the Yoruba goddess of fertility, love, and protection. Held in the Osun Sacred Grove, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, the Ataoja of Osogbo and the Arugba (votary maid) play central ritual roles in this deeply spiritual celebration.

name: Otaru Canal Festival
desc: Summer festival along Otaru's famous canal with floating lanterns, music, and food stalls.
details: Otaru's historic canal—the city's most iconic feature—hosts a summer festival with floating lanterns, outdoor concerts, dance performances, and food stalls along the stone-lined waterway. The warm summer evening atmosphere along the gas-lit canal district creates a romantic and nostalgic mood.

name: Lumo Art & Tech Festival
desc: Expanded light and technology festival combining international expertise in visual art, light, and sound as part of Oulu2026.
details: For 2026, the Lumo Light Festival expands into a ten-day event combining art, science, and technology. Large-scale light installations transform public spaces while immersive works in unexpected venues challenge perceptions of nature, space, and time. Part of the Oulu European Capital of Culture programme.

name: DMZ Peace Festival
desc: Cultural peace events along the Demilitarized Zone border area between North and South Korea.
details: The DMZ area hosts peace-themed cultural events featuring art exhibitions, concerts, and nature tours in the world's most heavily fortified border zone. The irony of the DMZ becoming one of Asia's most pristine nature reserves due to 70+ years of human absence adds poignancy.

name: Pátzcuaro Fiesta de las Ánimas 2026
desc: Regional celebration with boat processions and cemetery vigils

name: Pohang International Fire & Light Festival
desc: One of Korea's top fireworks festivals with international fireworks contests and spectacular drone light shows.
details: The Pohang International Fire & Light Festival is one of Korea's three largest fireworks events. It features an international fireworks competition, light drone displays creating formations in the night sky, street parades, and a local market. The coastal setting of Pohang adds to the spectacle.

name: Fest'Napuan
desc: Melanesian music and arts festival bringing together Pacific artists for performances and cultural exchange.
details: Fest'Napuan is Melanesia's largest music festival, held annually in Port Vila. Pacific Island musicians from Vanuatu, New Caledonia, Solomon Islands, and Papua New Guinea gather for a week of performances, workshops, and cultural exchange celebrating Melanesian arts.

name: Lohri
desc: Winter harvest bonfire festival with folk songs, dances (bhangra/gidda), and shared sweets.

name: National Mask Festival
desc: Celebration of PNG's extraordinary mask-making traditions with performances by spirit dancers from across the islands.
details: The National Mask Festival in Rabaul showcases Papua New Guinea's remarkable mask-making traditions. Spirit dancers in elaborate masks perform traditional dances, and master carvers display their work. The festival celebrates the spiritual and artistic significance of masks in Melanesian culture.

name: Carnival of Rijeka
desc: Croatia's largest carnival with zvončari bell-ringers (UNESCO heritage).
details: Rijeka Carnival blends the ancient zvončari tradition with elaborate Venetian-style masking. 10,000+ performers parade through the city in the International Carnival Parade.

name: MDLBEAST Soundstorm
desc: Mega music festival featuring world's top DJs and artists with massive production and stage design.
details: One of the world's largest music festivals featuring electronic, hip-hop, and pop artists across multiple stages with cutting-edge production in the desert.

name: Earth Celebration (Kodo Drums - Sado Island)
desc: World-famous Kodo taiko ensemble's annual festival on remote Sado Island blending music with nature.
details: Earth Celebration is the annual festival of the world-famous Kodo taiko ensemble on Sado Island. International musicians collaborate with Kodo in performances set against the Sea of Japan. The remote island setting, combined with workshops and outdoor concerts under the stars, creates an intimate yet world-class music experience.

name: Great Minnesota Get-Together (Minnesota State Fair)
desc: The largest state fair in the US by daily attendance, famous for food-on-a-stick and agriculture exhibitions.
details: The Great Minnesota Get-Together is the largest state fair in the country by daily attendance, drawing nearly 2 million visitors over 12 days. Famous for its creative food-on-a-stick offerings, the fair also features agricultural competitions, concerts at the Grandstand, the Miracle of Birth Center, and hundreds of vendors and exhibits.

name: Salzburg Festival
desc: One of Europe’s highest-profile classical music/opera/theatre festivals with a long summer run.
details: The Salzburg Festival presents opera, drama, and concerts of the highest calibre in Mozart's birthplace. The Vienna Philharmonic, guest orchestras, and world-class soloists perform in venues from the Felsenreitschule to the Grosses Festspielhaus.

name: Festival del Burro
desc: Seven-day Easter celebration featuring costumed donkeys in parades, competitions, coronations, and folkloric performances.
details: Since 1987, the National Donkey Festival celebrates donkeys' importance in rural Colombian agriculture and transportation. Activities: Desfiles de burros disfrazados (donkey parades), comparsas competitions, folkloric presentations (decimeros, gritos de monte, vaquería songs), bird and wind bands, traditional percussion, contests for best burros/pollinos, coronation of donkey king and queen. Mix of music, celebration, and cultural expression unique to Caribbean coast.

name: San Antonio Stock Show & Rodeo
desc: One of the premier livestock shows and rodeos in the US, with 18 days of western heritage and big-name concerts.
details: The San Antonio Stock Show & Rodeo is one of the largest in the nation, featuring PRCA rodeo competitions, livestock auctions, carnival midway, western heritage exhibits, and nightly concerts by major artists. The event raises millions for college scholarships and celebrates Texas ranching culture.

name: Fiesta San Antonio
desc: A 10-day citywide celebration of San Antonio's diverse heritage with over 100 events, parades, and music.
details: One of America's premier festivals, Fiesta San Antonio started as a simple parade honoring the heroes of the Alamo and the Battle of San Jacinto. Today it encompasses over 100 events including the spectacular Battle of Flowers Parade, Fiesta Flambeau (the largest illuminated night parade in the country), NIOSA (Night in Old San Antonio), and dozens of cultural celebrations reflecting the city's Mexican, German, and multicultural heritage.

name: Outside Lands Music Festival
desc: San Francisco's premier music festival in Golden Gate Park, combining top-tier music with wine, beer, and culinary experiences.
details: Set amid the eucalyptus groves and meadows of Golden Gate Park, Outside Lands features headlining music acts alongside Gastromagic (celebrity chef collaborations), Wine Lands, Beer Lands, and Grass Lands. The festival celebrates San Francisco's culinary and cultural identity while delivering world-class musical performances.

name: Fiestas de Zapote
desc: 11-day end-of-year festival combining bull riding corridas, mechanical amusement park rides, free concerts, and food zones in a family-friendly atmosphere.
details: The Fiestas de Zapote is held at the Campo Ferial de Zapote, an area east of central San José. The 11-day celebration fills the fairground with corridas de toros (bull-riding performances) held daily in two sessions at 3:00 pm and 7:00 pm, watchable via official transmissions on Canal OPA and Multimedios. About 30 mechanical rides operate throughout the grounds, including Ferris wheels, bumper cars, and spinning attractions for all ages. Food stalls serve Costa Rican staples such as tamales, vigorones, churros, pupusas, and elotes. Free concerts happen each evening in a dedicated area. The fair opens at 11 am daily, with activity peaking after 3 pm. Travelers reach the site easily by bus, Uber, or taxi from downtown San José.

name: Feria Nacional Potosina (FENAPO)
desc: Major state fair featuring professional wrestling, destruction derbies, concerts, and varied entertainment.
details: 2026 brings intense, diverse agenda with high-level entertainment for all ages. January activities: "Guerra de Leyendas" professional wrestling (January 10) with Alberto El Patrón, Hijo de Dos Caras, Dr. Wagner Jr.; CMLL wrestling function (January 14) with championship matches. Major concert lineup confirmed. Governor maintains approaches to finalize AC/DC presentation. Board of Directors assumed direct operation of Palenque for 2026 edition following gubernatorial instruction. Features VIP Palenque, free Teatro del Pueblo, Templo Mayor, complete amusement park, gastronomic pavilion with Mexican street food and Baja California seafood.

name: San Sebastián Film Festival
desc: Major international film festival and Spain's premier cinema event.
details: The San Sebastián International Film Festival is one of Europe's most prestigious, featuring the Golden Shell award, international premieres, and industry events in the elegant Basque coastal city.

name: San Sebastián Jazz Festival (Jazzaldia)
desc: One of Europe's premier jazz festivals in one of the world's greatest food cities — world-class performances in an unforgettable coastal setting.
details: Jazzaldia brings world-class jazz to multiple venues across San Sebastián, from the spectacular open-air stage at Zurriola Beach to intimate clubs in the old town. Free and ticketed concerts showcase jazz legends and emerging artists alike. The combination of top-tier jazz and San Sebastián's legendary Basque cuisine — with the world's highest concentration of Michelin stars per capita — is irresistible.

name: Havana Jazz Expansion (Santiago, Santa Clara, Holguín)
desc: Expansion of the Jazz Plaza Festival to reach new Cuban cities for the first time in 2026.
details: The 41st Jazz Plaza Festival reaches new cities including Santiago de Cuba, Santa Clara, and Holguín. Over 70 international artists confirmed from the United States, Brazil, Spain, France, and the United Kingdom. This expansion demonstrates Cuba's commitment to spreading jazz culture throughout the island beyond Havana.

name: Festival de Cine Global Santo Domingo
desc: The most important cinematographic event of the Caribbean, offering Dominican and international perspectives through cinema.
details: An initiative of the Fundación Global Democracia y Desarrollo (Funglode), the festival centers on accessing perspectives that cinema brings to "global themes" through "personal stories." Serves as a platform supporting local and international film production within the Dominican Republic with objectives including utilizing cinema to strengthen economic development. Includes multiple film categories and competitions for documentaries, animated films, and short films, with sections dedicated to debut filmmakers and films exploring important global issues.

name: Yosakoi Soran Festival
desc: Sapporo's version of the Yosakoi dance festival combining Kochi-style dancing with Hokkaido's Soran fisherman's song.
details: The Yosakoi Soran Festival merges the energetic Yosakoi dance tradition from Kochi with the traditional Soran Bushi fisherman's song of Hokkaido. Over 280 teams and 28,000 dancers perform in high-energy routines across multiple stages in central Sapporo. The grand finale features prize-winning teams performing together.

name: Camel Wrestling Festival
desc: Traditional Turkish camel wrestling competition near ancient Ephesus.
details: Bull camels decorated with ornate saddles and bells wrestle in pairs while 20,000+ spectators feast on camel sausage and local specialities. An ancient Turkic tradition.

name: Sendai Pageant of Starlight
desc: Sendai's famous winter illumination with 600,000 LED lights lining Jozenji-dori's zelkova tree avenue.
details: Sendai's Pageant of Starlight illuminates the iconic zelkova tree-lined Jozenji-dori avenue with 600,000 LED lights, creating a magical tunnel of golden light. The illumination transforms the avenue into Sendai's most romantic winter scene. Weekend performances and events accompany the display throughout December.

name: Seogwipo Canola Flower Festival
desc: Brilliant yellow canola flowers blanket Jeju Island's volcanic landscapes in a spectacular spring display.
details: Jeju's canola flower season transforms the island into a sea of yellow against the dramatic backdrop of Mt. Hallasan volcano and black lava stone walls. The Seogwipo area hosts the main festival with flower walks, local food stalls, horseback riding through flower fields, and Jeju tangerine tasting.

name: Seogwipo Jeju Citrus Festival
desc: Celebration of Jeju Island's iconic hallabong citrus harvest in the volcanic island's south.
details: Jeju's citrus festival celebrates the island's famous hallabong tangerines. Visitors can pick citrus, taste unique citrus products, and enjoy cultural performances. The volcanic island setting, with Hallasan mountain in the background and ocean views, provides a spectacular autumnal scene.

name: Seoul Fringe Festival
desc: Independent arts festival showcasing theatre, dance, and visual arts in unconventional venues across Seoul.
details: The Seoul Fringe Festival is Korea's premier independent arts event, featuring hundreds of performances in cafes, parks, galleries, and unconventional spaces throughout the Hongdae and Daehangno arts districts. The festival champions experimental and emerging artists across theater, dance, music, and visual arts, creating a vibrant alternative culture scene.

name: Yeouido Spring Flower Festival
desc: Seoul's premier cherry blossom event along the Yeouido congressional district's famous tree-lined avenue.
details: The Yeouido Spring Flower Festival is Seoul's most popular cherry blossom celebration. The 1.7km stretch behind the National Assembly Building transforms into a cherry blossom tunnel. The festival features street performances, food markets, and nighttime illuminations of the blossoms. Its central Seoul location makes it easily accessible.

name: Seoul Spring Festa
desc: Major city-wide spring festival transforming Seoul with K-culture events, concerts, and art installations.
details: Seoul Spring Festa is a relatively new but rapidly growing city-wide celebration that combines K-pop concerts, traditional cultural performances, art installations, food festivals, and international cultural exchanges across multiple Seoul venues. The festival aims to showcase Seoul as a global cultural capital during its most beautiful season.

name: Seoul Kimchi Making & Sharing Festival
desc: Massive communal kimchi-making event celebrating Korea's most iconic UNESCO-listed culinary tradition.
details: The Seoul Kimchi Festival celebrates the UNESCO-listed tradition of kimjang—the communal making of kimchi for winter. Thousands of participants, including international visitors, make kimchi alongside Korean chefs and community groups. The festival includes kimchi tastings, cooking competitions, educational programs, and the mass production of kimchi that is donated to those in need.

name: Shanghai Longhua Temple Fair
desc: Shanghai's oldest and largest temple fair with over 1,000 years of history.
details: The Longhua Temple Fair is Shanghai's most significant traditional gathering, held around the Longhua Temple and Pagoda—the city's oldest religious site. The month-long fair features folk performances, traditional handicrafts, Buddhist ceremonies, peach blossom viewing, and hundreds of food stalls serving traditional Shanghai snacks.

name: Xposure International Photography Festival
desc: One of the region's leading photography gatherings combining large-scale exhibitions with talks, film screenings, and portfolio reviews.
details: Sharjah's premier photography event hosts documentary, conceptual, and photojournalistic practices side by side, mapping regional concerns and global visual narratives. Large-scale exhibitions, talks, film screenings, and portfolio reviews make it a key event for photography professionals and enthusiasts.

name: Shenyang Ice and Snow Festival
desc: Major northern China ice festival in the former Manchurian capital with imperial-themed ice sculptures.
details: Shenyang's Ice and Snow Festival features ice sculptures inspired by the city's Manchu heritage and the nearby Imperial Palace. While smaller than Harbin's festival, it offers unique historical theming and is combined with hot spring experiences in the surrounding area.

name: Shimoda Black Ship Festival
desc: Festival commemorating Commodore Perry's arrival in 1854 with parades, US Navy participation, and cultural exchange.
details: The Shimoda Black Ship Festival commemorates the arrival of Commodore Matthew Perry's 'Black Ships' in 1854, which opened Japan to the world. The festival features a reenactment of Perry's landing, a parade with both Japanese and American participants, US Navy ship visits, and cultural performances. It celebrates the Japan-US friendship born from this historical encounter.

name: Shimizu Tanabata Festival
desc: One of Japan's three great Tanabata festivals with elaborate bamboo decorations along shopping arcades.
details: Shimizu's Tanabata ranks among Japan's three greatest, alongside Sendai and Hiratsuka. Shopping arcades are decorated with enormous bamboo streamers featuring intricate designs. Dance parades, food stalls, and wish-writing activities fill the streets.

name: KUDAFEST Gastro Festival
desc: Citywide gastro festival with 8 food venues offering curated festival sets exploring Shymkent's cuisine.
details: Citywide gastro festival with 8 food venues offering specially curated festival sets including main dishes, desserts, drinks at fixed prices. Explores Shymkent's culinary diversity.

name: Palio di Siena (Il Palio) – August race
desc: Historic bareback horse race between Siena’s contrade in Piazza del Campo, with pageantry and neighborhood rivalries.

name: Tyre/Sour International Festival
desc: Cultural festival in the ancient Phoenician city of Tyre featuring music and arts in the Roman hippodrome.
details: Performances in the UNESCO-listed Roman hippodrome of Tyre, one of the best-preserved ancient hippodromes in the world.

name: Stockholm Pride
desc: Scandinavia's largest Pride festival featuring colourful parades, concerts, and cultural events across Stockholm.
details: Stockholm Pride is one of the largest Pride celebrations in Europe, drawing hundreds of thousands to a week of events including a massive parade, concerts, debates, and cultural activities. The festival reflects Sweden's progressive identity and inclusive values.

name: Strasbourg Christmas Market
desc: Europe's oldest Christmas market (1570) and Christkindelsmärik.
details: Strasbourg's Christkindelsmärik, dating to 1570, fills 12 locations with 300+ chalets beneath a 30m Christmas tree. France's 'Capital of Christmas' draws 2 million visitors.

name: Emerge Fest
desc: Taiwan's largest and most iconic rock festival spotlighting underrated Asian alternative and punk artists.
details: EMERGE FEST celebrates how rock music has evolved within Asia, featuring acts from Taiwan, Japan, South Korea, and Thailand including PAPUN BAND, Fire EX, and TOUCHED. Set against the scenic backdrop of Taichung's Aofengshan Sports Park, the festival offers a cultural look at Asian alternative music that goes beyond the mainstream.

name: Guizhou Sisters' Meal Festival
desc: The 'oldest Valentine's Day in the world'—a Miao ethnic courtship festival with silver jewelry and colorful rice.
details: The Sisters' Meal Festival of the Miao people in Taijiang is called 'the oldest Valentine's Day in the world.' Young women prepare dyed glutinous rice hidden with symbolic objects (chopsticks=love, pine needles=waiting). Women dress in elaborate silver headdresses weighing up to 15kg. Traditional bullfighting and lusheng pipe music accompany the celebrations.

name: Taipei Arts Festival
desc: Major performing arts festival featuring international and Taiwanese theater, dance, and music productions.
details: The Taipei Arts Festival is one of Asia's leading performing arts events, presenting cutting-edge theater, dance, and music from Taiwan and around the world. Venues include the Taipei Performing Arts Center and various non-traditional spaces. The festival commissions new works and hosts international co-productions.

name: Taipei Pride
desc: Asia's largest LGBTQ+ pride parade in the first Asian country/territory to legalize same-sex marriage.
details: Taiwan Pride in Taipei is the largest LGBTQ+ pride event in Asia, typically drawing over 150,000 participants. Taiwan made history in 2019 as the first place in Asia to legalize same-sex marriage. The parade through central Taipei celebrates diversity with floats, performances, and parties.

name: Taipei Dragon Boat Races
desc: International dragon boat championship on the Keelung River attracting elite teams worldwide.
details: The Taipei International Dragon Boat Championship on the Keelung River draws elite paddling teams from around the world alongside local competitors. The riverside festival atmosphere includes food stalls, cultural performances, and zongzi-making competitions.

name: Taketa Bamboo Lantern Festival
desc: 20,000 bamboo lanterns illuminate the ruins of an old castle town creating an ethereal landscape.
details: Taketa's Chikuraku Festival features approximately 20,000 handmade bamboo lanterns placed throughout the historic castle town and along its stone walls. The warm candlelight creates an incredibly atmospheric scene among the ancient ruins and samurai-era architecture.

name: Festival of Horse Games and Birds of Prey
desc: Falconry demonstrations and traditional equestrian games at Tamchy village.
details: Festival featuring falconry demonstrations, traditional equestrian games (Ulak Tartysh, Tyiyn Enmei), local competitions, and cultural heritage displays. Ticket: 2,000 KGS (lunch included). Held twice annually.

name: Tateyama Kurobe Alpine Route Opening
desc: Spectacular opening of the Snow Wall route with 20-meter-high walls of snow along the mountain road.
details: The opening of the Tateyama Kurobe Alpine Route reveals the famous Yuki-no-Otani (Snow Canyon)—a road carved through snow walls reaching up to 20 meters high. Visitors walk between the towering white walls in one of Japan's most extraordinary seasonal experiences. Peak snow wall season is mid-April to late May.

name: Tel Aviv Pride
desc: One of the world's largest and most celebrated LGBTQ+ pride events with a massive beach parade.
details: Features a week of parties, cultural events, and the famous beach parade attracting over 250,000 participants from around the world.

name: Tobago Heritage Festival
desc: Yearly cultural celebration preserving and honoring the island's distinctive traditions and cultural legacy.
details: Since 1986, the festival has focused on preserving traditions. The 2026 theme is 'Ubuntu - I Am Because We Are.' Takes place over two weeks from mid-July to Emancipation Day (August 1). Different villages come alive with events highlighting traditional music, dance, storytelling, and local cuisine. Has become a major cultural event in the region, attracting thousands of visitors experiencing Tobago's unique heritage through various village productions and cultural performances.

name: Texas Renaissance Festival
desc: The largest Renaissance festival in the country, spanning 55 acres of themed village with jousting, crafts, and food.
details: The Texas Renaissance Festival creates an immersive 55-acre 16th-century English village with over 400 shopping spaces, 200+ food and beverage items, and 20 stages of continuous entertainment. Each weekend has a different theme (Oktoberfest, Pirates, Celtic, etc.) and features full-contact jousting, artisan demonstrations, and costumed performers.

name: Tokushima LED Art Festival
desc: Massive LED light installation along the Shinmachigawa River using Tokushima's LED technology heritage.
details: Tokushima, home to major LED manufacturers, transforms its Shinmachigawa River into a spectacular LED art installation each December. The river's surface reflects millions of LED lights in creative designs, showcasing the city's industrial heritage through artistic expression.

name: Hot Docs Film Festival
desc: North America's largest documentary film festival, screening 200+ docs from around the world.
details: Hot Docs is the premier documentary film festival in North America, screening over 200 documentaries from across the globe. The festival includes industry conferences, public lectures, and networking events that make it essential for documentary filmmakers and enthusiasts.

name: Tottori Sand Sculpture Festival
desc: World-class sand sculpture exhibition at Japan's Tottori Sand Dunes—the country's only major sand landscape.
details: The Sand Museum at Tottori Sand Dunes features enormous sand sculptures by world-class artists, with a new theme each year. The museum is the world's only indoor sand sculpture exhibition, with works reaching up to 10 meters tall. Located at Japan's famous Tottori Sand Dunes—the country's largest sand landscape.

name: Toucheng Qianggu (Ghost Grabbing) Festival
desc: Extreme folk competition where teams race up greased 13-meter poles to grab flags at the top.
details: The Toucheng Qianggu Festival is one of Taiwan's most spectacular folk competitions. Teams race to climb 13-meter greased poles to grab sacrificial flags and offerings at the top. The slippery poles and fierce competition create dramatic scenes. The event is held during Ghost Month as part of the Zhongyuan Pudu rituals to appease wandering spirits.

name: Tsunan Sky Lanterns
desc: Japan's own sky lantern festival—hundreds released over deep snow in the mountain town of Tsunan.
details: Tsunan's sky lantern release in deep snow country creates Japan's answer to Taiwan's Pingxi. Hundreds of paper lanterns float up from the snowy landscape, their warm glow contrasting with the white winter scene. The intimate mountain setting and snowy backdrop make it uniquely Japanese.

name: Tsushima Arirang Festival
desc: Unique festival on the island between Japan and Korea celebrating centuries of Japanese-Korean cultural exchange.
details: Tsushima Island, halfway between Japan and Korea, hosts a festival celebrating the deep historical ties between the two nations. Korean dance groups perform alongside Japanese taiko drummers. The Arirang parade and joint cultural performances symbolize friendship across the strait that has connected these cultures for centuries.

name: Turpan Grape Festival
desc: Celebration of Turpan's legendary grape harvest in the hottest and lowest city in China.
details: Turpan, famous for its scorching temperatures and ancient Silk Road ruins, celebrates its legendary grape harvest with a festival featuring grape tastings, traditional Uyghur music and dance, market bazaars, and cultural performances. The grape trellis-covered streets of the old town provide a unique atmospheric setting. Turpan's grapes have been cultivated for over 2,000 years.

name: Ulsan Whale Festival
desc: Cultural festival celebrating Ulsan's whaling heritage with whale-watching tours and marine cultural events.
details: Ulsan's Whale Festival celebrates the city's historical connection to whales, documented in the 8,000-year-old Bangudae Petroglyphs—one of the world's oldest depictions of whaling. The modern festival focuses on conservation, whale-watching boat tours, marine exhibitions, and cultural performances. It acknowledges both the ancient heritage and modern conservation efforts.

name: Vancouver International Film Festival (VIFF)
desc: One of the largest film festivals in North America, known for its strong Asian cinema programming.
details: VIFF screens over 300 films from 80+ countries, with particular strength in East Asian cinema. The two-week festival includes industry events, Dragons and Tigers Award for emerging Asian filmmakers, and the BC Spotlight on local talent.

name: Venice Architecture Biennale (20th edition)
desc: The world's most prestigious architecture exhibition, to be curated by Wang Shu and Lu Wenyu.
details: The 20th International Architecture Exhibition at the Venice Biennale is confirmed for 2027, not 2026. Curated by Chinese architects Wang Shu and Lu Wenyu. The Architecture Biennale alternates with the Art Biennale in odd/even years.

name: Vienna Design Week
desc: Austria's largest design festival, famous for its 'Passionswege' project.
details: The festival uniquely pairs cutting-edge international designers with traditional, highly specialized Viennese artisanal workshops, resulting in brilliant hybrid creations that preserve historical techniques through modern application.

name: Weifang International Kite Festival
desc: World's premier kite festival in the 'kite capital' of the world with spectacular designs from 60+ countries.
details: Weifang is recognized as the world kite capital, and its annual festival draws participants from over 60 countries. Thousands of kites—from traditional Chinese designs to enormous architectural kites spanning hundreds of meters—fill the skies. The festival includes kite-making workshops, competitions, and a kite museum showcasing 2,000 years of Chinese kite history.

name: Dreaming Festival
desc: Celebration of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander culture with performances, storytelling, and ceremony.
details: The Dreaming Festival at Woodfordia celebrates the oldest living culture on Earth through Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander music, dance, storytelling, art, film, and ceremony. It provides a rare opportunity for non-Indigenous Australians to engage deeply with First Nations culture.

name: Xi'an City Wall Lantern Festival
desc: Thousands of illuminated lanterns displayed along Xi'an's magnificent 600-year-old city wall.
details: The Xi'an City Wall Lantern Festival transforms the ancient Ming Dynasty wall into a spectacular corridor of light. Thousands of themed lanterns are mounted along the 13.7km wall, creating one of China's most photogenic lantern displays. Visitors can walk or cycle atop the wall surrounded by glowing lanterns against the backdrop of both ancient and modern Xi'an.

name: Xi'an International Horticultural Expo
desc: Major garden and horticultural exhibition in the ancient Tang Dynasty capital.
details: Xi'an periodically hosts horticultural expos celebrating the city's tradition of imperial gardens dating to the Tang Dynasty. Elaborate themed gardens, rare plant collections, and landscape architecture from around the world are displayed alongside cultural performances and Silk Road heritage exhibitions.

name: Yokote Bonten Festival
desc: Teams carry colorful bonten (prayer poles) through deep snow to the mountain shrine in wild competition.
details: In the Yokote Bonten Festival, teams carry elaborate bonten—tall bamboo poles decorated with colorful cloth streamers representing prayers—through the snow to Asahioka Shrine. Teams race and push to be first to place their bonten at the shrine, creating boisterous competition in the deep Akita snow.

name: Yuanyang Rice Terrace Festival
desc: Stunning flooded rice terraces of the Hani people create mirror-like reflections in their most photogenic season.
details: While not a traditional 'festival,' the Yuanyang rice terraces of the Hani people—a UNESCO World Heritage site—are at their most spectacular from February to March when the flooded paddies create stunning mirror reflections of the sky. The Hani celebrate their New Year (Angmatu) during this period with traditional feasts, sacrificial ceremonies, and performances. The Long Table Banquet is a highlight.

name: Street Parade Zurich
desc: The world's largest techno parade — a massive one-day dance party with decorated love mobiles rolling through Zurich's lakeside streets.
details: The Zurich Street Parade is the world's largest techno parade, drawing nearly a million ravers to dance along the shores of Lake Zurich. Decorated 'love mobiles' (trucks with DJs and sound systems) roll along the parade route while the crowds dance in the streets. The festival promotes peace, love, and tolerance through electronic music. Free to attend.

name: Carifesta
desc: A major Caribbean cultural festival celebrating music, arts, dance, food, and cultural traditions across the Caribbean region.
details: CARIFESTA brings together artists, musicians, performers, and cultural representatives from across the Caribbean to showcase regional heritage and creativity. The festival features performances, exhibitions, competitions, and cultural demonstrations.

name: Sankt Hans Aften (Midsummer Eve)
desc: Denmark's Midsummer celebration features enormous bonfires along coastlines and in parks, with traditional singing and community gatherings on the longest evening of the year.
details: On the evening of June 23, Danes gather at beaches, lakesides, and parks to light enormous bonfires — often topped with a witch effigy to symbolize burning away evil. Traditional songs are sung and communities come together for food and drink as the Scandinavian sky barely darkens. It is a beloved national tradition with pagan roots absorbed into the Christian feast of St. John.

name: Moulid an-Nabi (Prophet's Birthday)
desc: Celebration of Prophet Muhammad's birthday with processions, sweets, and cultural festivities across Egypt.
details: Features vibrant street processions, traditional sweets (halawet el-moulid), children's sugar dolls, and Sufi chanting ceremonies at mosques across Egypt.

name: Wandelkonzert / Rhine in Flames
desc: The Rhine Valley lights up with spectacular fireworks displays launched from hilltop castles and riverbanks, viewed from illuminated boats floating down the river.
details: Rhine in Flames (Rhein in Flammen) sees sections of the Rhine Valley illuminated by massive fireworks launched from medieval hilltop castles and riverside towns. Spectators cruise on illuminated boats or watch from the riverbanks as the UNESCO-listed Rhine Gorge comes alive with light and color. Multiple events across different sections of the Rhine from July to September.

name: Tin Hau Festival
desc: Celebration honoring the sea goddess Tin Hau with colorful temple processions and Cantonese opera.
details: The Tin Hau Festival honors the Goddess of the Sea, protector of fisher folk. Over 70 Tin Hau temples across Hong Kong hold celebrations, with the largest at Joss House Bay (Tai Miu). Fishing communities decorate their boats, and temple parades feature lion dances, dragon dances, and Cantonese opera. The festival reflects Hong Kong's maritime heritage.

name: Diwali (Festival of Lights)
desc: India's most significant festival illuminating homes and streets with millions of oil lamps, fireworks, and rangoli art.
details: Diwali celebrates the victory of light over darkness and knowledge over ignorance. Homes and streets are decorated with diyas (oil lamps), rangoli patterns, and fireworks. Varanasi's Ganga Aarti during Diwali is breathtaking, Ayodhya sets records with massive diya lighting ceremonies, and Jaipur's palaces create a fairy-tale atmosphere. Families exchange gifts and prepare elaborate feasts.

name: Holi (Festival of Colors)
desc: India's most joyful festival where millions throw colored powders and water at each other celebrating the victory of good over evil.
details: Holi is India's exuberant spring celebration. The eve features Holika Dahan bonfires, and the next day erupts into a riot of color as people drench each other with colored powders and water to music and drumbeats. Mathura and Vrindavan offer the most traditional celebrations including Lathmar Holi (women playfully striking men with sticks). Pushkar's community-driven celebration is especially popular with international travelers.

name: Sizdah Bedar (Nature Day)
desc: Final day of Nowruz celebrations where Iranians spend the day outdoors in nature.
details: On the 13th day after Nowruz, the entire nation goes outdoors for picnics, games, and to throw away the sabzeh (sprouted greens) from their Haft-sin tables.

name: Tirgan Festival
desc: Ancient Iranian summer festival with water splashing, dancing, and poetry, submitted for UNESCO recognition in 2026.
details: Celebrated with water splashing, dancing, poetry recitation, and traditional foods. Occurs in cities across Iran. Jointly submitted with Armenia for UNESCO ICH recognition.

name: Newroz (Kurdish New Year)
desc: The Kurdish celebration of spring and national identity with massive bonfires, traditional dress, dancing, and community gatherings.
details: For Kurds across Iraq, Iran, Syria, and Turkey, Newroz is both a spring celebration and a powerful symbol of Kurdish identity. Massive bonfires light up hillsides, communities gather in traditional colorful dress for folk dancing and music, and families celebrate with special foods. In Iraqi Kurdistan, the celebrations are especially vibrant in Erbil and Sulaymaniyah. In 2026, Syria officially recognized Nowruz as a national holiday following historic political changes.

name: Līgo and Jāņi (Latvian Midsummer)
desc: Latvia's most important and ancient holiday—a pagan midsummer celebration with bonfires, folk songs, wreaths, and feasting until sunrise.
details: Jāņi is bigger than Christmas in Latvia. On the eve of June 23, the entire country celebrates with bonfires, traditional folk songs with the 'Līgo' refrain, flower and oak-leaf wreaths, caraway cheese, and prodigious amounts of beer. Tradition dictates staying awake all night to greet the sunrise. The celebrations take place in the countryside, private gardens, and urban parks. Banned during the Soviet era, Jāņi has been restored as a proud expression of Latvian identity. It is part of Latvia's Cultural Canon and UNESCO-recognised intangible heritage.

name: Ganesh Chaturthi (Mauritius)
desc: Hindu celebration of Lord Ganesh featuring processions carrying clay statues to immerse in the sea.
details: Ganesh Chaturthi in Mauritius is a public holiday honoring Lord Ganesh, the elephant-headed god. Devotees carry beautifully decorated clay statues of Ganesh in colorful processions to beaches and riverbanks where they are ceremonially immersed in the water.

name: Dashain Festival
desc: Nepal's longest and most important Hindu festival with kite flying, animal sacrifice, family blessings, and nationwide celebration.
details: Dashain is Nepal's most significant celebration, honoring the goddess Durga's victory over evil. The 15-day festival features kite flying (symbolizing the end of monsoon), elaborate temple rituals, family gatherings where elders place tika on foreheads, and joyous celebrations. Kathmandu's Durbar Squares are epicenters of cultural activity.

name: Dragobete
desc: Romania's ancient festival of love, spring, and fertility — predating Valentine's Day — with roots in Dacian and Roman traditions.
details: Dragobete, celebrated on February 24, is Romania's traditional day of love with roots in ancient Dacian and Roman traditions. Named after Dragobete (son of the mythological Baba Dochia), it marks the arrival of spring. Customs vary by region but include gathering wildflowers, traditional games, dancing, and singing. Young people traditionally go out to find first spring flowers.

name: Saudi National Day
desc: National day celebrating the unification of Saudi Arabia in 1932 with spectacular nationwide festivities.
details: Massive celebrations with fireworks, aerial displays, concerts, cultural events, and heritage celebrations across all major Saudi cities.

name: Diwali (SE Asia)
desc: The Festival of Lights celebrated across Southeast Asia's Indian communities with Little India transforming into a glowing wonderland.
details: Singapore's Little India is spectacularly illuminated during Diwali, with elaborate light displays, cultural performances, bazaars, and traditional food markets along Serangoon Road. Malaysia's Hindu communities celebrate with open-house traditions, temple ceremonies, and community feasts. Both countries declare it a public holiday.

name: Mid-Autumn Festival (Vietnam)
desc: Vietnam's most colorful children's festival with glowing lanterns, lion dances, and mooncakes shared under the harvest moon.
details: Known locally as Tet Trung Thu, this is one of Vietnamese children's favorite holidays. Streets glow with colorful paper lanterns, and noisy lion dance performances captivate crowds. Mooncakes are shared between family and friends as symbols of reunion and good fortune. Hoi An's ancient town provides an especially atmospheric setting.

name: Carnival of Aalst
desc: UNESCO-listed carnival known for satirical floats and the Voil Jansen cross-dressing tradition.
details: Aalst Carnival features sharp social and political satire through elaborate floats, the Voil Jansen (men dressed as women), and the traditional onion-throwing by the Prince Carnival.

name: Abu Dhabi HSBC Championship (Golf)
desc: Premier European Tour golf tournament at Yas Links attracting top international golfers.
details: Features world-class golfers competing at Yas Links with entertainment, hospitality, and cultural activities.

name: Tianguis Turístico México 2026 - 50th Anniversary
desc: Most important tourism business forum in Mexico with pre-established buyer-exhibitor appointments
details: 50th anniversary edition. Participants include tour operators, wholesalers, incentive houses, event/congress organizers, wedding planners, charter operators, travel agencies, OTAs. Follows 49th edition in Baja California.

name: Odwira Festival
desc: Purification festival of the Akuapem people with processions up the Akuapem Ridge.
details: The Odwira Festival is a purification and harvest festival celebrated by the people of Akuapem. It features elaborate processions along the scenic Akuapem Ridge, ritual cleansing ceremonies, the display of ancestral stools, communal feasting, and traditional music and dancing.

name: Henley-on-Todd Regatta
desc: The world's only dry riverbed boat race — bottomless boats, sand skiing, and outback hilarity.
details: The Henley-on-Todd Regatta is a uniquely Australian event where teams race bottomless boats through the dry bed of the Todd River. Established in 1962, this comedic regatta features sand-skiing, kayak races, tug-of-war, and ends with a theatrical battle between pirate ships and naval vessels — all on dry sand.

name: Park Live Almaty
desc: Three-day world-class music festival featuring Jack White, Gorillaz, and international artists.
details: Park Live Almaty transforms the city into Central Asia's musical capital with a three-day lineup including Jack White (Aug 21), Gorillaz (Aug 22), The Kills, and additional international and Kazakhstani artists. Held at Pervomayskie Prudy outdoor venue.

name: Hogbetsotso Festival
desc: Major festival of the Anlo Ewe people commemorating their exodus from Notsie in present-day Togo.
details: Hogbetsotso is the most important festival of the Anlo Ewe people, commemorating their legendary escape from the tyrannical King Agorkoli of Notsie (in modern Togo). The durbar features chiefs in traditional regalia, war dances, drumming, and the re-enactment of the exodus.

name: Earthquake Memorial Day
desc: Solemn commemoration of the 1948 Ashgabat earthquake that killed 110,000 people.
details: Commemoration of the devastating 1948 Ashgabat earthquake (110,000 killed). Wreath-laying ceremonies, documentary screenings, and memorial events.

name: Aspen Food & Wine Classic
desc: The ultimate culinary and wine event set in the Rocky Mountains with celebrity chefs and master sommeliers.
details: Food & Wine's flagship event features cooking demonstrations by celebrity chefs, grand tastings of over 2,000 wines, seminars, and exclusive dinners. The Aspen mountain setting and star-studded lineup make it the most prestigious culinary event in America.

name: 49th Baghdad International Fair
desc: Major international commercial and investment fair at Baghdad International Fairgrounds.
details: General commercial and investment fair. Registration open for the 2026 edition.

name: Rock en Baradero
desc: Multi-stage rock festival with 40+ bands from various Argentine rock genres.
details: Held at Anfiteatro Municipal with three stages. Headliners include Babasónicos, Rata Blanca, Las Pelotas, Catupecu Machu, Kapanga, and others. Doors open at 3:00 PM until 2:00 AM. Ages 5+ with ID permitted. Extensive food corridor and cultural proposals. Tickets from $200,000 (2-day) to $120,000 (single day).

name: UIA World Congress of Architects 2026
desc: The world's architects gather in Barcelona under 'One today, one tomorrow' as UNESCO-UIA World Capital of Architecture.
details: Barcelona hosts the UIA World Congress as World Capital of Architecture 2026. Under the slogan 'One today, one tomorrow,' it brings together architects, urban planners, and citizens to rethink the future of cities. Part of the city's UNESCO designation.

name: La Patum de Berga
desc: Catalan folk festival with giants, devils, drums, and pyrotechnics; UNESCO Intangible Cultural Heritage.
details: religious festival with lively parades

name: Aste Nagusia (Semana Grande Bilbao)
desc: Bilbao's biggest festival week — a nine-day explosion of concerts, street performances, fireworks, and Basque identity on full display.
details: Aste Nagusia is massive in scale and atmosphere, and one of the strongest 'Basque identity on full display' experiences. The festival runs late every night with concerts, street performances, and fireworks. Traditional elements include txosnas tents serving Basque food and drink, Basque sports demonstrations, and the Marijaia figure symbolizing the festival's spirit. A true celebration of Basque culture and community.

name: Rock al Parque
desc: Free rock festival celebrating its 30th anniversary with 50+ bands and 400,000+ spectators representing Latin America's largest rock event.

name: Bregenz Festival
desc: Opera on the world's largest floating stage on Lake Constance.
details: The Bregenz Festival's Seebühne (floating stage) on Lake Constance presents opera with innovative staging visible to 7,000 spectators. The combination of music, water, and mountain scenery is unmatched.

name: National Folk Festival
desc: Australia's premier folk music festival with 120+ artists across multiple stages over Easter.
details: The National Folk Festival has been held in Canberra over Easter for decades, drawing folk music enthusiasts from across Australia. Over five days, 120+ artists perform across multiple stages, with workshops, dances, sessions, and a vibrant community atmosphere. It covers folk, traditional, world, and roots music.

name: Fetu Afahye
desc: Grand durbar of the people of Cape Coast with chiefs in traditional regalia and festive parades.
details: Fetu Afahye is the annual festival of the people of Cape Coast, featuring a grand durbar of chiefs and queen mothers in magnificent traditional regalia, military-style parades, traditional drumming and dancing, and purification ceremonies for the town.

name: Cartagena Festival de Música
desc: International classical-music festival staged in Cartagena’s historic venues.

name: Festa Junina Across Northeast Brazil
desc: The June festival tradition celebrating saints and rural heritage with quadrilha dances, forró music, and traditional foods across the entire Northeast region.
details: Festa Junina celebrates the Catholic feast days of Saint Anthony, Saint John the Baptist, and Saint Peter while honoring rural life and harvest season. Originating from Portuguese colonization traditions, these festivals blend indigenous, African, and European cultures. The celebrations feature quadrilha competitions with colorful costumes, forró and baião music, traditional northeastern cuisine, and street parties extending from late May through early July.

name: Costa Esmeralda Fest 2026 (Holy Week)
desc: Holy Week festival along emerald coast

name: St. Thomas Carnival
desc: Festive parades with food fairs, calypso competitions, and Crucian/Virgin Islands heritage events.
details: Blends festive parades with cultural programming including food fairs, calypso competitions, and heritage events. Emphasizes Crucian and Virgin Islands traditions. Includes J'ouvert, Grand Parade, and village celebrations with local food and music.

name: Hellfest
desc: France's (and one of Europe's) biggest heavy metal and hard rock festivals, drawing hardcore fans to Clisson for four days of extreme music.
details: Hellfest has grown into one of the world's largest and most respected metal and hard rock festivals. Held in the vineyards of Clisson near Nantes, it features multiple stages spanning metal, hardcore, punk, doom, stoner rock, and more. The festival's elaborate stage designs and production values rival any mainstream festival, while maintaining an authentically underground spirit.

name: Vendimia (Chile)
desc: Chilean wine harvest festivals with grape stomping, tastings, folk music, and vineyard celebrations.
details: Celebrate grape harvest in premier wine regions, especially Colchagua and Maipo Valley. Visitors participate in grape picking, traditional barefoot grape stomping, wine pairings, and tastings alongside art exhibitions, folk music, and cultural installations.

name: Cork Jazz Festival
desc: 500+ musicians perform across 100 events in 80 venues during Cork's legendary jazz celebration.
details: The 48th Guinness Cork Jazz Festival fills the city with jazz, blues, and improvised music across pubs, concert halls, and streets. The free Guinness Music Trail through city pubs is a highlight.

name: Pol'and'Rock Festival
desc: One of the world's largest free open-air festivals (formerly Woodstock Poland).
details: Formerly Przystanek Woodstock, Pol'and'Rock draws 500,000+ to a massive free festival combining rock, punk, reggae, and electronic music with discussions, workshops, and communal spirit.

name: Dakar Biennale (Dak'Art)
desc: Africa's most prominent contemporary art exhibition with the OFF program spanning all of Dakar.
details: The 16th edition of Dak'Art, recognized as one of the most prominent artistic events on the international stage, features paintings, sculptures, installations, performances, and video art. The extensive OFF program sees hundreds of independent exhibitions throughout Dakar alongside music, film, fashion, and culinary events.

name: Dakar OFF – Independent Art Programme
desc: The democratic OFF programme of Dak'Art transforms all of Dakar into a canvas for artistic intervention.
details: Running alongside the official Dak'Art programme, the OFF events spread across neighborhoods, studios, and public spaces throughout Dakar. Known for launching careers of major African artists and providing accessibility beyond official venues.

name: Qatar ExxonMobil Open (Tennis)
desc: ATP Tour 250 tennis tournament attracting top international players to Doha.
details: Prestigious tennis tournament at the Khalifa International Tennis Complex featuring top-ranked ATP players.

name: Rubaiya Qatar – Unruly Waters
desc: A brand-new contemporary art quadrennial debuts in Qatar, featuring 50+ artists examining water as a lens for geography, ecology, and migration.
details: Qatar Museums launches Rubaiya Qatar under ALRIWAQ Art + Architecture. The inaugural exhibition 'Unruly Waters' features 50+ artists and 20+ new commissions, curated by Tom Eccles, Ruba Katrib, Mark Rappolt, and Shabbir Husain Mustafa. Part of Qatar's Evolution Nation campaign celebrating 50 years of cultural development.

name: Dour Festival
desc: Belgium's most eclectic festival, spanning metal, rap, reggae, techno, and everything in between — a haven for curious music lovers.
details: Dour Festival boasts Belgium's most eclectic lineup, ranging from metal and rap to reggae and techno. The 2026 lineup includes Amelie Lens, Amenra, Orelsan, Pendulum, and Sean Paul.
