The diversity of genres makes it a can't-miss destination for open-minded music lovers who want to experience multiple worlds of sound in one festival.

name: Dubai World Cup
desc: World's richest horse race with $30.5 million in prize money at Meydan Racecourse.
details: Prestigious horse racing event combining world-class racing with fashion, entertainment, and fine dining at the iconic Meydan Racecourse.

name: Falak Day
desc: Traditional mountain music festival celebrating UNESCO Intangible Cultural Heritage.
details: Traditional mountain music festival celebrating Falak, Tajikistan's distinctive mountain vocal tradition. UNESCO intangible heritage recognition. Features performances by traditional musicians nationwide.

name: Edogawa Fireworks Festival
desc: One of Tokyo's largest fireworks festivals along the Edogawa River with 14,000 fireworks.
details: The Edogawa Fireworks Festival is one of the biggest hanabi events in the Tokyo area, launching about 14,000 fireworks along the Edogawa River. Spectators can watch from both the Tokyo (Edogawa) and Chiba (Ichikawa) sides of the river. The opening features a dramatic 5-second launch of 1,000 fireworks simultaneously.

name: Fiesta Nacional del Lúpulo
desc: Celebration of hop cultivation and craft beer culture with artisanal beers and regional gastronomy.
details: Held at Polideportivo Municipal with free admission. Features Emanero, Nonpalidece, La Beriso, and other artists. Festival originated in 1964 to honor hop cultivation promoted by early colonists. Includes craft breweries from the region and other provinces, food trucks with vegan and Mexican options. Estimated attendance reached multiple thousands.

name: Cayman Islands Batabano
desc: Extended carnival season on Grand Cayman with colorful parades and elaborate costumes.
details: Centers around a colorful street parade with elaborate costumes, music, and dance celebrating Caribbean culture. Extended season includes multiple events and competitions building to the main parade.

name: Mashramani (Republic Day celebrations)
desc: Guyana’s Republic Day street celebrations featuring parades, costumes, and music.

name: Timkat (Epiphany)
desc: Ethiopian Orthodox celebration with colorful processions of tabots, chanting, and water blessings.

name: Expo Chianti Classico
desc: Annual gathering of all Chianti Classico wine producers with tastings and vineyard tours.
details: The 54th Expo Chianti Classico brings every Chianti Classico producer to Greve for four days of tastings, vineyard visits, and encounters with winemakers in the heart of Tuscany.

name: Gstaad Menuhin Festival
desc: Classical chamber music in the Swiss Alps founded by violinist Yehudi Menuhin.
details: The Menuhin Festival presents intimate classical performances in Gstaad's churches, historic saanenmöser chapel, and tent venues amid stunning Alpine scenery.

name: Festival Internacional de Música Guadalajara 2026
desc: International music fair with 30+ activities, 70 panelists, 30 showcases
details: Begins Feb 25 at Conjunto Santander de Artes Escénicas in Zapopan. Spreads across city with 30+ activities, 70 panelists, 30 showcases. Concludes Feb 28 with PortAmérica Latitudes festival at Plaza Bicentenario.

name: Gympie Music Muster
desc: Iconic Australian country music camping festival with 100+ artists across six venues in the bush.
details: The Gympie Music Muster has been running for over four decades, bringing together country, folk, and roots music lovers for a camping festival in the Amamoor Creek State Forest. Over 100 artists perform across six venues, and the Muster raises significant funds for charity.

name: Mysteryland
desc: World's longest-running dance festival at a historic location.
details: Mysteryland at the Floriade grounds combines electronic music heritage with art installations and a unique camping experience on the same land where Woodstock-style events began in 1993.

name: Hawaii Merrie Monarch Festival
desc: The world's premier hula competition, a week-long celebration of Hawaiian arts and culture honoring King David Kalakaua.
details: The Merrie Monarch Festival is the Olympics of hula, drawing the finest hula halau (schools) from across Hawaii and beyond for intense competition in both ancient (kahiko) and modern (auana) hula. The week includes a grand parade, arts and crafts fair, and Ho'ike Night concert. Tickets are extremely coveted and the event is broadcast statewide.

name: Himeji Castle Cherry Blossom Festival
desc: 1,000 cherry trees frame Japan's most spectacular UNESCO World Heritage castle.
details: Himeji Castle—Japan's finest surviving feudal castle and a UNESCO World Heritage site—is surrounded by approximately 1,000 cherry trees that create an extraordinary backdrop during peak bloom. Night illuminations of both castle and blossoms create one of Japan's most iconic spring images. The festival includes tea ceremonies and traditional performances.

name: Dark Mofo
desc: MONA's winter solstice festival — a dark, immersive arts celebration embracing winter's darkness.
details: Dark Mofo is a winter solstice festival like no other. Hosted by MONA, it embraces the darkest, coldest time of year with a program of large-scale public art, immersive experiences, music, performance, and communal rituals including the famous nude solstice swim at dawn and the burning of a massive effigy.

name: CMC Rocks
desc: Australia's biggest international country music festival featuring top Nashville and local artists.
details: CMC Rocks brings major country music acts from Nashville and Australia to the Willowbank Raceway near Ipswich. Over three days, fans camp and enjoy performances across multiple stages, making it the premier country music festival in the Southern Hemisphere.

name: Aldrei Fór Ég Suður
desc: Free music festival in the remote Westfjords town of Ísafjörður, meaning 'I Never Went South'—celebrating those who stayed.
details: This free festival in the remote Westfjords celebrates Icelandic music and the spirit of those who stayed in rural Iceland rather than moving to Reykjavík. Top Icelandic artists perform for free in this picturesque fjord town, creating an intimate and uniquely Icelandic experience. The festival name reflects local pride in their northern home.

name: Ise Grand Shrine Shikinen Sengu
desc: Japan's most sacred shrine rebuilding ceremony held every 20 years—the ultimate Shinto ritual.
details: While the Shikinen Sengu isn't until 2033, Ise Grand Shrine remains Japan's holiest site year-round with ongoing ceremonies. The inner shrine (Naiku) enshrines Amaterasu, the sun goddess. Visiting during major holiday periods offers powerful spiritual experiences.

name: Carnival of Ivrea
desc: Unique carnival featuring the Battle of the Oranges where teams pelt each other.
details: Ivrea's carnival climaxes with the famous Battle of the Oranges, where nine teams on foot battle horse-drawn carts in a symbolic fight for freedom, pelting oranges at each other.

name: Art Jakarta Papers
desc: The premier contemporary art fair driving the rapidly expanding Indonesian market.
details: Indonesia possesses one of the most vibrant and fiercely independent art scenes in Asia (e.g., Bandung, Yogyakarta). This fair brings that domestic energy into contact with a rapidly growing class of wealthy Southeast Asian collectors.

name: Red Sea International Film Festival
desc: Jeddah's premier film festival showcasing Arab and international cinema in the historic Al-Balad district.
details: Held in Jeddah's UNESCO-listed historic district, this festival screens Arab and international films, hosts red carpet premieres, and facilitates industry networking. It has rapidly become one of the region's most significant film events, reflecting Saudi Arabia's growing film industry and cultural opening.

name: Ultra South Africa
desc: The continent's biggest EDM festival featuring international superstar DJs.
details: Ultra South Africa Johannesburg takes place at Expo Centre Nasrec with a stacked RESISTANCE lineup including Adam Beyer, Peggy Gou, and Eric Prydz. It is the largest electronic dance music event in Africa, part of the global Ultra Music Festival brand.

name: Kampala Art Biennale
desc: A showcase of contemporary art from Africa aiming to integrate African art from the peripherals of mainstream avenues.
details: The Kampala Art Biennale was established to recognize and integrate African contemporary art created on the peripherals of mainstream information avenues. Kampala serves as an active artistic center alongside KLA ART. The biennale aims to expose, educate, and create debate about art's value in society.

name: Kano Durbar Festival
desc: Spectacular cavalry display with the Emir of Kano leading thousands of horsemen.
details: The Kano Durbar is one of Nigeria's most spectacular events, featuring the Emir of Kano leading thousands of horsemen and warriors in a grand cavalry charge. Riders wear indigo turbans, chainmail, and elaborate costumes that have remained largely unchanged for centuries.

name: 5th Kathmandu Triennale: Coexistence
desc: Explores kinship among all beings, peoples, cultures, ecologies, and faiths, directed by Sujan Chitrakar and Natalie King.
details: The 5th Kathmandu Triennale features 100+ artworks at Nepal Art Council, Patan Museum, and Siddhartha Art Gallery. Co-directed by local artist Sujan Chitrakar and international curator Natalie King. Organized by Siddhartha Arts Foundation and Nepal Academy of Fine Arts. Theme of Coexistence bridges local and Global South perspectives.

name: Kaunas Jazz Festival
desc: Lithuania's largest jazz festival celebrating its 35th anniversary.
details: The 35th Kaunas Jazz Festival presents 50+ concerts with international stars and Lithuanian talent across the city's theatre, streets, and squares, with free masterclasses and children's programmes.

name: Fantasy Fest
desc: Ten-day costuming and masking festival in Key West featuring parades, street fairs, and elaborate body painting.
details: Fantasy Fest is Key West's legendary 10-day party featuring the Masquerade March, Zombie Bike Ride, Goombay Festival, and elaborate body-painting competitions. The festival's Duval Street parade is a showcase of extravagant costumes, creative floats, and Key West's trademark irreverence.

name: Ord Valley Muster
desc: Nine-day celebration of music, culture, and art in the spectacular East Kimberley landscape.
details: The Ord Valley Muster celebrates 25 years in 2026, bringing nine days of music, art, culture, and adventure to Kununurra and the East Kimberley. The Kimberley Moon Experience outdoor concert on the banks of the Ord River is the centrepiece, with a stunning natural amphitheatre setting.

name: Hala February Festival
desc: Month-long cultural and entertainment festival celebrating Kuwait's liberation and national days.
details: Kuwait's biggest annual festival featuring concerts, carnivals, shopping promotions, fireworks, and cultural events. Named for the welcoming spirit ('Hala' means welcome).

name: Pageant of the Masters
desc: Extraordinary living art show where real people recreate famous paintings and sculptures on a massive outdoor stage.
details: Part of the Festival of Arts, Pageant of the Masters is a one-of-a-kind theatrical production where volunteers meticulously recreate famous artworks using real people, elaborate sets, costumes, and lighting on a giant outdoor stage. The illusion is stunningly convincing and the annual show is a beloved Southern California tradition.

name: Festivale
desc: Tasmania's premier summer food, wine, and entertainment event in Launceston's City Park.
details: Festivale transforms Launceston's beautiful City Park into a vibrant celebration of Tasmanian food, wine, beer, cider, and entertainment. Local producers and chefs showcase the best of Tasmanian produce alongside live music performances.

name: Wave-Gotik-Treffen
desc: World's largest gothic festival attracting 20,000+ darkly dressed visitors.
details: The WGT fills Leipzig with gothic subculture across 100+ events: concerts, readings, cinema, medieval markets, and Victorian picnics in the park. A unique pilgrimage for the dark scene.

name: Feria de León 2026
desc: Largest fair in Bajío region and one of Mexico's most visited fairs
details: Main venues: Palenque and Velaria with numerous concerts, national/international performances. Features livestock exhibitions, food samples, children's zone, mechanical games, commercial pavilions.

name: Locarno Film Festival
desc: Prestigious film festival with Europe's largest open-air cinema in Piazza Grande.
details: The 79th Locarno Film Festival screens films in the spectacular Piazza Grande, an 8,000-seat open-air venue. It's known for championing independent and art-house cinema.

name: BST Hyde Park
desc: Series of major concerts in London's Hyde Park featuring global superstars.
details: BST Hyde Park transforms central London into a world-class concert venue with headline shows from the biggest names in music, plus free midweek entertainment in the Open House programme.

name: Lucas Museum of Narrative Art
desc: Opening of George Lucas's billion-dollar cultural institution.
details: Designed by MAD Architects, the futuristic museum focuses on the history and impact of visual storytelling, from illustration to cinematic arts.

name: Nuits Sonores
desc: Lyon's cutting-edge electronic music and digital arts festival.
details: Nuits Sonores transforms Lyon's industrial spaces and cultural venues into stages for electronic music, visual art, and creative innovation over five days and nights.

name: Bienal de Arte Flamenco de Sevilla
desc: The world's premier flamenco biennial showcasing dance, music, and singing in Seville's historic theaters.
details: The Bienal de Arte Flamenco de Sevilla is the most important flamenco festival worldwide. Held biennially in even years since 1980, it attracts top flamenco performers and audiences to venues across Seville. Features performances, workshops, and competitions across multiple weeks.

name: Mamoiada Carnival
desc: 2,000-year-old pagan carnival with Mamuthones in sheepskins carrying 40kg cowbells.
details: Mamoiada's ancient carnival features Mamuthones (dark sheepskin-clad figures with 40kg bells) and Issohadores (masked captors) in a prehistoric ritual to ward off evil and welcome spring.

name: Marrabenta Festival
desc: Annual music festival celebrating Mozambique's signature marrabenta musical genre on Heroes Day.
details: The Marrabenta Festival, held on Heroes Day in February, celebrates Mozambique's distinctive musical style built on the legacy of local musician Malangatana Ngwenya. Headline acts come from neighboring countries like Zimbabwe and Lesotho alongside local stars.

name: Marrakech Biennale
desc: A contemporary art biennial in Morocco's cultural capital, complemented by the 1-54 contemporary African art fair.
details: The Marrakech Biennale exhibits contemporary art in the city's historic palaces, gardens, and cultural spaces. It brings together international and Moroccan artists for exhibitions, performances, and talks exploring themes of cultural exchange.

name: Afreximbank Art Prize (inaugural)
desc: A new international art prize highlighting emerging artists from across Africa, launched at 1-54 Marrakech.
details: The Afreximbank Art Prize debuts at 1-54 Marrakech in 2026 and continues through the year. Created by the African Export-Import Bank to support and promote emerging African artists on the global stage.

name: Tarantella Festival (Notte della Taranta)
desc: Italy's largest music event celebrating the ancient pizzica/tarantella tradition.
details: La Notte della Taranta draws 200,000+ to Melpignano for a single night of frenzied pizzica dancing, where massive orchestras reinvent the Salento folk tradition. Italy's largest concert event.

name: Merano Wine Festival
desc: A highly exclusive celebration of the absolute finest Italian and international wines.
details: Set in the stunning, historic Kurhaus of Merano, the festival enforces an incredibly strict selection process for participating wineries. It is a pinnacle event for elite oenophiles, sommeliers, and luxury hospitality buyers.

name: Mérida Fest 2026
desc: Celebration marking city's founding with concerts, exhibitions, performances
details: Concerts, exhibitions, performances across public venues and theaters.

name: Mexico City Gastronomic Guide 2026
desc: Event bringing together 250 best restaurants in Mexico with Michelin-starred chefs
details: 2,000+ attendees expected. Economic impact over 20 million pesos.

name: Desfile de Llamadas - Candombe Heritage
desc: Iconic parade featuring candombe drum comparsas (groups) from African-descendant communities.
details: Route: Isla de Flores street through barrio Sur and Palermo. February 6 features comparsas that placed first in 2025 competition. February 7 features classified comparsas by score ranking. 44 comparsas with 3000+ candombe drums (chico, repique, piano). Candombe is UNESCO Intangible Cultural Heritage representing Uruguayan African-descendant culture heritage. The most representative manifestation of African diaspora culture in Uruguay.

name: Venice Glass Week
desc: An annual/biennial celebration of Venetian glass art heritage and contemporary glass innovation.
details: Venice Glass Week celebrates the centuries-old tradition of Murano glass through exhibitions, demonstrations, and events. Combines heritage preservation with contemporary glass art innovation.

name: Nairobi Restaurant Week
desc: Culinary celebration featuring 80+ top restaurants with curated menus and special pricing.
details: Nairobi Restaurant Week 2026 was organized by EatOut Kenya in partnership with the Kenyan Tourism Board. The 10-day event featured specially curated menus across 80+ of the city's top restaurants, reinforcing Nairobi's growing reputation as a leading culinary tourism destination in Africa.

name: CMA Fest (Country Music Association Festival)
desc: The ultimate country music fan experience with concerts, meet-and-greets, and events across downtown Nashville.
details: CMA Fest is the world's biggest country music festival, featuring four days of concerts at multiple venues including Nissan Stadium, Ascend Amphitheater, and honky-tonks along Broadway. Unique to CMA Fest is its fan interaction focus, with extensive meet-and-greet opportunities, autograph signings, and fan club parties. All net proceeds benefit music education.

name: Junkanoo (Bahamas)
desc: All-night Afro-Bahamian street parade with hand-crafted paper costumes, goatskin drums, cowbells, and brass.
details: Held on Boxing Day and New Year's Day in downtown Nassau from 2am to 10am. Groups spend months creating elaborate costumes from crepe paper and cardboard (some costing $100,000+), competing in music, costume, and overall performance. The distinctive sound comes from goatskin drums, cowbells, whistles, and brass. Rooted in celebrations by enslaved Africans during Christmas holidays.

name: Bahamas Carnival
desc: Modern high-energy celebration of Bahamian music, art, and street culture.
details: Spotlights Bahamian music, art, and street culture through concerts, road marches, and all-night parties. Complements traditional Junkanoo with a younger, party-driven experience bridging heritage and modern Caribbean carnival energy.

name: Fiesta de la Confluencia
desc: Four-day major cultural festival on Isla 132 with renowned national and international artists.
details: Record attendance with 270,000 on opening day and 410,000 on day three. Features Angela Torres, Bersuit Vergarabat, Dillom, Kapanga, Luciano Pereyra, Luck Ra, No Te Va Gustar, Trueno, and others. Free general admission; single-day entry $40,000, four-day pass $100,000. Includes gastronomic promenade and 200+ entrepreneurs.

name: New York Film Festival (NYFF)
desc: An incredibly prestigious, highly curated film festival presented by Film at Lincoln Center.
details: NYFF eschews the massive market frenzy of TIFF or Cannes. Instead, it offers a refined, non-competitive slate of the year's most critically acclaimed global cinema, setting the high-art standard for the American fall season.

name: Tribeca Film Festival
desc: Major film festival co-founded by Robert De Niro showcasing independent films, documentaries, and immersive media in Lower Manhattan.
details: Founded in the wake of September 11th to revitalize Lower Manhattan, Tribeca has grown into one of the world's most prestigious film festivals. It screens hundreds of films across narrative, documentary, shorts, and immersive categories, with talks, panels, and special events throughout the Tribeca neighborhood.

name: Christkindlesmarkt Nuremberg
desc: Germany's most famous and atmospheric Christmas market dating to 1628.
details: The Nuremberg Christkindlesmarkt fills the historic Hauptmarkt with 180 stalls selling Lebkuchen, Glühwein, handmade ornaments, and Nuremberg sausages. The Christkind opens the market with a prologue from the church balcony.

name: Expanded Art Osaka
desc: A prominent contemporary art fair highlighting the distinct culture of the Kansai region.
details: Often held in unique architectural settings like the Osaka City Central Public Hall, the fair champions the gritty, humorous, and independent spirit of artists from Japan's second-largest metropolitan area.

name: Ouidah International Voodoo Festival
desc: Vodun celebration with ceremonies, drumming, dance, and processions centered in Ouidah.

name: Obby Oss Festival
desc: Ancient May Day celebration with two Obby Oss hobby horses dancing through town.
details: Padstow's ancient May Day tradition sees two rival 'Obby Oss' hobby horses dance through streets accompanied by drummers, accordion players, and hundreds of followers in white and red.

name: Pori Jazz Festival
desc: One of the oldest and most prestigious jazz festivals in Europe, running since 1966 on the banks of the Kokemäenjoki River.
details: Pori Jazz has been bringing world-class jazz, soul, funk, and blues to the western Finnish coast since 1966. The main stage on the riverbank can host over 30,000 people, while intimate club gigs and free street performances fill the city. Past headliners include Miles Davis, BB King, and Stevie Wonder.

name: Chinese Spring Festival (Mauritius)
desc: Chinese New Year celebrations in Mauritius's Chinatown with dragon dances, firecrackers, and traditional food.
details: Chinese Spring Festival in Mauritius features vibrant celebrations in Port Louis's Chinatown with dragon dances, lion dances, firecrackers, lanterns, and traditional Chinese food. It reflects the island's multicultural heritage with Chinese-Mauritian communities celebrating their ancestral traditions.

name: Festival Capital Puerto Montt
desc: Multi-genre music and cultural festival celebrating Puerto Montt's cultural heritage.
details: Held at Costanera of Puerto Montt. Featured artists: Sinaka, Santaferia, Leo Rey, Joe Vasconcellos, Charros de Luchito y Rafael, Paul Vásquez, local and regional musicians. Free entry. Attracted massive gathering with hundreds enjoying local cultural performances. Transmission via ITV Patagonia. Helps establish La Serena as favorite summer destination.

name: Festopia Punta Cana
desc: Cultural and music celebration in the resort destination of Punta Cana.
details: Festival combining cultural elements and music performances in Punta Cana's resort setting. Attracts visitors and locals celebrating Dominican culture and entertainment.

name: Festival Internacional de Jazz
desc: Annual jazz festival celebrating 30 years with tributes to Miles Davis and pure jazz performances.
details: Held at Finca El Sosiego in Punta Ballena. 2026 features tributes to Miles Davis (turning 100 in 2026). Indoor venue ensures weather reliability. Featured performers: Elio Villafranca, Dayna Stephens, Brianna Thomas, Duduka Da Fonseca trio, Diego Urcola, Juan Chiavassa, Alfredo Cardim, others. Produced and directed by Francisco Yobino. Maintained commitment to "pure jazz" for enthusiasts since 1996.

name: Fiestas Patronales Quitupan 2026
desc: Local feast honoring Virgen de la Candelaria
details: Blends indigenous traditions with Catholic religion with processions, traditional food, folkloric dances, special masses, and community fairs.

name: Ravello Festival
desc: Classical music in Villa Rufolo overlooking the Amalfi Coast.
details: The 74th Ravello Festival presents world-class orchestras and soloists at the Villa Rufolo terrace, with the stunning Amalfi Coast as backdrop. The setting inspired Wagner and continues to enchant audiences.

name: Rhine in Flames
desc: Spectacular fireworks festival illuminating Rhine castles from boat convoys.
details: Rhine in Flames features massive fireworks displays launched from hilltop castles and riverbanks along the Rhine, viewed from illuminated boat convoys. Five separate events span the summer season.

name: Réveillon Copacabana
desc: World's largest New Year's Eve celebration on Copacabana beach with over 70 musical attractions across 13 stages and historic fireworks display.
details: Palco Rio at Copacabana Palace Hotel features Gilberto Gil with Ney Matogrosso, Belo, Alcione, João Gomes with Iza, and Alok. Palco Samba Amstel showcases Roberta Sá, Mart'nália, Diogo Nogueira, and Feyjão with Bloco da Preta. Over 70 musical attractions animate 13 stages across Rio neighborhoods. Historic fireworks with 19 barges along coastline deliver 12-minute pyrotechnic spectacle, largest ever performed in the city. Consolidates event as country's largest music festival with 2+ million attending.

name: Reveillon Copacabana (New Year’s Eve)
desc: Massive beachfront New Year’s celebration with concerts and fireworks at Copacabana.

name: Saudi Cup
desc: World's richest horse race with $20 million purse at King Abdulaziz Racecourse.
details: Two-day event at King Abdulaziz Racecourse featuring international horse racing, fashion, entertainment, and fine dining.

name: Maine Lobster Festival
desc: Internationally recognized seafood celebration featuring lobster dinners and cooking contests.
details: The Maine Lobster Festival serves over 20,000 pounds of lobster to hungry visitors along Rockland's scenic harbor. Events include lobster crate races, a parade, cooking contests, art shows, and live entertainment, all centered around Maine's most beloved seafood.

name: Bahrain Grand Prix
desc: Formula 1 season opener at the Bahrain International Circuit under spectacular floodlights.
details: Night race at Bahrain International Circuit launching the F1 season. Features concerts, entertainment, and cultural activities alongside racing.

name: John Legend Concert at Registan
desc: John Legend's first concert in Central Asia at the iconic Registan Square.
details: Soul and pop star John Legend performs his first ever concert in Central Asia at the iconic Registan Square. Organized by the Foundation for the Development of Culture and Art of Uzbekistan.

name: Dia de los Muertos SF
desc: Day of the Dead procession and celebration in San Francisco's Mission District.
details: San Francisco's Mission District hosts one of the oldest Dia de los Muertos celebrations in the US, with a community procession featuring elaborate altars on wheels, Aztec dancers, live music, and thousands of face-painted participants honoring their ancestors.

name: Semana Grande / Aste Nagusia
desc: San Sebastián's week-long summer festival built around an international fireworks competition that illuminates La Concha Bay nightly.
details: Semana Grande combines an international fireworks competition over La Concha Bay with a week of concerts, traditional Basque sports, culinary events, and family activities. The nightly fireworks competition, with entries from countries worldwide, produces some of the most spectacular pyrotechnic displays in Europe. By day, San Sebastián's legendary food scene — arguably the best per-capita in the world — is in full flow.

name: C6 Fest
desc: Multi-stage music festival including C6 Jazz stage and diverse programming across music genres.
details: C6 Fest brings together various musical styles with dedicated jazz stage. The Parque Ibirapuera location provides prestigious venue for summer programming.

name: Wanuskewin Days
desc: Indigenous Day celebrations at the 6,000-year-old Wanuskewin Heritage Park.
details: Wanuskewin Heritage Park, a site of continuous Indigenous habitation for over 6,000 years, celebrates National Indigenous Peoples Day with traditional dance, drumming, storytelling, and traditional foods.

name: Sefrou Cherry Festival
desc: One of Morocco's oldest festivals celebrating the cherry harvest with a parade, cherry queen coronation, and traditional music.
details: One of Morocco's oldest festivals dating back to the 1920s, this celebration of the cherry harvest features a parade, the crowning of a Cherry Queen, folk music and dance performances, and markets overflowing with fresh cherries. The charming town of Sefrou near Fes provides an intimate, authentically Moroccan setting.

name: Koenji Awa Odori
desc: Tokyo's largest Awa Odori event with 10,000 dancers filling the streets of Koenji.
details: The Koenji Awa Odori is the largest Awa Odori celebration outside of Tokushima, with about 10,000 dancers from 180 ren (teams) performing through the shopping streets of Koenji. The event transforms this quiet residential neighborhood into a vibrant dance party, attracting over a million spectators over two days.

name: Suwon Hwaseong Cultural Festival
desc: Festival at the UNESCO World Heritage Hwaseong Fortress with historical reenactments.
details: Suwon's Hwaseong Cultural Festival celebrates the UNESCO-listed 18th-century fortress with historical reenactments of King Jeongjo's royal procession, traditional martial arts demonstrations, and cultural performances. The beautifully preserved fortress walls and gates provide an impressive historical setting.

name: Noche de Ofrenda / Dia de los Muertos
desc: Tucson's vibrant Day of the Dead celebration featuring an All Souls Procession and elaborate community altars.
details: Tucson hosts one of the most authentic Dia de los Muertos celebrations in the United States, anchored by the All Souls Procession — a two-mile procession of thousands in elaborate costumes and face paint honoring the departed. Community altars, live music, and cultural programming celebrate the deep Mexican-American roots of the region.

name: Day Zero Tulum 2026
desc: Electronic music festival curated by Damian Lazarus in jungle venue
details: Three stages, sunrise rituals. Lineup: Seth Troxler, Nicola Cruz, Vintage Culture, Acid Pauli, Mau P.

name: Ruisrock
desc: Finland's oldest rock festival on the beautiful island of Ruissalo since 1970.
details: Ruisrock on Ruissalo island combines Finland's oldest rock festival tradition with the beautiful Baltic Sea island setting, featuring major international and Finnish rock, pop, and electronic artists.

name: Feria del Tephé 2026
desc: Festival celebrating Señor de Chalma with live music and hot springs
details: Features hot springs at Balnearios El Tephé. Friday Feb 20: live music with regional bands (11:00 AM, free). Saturday Feb 21: Young Carnival. Sunday Feb 22: "Los Compas" performances. Free admission.

name: Festival Internacional del Bolero y Jazz 2026
desc: Second edition of festival celebrating bolero and jazz music traditions
details: Held in Veracruz and Xalapa. Combines bolero and jazz genres with established venues in both cities.

name: Festival del Joropo
desc: International joropo tournament celebrating llanera music and dance with 3,000+ dancing couples, tail-roping competitions, and cultural showcases.
details: Largest plains celebration since 1960, attracting ~500,000 people. 56th+ edition features International Joropo Contest with competitions for dancers and musicians. "Joropódromo" parade featuring 3,000+ couples dancing to llanera music. Activities: tail-roping bulls, plains work, gastronomic festivals, handicraft exhibitions, art displays. Joropo is llanera region's most representative musical genre combining indigenous, African, Spanish influences. Traditional instruments: harp, cuatro, maracas, bass.

name: Kwita Izina
desc: Rwanda's famous mountain gorilla naming ceremony celebrating conservation success.
details: Kwita Izina is Rwanda's annual gorilla naming ceremony in Volcanoes National Park. Since 2005, invited guests take the stage to name each gorilla born in the past year. Rwanda is home to almost half the world's mountain gorillas. The event includes a conference, workshops, and cultural performances.

name: Spraoi International Street Arts Festival
desc: Ireland's largest free street arts festival with giant puppets, circus, and fire performances.
details: Spraoi transforms Waterford city with spectacular outdoor performances including giant puppetry, aerial circus, fire shows, and street theatre. Over 100,000 attend this free festival celebrating outdoor arts.

name: National Cherry Festival
desc: Three-day celebration of the Australian cherry harvest with parades, cherry-pit spitting, and market stalls.
details: Young's National Cherry Festival has celebrated the cherry harvest since the 1940s. The festival features cherry-picking competitions, a grand street parade, live entertainment, market stalls, cherry-pit spitting contests, and tours of local orchards.

name: InMusic Festival
desc: Croatia's biggest open-air music festival for rock, indie, and alternative — set on a beautiful island in Zagreb's Jarun Lake.
details: INmusic Festival is Croatia's largest open-air rock and alternative music festival, held on an island in Lake Jarun on the outskirts of Zagreb. The unique island setting, combined with a strong international lineup and the charm of Zagreb as a city, makes it a distinctive summer festival. The festival is known for excellent sound quality and a relaxed, friendly atmosphere.

name: Victoria Day Celebrations
desc: Canada-wide celebrations marking the unofficial start of summer with fireworks and community events.
details: Victoria Day is a beloved Canadian holiday marked with fireworks displays, community barbecues, and outdoor celebrations across the country. Major fireworks displays take place in Ottawa, Toronto, Montreal, and Victoria, marking the unofficial start of the Canadian summer.

name: Juhannus (Midsummer)
desc: Finland's Midsummer holiday when millions retreat to countryside cottages for bonfires, sauna, swimming, and celebrating the midnight sun and the height of summer.
details: Juhannus is a national holiday when Finns escape cities for country cottages. Massive bonfires (kokko) light up lakeshores, saunas are fired up, and people swim, eat, and drink into the white night. Old beliefs say the louder you celebrate, the luckier your year, and the more you drink, the better the harvest. Cities empty as the countryside comes alive with celebrations.

name: Jordan National Day
desc: Independence Day celebrations marking Jordan's independence in 1946 with parades and cultural events.
details: National celebrations featuring military parades, cultural performances, fireworks, and community events across the Hashemite Kingdom.

name: Diwali (Mauritius)
desc: Five-day Festival of Lights transforming the multi-cultural island into a fairyland of illumination.
details: Diwali in Mauritius is a public holiday celebrated by the island's Hindu majority (50%+ of population). The five-day celebration transforms the island with thousands of lights decorating buildings, temples, and homes. People clean and decorate homes, purchase new clothing, and share gifts.

name: Thaipoosam Cavadee
desc: Spectacular Tamil festival where devotees pierce their bodies and carry wooden structures to temples.
details: Thaipoosam Cavadee is one of the most spectacular Tamil festivals in Mauritius. Devotees pierce their bodies with needles and hooks, carrying elaborate wooden structures (Cavadees) decorated with flowers to temples in honor of the god Muruga. It is a visually stunning display of faith and devotion.

name: Ancestor Festival / Juneteenth Celebrations
desc: National celebrations of Juneteenth, the federal holiday commemorating the end of slavery in the United States.
details: Juneteenth celebrations take place in cities across America on June 19, commemorating the day in 1865 when enslaved people in Texas learned of their freedom. Events include parades, concerts, historical reenactments, community cookouts, art exhibitions, and cultural programs celebrating African American history, culture, and achievement.

name: Fête de l'Indépendance
desc: Ivorian Independence Day celebrations with grand parades, cultural performances, and fireworks.
details: Côte d'Ivoire's Independence Day on August 7th features grand military and civilian parades through Abidjan, traditional dance performances from the country's diverse ethnic groups, live music concerts, cultural exhibitions, and spectacular fireworks.

name: Mother of the Nation Festival
desc: Family festival honoring Sheikha Fatima with entertainment, food, culture, and art across the Corniche.
details: Celebrates the legacy of the Mother of the Nation with live performances, interactive activities, food experiences, and cultural programming along the Abu Dhabi Corniche.

name: Akhtala Barbecue Festival
desc: All-Armenian barbecue (khorovats) competition with awards for Best Chef, Best Flavor, and Best Innovation.
details: All-Armenian barbecue competition launched 2009. Cooks from cafes, restaurants, NGOs, educational institutions compete. Beef, pork, fish, mutton, vegetable barbecues. Awards: 'Best Idea,' 'Best Chef,' 'Best Flavor,' 'Best Innovation.'

name: Akwesasne International Powwow
desc: Cross-border Mohawk powwow celebrating the community that straddles the US-Canada boundary.
details: The Akwesasne Powwow takes place on Mohawk territory that spans the US-Canada border, making it a truly unique cross-border Indigenous celebration. Traditional dances, drumming, lacrosse, and traditional Haudenosaunee food are featured.

name: Antalya XI Youth Festival
desc: International youth festival celebrating dance and music with young performers worldwide.
details: Features youth-focused dance and music performances held in the coastal city of Alanya.

name: Albuquerque Día de los Muertos Marigold Parade
desc: Community Day of the Dead parade through the South Valley featuring altars, music, and traditional celebrations.
details: Albuquerque's Marigold Parade is a vibrant community celebration where families and art groups create elaborate floats, altars, and costumes honoring departed loved ones. The parade through the historically Hispanic South Valley reflects New Mexico's deep Day of the Dead traditions.

name: Algeria Revolution Day
desc: Commemoration of the start of the Algerian War of Independence in 1954.
details: Revolution Day marks the anniversary of the outbreak of the Algerian revolution against French colonial rule on November 1, 1954. The day features military parades, wreath-laying ceremonies at war memorials, cultural events, and patriotic concerts.

name: Alishan Cherry Blossom Season
desc: Cherry blossoms along the famous narrow-gauge mountain railway in the misty Alishan highlands.
details: Alishan's cherry blossoms are particularly magical due to the mountain setting at 2,200m elevation. The blossoms frame the narrow-gauge heritage railway and the famous sea of clouds (yunhai). The combination of ancient cypress forests, misty mountain views, and pink blossoms creates an otherworldly atmosphere.

name: Visa Fashion Week Almaty
desc: 12th edition showcasing 18+ fashion brands from Central Asia, UAE, and Mongolia at the Ritz-Carlton.
details: Showcases 18+ fashion brands from Central Asia, Kazakhstan, Uzbekistan, Armenia, UAE, Mongolia. Spring/Summer 2026 collections displayed on runway at the Ritz-Carlton Hotel Almaty.

name: Spirit of Tengri
desc: Central Asia's largest contemporary ethnic music festival featuring folk musicians from 20+ countries.
details: Spirit of Tengri is Central Asia's biggest contemporary ethnic music festival, held at Palace of the Republic and Abay Square in Almaty. Features folk and ethnic musicians from Central Asia, Russia, Mongolia, Georgia, Turkey, Ecuador, Altai, Norway, Estonia, Hungary, Austria, Germany, China, and Kyrgyzstan. Includes Global Village fair with craftsmen's products and national cuisine. UNESCO-recognized cultural event.

name: AlUla Moments
desc: Year-round calendar of cultural, arts, and heritage events in the ancient oasis of AlUla.
details: Set in UNESCO World Heritage Site of Hegra. Features art installations, concerts, wellness retreats, adventure activities, and heritage experiences in spectacular desert landscape.

name: Jordan Independence Day
desc: Grand celebrations commemorating Jordan's independence from British mandate rule with parades, fireworks, and cultural performances.
details: May 25th commemorates Jordan's independence from British mandate rule in 1946 with parades, fireworks, cultural performances, and patriotic displays. Grand celebrations take place in Amman and other major cities, showcasing national pride and heritage.

name: DGTL Festival
desc: Sustainable electronic music festival pioneering circular economy practices.
details: DGTL at Amsterdam's NDSM wharf combines cutting-edge electronic music with sustainability innovation—circular food systems, renewable energy, and waste-free ambitions.

name: Intl Antalya Summer Festival
desc: 10th edition international festival supporting amateur creativity through music and dance.
details: Designed to support amateur creativity and facilitate cultural exchange through dance, music, and cultural performances.

name: XI Intl Music & Folk Dance Antalya Fest
desc: International music and folk dance festival inviting ensembles and dance teams from worldwide.
details: Invites folk ensembles, choral groups, orchestras, brass bands, modern dance teams, and majorette teams of all ages.

name: Famadihana
desc: Unique Malagasy 'turning of the bones' ceremony where families exhume ancestors, rewrap them, and dance.
details: Famadihana is a traditional ceremony where Merina families exhume their ancestors from tombs, wrap them in fresh silk shrouds, and dance with them in a joyful procession accompanied by live music. Dates are set by the family's mpanandro (traditional diviner) every 3-7 years. It is a celebration of the bond between the living and the dead.

name: Main Square Festival
desc: Major rock and pop festival in the stunning Grand'Place of Arras.
details: Main Square Festival fills the magnificent Grand'Place of Arras—one of Europe's finest Flemish baroque squares—with major international headliners.

name: Takeda Castle Unkai (Sea of Clouds)
desc: Japan's 'Castle in the Sky'—400-year-old castle ruins floating above a sea of clouds at dawn.
details: While not a festival per se, the autumn sea of clouds phenomenon at Takeda Castle ruins creates one of Japan's most magical seasonal experiences. From a viewpoint across the valley, the 400-year-old castle ruins appear to float above a carpet of clouds at dawn. The phenomenon occurs on cold, clear mornings between September and November.

name: Neutrality Day
desc: Celebration of UN-recognized permanent neutrality with conferences and festivities.
details: Celebrates UN recognition of Turkmenistan's permanent neutrality (1995). International conferences, cultural festivities, and celebrations nationwide.

name: Solana Festival Astana
desc: Sister event to Almaty Solana Festival with identical global music lineup at Solana City hub.
details: Astana's Solana Festival mirrors the Almaty event with the same international lineup. Part of the new Solana City year-round events hub development positioning Astana as an event tourism destination.

name: Astana Day
desc: Capital city celebration with fireworks, laser shows, military tattoos, and cultural performances.
details: Astana Day commemorates the relocation of Kazakhstan's capital from Almaty. Features fireworks displays, laser shows, Eskeri Kernei International Military Tattoo Festival, concerts, theatrical performances, and cultural celebrations. The Astana Opera organizes concerts with national orchestras performing traditional music.

name: Kazakhstan Independence Day
desc: National celebration of 1991 independence with ceremonies at the Presidential Palace and traditional festivities.
details: Commemorates Kazakhstan's independence from the Soviet Union in 1991. Features yurts with local delicacies, indoor celebrations, ceremonies at Aqorda Presidential Palace where the President presents orders and medals to distinguished citizens, traditional clothing parades, and public entertainment programs.

name: XVIII Festival Mundial del Arpa
desc: International festival celebrating the harp with global performers and local Paraguayan harp traditions.
details: 18th edition world harp festival bringing global harp figures and local talent. Paraguay has strong harp tradition particularly in folk and classical music. Celebrates indigenous and mestizo musical heritage. The 2025 edition (Oct 2-5) featured figures from multiple countries. 2026 dates and programming to be confirmed by festival organizers.

name: Festa de Flores e Morangos (Atibaia, São Paulo)
desc: Celebrating flowers and strawberries with agricultural displays, crafts, typical food, and cultural activities in a rural festival setting.
details: The Festa de Flores e Morangos (Flowers and Strawberries Festival) is one of the region's major events, held at Parque Ecológico. The festival celebrates the agricultural heritage of the Circuito das Frutas region, featuring flower and strawberry displays, agricultural products, handicrafts, regional cuisine, and cultural performances. The festival attracts families celebrating rural traditions and seasonal harvests.

name: Auckland Lantern Festival
desc: Spectacular Chinese New Year lantern displays, performances, and food in Auckland's Albert Park.
details: The Auckland Lantern Festival is a dazzling celebration of Chinese New Year featuring hundreds of handcrafted lanterns illuminating the park, traditional Chinese performances, acrobatics, martial arts, and an array of Asian food stalls.

name: International Bagamoyo Arts Festival
desc: Week-long festival of music, dance and performances in Bagamoyo; includes cultural exchange and learning platforms.
details: Tanzania's Bagamoyo Arts Festival takes place north of Dar es Salaam, with music, dance, and other performances stretching over a full week. Originally a tiny event under a mango tree at the Bagamoyo College of Arts in 1982, the festival has grown into a significant cultural gathering.

name: Tumpek Uye
desc: Balinese ceremony showing gratitude to animals.
details: Special prayers and offerings are made for the wellbeing of livestock and wildlife supporting human life.

name: Bendigo Easter Festival
desc: One of Australia's oldest cultural festivals featuring the world's longest Imperial Chinese dragon — Sun Loong.
details: The Bendigo Easter Festival celebrates the city's Chinese heritage with a spectacular parade featuring Sun Loong, the world's longest Imperial Chinese processional dragon. The festival includes Chinese lion and dragon dancing, live performances, markets, and cultural events.

name: Igue Festival
desc: Ancient royal festival of the Oba of Benin involving elaborate traditional ceremonies.
details: The Igue Festival is one of the most important ceremonies of the ancient Benin Kingdom. The Oba performs rituals to renew his divine powers and ensure the prosperity of the kingdom. The festival features traditional dances, masquerades, and ceremonies dating back centuries.

name: Berlin Festival of Lights
desc: Berlin's landmarks are transformed by stunning large-scale light projections, illuminating over 70 buildings including the Brandenburg Gate and Berlin Cathedral.
details: For over a week, Berlin's most iconic landmarks are illuminated with spectacular light art installations, projections, and 3D video mapping. The Brandenburg Gate, Berlin Cathedral, Charlottenburg Palace, and over 70 other buildings become canvases for international light artists. The festival is free and best experienced walking or by bus through the illuminated city after dark.

name: Lollapalooza Berlin
desc: Berlin edition of the iconic American festival brand with major headliners.
details: Lollapalooza Berlin brings the festival's signature mix of rock, pop, electronic, and hip-hop to the German capital with spectacular stages and a young, energetic audience.

name: Musikfest
desc: 10-day free music festival with 500+ performances on 16 stages in historic Bethlehem.
details: Musikfest is the largest free music festival in the nation, featuring over 500 performances on 16 stages spread across the historic and revitalized SteelStacks campus and downtown Bethlehem. The festival encompasses all genres from rock to jazz to polka to world music.

name: Nupe Day Celebration
desc: Traditional and cultural celebration of the Nupe community of Niger State.
details: Nupe Day is observed on June 26 by the Nupe community, featuring traditional music, dance, horse riding displays, and cultural exhibitions that celebrate the rich heritage of the Nupe people of Niger State.

name: Irreecha Festival
desc: Oromo people's thanksgiving festival celebrating the end of winter at Lake Hora.
details: Irreecha is the Oromo people's annual thanksgiving festival, held at Lake Hora in Bishoftu. Millions gather wearing traditional white clothes adorned with green and red, carrying fresh grass and flowers to give thanks for peace, health, and the end of winter. It was added to UNESCO's Intangible Heritage list.

name: Festival de Verano
desc: August celebration of city's founding with 200+ cultural and recreational activities in parks featuring concerts and sporting events.
details: 28+ editions celebrating Bogotá's founding with outdoor activities in Parque Simon Bolivar and other parks (Cayetano, Canizares, Servitá, Timiza). Features professional competitions (boxing tournaments, taekwondo), local activities (rock climbing, Zumba, Pilates). Opening concert with national/international artists attracts 160,000+. Focus on getting people outdoors with diverse programming.

name: Jazz al Parque
desc: Free international jazz festival celebrating jazz in dialogue with urban culture at Parque El Country.
details: 28th edition in 2025 (September 6-7) featured diverse jazz programming. Festival promotes jazz as cultural expression accessible to all. Held in collaboration with Idartes and the District Administration. Scholarships available through "Bogotá Ciudad Creativa de la Música" program.

name: Birds of Prey Festival
desc: Celebration of ancient golden eagle and falcon hunting with demonstrations by experienced berkutchis.
details: Features demonstrations by experienced berkutchis (eagle hunters), felt-making workshops, traditional Kyrgyz cuisine tastings, folk music performances, traditional horseback games, and horse races. UNESCO recognition for traditional hunting heritage.

name: Bright Autumn Festival
desc: Stunning autumn foliage celebration in the Alpine village with parades, markets, and gourmet food.
details: Bright's Autumn Festival is set against the spectacular backdrop of deciduous trees in full autumn color. The 10-day program includes a grand parade, open gardens, gourmet food and wine events, live music, art exhibitions, and markets in this charming Alpine village.

name: Hungarian Formula 1 Grand Prix
desc: Formula 1 race weekend creating festival atmosphere at the Hungaroring.
details: The Hungarian GP at the Hungaroring creates a massive party atmosphere with concerts, fan zones, and 100,000+ spectators over the race weekend.

name: Busan Christmas Tree Festival
desc: Festive light festival transforming Busan's Nampo-dong into a dazzling winter wonderland.
details: The Busan Christmas Tree Festival adorns the streets of Nampo-dong shopping district with spectacular light installations, enormous Christmas trees, and festive decorations. The festival creates a magical winter atmosphere with themed zones, live performances, and illuminated walkways attracting visitors throughout December.

name: Byblos International Film Festival
desc: A new film festival in the world's oldest city celebrating cinema through screenings, workshops, and filmmaker discussions.
details: Set in one of the world's oldest continuously inhabited cities, this festival showcases international music acts, dance shows, and cultural performances in a stunning open-air venue with ancient ruins and the Mediterranean Sea as backdrop. The historic Crusader castle and Roman amphitheater provide an intimate yet grand setting. Ticket prices start from $30.

name: Ramadan & Eid al-Fitr in Egypt
desc: The transformative holy month of Ramadan turns Egypt into a nocturnal wonderland of lanterns, communal meals, and festive celebrations.
details: Ramadan transforms Egypt into a nocturnal wonderland. While daytime activities slow for fasting, nights come alive with special prayers, festive decorations, and community celebrations. Streets are adorned with colorful Ramadan lanterns (fawanees), communal iftar meals are shared, and the atmosphere in Cairo's historic districts is magical. Eid al-Fitr marks the end with vibrant celebrations, new clothes, and family gatherings.

name: Ramadan Nights (Egypt)
desc: Month-long nightly celebrations across Egypt with vibrant street life, lanterns, and Ramadan tents.
details: Ramadan in Egypt transforms the country's nights into vibrant celebrations. Streets are decorated with colorful lanterns (fanous), Ramadan tents (sewan) serve iftar meals, and entertainment continues until dawn. Cairo's Islamic quarter is particularly atmospheric during this holy month.

name: Enlighten Festival
desc: Festival illuminating Canberra's national institutions with spectacular projections and light installations.
details: Enlighten Festival transforms Canberra's parliamentary triangle with architectural projections on the National Gallery, Parliament House, and other institutions, alongside night markets, live entertainment, and special late-night events at national cultural institutions.

name: Bazique Festival
desc: Unique collaboration of 10 Cape Town party promoters featuring 6 music stages and 110+ local DJs.
details: Bazique Festival at The Ostrich Cape Town is a unique collaboration of 10 like-minded Cape Town party promoters, featuring 6 music stages, 7 international DJs, 110 local DJs, and more. It represents Cape Town's thriving underground electronic music scene.

name: Black Coffee Weekender
desc: Three-day culture and music festival hosted by DJ Black Coffee featuring Peggy Gou's SA debut.
details: The Black Coffee Weekender is a premium three-day festival curated by internationally acclaimed DJ and producer Black Coffee. The 2026 edition features Peggy Gou performing exclusively for the first time in South Africa, alongside a mix of international guest DJs and local talent across multiple stages.

name: Kirstenbosch Summer Sunset Concerts
desc: Iconic outdoor concerts in the stunning Kirstenbosch Botanical Gardens at sunset.
details: The Kirstenbosch Summer Sunset Concerts are a beloved Cape Town tradition held every Sunday from November to March. Audiences picnic on the lush lawns of the botanical gardens while watching top South African and international artists perform as the sun sets over Table Mountain.

name: Chengdu Panda Festival
desc: Celebration of Chengdu's most beloved residents—giant pandas—with conservation events and cultural activities.
details: The Chengdu International Panda Festival celebrates the city's iconic giant pandas with events at the Chengdu Research Base of Giant Panda Breeding. The festival includes panda-themed art exhibitions, conservation lectures, children's activities, and opportunities to observe pandas in their natural-style habitats. It raises awareness about conservation while celebrating Sichuan culture.

name: Chichibu Meisen Silk Festival
desc: Celebration of Chichibu's traditional meisen silk weaving heritage with demonstrations and exhibitions.
details: Chichibu's meisen silk tradition, dating back centuries, is celebrated with weaving demonstrations, kimono exhibitions, and fabric markets. The craft involves a unique resist-dyeing technique that creates iridescent silk patterns. The festival coincides with autumn foliage in the scenic mountain town.

name: Bread and Circus World Buskers Festival
desc: World-class street performers and buskers transforming Christchurch's streets with comedy, acrobatics, and spectacle.
details: The World Buskers Festival brings international street performers to Christchurch for 10 days of outdoor entertainment. Acrobats, comedians, musicians, magicians, and circus performers take over the city's streets and public spaces, creating an infectious carnival atmosphere.

name: Nami Island Winter Festival
desc: Winter wonderland festival on the island made famous by Korean drama 'Winter Sonata.'
details: Nami Island, made internationally famous by the K-drama 'Winter Sonata,' hosts winter festivals with snow activities, ice sculptures, and the iconic tree-lined avenues. The island's artistic installations and natural beauty attract visitors year-round, with winter adding a romantic snow-covered atmosphere.

name: Chungju World Martial Arts Festival
desc: International martial arts gathering showcasing combat traditions from around the world.
details: The Chungju World Martial Arts Festival brings together practitioners of martial arts from dozens of countries. Events include taekwondo, hapkido, kendo, judo, and traditional Korean sword arts alongside Asian and international martial traditions. Demonstrations, competitions, and cultural performances fill the week.

name: Cologne Street Carnival (Weiberfastnacht)
desc: Opening day of Cologne Carnival when women cut men's ties in street revelry.
details: Weiberfastnacht kicks off Cologne's carnival at 11:11 AM when women symbolically take power by cutting men's ties. The old town erupts into outdoor partying and costume revelry.

name: Coober Pedy Opal Festival
desc: Celebration of opal mining heritage in the underground town of Coober Pedy.
details: The Coober Pedy Opal Festival celebrates the unique heritage of this underground outback town, famous for its opal mines. Events include opal displays, underground tours, food, crafts, live entertainment, and cultural activities in one of Australia's most unusual destinations.

name: Wilderness Festival
desc: Four-day boutique festival of music, arts, food, and wellbeing.
details: Wilderness combines headline music acts with Michelin-star dining, long-table banquets, foraging, yoga, wild swimming, and theatre in idyllic Oxfordshire parkland.

name: Deichbrand Festival
desc: North Sea coast festival combining music with beach camping.
details: Deichbrand near Cuxhaven offers rock, pop, hip-hop, and electronic music with North Sea beach camping and dike-side stages.

name: Daegu Dalgubeol Festival
desc: Daegu's main city festival combining traditional culture with modern K-pop performances.
details: The Dalgubeol Festival is Daegu's signature cultural event, featuring historical parades, traditional performances, K-pop concerts, and food markets. The festival celebrates the city's identity as the 'Apple Capital' and textile center of Korea.

name: Daegu Chimac (Chicken & Beer) Festival
desc: Massive outdoor festival celebrating Korea's beloved fried chicken and beer pairing culture.
details: The Daegu Chimac Festival is Korea's biggest celebration of chimaek—the beloved combination of fried chicken (chi) and beer (maekju). The festival features massive outdoor dining areas, chicken cooking competitions, K-pop performances, and beer gardens. It captures the spirit of Korean social dining culture. Daegu, known for its fried chicken, draws over a million visitors.

name: Dak'Art OFF
desc: Hundreds of independent art exhibitions throughout Dakar running alongside the official Biennale.
details: The Dak'Art OFF program features hundreds of independent exhibitions, pop-up galleries, and cultural events throughout Dakar running parallel to the official Biennale. It transforms the entire city into an open-air gallery and is considered by many to be even more exciting than the official programme.

name: Damyang Bamboo Festival
desc: Celebration of Damyang's famous bamboo culture with crafts, food, and forest experiences.
details: Damyang's bamboo forests are among Korea's most beautiful natural landscapes, and the bamboo festival celebrates this heritage with bamboo craft workshops, bamboo shoot cooking, bamboo forest walks, and traditional music performances. The famous Juknokwon bamboo garden serves as the main venue.

name: Tanzania Union Day
desc: Celebration of the union of Tanganyika and Zanzibar forming Tanzania.
details: Union Day marks the 1964 union of Tanganyika and Zanzibar. Festivities include military parades, traditional ngoma dances, cultural exhibitions, and speeches celebrating national unity and the country's progress.

name: ChillOut Festival
desc: Australia's premier regional LGBTQIA+ pride event in the spa country town of Daylesford.
details: ChillOut has been celebrating diversity in Daylesford since 1997. The five-day festival features a colourful street parade, carnival, live music, drag shows, art exhibitions, and a relaxed country town atmosphere that draws visitors from across Australia.

name: Shaolin Martial Arts Festival
desc: International martial arts gathering at the legendary Shaolin Temple with competitions and performances.
details: The Shaolin Martial Arts Festival at the legendary Shaolin Temple in Dengfeng draws martial artists from around the world. The month-long event features kung fu competitions, demonstrations by Shaolin monks, cultural exchanges, and traditional Chinese martial arts performances. The temple setting at the foot of Song Mountain adds dramatic backdrop to the competitions.

name: Graspop Metal Meeting
desc: Belgium's premier metal festival with 200+ bands across four days.
details: Graspop Metal Meeting brings 200+ metal, rock, and hardcore bands to Dessel for four days of intense music, from legendary headliners to underground acts.

name: Taste of Dubai
desc: Premier food festival featuring Dubai's top restaurants, celebrity chefs, and cooking demonstrations.
details: Outdoor festival where top restaurants serve signature dishes. Features live cooking demos, chef interactions, and food-themed entertainment.

name: Shashmaqam Day
desc: Celebration of the UNESCO-inscribed classical Central Asian music tradition.
details: UNESCO intangible heritage celebration of Shashmaqam, the classical music tradition shared with Uzbekistan. Classical music performances in Dushanbe.

name: Düsseldorf Carnival
desc: Third of Germany's great Rhineland carnivals with politically satirical floats.
details: Düsseldorf's Rose Monday parade is famous for its sharp political satire, with artists creating pointed caricature floats that make international headlines.

name: Edinburgh Festival Fringe
desc: World’s largest performing arts festival; city-wide shows plus street performers and pop-up venues.

name: Hopi Festival of Arts and Culture
desc: Celebration of Hopi art, music, dance, and culture at the Museum of Northern Arizona.
details: The Museum of Northern Arizona hosts this annual celebration featuring Hopi artists and cultural practitioners. The festival includes traditional and contemporary art exhibitions, musical and dance performances, artist demonstrations, storytelling, and traditional Hopi foods.

name: Pilgrimage Music & Cultural Festival
desc: Boutique music festival on the grounds of a historic Civil War site in charming downtown Franklin.
details: The Pilgrimage Festival takes place on the grounds of The Park at Harlinsdale Farm, a former horse farm near the site of the Battle of Franklin. The curated lineup features Americana, indie, and roots artists in an intimate, family-friendly setting that celebrates Franklin's rich musical and historical heritage.

name: Sierra Leone Independence Day
desc: National celebrations featuring traditional masquerade performances and lantern parades.
details: Sierra Leone's Independence Day features unique lantern parades through Freetown's streets, traditional masquerade performances, music, and cultural celebrations reflecting the country's resilience and diverse heritage.

name: Fuji Shibazakura Festival
desc: Spectacular carpet of 500,000 pink moss phlox flowers at the base of Mount Fuji.
details: The Fuji Shibazakura Festival showcases approximately 500,000 shibazakura (moss phlox) plants in vivid pinks, whites, and purples against the iconic backdrop of Mount Fuji. The flower fields cover about 2.4 hectares and are complemented by a Mt. Fuji Gourmet Festival with local specialties. It is one of the most photogenic spring events in Japan.

name: Madeira Flower Festival (Festa da Flor)
desc: Funchal's streets bloom with spectacular flower carpets, parades of flower-covered floats, and the 'Wall of Hope' where children place flowers for world peace.
details: The Madeira Flower Festival celebrates the island's extraordinary floral abundance. Funchal's main avenue is decorated with elaborate flower carpets, and a grand parade features magnificent flower-covered floats. The 'Wall of Hope' ceremony sees hundreds of children each place a flower in a wall on Praça do Município. The subtropical climate ensures spectacular blooms. Flower exhibitions, concerts, and folk performances round out the program.

name: Drachenstich
desc: Germany's oldest folk play featuring a fire-breathing mechanical dragon.
details: The Drachenstich (Dragon Slaying) is Germany's oldest continuously performed folk play (since 1590), featuring a 16m long robotic dragon that breathes fire and bleeds.

name: Garbicz Festival
desc: Intimate electronic music and arts festival in a lakeside forest with no-photo policy.
details: Garbicz offers a mindful electronic music experience in Polish lakeside forest with solar power, composting, and a famous no-photo policy to keep attendees present.

name: Geelong Rainbow Festival
desc: Victoria's largest regional LGBTQIA+ pride festival with parade, music, and community events.
details: The Geelong Rainbow Festival is a vibrant celebration of diversity and inclusion, featuring a pride parade through the city centre, live music, drag performances, community activities, and family-friendly events across three days.

name: Australian Celtic Festival
desc: Four-day celebration of Celtic heritage with music, dance, Highland games, and cultural events.
details: Glen Innes's Australian Celtic Festival celebrates the region's Celtic heritage with Highland games, pipe bands, Celtic music sessions, stone-throwing competitions, and traditional dance. Each year focuses on a different Celtic nation — 2026 highlights Scotland.

name: Goyang International Flower Festival
desc: One of Asia's largest flower festivals with millions of blooms across massive exhibition grounds.
details: The Goyang International Flower Festival near Seoul features over 3.5 million flowers from 30+ countries across a 1,000,000 sq meter exhibition. Highlights include themed gardens, flower carpet displays, garden design competitions, and horticultural workshops. It is one of the largest flower exhibitions in Asia.

name: Taste Great Southern
desc: Food and wine festival celebrating the Great Southern region's premium produce and wine.
details: Taste Great Southern showcases the premium food and wine of Western Australia's Great Southern region, including Albany, Denmark, and Mount Barker. Events include winemaker dinners, long table lunches, cooking demonstrations, and local produce markets.

name: Highfield Festival
desc: Rock, indie, and electronic festival at a lakeside former mining site.
details: Highfield at the Störmthaler See near Leipzig offers lake swimming between sets of rock, indie, hip-hop, and electronic music.

name: Fiestas de Octubre (october Celebrations)
desc: Month-long festival celebrating Guadalajara's culture with concerts, bullfights, exhibits, and regional traditions.
details: Begins with enormous opening parade (usually first Saturday or Sunday). Throughout the month: concerts by renowned national and international artists, dance performances, film festivals, painting exhibitions, ballet, workshops, traditional palenque (concert venues with dancing), cockfighting, charreadas (rodeos), art exhibits, regional dancing, food fair, and Day of Nations incorporating all Guadalajara consulates. Takes place at Benito Juárez Auditorium and various locations throughout Guadalajara and Jalisco. October 12: Procession honoring Our Lady of Zapopan—her figure travels 5 hours from Cathedral of Guadalajara to Basilica of Zapopan.

name: Encuentro Internacional del Mariachi y la Charrería
desc: International gathering of mariachi ensembles and charros in the birthplace of mariachi music.
details: This festival celebrates two of Mexico's most iconic cultural traditions — mariachi music and charrería (Mexican rodeo). Hundreds of mariachi musicians from Mexico and around the world gather for concerts, competitions, and a spectacular parade through downtown Guadalajara. Championship charrería events showcase horsemanship and traditional Mexican equestrian culture.

name: Carnival (Ecuador)
desc: Carnival with water play, parades, and regional traditions; Ambato hosts the Flowers & Fruits Festival around this period.

name: Guatemala Jazz Festival
desc: International jazz festival featuring 27 concerts from 16 groups representing 9 countries, showcasing world-class jazz music.

name: Feria de Jocotenango (Nuestra Señora de la Asunción)
desc: Traditional fair with food, rides, and celebrations around the Assumption feast.

name: Moussem of Tan-Tan (Guedra Dance)
desc: Traditional Sahrawi celebration featuring the hypnotic Guedra trance dance ritual.
details: The Guedra is a spiritual trance dance performed by Sahrawi women during moussems in the Guelmim-Oued Noun region. The dancer, covered in a cloth, gradually unveils herself while performing increasingly intense hand gestures meant to spread blessings. It is one of Morocco's most mesmerizing cultural traditions.

name: Gwangju Biennale (16th Edition)
desc: Asia's oldest biennial of contemporary art celebrating its 30th anniversary—curated by Ho Tzu Nyen.
details: The 16th Gwangju Biennale marks the 30th anniversary of Asia's most important contemporary art biennial. Founded in 1995 in memory of the 1980 pro-democracy uprising, it has become a cornerstone of the global art calendar. The 2026 edition, curated by Singaporean artist Ho Tzu Nyen, features large-scale installations, films, and performances across the Biennale Hall and city venues.

name: Gwangju World Kimchi Culture Festival
desc: International celebration of Korea's kimchi heritage as UNESCO Intangible Cultural Heritage.
details: The Gwangju World Kimchi Culture Festival is a major celebration of Korea's kimchi tradition, recognized by UNESCO. The festival features international kimchi-making competitions, tastings of hundreds of regional varieties from across Korea and the world, and cultural performances. Master kimchi makers demonstrate traditional techniques.

name: Gyeongju Cherry Blossom Marathon
desc: Beautiful marathon through the UNESCO World Heritage ancient Silla capital amid cherry blossoms.
details: The Gyeongju Cherry Blossom Marathon combines athletic competition with cultural heritage as runners pass through the UNESCO-listed ruins of the ancient Silla Kingdom capital. Routes pass royal tombs, temples, and pagodas—all framed by cherry blossoms in early April. It's one of the world's most scenic marathons.

name: Hampyeong Butterfly Festival
desc: Eco-friendly butterfly festival in the clean Korean countryside with live butterfly exhibitions.
details: The Hampyeong Butterfly Festival celebrates the county's success in environmental restoration. Live butterfly gardens, insect exhibitions, flower fields, and environmental education programs attract families. The festival symbolizes Korea's commitment to ecological sustainability and rural revitalization.

name: Hangzhou West Lake Lotus Festival
desc: Beautiful celebration of blooming lotus flowers across the legendary West Lake.
details: West Lake in Hangzhou—a UNESCO World Heritage site—hosts its annual lotus festival when thousands of lotus flowers bloom across the lake's famous causeways and islands. Evening boat rides through the lotus fields, traditional tea ceremonies, and cultural performances celebrate this quintessentially Chinese flower. The Quyuan Garden is particularly spectacular.

name: Hangzhou Tea Festival
desc: Celebration of Longjing (Dragon Well) tea at the source of China's most prized green tea.
details: Hangzhou celebrates its famous Longjing green tea with spring festivals in the tea villages surrounding West Lake. Events include tea picking, traditional roasting demonstrations, tea ceremonies, and tastings of the year's first harvest. West Lake's UNESCO-listed beauty and centuries of tea culture create an unmatched experience.

name: Havana Jazz Festival (Jazz Plaza)
desc: The 41st annual Havana Jazz Festival features eight days of spectacular concerts by top Cuban musicians and international guests.
details: The 2026 edition features the musical theme "La Rumba Me Llama" (The Rumba Calls Me) with performers including pianist Roberto Fonseca, Bobby Carcassés, Alain Pérez, Isaac Delgado, and Los Muñequitos de Matanzas. Venues include the National Theatre, Fabrica de Arte Cubano, and Theatre Alicia Alonso. The festival has expanded to other provinces including Holguín, Santiago de Cuba, and Santa Clara.

name: Festival de la Salsa
desc: Cuba's premier salsa festival with top local/international performers, dance workshops, and parties.
details: One of Havana's most lively events. Features Cuba's top salsa performers, international guest artists, workshops in Cuban dance styles, and parties. One of Cuba's better-organized festivals with programs announced months in advance.

name: Fichee Chambalaalla
desc: UNESCO-listed Sidama New Year celebration with ritual food sharing and reconciliation.
details: Fichee Chambalaalla is the Sidama people's New Year, inscribed on UNESCO's Intangible Cultural Heritage list. Families share a ritual meal of buurisame (false banana dish mixed with butter and milk), exchange blessings, and reconcile conflicts. It emphasizes community cohesion and social renewal.

name: Hirosaki Cherry Blossom Festival
desc: One of Japan's top cherry blossom spots with 2,600 trees around a stunning moat and castle.
details: Hirosaki Castle Park hosts one of Japan's most spectacular hanami (cherry blossom viewing) festivals with over 2,600 cherry trees. The park's moat fills with fallen petals creating a pink carpet on the water (hanaikada). Night illuminations reflect the blossoms in the moat, creating a dreamlike atmosphere. The castle backdrop makes it one of Japan's most photographed spring scenes.

name: Hitachi Seaside Park Nemophila
desc: 4.5 million baby blue nemophila flowers create an ethereal blue carpet merging with the sky.
details: Hitachi Seaside Park's Miharashi Hill transforms into a sea of blue every spring as 4.5 million nemophila (baby blue eyes) flowers bloom simultaneously. The blue flowers against the blue sky create the illusion of the hill merging with the heavens. The park also features tulips, poppies, and cosmos in other seasons, and kokia bushes turn brilliant red in autumn.

name: Taste of Tasmania
desc: Australia's largest food festival celebrating Tasmania's exceptional food and drink culture over New Year.
details: Taste of Tasmania takes over Hobart's waterfront for a week of food, wine, and entertainment straddling the New Year period. Tasmania's finest producers showcase their goods — from world-class seafood and cheeses to craft beer and cool-climate wines — alongside live music stages.

name: Wildfoods Festival
desc: Wild food celebration on the West Coast where adventurous eaters try huhu grubs, grasshoppers, and more.
details: The Hokitika Wildfoods Festival is a uniquely New Zealand experience where visitors can sample wild and unusual foods including huhu grubs, scorpions, venison, whitebait, and other bush tucker alongside wild beer and entertainment. It celebrates the rugged West Coast spirit.

name: Hong Kong Winterfest
desc: City-wide winter celebration with spectacular light displays, holiday markets, and New Year countdown.
details: Hong Kong Winterfest transforms the city with massive light displays on skyscrapers, holiday markets, and festive events. The highlight is the New Year's Eve countdown at Victoria Harbour with fireworks and the A Symphony of Lights laser show. Shopping districts compete with elaborate decorations.

name: Hopkins Mango Festival
desc: Celebration of mango season in the southern Belize beach community with mango-based dishes, drinks, and desserts.
details: Celebrates mango season with mango-based dishes, drinks, and desserts alongside local vendors, music, and community activities. The southern beach community of Hopkins comes alive with festival celebrations, agricultural traditions, and local food specialties.

name: Hualien Stone Sculpture Festival
desc: International stone sculpture festival leveraging Hualien's famous marble and dramatic Taroko Gorge setting.
details: Hualien, famous for its marble industry and proximity to Taroko Gorge, hosts an international stone sculpture festival featuring artists working with the local marble. Sculptures are installed throughout the city and along the coast, creating a permanent outdoor gallery complementing the stunning natural landscape.

name: Corpus Christi - Huamantla, Tlaxcala 2026
desc: Regional celebration with sawdust carpets and eucharistic procession through historic center
details: Decorative sawdust/flower carpets created by local artisans in historic center. Solemn mass begins 6:00 PM, followed by monstrance passage over carpets with choirs and traditional music groups.

name: Great Wall Marathon
desc: One of the world's most challenging marathons with 5,164 stone steps on the Great Wall.
details: The Great Wall Marathon at Huangyaguan is one of the world's most challenging and scenic races. Runners navigate 5,164 stone steps on the ancient wall, steep mountain trails, and village paths. The combination of extreme physical challenge and the iconic Great Wall setting makes it a bucket-list race.

name: Iiyama Snow Festival
desc: Charming local snow festival in one of Japan's snowiest cities with community snow sculptures and competitions.
details: Iiyama Snow Festival showcases the community spirit of one of Nagano's snowiest cities. Local teams create snow sculptures, and activities include snow bowling, snow slides, and warm nabe (hot pot) served outdoors. The intimate scale and authentic community feel contrast with larger commercial snow festivals.

name: 33rd Istanbul Jazz Festival
desc: Premier international jazz festival featuring classical and modern jazz, Latin, Nordic, electronic fusion, and world music.
