details: Organized by IKSV since 1994, the festival brings together famous jazz artists globally with diverse categories including rock, pop, reggae, funk, and world music across multiple Istanbul venues.

name: Festival Nacional del Ñandutí
desc: Celebration of ñandutí (spider web) lace-making, Paraguay's UNESCO intangible cultural heritage craft.
details: Three-day festival in Itauguá near Asunción. Ñandutí means "spider's web" in Guaraní; embodies mestizo creativity, historical memory, and cultural identity. Woven on circular frames using fine white or colored threads with openwork designs. Festival features artisan exhibitions and sales, fashion shows, ballets, concerts, transforming town into open-air market. Displays other traditional crafts (ao po'i, pottery), accompanied by music, dance, traditional Paraguayan polka, and guarania. Recognized as "Patrimonio Nacional de la Artesanía y del Folclore" (National Heritage of Crafts and Folklore) since 1970.

name: Jacmel Carnival (weekends)
desc: Renowned for artistic papier-mâché masks and creative street theater.

name: Jeju Haenyeo (Women Divers) Festival
desc: Celebration of Jeju's legendary haenyeo women divers—UNESCO Intangible Cultural Heritage.
details: The Haenyeo Festival celebrates Jeju's legendary women free-divers, whose tradition is a UNESCO Intangible Cultural Heritage. Now mostly in their 60s-80s, these remarkable women dive without breathing equipment to harvest seafood. The festival features diving demonstrations, fresh seafood tastings, and cultural performances honoring their legacy.

name: Jinan Red Ginseng Festival
desc: Celebration of Korea's prized red ginseng in the mountain town of Jinan.
details: Jinan's Red Ginseng Festival celebrates one of Korea's most valued medicinal ingredients. Events include ginseng harvesting, traditional medicine workshops, ginseng cooking competitions, and health consultations. The mountain setting of Maisan (Horse Ear Mountain) Provincial Park adds natural beauty.

name: Jingdezhen International Ceramics Fair
desc: Major ceramics event in China's porcelain capital—the city that gave chinaware its name.
details: Jingdezhen, known as the 'Porcelain Capital' for its 1,000+ year history of ceramic production, hosts an international ceramics fair featuring exhibitions, trade, workshops, and kiln visits. The city's ancient dragon kilns and contemporary ceramics studios create a unique blend of tradition and innovation. International artists increasingly participate.

name: In the BURG
desc: South Africa's biggest winter electronic festival with five immersive stages and 30+ performances.
details: In the BURG takes over Carfax in Newtown, Johannesburg on Women's Day with five immersive stages and over 30 electrifying electronic music performances. It has established itself as South Africa's biggest winter electronic festival.

name: Buzkashi National Championship
desc: Afghanistan's most intense traditional sport with horseback teams competing for national championship.
details: Afghanistan's most intense traditional sport combining horsemanship and competition. Teams from across provinces compete for national championship. Recent tournaments feature international participants from Tajikistan and Kyrgyzstan. Prizes include automobiles and trophies.

name: Pow Wow
desc: Tk'emlúps te Secwépemc First Nation powwow, one of the largest in British Columbia.
details: The Kamloopa Powwow is one of the largest powwows in British Columbia, hosted by the Tk'emlúps te Secwépemc First Nation. Traditional dance competitions, drumming, indigenous art vendors, and traditional food bring together First Nations communities from across the province.

name: Red Earth Arts Festival
desc: Four-day arts festival transforming the Pilbara mining town of Karratha into an artistic playground.
details: Red Earth Arts Festival brings art, music, and performance to the remote Pilbara region. Over four days, Karratha transforms with outdoor installations, live performances, workshops, community art projects, and exhibitions celebrating the unique landscape and culture of the Pilbara.

name: Kaustinen Folk Music Festival
desc: Finland's largest and oldest folk music festival, running since 1968, celebrating folk traditions from around the world.
details: The Kaustinen Folk Music Festival is the oldest and largest of its kind in Finland. For a week in July, this small Ostrobothnian town fills with folk musicians, dancers, and enthusiasts from across the globe. Traditional Finnish folk music, including the iconic kantele and fiddling traditions, takes centre stage alongside international folk acts. Workshops and jam sessions create an intensely communal atmosphere.

name: Koedo Kawagoe (Little Edo) Spring Festival
desc: Cherry blossoms along the historic kurazukuri warehouse district of 'Little Edo' Kawagoe.
details: Kawagoe's preserved kurazukuri (clay-walled warehouse) district—known as 'Little Edo'—is particularly atmospheric during cherry blossom season. The combination of Edo-period architecture, the iconic Toki no Kane bell tower, and sakura creates a journey back to feudal Japan just 30 minutes from central Tokyo.

name: Kenting Spring Scream
desc: Taiwan's legendary indie music festival on the tropical southern tip of the island.
details: Spring Scream is Taiwan's oldest and most iconic indie music festival, held in the tropical beach town of Kenting at the southern tip of the island. Hundreds of bands perform across multiple stages in a relaxed beach setting. The festival launched Taiwan's independent music scene and continues to showcase emerging artists from across Asia.

name: Ice Festival (Blue Pearl)
desc: Winter celebration on frozen Lake Khovsgol featuring ice sculptures, shamanic ceremonies, and traditional games.
details: The Ice Festival celebrates Lake Khovsgol, Mongolia's largest freshwater body containing 70% of the country's freshwater. Activities include horse-drawn sleigh rides on frozen lake ice, elaborate ice sculptures, ice sumo wrestling, tug of war on ice, ice ger building competitions, dog sledding, and shamanic fire-burning ceremonies. Participants dress in colorful traditional costumes representing Mongolia's 21 aimags.

name: Rwanda Liberation Day
desc: National celebration of the end of the 1994 genocide with military parades and cultural events.
details: Rwanda Liberation Day commemorates the RPF's victory that ended the 1994 genocide. Events include military parades, Intore traditional dancing, cultural performances, and reflections on Rwanda's remarkable transformation from tragedy to one of Africa's success stories.

name: Danjiri Festival (岸和田)
desc: Death-defying festival with 4-ton wooden floats raced through narrow streets at high speed.
details: At Kishiwada Danjiri, teams of young men race elaborately carved wooden floats weighing 4 tons through narrow streets. The yarimawashi—high-speed turns at intersections—is the festival's most dangerous and thrilling moment. Carpenters dance acrobatically atop the speeding floats.

name: Kobe Luminarie
desc: Spectacular Italian-designed light festival commemorating the 1995 Great Hanshin Earthquake.
details: Kobe Luminarie was created to memorialize victims and celebrate recovery from the 1995 Kobe earthquake. Italian designers create elaborate arched galleries of light stretching hundreds of meters through downtown Kobe. The millions of LED lights form cathedral-like tunnels and a grand finale piazza. Free to attend but drawing millions of visitors.

name: Yosakoi Festival
desc: Energetic dance festival where 200+ teams perform high-energy choreography with naruko clappers.
details: The Yosakoi Festival features over 200 teams of dancers performing energetic, creative choreography while holding naruko (wooden clappers). Teams wear colorful costumes and perform on decorated trucks moving through the city. The festival blends traditional and modern dance styles, with some teams doing everything from traditional Japanese to hip-hop fused routines.

name: Kameido Tenjin Wisteria Festival
desc: Beautiful wisteria arbors reflected in the shrine pond with Skytree in the background.
details: Kameido Tenjin Shrine's wisteria festival features cascading purple blooms reflected in the heart-shaped pond, with Tokyo Skytree visible in the background. The combination of traditional beauty and modern architecture creates a quintessentially Tokyo scene.

name: Kuwait National Day
desc: National day celebrating Kuwait's independence with fireworks, parades, and festivities.
details: Major celebrations at Kuwait Towers and Gulf Road with fireworks, light shows, traditional performances, and community events.

name: Autumn Foliage (Kyoto Koyo)
desc: Kyoto's temples blaze with red and gold autumn maples in Japan's most celebrated koyo season.
details: Kyoto's autumn foliage is Japan's most celebrated, with hundreds of temples and gardens ablaze in red, orange, and gold. Top spots include Tofukuji, Eikando, Kiyomizu-dera, and Arashiyama. Special night illuminations at Kitano Tenmangu and Kodaiji create magical scenes.

name: Kyoto Hanatoro (Flower Path Illumination)
desc: Magical pathway illuminations through Kyoto's most iconic temple districts.
details: Kyoto Hanatoro lights thousands of lanterns along pathways through two of Kyoto's most atmospheric districts. The Higashiyama edition (March) illuminates the path from Shoren-in to Kiyomizu-dera. The Arashiyama edition (December) lights up the famous bamboo grove and temple paths. The warm lantern light transforms already beautiful landscapes into magical scenes.

name: Kyzyl-Tuu Yurt Festival
desc: Yurt-building races and traditional crafts in the village famous for producing Kyrgyzstan's best yurts.
details: Celebration in the village famous for producing the best yurts in Kyrgyzstan. Features yurt-building races, weaving workshops, wood carving demonstrations, traditional Kyrgyz horse games, and Manas Epic recitation by professional Manaschy.

name: Lamu Cultural Festival
desc: Celebration of Swahili culture on the UNESCO-listed island of Lamu with dhow races and donkey races.
details: The Lamu Cultural Festival celebrates the rich Swahili heritage of this UNESCO World Heritage island. Events include traditional dhow sailing races, donkey races, henna painting, Swahili poetry readings, traditional cooking competitions, and Taarab music performances.

name: End of the Road Festival
desc: Intimate boutique festival for lovers of folk, indie, and alternative music.
details: End of the Road in the magical Larmer Tree Gardens features impeccable curation of folk, indie, and leftfield music alongside a 24-hour comedy tent and peacock garden.

name: Kuomboka Ceremony
desc: Spectacular royal procession of the Lozi king by royal barge from flood plains to higher ground.
details: The Kuomboka is one of Africa's most spectacular royal ceremonies. The Litunga (Lozi King) travels by magnificent royal barge from his palace at Lealui on the Barotse floodplain to his dry-season palace at Limulunga, accompanied by paddlers in traditional dress and thousands of subjects.

name: Festival de Cine de Lima (Lima Film Festival)
desc: Peru's main film event and one of Latin America's most important film festivals celebrating regional cinema with diverse international and Latin American productions.
details: Organized by the Cultural Centre of the Catholic University of Peru, the festival showcases important films during mid-August. It serves as a noted festival for regional cinema in Latin America, with additional 2026 film events including Lima Alterna (7th edition, October 10-17), LimaDocs Documentary Film Festival (May 14-23), Inca Imperial International Film Festival (May 12-15), and Al Este International Film Festival (June 19-28). These festivals collectively showcase the diversity of Peru's film culture.

name: Marsabit Lake Turkana Cultural Festival
desc: Cultural festival bringing together 14 tribal communities of Kenya's northern frontier.
details: The Marsabit-Lake Turkana Cultural Festival unites 14 distinct ethnic communities from Kenya's remote north for cultural exchanges. Each group showcases its traditions through dance, music, crafts, and ceremonies, promoting peace through cultural understanding.

name: Olvera Street Blessing of the Animals
desc: Traditional blessing of animals on LA's historic Olvera Street, the oldest street in Los Angeles.
details: Every year before Easter, thousands bring their pets to Olvera Street - the birthplace of Los Angeles - for a traditional blessing by a Catholic priest. The event also features music, food, and cultural performances on this historic Mexican-American marketplace street.

name: Macau Light Festival
desc: Spectacular light projections on Macau's UNESCO World Heritage Portuguese colonial buildings.
details: The Macau Light Festival projects spectacular animated light shows onto the facades of UNESCO-listed Portuguese colonial buildings throughout the historic center. The contrast of cutting-edge projection mapping on 400-year-old churches and fortresses creates a unique visual experience that celebrates Macau's cultural fusion.

name: Waisak (Vesak) at Borobudur
desc: A breathtaking candlelit procession at the world's largest Buddhist temple under the full moon.
details: On Vesak, the massive 9th-century Borobudur temple becomes the spiritual heart of Indonesian Buddhism. Thousands of monks and devotees carry candles in a solemn procession up the temple's terraces as the full moon rises. The combination of the ancient monument, flickering candlelight, and Buddhist chanting creates one of Southeast Asia's most transcendent experiences.

name: Mainz Carnival
desc: One of Germany's three great carnival celebrations with a famous Rose Monday parade.
details: Mainz Carnival is known for its sharp political satire at the Sitzungen (sessions) and the Rose Monday parade with elaborate floats lampooning politicians.

name: Feria de Málaga (cont)
desc: Málaga's great summer fair celebrating the reconquest with music, dance, and food.
details: The Feria de Málaga features daytime celebrations in the historic centre with flamenco and tapas, and nighttime festivities at the fairground with casetas, rides, and live music.

name: WOMAD
desc: World music festival founded by Peter Gabriel celebrating global music traditions.
details: WOMAD (World of Music, Arts and Dance) in Charlton Park brings musicians from every continent for four days of world music, dance workshops, and global food.

name: Lesotho Independence Day
desc: National celebrations featuring traditional Basotho blanket-wearing warriors and horseback displays.
details: Lesotho's Independence Day features colorful celebrations including traditional Basotho warriors draped in the iconic Basotho blanket, horseback displays, traditional Famo music, and cultural performances. The mountain kingdom's unique identity is celebrated with pride.

name: Festa della Madonna Bruna
desc: Matera's spectacular festival climaxing with the destruction of the processional float.
details: The Madonna Bruna procession through Matera's ancient sassi ends with the crowd destroying the elaborately decorated papier-mâché float (lo strazzo) to claim lucky fragments.

name: Matsumoto Taiko Festival
desc: Powerful taiko drumming festival in the shadow of the beautiful black Matsumoto Castle.
details: The Matsumoto Taiko Festival brings together drum groups from across Japan to perform powerful taiko concerts against the backdrop of Matsumoto Castle—one of Japan's most beautiful original castles. The thunderous rhythms echoing off the castle walls create a uniquely atmospheric concert experience.

name: Meguro River Cherry Blossoms
desc: 800 cherry trees form a stunning pink tunnel over the Meguro River in central Tokyo.
details: The Meguro River is one of Tokyo's most photogenic cherry blossom spots. Approximately 800 trees form a canopy over the narrow river, and fallen petals create a pink carpet on the water surface (hanaikada). The area features trendy cafes and shops, and evening illuminations transform it into a romantic destination.

name: Melbourne International Arts Festival (Rising)
desc: Melbourne's flagship arts festival presenting contemporary performance, visual art, music, and film.
details: Rising (formerly Melbourne International Arts Festival) transforms the city each winter with a bold program of contemporary art, music, performance, and film. International and local artists present world premieres and ambitious works across the city's iconic venues and unexpected spaces.

name: Melbourne Writers Festival
desc: Major literary festival bringing international and Australian writers together for ideas and conversation.
details: Melbourne Writers Festival presents conversations, readings, and workshops with leading Australian and international authors. Events span fiction, non-fiction, poetry, graphic novels, and emerging literary forms across venues throughout the city.

name: Fiestas del Sol
desc: Northwestern Mexico's largest fair celebrating regional culture with top artist lineups, amusement park, and gastronomic experiences.
details: Most important fair in Baja California bringing together impressive lineup of Mexican and Latin American artists. Features VIP Palenque, free Teatro del Pueblo, new Templo Mayor, complete amusement park, gastronomic pavilion with Mexican street food and Baja California seafood specialties. Celebrates Mexicali's culture and desert traditions.

name: Desfile de Alebrijes (alebrije Parade)
desc: Spectacular parade featuring giant handcrafted spirit animal sculptures from Mexican artisans, preceding Day of the Dead.
details: Route begins at Zócalo at noon, proceeding through 5 de Mayo, Juárez, and Paseo de la Reforma to the Angel of Independence roundabout. Features alebrijes created by artisans from Guerrero, Estado de México, Morelos, Guanajuato, Jalisco, Tlaxcala, Hidalgo, and Mexico City. Includes batucadas (Brazilian-style percussion), gymnastic performances, and spectacular color. Post-parade, alebrijes remain on display for two weeks on Paseo de la Reforma sidewalks between Angel of Independence and Estela de Luz roundabouts.

name: Hakka Tung Blossom Festival
desc: Celebration of the Hakka people's culture timed with the beautiful tung oil tree blossoms creating 'April Snow.'
details: The Hakka Tung Blossom Festival celebrates the unique culture of Taiwan's Hakka people when tung oil trees bloom, creating a 'snow' effect as white petals blanket the ground. Events across Hakka communities in Miaoli, Hsinchu, and Taoyuan feature traditional Hakka cuisine, tea ceremonies, folk music, and mountain trail walks through the blossoming trees.

name: Soma Nomaoi Kacchu Keiba (Armored Horse Race)
desc: 400 samurai-armored horsemen thunder across a field chasing flags launched by fireworks shells.
details: The Kacchu Keiba armored horse race at Soma Nomaoi sees 400 horsemen in full samurai armor racing across a field to catch sacred flags shot into the sky by firework shells. The ancient spectacle dates back over 1,000 years to military training exercises. It survived even the Fukushima disaster and remains one of Japan's most stirring festivals.

name: Roppongi Art Night
desc: All-night art festival transforming Tokyo's Roppongi district into an open-air museum until dawn.
details: Roppongi Art Night is Tokyo's premier contemporary art event, transforming the Roppongi district into an open-air gallery from dusk to dawn. Installations, performances, music, and film screenings take place across museums (Mori Art Museum, National Art Center), parks, and streets. The event encourages visitors to experience art throughout the night in one of Tokyo's most cosmopolitan districts.

name: Mito Plum Blossom Festival
desc: 3,000 plum trees bloom at Kairakuen, one of Japan's three great gardens.
details: Kairakuen Garden in Mito hosts one of Japan's premier ume (plum blossom) festivals. Over 3,000 plum trees of 100 varieties create a fragrant, colorful display. Tea ceremonies, traditional music, and night illuminations complement the natural beauty.

name: Mito Komon Festival
desc: Three-day festival honoring the legendary lord Mito Komon with parades, dances, and fireworks.
details: Mito's main summer festival honors the historical Tokugawa lord Mito Komon, famous in Japanese pop culture. Features include a 1,000-person dance parade, float processions, fireworks, and performances at Kairakuen garden—one of Japan's three great gardens famous for plum blossoms.

name: Mombasa Old Town Heritage Walk
desc: Guided cultural walks through the historic Swahili Old Town with its carved doors and ancient mosques.
details: Mombasa's Old Town heritage walks take visitors through narrow streets lined with ornately carved wooden doors, ancient mosques, and Portuguese-era Fort Jesus (UNESCO World Heritage Site). The walks showcase centuries of Swahili, Arab, Portuguese, and Indian cultural heritage.

name: Tohoku Kizuna Festival
desc: Six major Tohoku festivals unite in a single spectacular parade celebrating the spirit of recovery.
details: The Tohoku Kizuna Festival brings together elements of all six major Tohoku summer festivals—Nebuta, Kanto, Sansa Odori, Hanagasa, Tanabata, and Waraji—in a single collaborative parade. Created to honor those lost in the 2011 Great East Japan Earthquake, it rotates annually among the six Tohoku prefectural capitals. In 2026, it will be held in Morioka, Iwate.

name: Moussem Moulay Abdellah Amghar
desc: A colorful religious moussem on the Atlantic coast with boat processions, fantasia horseback shows, and spiritual celebrations.
details: This religious and cultural celebration near El Jadida includes a beautiful procession of colorfully decorated boats, traditional fantasia horseback performances, and music tied to local spiritual traditions. Less known to tourists, it offers an intimate way to experience Moroccan devotion and folklore near the coast.

name: Muju Firefly Festival
desc: Enchanting eco-festival celebrating the fireflies of Muju's pristine streams in the mountains.
details: The Muju Firefly Festival celebrates the habitat of Geumsan fireflies in the clean mountain streams of Muju. Evening firefly observation walks, environmental education programs, and traditional rural culture experiences make it Korea's premier eco-festival. The ethereal sight of thousands of fireflies blinking along dark stream banks is magical.

name: Fasching Munich
desc: Munich's carnival season with the famous Marktweiber (market women) dance.
details: Munich's Fasching centres on the famous dance of the Marktweiber at Viktualienmarkt on Shrove Tuesday, plus costume balls, parades, and street celebrations.

name: Muscat Festival
desc: Major cultural festival celebrating Omani heritage with exhibitions, performances, and family entertainment.
details: Month-long festival at Qurum Natural Park and other venues featuring Omani cultural displays, international performances, food villages, heritage activities, and children's entertainment.

name: Nagoya Matsuri
desc: Grand parade celebrating Nagoya's three great historical heroes with costumed warriors and floats.
details: The Nagoya Matsuri features a grand procession recreating the era of the Three Great Unifiers—Oda Nobunaga, Toyotomi Hideyoshi, and Tokugawa Ieyasu—who all originated from the Nagoya area. Over 700 costumed participants march through the city. Nine floats designated as Aichi Cultural Properties are also displayed.

name: Kenya Jamhuri Day
desc: Kenya's Republic Day celebrating full independence with parades and cultural performances.
details: Jamhuri Day marks the day Kenya became a republic in 1964. Celebrations at Nyayo Stadium include military displays, traditional dances from Kenya's 40+ ethnic groups, athletic demonstrations, and patriotic speeches.

name: Safari Rally Kenya
desc: Legendary World Rally Championship round considered the toughest rally in the world since 1953.
details: The Safari Rally Kenya is part of the FIA World Rally Championship and has been running since 1953. Known as the toughest round of the WRC, it challenges drivers across diverse Kenyan terrain from the Great Rift Valley to Lake Naivasha. It attracts global motorsport fans and media.

name: Namangan International Flower Festival
desc: One of Asia's longest-running flower festivals with a 200+ vehicle flower-decorated parade.
details: 64th edition of one of Asia's longest-running flower festivals. Opens with colorful parade of 200+ flower-decorated vehicles traveling from airport to Babur Park. Features floral exhibitions, live demonstrations, music performances, cultural shows, and master classes.

name: La Folle Journée
desc: Classical music marathon with 300+ affordable concerts in five days.
details: La Folle Journée presents 300+ classical concerts at the Cité des Congrès, each lasting 45 minutes with affordable tickets, making classical music accessible to all.

name: Nantou Tea Expo
desc: Major tea exhibition in the homeland of Taiwan's world-famous oolong teas.
details: Nantou County, home to Sun Moon Lake and the source of Taiwan's finest oolong teas, hosts an annual tea expo. Tea plantations, competitions, ceremonies, and tastings showcase varieties including Dong Ding, Alishan, and Sun Moon Lake black tea. The mountainous tea-growing landscape provides stunning scenery.

name: Junkanoo (Boxing Day and New Year's)
desc: Bi-annual celebration of sights and sounds on Bay Street with elaborately costumed participants, parades, and distinctive Caribbean culture.
details: This bi-annual cultural highlight takes place on Bay Street in New Providence and other Family Islands during early morning hours, 1:00 a.m. - 9:00 a.m. on Boxing Day (day after Christmas) and New Year's Morning. The 2026 Pineyard Rush Senior Junkanoo Parade on Grand Bahama takes place Friday, January 9, 2026, along Explorer's Way. Junkanoo is also celebrated on Independence Day, Junkanoo Summer Fest (July), and other small holidays throughout the year. Anyone can participate so long as they abide by the National Junkanoo Association rules. Visitors can make arrangements through their hotel to join the festival.

name: Midburn (Israeli Burning Man)
desc: Israel's version of Burning Man in the Negev Desert with art installations and radical self-expression.
details: Five-day desert festival featuring art installations, music, participatory events, and community building based on Burning Man principles.

name: Festival del Bambuco
desc: 65th edition celebrating San Juan and San Pedro with traditional bambuco dance, floats, and cultural activities in Huila highlands.
details: June 12 marks 90th anniversary of first Sanjuanero Huilense dance presentation in Gigante. Invites cultural organizers in dance, floats, rajaleñas, traditional bambuco, trios, and duets. Float themes for 2026: "Characters of San Juan and San Pedro" (Popular parade) and "Practices and knowledge around San Juan and San Pedro" (Night parade). Budget of 4,000 million pesos with additional funding sought from national entities. Celebrates indigenous and colonial heritage through dance.

name: Southside Festival
desc: Major southern German rock and pop festival, twin to Hurricane.
details: Southside mirrors Hurricane Festival's lineup in southern Germany, drawing 60,000+ fans for three days of diverse contemporary music.

name: Autumn Foliage
desc: Brilliant autumn colors surrounding the ornate Toshogu shrine complex and the dramatic Kegon Falls.
details: Nikko's autumn foliage is among Japan's most stunning, with the ornate Toshogu shrine complex framed by brilliant reds and golds. The winding Irohazaka road, Lake Chuzenji, and Kegon Falls offer spectacular mountain autumn scenery. The combination of elaborate architecture and natural color is unmatched.

name: Nonsan Strawberry Festival
desc: Celebration of Korea's strawberry capital with picking, tastings, and strawberry-themed activities.
details: Nonsan produces a significant portion of Korea's strawberries, and its festival celebrates the spring harvest with strawberry picking, jam-making workshops, dessert tastings, and family activities. The festival captures Korea's love of seasonal food celebrations.

name: Shambala Festival
desc: Car-free, meat-free festival championing sustainability and community.
details: Shambala bans cars and meat, running entirely on renewable energy. It combines eclectic music with workshops on sustainability, wellbeing, and social change.

name: Kundum Festival
desc: Harvest festival of the Nzema and Ahanta people with elaborate masquerades and feasting.
details: The Kundum Festival is a harvest celebration of the Nzema and Ahanta people of Ghana's Western Region. It features elaborate masquerade performances, traditional music and dance, feasting, and purification rituals to drive away evil spirits.

name: Ohrid Summer Festival
desc: Classical music, theatre, and folklore against the UNESCO World Heritage backdrop of Lake Ohrid.
details: The Ohrid Summer Festival presents performances in the ancient theatre and lakeside venues of this UNESCO site, blending classical music, contemporary theatre, and traditional folklore.

name: Okayama Momotaro Festival
desc: Festival celebrating the legend of Momotaro (Peach Boy) with parades and traditional dances.
details: Okayama's Momotaro Festival celebrates the city's most famous folk tale—the story of Momotaro, the boy born from a peach who defeated demons. The Uraja dance parade features 6,000+ dancers in demon-inspired costumes and makeup performing through the streets.

name: Okinawa Eisa Festival
desc: High-energy Okinawan drum dance festival showcasing the islands' unique Ryukyu cultural heritage.
details: The All-Okinawa Eisa Festival features energetic group dance performances with taiko drums during Obon season. Eisa is Okinawa's distinctive folk dance tradition combining Ryukyu kingdom heritage with Buddhist Obon customs. Teams in colorful costumes perform synchronized routines to sanshin music.

name: Red Earth Festival
desc: Premier celebration of Native American arts and culture featuring artists from over 100 tribes.
details: Red Earth is one of the most visually stunning Native American cultural festivals, featuring traditional dance competitions, fine art exhibitions, and a spectacular grand parade through downtown Oklahoma City. Artists from over 100 tribal nations participate, showcasing traditional and contemporary Native art.

name: Frozen People Festival
desc: International winter festival of electronic music and northern art on the frozen sea, part of Oulu2026.
details: This extraordinary festival takes place on the shores of the frozen Baltic Sea. Three stages host Finnish and international electronic music artists in unique Arctic surroundings, creating what may be the coolest dance party in the world. Part of the Oulu2026 European Capital of Culture programme, it also features art installations on the ice.

name: Festival de Inverno de Ouro Preto
desc: Winter festival celebrating popular culture with theater, music, dance, and cultural programming in historic mining town.
details: The Festival de Inverno transforms Ouro Preto's colonial streets into venues for performances. The festival typically runs for 28 days in July with theme celebrating popular culture. While specific 2026 dates have not been officially announced in public sources accessed, the festival traditionally occurs in July. Check official Prefeitura de Ouro Preto or UFOP websites for confirmed 2026 dates and programming details.

name: Ofunehiki (Grand Ship Festival)
desc: Fishing town tradition where a massive decorative ship is pulled through the streets.
details: The Ofunehiki Festival in Owase features an enormous decorative wooden ship float pulled through the narrow streets of this fishing town on the Kumano coast. The tradition celebrates maritime heritage and safe fishing. The major full-scale version occurs every four years.

name: Heiva i Tahiti
desc: Tahiti's spectacular month-long celebration of Polynesian culture with competitive traditional dance and music.
details: Heiva i Tahiti is the most important cultural event in French Polynesia, running for the entire month of July. Professional dance troupes compete in breathtaking ori Tahiti performances, musicians play traditional instruments, and athletes compete in traditional sports like stone-lifting, javelin-throwing, and outrigger canoe racing.

name: Semana de la Cerveza
desc: Large riverfront festival mixing concerts, fairgrounds and local beer culture.

name: Perth Festival
desc: Western Australia's premier international arts festival spanning theatre, music, dance, film, and visual art.
details: Perth Festival is one of the oldest arts festivals in the Southern Hemisphere, presenting a world-class program of international and Australian art across three weeks. The Lotterywest Festival Films outdoor cinema and spectacular events at venues across the city and surrounds are highlights.

name: Khmer New Year (Choul Chnam Thmey)
desc: Traditional New Year celebrations with temple visits, games, and community festivities.

name: The Enchanted Forest
desc: Scotland's pioneering sound and light show set in Faskally Wood, celebrating its 25th anniversary in 2026.
details: This award-winning show transforms the woodland around Loch Dunmore with immersive light installations, original music, and projections. The experience takes visitors on a walking trail through illuminated forests. Over 800,000 people have visited across two decades. Shows sell out quickly and advance booking is essential.

name: Festival de Jazz de la Riviera Maya
desc: Free beachfront jazz festival on the Caribbean coast featuring international jazz artists.
details: The Riviera Maya Jazz Festival presents world-class jazz artists on a beachfront stage with the turquoise Caribbean Sea as a backdrop. This free festival brings internationally renowned musicians to the paradisiacal setting of Playa del Carmen.

name: Kanaval national (core days)
desc: Carnival with floats, music, costumes, and street performance.

name: Afro Nation
desc: The world's biggest Afrobeats festival, set on the stunning beaches of the Algarve.
details: Riding the massive global explosion of African music, Afro Nation brings the biggest stars of Afrobeats, Amapiano, dancehall, and R&B to Europe, creating an unparalleled, joyous celebration of Black diasporic culture.

name: Portland Rose Festival
desc: Portland's signature celebration featuring the Grand Floral Parade, dragon boat races, and citywide events.
details: One of the oldest continuous festivals in the Pacific Northwest, the Rose Festival includes the spectacular Grand Floral Parade (the second-largest all-floral parade in the US), CityFair on the waterfront, dragon boat races, a starlight parade, and the crowning of the Rose Festival Queen. The festival celebrates Portland's identity as the City of Roses.

name: Voortrekker Monument Heritage Festival
desc: Day of Reconciliation celebrations at the Voortrekker Monument with cultural events.
details: December 16 (Day of Reconciliation) features events at the Voortrekker Monument and Freedom Park in Pretoria, reflecting on South Africa's complex history. Cultural performances, memorial services, and community activities promote national reconciliation.

name: Cinco de Mayo
desc: The authentic Cinco de Mayo celebration in Puebla commemorating the 1862 Battle of Puebla.
details: The authentic celebration in Puebla commemorating the Mexican army's 1862 victory over French forces. Military reenactments at the Loreto and Guadalupe forts, parades, cultural events, and fireworks. Puebla's colonial architecture and famous cuisine (mole poblano) add to the experience.

name: Carnevale di Putignano
desc: One of Europe's longest carnivals with elaborate float parades.
details: Putignano's carnival, running since 1394, features spectacular papier-mâché floats on wheeled platforms, traditional mask dances, and the unique Farinella character.

name: Pyeongchang Trout Festival
desc: Winter ice-fishing festival in the former Winter Olympics host city surrounded by mountains.
details: Pyeongchang, host of the 2018 Winter Olympics, celebrates winter with a trout ice-fishing festival. Visitors can fish through the ice, enjoy fresh grilled trout, and participate in snow activities. The mountain setting and Olympic legacy facilities add to the experience.

name: Quanzhou Maritime Silk Road Festival
desc: Cultural festival at the UNESCO-listed starting point of the Maritime Silk Road.
details: Quanzhou—the UNESCO-listed starting point of the Maritime Silk Road—celebrates its multicultural trading heritage with a festival featuring Nanyin (Southern Chinese) music performances, puppet shows, religious ceremonies at temples of multiple faiths, and trade exhibitions. The city's unique blend of Chinese, Arab, and Southeast Asian influences is on full display.

name: Queenstown Winter Festival
desc: The Southern Hemisphere's premier winter festival with wild street parties, comedy, and mountain madness.
details: The Queenstown Winter Festival is a 10-day celebration welcoming winter with fireworks, street parties, mountain events, comedy, live music, and family activities. The stunning alpine scenery provides a dramatic backdrop for one of the Southern Hemisphere's most vibrant winter celebrations.

name: Festival San Pancho Music Festival
desc: Three-day free music festival in Riviera Nayarit featuring jazz, funk, reggae, and beach activities.
details: Free festival in Riviera Nayarit offering 3 days of diverse music genres including jazz, funk, and reggae. Casual beach atmosphere with multiple stages and performers. Family-friendly with activities and food. Pacific coast setting provides scenic backdrop.

name: Arkana Festival (Music & Andean-Amazonian Culture)
desc: An innovative music and Andean-Amazonian culture festival in the Sacred Valley featuring lineups, workshops, and cultural experiences blending indigenous traditions with contemporary sounds.
details: Arkana Festival represents a modern approach to celebrating Peru's indigenous heritage, combining music performances with cultural workshops and experiences. The festival brings together Andean and Amazonian cultural elements in the breathtaking Sacred Valley setting, creating a unique experience that honors traditional music while exploring contemporary expressions. The event features international and local performers and offers workshops on indigenous instruments, traditional dances, and cultural practices.

name: Sado Earth Celebration
desc: Intimate global music festival by the legendary Kodo taiko ensemble on remote Sado Island.
details: Earth Celebration on Sado Island brings together Kodo's world-class taiko performances with international guest artists in an intimate island setting. Workshops, beach concerts, and collaborative performances create a deeply immersive music experience surrounded by sea.

name: St. Paul Winter Carnival
desc: One of the nation's oldest winter festivals featuring ice palaces, parades, and winter sports.
details: The St. Paul Winter Carnival dates to 1886 and features ice and snow sculpture competitions, winter sports events, medallion treasure hunts, parades, and the construction of an ice palace. The carnival's King Boreas and Queen of Snows reign over the festivities.

name: Réunion Abolition of Slavery Day
desc: Commemoration of slavery abolition on Reunion Island with traditional maloya music and dance.
details: December 20 marks the abolition of slavery on Reunion Island (Fête Kaf). Celebrations feature maloya music and dance (UNESCO Intangible Heritage), which was performed secretly by enslaved people. It is a deeply meaningful cultural and historical commemoration.

name: Mikuni Matsuri
desc: Vibrant coastal festival with giant warrior floats paraded through a charming fishing town.
details: Mikuni Matsuri features enormous yamabushi warrior floats (some over 6 meters tall) carried through the narrow streets of this historic port town. The festival includes performances of Mikuni Bayashi festival music, dances, and processions to the local shrine. The combination of the coastal setting and giant warrior figures creates a distinctly dramatic atmosphere.

name: Electric Love Festival
desc: Major Austrian electronic festival with 200+ artists across 7 stages.
details: Electric Love near Salzburg presents 200+ EDM, techno, and bass artists across seven elaborately designed stages over three days of camping and dance.

name: Feria de San Cristobal de las Casas
desc: Highland Chiapas fair combining Tzotzil Maya traditions with colonial Spanish heritage.
details: San Cristobal's annual fair reflects the unique cultural blend of this highland city, with Tzotzil and Tzeltal Maya cultural events, traditional amber and textile markets, colonial-era religious processions, live music, and food celebrating both indigenous and Spanish traditions.

name: Superfine San Francisco
desc: An artist-driven fair heavily focused on market accessibility.
details: Hosted at Fort Mason Pier 2, drawing over 8,000 patrons to a sold-out exhibitor floor, providing direct sales opportunities for independent creators outside gallery structures.

name: Saborea Puerto Rico (Food Festival)
desc: The "best party for foodies" in the Caribbean showcasing local chefs and traditional/contemporary Puerto Rican cuisine.
details: A vibrant culinary festival in picturesque San Juan, this foodie's paradise showcases local chefs and a mix of traditional and contemporary Puerto Rican cuisine. Taste dishes from top local and international chefs paired with plenty of Puerto Rican rum. The festival features live music ranging from salsa to reggaeton, attracting lively crowds of locals and tourists. Includes cooking demonstrations and hands-on workshops from professional chefs teaching real techniques like mofongo assembly, sofrito tricks, and seafood preparation. Festival spans multiple venues across San Juan designed for food enthusiasts.

name: San Miguel de Allende Patron Saint Festival
desc: Patron saint celebration featuring the spectacular Pamplonada (running of the bulls) and fireworks castillos.
details: San Miguel de Allende's patron saint festival features a dramatic dawn Pamplonada (running of the bulls) through the cobblestone colonial streets, followed by religious processions, traditional music, elaborate fireworks castillos, and community celebrations.

name: Costa Maya Festival (Belize)
desc: Multi-day festival bringing together performers from Belize and neighboring countries for music, dance, and cultural presentations.
details: Takes place in San Pedro during August, featuring performances from Belize and neighboring countries celebrating regional cultural heritage through music, dance, and artistic performances.

name: Sancheong Herbal Medicine Festival
desc: Celebration of traditional Korean herbal medicine in the mountain valleys of Jirisan.
details: Sancheong at the foot of Jirisan Mountain has been Korea's herbal medicine center for centuries. The festival features traditional medicine experiences, mountain herb tastings, Hanyak (Korean medicine) consultations, foot baths, and walks through the mountain valleys where herbs are gathered. A unique wellness-focused festival.

name: Festival Música Barroca Chiquitos (Baroque Music Festival)
desc: World's largest event of its kind featuring 1,300 musicians from 16 countries performing 13th-18th century music written by Jesuit missionaries and native Chiquitanos in 132 simultaneous concerts across 27 venues.
details: The XV edition features 132 concerts simultaneously in 27 venues distributed across Santa Cruz de la Sierra, mission towns, Tarija, and Sucre. Artists from 16 countries (Belgium, Canada, Colombia, Korea, Spain, USA, France, Italy, Japan, Poland, UK, Switzerland) participate with 300 international and 1,000 national musicians. Estimated attendance reaches 50,000 at concerts and parallel activities. Over 1,000 musicians worldwide perform music from colonial Latin America, deemed the most important cultural event in Bolivia. APAC (Asociación Pro Arte y Cultura) successfully carries out this biennial festival since 1996.

name: Vendimia Regional Chile - Various
desc: National wine harvest celebration with 40+ regional events celebrating Chile's 15 wine valleys.
details: Vendimia Colchagua (March 6-8, Santa Cruz Plaza de Armas), Vendimia Peralillo (March 14-15), Vendimia Curicó (March 20-22, Parque La Granja). Regional celebrations highlight identity of wine valleys. Tren del Vino (wine train) through Aconcagua Valley. Pisco celebrations in Atacama and Coquimbo. Enoturismo Chile provides Mapa de Vendimias tool for consulting dates, locations, and programming. Develops from north to south throughout season.

name: Sante Fe Spanish Market
desc: The oldest and largest juried market of traditional Hispanic art in the US, on the historic Santa Fe Plaza.
details: Spanish Market showcases traditional Spanish Colonial art forms including santos (religious carvings), retablos, weaving, tinwork, ironwork, and straw appliqué. Over 200 artists display their work on the Santa Fe Plaza and in the New Mexico History Museum, preserving centuries-old artistic traditions brought by Spanish colonists.

name: Primavera Sound Santiago
desc: Latin American edition of prestigious Barcelona Primavera Sound festival with indie and alternative artists.
details: Expanding Latin American presence with both Buenos Aires and Santiago editions in 2026. Expected to feature curated indie/alternative international lineup. Based on Barcelona's successful format. Specific venue, lineup, and dates to be announced.

name: Merengue and Caribbean Rhythms Festival
desc: A celebration of Caribbean music and rhythm on Santo Domingo's promenade featuring reggaeton, merengue, bachata, reggae, and more.
details: The festival showcases a mix of traditional and contemporary Caribbean music and dance styles, celebrating Dominican and regional musical heritage through performances and street celebrations.

name: Primavera Sound São Paulo
desc: São Paulo edition of Primavera Sound bringing world-class indie and alternative programming to Brazil.
details: Returns as part of the Spanish festival's renewed commitment to Latin America. Follows Barcelona's legendary curation model blending international indie, electronic, and alternative artists with Brazil's vibrant scene. São Paulo's massive music market makes it an ideal host.

name: Winter Carnival
desc: One of the oldest winter carnivals in the eastern US, famous for its illuminated Ice Palace.
details: The Saranac Lake Winter Carnival features a spectacular illuminated Ice Palace built from blocks of ice cut from Lake Flower. The 10-day festival includes parades, live music, snow sports, skating, and community events in the heart of the Adirondack Mountains.

name: Hurricane Festival
desc: Twin festival to Southside with same lineup in northern Germany.
details: Hurricane is the northern twin to Southside Festival, sharing the same diverse lineup of rock, indie, electronic, and hip-hop artists.

name: Seoul International Fireworks Festival
desc: International pyrotechnics competition over the Han River drawing over a million spectators.
details: The Seoul International Fireworks Festival on Yeouido's Han River attracts over a million spectators. International teams compete with dazzling displays synchronized to music, reflected in the wide Han River. The urban riverside setting with Seoul's skyline creates a spectacular backdrop. It is one of Asia's most attended fireworks events.

name: Seoul Bamdokkaebi Night Market
desc: Famous Seoul night markets with food trucks, crafts, and performances at iconic locations.
details: Seoul's Bamdokkaebi (Ghost Goblin) Night Markets at Yeouido, DDP (Dongdaemun Design Plaza), and other locations feature food trucks, artisan crafts, live performances, and cultural events every weekend evening from spring to autumn. The DDP market at Zaha Hadid's iconic building is particularly atmospheric.

name: Seoul Drum Festival
desc: International percussion festival featuring drum traditions from Korea and around the world.
details: The Seoul Drum Festival brings together percussion artists from around the world alongside Korea's rich drumming traditions. Traditional samulnori, Buddhist temple drums, and contemporary fusion performances fill venues across Seoul. Interactive workshops allow visitors to try Korean drumming.

name: Shizuoka Festival
desc: Major festival honoring Tokugawa Ieyasu's legacy with a grand night cherry blossom parade.
details: The Shizuoka Matsuri celebrates Tokugawa Ieyasu, who spent his retirement in Shizuoka. The main event is the Yozakura Ren night parade where dance groups perform under illuminated cherry blossoms. A large-scale Ieyasu procession in samurai armor adds historical flavor.

name: Skagen Festival
desc: Denmark's oldest music festival in the picturesque northernmost town of Skagen, featuring folk, rock, and singer-songwriters.
details: Set in the charming and luminous town of Skagen at Denmark's northernmost tip, this festival features excellent Danish and international bands, songwriters, and troubadours across multiple venues. The combination of great music and Skagen's famous light has made this a beloved fixture since the 1970s.

name: Sokcho Red Crab Festival
desc: Coastal food festival celebrating the famous East Sea snow crabs in the fishing city of Sokcho.
details: The Sokcho Red Crab Festival celebrates the region's prized snow crabs during peak season. Visitors can buy fresh crabs at discount prices, watch crab-catching demonstrations, and enjoy crab dishes prepared by local restaurants. The East Sea coastal setting and proximity to Seoraksan National Park make it a popular autumn trip.

name: Taste of Stockholm
desc: Scandinavia's largest food festival with 30 top restaurants and 650,000 visitors.
details: Taste of Stockholm fills Kungsträdgården with outdoor stalls from the city's best restaurants, offering small plates, street food, and fine dining alongside cooking demonstrations.

name: St. Lucia Day
desc: Winter light tradition with candlelit Lucia processions, songs, saffron buns (lussekatter), and community gatherings.

name: Zanzibar Revolution Day
desc: Commemoration of the 1964 Zanzibar Revolution with parades and cultural displays.
details: January 12 marks the anniversary of the 1964 Zanzibar Revolution. The day features parades, speeches, cultural performances, and commemorative events in Stone Town and across the islands of Zanzibar.

name: Sumidagawa Fireworks (Two Launch Sites)
desc: Two simultaneous launch sites along the Sumida River creating a spectacular dual fireworks display.
details: The Sumidagawa festival is unique in having two launch sites. The First Site near Sakurabashi features the fireworks competition, while the Second Site near Komagatabashi emphasizes artistic displays. Together, over 20,000 fireworks are launched. Views from Tokyo Skytree's observation deck are particularly sought after.

name: Suzhou Garden Season
desc: Peak viewing season for Suzhou's UNESCO-listed classical gardens with cultural performances.
details: Suzhou's UNESCO-listed classical gardens—including the Humble Administrator's Garden and Lingering Garden—are at their most beautiful in spring. Special events include moonlit garden concerts, Kunqu opera performances, and silk culture exhibitions within the garden walls.

name: Suzhou Silk Festival
desc: Celebration of Suzhou's 4,000-year silk-weaving heritage with fashion shows, workshops, and garden events.
details: Suzhou has been China's silk capital for over 4,000 years, and its silk festival celebrates this heritage with fashion shows featuring silk garments, weaving demonstrations, silk art exhibitions, and events in the city's UNESCO-listed classical gardens. The festival combines traditional craftsmanship with contemporary fashion design.

name: Sydney Writers' Festival
desc: Australia's largest literary festival with hundreds of events featuring international and local authors.
details: Sydney Writers' Festival at Walsh Bay presents a week of conversations, readings, debates, and workshops with the world's leading authors and thinkers. Hundreds of events explore literature, ideas, and storytelling across free and ticketed sessions.

name: Taean Tulip Festival
desc: Massive tulip festival with millions of flowers along the scenic west coast.
details: Korea Flower Park in Taean hosts one of Asia's largest tulip festivals with millions of tulips in hundreds of varieties. The west coast seaside setting, combined with additional flower gardens, makes it a premier spring flower destination in Korea.

name: Cherokee National Holiday
desc: Annual celebration of Cherokee heritage, culture, and sovereignty at the Cherokee Nation capital.
details: Held in Tahlequah, the capital of the Cherokee Nation, this holiday celebrates Cherokee culture with traditional stickball games, a powwow, art shows, a parade, traditional food, language workshops, and the State of the Nation address by the Cherokee Principal Chief.

name: Reindeer Festival
desc: Winter festival celebrating the Tsaatan people, Mongolia's last indigenous reindeer herders in the taiga.
details: The Reindeer Festival celebrates the reindeer herding culture of the Tsaatan people, Mongolia's only remaining indigenous reindeer herders living in the taiga region. Features reindeer races through snow, traditional winter cultural performances, overnight stays with local herder families, and ice sculpture viewings. Combined 13-day tour packages (Feb 22 - Mar 6) include both Ice Festival and Reindeer Festival.

name: Tainan Arts Festival
desc: Contemporary arts festival in Taiwan's oldest and most culturally rich city.
details: Tainan, Taiwan's ancient capital and cultural heart, hosts an arts festival bringing contemporary performance, visual arts, and installation art to the city's historic temples, Japanese-era buildings, and modernist spaces. The juxtaposition of cutting-edge art with centuries-old architecture creates compelling dialogue.

name: Qazaq Kuresi Championships
desc: Traditional Kazakh wrestling championships, a UNESCO Intangible Cultural Heritage since 2016.
details: Traditional Kazakh stand-up wrestling competitions at various levels. UNESCO Intangible Cultural Heritage since 2016. Requires opponents' shoulders on ground. Weight-class competitions with 1,500+ junior athletes (age 12-14).

name: Tallinn Hanseatic Days
desc: Medieval market celebrating the Hanseatic trading heritage in Tallinn's UNESCO-listed Old Town.
details: Hundreds of merchants, craftspeople, and entertainers fill the streets of Tallinn's excellently preserved medieval Old Town. Unique items from across the Baltics, delicious local cuisine, and live demonstrations of medieval craftsmanship transform the city. The Hanseatic Days are fantastic for discovering traditional crafts and period entertainment.

name: Tallinn Old Town Days
desc: Annual celebration of Tallinn's medieval heritage with concerts, medieval markets, and performances in the UNESCO Old Town.
details: Tallinn Old Town Days celebrate the city's rich medieval history with concerts, markets, performances, and guided tours throughout the beautifully preserved UNESCO World Heritage Old Town. Traditional crafts, period costumes, and historical demonstrations bring the Hanseatic era to life.

name: Jazzkaar
desc: Estonia's premier jazz festival since 1990, known for original programming and broad musical lineup.
details: Jazzkaar has been an important component of Estonia's music scene since 1990. Mainly located in Telliskivi Creative City, the festival extends throughout Estonia with concerts in Otepää, Haapsalu, Tartu, and Viljandi. It brings together international legends and rising jazz stars.

name: Tamworth Country Music Festival
desc: Australia's largest country music festival spanning 10 days with 200+ events and Golden Guitar Awards.
details: The Tamworth Country Music Festival is held annually in January and is one of the top 10 music festivals in the world. Over 10 days, 200+ events take place across multiple venues, culminating in the Golden Guitar Awards. Street busking, workshops, and late-night jam sessions create an electric atmosphere throughout the city.

name: Moussem of Tan-Tan
desc: A UNESCO Masterpiece of Intangible Heritage gathering of 30+ nomadic Saharan tribes with camel races, poetry, and music.
details: Recognized by UNESCO, this moussem is a gathering of more than 30 nomadic tribes from across the Sahara region. It features camel races, fantasia horseback shows, poetry, traditional music, games, and artisanal crafts. The event celebrates nomadic heritage and offers a rare glimpse into a world seldom accessible through conventional travel.

name: Tanegashima Rocket Festival
desc: Festival on the island of Japan's main space center combining rocket culture with traditional dance.
details: Tanegashima, home to JAXA's space center, celebrates both its space heritage and traditional culture. The festival combines rocket-themed events and space center tours with the island's ancient teppo (gun) heritage and traditional iron-sand dancing. A uniquely futuristic-meets-ancient experience.

name: Fiesta Señor Santa Cruz (Tarija Regional)
desc: Regional festival honoring the Señor de la Santa Cruz (Holy Cross) in Tarija with religious processions and traditional celebrations.
details: This festival celebrates the Holy Cross, which is deeply rooted in Tarija's religious and cultural traditions. The celebration includes religious processions, traditional ceremonies, and community gatherings honoring this important religious symbol in the Tarija region.

name: Castells (Human Tower) Competitions
desc: UNESCO-listed tradition of building human towers up to 10 stories high.
details: Castells are breathtaking human towers built by colles (teams) reaching 10+ stories. The enxaneta (small child) climbs to the peak to complete the tower. UNESCO Intangible Heritage.

name: Day of Remembrance and Honor
desc: WWII commemoration honoring 450,000+ fallen Uzbek soldiers with ceremonies at Mustakillik Square.
details: Commemorates those who died in WWII (450,000+ Uzbeks lost). Observed with festive concerts, charity events, awards ceremonies, and visits to memorials and eternal flames. Tashkent's Walk of Fame features names of every fallen Uzbek carved on granite steles.

name: Constitution Day
desc: National holiday commemorating the 1992 constitution with outdoor celebrations and pop concerts.
details: Commemorates adoption of Uzbekistan's constitution on December 8, 1992. Streets decorated with flags; pop concerts, exhibitions, sporting events, and shows held in honor of patriotic holiday.

name: Eid al-Adha (Qurbon Hayiti)
desc: Most important Islamic holiday with family gatherings and traditional sheep sacrifice.
details: Most important Islamic holiday for Muslims in Uzbekistan. Celebrated with special prayers, family visits, gift exchanges, and animal sacrifice (traditionally sheep). Season of blessing lasting 3-4 days with emphasis on family gathering and religious observance.

name: Eid al-Fitr (Ramadan Khait)
desc: Islamic holiday at end of Ramadan overlapping with Navruz celebrations in 2026.
details: Celebrated at end of Ramadan with special morning prayer (Hayit Namaz), visits to loved ones' graves, and gift exchanges. In 2026, overlaps with Navruz celebrations, creating extended holiday period.

name: Centre for Contemporary Arts Tashkent Opening
desc: Uzbekistan's first permanent center for contemporary art opening with landmark 'Hikmah' exhibition.
details: Uzbekistan's first permanent center for contemporary art and research opening with landmark inaugural exhibition 'Hikmah' curated by Dr Sara Raza. Brings together exhibitions, public programs, research, and education exploring wisdom, spirit, and material transformation. Free admission.

name: Fiera Nacional de la Plata (silver Fair - Taxco)
desc: Celebration of Taxco's silversmith tradition featuring artisans, exhibitions, workshops, and sales of fine silverwork.
details: Taxco de Alarcón, colonial silver city, celebrates its heritage as Mexico's silver capital. Fair showcases master silversmiths, contemporary jewelry designers, traditional techniques. Features exhibitions of fine silverwork, workshops teaching silver craftsmanship, demonstrations of traditional techniques. Fair supports continuation of silversmith tradition. Coincides with other December celebrations in historic colonial city.

name: 10th National Toy Festival
desc: National toy festival themed 'Play, the Joy of Life' at Institute for Intellectual Development.
details: Emphasizes importance of play in child development and well-being at the Institute for Intellectual Development of Children and Young Adults.

name: Oerol Festival
desc: Land art and performance festival across the Wadden Sea island of Terschelling.
details: Oerol transforms the entire Wadden Sea island into a stage for site-specific theatre, visual art, and music created in dialogue with the landscape—dunes, forests, beaches, and villages.

name: Outlook Festival
desc: Bass music festival on the Adriatic coast celebrating its 18th anniversary.
details: Outlook Origins at The Garden in Tisno celebrates 18 years of dubstep, drum & bass, jungle, reggae, and grime against the stunning Adriatic backdrop.

name: Yuki Matsuri (Tokamachi Snow Festival)
desc: One of Japan's original snow festivals featuring elaborate snow sculptures and winter activities in heavy snow country.
details: The Tokamachi Snow Festival predates even the Sapporo Snow Festival and is held in one of Japan's snowiest cities. Features include elaborate snow sculptures, snow stages for performances, and activities like snow rafting and snowshoe trekking. The intimate scale compared to Sapporo gives it a more authentic community feel.

name: Sakura Season (Ueno/Sumida/Meguro)
desc: Tokyo's cherry blossom season transforms multiple districts into pink wonderlands.
details: Tokyo's cherry blossom season sees millions of residents and visitors flock to parks and riversides for hanami parties. Top spots include Ueno Park (800 trees), Shinjuku Gyoen (1,100 trees), Meguro River (800 trees), and Chidorigafuchi moat. Each location offers a distinct hanami experience.

name: Tønder Festival
desc: One of Europe's greatest folk music festivals in the historic town of Tønder, featuring exceptional international folk and roots artists.
details: The Tønder Folk Festival is renowned for attracting exceptional international folk musicians across blues, bluegrass, singer-songwriters, and traditional Irish, English, and American folk. The cosy festival village atmosphere, workshops, and dance sessions in the historic border town of Tønder make this a pilgrimage for folk music enthusiasts.

name: Hezhen Fish Skin Festival
desc: Rare cultural celebration of the Hezhen people's unique tradition of making clothing from fish skins.
details: The Hezhen (Nanai) people—one of China's smallest ethnic groups with about 5,000 members—celebrate their unique tradition of making clothing, accessories, and art from fish skins. The festival showcases this UNESCO-listed craft alongside traditional fishing, shamanic ceremonies, and river-based cultural events along the Heilongjiang (Amur) River.

name: Settimana Santa Trapani
desc: 20-hour Good Friday procession with 18th-century wooden religious sculptures.
details: Trapani's Processione dei Misteri features 20 groups of life-size 18th-century wooden sculptures carried through the city for 20 continuous hours from Good Friday afternoon through Saturday.

name: Tsuchiura Fireworks Competition
desc: Rare autumn fireworks competition showcasing cutting-edge pyrotechnic artistry and innovation.
details: The Tsuchiura National Fireworks Competition is one of Japan's Big Three alongside Omagari and Nagaoka. Uniquely held in autumn, it features innovative designs and cutting-edge technology from Japan's top fireworks artisans competing for national awards. Originally started as a memorial for naval officers, it has become a showcase for pyrotechnic innovation.

name: Tsunan Snow Carrot Festival
desc: Quirky snow-country festival featuring sky lantern releases in deep snow—Japan's answer to Pingxi.
details: The Tsunan Snow Carrot Festival in one of Japan's snowiest regions features a magical sky lantern release similar to Taiwan's Pingxi festival. Hundreds of paper lanterns float skyward against the snow-covered landscape. The combination of deep snow and floating lights creates an otherworldly atmosphere.

name: Mongolian Deel Fashion Show
desc: Contemporary fashion show celebrating Mongolia's traditional deel garment with modern reinterpretations.
details: Mongolian designers showcase contemporary reinterpretations of the traditional deel (the iconic Mongolian robe) alongside traditional dress from across the country's ethnic groups. The event bridges nomadic heritage and modern fashion.

name: IV Intl Cappadocia World Dance Festival
desc: International dance festival and competition in the UNESCO World Heritage Cappadocia region.
details: Features world dance competitions and performances set against the dramatic Cappadocia landscape in the town of Urgup.

name: Festival de Música Clásica
desc: International classical music festival positioning Tierra del Fuego as major South American musical center.
details: Also known as "Gala del Fin del Mundo" (End of the World Gala). Running since 2005 with classical and world music versions. Includes free popular concerts, masterclasses, and conferences in Ushuaia, Tolhuin, and Río Grande. Positions the region as autumn musical reference for South American classical music.

name: Festival de las Almas (souls Festival)
desc: Free cultural festival celebrating Day of the Dead with music, theater, dance, and the famous CatrinValle parade.
details: Organized by Secretary of Culture and Tourism of State of Mexico with Municipality of Valle de Bravo. Features musical presentations, theatrical works, dance, children's workshops, exhibitions, Cinema programming. Main event: CatrinValle parade celebrating Day of the Dead with Catrinas (elegant skeleton figures). Activities at Museo Joaquín Arcadio Pagaza, central garden, Alameda Bicentenario, and Archaeological Museum. Approximately 9 days spanning late October through early November coinciding with Day of the Dead. Free admission to most events.

name: Kilkim Žaibu
desc: Lithuania's premier folk-metal and pagan music festival in a historic setting near the ancient Samogitian capital.
details: Kilkim Žaibu is an open-air festival combining folk metal, pagan metal, and traditional Baltic music. Set near the historic Samogitian town of Varniai, it attracts fans of Baltic folk traditions blended with heavy music. The festival features reenactments, traditional crafts, and a uniquely Lithuanian atmosphere.

name: Venice Film Festival (Mostra del Cinema)
desc: The world's oldest film festival returns to the Lido for its 83rd edition, with red carpets, world premieres, and the coveted Golden Lion award.
details: The 83rd Venice International Film Festival, directed by Alberto Barbera, runs on the Lido di Venezia. As the world's oldest film festival (founded 1932), it showcases world premieres competing for the prestigious Golden Lion. The festival attracts Hollywood glamour alongside auteur cinema in one of the world's most beautiful settings. Surprisingly accessible compared to Cannes.

name: Vic Falls Carnival
desc: Three-day New Year's music celebration at Victoria Falls featuring Southern African talent.
details: The Vic Falls Carnival is a 3-day event at Victoria Falls featuring the largest gathering of Southern African musical talent from Zimbabwe, Zambia, South Africa, Botswana, Mozambique, and Namibia. Set against the backdrop of one of the world's most spectacular natural wonders.

name: Medieval Week (Medeltidsveckan)
desc: Scandinavia's largest medieval festival inside the UNESCO World Heritage walled city of Visby, Gotland.
details: The island of Gotland's capital transforms into a medieval town with jousting tournaments, medieval markets, feasts, theatrical performances, and processions. Within the UNESCO-listed medieval city walls, thousands don period costumes. The week features over 500 events, from mead-tasting to sword-fighting workshops. It is one of the most immersive medieval experiences in Europe.

name: Wando Seaweed Festival
desc: Festival celebrating Korea's seaweed culture—the island produces 80% of Korea's seaweed.
details: Wando Island produces about 80% of Korea's seaweed (gim/nori) and celebrates this marine harvest with a festival featuring seaweed harvesting, cooking demonstrations, beauty product showcases (seaweed-based cosmetics), and traditional island cultural performances.

name: Parookaville
desc: Elaborately themed electronic music festival creating a fictional city.
details: Parookaville builds an entire fictional city at Weeze Airport with themed stages, a town hall, post office, and creative experiences alongside top EDM artists.

name: New Zealand Festival / Aotearoa NZ Festival of the Arts
desc: New Zealand's premier international arts festival presenting theatre, music, dance, visual art, and literature.
details: The New Zealand Festival (held biennially) is the country's flagship international arts festival. Over three weeks, Wellington hosts world-class performances and exhibitions across theatre, music, opera, dance, visual art, and literature, transforming the capital into a cultural powerhouse.

name: CubaDupa
desc: Wellington's wild two-day street festival transforming Cuba Street with music, performance, and art.
details: CubaDupa takes over Wellington's iconic Cuba Street for a massive two-day celebration of music, performance, art, food, and creativity. Multiple stages and performance spaces host hundreds of acts, while parades, installations, and street food create a carnival atmosphere.

name: Whitby Goth Weekend
desc: Twice-yearly gathering of goths in the atmospheric seaside town that inspired Dracula.
details: Whitby Goth Weekend fills the town that inspired Bram Stoker's Dracula with 10,000+ goths, featuring live music, a bizarre bazaar, and the dramatic Whitby Abbey as backdrop.

name: Willunga Almond Blossom Festival
desc: Annual celebration of almond blossoms with food trucks, live music, fireworks, and family events.
details: The Willunga Almond Blossom Festival celebrates the beautiful almond tree blossoms that blanket the town each winter. The festival features live music, food trucks, artisan markets, fireworks, competitions, and family activities in a charming village setting.

name: Aboakyer Festival
desc: Unique deer-hunting festival of the Effutu people featuring a ceremonial competition between two groups.
details: The Aboakyer Festival in Winneba features a dramatic deer-hunting competition between two Asafo (warrior) groups of the Effutu people. The group that catches a live deer first and presents it to the paramount chief is the winner. It includes processions, drumming, and traditional rituals.

name: Qianjiang (Wuhan) Cherry Blossom Festival
desc: Wuhan University's famous cherry blossom avenue—one of China's most popular spring destinations.
details: Wuhan University's cherry-tree-lined avenue is one of the most famous cherry blossom spots in China, attracting millions every March. The trees were originally planted during the Japanese occupation, giving them a complex historical significance. The combination of blossoms, historic university buildings, and East Lake creates a stunning spring scene.

name: Wuxi Cherry Blossom Festival (Yuantouzhu)
desc: 30,000 cherry trees bloom at Yuantouzhu Peninsula on the shores of Lake Taihu.
details: Yuantouzhu (Turtle Head Peninsula) on Lake Taihu is one of China's premier cherry blossom viewing spots, with over 30,000 cherry trees. The combination of blooming sakura, traditional Chinese gardens, and the vast lake creates scenes rivaling Japan's famous hanami spots. Night illuminations extend viewing hours.

name: Xiamen International Marathon
desc: Beautiful seaside marathon along Xiamen's stunning island coastline and colonial Gulangyu views.
details: The Xiamen Marathon is one of China's most scenic road races, following the island's coastline with views of colonial Gulangyu Island. The mild January weather and beautiful coastal route make it one of Asia's premier running events.

name: Xining Great Mosque Festival
desc: Muslim cultural celebrations in the gateway city to the Tibetan Plateau.
details: Xining, with its significant Hui Muslim population, celebrates Islamic festivals including Eid al-Fitr and Eid al-Adha with markets, prayers, and communal feasting around the Great Mosque. The city's unique blend of Tibetan, Mongol, and Muslim cultures creates a distinctive atmosphere.

name: Xinying Arts Festival
desc: Traditional arts festival in the old sugar-refining district featuring theater, puppetry, and folk performance.
details: Xinying's arts festival celebrates the town's role as a traditional performing arts hub. Taiwanese puppet theater (budaixi), Gezai opera, and folk performances take place in atmospheric venues including old sugar refinery buildings.

name: Yangzhou Slender West Lake Garden Expo
desc: Spring garden festival at one of China's most beautiful classical gardens.
details: Yangzhou's Slender West Lake—one of China's most poetic landscapes—hosts spring festivals with traditional boat concerts, garden tours, Yangzhou cuisine tastings, and traditional performances. The city's 2,500-year history as a salt-trading capital produced some of China's most refined cultural traditions.

name: Yeoju Ceramics Festival
desc: Festival celebrating the birthplace of Korean celadon and white porcelain ceramics traditions.
details: Yeoju, one of Korea's most important ceramics centers, celebrates its pottery heritage with exhibitions, workshops, kiln firing demonstrations, and sales of contemporary and traditional ceramics. The town has produced pottery for over 500 years and visitors can try their hand at the wheel.

name: Yeongdeok Snow Crab Festival
desc: East coast seafood festival celebrating the prized snow crabs of Yeongdeok.
details: Yeongdeok's snow crab festival celebrates the region's most prized seafood. Fresh crabs are sold at special prices, with cooking demonstrations and tasting events. The coastal scenery of the East Sea provides a beautiful backdrop.

name: Yeosu Night Sea Fireworks Festival
desc: Spectacular fireworks display over the beautiful Yeosu night sea coast.
details: Yeosu, famous for its beautiful coastline, hosts a fireworks festival that illuminates the night sea. The fireworks are launched from the historic Yi Sun-sin bridge area, with displays reflected in the calm harbor waters. The event includes ocean-themed performances and street food markets.

name: Yilan International Children's Folklore & Folkgame Festival
desc: Massive children's folk game festival attracting kids from around the world for traditional play.
details: The Yilan festival is one of Asia's largest children's cultural events, featuring traditional folk games, puppet shows, storytelling, and play activities from around the world. The riverside park setting and summer timing make it a premier family destination in Taiwan.

name: Yokohama Red Brick Christmas Market
desc: German-style Christmas market at Yokohama's iconic Red Brick Warehouse waterfront.
details: Yokohama's Red Brick Christmas Market recreates a traditional German Christmas market (Weihnachtsmarkt) at the historic waterfront warehouse. German-style food, mulled wine, and handcrafted ornaments are sold from wooden stalls surrounding a large illuminated Christmas tree. The harbor setting adds romantic atmosphere.

name: Yokosuka Friendship Day
desc: US Navy base opens to the public for a massive cultural exchange festival and air show.
details: Yokosuka's US Naval Base opens its gates for a cultural exchange festival attended by over 200,000 people. American and Japanese food, entertainment, and military displays create a unique cross-cultural celebration. The event symbolizes the post-war Japan-US alliance.

name: Hani Long Table Banquet
desc: Massive communal feast stretching through Hani villages during the Hani New Year.
details: The Hani Long Table Banquet during Angmatu (Hani New Year) features tables stretching hundreds of meters through terraced-rice villages. Each family contributes dishes to create a communal feast. The celebration includes traditional songs, dances, and ceremonies set against the spectacular UNESCO-listed Yuanyang Rice Terraces.

name: Zanzibar International Film Festival (ZIFF)
desc: East Africa's largest film and arts festival in Stone Town bringing together diverse Indian Ocean cultures.
details: ZIFF, often described as East Africa's largest cultural event, brings together arts and cultures of East African countries with those of India, Pakistan, the Gulf States, Iran, and the Indian Ocean islands. It features film screenings, music performances, workshops, and forums in the atmospheric setting of Stone Town.

name: Zibo Barbecue Festival
desc: Viral food phenomenon turned annual festival in the city that became China's BBQ capital overnight.
details: Zibo became a viral sensation in 2023 when its distinctive barbecue style—small stove, wrapped in flatbread—took Chinese social media by storm. The city now hosts an annual BBQ festival drawing millions of domestic tourists. The event showcases Zibo's unique barbecue culture alongside other Shandong culinary traditions and street performances.

name: Groovin The Moo
desc: Touring regional music festival bringing major acts to country towns across Australia.
details: Groovin The Moo is a beloved touring festival that brings top-tier music acts to regional Australian towns. The one-day events feature multiple stages with diverse lineups spanning hip-hop, electronic, indie, and pop, giving regional audiences access to major festival experiences.

name: Trifon Zarezan (Wine Day)
desc: Bulgaria's traditional wine festival celebrating the patron saint of vine growers, with ritual vine pruning, wine blessings, and communal feasting.
details: Celebrated on February 14 (Gregorian calendar), Trifon Zarezan marks the beginning of grapevine pruning season. Vine growers perform the first symbolic pruning in the shape of a cross, then pour wine over the vines. The most skilled pruner is crowned Wine King and paraded through town on a donkey. Feasting, drinking, and traditional music follow. It's Bulgaria's Valentine's Day — but with wine.

name: Cheung Yeung Festival (China-wide)
desc: Ancient autumn festival for climbing heights and honoring elders on the 9th day of the 9th lunar month.
details: Chong Yang (Double Ninth) is celebrated with mountain climbing, chrysanthemum appreciation, and filial piety. It has been designated as Senior Citizens' Day. Traditional customs include drinking chrysanthemum wine, eating Chongyang cake, and wearing cornel sprigs. Many scenic mountain areas host special events.

name: Genna (Ethiopian Christmas)
desc: Ethiopian Orthodox Christmas featuring all-night church services and traditional Genna hockey.
