details: Genna, Ethiopian Christmas celebrated on January 7, features all-night church services with singing, prayer, and incense. A traditional game similar to field hockey, also called Genna, is played in many communities. Families gather for festive meals featuring injera, doro wat, and tej.

name: Día de Todos los Santos (All Saints' Day)
desc: Day honoring deceased loved ones blending indigenous Mayan beliefs with Catholicism, featuring cemetery visits, floral offerings, giant kite flying, and regional horse racing traditions.
details: Día de Todos los Santos is deeply rooted in a blend of indigenous Mayan beliefs and Catholicism. Guatemalans honor deceased family members by visiting cemeteries with floral offerings, pine branches, and candles. Regional traditions vary significantly: in Sumpango and Santiago Sacatepéquez, the day is celebrated with the iconic flying of giant barriletes (kites); in Todos Santos Cuchumatán, the tradition is "La Carrera de Cintas" featuring rapid horse races along dirt streets leading to cemeteries; in Salcajá, locals create "calaveras de ayote" (squash skulls) that become lanterns with candles inside. These regional traditions represent the unique ways each community honors its heritage.

name: Newroz Kurdish New Year 2726
desc: Celebration of Kurdish New Year 2726 marking spring and cultural identity with bonfires and dances.
details: Kurdish calendar adds 700 years commemorating legendary hero Kawa. Celebrations include traditional dances, music, bonfires. Tour packages available March 16-22.

name: Ferragosto Celebrations
desc: Italy's beloved midsummer holiday with beach festivals, fireworks, and feasts.
details: Ferragosto on August 15 sees all of Italy celebrate with beach parties, sagre (food festivals), fireworks, and family feasts. It's the peak of Italian summer culture.

name: Joninės (Lithuanian Midsummer)
desc: Lithuanian midsummer celebration with bonfires, folk songs, traditional rituals, and the search for the mythical fern flower.
details: Like its Baltic neighbours, Lithuania celebrates the summer solstice with ancient traditions. Bonfires are lit, folk songs are sung, and young people search for the mythical fern flower in the forest. The celebrations combine pre-Christian pagan traditions with later folk customs and take place in countryside settings, parks, and cultural venues.

name: Matariki
desc: Celebration of the Maori New Year with cultural events, ceremonies, and community gatherings nationwide.
details: Matariki marks the Maori New Year, signalled by the rising of the Pleiades star cluster. Since becoming a public holiday in 2022, celebrations have grown significantly, with dawn ceremonies, cultural performances, feasts, storytelling, music, art exhibitions, and community events across the country.

name: Nevruz / Nowruz Celebrations Turkey
desc: 3,000-year-old celebration of spring equinox and new year across Turkey.
details: Celebrated across regions including Balkans, Central Asia, and Middle East. Communities celebrate with cultural events, gatherings, and traditional foods.

name: Turkish Republic Day
desc: National holiday commemorating the foundation of the Turkish Republic in 1923 with parades and celebrations.
details: Features national parades, cultural performances, and community celebrations throughout the country.

name: NorthSide Festival
desc: Aarhus' celebrated alternative and indie music festival with a focus on sustainability, art, and culture.
details: Set in Eskelunden park in Aarhus, NorthSide is a three-day festival combining indie, alternative, and electronic music with a strong emphasis on sustainability and community. The intimate setting and carefully curated lineup make it a favourite for music enthusiasts seeking something beyond mainstream festivals.

name: Krampusnacht
desc: Parades featuring Krampus figures—horned folkloric companions of St. Nicholas—with costumes and bells.

name: Ankara-Kazan Dance & Music Festival
desc: International dance and music festival promoting cultural exchange.
details: Limited to 35 people per group. Promotes cultural exchange through music and dance between Turkish and international participants.

name: Ann Arbor Art Fair
desc: One of the largest juried art fairs in North America with over 1,000 artists spanning 30 city blocks.
details: The Ann Arbor Art Fair is actually four concurrent juried art fairs that together attract over 1,000 artists from across the continent. Spanning 30 city blocks of downtown Ann Arbor, the fair features painting, sculpture, ceramics, jewelry, glass, and more. It is consistently ranked among the top art fairs in the United States.

name: Eritrea Independence Day Festival
desc: National celebration of Eritrea's independence with parades, music, and cultural displays in Art Deco Asmara.
details: Eritrea's Independence Day on May 24th features grand military and civilian parades through the UNESCO-listed Art Deco streets of Asmara, traditional music and dance from the country's nine ethnic groups, and festive celebrations throughout the capital.

name: Qurban Ait (Eid al-Adha)
desc: Islamic holiday of sacrifice with major celebrations at Turkestan's Khoja Ahmed Yasawi Mausoleum.
details: Most important Islamic holiday in Kazakhstan. Major pilgrimage celebrations at Khoja Ahmed Yasawi Mausoleum in Turkestan. Communities gather for prayers, feasts, and traditional ceremonies.

name: S20 Songkran Music Festival
desc: The world's wettest music festival combining Thailand's iconic Songkran water fights with world-class EDM and water cannons.
details: S20 takes Bangkok's iconic Songkran water fights and dials them up to eleven with a world-class EDM soundtrack. Previous editions featured headliners like Marshmello, Alan Walker, and DJ Snake. Prepare for water cannons, not water pistols, set against a backdrop of international DJs at Rajamangala Stadium.

name: St. Kitts Music Festival
desc: Brings global sounds with island vibes featuring multiple days of performances at Warner Park Stadium.
details: The St. Kitts Music Festival showcases diverse musical genres and international artists celebrating Caribbean and global music traditions.

name: Chinese New Year / Lunar New Year
desc: Lunar New Year celebrations featuring family reunions, lion/dragon dances, fireworks, and temple fairs; starts the Year of the Horse.

name: Mid-Autumn Festival
desc: Full-moon harvest celebration with mooncakes, lanterns, and family reunions.

name: Borealis Festival
desc: Bergen's international festival for experimental music, bringing together new musical experiments from Norway and around the world.
details: Borealis is Bergen's adventurous contemporary music festival, presenting new musical experiments and sonic experiences. Performances range from intimate electronic sets to large-scale contemporary orchestral works, held in venues across the city. It draws curious listeners from across Europe.

name: Busan International Rock Festival
desc: Korea's longest-running rock music festival at Samnak Ecological Park featuring domestic and international artists.
details: The Busan International Rock Festival is Korea's oldest rock festival, held at the scenic Samnak Ecological Park along the Nakdong River. The festival features both established and emerging rock, indie, and alternative artists from Korea and abroad. The riverside setting provides a unique concert atmosphere.

name: Cairo Jazz Festival
desc: Annual jazz festival bringing international and regional jazz artists to Cairo's Al Azhar Park.
details: Held annually since 2009, the Cairo Jazz Festival is a dynamic convergence of international jazz artists from 15+ countries and local talents. Performances unfold across multiple stages at the American University in Cairo and intimate Zamalek venues, with various jam sessions and after-hour club gigs.

name: Canberra Balloon Spectacular
desc: Breathtaking hot air balloon festival with mass launches from the lawns of Old Parliament House each morning.
details: The Canberra Balloon Spectacular sees dozens of colourful hot air balloons, including spectacular special shapes, launching from the lawns of Old Parliament House at dawn each day for nine days. The free event draws early risers for a magical start to their day.

name: Ultra South Africa
desc: Cape Town edition of the continent's biggest EDM festival.
details: Ultra South Africa Cape Town takes place at The Ostrich featuring acts like John Summit, DJ Snake, and Axwell. The Cape Town leg offers a different vibe from Johannesburg with its own unique lineup additions.

name: Cape Town Cycle Tour
desc: World's largest individually timed cycling event with 35,000 riders around the Cape Peninsula.
details: The Cape Town Cycle Tour is the world's largest individually timed cycling event, with 35,000 riders completing the scenic 109km route around the Cape Peninsula. It passes through Chapman's Peak, along the Atlantic coast, and around the famous Cape of Good Hope.

name: Festival de Reyes Celaya 2026
desc: Family-oriented festival celebrating Three Kings Day
details: Held at Ciro Soto Lara Stadium. Thousands of families. Thousands of attendees. Games, music, workshops, raffles, mini fair, gifts for children. Strengthens traditions and brings joy.

name: Nc'wala Ceremony
desc: Ngoni first-fruits ceremony featuring the paramount chief tasting the first harvest.
details: The Nc'wala ceremony of the Ngoni people near Chipata is a dramatic first-fruits celebration. Warriors in traditional Ngoni battle dress perform the Ingoma war dance before the Paramount Chief Mpezeni, who ceremonially tastes the season's first fruits, signaling the harvest can begin.

name: Festival del Café - Coatepec 2026
desc: Festival celebrating Veracruz's famous coffee culture

name: Festival del Mar 2026
desc: Celebration of sea/maritime culture

name: Copenhell
desc: Copenhagen's premier heavy metal and hard rock festival set on the industrial island of Refshaleøen.
details: Four days of heavy music on the atmospheric Refshaleøen island. Copenhell features international metal, hard rock, and punk acts across multiple stages. The industrial harbour setting adds to the raw atmosphere. It has become one of Scandinavia's most important heavy music events.

name: Copenhagen Distortion
desc: Week-long citywide street festival celebrating club culture, electronic music, street life, and contemporary art across Copenhagen.
details: Distortion transforms different Copenhagen neighborhoods into massive block parties each day. Thousands swarm the streets for stages, drinking, and dancing, and each night the party is cleaned up and moved to the next area. It culminates with two stacked nights of electronic music at the harbour. It is the ultimate urban street party experience.

name: Festival de Música Barroca de Cusco (Cusco Baroque Music Festival)
desc: Celebration of Baroque and Renaissance music featuring international and regional ensembles performing music from colonial Latin America.
details: Under the direction of Iván Zignaigo, a prominent Cuscan musician, musicologist, and composer, the festival offers music concerts, conferences, and visits. The program grows each year with more activities. Renowned ensembles include Anástasis and Il Furore from Mexico, Carmina Indos and Camerata dei Fiori from Chile, and Kukulis Ensamble and Corda e Voce Ensamble from Peru. The festival celebrates the rich Baroque musical heritage of colonial Latin America and its influence on contemporary compositions.

name: Dak'Art: African Contemporary Art Biennale
desc: The foundational and longest-running biennial dedicated to contemporary African art and the diaspora.
details: Dak'Art transforms the Senegalese capital into a vibrant nexus of Pan-African creativity. It is essential for curatorial discovery and features both official state-sponsored exhibitions (the IN) and hundreds of independent, parallel grassroots events (the OFF).

name: Diwali / Deepavali
desc: Festival of lights with diyas, rangoli, family puja, sweets, and fireworks celebrating renewal and victory of light over darkness.

name: Thaipusam (South Africa)
desc: Hindu kavady festival in Durban's large Indian community featuring body piercings and fire walking.
details: Thaipusam in Durban features South Africa's large Tamil Hindu community carrying kavady (ornate wooden arches) and performing body piercings with hooks and skewers as acts of devotion. Durban has the largest Indian diaspora population in Africa.

name: Royal Highland Show
desc: Scotland's premier agricultural and food event showcasing the best of farming, food, and rural life.
details: Held annually at Ingliston near Edinburgh, this iconic four-day event brings together livestock competitions, food halls, rural crafts, equestrian displays, and forestry demonstrations. It is a celebration of Scotland's agricultural heritage and countryside culture, attracting nearly 200,000 visitors each year.

name: Franschhoek Uncorked Festival
desc: Spring harvest celebration with estate tastings, vineyard walks, and chef demonstrations across 35 properties.
details: The Franschhoek Uncorked Festival celebrates the spring harvest season through estate tastings, vineyard walks, and chef demonstrations across 35 participating properties in the picturesque Franschhoek valley, one of South Africa's premier wine regions.

name: Winter Tale Music Festival
desc: Classical and world music festival at Heydar Aliyev Congress Center with flamenco-jazz and themed nights.
details: Programs include vocal performances, chamber instrumental ensembles, solo recitals, flamenco-jazz, and themed nights (Azerbaijan-Spain, Baku-Naples).

name: TRNSMT Festival
desc: Scotland's biggest pop and indie music festival in Glasgow Green, drawing major international headliners.
details: Held on the historic Glasgow Green, TRNSMT is a non-camping urban festival that brings tens of thousands of music fans together for three days of major headline acts and emerging talent. Since its launch in 2017 it has rapidly become one of the UK's must-attend summer festivals.

name: FIFA World Cup 26 (matches hosted in Mexico)
desc: Men’s FIFA World Cup; matches + fan zones across Mexico’s host cities.

name: Elbphilharmonie Festival
desc: Year-round programme at Hamburg's stunning Elbphilharmonie concert hall.
details: Hamburg's architectural masterpiece hosts world-class orchestras, soloists, and innovative programmes year-round, with its acoustically perfect Grand Hall as centrepiece.

name: May Day celebrations
desc: Traditional spring celebrations featuring Morris dancing, maypole dancing, and local rituals.

name: Dragon Boat Festival (Duanwu)
desc: Dragon boat races and zongzi (rice dumplings) commemorating poet Qu Yuan; widely celebrated in Chinese communities.

name: Olojo Festival
desc: Sacred Yoruba festival in Ile-Ife celebrating the creation of the world by Oduduwa.
details: The Olojo Festival in Ile-Ife, the spiritual home of the Yoruba people, celebrates the creation of the world. The Ooni of Ife wears the sacred Are crown (believed to have been made by the gods) in public, accompanied by elaborate processions, traditional rites, and cultural performances.

name: Istanbul Theatre Festival
desc: Established theatre festival presenting recent plays and premieres by local and international companies.
details: Organized since 1989, Turkey's most established theatre event presents local and international theatre, dance, and performance companies at venues including Zorlu PSM, DasDas, and AKM.

name: Battaglia delle Arance
desc: A wild carnival battle where thousands of people pelt each other with oranges from horse-drawn carts.
details: The Battle of the Oranges in Ivrea is one of Europe's most extraordinary carnival traditions. Teams of orange-throwers on foot battle cart-riding warriors in a messy, exhilarating food fight symbolizing a medieval rebellion.

name: Indonesian Independence Day
desc: Country-wide celebration with flag-raising ceremonies, traditional neighborhood games, and red-and-white decorations.
details: Indonesia celebrates independence from Japan (1945) with nationwide festivities. Jakarta hosts the main flag-raising ceremony at the Presidential Palace, while communities across the archipelago organize traditional games (lomba), neighborhood competitions, parades, and cultural performances. Red and white decorations adorn everything from city skyscrapers to the smallest villages.

name: Jember Fashion Carnaval
desc: Costume carnival parade known for elaborate designs and large-scale street procession.

name: Days of Live Archaeology in Kernave
desc: Three-day festival at Lithuania's first historical capital featuring ancient crafts from Stone Age fire-starting to Viking-age smithing.
details: This festival at the UNESCO-listed Kernavė Archaeological Site presents preserved ancient crafts including Stone Age fire-starting techniques, bronze casting, yarn dyeing, and Viking-age smithing. Set in the landscape of Lithuania's medieval capital with its dramatic hill-fort mounds, it offers a unique journey through Baltic prehistoric and medieval life.

name: Wonderfruit Festival
desc: Thailand's answer to Burning Man — a sustainability-focused festival of music, art, wellness, and farm-to-table dining.
details: Five days of diverse electronic and live music, wellness workshops, farm-to-table dining, and some of Southeast Asia's most impressive art installations. Set in a lush outdoor venue near Pattaya, Wonderfruit takes sustainability seriously with eco-friendly practices throughout. Glamping options, yoga sessions, and community engagement create a complete cultural experience.

name: Rwanda Cultural Day (Umuganura)
desc: National harvest festival revived as a celebration of Rwandan cultural identity and unity.
details: Umuganura is Rwanda's traditional harvest festival, revived as a national holiday celebrating Rwandan cultural identity. It features the first-fruits ceremony where communities share newly harvested sorghum, traditional Intore dancing, and cultural exhibitions promoting unity and reconciliation.

name: Lagos Carnival (Fanti Carnival)
desc: Annual Lagos street carnival with colorful parades, music, dance, and cultural displays on Easter Monday.
details: The Lagos Carnival, traditionally held on Easter Monday, features colorful parades through the streets of Lagos Island with costumed bands, traditional dance troupes, floats, and live music representing Lagos's diverse communities and cultural heritage.

name: Khuvsgul Ice Festival
desc: Winter festival on a frozen lake featuring ice sumo and shamanic rituals.

name: Rise Festival 2025/2026
desc: An adrenaline-fueled week combining high-altitude alpine skiing with massive electronic music parties.
details: Rise Festival epitomizes the booming 'snow-bombing' trend, where attendees ski during the day and rave at night. It brings elite DJs to massive outdoor stages and intimate mountain clubs in the French Alps.

name: V&A East Museum Opening
desc: Major expansion of the Victoria and Albert Museum.
details: A massive new cultural hub in East London designed to showcase global creativity, design, and contemporary visual culture.

name: Lowell Folk Festival
desc: The largest free folk festival in the nation, co-produced by the National Park Service in historic Lowell.
details: Co-produced by the Lowell National Historical Park and the National Council for the Traditional Arts, this free festival presents traditional music, dance, craft demonstrations, and ethnic food from diverse American cultures. Set in the historic mill city of Lowell, it features six stages of continuous performances over three days.

name: Lucca Comics & Games
desc: Europe's largest comics, gaming, and pop culture festival.
details: Lucca Comics & Games fills the walled medieval city with 500,000+ visitors celebrating comics, manga, gaming, cosplay, and pop culture in a unique historic setting.

name: San Isidro Festival
desc: Madrid’s patron-saint festival with concerts, processions, and traditional dress/food in parks and plazas.

name: Marrakech International Film Festival
desc: A glamorous film festival with red carpet screenings in Jemaa el-Fnaa Square attracting global cinema stars.
details: This prestigious festival gathers filmmakers, actors, and cinema enthusiasts from around the world for screenings, discussions, and cultural exchanges. Open-air screenings in the iconic Jemaa el-Fnaa Square and indoor venues across Marrakech place Morocco firmly on the global cinematic map. Past editions have honored international filmmakers while showcasing fresh Arab and African talent.

name: Lollapalooza India
desc: The iconic Chicago music festival's fourth Indian edition featuring 40+ artists including Linkin Park and Playboi Carti.
details: Lollapalooza India returns to Mahalaxmi Race Course in Mumbai for its 4th edition. The 2026 lineup features international headliners Linkin Park, Playboi Carti, YUNGBLUD, and Kehlani alongside 40+ artists across rock, hip-hop, alternative, and EDM genres, delivering a world-class festival experience with high-energy atmosphere and neon art installations.

name: Nantes à la Folie / Les Machines de l'île
desc: Year-round spectacular mechanical creatures including the Grand Elephant.
details: Les Machines de l'île features a 12m mechanical elephant carrying passengers, a 3-story marine carousel, and other Jules Verne-inspired creations. The Voyage à Nantes summer trail adds art installations.

name: Taranaki Garden Festival
desc: Six-day celebration showcasing stunning private gardens and artistic displays in the Taranaki region.
details: The Taranaki Garden Festival opens the gates of over 40 stunning private gardens for visitors to explore. Combined with art installations, sculptures, and special events, it celebrates the region's extraordinary gardening culture against the backdrop of Mount Taranaki.

name: Rumbo Oaxaca Intercultural Music Festival
desc: Intercultural music festival celebrating diverse musical traditions from Oaxaca and international guests.
details: Four-day festival in Oaxaca City featuring music from multiple cultures and traditions. Showcases indigenous Oaxacan music alongside international performers. Emphasizes cultural exchange through music. January timing provides early-year cultural programming.

name: Chorégies d'Orange
desc: France's oldest festival featuring world-class opera in a UNESCO Roman Theatre.
details: Founded in 1869, the Chorégies d'Orange presents opera and classical music in the magnificent Roman Theatre of Orange, a UNESCO World Heritage site with perfect acoustics and a capacity of 9,000.

name: Holmenkollen Ski Festival
desc: World-class winter sports festival featuring FIS World Cup events in Nordic skiing and biathlon at Oslo's iconic ski arena.
details: More than 2,000 volunteers make this event run smoothly. The 2026 edition incorporates FIS World Cup events in cross-country skiing, ski jumping, and Nordic combined (14-15 March) and biathlon (19-22 March). The Holmenkollen ski jump arena offers spectacular views over Oslo and has hosted events since 1892.

name: Medieval Festival Oslo
desc: One of the most authentic medieval festivals in Northern Europe, held at Akershus Fortress.
details: This festival transforms the grounds of the historic Akershus Fortress into a medieval experience with jugglers, longbow demonstrations, market stalls selling crafts from across Europe, activities for children, and much more. It offers an immersive step back into the Middle Ages in a stunning waterfront fortress setting.

name: Inti Raymi / San Juan festivities
desc: Andean solstice celebrations with dance, music and community rituals.

name: Ouidah Sacred Python Temple Festival
desc: Voodoo ceremonies at the Temple of Pythons where live royal pythons are worshipped.
details: The Temple of Pythons in Ouidah houses over 50 royal pythons worshipped in the voodoo tradition. During the January voodoo celebrations, special ceremonies take place at the temple with devotees handling the sacred snakes and performing rituals.

name: Sango Festival
desc: Sacred Yoruba festival honoring Sango, the god of thunder and lightning, with fire dances.
details: The Sango Festival in Oyo honors the deified fourth Alaafin (king) of Oyo, Sango, god of thunder and lightning. Devotees perform spectacular fire-eating and fire-dancing rituals, with priests handling flames without being burned in a dramatic display of spiritual power.

name: Festival Folclórico de Parintins
desc: Three-night rivalry between Garantido (red) and Caprichoso (blue) with massive staged folklore productions.

name: Nuit Blanche Paris
desc: All-night contemporary art festival transforming Paris with free installations and performances.
details: Nuit Blanche opens museums, galleries, and public spaces across Paris for one magical night of free contemporary art installations, performances, and experiences from dusk until dawn.

name: Tomorrowland Thailand
desc: The inaugural Asian debut of the world's most famous electronic music festival at Wisdom Valley near Pattaya.
details: The legendary Belgian EDM festival makes its highly anticipated Thailand debut in 2026 at Wisdom Valley, about 90 minutes from Bangkok. Known for its elaborate stage designs, world-class production, and top international DJs, Tomorrowland Thailand promises to be one of the biggest music events in Asian history.

name: Philadelphia Flower Show
desc: The world's oldest and largest indoor flower show, presented by the Pennsylvania Horticultural Society.
details: Dating back to 1829, the Philadelphia Flower Show is a horticultural spectacle featuring massive landscape installations, competitive floral arrangements, and garden design. Each year a different theme transforms the venue into an immersive botanical wonderland. The show combines scientific horticulture with artistic design at a grand scale.

name: Pingyao International Film Festival
desc: Jia Zhangke's film festival in the atmospheric UNESCO ancient walled city of Pingyao.
details: The Pingyao International Film Festival, founded by acclaimed director Jia Zhangke, screens international and Chinese films within the stunning UNESCO-listed walled city. Films are shown in repurposed ancient buildings, creating a unique viewing experience that bridges contemporary cinema and centuries-old architecture.

name: Fantasporto International Film Festival
desc: International fantasy, horror, and sci-fi film festival in Porto.
details: Fantasporto is one of the world's leading genre film festivals, showcasing international fantasy, sci-fi, and horror cinema in Porto since 1981.

name: Victorious Festival
desc: Seaside music festival on Portsmouth's historic seafront.
details: Victorious fills Southsea Common with music, comedy, and family activities against the backdrop of Portsmouth's naval heritage and seafront.

name: Biennale Matter of Art
desc: A critical, politically engaged contemporary art biennial exploring Central and Eastern European identities.
details: Hosted in Prague and Pardubice, this event addresses post-socialist realities, labor, gender, and class. It serves as a vital platform for Eastern European artists to articulate regional nuances outside of Western European institutional frameworks.

name: Festival Navideño Puebla 2026 (Christmas Festival "For the Love of Puebla")
desc: Month-long Christmas celebration

name: Este Arte
desc: An exclusive, boutique art fair catering to the elite summer crowd in South America's premier resort town.
details: Este Arte offers a highly curated selection of contemporary art, serving as a relaxed but commercially potent meeting point for affluent collectors vacationing in Uruguay.

name: Winter Lights Festival
desc: Reykjavík's festival of light and darkness with Museum Night, Pool Night, Light Trail, and 150+ free events.
details: The Winter Lights Festival brightens Reykjavík's dark winter with illuminated art installations, Museum Night (40+ museums open free, 6-11pm), Pool Night (free swimming under the stars), and a Light Trail of installations from Hallgrímskirkja to Austurvöllur. All events are free, making it an accessible celebration across all six municipalities of the capital area.

name: Reykjavík Arts Festival
desc: Iceland's premier biennial multidisciplinary arts festival featuring new commissions and international talent.
details: The Reykjavík Arts Festival is the crown jewel of the spring-to-summer transition—a biennial multidisciplinary arts festival featuring new commissions, international performers, visual art installations, theatre, dance, and music. It transforms the city's venues with world-class programming that spans two weeks.

name: Reykjavík Pride
desc: One of the summer's biggest events, drawing tens of thousands to show solidarity with the LGBTQ+ community.
details: Reykjavík Pride is a colourful celebration that brings tens of thousands into the city centre. The week includes concerts, art exhibitions, talks, and family events, culminating in the massive Pride parade. It has been designated a permanent Reykjavík City Festival due to its cultural and social importance.

name: Tuwaiq Sculpture Symposium
desc: An international sculpture symposium where artists create large-scale public works across Riyadh's landscape.
details: Part of Riyadh's expanding public art program, the Tuwaiq Sculpture Symposium brings international and Saudi sculptors together to create monumental works that become permanent additions to the city's landscape. The symposium reflects Saudi Arabia's ambitious investment in public art and cultural infrastructure.

name: I Land Sound
desc: Sustainability-focused electronic music festival on a breathtaking Baltic islet at the gateway to Saaremaa.
details: I Land Sound is held on Illiku Islet near Saaremaa—one of Estonia's most unforgettable festival experiences. This sustainability-focused festival blends stunning nature, electronic beats, immersive art, and intimate connection between music, nature, and soul. Morning yoga sessions, afternoon art installations, and dancing under starry skies with the sea always in view.

name: International Sand Marathon (Marathon des Sables)
desc: The toughest footrace on Earth - 250km self-supported ultra-marathon through the Sahara Desert.
details: Considered the world's toughest footrace, the Marathon des Sables sends competitors across 156 miles of the Sahara Desert over 10 days, carrying their own supplies. While primarily a sporting event, it's also a cultural spectacle with global participants experiencing the raw beauty and challenge of the desert.

name: San Francisco International Film Festival
desc: The longest-running film festival in the Americas, showcasing international and independent cinema.
details: Founded in 1957, SFFILM presents approximately 200 films from 50+ countries in venues across San Francisco. The festival champions international cinema, new directors, and innovative storytelling, with a strong emphasis on social justice and diverse perspectives.

name: Tope Nacional (horse parade)
desc: Large horse parade through downtown San José during end-of-year festivities.

name: Puerto Rico Wine and Food Festival
desc: Wine and culinary celebration combining wine tastings with Puerto Rican cuisine and international culinary traditions.
details: Similar timing to Saborea, this festival emphasizes wine pairings with Puerto Rican and international cuisine. Features wine tastings, culinary demonstrations, and gourmet experiences celebrating Puerto Rico's food and wine culture.

name: Desfile Nacional de Carnaval
desc: National carnival parade showcasing regional comparsas and costumes.

name: Thaipusam
desc: Hindu devotional procession with kavadi bearers and street rituals.

name: Surin Elephant Round-up
desc: Thailand's largest elephant festival with hundreds of elephants parading, performing, and competing at the world's largest elephant village.
details: Held at Si Narong Stadium in the world's largest domestic elephant village, the festival features a parade of elaborately decorated elephants, re-enactments of historical battles, elephant football, and cultural shows. Opening ceremonies include floats decorated with carved fruits and vegetables, music, and light shows with native elements.

name: Hwaseong Fortress Night Walk
desc: Evening illuminated walk along the UNESCO World Heritage fortress walls of Suwon.
details: Suwon's Hwaseong Fortress, a UNESCO World Heritage site, offers seasonal evening walks along the illuminated 5.7km walls. The combination of 18th-century military architecture, traditional performances, and city views creates an atmospheric cultural experience.

name: G! Festival
desc: Intimate beach-side music festival in a tiny Faroese village, combining global music with dramatic North Atlantic scenery.
details: G! Festival takes place on the beach in the village of Syðrugøta on the island of Eysturoy. This intimate festival combines Faroese and international music with dramatic cliff backdrops, village hospitality, and the raw beauty of the North Atlantic. It is one of the most unique and remote festival experiences in Europe.

name: Fiesta de la Patria Gaucha
desc: Gaucho heritage festival with rodeo-style events, crafts, and traditional music.

name: Taipei Golden Horse Film Festival
desc: The most prestigious Chinese-language film awards—the 'Oscars of Chinese cinema.'
details: The Golden Horse Film Festival and Awards is the most prestigious Chinese-language film event in the world. It screens hundreds of Chinese-language films, hosts masterclasses, and culminates in the glittering Golden Horse Awards ceremony. Past winners include Ang Lee, Wong Kar-wai, and Hou Hsiao-hsien. The festival is a cornerstone of global Chinese-language cinema.

name: Tampere Theatre Festival
desc: Finland's leading international theatre festival featuring cutting-edge performances from around the world.
details: The Tampere Theatre Festival has been showcasing the best of Finnish and international theatre since 1968. It presents innovative and challenging works alongside more accessible productions, panel discussions, and workshops. The festival transforms Tampere's various venues into a celebration of performing arts.

name: Uzbekistan Independence Day
desc: Grand national celebration with hundreds of performers at Mustakillik Square and regional festivities.
details: Celebrates Uzbekistan's independence from Soviet Union. Grandest celebration at Mustakillik Square with hundreds of performers, dozens of music and dance groups, pop and movie stars, elaborate performances, and fireworks display. Each region prepares festive programs featuring folklore groups, sports competitions, craft fairs, and traditional music/dance. Central celebration features Plov as traditional feast dish.

name: Tbilisoba
desc: Georgia's biggest cultural festival transforming Tbilisi with food markets, wine, folk dancing, and multicultural displays.
details: Georgia's biggest cultural festival. Two-day celebration transforming entire city with food markets, pop-up handicraft bazaars, vintage car displays, big band performances, and folk dancing. Coincides with harvest season; wine central. Features Azerbaijani, Armenian, Greek, and other minority community stalls.

name: 14th Tehran Intl Animation Festival
desc: International animation festival with four competitive sections showcasing global animation.
details: Held by Institute for Intellectual Development of Children & Young Adults. Sections: Competition, Out of Competition, Special Screening, and Panorama.

name: Echigo-Tsumari Art Triennale (Winter SNOWART)
desc: Winter edition of the grandparent of Japan's art festivals, spanning 760 sq km of terraced rice fields and mountains.
details: The Echigo-Tsumari Art Field is the world's largest outdoor art festival. The Winter SNOWART edition transforms the snowy landscape into an open-air gallery featuring site-specific installations by international artists woven into the rural Japanese countryside. The main triennale returns in 2027, but the winter program offers a unique snow-covered art experience.

name: Træna Festival
desc: Music festival on a remote Arctic island 33km off the Norwegian coast.
details: Træna Festival is held on a tiny Arctic archipelago with concerts in caves, on beaches, and on a small island. With midnight sun and the Lofoten Wall as backdrop, it's spectacularly remote.

name: Festival Internacional de Cine de Valdivia (FICValdivia)
desc: International film festival with horror film specialization and summer showcase event.
details: FICValdivia in Summer (Jan 27-29) is free showcase featuring award-winning films from latest edition with regional music and poetry performers. Horror Film Festival (May 4-9) features competitive sections. Results announced May 10 at closing ceremony. One of Latin America's most important film festivals with competitive sections, independent screenings, and educational activities. Held annually in Valdivia.

name: Festival Kreol
desc: The world's first festival dedicated to Creole heritage, celebrating 41 years of preserving Creole culture.
details: Seychelles' Festival Kreol, launched in 1985, was the first festival in the world dedicated to Creole heritage. The week-long celebration features traditional moutya, sega, and kanmtole music, cultural activities across all islands, and culminates in a vibrant march through Victoria. The 2026 edition continues its mission of preserving Creole heritage for future generations.

name: Vienna Philharmonic Summer Night Concert
desc: Free open-air concert by the Vienna Philharmonic in Schönbrunn Palace gardens.
details: The Vienna Philharmonic performs a free summer night concert in the spectacular gardens of Schönbrunn Palace, broadcast worldwide and attended by 100,000+.

name: Gala de Viña (Noche Cero)
desc: Red-carpet gala event ahead of the Viña del Mar Festival.

name: Midnight Sun Festival (Dawson City / Whitehorse)
desc: Summer solstice celebration under 24-hour daylight in Canada's North with music and outdoor events.
details: The Yukon celebrates the summer solstice with outdoor concerts, midnight golf tournaments, river events, and community celebrations under the midnight sun. The nearly 24 hours of daylight create a surreal and joyous atmosphere.

name: Festival Afrocaribeño 2026
desc: Celebration of Afro-Caribbean culture and heritage
details: Takes place in Yanga and Cosamaloapan.

name: Likumbi Lya Mize
desc: Luvale masquerade festival with the famous Makishi masked dancers.
details: The Likumbi Lya Mize (Day of Makishi) is the most important ceremony of the Luvale people, featuring the UNESCO-recognized Makishi masquerade. Elaborately costumed masked dancers represent spirits and ancestors in dramatic performances that play key roles in initiation ceremonies.

name: Lantern Festival (Yuanxiao)
desc: Marks the end of Lunar New Year celebrations with lantern displays, riddles, and tangyuan (sweet rice balls).

name: Diwali Motorcade Festival (Festival of Lights)
desc: Diwali, also called Deepavali (Hindi for "row of lights"), is celebrated with a spectacular motorcade of brightly lit floats.
details: The Diwali Motorcade features a grand procession of brightly lit floats parading through the streets. Floats often depict scenes from Hindu mythology and are accompanied by music, dancing, and joyous celebration. Although Diwali is rooted in Hindu tradition, it has become a national celebration in Guyana, embraced by people from all walks of life. The motorcade has grown to be a major cultural event drawing thousands of spectators annually. People walk through local neighborhoods to view homes lit with traditional Hindu lamps (diyas). Public buildings are covered in lights—both clay oil lamps and modern electric lights.

name: Hina Matsuri (Girls' Day / Doll Festival)
desc: Traditional celebration for young girls featuring elaborate displays of ornamental dolls in imperial court dress.
details: Hina Matsuri is celebrated on March 3rd across Japan. Families display elaborate sets of ornamental dolls (hina ningyo) representing the Emperor, Empress, and attendants of the Heian period. Special foods like chirashizushi, hina-arare (rice crackers), and shirozake (sweet rice wine) are enjoyed. Major public displays can be seen at Katsuura and Konosu, featuring thousands of dolls.

name: Shichi-Go-San (7-5-3 Festival)
desc: Traditional celebration for children aged 7, 5, and 3 who visit shrines in beautiful kimono.
details: Shichi-Go-San is a cherished Japanese tradition where children aged three, five, and seven are dressed in their finest kimono and taken to shrines to pray for their healthy growth. The custom celebrates children surviving these milestone ages. Meiji Shrine in Tokyo is especially popular. Children receive chitose-ame (thousand-year candy) in decorative bags.

name: Abolition of Slavery Day (Mauritius)
desc: National commemoration of the abolition of slavery in Mauritius with cultural events and ceremonies.
details: February 1st marks the anniversary of the abolition of slavery in Mauritius in 1835. The day is marked with cultural events, musical performances, memorial ceremonies, and discussions about the island's slavery heritage and the contributions of the enslaved people's descendants.

name: Semana Santa 2026 - General Mexico
desc: Most significant religious period in Mexico with processions, reenactments, and traditional observances
details: Key dates: Domingo de Ramos (March 29), Jueves Santo (April 2), Viernes Santo (April 3). One of Mexico's busiest travel seasons. Various celebrations across the country include viacrucis (Stations of the Cross) processions.

name: Oman National Day
desc: National day celebrating Oman's Renaissance Day with military parades and cultural celebrations.
details: Features military parades, cultural performances, fireworks, and community celebrations commemorating the accession of Sultan Qaboos in 1970.

name: Fiestas Patrias (Independence Day Celebration)
desc: Peru's most important national celebration honoring independence from Spanish rule with parades, cultural activities, gastronomic fairs, concerts, and civic-military ceremonies.
details: July 28 commemorates José de San Martín's declaration of independence (1821) while July 29 honors Peru's Armed Forces and National Police. Across the country, special events include concerts, cultural activities, gastronomic fairs showcasing regional cuisine, parades, and parties. Cities and buildings display Peruvian national colors (red and white). Celebrations peak during the second half of July, coinciding with winter school holidays when Peruvians travel to visit family and celebrate together. The President addresses the nation, and a Te Deum Mass is held (July 28), followed by a large civic-military parade (July 29).

name: Fiestas Patronales de Nuestra Señora del Carmen (July festivals)
desc: Multiple municipalities celebrate Fiestas Patronales de Nuestra Señora del Carmen (Our Lady of Carmen) throughout Puerto Rico.
details: Each town celebrates patron saint festivals featuring religious processions, parades, games, rides, regional food, and live entertainment. The festivities last ten days, with activities held evenings on weekdays and all day on weekends. These celebrations originated as Catholic traditions but have adopted elements of African and local origin, reflecting Puerto Rico's diverse cultural heritage.

name: First Night (Multiple US Cities)
desc: Alcohol-free community New Year's Eve celebrations with arts programming in cities across America.
details: First Night celebrations in cities including Boston, Burlington, Chattanooga, and others offer family-friendly New Year's Eve events featuring live music, theater, dance, visual arts, ice sculptures, and fireworks in downtown cultural districts.

name: Fiesta de Independencia - Mexican Independence celebrations in US
desc: Mexican Independence Day celebrations in US cities with large Mexican-American populations.
details: Cities across the US with significant Mexican-American communities celebrate Mexican Independence Day with El Grito ceremonies, parades, live music, traditional food, and cultural events. Major celebrations take place in Los Angeles, Chicago, Houston, Dallas, and San Antonio.

name: Abu Dhabi Art
desc: Premier art fair held at Manarat Al Saadiyat featuring international galleries and installations.
details: Galleries from around the world present modern and contemporary art. Includes Beyond section with large-scale installations, talks, and performances.

name: Abu Dhabi Science Festival
desc: Annual festival promoting science, technology, and innovation through interactive exhibits and workshops.
details: Interactive festival with hands-on science experiments, robotics workshops, and STEM activities for families and students.

name: Ghana Independence Day
desc: Celebration of Africa's first sub-Saharan nation to gain independence in 1957.
details: Ghana's Independence Day celebrates the country becoming the first sub-Saharan African nation to gain independence in 1957. Events include military parades at Independence Square, traditional durbar of chiefs, cultural performances, and patriotic speeches.

name: Adelaide Cabaret Festival
desc: The world's largest annual cabaret festival showcasing international and Australian artists.
details: The Adelaide Cabaret Festival is the largest and most prestigious cabaret festival in the world. Held in the Adelaide Festival Centre, it presents international and Australian cabaret artists across an intimate program of music, comedy, and performance.

name: Festival de las Calaveras
desc: Festival honoring the city's native son José Guadalupe Posada, creator of La Catrina, with skull-themed art and parades.
details: Aguascalientes celebrates Day of the Dead with special intensity as the birthplace of artist José Guadalupe Posada, creator of the iconic La Catrina skeleton figure. The Festival de las Calaveras features skull-themed parades, art exhibitions, literary calaveras (satirical poems), music, theater, and the spectacular Desfile de Calaveras parade.

name: Festival de las Flores de Aibonito (Flower Festival)
desc: Puerto Rico's largest flower festival and one of the island's most vibrant cultural celebrations.
details: Every year, Puerto Rico's best flower-growers and landscape artists come together at the fairgrounds near Aibonito's center. Aibonito is known as "La Ciudad de las Flores"—the City of Flowers—with cool climate and fertile highland soil making it ideal for cultivating plants. The festival, celebrated since 1969, features a wide variety of plants including fruit trees, vegetable plants, orchids, and all sorts of flowers. Also includes live music, food kiosks, workshops, arts and crafts, and exhibitions.

name: Musilac
desc: Music festival on the shores of Lac du Bourget in the Alps.
details: Musilac combines pop, rock, and electronic music with the stunning Alpine lake setting of Aix-les-Bains, offering swimming between sets.

name: Moros y Cristianos
desc: Historic battle reenactment celebrating the reconquest with elaborate costumes and parades.
details: Moros y Cristianos features spectacular mock battles between 'Moorish' and 'Christian' armies with thousands of costumed participants, gunpowder displays, and elaborate processions through Alcoi's streets.

name: Eurasian Fashion Week
desc: 10th anniversary of Eurasia's largest pret-a-porter fashion week with 'Great Silk Road' theme.
details: 10th anniversary season of Eurasia's largest pret-a-porter fashion week. Theme 'The Great Silk Road' symbolizing East-West dialogue. Held at Koktobe Hall, Almaty.

name: FoodExpo Kazakhstan
desc: Annual international food industry expo at Atakent International Exhibition Centre.
details: Annual expo featuring food production, retail/wholesale, catering, packaging companies presenting products/services. Held at Atakent International Exhibition Centre.

name: Kitap Fest (Book Festival)
desc: Kazakhstan's first international book festival with 8,000 books sold and 5,000 given free daily.
details: First international book festival in Kazakhstan (held annually since 2014). Features book-illustrated exhibitions, meetings with Kazakh writers, miniature books showcase, archival images, children's entertainment, publisher/bookstore marketplace. Sales: 8,000 books/day, 5,000 given free daily.

name: Mole Poblano Festival - Puebla 2026
desc: Celebration of Puebla's famous mole sauce with cooking competitions
details: Cooks prepare state's best mole, invading streets with powerful aromas. Competition to claim best.

name: Madagascar Independence Day
desc: Malagasy national celebrations with traditional hira gasy performances and ox cart parades.
details: Madagascar's Independence Day features traditional hira gasy musical theatre performances, ox cart parades, zebu cattle celebrations, military displays, and cultural exhibitions showcasing the island's unique blend of Southeast Asian and African heritage.

name: Semana Santa processions (Antigua)
desc: World-famous Holy Week processions with elaborate alfombras (sawdust carpets).

name: Samoa Independence Day
desc: Celebration of Samoa's independence with cultural performances, feasting, and fautasi longboat races.
details: Samoa celebrates its independence on June 1 with official ceremonies, cultural performances, church services, traditional feasting, and the spectacular fautasi (longboat) races in Apia Harbour, where villages compete with 50-oar war canoes.

name: Fiesta Arequipa (Regional Celebration)
desc: August celebrations showcasing Arequipa's regional pride with the "Corso de la Amistad" (Course of Friendship) parade, traditional dishes, and spectacular fireworks.
details: Arequipa, known as "The White City," hosts celebrations rivaling national festivals. The centerpiece is the Corso de la Amistad, a massive hours-long parade featuring floats and beauty queens representing Arequipa's pride. Traditional dishes including Rocoto Relleno (spicy stuffed peppers) and Adobo (pork stew) are served in "picanterías" with communal tables and flowing chicha de jora. A large fireworks show on August 14th in the Plaza de Armas provides spectacular visual entertainment. Arequipa maintains status as Peru's "cultural oasis" with numerous traditional celebrations throughout the year.

name: Asahikawa Winter Festival
desc: Hokkaido's second-largest winter festival featuring enormous snow sculptures and winter activities.
details: The Asahikawa Winter Festival is Hokkaido's second-largest winter event, featuring massive snow sculptures including some that hold Guinness records for size. Activities include snow tubing, ice slides, and horse-drawn sleigh rides. The festival takes place along the Asahibashi area and Heiwadori shopping district.

name: Bele Chere Festival / LEAF Festival
desc: Eclectic arts and music festival in the Blue Ridge Mountains celebrating global and Appalachian culture.
details: LEAF (Lake Eden Arts Festival) takes place at the stunning Camp Rockmont on the shores of Lake Eden in the Blue Ridge Mountains. The festival weaves together global and Appalachian music, dance, poetry, healing arts, and craft in a beautiful natural setting.

name: Carpet Day
desc: National celebration of Turkmen carpet-weaving traditions with exhibitions and craftspeople awards.
details: Celebration of Turkmen carpet tradition (UNESCO Intangible Cultural Heritage). Features exhibitions, forums, and awards for craftspeople across the country.

name: Aspen Ideas Festival
desc: Prestigious thought leadership festival bringing together innovators, thinkers, and leaders in the stunning Colorado Rockies.
details: The Aspen Ideas Festival gathers world leaders, scientists, artists, and entrepreneurs for 10 days of provocative discussions and presentations. Set against the spectacular Rocky Mountain backdrop, the festival covers topics from geopolitics and climate to art and technology, offering an unparalleled intellectual experience.

name: Asunción Super Festival
desc: Paraguay's major international music festival bringing global acts to Asunción.
details: Brings international musical acts to Paraguay's capital. Multiple stages with diverse programming spanning Latin pop, rock, electronic, and Paraguayan folk-influenced acts.

name: Art Athina
desc: One of the oldest contemporary art fairs in Europe, deeply embedded in the Athenian scene.
details: The fair highlights the resilience and explosive creativity of the Greek art scene, drawing heavily on Mediterranean galleries and featuring extensive non-profit and performance programming.

name: Hidar Tsion (Festival of Zion)
desc: Major Ethiopian Orthodox festival at Axum where the Ark of the Covenant is said to rest.
details: Hidar Tsion is celebrated with particular intensity in Axum, where Ethiopians believe the original Ark of the Covenant rests at the Church of Our Lady Mary of Zion. Thousands of pilgrims in white robes gather for all-night prayers, chanting, and processions around this most sacred of Ethiopian sites.

name: 12th Babylon Intl Festival for Cultures & Arts
desc: International arts and music festival set against ancient Babylonian ruins, revived after 18-year hiatus.
details: Originally launched 1985, interrupted by 2003 invasion. Revived as symbol of cultural renewal. Features international book fair on Babylonian theater stage under theme 'We Are All Babylonians.'

name: Baikonur Year of Visiting
desc: Kazakhstan's $150M space tourism initiative marking the 65th anniversary of first human spaceflight with scheduled launches.
details: 2026 declared 'Year of Visiting Baikonur' with $150 million investment. Commemorates 65th anniversary of first human spaceflight. New visitor center, Gagarin's Launch Pad museum, CosmoKids STEM camp, 200-room eco-hotel, luxury glamping yurtas, stargazing. Scheduled launches: Soyuz 5 (March), Progress MS-34 (April 26), Soyuz MS-29 (July 14), Progress MS-35 (Sept 9), Progress MS-36 (Dec 2).

name: Festes de la Mercè
desc: Barcelona's biggest annual festival honouring its patron saint with fire runs and human towers.
details: La Mercè celebrates Barcelona's patron saint with human towers (castells), fire-running devils (correfoc), giant parade figures, and free concerts. The Piromusical fireworks finale at Montjuïc is spectacular.

name: Nanluoguxiang Cultural Festival
desc: Arts and culture festival in Beijing's most famous hutong alleyway during National Day holiday.
details: Nanluoguxiang, one of Beijing's most famous preserved hutong neighborhoods, hosts cultural festivals during the October National Day holiday. Events include traditional craft workshops, Peking opera performances, calligraphy demonstrations, and artisan markets in the 786-year-old lane. The blend of traditional hutong culture with contemporary art spaces defines modern Beijing.

name: Low Festival
desc: Beachside indie and electronic festival in Benidorm.
details: Low Festival brings indie, rock, and electronic music to the beach resort of Benidorm, with stages between the sea and the mountains.

name: Gurten Festival
desc: Bern's hilltop festival with panoramic views of the Alps.
details: Gurten Festival sits atop the Gurten hill overlooking Bern and the Swiss Alps, featuring rock, pop, hip-hop, and electronic music with arguably Europe's best festival view.

name: Bilbao BBK Live
desc: Major Basque Country festival; official site titles the 2026 dates.
details: BBK Live offers panoramic views of Bilbao and the Bay of Biscay from its hilltop festival site, with rock, indie, and electronic artists performing across multiple stages.

name: Semana Grande de Bilbao
desc: Bilbao's biggest festival week with concerts, fireworks competitions, and Basque cultural events.
details: Aste Nagusia (Great Week) transforms Bilbao with nine days of non-stop festivities. The Marijaia figure presides over fireworks competitions, bullfights, open-air concerts, and traditional Basque sports. Over a million visitors fill the streets.

name: Bisbee 1000 Stair Climb
desc: Quirky athletic event and festival climbing 1,000+ stairs through the eccentric old mining town of Bisbee.
details: This unique event takes participants up approximately 1,034 stairs through the steep hillside streets and stairways of this charming old copper mining town. Part race, part community celebration, the event showcases Bisbee's colorful architecture, art galleries, and bohemian spirit.

name: Bishkek International Film Festival
desc: Premier Central Asian cinema festival with international, regional, and Kyrgyz competition categories.
details: Premier cinema festival showcasing international, Central Asian, and Kyrgyz feature films. Three competition categories: International Competition, Central Asian Competition, and KyrgyzBox Competition. Platform for emerging filmmakers and cultural dialogue.

name: Kyrgyzstan Independence Day
desc: National holiday with military parade at Ala-Too Square (2026 is a parade year) and fireworks.
details: Kyrgyzstan's primary national holiday commemorating independence from the Soviet Union (1991). Major celebrations on Ala-Too Square with military parade (every 5 years - 2026 is a parade year), fireworks, traditional music and dance, presidential attendance. Coincides with World Nomad Games opening.

name: Kok-Boru Championships
desc: Traditional horseback polo tournaments featuring teams wrestling over goat carcass.
details: Traditional nomadic horseback polo with teams of 12, 4 players on field, wrestling over prepared goat carcass to toss into goal (kazan). Featured prominently at Nooruz and World Nomad Games. One of the most iconic Central Asian sports.

name: Festival of the Arts Boca
desc: Multi-day celebration featuring world-class authors, musicians, and performers in a beautiful South Florida setting.
details: The Festival of the Arts Boca presents a 10-day program of classical and jazz music performances, author talks, film screenings, and art exhibitions. Held at the Mizner Park Amphitheater, the festival has featured the London Symphony Orchestra, Itzhak Perlman, and prominent authors, creating a cultural haven in South Florida.

name: Hip Hop al Parque
desc: Latin America's most important hip hop festival since 1996 featuring international and national artists in free, open-air format.
details: 2025 edition (23-24 August) brought together 24 national, international, and district groups with alternative activities. Festival accepts proposals from Colombian hip hop projects. Held in Simón Bolívar Metropolitan Park with free admission. Large-scale stage productions, workshops, and cultural programming.

name: Kansas City Renaissance Festival
desc: 16-acre Renaissance village in the Kansas City metro with full-contact jousting and artisan marketplace.
details: The Kansas City Renaissance Festival creates an immersive 16th-century village experience on 16 acres with jousting, artisan demonstrations, musical performances, themed weekends, and costumed characters bringing history to life.

name: Fiesta de los Diablitos
desc: Boruca ‘little devils’ masked dances reenacting historic resistance.

name: Bristol International Balloon Fiesta
desc: One of the largest hot air balloon events in Europe — a colorful spectacle of hundreds of balloons filling the sky in synchronized mass ascents.
details: The Bristol International Balloon Fiesta is a free annual event featuring mass ascents of over 100 hot air balloons at dawn and dusk. Special shape balloons, night glows (where tethered balloons glow in synchronized patterns to music), and a funfair make it one of the UK's most photogenic and family-friendly summer events. The sight of hundreds of balloons rising simultaneously is magical.

name: Kanal Centre Pompidou
desc: A massive contemporary art space in a converted Citroën garage.
details: Brings the prestige and curatorial weight of the Paris Pompidou to Brussels in a highly stylized, adaptive-reuse industrial space.

name: arteBA
desc: Argentina's premier contemporary art fair.
details: A massive cultural attraction drawing over 100,000 visitors, providing a fantastic platform for under-represented artists and offering a spectacular vision of Latin American art today.

name: Bukhara Biennial
desc: Central Asia's first contemporary art biennial titled 'Recipes for Broken Hearts' with free admission.
details: Central Asia's first contemporary art biennial. Titled 'Recipes for Broken Hearts,' curated by Diana Campbell. Celebrates artistic disciplines globally with new commissions created exclusively in Uzbekistan in collaboration with local artisans. Four-part Curatorial School programme culminates in spring 2026 international exhibition. Free admission.

name: Bluesfest Byron Bay
desc: World-class blues, roots, and world music festival in the Byron Bay hinterland over Easter.
details: Byron Bay Bluesfest is Australia's premier blues and roots festival, held at the Byron Events Farm over the Easter long weekend. International and local artists perform across multiple stages, covering blues, roots, soul, folk, and world music.

name: Byron Bay Bluesfest
desc: World-renowned blues and roots music festival over Easter weekend at Byron Bay.
details: Bluesfest is one of Australia's premier music festivals, held annually over Easter at the Byron Events Farm. Featuring international and domestic artists across multiple stages, it covers blues, roots, soul, folk, and world music. Artists like Robert Plant, Buddy Guy, and John Mayer have headlined.

name: Splendour in the Grass
desc: Australia's premier contemporary music festival set in the Byron Bay hinterland.
details: Splendour in the Grass is one of Australia's most beloved music festivals, held at North Byron Parklands. Over three days, multiple stages host a diverse lineup spanning rock, pop, electronic, hip-hop, and indie, alongside art installations, comedy, and workshops in a subtropical setting.

name: Pharaonic Village Festival
desc: Living history re-enactments of ancient Egyptian life at the Pharaonic Village.
details: Features costumed re-enactments, traditional crafts demonstrations, and cultural displays bringing ancient Egypt to life on an island in the Nile.

name: Festival de Música del Pacífico Petronio Álvarez
desc: 30th edition celebrating Afro-Colombian and Pacific music traditions honoring composer Petronio Álvarez Quintero.
details: Festival dedicated to preserving Pacific folklore music, highlighting composers, musicians, and researchers of Afro-Colombian culture. Emphasizes cultural, economic, and social development of Afro-descendant communities. Strengthens international networks and opportunities for those preserving Pacific traditions. First held in 1997 as tribute to legendary composer whose compositions captured Pacific landscape, people, and nature.

name: Fiesta de la Chirimoya (Chirimoya/Custard Apple Festival)
desc: Festival celebrating Peru's unique chirimoya fruit with traditional dishes, ice cream, Chirimpisco (chirimoya-pisco blend), and demonstrations of agricultural production techniques.
details: Held in Callahuanca, the festival features the versatile chirimoya fruit in various preparations including desserts, ice cream, and yogurt. Visitors enjoy local dishes like Carapulcra and Seco de Cabrito alongside traditional foods such as huatia, grilled trout, and pachamanca. The festival includes workshops on improving production, showcasing finest chirimoya varieties, and displaying delicious fruit derivatives. In 2024, the town expected around 20,000 visitors. Traditional dances accompany the celebrations, making it a complete cultural and gastronomic experience.

name: Festival Acadien de Caraquet
desc: Longest-running Acadian festival celebrating music, dance, and cultural heritage on the Acadian Peninsula.
details: The Festival Acadien de Caraquet is the longest-running Acadian cultural event, featuring two weeks of traditional and contemporary Acadian music, dance, theater, art exhibitions, and the blessing of the fleet ceremony honoring the region's fishing heritage.

name: Festival del Dulce - Cartagena (Semana Santa)
desc: XIII Festival celebrating Afro-descendant culinary heritage with traditional candies, artisan makers, and gastronomic tribute to African diaspora.
details: Gastronomic encounter honoring African diaspora reflected in flavors and textures from tropical fruits combined with ancestral cooking wisdom. Features traditional candy makers and artisans from historic center. Part of Cultural Agenda 2026 organized by Instituto de Patrimonio y Cultura de Cartagena (IPCC). Held during Holy Week combining religious tourism with cultural gastronomy. Festival celebrates city's rich culinary heritage and cultural traditions.

name: South Carolina Oyster Festival
desc: Lowcountry celebration of the oyster with shucking contests and live music at Boone Hall Plantation.
details: The Lowcountry Oyster Festival at Boone Hall Plantation is billed as the world's largest oyster festival, with tons of locally harvested oysters steamed and served to tens of thousands of attendees. The event includes oyster shucking and eating contests, live music, and local food vendors.

name: Cabaret Vert
desc: Eco-friendly music festival in the Ardennes.
details: Cabaret Vert presents rock, pop, hip-hop, and electronic music with a strong environmental commitment in the green Ardennes region.

name: PEI Shellfish Festival
desc: Celebration of PEI's world-famous shellfish with oyster shucking championships and chef competitions.
details: The PEI International Shellfish Festival showcases the best of Atlantic Canadian seafood with the Canadian Oyster Shucking Championship, chef competitions, live music, and a massive food market. Set in Charlottetown's waterfront, the festival celebrates PEI's status as the birthplace of Confederation and a shellfish paradise.

name: Cheltenham Literature Festival
desc: World's oldest literature festival celebrating its 77th year.
details: The Times and Sunday Times Cheltenham Literature Festival hosts 700+ events with authors, poets, and thinkers discussing the biggest ideas of our time.

name: Sichuan International Travel Festival
desc: Major travel and cultural festival showcasing Sichuan's diverse attractions.
details: Sichuan's international travel festival promotes the province's extraordinary diversity—from panda reserves to Tibetan highlands, spicy cuisine to ancient Buddhist sites. Cultural performances, food events, and tourism promotions draw visitors to explore China's most geographically and culturally diverse province.

name: Chengdu International Intangible Cultural Heritage Festival
desc: Major UNESCO-supported festival showcasing intangible cultural heritage from across Asia.
details: Chengdu hosts a biennial festival promoting intangible cultural heritage, supported by UNESCO. Events showcase traditional crafts, performing arts, and cultural practices from across China and Asia. Sichuan opera face-changing (bian lian), shadow puppetry, and traditional medicine demonstrations are highlights.

name: Chicago Blues Festival
desc: The world's largest free blues festival, held in Millennium Park in the birthplace of Chicago blues.
details: As the spiritual home of electric blues, Chicago hosts the world's largest free blues festival in stunning Millennium Park. Multiple stages feature blues legends and rising artists across Chicago blues, Delta blues, soul blues, and related genres. The three-day event is a pilgrimage for blues lovers worldwide.

name: Roaring Hooves Festival
desc: International music festival at the giant Chinggis Khan statue combining nomadic and world music.
details: The Roaring Hooves Festival at the massive Chinggis Khan Equestrian Statue complex combines traditional Mongolian music (throat singing, morin khuur) with international world music acts. The festival's steppe setting near the iconic statue creates a powerful fusion of ancient and contemporary culture.

name: Chongqing Hot Pot Festival
desc: Celebration of China's spiciest culinary tradition in the hot pot capital of the world.
details: Chongqing, the undisputed capital of Chinese hot pot, celebrates its fiery culinary heritage with a festival featuring massive communal hot pot tables, cooking competitions, and spice-tolerance challenges. Hundreds of restaurants participate with special menus. The festival showcases the city's tongue-numbing Sichuan peppercorn and chili-laden broth culture.

name: Roots N Blues Festival
desc: Celebration of roots, blues, and Americana music in the heart of Missouri with BBQ and craft beverages.
details: Set at Stephens Lake Park, Roots N Blues brings together top roots, blues, and Americana artists with award-winning BBQ, craft beer, and family activities. The festival captures the spirit of the American heartland with exceptional musical programming.

name: Virgen de Copacabana festival
desc: Pilgrimages and blessings to the patron saint of Bolivia’s lake region.

name: J-Day
desc: Citywide celebrations marking the annual delivery of Christmas beer (Julebryg) to bars across Denmark.
details: On J-Day, brewery trucks deliver the year's Christmas beer to bars across Denmark, accompanied by festivities centred in Copenhagen. What began as a marketing event has become a genuine Danish cultural moment—bars and pubs fill up as Danes toast the start of the holiday season with the first sips of seasonal brew.

name: Benin National Day
desc: Benin's national celebrations featuring traditional voodoo ceremonies and military parades.
details: Benin's National Day on August 1 features military parades, traditional dance performances, and cultural events reflecting the country's unique blend of voodoo traditions and modern African identity.

name: Pase del Niño Viajero
desc: Large Christmas Eve procession with costumes, floats and music.

name: Medusa Sunbeach Festival
desc: Major EDM festival on the Valencia coast.
details: Medusa Sunbeach brings massive EDM production to the beach at Cullera with spectacular stages, pyrotechnics, and the biggest names in electronic music.

name: Mountain Heritage Day
desc: Celebration of Southern Appalachian culture with traditional crafts, music, and mountain heritage demonstrations.
details: Western Carolina University hosts this free celebration of Southern Appalachian heritage featuring old-time and bluegrass music, clogging, traditional crafts demonstrations, Cherokee cultural presentations, and authentic mountain food.

name: Da Nang International Fireworks Festival
desc: An international competition where teams choreograph fireworks to music over the Han River, transforming the city into one big festival.
details: Teams from around the world compete to create the most spectacular fireworks display choreographed to music over the Han River. The 2026 edition features themes tied to sustainability and ocean conservation. Street food stalls, pop-up stages, and river cruises make the city feel like one enormous festival ground on competition nights.

name: Decatur Book Festival
desc: The largest independent book festival in the US, featuring author appearances, panels, and literary celebrations.
details: The AJC Decatur Book Festival is the largest independent book festival in the United States, drawing over 80,000 book lovers to downtown Decatur. The free event features author readings, book signings, panel discussions, children's programming, a parade of characters, and a massive book marketplace.

name: FESTIMA (Festival of Masks)
desc: West African mask festival celebrating the sacred tradition of mask-wearing with dance and music.
details: FESTIMA (Festival International des Masques et des Arts) features incredible mask performances from communities across Burkina Faso and neighboring West African countries. The masks made from leaves, straw, wood, and textiles play important roles in rites and the cycle of life.

name: Djibouti Independence Day
desc: National celebrations featuring traditional Afar and Issa dances, parades, and cultural shows.
details: Djibouti's Independence Day on June 27 features parades, traditional Afar and Issa dance performances, music, cultural exhibitions, and fireworks in this small but strategically important Horn of Africa nation.

name: Doha Jewellery & Watches Exhibition
desc: Premier jewellery and watches exhibition attracting international luxury brands and collectors.
details: One of the largest jewellery exhibitions in the Middle East featuring high-end brands, artisan jewellers, and exclusive collections.

name: Dubai International Boat Show
desc: Major marine industry exhibition showcasing superyachts, boats, and maritime luxury lifestyle.
details: Held at Dubai Harbour featuring world premieres of superyachts, water sports demonstrations, and luxury marine lifestyle experiences.

name: Comrades Marathon
desc: The world's oldest and largest ultra-marathon between Durban and Pietermaritzburg.
details: The Comrades Marathon is the world's oldest and largest ultra-marathon, covering approximately 89km between Durban and Pietermaritzburg. Over 20,000 runners from around the world participate in this iconic South African sporting event that alternates between up and down runs each year.

name: Epidaurus Festival (Ancient Greek Theatre)
desc: Ancient Greek drama in the acoustically perfect Theatre of Epidaurus.
details: Performances of ancient Greek tragedies and comedies in the 14,000-seat Theatre of Epidaurus, where a whisper on stage can be heard in the last row. Built around 340 BC.

name: Oregon Truffle Festival
desc: Celebration of Pacific Northwest wild truffles with foraging expeditions, chef dinners, and truffle dog training.
details: The Oregon Truffle Festival is the premier truffle event in North America, featuring guided truffle foraging expeditions, multi-course truffle dinners by top chefs, a fresh truffle marketplace, and truffle dog training workshops in Oregon's Willamette Valley.

name: Fayetteville Roots Festival
desc: Intimate roots music festival in downtown Fayetteville featuring Americana artists and farm-to-table food.
details: Fayetteville Roots is a boutique-scale festival celebrating Americana and roots music in the charming downtown of Fayetteville, Arkansas. The festival pairs nationally touring artists with exceptional local and regional food in intimate indoor and outdoor venues.

name: Fes Sufi Festival
desc: Sufi music and spiritual gathering in the ancient medina of Fes.
details: The Fes Sufi Festival brings together Sufi orders and spiritual musicians from across the Muslim world for concerts, dhikr ceremonies, and spiritual gatherings in the mystical setting of the Fes medina.

name: FloydFest
desc: Blue Ridge Mountain roots music festival combining Appalachian traditions with contemporary folk, rock, and world music.
details: Nestled in the Blue Ridge Highlands, FloydFest celebrates the rich musical heritage of the Appalachian region while embracing contemporary sounds. The festival features multiple stages, swimming, yoga, craft vendors, and workshops set among beautiful mountain scenery. The community atmosphere and stunning natural setting make it a favorite among roots music enthusiasts.

name: Harvest Jazz & Blues Festival
desc: Six-day celebration of jazz, blues, and world music in downtown Fredericton.
details: The Harvest Jazz & Blues Festival transforms downtown Fredericton into a vibrant music scene with performances in clubs, theaters, and outdoor stages. The festival features Canadian and international jazz and blues artists alongside local culinary experiences and a warm Maritime hospitality.

name: Botswana Independence Day
desc: National celebrations with traditional Tswana performances and modern entertainment.
details: Botswana's Independence Day on September 30 features traditional Tswana dance performances, military parades, music concerts, and cultural exhibitions celebrating the nation's peaceful independence in 1966 and its remarkable development story.

name: Galveston Mardi Gras
desc: The third-largest Mardi Gras celebration in the US, with parades, music, and revelry along the Galveston Seawall.
details: Galveston's Mardi Gras is a major Texas celebration featuring elaborate parades with themed floats and masked krewes along the Seawall Boulevard and through the historic Strand District. Multiple entertainment stages, headliner concerts, and balcony parties keep the festivities going throughout the two-week celebration.

name: Galway Oyster Festival
desc: The world's oldest oyster festival — a three-day celebration of Galway Bay oysters, Guinness, live music, and oyster-shucking competitions.
details: The Galway International Oyster Festival has been running since 1954, making it the world's oldest oyster festival. The highlight is the World Oyster Opening Championship, where champions from around the globe compete to shuck oysters fastest. Three days of parties, live music in Galway's famous pubs, and copious amounts of Galway Bay oysters washed down with Guinness.

name: Gaziantep Gastronomy Festival
desc: Culinary festival in Turkey's UNESCO Creative City of Gastronomy celebrating baklava and kebab traditions.
details: Gaziantep, a UNESCO Creative City of Gastronomy, hosts food competitions, cooking demonstrations, and tastings of its famous baklava, kebabs, and traditional cuisine.

name: George Town Festival
desc: A major arts festival in UNESCO-listed George Town featuring theater, street art, photography, and community projects.
details: What began as a heritage celebration has become a major regional arts festival. For several weeks, shophouses, warehouses, and streets in the UNESCO-listed old town host theater, street art, photography exhibitions, and community projects that invite residents to see their multicultural city with fresh eyes. The festival reflects Penang's rich Malay, Chinese, Indian, and European heritage.

name: Rhythm and Vines
desc: New Year's Eve festival in Gisborne — the first city in the world to see the new sunrise.
details: Rhythm and Vines is held at Waiohika Estate vineyard in Gisborne, one of the first places in the world to see the new year's sunrise. Three days of music across multiple stages celebrate the end of the year with international and local acts across electronic, indie, hip-hop, and more.

name: Gothenburg Culture Festival (Kulturkalaset)
desc: A week-long free cultural takeover of Gothenburg with over 1,200 events in opera, art, music, theater, literature, and more — all open to everyone.
details: Every August, the Gothenburg Culture Festival takes over the city with over 1,200 free activities. There's opera, art, music, theater, handicrafts, literature, and more — all open to everyone. The festival transforms Sweden's second city into a vibrant cultural playground. The breadth and accessibility of the programming make it remarkably inclusive.

name: Grafton Jacaranda Festival
desc: Australia's oldest floral festival celebrating the spectacular purple jacaranda blooms.
details: The Grafton Jacaranda Festival has been running for over 80 years, making it Australia's longest-running floral festival. When the jacaranda trees burst into purple bloom, the town celebrates with a grand parade, Jacaranda Queen coronation, markets, art exhibitions, and community events.

name: Fiestas de Guayaquil
desc: October 9 celebration of Guayaquil's independence (1820) with parades, cultural events, and civic festivities.
