details: October 9 marks Guayaquil's independence/founding. Celebrated as national holiday in Ecuador. Local celebrations include parades, cultural performances, community events. October 2026 also features Cantonization of Samborondón (Oct 31) and Founding of Durán (Oct 16). Guayaquil's celebration emphasizes civic pride and historical commemorations.

name: Guiyang Bamboo Pole Dance Festival
desc: Vibrant ethnic minority dance festival featuring the acrobatic bamboo pole dance tradition.
details: Multiple ethnic groups in Guizhou celebrate with the bamboo pole dance—participants must jump rhythmically between bamboo poles that are clapped together. The dance requires incredible timing and agility. Festivals combine the dance with other traditional performances, ethnic cuisine, and handicraft displays.

name: Gwangju Fringe Festival
desc: Independent arts festival alongside the Gwangju Biennale showcasing emerging artists.
details: The Gwangju Fringe Festival runs alongside the Gwangju Biennale, creating a dual art experience. Independent and emerging artists present performances, installations, and visual art across alternative venues in this culturally vibrant city known for its democratic heritage.

name: Hainan Coconut Festival
desc: Tropical celebration of Hainan Island's coconut culture and Li ethnic heritage.
details: Hainan's Coconut Festival celebrates the island's tropical identity with coconut-themed food events, Li and Miao ethnic performances, beach activities, and cultural exhibitions. The festival showcases Hainan's unique position as China's tropical paradise.

name: Royal Nova Scotia International Tattoo
desc: The world's largest annual indoor show, a spectacular military tattoo featuring international performers.
details: The Royal Nova Scotia International Tattoo is the world's largest annual indoor show, featuring over 2,000 international military and civilian performers in the Scotiabank Centre. The show includes military bands, pipes and drums, gymnastic displays, cultural dancing, and dramatic theatrical effects in a stirring celebration of music and pageantry.

name: Hamburg Dom
desc: Northern Germany's biggest funfair running three times yearly since 1329.
details: Hamburg Dom transforms Heiligengeistfeld with 250 rides, attractions, and food stalls three times a year (spring, summer, winter), continuing a tradition from 1329.

name: Pickathon
desc: Innovative indie and roots music festival on a family farm outside Portland, known for zero-waste practices.
details: Pickathon is a unique music festival on Pendarvis Farm featuring custom-built stages from reclaimed materials, no single-use plastic, and an intimate atmosphere. The lineup emphasizes indie rock, folk, bluegrass, soul, and global sounds. Its commitment to sustainability and community has earned it recognition as one of America's most innovative festivals.

name: Harbin Summer Music Festival
desc: Historic summer music festival in China's 'Music City' featuring classical and international performances.
details: Harbin, known as China's 'Music City' due to its Russian cultural influence, hosts one of China's oldest music festivals. The month-long event features classical concerts, jazz performances, opera, and contemporary music across venues including the stunning Harbin Grand Theatre (designed by MAD Architects). The festival reflects Harbin's unique blend of Chinese and European cultural heritage.

name: Hawke's Bay Arts Festival
desc: Premier arts festival in the Art Deco capital featuring music, theatre, comedy, and visual art.
details: The Hawke's Bay Arts Festival presents a diverse program of performing and visual arts across the twin cities of Napier and Hastings. Events span music, theatre, comedy, dance, literature, and visual art, set against the region's famous Art Deco architecture and wine country.

name: Jack in the Green
desc: Pagan May Day celebration with a giant leaf-covered figure parading through Hastings.
details: Jack in the Green revives an ancient tradition where a figure covered entirely in greenery leads a costumed procession through Hastings. Morris dancing, drumming, and green-painted faces create an unforgettable atmosphere.

name: Festival de Música Contemporánea de La Habana
desc: One of the most prestigious international events organized for over three decades showcasing contemporary music from Cuba and the world.
details: Organized by the Association of Musicians of the Union of Writers and Artists of Cuba (UNEAC) and the Cuban Institute of Music. Founded in 1984, it has hosted great composers like Luigi Nono, Krystof Penderecki, and Hans Werner Henze. Features music dedicated to Cuban and international chamber music, choral, vocal, and electroacoustic music among others.

name: Epicentro Festival
desc: Week-long electronic and alternative music festival in Costa Rica's Central Valley.
details: Week-long electronic and alternative music festival in Heredia. International and regional DJs and live acts across multiple events and venues throughout the week.

name: Solomon Islands Independence Day
desc: National independence celebration with pan-pipe performances, traditional dancing, and canoe racing.
details: Solomon Islands celebrates independence on July 7 with cultural performances featuring the islands' famous pan-pipe orchestras, traditional dancing, canoe races, speeches, and community feasting in the capital Honiara.

name: Els Enfarinats
desc: 200-year-old flour, egg, and firecracker fight marking Holy Innocents' Day.
details: On Holy Innocents' Day, the town of Ibi stages a mock coup where 'Els Enfarinats' take over, impose absurd laws, and a massive flour-and-egg battle erupts in the streets.

name: Indio International Tamale Festival
desc: One of the largest tamale festivals in the world, celebrating the iconic Mesoamerican culinary tradition.
details: The Indio International Tamale Festival celebrates the beloved tamale with vendors serving every variety imaginable - from traditional Mexican to fusion creations. Tamale-making contests, live entertainment, and cultural performances make this one of the most unique food festivals in the Southwest.

name: 95th Izmir International Fair
desc: Major international fair and exposition held annually in Izmir for 95+ years.
details: One of Turkey's oldest and most significant international trade and cultural fairs, serving as a showcase for commerce and cultural exchange.

name: Byblos International Festival
desc: Music festival in one of the oldest continuously inhabited cities in the world, at the Crusader Castle.
details: Features international pop, rock, Arabic, and world music performances at the medieval Crusader Castle overlooking the Mediterranean in ancient Byblos.

name: Israel Festival
desc: Israel's premier multi-disciplinary performing arts festival featuring theatre, dance, and music.
details: Features international and Israeli performances in theatre, dance, music, and visual arts at various venues across Jerusalem.

name: Jiayuguan Great Wall Festival
desc: Cultural festival at the western terminus of the Great Wall where the Silk Road begins.
details: Jiayuguan, the western end of the Great Wall and the start of the Silk Road, hosts festivals celebrating this strategic cultural intersection. Events include Great Wall walking, Silk Road cultural exhibitions, traditional Hexi Corridor performances, and Gobi Desert experiences against the dramatic backdrop of the snow-capped Qilian Mountains.

name: South Sudan Independence Day
desc: National day of the world's youngest country, celebrating independence from Sudan in 2011.
details: South Sudan, the world's youngest nation (independent since 2011), celebrates its Independence Day with parades, traditional dances from the Dinka, Nuer, and other ethnic groups, and cultural performances in Juba.

name: Juneau Jazz & Classics Festival
desc: Unique music festival in Alaska's capital combining jazz and classical performances in stunning settings.
details: This 10-day festival brings world-class jazz and classical musicians to Alaska's capital city, with performances in venues from concert halls to a historic gold mine and glacier viewpoints. The combination of high-caliber music and Alaska's breathtaking spring scenery creates a one-of-a-kind festival experience.

name: Rtveli (Wine Harvest Festival)
desc: Georgia's iconic wine harvest encompassing grape picking, barefoot stomping, and qvevri winemaking.
details: Encompasses entire winemaking process from grape picking through processing into qvevri (traditional wine vessels) to post-harvest supra (feast). Participants harvest grapes barefoot, stomp grapes, taste natural Georgian wines direct from source. Weather-dependent timing varies by location.

name: Kaslo Jazz Etc. Festival
desc: Jazz and world music festival on the shores of Kootenay Lake in the stunning West Kootenay mountains.
details: The Kaslo Jazz Etc. Festival combines jazz and world music with one of the most spectacular festival settings in Canada - on the shores of Kootenay Lake surrounded by the Selkirk and Purcell mountain ranges. The intimate festival features Canadian and international artists.

name: OFF Festival
desc: Poland's most adventurous alternative music festival.
details: OFF Festival in Katowice presents leftfield indie, noise, experimental, and electronic music with a fiercely independent spirit and low ticket prices.

name: Pumpkinfest (Keene NH)
desc: Town-wide celebration formerly holding the world record for most lit jack-o-lanterns.
details: Keene Pumpkin Festival fills the charming New England town with thousands of carved and lit jack-o-lanterns, creating a magical autumn scene. The festival includes live music, pumpkin-themed food, arts and crafts, and community activities.

name: Big Ears Festival
desc: Adventurous multi-genre music festival celebrating boundary-pushing sounds in Knoxville's historic theaters and venues.
details: Big Ears is a festival for the musically curious, presenting avant-garde, experimental, classical, electronic, and world music across multiple historic Knoxville venues. The intimate settings of the Tennessee Theatre, Bijou Theatre, and other venues create extraordinary acoustic experiences. It has quickly become one of the most critically acclaimed music festivals in America.

name: Kunming Ethnic Unity Festival
desc: Festival celebrating Yunnan's 25 ethnic minorities with performances, costumes, and cuisine.
details: Kunming, gateway to China's most ethnically diverse province, hosts festivals bringing together all 25 of Yunnan's ethnic minorities. Traditional costumes, dances, music, and cuisine from the Dai, Bai, Naxi, Yi, Hani, and other groups create a kaleidoscope of cultural diversity.

name: Art Collaboration Kyoto
desc: A unique fair format emphasizing collaboration between Japanese and international galleries.
details: Set in the ancient capital, ACK pairs local galleries with foreign partners to share booths. This model fosters deep cross-cultural dialogue and integrates contemporary art with Kyoto's profound traditional craftsmanship.

name: Fête de l'Humanité
desc: France's largest popular festival combining music, politics, and culture.
details: Fête de l'Humanité is a unique blend of major concerts, political debates, world food, and cultural activities organized by the French Communist Party since 1930. Over 600,000 attend.

name: Dominican Carnival (national)
desc: Masks, diablos cojuelos, and regional parades during Carnival season.

name: Festival International de Louisiane
desc: The largest free international Francophone music and arts festival in the US, celebrating Cajun and Creole culture.
details: Lafayette's Festival International transforms downtown into a global celebration of French-speaking cultures with music from Africa, the Caribbean, Canada, Europe, and Louisiana. Cajun, zydeco, and world music fill multiple stages while visual arts, crafts, and culinary events showcase the rich cultural tapestry of Acadiana.

name: Lanzhou Beef Noodle Festival
desc: Celebration of Lanzhou's world-famous hand-pulled beef noodle (niu rou mian) tradition.
details: Lanzhou's beef noodle (niu rou mian) is one of China's most iconic dishes, and the annual festival celebrates this culinary art. Master noodle pullers demonstrate their craft, creating increasingly thin noodles from a single piece of dough. Competitions, tastings, and noodle-making workshops showcase a tradition dating back over 100 years.

name: EDC Las Vegas (30th Anniversary)
desc: The largest electronic dance music festival in North America celebrating its 30th milestone year.
details: An overwhelmingly sensory experience featuring colossal stage designs, pyrotechnics, and dusk-till-dawn DJ sets.

name: When We Were Young Festival
desc: A massive, nostalgia-driven festival celebrating 2000s emo, pop-punk, and alternative rock.
details: Capitalizing heavily on millennial nostalgia, the festival crams dozens of beloved legacy bands into a single day. It represents a highly lucrative, highly targeted shift in the modern festival economy.

name: Gabon Independence Day
desc: National celebrations with parades, traditional dance, and cultural displays in Libreville.
details: Gabon's Independence Day on August 17 features military parades, traditional Fang, Punu, and Myene dance performances, music concerts, and cultural exhibitions in Libreville. The celebrations showcase the cultural diversity of this Central African nation.

name: Incwala Festival
desc: Eswatini's most sacred festival with warriors performing ceremonial dances led by the king.
details: Incwala is regarded as Eswatini's most sacred festival, offering rare insight into African royal traditions. Warriors in elaborate attire perform ceremonial dances, the king leads ancestral rituals, and the entire kingdom unites in a powerful expression of heritage and renewal. Visitors need special permission.

name: Togo Independence Day
desc: National celebrations with traditional dance performances from Togo's diverse ethnic groups.
details: Togo's Independence Day features parades and cultural performances from the Ewe, Kabye, and other ethnic groups, celebrating the small West African nation's sovereignty and cultural diversity.

name: Fiesta Broadway
desc: The largest Cinco de Mayo celebration in the world, drawing half a million to downtown LA's Broadway.
details: Fiesta Broadway is billed as the world's largest Cinco de Mayo celebration, stretching over 36 blocks of downtown Los Angeles's historic Broadway. Multiple stages feature top Latin music artists, traditional dance performances, and hundreds of food and merchandise vendors celebrating Mexican-American culture.

name: Día de los Muertos Oaxaqueño
desc: Authentic Oaxacan-style Day of the Dead celebration reflecting LA's vibrant Oaxacan community.
details: Los Angeles is home to the largest Oaxacan community outside of Mexico, and their Day of the Dead celebrations bring unique Oaxacan traditions including comparsas (processional parades with brass bands), elaborate sand tapestries, and traditional Oaxacan cuisine to neighborhoods across East LA.

name: Dia de los Muertos (Day of the Dead) - Hollywood Forever
desc: The largest Day of the Dead celebration in the US, held in the iconic Hollywood Forever Cemetery with altars, music, and art.
details: This extraordinary event transforms Hollywood Forever Cemetery into a vibrant celebration of life and remembrance. Thousands of attendees build and visit elaborate altars (ofrendas), enjoy live music and performances, view art installations, and participate in face painting and traditional rituals. The cemetery setting adds a powerful dimension to this deeply cultural celebration.

name: Maasai Mara Wildebeest Migration
desc: The greatest wildlife spectacle on Earth as millions of wildebeest cross the Mara River.
details: While not a festival per se, the Great Wildebeest Migration is an annual natural event attracting hundreds of thousands of visitors. Over 1.5 million wildebeest, zebras, and gazelles cross the Mara River in dramatic fashion, risking crocodiles and predators. It is the world's most iconic wildlife experience.

name: Fiesta de San Isidro
desc: Madrid's patron saint festival with traditional celebrations and bullfighting fair.
details: San Isidro transforms Madrid with traditional chotis dancing, chulapos and chulapas in traditional dress, the Pradera picnic, and Spain's most important bullfighting fair at Las Ventas.

name: Mad Cool Festival
desc: Major Madrid summer music festival; 2026 dates posted on official ticket page.
details: Mad Cool brings 100,000+ music fans to Madrid with a lineup spanning rock, indie, electronic, and pop from international and Spanish artists across multiple stages.

name: Mwaka Kogwa
desc: Traditional Zanzibar New Year festival of Persian origin with ritual fighting, dance, and feasting.
details: Mwaka Kogwa celebrates the Shirazi New Year in the village of Makunduchi, Zanzibar. Originating from Persian traditions, it features ritual stick fighting between men (symbolizing release of past grievances), traditional singing and dancing by women, and a bonfire whose smoke direction predicts the coming year.

name: Malmö Festival
desc: Sweden's largest city festival with 1.5 million visitors and free events.
details: Malmöfestivalen fills Sweden's third city with free concerts, food from 40+ countries, art installations, debates, and family activities over eight days.

name: Bahrain International Garden Show
desc: International garden show featuring landscape design, floral displays, and horticultural competitions.
details: Features elaborate garden installations, international exhibitors, educational workshops, and children's activities at the Bahrain International Exhibition Centre.

name: Spring of Culture Festival
desc: Premier arts festival featuring international music, dance, theatre, and visual arts.
details: Multi-month festival bringing world-class artists to historic venues including Bahrain Fort and National Theatre. Features concerts, exhibitions, and cultural events.

name: Philippine Independence Day
desc: National celebration marking independence from Spanish rule with civic parades, cultural shows, and wreath-laying ceremonies.
details: June 12 marks Philippine independence from Spanish rule, celebrated with civic parades, wreath-laying at Rizal Park in Manila, cultural performances, and patriotic events nationwide. Schools, government buildings, and communities organize programs showcasing Filipino heritage, music, and dance.

name: Mesir Macunu Festival
desc: UNESCO ICH festival celebrating a special paste made from 41 herbs and spices distributed from mosque minarets.
details: Commemorates recovery of Hafsa Sultan with paste raining from Sultan Mosque minarets. UNESCO recognized in 2012. Tens of thousands attend.

name: Maralal International Camel Derby
desc: Three decades of camel, cycle, and donkey races in the remote northern Kenyan town of Maralal.
details: The Maralal International Camel Derby in northern Kenya has been running for more than three decades. It includes camel, bicycle, and donkey races attracting both professional and amateur riders. The remote town of Maralal provides a dramatic semi-arid landscape for this unique sporting and cultural event.

name: Oasis Festival
desc: An electronic dance music festival in a unique desert setting on the outskirts of Marrakech.
details: Growing in popularity, this annual electronic dance music event takes place in a unique setting in the heart of Marrakech. Electronic music enthusiasts gather for a multi-day experience combining world-class DJs with the exotic atmosphere of Morocco's oasis landscapes.

name: Melbourne International Comedy Festival
desc: One of the three largest comedy festivals in the world with hundreds of shows across Melbourne.
details: The Melbourne International Comedy Festival is a cultural institution, running for nearly a month each autumn. Hundreds of comedians from around the world perform in venues large and small across the city, from major theatre shows to intimate stand-up, sketch, cabaret, and street performance.

name: World Championship Barbecue Cooking Contest
desc: The world's largest BBQ competition, part of Memphis in May, with 250+ teams competing along the Mississippi River.
details: The World Championship Barbecue Cooking Contest is the Super Bowl of BBQ, attracting over 250 competition teams from around the world to Tom Lee Park on the Mississippi. Teams compete in categories like whole hog, ribs, and shoulder, with elaborate themed booths and parties. The event is a unique blend of competitive cooking and Southern hospitality.

name: Festival de México en el Centro Histórico
desc: Arts festival transforming Mexico City's historic center with theater, music, dance, and visual arts.
details: This annual festival fills the plazas, theaters, and cultural spaces of Mexico City's UNESCO World Heritage Historic Center with performances and exhibitions spanning classical music, contemporary dance, theater, visual arts, and film from Mexican and international artists.

name: Calle Ocho Festival
desc: The world's largest Hispanic street festival along Calle Ocho in Miami's Little Havana neighborhood.
details: Calle Ocho transforms 15 blocks of SW 8th Street in Little Havana into the largest Hispanic street party in the country. Over a million visitors enjoy live salsa, merengue, and reggaeton stages, authentic Cuban and Latin American cuisine, domino tournaments, and the vibrant energy of Miami's Cuban-American community.

name: Ultra Music Festival
desc: A globally televised, high-energy electronic dance music festival closing out Miami Music Week.
details: Transforming Bayfront Park into a neon-lit dance floor, Ultra features the world's highest-paid DJs and next-level production. It is the defining event of global rave culture and a major driver of Miami's spring tourism economy.

name: Festa Italiana Milwaukee
desc: The largest Italian festival in the United States, celebrating Italian-American culture on Milwaukee's lakefront.
details: Festa Italiana transforms Henry Maier Festival Park on the shores of Lake Michigan into an Italian piazza with authentic Italian cuisine from dozens of vendors, live music ranging from opera to contemporary Italian, cooking demonstrations, bocce tournaments, and cultural exhibits celebrating Italian-American heritage.

name: Polish Fest Milwaukee
desc: The largest Polish festival in North America, celebrating Polish culture, food, and music on the Milwaukee lakefront.
details: Polish Fest showcases the rich heritage of Milwaukee's Polish community with traditional and contemporary Polish music, authentic cuisine (pierogi, kielbasa, placek), polka dancing, cultural exhibits, and a marketplace of Polish crafts and imports. Multiple stages feature entertainment from Poland and Polish-American artists.

name: Liberia Independence Day
desc: Africa's oldest republic celebrates with parades and traditional performances.
details: Liberia, Africa's oldest republic (founded 1847), celebrates Independence Day with parades, traditional music and dance, cultural exhibitions, and speeches celebrating the nation's unique history as a settlement of freed American slaves.

name: Le Festival d'ete de Tremblant
desc: Free music festival in the pedestrian village of one of Eastern North America's premier mountain resorts.
details: Mont-Tremblant's summer music festival fills the European-style pedestrian village with free concerts spanning blues, jazz, pop, and world music. The Laurentian Mountain setting and charming resort village atmosphere make it a perfect summer escape.

name: Festival de Tango Montevideo
desc: Annual tango festival celebrating dance, music, and Uruguayan-Argentine cultural heritage.
details: Spring season (Sept-Nov) temperatures 15-22°C ideal for celebrations. Includes tango marathons with extended dancing sessions, master classes from best tango dancers in Uruguay and Argentina, workshops, and performances in city's iconic theaters and open plazas. Related event: "La Dama del Tango" musical celebrated tango history and women in genre. Montevideo's tango culture reflects shared heritage with Buenos Aires.

name: Montreal International Fireworks Competition (L'International des Feux Loto-Québec)
desc: The world's most prestigious fireworks competition, with shows choreographed to music over La Ronde amusement park.
details: The Montreal Fireworks Competition is considered the most prestigious pyrotechnical competition in the world. Countries compete by presenting spectacular fireworks displays choreographed to music, launched from La Ronde amusement park and visible from across the city. Thousands gather at the Jacques-Cartier Bridge and waterfront to watch.

name: Under Pressure Graffiti Festival
desc: North America's oldest graffiti and street art festival, transforming Montreal walls into open-air galleries.
details: Under Pressure brings together graffiti writers and street artists from around the world to create large-scale murals in Montreal. The festival includes live painting, DJ sets, breakdancing, and hip-hop performances, celebrating the culture that gave birth to graffiti art.

name: Festival du Cinema des Peuples Autochtones
desc: Indigenous peoples' film festival in Montreal presenting stories from First Nations, Inuit, and Metis filmmakers.
details: Montreal's Indigenous film festival screens films by and about Indigenous peoples from Canada and around the world, providing a platform for Indigenous storytelling and perspectives through cinema.

name: Royal Opera House Muscat Season
desc: Season of international opera, ballet, classical music, and jazz at Oman's stunning opera house.
details: World-class performances at the architecturally stunning Royal Opera House Muscat featuring international orchestras, opera, ballet, and regional artists.

name: Bula Festival
desc: Week-long celebration in Nadi featuring cultural performances, beauty pageant, food, and carnival atmosphere.
details: The Bula Festival is Nadi's premier cultural event, celebrating Fijian hospitality and culture. The week-long festival features a Bula Queen pageant, traditional Fijian music and dance, Indian cultural performances, a carnival, food stalls, and business trade exhibitions.

name: Fujian Tulou Cultural Festival
desc: Cultural celebrations at the UNESCO-listed Hakka earth buildings (tulou) of Fujian.
details: The Fujian Tulou—massive circular earth buildings that housed entire Hakka clans—host cultural festivals during National Day holiday. Events include Hakka tea ceremonies, traditional puppet shows, folk music, and demonstrations of tulou communal living traditions. The unique architecture and mountain setting make it a remarkable cultural experience.

name: Napa Valley Wine Auction
desc: The world's most celebrated charity wine auction in the heart of Napa Valley.
details: Auction Napa Valley is the most prestigious wine auction in the world, featuring barrel tastings, vineyard dinners, and a spectacular live auction where rare lots fetch hundreds of thousands of dollars. All proceeds benefit Napa Valley nonprofits.

name: Natchitoches Christmas Festival
desc: Oldest community Christmas celebration in the nation, featuring spectacular light displays along Cane River Lake.
details: Natchitoches (the oldest permanent settlement in the Louisiana Purchase territory) has been celebrating Christmas since 1927 with over 300,000 lights along the banks of Cane River Lake, fireworks shows, a Christmas parade, and tours of the historic French Colonial district.

name: Frozen Dead Guy Days
desc: Quirky winter festival in a mountain town that is home to a cryogenically frozen corpse, featuring coffin races and frozen t-shirt contests.
details: Nederland, Colorado is home to Grandpa Bredo Morstoel, whose body has been stored in a Tuff Shed packed with dry ice since 1994. The town celebrates with coffin races, frozen salmon tossing, polar plunges, costume parades, and live music — making it one of the most wonderfully weird festivals in America.

name: Festival Nacional del Bambuco
desc: The 65th edition celebrating traditional bambuco music and southern Colombia's folkloric heritage.
details: The Festival Folclórico, Reinado Nacional del Bambuco y Muestra Internacional del Folclor takes place in Neiva with parades, processions, artistic performances, and the election of the national bambuco queen. Activities include dance groups, floats, rajaleñas, traditional bambuco, parades, trios, and duets. All cultural organizers are invited to participate in this celebration honoring the 90-year legacy of Sanjuanero Huilense.

name: New Bedford Folk Festival
desc: Intimate folk festival in historic New Bedford's downtown, known for close-up performances and maritime culture.
details: Centered in the historic whaling city's downtown, this intimate festival features folk, roots, and singer-songwriter performances in multiple indoor and outdoor venues. The walkable downtown setting, rich maritime history, and strong sense of community make it a gem among Northeast folk festivals.

name: Mardi Gras (Fat Tuesday)
desc: Parades, throws, costumes, and neighborhood traditions across New Orleans; last day before Lent.

name: Voodoo Music + Arts Experience
desc: Halloween-weekend music and arts festival in New Orleans City Park combining rock, hip-hop, and electronic music.
details: Set in the beautiful City Park with its ancient oak trees, Voodoo Fest brings together rock, hip-hop, electronic, and New Orleans-centric artists for a Halloween-themed festival experience. Art installations, immersive experiences, and the festive New Orleans Halloween atmosphere make it uniquely memorable.

name: French Quarter Festival
desc: Free music festival celebrating New Orleans culture with 25+ stages throughout the historic French Quarter.
details: The largest free music festival in the South features over 1,700 local and regional musicians on 25+ stages set throughout the historic French Quarter. Unlike Jazz Fest, which has a broader scope, French Quarter Fest is entirely free and focused on the city's own musical talent. The festival also showcases over 60 local restaurants and food vendors.

name: WOMAD New Zealand
desc: World music, arts, and dance festival in the stunning Brooklands Park beneath Mount Taranaki.
details: WOMAD New Zealand brings the world's greatest musicians and artists to the spectacular Brooklands Park in New Plymouth. Set beneath Mount Taranaki, three days of world music, dance, workshops, and cultural experiences create an unforgettable atmosphere of global celebration.

name: The Winter Show
desc: A premier art, antiques, and design fair spanning 5,000 years of visual culture.
details: Held at the Park Avenue Armory, benefiting the East Side House Settlement. Known for its rigorous vetting and eclectic mix of ancient artifacts and modern masterpieces.

name: World Science Festival
desc: Six-day festival bringing cutting-edge science to the public through debates, performances, and immersive experiences.
details: The World Science Festival transforms NYC into a hub of scientific exploration with thought-provoking discussions featuring Nobel laureates, immersive exhibits, street-level demonstrations, and performances that bridge science and art.

name: Boardmasters Festival
desc: A surf and music festival combining Atlantic waves with major live acts on the Cornish coast.
details: Boardmasters brings together surfing competitions, skateboarding, BMX and live music at Watergate Bay and Fistral Beach. Past headliners have included Disclosure and The Chemical Brothers.

name: Oaxaca Textile Festival
desc: Celebration of Oaxaca's extraordinary textile traditions with exhibitions, workshops, and artisan markets.
details: Oaxaca's rich textile heritage is showcased through exhibitions of traditional and contemporary textiles, weaving workshops, natural dye demonstrations, fashion shows, and artisan markets featuring work from Zapotec, Mixtec, and other indigenous weaving communities.

name: Hans Christian Andersen Festival
desc: Odense celebrates its most famous son with over 500 cultural and musical events, fairy-tale performances, and storytelling for all ages.
details: The week-long Hans Christian Andersen Festival in the author's birthplace city of Odense features over 500 cultural and musical events. Fairy-tale performances, storytelling sessions, parades, concerts, and exhibitions celebrate Andersen's legacy. The historic city provides a charming backdrop for events suitable for all ages.

name: Echizen Ono Wasabi Festival
desc: Festival celebrating the mountain city's pure water and wasabi cultivation heritage.
details: Echizen Ono, known as 'Japan's Machu Picchu' for its castle-above-clouds phenomenon, celebrates its pristine water and wasabi heritage. Wasabi tastings, water-source tours, and local food events highlight the connection between mountain water and culinary traditions.

name: Umbria Jazz Winter
desc: Winter jazz edition extending into the New Year; dates published by organizer.

name: Musikkfest Oslo
desc: Free one-day festival transforming Oslo into one big concert venue with up to 30 outdoor stages across the city.
details: Musikkfest turns the entire capital into a music playground for one day. Up to 30 outdoor stages are set up across Oslo featuring diverse genres. The best approach is simply to wander and discover. It has become one of the most beloved free music days in the Norwegian calendar.

name: Festival de las Ánimas - Pachuca, Hidalgo 2026
desc: Combines Day of the Dead with unique Hidalgo traditions

name: Alaska State Fair
desc: Famous for its giant vegetables (100+ lb cabbages) grown under the midnight sun, set against the Chugach Mountains.
details: The Alaska State Fair is legendary for its enormous produce grown under the extended summer daylight — cabbages weighing over 100 pounds and massive pumpkins are regular sights. Beyond the agriculture, the fair features concerts, carnival rides, Native Alaskan cultural demonstrations, and spectacular mountain views.

name: San Fermín Txikito
desc: Global street spectacle anchored by running of the bulls; official tourism calendar provides dates and links.
details: "little San Fermín"), Pamplona (concerts, parades

name: Lollapalooza Paris
desc: Paris edition of the global Lollapalooza festival brand.
details: Lollapalooza Paris at Hippodrome ParisLongchamp brings the American festival's energy to Paris with major rock, pop, electronic, and hip-hop headliners.

name: PAD Paris
desc: The pioneering fair for collectible design, decorative arts, and historical jewelry.
details: Set in the Tuileries Garden, PAD exudes Parisian chic. It is the ultimate destination for sourcing impeccably pedigreed 20th-century furniture, mixing Art Deco masterpieces with contemporary artisanal creations.

name: Fête de la Musique
desc: Free outdoor concerts and street performances celebrating music on the summer solstice.

name: Pasadena Chalk Festival
desc: World's largest chalk art festival with 600+ artists creating masterpieces on the streets of Pasadena.
details: Over 600 artists transform the streets around Paseo Colorado into a massive open-air gallery of chalk art. Works range from classic recreations to original designs, all created on asphalt over two days. Visitors watch artists work and the results are stunning but ephemeral.

name: Virgen del Carmen festival
desc: Masked dances and processions honoring Virgen del Carmen.

name: Glastonbury Festival
desc: Iconic music and performing arts festival on Worthy Farm, one of the world's most famous festivals.
details: Glastonbury is a cultural phenomenon spanning 900 acres with over 100 stages and areas. Note: Glastonbury traditionally takes a fallow year every 5-6 years; 2026 status is uncertain. When it runs, it features legendary headliners, the Pyramid Stage, and immersive areas like Shangri-La and The Park.

name: Vanuatu Independence Day
desc: National celebration of Vanuatu's independence with parades, cultural performances, and celebrations.
details: Vanuatu's Independence Day on July 30 features flag-raising ceremonies, military parades, traditional cultural performances from different island groups, community feasting, and festivities across the nation.

name: Waterfront Blues Festival
desc: The largest blues festival west of the Mississippi, set along Portland's Willamette River waterfront.
details: Portland's Waterfront Blues Festival is the largest blues festival west of the Mississippi, featuring over 100 acts on multiple stages along Tom McCall Waterfront Park. The festival pairs world-class blues with Portland's food cart culture and craft beer scene, and admission is by suggested donation plus a can of food for the Oregon Food Bank.

name: Provins Medieval Festival
desc: A major medieval festival in the UNESCO-listed walled town of Provins, southeast of Paris.
details: The medieval town of Provins comes alive with knights, troubadours, jesters, and craftsmen. Jousting tournaments, falconry displays, and theatrical performances fill the ancient ramparts and market squares.

name: Cinco de Mayo
desc: One of the largest Cinco de Mayo celebrations in the US, reflecting Pueblo's Mexican-American heritage.
details: Pueblo's Cinco de Mayo celebration is one of the largest in the nation, featuring live music, traditional dance, a parade, green chile cooking competitions, lowrider car shows, and a massive street festival. The celebration reflects the city's strong Mexican-American cultural identity.

name: Puerto Plata Festival
desc: Vibrant mix of folk, blues, jazz, and merengue music celebrating Dominican cultural heritage.
details: Lights up October with music lovers flocking to Fuerte San Felipe, the festival's main stage. This annual event showcases Dominican Republic's rich musical heritage, drawing both local and international artists. Emphasizes the island's diverse musical traditions and cultural pride.

name: Puno Week
desc: Week-long celebration on Lake Titicaca shores reenacting the legendary founding of the Inca Empire.
details: Centered around November 5, honoring Manco Capac's legendary emergence from Lake Titicaca to found the Inca Empire. Colorful parades with masks and costumes, traditional Andean music, and reenactment of the empire's establishment. Music and dancing spread from city to lakeside.

name: About You Pangea Festival
desc: Boutique lakeside festival with music, art, and workshops.
details: Pangea at the former Pütnitz airfield offers an intimate lakeside experience with indie, electronic, and pop music alongside art installations and workshops.

name: Qingdao International Beer Festival
desc: Asia's largest beer festival celebrating Qingdao's German brewing heritage with international beers and entertainment.
details: The Qingdao International Beer Festival is Asia's answer to Oktoberfest, running for over three weeks every August. Held in the city famous for Tsingtao Beer (thanks to German colonial brewing traditions), the festival features hundreds of international and domestic beers, live music, parades, and a carnival atmosphere. Multiple venues across the city host themed beer halls and entertainment stages.

name: Wheatland Music Traditional Arts Festival
desc: Beloved traditional arts festival in rural Michigan celebrating acoustic music, crafts, and sustainable living.
details: Set on a 160-acre site in rural Mecosta County, the Wheatland Festival is a volunteer-run celebration of traditional music, dance, and crafts. The festival features acoustic-only music across multiple stages, craft demonstrations, contra dancing, workshops, and a warm community atmosphere that keeps families returning for generations.

name: Rochester Lilac Festival
desc: 10-day celebration of 500+ varieties of lilacs in Highland Park, one of the oldest flower festivals in the US.
details: Highland Park's collection of over 500 varieties of lilacs transforms into a fragrant wonderland each May. The 10-day festival features concerts, craft shows, food vendors, a 5K/10K race, and a parade, all centered around the breathtaking display of purple, white, and pink blooms.

name: Electric Forest
desc: Immersive music festival in an enchanted forest setting with elaborate light installations and diverse music.
details: Set in the Sherwood Forest at Double JJ Resort, Electric Forest transforms a real forest into a fantastical wonderland with intricate lighting, art installations, and interactive experiences woven between the trees. The lineup spans electronic, jam, indie, and hip-hop, with the forest itself serving as the main attraction after dark.

name: North Sea Jazz Festival
desc: World's largest indoor jazz festival with 150+ concerts across 15 stages.
details: North Sea Jazz at Rotterdam Ahoy presents 150+ concerts ranging from jazz legends to soul, funk, hip-hop, and world music across 15 stages over three days.

name: International Film Festival Rotterdam (IFFR)
desc: Major international film festival focused on discovery-oriented cinema; official listing gives dates.
details: IFFR is renowned for its Tiger Awards and its CineMart co-production market, making it an absolute necessity for global independent producers seeking funding for challenging, non-commercial cinematic projects.

name: Macau Food Festival
desc: Celebration of Macau's UNESCO Creative City of Gastronomy status with Portuguese, Chinese, and fusion cuisine.
details: The Macau Food Festival celebrates the city's unique culinary heritage as a UNESCO Creative City of Gastronomy. Over 150 stalls serve Portuguese, Cantonese, Southeast Asian, and Macanese fusion dishes—reflecting the city's 450 years of cultural blending. The festival at Sai Van Lake features cooking demonstrations, competitions, and entertainment, showcasing one of Asia's most distinctive food cultures.

name: Carnival of Salvador da Bahia
desc: The world's largest street carnival by attendance, with electric trios (mobile stages on trucks) and Afro-Brazilian axé music filling the streets.
details: Salvador's Carnival is often cited as the largest street party on Earth by participant numbers. The signature element is the trio elétrico — trucks carrying enormous sound systems and live bands that roll through circuits while massive crowds dance behind. The music is dominated by axé, samba-reggae, and pagode, reflecting Salvador's deep Afro-Brazilian heritage. Blocos afro like Olodum and Ilê Aiyê celebrate Black identity through music and dance.

name: Festival de Luna Verde
desc: Caribbean cultural celebration highlighting African and European heritage of island archipelago with music, food, dance, and documentation.
details: Motto: "A fraternal embrace in the form of race and culture." Festival organized by Casa de Cultura and Green Moon Foundation. Activities: film and documentary screenings, conferences on Antillean culture, food fair, linguistic fair, traditional dance displays, two major concerts featuring Antillean and Caribbean music. Celebrates unique culture resulting from integration of ancestral African and European knowledge in island communities.

name: Texas Folklife Festival
desc: Celebration of the diverse ethnic cultures that have shaped Texas, with food, music, dance, and crafts from 40+ groups.
details: The Texas Folklife Festival at the Institute of Texan Cultures brings together over 40 ethnic and cultural groups to share their Texas heritage through food, music, dance, crafts, and storytelling. From German polka to Cajun zydeco to Tejano conjunto, the festival is a living tapestry of Texan diversity.

name: Festival del Camerón (Shrimp Festival) - San Felipe, Baja California 2026
desc: Seafood lover's paradise featuring fresh locally-caught shrimp with gastronomic contests
details: Top chefs participate in gastronomic contest preparing best shrimp dishes. Includes cooking demonstrations, tastings, live music, dance performances, rides, regional crafts.

name: Litquake San Francisco
desc: San Francisco's annual literary festival with readings, panels, and the legendary Lit Crawl bar-hopping event.
details: Litquake celebrates literature with readings, panels, and workshops across San Francisco venues, culminating in the legendary Lit Crawl where hundreds of authors read simultaneously in bars, laundromats, and shops throughout the Mission District.

name: Chinese New Year Parade
desc: The largest Chinese New Year celebration outside of Asia, featuring elaborate floats and a 268-foot Golden Dragon.
details: San Francisco's Chinese New Year Parade is one of the oldest and most spectacular in North America. Featuring over 100 units including elaborate floats, lion dancers, marching bands, and the famous 268-foot Golden Dragon (Gum Lung), the parade draws massive crowds along a route through downtown and Chinatown. The broader festival includes a street fair, flower market, and cultural performances.

name: Hardly Strictly Bluegrass
desc: Massive free three-day music festival in Golden Gate Park featuring bluegrass, country, folk, and roots artists.
details: Founded by venture capitalist Warren Hellman as a gift to San Francisco, Hardly Strictly Bluegrass is completely free and features over 100 acts on seven stages in beautiful Golden Gate Park. Despite its name, the lineup extends well beyond bluegrass to include rock, folk, country, punk, and world music. It is one of the largest free music events in the country.

name: Cabo Picnic
desc: Boutique music festival in the exclusive Cabo setting blending international and Mexican artists.
details: Boutique festival in San José del Cabo combining international and Mexican artists with luxury resort atmosphere. Intimate scale and stunning Pacific/Sea of Cortez setting distinguish it from larger festivals.

name: Festival Casals (Pablo Casals Festival)
desc: The gold standard for classical music in the Caribbean, founded in 1957 by Pablo Casals himself.
details: The Festival Casals gathers world-renowned artists and musicians, featuring symphonic masterpieces and intimate chamber music performances. Significant figures such as Yo-Yo Ma and the New York Philharmonic have been among the festival's guests. Current artistic director is Maximiliano Valdés. High-profile events in Puerto Rico often sell out weeks in advance, so purchasing tickets early is recommended.

name: Feria de las Flores de San Ángel (flower Fair)
desc: Mexico City's annual tradition since 1856 celebrating flowers, nature, and neighborhood culture.
details: 169th edition continues traditions of 168 previous years under motto themes. 2025 edition (168th) motto: "Seeds Today, Flowers Tomorrow" evoking commitment to rescue/transmit traditions and cultural wealth of Álvaro Obregón Borough. Attracts 80,000+ visitors. Located in San Ángel neighborhood (southwest Mexico City, Álvaro Obregón borough). Free public access with family activities and cultural performances. Rooted in neighborhood's horticultural heritage and artistic community.

name: San Miguel de Allende Jazz & Blues Festival
desc: Jazz and blues performances in the plazas and venues of one of Mexico's most beautiful colonial cities.
details: The charming colonial city of San Miguel de Allende hosts international and Mexican jazz and blues artists in venues ranging from the historic Teatro Angela Peralta to outdoor plazas surrounded by baroque architecture. The intimate scale and beautiful setting create an exceptional cultural experience.

name: Tamborrada
desc: 24-hour drumming celebration across San Sebastián for the city's patron saint.
details: From midnight on January 19 to midnight on January 20, over 100 groups (comparsas) of chefs and soldiers drum through San Sebastián's streets in a thunderous 24-hour celebration.

name: Noche de Altares
desc: One of the largest Day of the Dead celebrations in Southern California with 100+ community altars.
details: Noche de Altares fills the streets of downtown Santa Ana with over 100 community-built altars honoring departed loved ones. Live music, Aztec dancers, face painting, and thousands of marigolds create a vibrant celebration of life and memory in the heart of Orange County's Mexican-American community.

name: Santa Marta Festival
desc: Multi-day music festival in Colombia's oldest city on the Caribbean coast.
details: Multi-day festival in Colombia's oldest city against the Caribbean coast and Sierra Nevada mountains. Mix of international and Colombian artists across genres, leveraging Santa Marta's stunning natural setting.

name: Santo Domingo Festival
desc: Major music event featuring international Latin and urban acts in the Dominican Republic.
details: Major one-day festival featuring top Latin and urban acts. Santo Domingo is an increasingly important stop on the Latin American festival circuit for reggaetón, dembow, merengue, and bachata fans.

name: Festival de Dança Brasil (Dance Festival)
desc: Multiple dance festivals and events celebrating Brazilian and international dance styles including ballet, contemporary, jazz, and regional dances.
details: Brazil hosts numerous dance festivals throughout the year. Notable 2026 events include Tatuí em Dança (February 21 at Teatro Procópio Ferreira in Tatuí/SP) combining competition, training, and artistic transformation. Brazilian Zouk events occur in Feira de Santana (April 30-May 5 - Embrazouk) and Rio de Janeiro (October-November), and the Brasil Dance Festival features Dancesport at Copacabana, Rio de Janeiro (March 28-31 at JW Marriott Hotel). These events offer diverse dance styles and artistic expression.

name: Makomanai Fireworks Festival
desc: Hokkaido's premier fireworks event featuring 22,000 shots illuminating the Sapporo night sky.
details: The Makomanai Fireworks Festival is one of Hokkaido's largest fireworks displays, featuring approximately 22,000 fireworks including impressive 8.4-inch shells. Held at Makomanai Open Stadium area, it combines music-synchronized displays with traditional Japanese firework artistry.

name: Philadelphia Folk Festival
desc: The oldest continuously running outdoor folk festival in North America, featuring camping and legendary musical performances.
details: Founded in 1962, the Philadelphia Folk Festival is a beloved institution of American folk music. Held at the Old Pool Farm in Schwenksville, it features multiple stages, camping, workshops, and late-night song swaps. Artists from Pete Seeger to modern folk stars have graced its stages, and the camping community creates a warm, multigenerational atmosphere.

name: Folklife Festival (Northwest)
desc: Free four-day celebration of folk and traditional arts at Seattle Center with music, dance, food, and crafts.
details: The Northwest Folklife Festival is one of the largest free folk festivals in the country, transforming Seattle Center into a celebration of cultural traditions from around the world. Multiple indoor and outdoor stages feature folk music, dance, and storytelling, while artisan vendors and international food stalls fill the grounds.

name: Cherry Festival
desc: Annual celebration of the cherry harvest in Sefrou with a Cherry Queen pageant and traditional music.
details: The Cherry Festival in Sefrou, near Fes, is one of Morocco's oldest festivals dating to the 1920s. It celebrates the cherry harvest with a Cherry Queen pageant, parades, traditional Amazigh music, dancing, and a bustling cherry market.

name: Lavender Festival
desc: Fragrant celebration of the Pacific Northwest's lavender capital with farm tours, crafts, and culinary events.
details: The Sequim Lavender Festival celebrates the Olympic Peninsula's status as the lavender capital of North America. Visitors tour blooming lavender farms, attend workshops on lavender cultivation and use, enjoy lavender-infused foods, and browse artisan vendors. The stunning setting with views of the Olympic Mountains adds to the sensory experience.

name: Great Migration Calving Season
desc: Over 8,000 wildebeest calves born daily on the southern Serengeti plains during the calving season.
details: The calving season in the southern Serengeti sees over 8,000 wildebeest born daily over several weeks, attracting massive predator activity. This natural spectacle draws wildlife enthusiasts and photographers from around the world.

name: Minnesota Renaissance Festival
desc: One of the largest Renaissance festivals in the US, featuring a recreated 16th-century village on 22 acres.
details: The Minnesota Renaissance Festival creates a full 16th-century English village with over 250 artisans, 13 stages of entertainment, full-armor jousting, and themed weekends. With food-on-a-stick, turkey legs, and mead, it has become a beloved late-summer tradition for the Upper Midwest.

name: Sharjah Light Festival
desc: Spectacular light installations projected onto Sharjah's iconic buildings and heritage sites.
details: Transforms architectural landmarks with stunning light art, projections, and immersive installations. Free public event attracting visitors from across the region.

name: Sharjah International Book Fair
desc: One of the world's largest book fairs with 2 million+ visitors and publishers from 80+ countries.
details: Major literary event featuring author talks, cultural programs, children's activities, and publishers from around the world. UNESCO World Book Capital legacy.

name: Tramlines
desc: Sheffield's outdoor music festival at Hillsborough Park.
details: Tramlines has grown into one of the UK's biggest inner-city festivals with headliners, emerging artists, and a proud Sheffield identity across multiple stages.

name: Artmania Festival
desc: Rock and metal festival in Sibiu's stunning central square.
details: ARTmania transforms Sibiu's Piața Mare (Great Square) into a rock stage, combining heavy music with the charm of this beautifully preserved medieval Transylvanian city.

name: Feast of Santa Lucia
desc: Feast of Santa Lucia — culminates with procession of the saint's statue and relics to the cathedral on December 13
details: culminates with procession of the saint's statue and relics to the cathedral on December 13

name: Holi Festival of Colors
desc: The largest Holi celebration in the Western Hemisphere at the Sri Sri Radha Krishna Temple.
details: The Holi Festival at the Sri Sri Radha Krishna Temple in Spanish Fork is the largest Holi celebration outside of India, attracting tens of thousands who throw vibrant colored powder into the air in a joyous celebration of spring, love, and new beginnings. Live music, dance, and vegetarian Indian food complement the colorful chaos.

name: iSimangaliso Wetland Park Turtle Nesting Season
desc: Guided turtle nesting and hatching tours at the UNESCO World Heritage wetland park.
details: The iSimangaliso Wetland Park's turtle season runs from November to March, when loggerhead and leatherback turtles nest on the beaches. Guided night tours allow visitors to witness ancient nesting rituals under starlight at this UNESCO site.

name: Balloon Glow at Forest Park
desc: Free hot air balloon race and evening glow event in St. Louis's Forest Park, one of the largest free events in the Midwest.
details: The Great Forest Park Balloon Race features dozens of hot air balloons launching from Forest Park, with the Saturday evening Balloon Glow creating a magical scene as tethered balloons light up in unison against the night sky. This free event draws hundreds of thousands to picnic and enjoy the spectacle.

name: Carnival of Strumica
desc: North Macedonia's biggest carnival with elaborate costumes and parades.
details: Strumica Carnival features elaborate masked parades, competitions, and celebrations in this southeastern Macedonian town with roots in pre-Christian traditions.

name: Hibiscus Festival
desc: Fiji's largest annual festival featuring carnival rides, beauty pageant, cultural shows, and street parades.
details: The Hibiscus Festival is Suva's biggest annual event, running for over 60 years. The week-long celebration features a beauty queen competition, carnival rides, live entertainment, cultural performances, food stalls, and a grand street parade through the capital.

name: Fiji Day / Independence Day
desc: National celebration of Fiji's independence with parades, cultural performances, and community events.
details: Fiji Day celebrates the nation's independence from Britain on October 10, 1970. The main celebrations take place in Suva with military parades, cultural performances by indigenous Fijian and Indo-Fijian communities, flag-raising ceremonies, and community festivities.

name: Sydney Contemporary
desc: Australasia's largest and most diverse contemporary art fair.
details: Housed in the vast industrial spaces of Carriageworks, the fair is renowned for its vibrant atmosphere, extensive public programming, and strong sales, functioning as the primary commercial engine for the Australian art ecosystem.

name: Vivid Sydney
desc: The world's largest festival of light, music, and ideas transforming Sydney Harbour and surrounds.
details: Vivid Sydney illuminates the city with spectacular light installations, projections on the Opera House and Harbour Bridge, live music performances, and thought-provoking talks. Over three weeks, millions of visitors experience immersive light walks, performances at venues across the city, and creative industry events.

name: Taichung Jazz Festival
desc: One of Asia's largest free jazz festivals with 10 days of performances across the city.
details: The Taichung Jazz Festival is one of Asia's largest free jazz events, featuring hundreds of performances across multiple venues and outdoor stages throughout the city over 10 days. International and Taiwanese jazz, blues, and fusion artists perform in parks, streets, and clubs.

name: Taoyuan Land Art Festival
desc: Site-specific art installations across Taoyuan's coastal wetlands and rice paddies.
details: The Taoyuan Land Art Festival features site-specific installations by international and Taiwanese artists placed in coastal wetlands, irrigation ponds, and agricultural landscapes. The festival highlights the relationship between art, ecology, and Taiwan's rapidly changing rural landscapes.

name: Splore
desc: Boutique arts, music, and sustainability festival in a beautiful beachside bush setting.
details: Splore is New Zealand's premier boutique festival, set in the stunning Tapapakanga Regional Park on Auckland's coast. Over three days, festival-goers enjoy eclectic music across multiple stages, art installations, performance art, workshops, swimming, and a strong emphasis on sustainability.

name: Navoi Day
desc: Celebration of the 585th anniversary of great poet Alisher Navoi with international symposiums.
details: Celebrates the birth of the great 15th-century poet, writer, and philosopher Alisher Navoi. The year 2026 marks the 585th anniversary with major international symposiums, academic discussions, and cultural performances.

name: Tbilisi International Theatre Festival
desc: Key cultural event featuring international theatre companies.
details: Tbilisi Photo Festival presents exhibitions, talks, and workshops from Georgian and international photographers across the city's galleries and public spaces.

name: Fajr International Theatre Festival
desc: Iran's premier theatre festival held during the Revolution anniversary period.
details: Features Iranian and international theatre productions at venues across Tehran during the Fajr period.

name: White Night Tel Aviv (Layla Lavan)
desc: All-night cultural festival with free performances, exhibitions, and events across Tel Aviv-Yafo.
details: Annual celebration with hundreds of free cultural events, concerts, art exhibitions, and performances throughout the night in the UNESCO-listed White City.

name: Telluride Film Festival
desc: Intimate and prestigious film festival in a stunning mountain setting, known for premiering Oscar-winning films.
details: One of the most respected film festivals in the world, Telluride takes place in a former mining town in the San Juan Mountains. Known for its no-advance-lineup policy, the festival creates an atmosphere of pure cinematic discovery. Many Oscar Best Picture winners have premiered here, and the small-town setting creates unparalleled access to filmmakers.

name: Tengchong Hot Spring & Volcanic Festival
desc: Festival celebrating the volcanic hot springs of this border town near Myanmar.
details: Tengchong, on the edge of the Yunnan-Myanmar border, celebrates its extraordinary geothermal features—including Rehai (Hot Sea) geysers and volcanic craters. The festival features hot spring bathing, jade trading (the area is China's jade capital), and ethnic minority cultural performances.

name: Festival Internacional del Queso y el Vino (cheese & Wine Festival)
desc: International celebration of artisanal cheeses and wines with tastings, workshops, concerts, and cultural programming.
details: Over 20 national wineries, international wineries (Spain as guest country), and 10+ cheese producers participate. Features basic wine tasting techniques and cheese production explanations. Internationally renowned artists perform; concerts and top-level shows. All presentations completely free for visitors. Venues: emblematic Parque La Pila, Plaza Miguel Hidalgo, Avenida Juárez. Pueblo Mágico expands festival throughout area with expanded programming this year.

name: Terlingua International Chili Championship
desc: The original chili cook-off held in a remote Big Bend ghost town — part cooking contest, part desert party.
details: In the ghost town of Terlingua near Big Bend National Park, the original chili cook-off draws competitors and spectators to one of the most remote festival sites in America. The rugged desert landscape, Wild West atmosphere, and fierce chili competition create a uniquely Texan experience.

name: Tongyeong International Music Festival
desc: Prestigious classical music festival in the hometown of Korean composer Yun Isang, set in a beautiful coastal city.
details: The Tongyeong International Music Festival honors Korean composer Yun Isang with world-class classical music performances in the beautiful port city of Tongyeong. International soloists, orchestras, and chamber ensembles perform alongside rising Korean musicians. The festival includes educational programs and the stunning Tongyeong Concert Hall as its centerpiece.

name: Nuit Blanche Toronto
desc: All-night contemporary art event transforming Toronto streets and public spaces with immersive installations.
details: Nuit Blanche is a free, city-wide celebration of contemporary art that runs from sunset to sunrise. Hundreds of art installations, performances, and experiences pop up across Toronto's neighborhoods, transforming familiar spaces into extraordinary artistic encounters. Over a million people wander the city throughout the night.

name: Indigenous Fashion Week Toronto
desc: Showcase of Indigenous fashion designers and artists from across Turtle Island.
details: Indigenous Fashion Week Toronto presents contemporary Indigenous fashion from designers across North America, combining runway shows with art exhibitions, panel discussions, and cultural events that celebrate Indigenous creativity and entrepreneurship.

name: Luminato Festival
desc: Toronto's international multidisciplinary arts festival presenting world premieres and immersive experiences.
details: Luminato presents bold, innovative programming across theater, dance, music, visual arts, and film over 10 days in venues across Toronto. The festival commissions world premieres and brings international artists for unique presentations that push creative boundaries.

name: Toronto Pride
desc: One of the largest Pride celebrations in the world, with a month of events culminating in the massive Pride Parade.
details: Toronto Pride is one of the largest LGBTQ+ events globally, with a full month of programming including marches, cultural events, art exhibitions, and parties. The highlight is the Pride Parade through downtown, featuring elaborate floats, community groups, and political leaders. The Church-Wellesley Village becomes the epicenter of celebrations.

name: Tucson Gem, Mineral & Fossil Showcase
desc: The world's largest gem and mineral show, spanning dozens of venues across the city for three weeks.
details: Each year, Tucson transforms into the global capital of gems, minerals, and fossils as over 40 individual shows spread across hotels, convention centers, and parking lots throughout the city. Dealers and collectors from over 60 countries buy, sell, and trade precious stones, fossils, and jewelry. The main TGMS show at the Tucson Convention Center is the crown jewel of this sprawling event.

name: Tucson Meet Yourself
desc: Free folklife festival celebrating Tucson's diverse cultural communities through food, music, and crafts.
details: Tucson Meet Yourself transforms downtown Tucson into a celebration of the region's extraordinary cultural diversity, with authentic food from dozens of ethnic communities, traditional music and dance performances, folk arts demonstrations, and narrative traditions.

name: Festival del Mariachi
desc: Tucson International Mariachi Conference bringing together mariachi ensembles and folklorico dancers.
details: The Tucson International Mariachi Conference is one of the premier mariachi events in the US, featuring student and professional mariachi performances, folklorico dance showcases, and a spectacular Mariachi Garibaldi de Jaime Cuellar concert.

name: Tulsa International Mayfest
desc: Four-day arts festival in downtown Tulsa featuring 100+ artists, live music, and interactive art experiences.
details: Mayfest transforms the Brady Arts District and downtown Tulsa into an open-air gallery and concert venue. Over 100 juried visual artists, five stages of live music, children's creativity area, and culinary experiences make it Tulsa's signature spring celebration.

name: Art With Me Tulum - November 2026
desc: Festival of art, cinema, culture created for nature connection
details: Culinary, visual, cultural, experiential artistic innovations.

name: Zamna Tulum 2026
desc: Electronic music festival in jungle venue built around natural cenotes
details: Cultural hub reopening January 2026. 30,000+ attendees historically. Features workshops with Maya artisans, poetry slams with regional writers, pop-up culinary experiences with indigenous chefs.

name: Aguinaldo Boyacense
desc: 70th+ edition celebrating Boyacán identity with concerts, parades, and urban/Mexican regional music in the Andes.
details: 2025 edition ("Bodas de Titanio"/70th) exceeded 220,000 attendees with $220 billion pesos economic impact. Tunja becomes world music epicenter. Designated Cultural Heritage of Tunja. Programming includes concerts, parades, cultural performances, recreational activities. Features urban, Mexican regional, Colombian music artists. Festival consolidated as the most ambitious version in its history.

name: Ren Faire New York
desc: Immersive Renaissance village experience in the Hudson Valley with jousting and period entertainment.
details: The New York Renaissance Faire creates an immersive 16th-century English village in the scenic Hudson Valley, with full-contact jousting, over 100 artisan shops, live performances, and themed weekends spanning late summer through early fall.

name: Playtime Music Festival
desc: Mongolia's largest and longest-running annual multi-genre music festival with seven dedicated stages.
details: Founded in 2002 by Natsagdorj 'George' Tserendorj, Playtime is Mongolia's premier music festival featuring seven stages specializing in rock, indie, electronic, hip-hop, metal, world, and acoustic genres. Held at the specially-built Playtime Field grounds in Nalaikh, just outside Ulaanbaatar. Mix of local and international acts in an all-ages festival format. Strategically scheduled the weekend before Naadam.

name: Vendimia Valle de Guadalupe
desc: Wine harvest celebration in Mexico's premier wine country with farm-to-table dining and tastings.
details: The Valle de Guadalupe wine harvest festival showcases Mexico's burgeoning wine scene with tastings at over 100 boutique wineries, outdoor feasts featuring Baja Med cuisine, grape-stomping competitions, and concert events against the rolling vineyard landscape.

name: Dragon Boat Festival
desc: Major dragon boat racing event and cultural festival in False Creek.
details: The Vancouver Dragon Boat Festival combines competitive dragon boat racing with a vibrant cultural festival on the shores of False Creek. Over 100 teams race colorful dragon boats while spectators enjoy live music, food vendors, and cultural performances.

name: Pacific National Exhibition (PNE)
desc: Vancouver's annual summer fair with concerts, midway rides, agricultural exhibits, and nightly entertainment.
details: The PNE is Vancouver's beloved end-of-summer tradition at Hastings Park, featuring a massive midway, SuperDogs show, agricultural exhibitions, nightly concerts, and the iconic wooden Coaster. Mini donuts, corn dogs, and creative fair food are quintessential PNE experiences.

name: Oregon Country Fair
desc: Countercultural arts festival in a forested setting, a living legacy of the 1960s with handmade crafts, theater, and music.
details: The Oregon Country Fair is a unique countercultural institution set in a 280-acre wooded site near Veneta. It features handmade artisan crafts (no manufactured goods allowed), street performers, multiple music stages, and elaborate community art. The fair maintains a hippie-era ethos of community, creativity, and environmental consciousness.

name: Romaria de Nossa Senhora d'Agonia
desc: Spectacular religious festival with traditional costumes and gold filigree jewelry.
details: Viana do Castelo's Romaria features women in magnificent traditional Minho costumes adorned with gold filigree jewelry, religious processions, folk music, and elaborate fireworks over the Lima River.

name: Christmas Markets Vienna
desc: Vienna's enchanting Christmas markets across the city's historic squares.
details: Vienna hosts 20+ Christmas markets from the Rathausplatz (3 million visitors) to Schönbrunn Palace and Maria-Theresien-Platz, offering Glühwein, Punsch, handicrafts, and festive atmosphere.

name: Festival de las Cometas
desc: Festival celebrating kite flying in colonial town with competition categories, cultural events, and live music during strong wind season.
details: Three-day celebration in main plaza since 1975. Sky fills with colorful kites of various sizes, shapes, and designs. Competition categories: artisanal, commercial, pandero, train, acrobatic, delta, miniature kites, and others. Beyond kite flying: live music, traditional dances, craft exhibitions, regional gastronomy. Located in colonial town 4 hours from Bogotá.

name: Art Vilnius Fair
desc: Largest contemporary art fair in the Baltic States and Eastern Europe.
details: ArtVilnius'26 presents 70+ galleries from 20+ countries showcasing painting, sculpture, and installations at the Litexpo centre, with educational events and panel discussions.

name: Artvilnius
desc: The largest contemporary art fair in the Eastern European region.
details: The fair serves as a critical meeting point for galleries from the Baltics, Poland, and Ukraine, fostering regional solidarity and exposing Eastern European talent to visiting Western curators.

name: National Book Festival
desc: Free one-day literary festival at the Walter E. Washington Convention Center, organized by the Library of Congress.
details: The Library of Congress National Book Festival features over 100 bestselling and award-winning authors in conversation, book signings, and presentations. It is entirely free and celebrates the joy of reading with programs for all ages, culinary demonstrations, and displays from the Library of Congress's collection.

name: MerleFest
desc: Premier traditional plus music festival honoring Merle Watson, featuring bluegrass, folk, country, and roots music.
details: Founded in memory of the son of legendary guitarist Doc Watson, MerleFest celebrates 'traditional plus' music — a blend of traditional and contemporary folk, bluegrass, country, and roots music. Held on the campus of Wilkes Community College, the festival features over 75 artists on 13 stages with workshops, jam sessions, and a family-friendly atmosphere in the foothills of the Blue Ridge Mountains.

name: Woodford Folk Festival
desc: Six-day festival of folk, roots, and world music with 2,000+ performers across 25 venues.
details: The Woodford Folk Festival is Australia's largest outdoor folk festival, running over six days spanning New Year's Eve. With over 2,000 performers across 25 stages and venues, it encompasses folk, world, roots, and indigenous music alongside circus, dance, comedy, debate, film, and visual art.

name: Flower & Garden Festival Yanbu
desc: Annual flower and garden festival featuring millions of flowers and botanical displays.
details: Showcases stunning floral displays, landscaped gardens, cultural performances, and family entertainment. One of Saudi Arabia's most colorful seasonal events.

name: Cameroon Youth Day
desc: Colorful parades featuring youth from across Cameroon's diverse cultural groups.
details: Cameroon's Youth Day on February 11 features massive parades of school children and youth groups from across the country's 250+ ethnic groups, each wearing traditional costumes and performing cultural dances. It is one of the most colorful national celebrations in Africa.

name: Yeongam F1 Korean Grand Prix Festival
desc: Cultural festival at the former F1 circuit featuring motorsport events and entertainment.
details: The Yeongam area near the former Korean Grand Prix circuit hosts annual motorsport and cultural events. While the F1 race is no longer held, the circuit hosts other racing events alongside cultural festivals, food markets, and entertainment, drawing motorsport enthusiasts and families.

name: Fiestas del Pilar
desc: Zaragoza's patron saint festival with massive flower offering.
details: Fiestas del Pilar features a massive flower offering to the Virgin creating a 7m flower-covered mantle, plus giant parades, jota dancing, concerts, and fireworks.

name: Zhangjiajie International Forest Festival
desc: Cultural festival at the stunning pillar mountains that inspired Avatar's Pandora.
details: Zhangjiajie's pillar-like sandstone mountains—the inspiration for the floating mountains in Avatar—host an annual festival featuring cliff-side performances, glass bridge events, extreme sports, and Tujia ethnic minority cultural celebrations. The otherworldly landscape provides the ultimate backdrop.

name: Zhangye Danxia Landscape Festival
desc: Cultural events at China's most otherworldly landscape—the Rainbow Mountains of Zhangye.
details: The Zhangye Danxia National Geological Park, with its striped, multicolored sandstone formations known as the 'Rainbow Mountains,' hosts summer cultural events and photography festivals. The otherworldly landscape—looking like a painter's palette—is one of China's most extraordinary natural wonders.

name: Zhuhai International Circuit Festival
desc: Major music and arts festival in the coastal city near Macau.
details: Zhuhai's annual festival combines international music performances with art exhibitions and cultural events in this scenic coastal city adjacent to Macau. The festival leverages Zhuhai's reputation as one of China's most livable cities and its proximity to the Greater Bay Area cultural scene.

name: Zurich Street Parade
desc: One of world's largest techno and house music street parties with 1 million attendees.
details: The Street Parade fills Zürich's lakeside promenades with 30+ Love Mobiles (decorated trucks) blasting electronic music as 1 million ravers dance through the Swiss financial capital.

name: Uyghur Meshrep Gatherings
desc: UNESCO-inscribed traditional Uyghur community gatherings with music, dance, drama, and oral literature.
details: UNESCO Intangible Cultural Heritage. Most important cultural carrier of Uyghur traditions combining music, dance, drama, folk arts, acrobatics, oral literature, foodways, and games. Men play progressively faster muqam melodies on dutar while others perform whirling circle dances.

name: Semana Santa (Holy Week)
desc: Easter is the biggest religious celebration in the Dominican Republic, with Holy Week from Palm Sunday through Easter Sunday widely observed.
details: Holy Thursday features Chrism Mass and evening Mass of the Lord's Supper with foot-washing procession. Saturday features kite flying—a beautiful tradition where skies fill with all types of kites as signs of hope. Dominicans traditionally refrain from eating meat during Holy Week, with abundant fish and seafood dishes. The most popular dish is Habichuelas con Dulce (Sweet Beans)—a mix of red beans, condensed milk, and spices served cold pudding-style.

name: Independence Day celebrations
desc: Parades and celebrations marking Dominican independence; often linked with Carnival parades.

name: Ethiopia Adwa Victory Day
desc: Celebration of Ethiopia's historic 1896 victory over Italy, preserving African independence.
details: Adwa Victory Day celebrates Ethiopia's decisive 1896 defeat of Italian colonial forces at the Battle of Adwa, making it the only African nation to successfully resist European colonization. It is celebrated with parades, reenactments, and patriotic speeches.

name: Easter in Ethiopia (Fasika)
desc: Ethiopian Orthodox Easter following 55 days of fasting, celebrated with all-night vigils and feasting.
details: Fasika (Ethiopian Easter) follows 55 days of strict fasting during which the faithful abstain from all animal products. The celebration begins with an all-night candlelit vigil and culminates in a joyous feast featuring doro wat (chicken stew), kitfo, and other rich dishes.

name: Juhannus (Finnish Midsummer)
desc: Finland's cherished midsummer celebration with bonfires at lakeside cottages, sauna rituals, and midnight sun.
details: Known as Juhannus, Finland's midsummer celebration sees Finns retreat to lakeside cottages to light bonfires (kokko), enjoy saunas, swim, and celebrate under the midnight sun. Cities empty as the entire country heads to the countryside. It is one of the most important holidays in the Finnish calendar.

name: Amerindian Heritage Month
desc: An annual observance honoring Guyana's indigenous peoples and their rich cultures, traditions, and contributions.
details: Designated September as Amerindian Heritage Month on September 10, 1995 by Prime Minister Cheddi Jagan. September 10 is celebrated as "Heritage Day." During this month, the nation collectively immerses itself in the rich cultures, traditions, and contributions of Guyana's indigenous peoples. The nine Amerindian tribes of Guyana present their ancient legends, arts, music, dances, and lifestyle during celebrations throughout September. Various events showcase indigenous cultural heritage, traditional crafts, and cultural performances.

name: Tanabata (Star Festival)
desc: Romantic festival celebrating the annual meeting of star-crossed lovers Orihime and Hikoboshi.
details: Tanabata celebrates the legend of two lovers—Orihime (Vega) and Hikoboshi (Altair)—who can only meet once a year when the Milky Way is bridged. People write wishes on colorful tanzaku paper strips and hang them on bamboo branches. Major celebrations occur in Shonan Hiratsuka (July) and Sendai (August).
