Decorations include elaborate paper streamers and star motifs.

name: Golden Week
desc: Japan's longest holiday period combining four national holidays with widespread celebrations and travel.
details: Golden Week is a cluster of four national holidays: Showa Day (Apr 29), Constitution Day (May 3), Greenery Day (May 4), and Children's Day (May 5). It is the longest vacation period in Japan, when millions travel domestically. Major events include koinobori (carp streamer) displays for Children's Day and special exhibitions at temples and gardens nationwide.

name: Holi (Mauritius)
desc: Colorful Festival of Colors marking the end of winter with powder throwing and community celebrations.
details: Holi in Mauritius marks the end of winter and the beginning of spring. While not a public holiday, everyone joins in the colorful celebrations, throwing vibrant colored powder and water at each other in the streets and at organized events.

name: Arrival of Indentured Labourers Day
desc: Commemoration of the arrival of indentured workers from India at the Aapravasi Ghat UNESCO site.
details: This public holiday commemorates the arrival of indentured laborers from India who came to work on sugar plantations after the abolition of slavery. Ceremonies at the Aapravasi Ghat, a UNESCO World Heritage Site in Port Louis, honor their contributions to Mauritian society.

name: La Rama (Veracruz Christmas)
desc: Unique Veracruz Christmas tradition of going door-to-door with decorated branches singing aguinaldo songs.
details: La Rama is a distinctive Veracruz Christmas tradition where groups carry decorated tree branches door-to-door singing humorous aguinaldo verses. If the homeowner doesn't give treats or money, the singers respond with comedic insults. The tradition reflects the Afro-Caribbean influence on Veracruz culture.

name: Fiestas Patrias / Independence celebrations
desc: Grito celebrations, parades, fireworks and civic ceremonies across Mexico.

name: Día de la Candelaria (nationwide)
desc: Tamales gatherings and religious observances linked to Candlemas traditions.

name: Sankthansaften (St. John's Eve)
desc: Norway's midsummer celebration with bonfires along the coastline, folk music, and celebrations of the summer solstice.
details: On the evening of June 23, Norwegians light bonfires along the coast and in the mountains to celebrate the longest day of the year. The tradition dates back centuries and is tied to both pagan solstice rituals and the Christian feast of St. John the Baptist. Communities gather for food, music, and dancing as the midnight sun keeps the sky bright.

name: Independence from Spain celebrations
desc: Parades and ceremonies marking Panama’s independence from Spain.

name: Major pilgrimage to Fátima
desc: Major pilgrimage to Fátima — Peregrinação de Fátima; also minor pilgrimages on the 13th of each month until October
details: Peregrinação de Fátima; also minor pilgrimages on the 13th of each month until October

name: South Africa Freedom Day
desc: Commemoration of the first democratic elections in 1994, ending apartheid.
details: Freedom Day commemorates the first democratic elections on April 27, 1994, when all South Africans could vote for the first time. Events include memorial services, concerts, cultural activities, and community gatherings celebrating the end of apartheid.

name: Eid Celebrations Yemen
desc: Major Eid celebrations across Yemen with traditional festivities despite ongoing conflict.
details: Yemenis celebrate with traditional foods, new clothing, family visits, and community gatherings. Celebrations include traditional dances like the Bara'a.

name: Makishi Masquerade
desc: UNESCO-recognized masked performances of the Luvale, Chokwe, and related peoples.
details: The Makishi masquerade, inscribed on UNESCO's Intangible Heritage list, features elaborate masks and full-body costumes representing spirits and ancestors of the Luvale, Chokwe, Lunda, and Mbunda peoples. Performances play key roles in mukanda initiation ceremonies.

name: Frieze Abu Dhabi
desc: A newly established major art fair reflecting the UAE's aggressive cultural expansion.
details: Complementing the Louvre Abu Dhabi and upcoming Guggenheim, this fair brings high-end contemporary commerce to the capital, targeting sovereign wealth and the region's rapidly maturing institutional collecting strategies.

name: Nigeria Independence Day
desc: National celebration of Nigeria's independence with parades and cultural displays from 36 states.
details: Nigeria's Independence Day on October 1 features grand military and civilian parades in Abuja, with each of the 36 states represented by cultural troupes performing traditional dances and music. It celebrates the diversity and unity of Africa's most populous nation.

name: Drift Museum
desc: A new museum space dedicated to experiential and kinetic art.
details: Expected to feature massive, highly technological immersive installations created by the acclaimed Studio Drift.

name: Akra Jazz Festival
desc: Ninth edition featuring international jazz performances on an open-air stage at Akra Antalya.
details: Prestigious venue with open-air jazz programming making it one of Turkey's notable summer jazz events.

name: Teuila Festival
desc: Samoa's largest cultural festival featuring fire knife dancing, traditional canoe races, and Samoan song and dance.
details: The Teuila Festival is Samoa's biggest annual cultural event, named after the native teuila flower. The week-long celebration showcases fire knife dancing (siva afi), fautasi (longboat) races, traditional Samoan dance, tattooing demonstrations, arts and crafts, and a floral parade.

name: Silvesterchlausen
desc: Silvesterchlausen — medieval masked procession
details: medieval masked procession

name: Mountain Dance and Folk Festival
desc: The oldest folk festival in America, celebrating Appalachian music and dance traditions since 1928.
details: Founded by Bascom Lamar Lunsford in 1928, this is the oldest continuously running folk and dance festival in America. Held at the Diana Wortham Theatre in downtown Asheville, it features clogging, smooth-style dancing, ballad singing, and old-time and bluegrass music from the Southern Appalachian tradition.

name: Turkmenistan Independence Day
desc: 35th anniversary of independence with military parades, concerts, and cultural events.
details: 35th anniversary of Soviet independence celebrated with military parade, concerts, cultural events, and nationwide festivities. Major celebrations centered in Ashgabat.

name: Nyepi (Day of Silence)
desc: Balinese Hindu New Year marked by absolute silence.
details: No lights, travel, or external activity is permitted across the entire island, fostering deep meditation.

name: Africa Basel
desc: A specialized event highlighting contemporary art from the African continent and diaspora.
details: Taking advantage of the massive global collector presence during Basel week, this platform ensures visibility and commercial viability for African galleries within the epicenter of the European art market.

name: Photo Basel 2026
desc: Switzerland's first and only international art fair dedicated to photography.
details: Running concurrently with Art Basel, it provides a highly focused environment for the acquisition of fine art photography, from vintage masterpieces to contemporary lens-based media.

name: Positions Berlin
desc: A cornerstone of Berlin Art Week hosted at Tempelhof Airport.
details: Showcasing 75 international galleries within a massive aircraft hangar, driving critical sales and serving as the official fair partner of the city's vast institutional network.

name: Berlin Art Week
desc: A massive city-wide festival combining institutional exhibitions, private collections, and fairs.
details: The week synchronizes Berlin's entire cultural apparatus. It features major openings at the KW Institute, Hamburger Bahnhof, and numerous private 'Sammlungs', solidifying Berlin's reputation as Europe's premier production hub for contemporary art.

name: Palo de Mayo (Maypole festivities)
desc: Caribbean coast celebration featuring dance, music, and Afro-descendant cultural traditions.

name: Festival de Cine de Bogotá (BOGOCINE)
desc: 43rd edition screening 198+ films in international competitions, social documentaries, and short film categories.
details: Major film festival featuring diverse cinema: fiction, documentaries, shorts, international productions. New dates for 2026 (September vs. traditional dates). Projects approximately 198 films across multiple competition categories. Social documentary focus highlights films addressing cultural and social issues. Workshops and screenings throughout Bogotá venues.

name: Bloemencorso (Flower Parade)
desc: Spectacular flower parade with massive floats decorated in millions of blooms.
details: The Bloemencorso parade features 20+ enormous floats covered in millions of tulips, hyacinths, and daffodils, parading 40km from Noordwijk to Haarlem through tulip fields.

name: Boysun Bahori (Spring Festival)
desc: UNESCO-recognized folklore festival celebrating arrival of spring with traditional sports and crafts in mountain villages.
details: Colorful folklore festival celebrating arrival of warm weather and showcasing Boysun cultural heritage. Large yurt camp with workshops and stages for folk ensemble performances. Traditional sports competitions include kurash (wrestling), kupkari (horseback game), and darboz (tightrope walking combining circus and theater).

name: Superfine NYC
desc: The flagship event for the artist-direct Superfair franchise.
details: A high-energy, accessible platform returning to Brooklyn, designed specifically to bypass traditional gallery structures and connect independent artists directly with eager buyers.

name: NEB (New European Bauhaus) Festival
desc: An initiative by the European Commission uniting culture, art, and sustainability.
details: The festival addresses the transformative power of democratic engagement in shaping inclusive communities. It acts as a laboratory highlighting prototypes and architectural concepts that support the EU's aggressive green transition goals.

name: BAFICI - Buenos Aires International Independent Film Festival
desc: One of Latin America's most important film festivals, showcasing independent cinema with free open-air screenings throughout the city.
details: The 27th edition accepts short and feature films produced after January 1, 2025. Screenings held in major Buenos Aires cinemas plus free open-air screenings in parks and plazas. Application deadline was December 18, 2025. Accepts fiction, documentary, and experimental films.

name: Caribana / Toronto Caribbean Carnival (US connection - Buffalo)
desc: Buffalo's Caribbean parade and festival celebrating West Indian culture, connected to the larger Toronto Caribana tradition.
details: Buffalo hosts its own Caribbean celebration connected to the larger Toronto Caribana tradition, with costumed masqueraders, steel pan bands, soca and calypso music, and Caribbean cuisine in a colorful street parade and festival.

name: Art Busan
desc: A rapidly growing international fair in South Korea's massive maritime metropolis.
details: Offering a more relaxed alternative to the frenzy of Seoul, Art Busan attracts serious collectors to the coast, heavily featuring vibrant, large-scale contemporary painting and sculpture.

name: Art Cairo
desc: A major platform uniting contemporary art from the Middle East and Africa.
details: Reflecting Egypt's dual identity as an Arab and African nation, the fair brings together galleries from across the continent, playing a crucial role in fostering South-South commercial and cultural networks.

name: Artemis II Launch
desc: First crewed lunar flyby since Apollo.
details: NASA astronauts will orbit the Moon to test critical habitation systems and life support for future deep-space missions.

name: Open Air Cinema
desc: Outdoor film screenings at the Galileo Open Air Cinema across stunning Cape Town locations.
details: The Galileo Open Air Cinema operates across multiple stunning Cape Town locations including Kirstenbosch Gardens, the V&A Waterfront, and various wine estates. Audiences bring picnic blankets and enjoy films under the stars with Table Mountain as a backdrop.

name: Robben Island Day
desc: Commemoration events at Nelson Mandela's former prison island for the anniversary of his release.
details: February 11 marks the anniversary of Nelson Mandela's release from prison in 1990. Special commemorative events take place at Robben Island, including tours, memorial services, and cultural programmes reflecting on South Africa's journey to democracy.

name: Table Mountain Cableway Summer Festival
desc: Summer events and sunset concerts atop Cape Town's iconic Table Mountain.
details: Table Mountain's summer programme features sunset concerts, full moon hikes, and cultural events atop one of the New7Wonders of Nature. The views of Cape Town, the Atlantic, and the surrounding mountains make this one of the world's most spectacular festival settings.

name: Cape Town Design Festival
desc: A celebration of design innovation in one of Africa's most creative cities.
details: The festival focuses on how design thinking can solve complex urban and social challenges in a post-apartheid context. It features heavy cross-pollination between local artisans and high-end industrial designers.

name: Festival de Carcassonne
desc: A summer-long performing arts festival within the stunning medieval fortress of Carcassonne.
details: The Festival de Carcassonne hosts over 120 events within and around the spectacular walled medieval city, a UNESCO World Heritage site. Opera, theatre, dance, classical music, and rock concerts fill the ancient amphitheatre.

name: Pinta Miami
desc: The only fair specialized in Latin American art during Miami Art Week.
details: Held at 'The Hangar', curating a boutique experience that positions Ibero and Latin American creators at the forefront, bridging the gap between North and South American markets.

name: lit.COLOGNE
desc: Europe's biggest literature festival attracting ~100,000 visitors.
details: lit.COLOGNE brings 100+ authors from around the world for readings, discussions, and literary events across Cologne's venues, making it the largest literature festival on the continent.

name: Guinea Independence Day
desc: National celebrations featuring Guinea's legendary drum and dance troupes.
details: Guinea's Independence Day celebrations showcase the country's extraordinary musical heritage, with performances by drum and dance ensembles that are among the finest in West Africa. The national ballet tradition that has influenced global dance is celebrated alongside patriotic ceremonies.

name: Senegal Independence Day
desc: Senegalese national day with parades, teranga hospitality, and cultural performances.
details: Senegal's Independence Day on April 4 features military parades, cultural performances from the country's diverse ethnic groups, and celebrations embodying the Senegalese spirit of teranga (hospitality). Events take place across the country with the main festivities in Dakar.

name: Great American Beer Festival
desc: The nation's premier beer festival with 800+ breweries pouring 4,000+ beers at the Colorado Convention Center.
details: The GABF is the ultimate American craft beer experience, featuring over 800 breweries from across the country pouring more than 4,000 different beers. The festival includes the prestigious GABF Competition, educational sessions, food pairings, and an electric atmosphere of beer enthusiasts and industry professionals.

name: Dorrigo Folk and Bluegrass Festival
desc: Intimate three-day folk and bluegrass celebration with workshops and jam sessions in a rainforest setting.
details: Set in the lush Dorrigo plateau, this boutique festival brings together folk, bluegrass, and old-time music lovers for workshops, performances, and spontaneous jam sessions in a welcoming community atmosphere.

name: Palm Jebel Ali Friday Mosque
desc: Groundbreaking of a sculptural mosque on an artificial archipelago.
details: Designed by SOM, featuring a cascading chainmail canopy that filters light and captures sea breezes, serving as the spiritual center of the development.

name: Dubai Marathon
desc: Major international marathon through the streets of Dubai attracting elite and amateur runners.
details: Features a fast, flat course along Jumeirah Beach Road with views of iconic Dubai landmarks.

name: Dubai International Dance Festival
desc: Major film festival attracting regional and international filmmakers with screenings and premieres.
details: Showcases Arab and international cinema with red carpet premieres, industry workshops, and filmmaker Q&A sessions.

name: Guli Lola (Tulip Festival)
desc: National celebration of flowers with 3.9 million tulips planted across the country.
details: National celebration of flowers and gardening with 3.9 million tulips planted across the country. Major events in Dushanbe and nationwide.

name: Art Dusseldorf
desc: A sophisticated fair housed in the spectacular Areal Böhler steelworks.
details: Operating as a strong regional rival to Cologne, the fair heavily features established German and Benelux galleries. Its industrial setting provides a dramatic backdrop for large-scale contemporary painting and sculpture.

name: Yaga Gathering
desc: Forest gathering blending music, performance, and installation art among Lithuanian lakes.
details: Yaga Gathering immerses attendees in Lithuanian forest with 4 stages, workshops, healing zones, and experimental art forms including video, installation, and performance.

name: Mountain State Forest Festival
desc: West Virginia's oldest and largest festival celebrating Appalachian culture amid peak fall foliage.
details: The Mountain State Forest Festival celebrates West Virginia's timber heritage and Appalachian culture with parades, the crowning of Queen Silvia, woodchopping competitions, carnival rides, and community events amid the stunning fall colors of the Allegheny Mountains.

name: Montreux Jazz Festival Africa
desc: The legendary Montreux Jazz Festival's first-ever African edition in the Franschhoek Wine Valley.
details: Franschhoek Wine Valley makes history as the first African destination of the legendary Montreux Jazz Festival, a cultural cornerstone since 1967. The 2026 debut edition features a lineup of international superstars and local talent set against the backdrop of world-class vineyards. This marks a significant moment for African music tourism.

name: Art Genève
desc: A refined, salon-style art fair located in the heart of the Swiss financial sector.
details: Distinct from the massive scale of Art Basel, this fair offers an elegant, curated selection of blue-chip galleries, appealing directly to the immense, discrete private wealth and banking infrastructure of Geneva.

name: Forever is Now.06, Art d’Egypt
desc: A monumental contemporary art exhibition staged at the foot of the Pyramids of Giza.
details: This event provides arguably the most spectacular backdrop in the global art world. It creates a profound dialogue between 4,500-year-old monumental heritage and massive, site-specific contemporary interventions by global superstars.

name: Grafenegg Music Festival
desc: Classical music in a spectacular castle and open-air auditorium.
details: Grafenegg Festival features the Tonkünstler Orchestra and international guest artists performing in the stunning Wolkenturm open-air auditorium and castle Auditorium.

name: Empire Music Festival
desc: Electronic music festival attracting major international and regional artists.

name: Festival de Cine de Guayaquil
desc: XII edition screening fiction/documentary shorts, features (5 min-120 min), with Golden/Silver Iguana awards for selected works.
details: Accepts short films (5-30 min) and feature films (50-120 min), both fiction/documentary. Ecuadorian and international films, non-Spanish must be Spanish-subtitled. Features in-person screenings, workshops, master classes, parallel events. Awards: Golden Iguana (features), Silver Iguana (shorts). Contact: contacto.ffesticinegye@gmail.com or +593 97 894 1010 (Mon-Fri, 8 AM-5 PM).

name: Augustibluus (Haapsalu Blues)
desc: Blues festival set against Haapsalu Castle, featuring major American and European blues artists.
details: Haapsalu Castle provides a stunning backdrop for this blues festival. Big names from the US and European artists perform on the main stage, while musicians take their shows to the streets and open-air cafés. The programme includes workshops, exhibitions, and acoustic concerts in the old railway station.

name: Tet Trung Thu (Vietnam Mid-Autumn)
desc: Children-focused festival with lantern parades, lion dances, and mooncakes across Vietnam.

name: Hay Festival Hay-on-Wye
desc: Major literature and ideas festival with headline talks and extensive programming.
details: Bill Clinton called it 'the Woodstock of the mind'. Hay Festival brings 700+ writers, thinkers, and performers for talks, debates, and workshops in the charming Welsh border town.

name: World Village Festival
desc: Helsinki's festival of global cultures with music, food, talks, and activism from around the world.
details: The World Village Festival (Maailma kylässä) is Finland's largest free multicultural event, bringing together music, food, and discussion from cultures around the world. Held at Helsinki's Railway Square, it promotes global solidarity, fair trade, and intercultural dialogue.

name: Hermanus Whale Festival
desc: Eco-marine festival celebrating southern right whale season with concerts, crafts, and whale watching.
details: The Hermanus Whale Festival is the only eco-marine festival in South Africa, celebrating the annual arrival of southern right whales to Walker Bay. It features whale watching, live music, environmental talks, arts and crafts, and a food market in one of the world's best land-based whale watching destinations.

name: Art Central HK
desc: A highly energetic satellite fair running concurrently with Art Basel Hong Kong.
details: Housed in a massive tent on the Central Harbourfront, Art Central focuses heavily on young, progressive Asian galleries and immersive installations, offering a more accessible entry point to the HK art market.

name: Incheon Pentaport Rock Festival
desc: Korea's major international rock festival featuring major international headliners and Korean acts.
details: The Incheon Pentaport Rock Festival is one of Korea's biggest music festivals, held at Songdo Moonlight Festival Park. It features major international rock, indie, and electronic artists alongside top Korean acts across multiple stages. The festival's location near Seoul makes it highly accessible for international visitors.

name: CI Bloom
desc: A spring contemporary art fair focused specifically on Turkish galleries and artists.
details: Organized by the founders of Contemporary Istanbul, CI Bloom is designed to stimulate the local market, providing a vital commercial platform for Turkish artists amidst ongoing regional economic challenges.

name: Contemporary Istanbul
desc: A vibrant fair located at the geographic crossroads of Europe and Asia.
details: Drawing heavily from the Balkans, the Caucasus, and the Middle East, this fair reflects Istanbul's complex identity. It is a critical hub for regional collectors and highlights the resilience of the Turkish contemporary art scene.

name: Art KARLSRUHE
desc: A massive, domestically focused fair emphasizing classical modernism and contemporary art.
details: With hundreds of exhibitors, the fair caters heavily to the affluent, conservative collecting base of Southern Germany. It is known for strong sales in mid-market 20th-century German art.

name: Kobe Jazz Festival
desc: Japan's premier jazz festival in the cosmopolitan port city with its long jazz tradition.
details: Kobe has been Japan's jazz capital since the 1920s, and its annual festival features performances across dozens of venues throughout the city's international district. Free outdoor concerts, club performances, and concert hall shows showcase jazz artists from Japan and around the world.

name: Krobo Dipo Initiation
desc: Coming-of-age ceremony for young Krobo women involving elaborate bead adornment and public dancing.
details: The Dipo initiation ceremony of the Krobo people marks the transition of girls to womanhood. Initiates are adorned with hundreds of strands of traditional beads, their bodies painted with white clay, and they perform public dances demonstrating their readiness for marriage.

name: Corpus Christi ‘Diablicos’ (devils) traditions
desc: Masked diablicos dances and processions tied to Corpus Christi.

name: Lake Como Design Festival
desc: An intimate, highly aestheticized design festival set around the spectacular Lake Como.
details: Moving away from the frantic pace of Milan, this festival offers a curated selection of contemporary and 20th-century design displayed within stunning, often private, historic villas and palazzi along the lake.

name: Tanglewood Music Festival
desc: The summer home of the Boston Symphony Orchestra, set in the idyllic Berkshires with classical, jazz, and popular music.
details: Tanglewood is the summer home of the Boston Symphony Orchestra and one of the most prestigious classical music festivals in the world. Set on a 524-acre estate in the beautiful Berkshire Hills, the festival features orchestral concerts, chamber music, recitals, and popular artist performances. Lawn seating allows picnicking under the stars while listening to world-class music.

name: Glyndebourne Festival Opera
desc: World-renowned opera festival in a stunning Sussex country house setting.
details: Glyndebourne presents six operas across the summer season in its purpose-built theatre, with picnicking on the lawns during the long interval as an iconic tradition.

name: ARCO Lisboa
desc: The Portuguese edition of the ARCO franchise, capitalizing on Lisbon's cultural boom.
details: Set in the historic Cordoaria Nacional, it focuses heavily on Portuguese and Spanish galleries, alongside strong connections to the Angolan and Brazilian contemporary scenes, reflecting historical Lusophone networks.

name: Proms (BBC Proms)
desc: World's greatest classical music festival with 90+ concerts at the Royal Albert Hall.
details: The BBC Proms presents 90+ concerts over eight weeks at the Royal Albert Hall, culminating in the legendary Last Night of the Proms with its patriotic sing-along tradition.

name: Frieze Sculpture London
desc: A monumental, free public exhibition of outdoor sculpture in The Regent's Park.
details: Running concurrently with Frieze London, this highly accessible exhibition brings museum-quality, large-scale contemporary sculpture into the public domain, blurring the lines between commercial fair and civic art project.

name: London Design Festival
desc: A citywide celebration championing London's role as a global creative capital.
details: LDF features hundreds of events, landmark installations in public spaces like the V&A museum, and targeted design districts. It is a powerful platform for diverse voices across architecture, digital design, and traditional craftsmanship.

name: Festival Interceltique de Lorient
desc: One of Europe’s leading Celtic-culture festivals mixing music, dance, and heritage.
details: The Festival Interceltique brings Celtic nations together for 10 days of music, dance, parades, and cultural events. Bagpipers, Celtic rock, Breton dance, and the Grand Parade are highlights.

name: Madrid Fusión
desc: The world's most influential, chef-led culinary innovation congress.
details: Madrid Fusión is where the future of global gastronomy is forged. Elite chefs from around the world gather to unveil groundbreaking new techniques, radical sustainability practices, and avant-garde flavor profiles.

name: Equatorial Guinea Independence Day
desc: National celebrations in Central Africa's wealthiest nation per capita.
details: Equatorial Guinea's Independence Day features celebrations in Malabo with traditional Fang and Bubi cultural performances, military parades, and festivities marking independence from Spain in 1968.

name: Dansbandsveckan
desc: Unique Swedish festival centred around 'dansband' music, celebrating partner dancing with over 100,000 visitors.
details: This one-of-a-kind festival in Malung, Dalarna, centres around dansband music—a Swedish genre ideal for partner dances like jitterbug and foxtrot. Rooted in schlager, country, rock'n'roll, and swing, it provides a lively soundtrack for social dancing. With over 100,000 visitors expected, it is a genuinely joyful celebration of a uniquely Swedish tradition.

name: Art-O-Rama
desc: An intimate, highly experimental contemporary art fair in the South of France.
details: Held at the Friche la Belle de Mai, the fair features bespoke booth designs created specifically by the artists. It reflects Marseille's gritty, independent, and fiercely creative contemporary art ecosystem.

name: Contour Biennale 11
desc: Europe's only biennial dedicated to moving image art, curated by Sofia Lemos across five locations in historic Mechelen.
details: The 11th Contour Biennale in Mechelen presents cutting-edge film, video, and installation works. Curated by Sofia Lemos, it unfolds through a parcours across five locations anchored at The Garage/Kunsthal Mechelen. Established in 2003, it engages with contemporary social, political, and aesthetic concerns within Mechelen's historical context.

name: The Medina Triennial
desc: A newly launched contemporary art initiative in Western New York.
details: It features site-responsive works dispersed across the village's industrial architecture and Erie Canal waterfront, engaging directly with Western New York's communities, often collaborating with residents to create works rooted in place.

name: Spectrum Miami
desc: A lively contemporary art fair produced by the Redwood Art Group.
details: Offers a highly accessible entry point for newer collectors during Miami Art Week, focusing heavily on independent artists and affordable contemporary works.

name: Art Wynwood
desc: A mid-winter contemporary art fair capitalizing on the Presidents' Day weekend.
details: Taking place in the Wynwood Arts District, the fair focuses on urban art, pop surrealism, and blue-chip contemporary works, drawing affluent snowbirds and the local Miami elite.

name: Scope Miami Beach
desc: A premier incubator for contemporary art and experiential programming.
details: Known for its immersive installations, monumental sculptures, and integration of music and wellness, heavily targeting a younger, dynamic collector base.

name: MIA Photo Fair Milano
desc: Italy's premier international fair dedicated entirely to photography and the moving image.
details: MIA focuses on elevating photography to the highest levels of fine art collecting. It features a diverse range of historic reportage, avant-garde fashion photography, and cutting-edge digital image manipulation.

name: Miart Milano
desc: An elegant fair blending modern masters with cutting-edge contemporary art.
details: Capitalizing on Milan's design and fashion wealth, Miart offers a highly sophisticated VIP program. It acts as the intellectual and commercial prelude to the frenzy of Milan Design Week, which follows immediately after.

name: Las Llamadas (candombe parades)
desc: Signature candombe drum parades through Montevideo’s barrios Sur and Palermo.

name: Art Russia
desc: A major domestic contemporary art fair operating within complex geopolitical realities.
details: Given international sanctions, the fair primarily serves the internal Russian art market, focusing on domestic galleries, state-approved narratives, and internal wealth circulation.

name: ADAA The Art Show
desc: The highly respected fair of the Art Dealers Association of America.
details: Returning to the Park Avenue Armory after a strategic pause, focusing on rigorously curated solo, two-person, and thematic exhibitions by top-tier American galleries.

name: Frieze New York
desc: Hosted at The Shed in Hudson Yards featuring an elite selection of global galleries.
details: A premier spring destination for East Coast collectors, noted for its strong sales, curatorial rigor, and extensive public programming exploring contemporary political and social themes.

name: The Photography Show (AIPAD)
desc: The preeminent exhibition dedicated strictly to fine art photography.
details: Held at the Park Avenue Armory, showcasing exceptional historical and contemporary lens-based work, accompanied by robust educational programming and live talks.

name: Salon Art + Design
desc: A highly vetted showcase of vintage, modern, and contemporary design.
details: Celebrated for its 'thematically permissive' approach where fine art competes directly with high-end furniture, appealing to collectors who curate holistic living environments.

name: Independent 20th Century
desc: A specialized fair re-examining overlooked narratives in 20th-century art.
details: Held at the historic Breuer building, this fair focuses on historical re-evaluations, presenting works by artists who were marginalized during their lifetimes. It caters to a highly academic, museum-oriented collector base.

name: Reed Dance (Zulu)
desc: Zulu Reed Dance ceremony at the royal palace of the Zulu Nation.
details: The Zulu Reed Dance (Umkhosi Womhlanga) at the royal palace in Nongoma is a cultural ceremony where thousands of young Zulu women present reeds to the Zulu King. It celebrates virginity, womanhood, and Zulu cultural pride in one of South Africa's most impressive traditional ceremonies.

name: Notodden Blues Festival
desc: One of Europe's premier blues festivals featuring international blues legends and emerging talent.
details: For five days, the small town of Notodden becomes the blues capital of Europe. The festival features top international artists including the 2026 lineup of Kenny Wayne Shepherd Band, Vanessa Collier, and DumDum Boys. Intimate venues and outdoor stages create an authentic blues atmosphere.

name: Inferno Metal Festival
desc: Legendary four-day extreme metal festival drawing metal lovers from around the world to Oslo.
details: Held at Oslo's Rockefeller, John Dee, and other venues, Inferno has been a pilgrimage for extreme metal fans for over two decades. The 2026 lineup features Cult of Luna, Deicide, and Enslaved. Both four-day passes and individual venue tickets are available.

name: MUNCH Triennale 2025/2026
desc: Titled 'Almost Unreal', an exploration of contemporary art through the legacy of Edvard Munch.
details: Hosted at the monumental new MUNCH museum, the triennale leverages the psychological depth of Munch's work to frame contemporary anxieties, utilizing digital media and immersive installations.

name: Storsjöyran (Yran)
desc: One of Sweden's oldest city festivals dating back to 1963, combining renowned Swedish and international acts.
details: Often simply called Yran, this is one of Sweden's oldest city festivals. The event combines a diverse lineup of Swedish and international acts with niche performers, creating a vibrant mix in the charming lakeside city of Östersund.

name: Salon du Dessin de Paris
desc: The world's most prestigious fair dedicated exclusively to the art of drawing.
details: Attracting top museum curators from the Louvre, Met, and Getty, the Salon offers an intimate look at masterpieces on paper from the Renaissance to the modern era, demanding intense connoisseurship.

name: Maison & Objet Paris
desc: A massive, trend-setting biannual trade fair for interior design, lifestyle, and home decor.
details: Attracting professionals from across the globe, Maison & Objet dictates the aesthetic trends for the coming seasons. It covers everything from high-end furniture and artisanal crafts to smart home technologies and retail forecasting.

name: Kukeri Festival
desc: A spectacular masked festival where costumed dancers drive away evil spirits with enormous bells.
details: The International Festival of Masquerade Games in Pernik brings together Kukeri performers from across Bulgaria and the Balkans. Wearing elaborate animal costumes with massive bells, they dance to chase away winter spirits in a tradition thousands of years old.

name: Thailand Biennale Phuket
desc: A roving national biennial that brings site-specific international art to Thailand's tourist hubs.
details: By placing contemporary art within the natural and cultural landscapes of Phuket, the biennial aims to diversify the local tourism economy. It bridges Thai artistic traditions with global contemporary currents in a highly accessible format.

name: Riviera Maya Jazz Festival
desc: Annual free open-air jazz festival on Caribbean beaches featuring renowned international and national jazz artists.
details: Held in late November on Playa del Carmen beaches. Festival faced cancellation in 2024 amid corruption allegations but plans for 2026 revival announced. Scenic coastal setting. Free open-air format. Attracts international jazz artists and regional talent. Typically spans 2–3 days with performances beginning around 7:00 PM.

name: Flag Day celebrations
desc: Parades and cultural events commemorating Haitian Flag Day.

name: Festival de Diablos y Congos (around Corpus Christi)
desc: Afro-Panamanian tradition featuring masked devils, Congo music/dance, and street performance.

name: Prescott Frontier Days
desc: World's oldest rodeo, celebrating western heritage in the mile-high city of Prescott since 1888.
details: Prescott Frontier Days is recognized as the World's Oldest Rodeo, featuring PRCA rodeo competitions, a massive Fourth of July parade, western art shows, and community celebrations in the charming mountain town of Prescott.

name: Rabat Mawazine Fringe
desc: Free outdoor concerts and street performances running alongside the main Mawazine Festival.
details: The fringe programme of the Mawazine Festival features hundreds of free concerts and street performances across Rabat and Salé, making world-class music accessible to all. Many of the fringe stages attract even larger crowds than the ticketed events.

name: Riga Opera Festival
desc: Latvian National Opera’s festival program with premieres and gala; dates stated in report.
details: The Riga Opera Festival at Latvia's National Opera and Ballet features new productions and beloved classics, concluding with a gala concert showcasing Baltic operatic talent.

name: Salvador Carnival (core days)
desc: Trio elétrico street parties and Afro-Brazilian bloco traditions across multiple circuits.

name: Salzburg Whitsun Festival
desc: High-profile classical music festival weekend within Salzburg’s festival ecosystem.
details: Baroque music concert series

name: Feria Internacional de San Sebastián
desc: Street parties, cultural shows and sports events tied to the city’s patron saint.

name: Puerto Rico Heineken Jazz Festival
desc: One of the biggest jazz festivals in the Caribbean, bringing jazz masters and famous jazz artists together to celebrate music.
details: The Heineken Jazz Festival takes place at Tito Puente, an open-air amphitheater in Hato Rey, San Juan. The four-day concert brings together international and Caribbean jazz performers celebrating the genre. It's an important cultural event highlighting jazz as central to Caribbean musical heritage.

name: SP-Arte
desc: The São Paulo International Art Festival, the anchor of the Brazilian art market.
details: Set in the iconic Bienal Pavilion designed by Oscar Niemeyer, SP-Arte is an explosion of Brazilian modernism and contemporary practice, essential for navigating South America's largest and most sophisticated market.

name: Kiaf Seoul
desc: Korea's longest-running international art fair, emphasizing Asian contemporary art.
details: Held concurrently with Frieze, Kiaf defends the local market, providing a massive platform for Korean artists and regional galleries to capitalize on the massive influx of international curators and buyers.

name: Sardine Run Festival
desc: One of nature's greatest spectacles as billions of sardines migrate along the KZN coast.
details: The annual Sardine Run along the KwaZulu-Natal coast is one of the planet's greatest natural spectacles. Billions of sardines create a slick stretching for kilometres, followed by sharks, dolphins, whales, and seabirds. Coastal communities celebrate with fish braais and diving expeditions.

name: Nomad St.Moritz
desc: An exclusive, traveling showcase for collectible design and contemporary art.
details: Held in stunning architectural locations (often historic chalets), Nomad breaks the trade fair model. It caters to ultra-high-net-worth individuals during the peak of the Swiss winter sports season, offering a highly intimate purchasing environment.

name: Sauti za Busara Workshops
desc: Music industry workshops and masterclasses running alongside the main Sauti za Busara festival.
details: The workshop programme accompanying Sauti za Busara features music industry masterclasses, instrument-making workshops, recording sessions, and networking events for African musicians and industry professionals. It builds East African music industry capacity.

name: Sydney Film Festival
desc: Major international arts festival across Sydney with theatre, music, dance, and visual art.
details: Sydney Festival is one of Australia's flagship cultural events, presenting hundreds of performances and events across the city during January. The three-week program spans theatre, music, dance, circus, visual arts, and free outdoor events, attracting artists and audiences from around the world.

name: Arctic Winter Games
desc: International multi-sport event for circumpolar athletes including traditional Inuit and Dene games.
details: The Arctic Winter Games bring together athletes from circumpolar regions to compete in conventional winter sports alongside traditional Inuit and Dene games like the knuckle hop, one-foot high kick, and Arctic sports. A cultural festival runs alongside the games.

name: Virgen de Suyapa pilgrimage
desc: Pilgrimages and masses honoring Honduras’ patron saint, Virgen de Suyapa.

name: Artist Project Toronto
desc: A massive un-galleried art fair where patrons buy directly from independent artists.
details: This format provides crucial income for hundreds of independent Canadian artists. It fosters a highly interactive, democratic environment, stripping away the traditional gallery intermediary.

name: HotDocs
desc: North America's largest documentary film festival, conference, and market.
details: HotDocs is the critical nexus for documentary filmmakers to secure funding, distribution, and critical acclaim. It screens hundreds of deeply investigative films, driving the cultural conversation on global socio-political issues.

name: Trabzon International Folk Dance Festival
desc: International folk dance festival on the Black Sea coast featuring horon and world dances.
details: Showcases the famous Black Sea horon dance alongside international folk dances from participating countries. Vibrant performances along the scenic coastline.

name: One Caucasus Festival
desc: Tri-national peace-building festival bringing Armenians, Azerbaijanis, and Georgians together through music.
details: Interdisciplinary borderland festival bringing Armenians, Azerbaijanis, and Georgians together annually through volunteer programs, collaborations, workshops, and music. 21,000+ annual attendees, 570+ musicians from 40+ countries.

name: Artissima Torino
desc: Italy's most experimental and avant-garde contemporary art fair.
details: Artissima is revered by curators for its rigorous focus on discovery and conceptual art. It consistently eschews safe, commercial painting in favor of challenging installations, performance, and highly theoretical curatorial projects.

name: Mongolia Independence Day
desc: Celebration of Mongolia's independence from Qing China with concerts, parades, and fireworks.
details: Mongolia's Independence Day commemorates the declaration of independence from Qing China in December 1911. Celebrations include concerts, parades, fireworks, traditional foods, and patriotic ceremonies across the country, centered in Ulaanbaatar.

name: Brännbollsyran
desc: Unique festival combining the World Championship in Swedish rounders (brännboll) with northern Sweden's largest evening music festival.
details: Brännbollsyran offers a truly unique dual experience: daytime World Championship in brännboll (Swedish rounders) followed by northern Sweden's largest evening music festival. The combination of competitive sport and live music in the university city of Umeå creates an energetic and distinctly Swedish event.

name: Biennale Danza (Int. Festival of Contemporary Dance)
desc: Directed by the visionary British choreographer Wayne McGregor.
details: The 20th edition integrates cutting-edge technology, visual arts, and performance. It features daily events with global companies and awards the Golden Lion (to Bangarra Dance Theatre) and Silver Lion (to Mamela Nyamza) for lifetime achievement.

name: Biennale Teatro (Int. Theatre Festival)
desc: The 54th edition of the international theatre showcase, directed by acclaimed actor Willem Dafoe.
details: Dafoe brings a focus on avant-garde performance, physical theater, and the intersection of stagecraft with cinematic acting. The festival highlights radical experimentation and daily masterclasses with the most important protagonists of the contemporary scene.

name: Biennale Musica (Int. Festival of Contemporary Music)
desc: The 70th edition of La Biennale's contemporary music festival, directed by Caterina Barbieri.
details: Barbieri, known for her pioneering work in modular synthesis and psychoacoustics, will likely steer the festival toward electronic composition, immersive sonic environments, and performances that bridge classical avant-garde with modern electronic music.

name: The Other Art Fair Los Angeles
desc: An unpretentious hotel takeover showcasing independent artists.
details: Hosted at 3Labs, featuring 160 independent artists. Provides an immersive, non-traditional environment with live DJs, installations, and direct artist-to-buyer transactions.

name: Seychelles Carnival
desc: International carnival with delegations from around the world celebrating in the tropical islands.
details: The Seychelles Carnival (Carnaval International de Victoria) welcomes delegations from countries worldwide for three days of colorful parades, music, dance, and cultural displays through the streets of Victoria, with the Indian Ocean as a stunning backdrop.

name: Meeting of Styles Vilnius
desc: International street art and graffiti festival at Vilnius Railway Park.
details: The first Meeting of Styles in Lithuania brings international street artists to paint murals, panels, and a real train wagon alongside workshops, talks, and DJ sessions.

name: Tokyo Gendai
desc: A major international art fair re-establishing Japan's position in the global market.
details: Attracting top-tier global galleries, Tokyo Gendai aims to activate Japan's massive but historically insular wealth. It provides a highly curated, sophisticated platform bridging the Japanese aesthetic with global contemporary currents.

name: Festival of Lights Zagreb
desc: Civic-scale light-art festival turning central Zagreb into an open-air installation route.
details: light displays on landmark buildings

name: Sechseläuten
desc: Zurich spring tradition with guild parades and burning of the Böögg.

name: Salmon Festival
desc: Celebrations of the annual salmon run across BC, with Indigenous cultural events and ecological education.
details: Multiple communities across British Columbia celebrate the annual salmon run with festivals honoring the ecological and cultural significance of salmon to Indigenous peoples and the region. Events include Indigenous ceremonies, salmon barbecues, ecological tours, and art exhibitions related to the salmon lifecycle.

name: Corpus Christi 2026 - Mexico Celebrations
desc: Catholic holiday with processions, decorated streets, and traditional performances
details: Occurs Thursday after Trinity Sunday, ~2 months after Easter. Processions carry Holy Eucharist under decorated canopies. Streets adorned with flowers, colored sawdust, traditional designs. Children dress traditionally, altars erected. In Puebla/Veracruz Sierras: symbolic Moors & Christians battles, Danza de los Voladores.

name: Amazigh (Berber) New Year
desc: Celebration of Berber culture and identity marking the Amazigh new year (Yennayer).
details: Yennayer, the Amazigh New Year, is celebrated across Morocco on January 13th. Made an official holiday in 2023, it highlights Amazigh culture with traditional music, dance, food, and contemporary art. It is celebrated by Berber communities across North Africa.

name: Morocco Throne Day
desc: Morocco's most important national holiday celebrating the King's accession to the throne.
details: Throne Day (Fête du Trône) is Morocco's most significant national holiday, celebrating King Mohammed VI's accession to the throne. Festivities include military parades, fireworks, illuminated public buildings, traditional fantasias, and concerts across the kingdom.

name: South Africa Heritage Day
desc: National celebration of cultural diversity also known as National Braai Day.
details: Heritage Day celebrates South Africa's cultural diversity. Popularly known as National Braai Day, communities gather to braai (barbecue) while celebrating the Rainbow Nation's diverse heritage through music, dance, food, and cultural activities.

name: Chuseok (Korean Harvest Festival)
desc: Korea's harvest thanksgiving featuring songpyeon rice cakes, ancestral rites, and traditional folk games.
details: Chuseok is Korea's harvest thanksgiving, one of the year's two most important holidays. Families gather for charye (ancestral rites), eat songpyeon (crescent-shaped rice cakes), and visit ancestral graves for seongmyo. Folk villages host traditional activities including ganggangsullae circle dances, ssireum wrestling, and talchum mask dances.

name: Uhuru Celebrations (Tanzania)
desc: Tanzania's Independence Day celebrations with ngoma dances and cultural exhibitions.
details: Uhuru (Freedom) Day celebrates Tanzania's independence from Britain in 1961. Events include military parades, traditional ngoma drumming and dancing from across the country's 120+ ethnic groups, and cultural exhibitions.

name: Sheikh Zayed Festival
desc: One of Abu Dhabi's most iconic cultural celebrations showcasing Emirati heritage with international pavilions, crafts, and nightly fireworks.
details: This grand festival celebrates Emirati heritage through traditional crafts, heritage villages, international cultural pavilions, live performances, and nightly fireworks. Held during the cooler months, it's a favorite for families and visitors, presenting Emirati culture on a grand scale with food from around the world and cultural programming.

name: Guggenheim Abu Dhabi Opening
desc: Frank Gehry-designed museum opening on Saadiyat Island.
details: At 320,000 square feet, it will be the world's largest Guggenheim, showcasing global modern and contemporary art on Saadiyat Island.

name: Azmari Bet Music Nights
desc: Traditional Ethiopian live music venues where azmari musicians improvise witty songs about the audience.
details: Azmari bets are traditional Ethiopian music houses where azmari musicians play the masinko (one-stringed fiddle) and sing improvised, often humorous songs about audience members. These nightly gatherings in Addis Ababa are one of the most authentic cultural experiences in Africa.

name: Día de los Farolitos
desc: Lantern-lit streets and candles celebrating the Virgin Mary tradition.

name: Liwa International Festival
desc: A celebration of Bedouin culture and desert traditions with camel competitions, falconry, and heritage markets at Moreeb Dune.
details: Held in the Al Dhafra region, this festival celebrates Bedouin culture and desert traditions. Visitors experience camel competitions, falconry displays, heritage markets, and traditional sports, with the action at Moreeb Dune adding high-energy dune bashing and off-road challenges. It's an authentic insight into Emirati desert heritage.

name: Festival de las Huastecas 2026
desc: Multi-state festival celebrating Huasteca region culture
details: Participation from Tamaulipas, San Luis Potosí, Hidalgo, Querétaro, Puebla, Veracruz.

name: Bibliotheca Alexandrina Cultural Season
desc: Year-round cultural programming at the modern Library of Alexandria.
details: Features concerts, exhibitions, lectures, film screenings, and cultural events at the iconic modern library built near the site of the ancient Library of Alexandria.

name: Bard SummerScape
desc: Eclectic summer arts festival at Bard College featuring opera, theater, dance, and film.
details: Bard SummerScape presents a curated program of opera, theater, dance, cabaret, film, and orchestral concerts at the Frank Gehry-designed Fisher Center and other venues on Bard College's scenic Hudson Valley campus.

name: Alahamady Be
desc: Malagasy New Year celebration marking the start of the traditional lunar calendar year.
details: Alahamady Be is the traditional Malagasy New Year, based on the lunar calendar. It is a time for families to gather, perform rituals to honor ancestors, and celebrate the start of a new year with feasting, music, and traditional ceremonies.

name: Semana Santa (processions & alfombras)
desc: Iconic Holy Week processions over intricate sawdust ‘alfombras’ carpets.

name: Festival de Música Llanera - Various Locations
desc: International llanera music festival celebrating joropo, harp, and cuatro traditions of plains region across Venezuelan-Colombian border.
details: Festival Internacional de Música Llanera "El Silbón" in Venezuela (40 years of research/promotion). Venue where llanero folklorists test skills in joropo dancing, bandola, harp, cuatro, maracas, bass, and vocals in pasaje llanero, recitation, corrido. Celebrates folkloric music traditions of Colombian-Venezuelan Llanos plains. Music combines indigenous, African, Spanish influences in distinctive llanera sound.

name: Areni Wine Festival
desc: Annual festival at the cradle of winemaking with free entrance and tasting packages.
details: 13+ year-old annual festival in Areni, considered the cradle of winemaking. Free entrance; wine tasting packages 5,000 AMD. International tourism promotion.

name: Argungu Fishing Festival
desc: Spectacular fishing competition where thousands of men jump into the river with nets to catch the biggest fish.
details: The Argungu Fishing Festival dates back to 1934, initiated to mark peace between the Sokoto Caliphate and the Kebbi Kingdom. The four-day festival's highlight is a dramatic fishing competition where thousands of fishermen jump into the Matan Fada River with large hand nets to catch the biggest fish.

name: Ikeji Festival
desc: Major Igbo festival featuring the famous Long Juju oracle and warrior masquerades of Arochukwu.
details: The Ikeji Festival of the Aro people of Arochukwu is one of the most significant Igbo cultural celebrations. It features spectacular warrior masquerades, traditional wrestling, the display of ancestral relics, and ceremonies connected to the historic Long Juju oracle.

name: Intersect Aspen
desc: An intimate summer fair targeting ultra-high-net-worth vacationers.
details: Held at the Aspen Ice Garden, combining modern and contemporary design with exclusive programming tailored specifically for an elite seasonal demographic.

name: Palio di Asti
desc: Oldest bareback horse race in Italy predating Siena's Palio.
details: The Palio di Asti, documented since 1275, features a bareback horse race preceded by 1,200 costumed participants in a medieval corteo through the city.

name: National Black Arts Festival
desc: Multidisciplinary arts festival celebrating the art, culture, and heritage of the African diaspora.
details: The National Black Arts Festival presents visual art, theater, film, dance, music, and literary arts celebrating the creative contributions of the African diaspora. Events take place across Atlanta venues with exhibitions, performances, and community programs.

name: Artscape Baltimore
desc: The largest free arts festival in America, spanning 10 blocks of midtown Baltimore.
details: Artscape transforms 10 blocks of Baltimore's Mount Royal cultural corridor into a massive open-air celebration of visual arts, performing arts, literary arts, and film. Multiple stages feature music, dance, and theater performances alongside juried art exhibitions and interactive art experiences.

name: Bamako Encounters (15th edition)
desc: Africa's premier photography biennale dedicated to showcasing photographic practices from Africa and its diaspora since 1994.
details: The Bamako Encounters (Rencontres de Bamako), if held in 2026 as per its biennial cycle, would be the 15th edition. Organized by Mali's Ministry of Culture with Institut Français. The 14th edition (2024) was themed 'Kuma, La Parole.' Held across venues including the National Museum of Mali. Past exhibitors include William Kentridge and Zanele Muholi.

name: Fira de Santa Llúcia
desc: Barcelona's beloved Christmas market in front of the Cathedral since 1786.
details: The Fira de Santa Llúcia fills the area around Barcelona Cathedral with 280+ stalls selling nativity figures (including the cheeky caganer), Christmas trees, and decorations.

name: Razzmatazz Anniversary
desc: Barcelona's legendary five-room nightclub hosting major live acts.
details: Razzmatazz's five themed rooms spanning indie, electronic, pop, and rock host live concerts and club nights that define Barcelona's nightlife culture.

name: Sónar Festival
desc: Electronic + digital culture festival; official site lists 2026 dates.
details: electronic music

name: Kentucky Bourbon Festival
desc: Celebration of bourbon heritage in the Bourbon Capital of the World.
details: The Kentucky Bourbon Festival in Bardstown celebrates the commonwealth's signature spirit with distillery tours, tastings, barrel-rolling competitions, bourbon-themed cuisine, and live music in America's most beautiful small town.

name: Bayou Country Superfest
desc: Major country music festival in Baton Rouge featuring top Nashville acts at Tiger Stadium.
details: Bayou Country Superfest brings the biggest names in country music to LSU's Tiger Stadium for a two-day mega-concert. The stadium setting provides a massive-scale concert experience unique among country music events.

name: Wintergrass
desc: Premier Pacific Northwest bluegrass and acoustic music festival held in a hotel setting.
details: Wintergrass transforms a Bellevue hotel into a bluegrass heaven, with performances on multiple stages, workshops, jamming in hallways and lobbies, and a warm indoor festival atmosphere. The festival features top national and regional bluegrass, folk, and acoustic acts and is a beloved winter tradition for the Pacific Northwest music community.

name: Benin Bronze Casting Festival
desc: Demonstration and celebration of the ancient Benin Kingdom's world-famous bronze casting tradition.
details: The bronze casting festival in Benin City celebrates the ancient lost-wax casting technique that produced the world-famous Benin Bronzes. Master casters demonstrate their craft, and the festival highlights ongoing efforts to preserve this extraordinary artistic tradition.

name: Benin City Arts Festival
desc: Festival celebrating the ancient Benin Kingdom's artistic heritage including famous bronze casting.
details: The Benin City Arts Festival celebrates the legendary artistic heritage of the ancient Benin Kingdom, famous for its bronze casting traditions. It features traditional art exhibitions, bronze casting demonstrations, cultural performances, and historical reenactments.

name: Nattjazz
desc: Northern Europe's longest jazz festival, presenting familiar and boundary-pushing music in Bergen's atmospheric venues.
details: Nattjazz (Night Jazz) is a late-night jazz experience presenting music for those who want familiar material alongside those seeking to expand their musical horizons. Running in parallel with the Bergen International Festival, it features intimate performances in atmospheric venues where the summer night barely darkens.

name: Bay Area Book Festival
desc: Free literary festival in downtown Berkeley featuring 300+ authors and community events.
details: The Bay Area Book Festival transforms downtown Berkeley into a literary wonderland with author talks, panel discussions, book signings, children's programming, and an outdoor fair. Over 300 authors participate in this celebration of the written word.

name: Berlin Biennale (13th edition)
desc: An influential contemporary art biennial known for experimental and socially engaged work across multiple Berlin locations.
details: The Berlin Biennale for Contemporary Art was founded in 1996. Known for experimental and boundary-pushing projects. The 14th edition, curated by Vasyl Cherepanyn, is confirmed for summer 2027. The 13th edition was listed among key 2026 art events but specific dates are unclear. It may have concluded in late 2025 or early 2026.

name: Marlborough Wine and Food Festival
desc: New Zealand's original wine and food festival showcasing the world-famous Marlborough Sauvignon Blanc region.
details: The Marlborough Wine and Food Festival is held among the vines at Brancott Estate, celebrating the region's world-renowned wines — especially Sauvignon Blanc. Over 50 wineries pour their best alongside gourmet food stalls and live entertainment.

name: Lotus World Music & Arts Festival
desc: World music festival in a charming college town featuring artists from 20+ countries.
details: The Lotus Festival transforms downtown Bloomington into a global village of music, with performances in venues from concert halls to churches to outdoor stages. Artists from 20+ countries perform traditional and contemporary world music, and the walkable downtown setting creates an intimate, community-driven experience.

name: Flamm
desc: A visual art festival in Cornwall operating under the theme of 'Location'.
details: Flamm is a visual art-led event that brings internationally and nationally important work to Cornwall, enabling ambitious new work by locally-based artists and engaging communities and visitors in its multi-layered programme.

name: Alimentarte Food Festival
desc: Major gastronomic festival celebrating Colombian Pacific cuisine with 120+ exhibitors and sustainable food vendors.
details: Held at Parque El Country, Alimentarte features 70 of Bogotá's best restaurants, 12 sustainable product vendors, and 40 allied businesses showcasing culinary proposals from nine Colombian regions. The Colombian Pacific is the honored guest region. Part of proceeds benefit Fundación Corazón Verde's social programs. Tickets: $13,000 with 2x1 promotion available.

name: Brighton Festival
desc: England's largest annual arts festival with 600+ events.
details: Brighton Festival presents theatre, dance, music, film, literature, and outdoor events across the city. The Open Houses scheme invites visitors into private homes turned art galleries.

name: Bristol Rhythm and Roots Reunion
desc: Music festival in the 'Birthplace of Country Music' spanning the Tennessee-Virginia state line.
details: Bristol straddles the Tennessee-Virginia border and is recognized by Congress as the Birthplace of Country Music due to the 1927 Bristol Sessions recordings. This festival celebrates that heritage with Americana, roots, bluegrass, and country music on stages along State Street, which literally runs along the state line.

name: New York Botanical Garden Orchid Show
desc: Spectacular display of thousands of orchids in the landmark Enid A. Haupt Conservatory.
details: Each year, the New York Botanical Garden transforms the Victorian-era Enid A. Haupt Conservatory into a breathtaking orchid paradise. Thousands of orchids in every color and variety are artfully displayed in dramatic installations. The annual show is a beloved rite of spring for New Yorkers and visitors alike.

name: Mermaid Parade
desc: Gloriously weird art parade on the Coney Island boardwalk celebrating the mythical and the marine.
details: The Coney Island Mermaid Parade is the nation's largest art parade and a celebration of creativity, body positivity, and Coney Island kitsch. Thousands of participants dress as mermaids, Neptunes, and sea creatures, parading along the boardwalk before Mermaid Queen and King.

name: Cherry Blossom Festival (DC extension - Brooklyn Botanic)
desc: Japanese-themed celebration of cherry blossoms at the Brooklyn Botanic Garden.
details: Sakura Matsuri at Brooklyn Botanic Garden is one of the largest Japanese cultural festivals in the US, celebrating the garden's renowned cherry blossom collection with taiko drumming, cosplay, manga workshops, Japanese food, and traditional tea ceremonies amid blooming cherry trees.

name: Northside Festival
desc: Brooklyn's multi-day festival of music, innovation, and film in Williamsburg and Greenpoint.
details: Northside brings together independent music showcases, tech innovation talks, and film screenings across venues in Brooklyn's Williamsburg and Greenpoint neighborhoods. The festival captures the creative energy of Brooklyn's indie culture.

name: AFROPUNK Brooklyn
desc: Groundbreaking festival celebrating Black alternative culture, music, fashion, and activism.
details: AFROPUNK Brooklyn is a cultural movement manifested as a festival, showcasing Black creativity across punk, hip-hop, R&B, electronic, and experimental genres. Known for its extraordinary fashion and style, AFROPUNK celebrates diversity, community, and the intersection of art and activism.

name: Silk and Spices Festival
desc: Bukhara's oldest international festival celebrating Silk Road heritage with artisans from across Central Asia.
details: One of Uzbekistan's oldest international festivals celebrating Silk Road heritage. Features artisans from Central Asia (Kazakhstan, Kyrgyzstan, Tajikistan, Turkmenistan) and beyond. Master classes in traditional crafts (silk-weaving, embroidery, jewelry, ceramics), fairs, fashion shows, and sporting events held in historic Bukhara.

name: International Bursa Festival
desc: Cultural festival in the former Ottoman capital featuring music, dance, and traditional arts.
details: Held in the historic first Ottoman capital with performances in venues including the Koza Han and Cultural Park.

name: Sled Island
desc: Calgary's indie music and arts festival spread across 30+ venues.
details: Sled Island transforms Calgary into an indie music playground with 250+ bands performing across 30+ venues, complemented by comedy, art exhibitions, and film screenings. The festival champions emerging and independent artists.

name: Festival Petronio Álvarez
desc: The largest Afro-cultural festival in Latin America celebrating Pacific Colombian rhythms and the UNESCO-recognized marimba de chonta.
details: Transforms Cali into the epicenter of Colombia's Pacific coast culture. Celebrates currulao, bunde, and juga rhythms centered around the marimba de chonta (UNESCO-recognized). Features live music competitions, traditional Pacific cuisine (viche, arrechón, cocadas), and community resilience displays. Named after a beloved Afro-Colombian musician.

name: Sagra del Pesce
desc: Fish fry festival in a giant 4-metre frying pan on Camogli's harbour.
details: Camogli's Sagra del Pesce features a 4-metre diameter frying pan producing free fried fish for thousands, accompanied by music, fireworks, and the procession of decorated boats.

name: Festival de Cannes OFF
desc: Parallel festival alongside the main Cannes film festival with independent screenings.
details: The OFF programme runs parallel to the main Festival de Cannes with independent film screenings, parties, and industry events accessible to the public.

name: Canneseries
desc: An international festival dedicated entirely to the celebration of television series.
details: Running alongside MIPTV, Canneseries brings the glamour of the film festival to the rapidly expanding, highly lucrative world of premium global television, premiering major shows from Netflix, HBO, and international broadcasters.

name: Stan Rogers Folk Festival (Stanfest)
desc: Beloved Maritime folk festival honoring the legacy of Canadian folk icon Stan Rogers.
details: Named for the beloved Canadian folk singer Stan Rogers, Stanfest takes place in the small fishing village of Canso on the remote eastern tip of Nova Scotia. The intimate festival features folk, roots, and traditional Maritime music, with camping and a strong community atmosphere. Despite its remote location, it draws devoted fans from across Canada.

name: Kaapse Klopse (Cape Town Minstrel Carnival)
desc: Colorful minstrel parade tradition (Tweede Nuwe Jaar) with music, costumes, and marching troupes.

name: Cappadocia Hot Air Balloon Festival
desc: International festival showcasing hot air ballooning against Cappadocia's fairy chimneys and cave dwellings.
details: Part of Nevsehir Culture Route summer festivities. First launched 2019, rapidly grown into global attraction against extraordinary landscape backdrop.

name: XI Intl Cappadocia Dance & Music Festival
desc: International dance and music festival in the UNESCO World Heritage Cappadocia region.
details: Invites folk ensembles, choral groups, ballroom dance teams, orchestras, and majorette teams including children and youth groups.

name: National Acadian Day / Tintamarre
desc: Celebration of Acadian culture and identity, culminating in the noisy Tintamarre parade.
details: National Acadian Day celebrations across the Maritime provinces culminate in the spectacular Tintamarre - a parade where participants make as much noise as possible with pots, pans, bells, and horns to celebrate Acadian survival and culture. Caraquet hosts one of the largest celebrations.

name: Changchun International Film Festival
desc: Historic film festival in China's cinema birthplace—known as 'Cradle of New China's Cinema.'
details: Changchun, home to China's oldest film studio, hosts an international film festival celebrating the city's role as the birthplace of Chinese cinema. The festival features film screenings, industry forums, and awards alongside cultural events in this northeast Chinese city.

name: Fiesta del Sol (Pilsen Chicago)
desc: Chicago's largest Latino festival in the Pilsen neighborhood with music, food, and art.
details: Fiesta del Sol fills Cermak Road in Chicago's Pilsen neighborhood with live Latin music stages, authentic Mexican and Latin American food, art exhibitions, and community celebrations. It is the largest Latino festival in the Midwest.

name: Chongqing International Marathon & Cultural Festival
desc: Scenic marathon through Chongqing's dramatic mountain-river cityscape with cultural events.
details: The Chongqing marathon winds through one of China's most dramatic urban landscapes—a city built on steep mountains at the confluence of the Yangtze and Jialing rivers. Cultural events, street food festivals, and hot pot celebrations accompany the athletic competition.

name: DesertX
desc: Free outdoor contemporary art exhibition across the Coachella Valley desert landscape.
details: DesertX is a recurring site-specific art exhibition presenting monumental installations by international artists across the Coachella Valley desert. The contrast of cutting-edge contemporary art against the dramatic desert landscape creates powerful visual and conceptual experiences.

name: Georgian Bay Folk Festival
desc: Intimate folk festival on the shores of Georgian Bay in Ontario's Blue Mountain region.
details: This intimate folk festival takes place at Sunset Point Park on the shores of Georgian Bay, featuring Canadian and international folk and roots artists in a stunning lakeside setting near Blue Mountain ski resort.

name: Foire aux Vins d'Alsace
desc: Major summer wine and food festival with concerts in the heart of Alsace.
details: The Foire aux Vins combines Alsatian wine tastings with a major concert programme, creating a festive atmosphere in the charming medieval town of Colmar.

name: Festival Maqam (Algeria)
desc: Classical Arab-Andalusian music festival in the ancient city of Constantine.
details: The Festival Maqam in Constantine celebrates the rich tradition of Arab-Andalusian (malouf) music that has flourished in this dramatic cliffside city for centuries. It features orchestras from across the Maghreb performing this refined musical heritage.

name: Glimmerglass Festival
desc: Acclaimed opera festival presenting four productions in a lakeside theater near Cooperstown.
details: The Glimmerglass Festival presents four fully staged opera productions in the intimate Alice Busch Opera Theater overlooking Otsego Lake. Known for artistic excellence, innovative programming, and its beautiful lakeside setting near the Baseball Hall of Fame.

name: Tivoli Christmas Market
desc: Magical Christmas market inside the historic Tivoli Gardens with rides, food, performances, and millions of lights.
details: Tivoli Gardens, one of the world's oldest amusement parks (opened 1843), transforms into a winter wonderland with hundreds of thousands of lights, Christmas stalls, traditional Danish treats like æbleskiver, mulled wine, and live performances. The atmospheric combination of heritage rides, gardens, and festive magic draws over a million visitors annually.

name: Folklife Festival of the Smokies
desc: Celebration of Appalachian heritage in the Great Smoky Mountains with traditional crafts and music.
details: Set in the gateway to the Great Smoky Mountains, this festival features traditional Appalachian crafts demonstrations, old-time and bluegrass music, storytelling, mountain cuisine, and heritage skills workshops celebrating the living traditions of the Southern Appalachians.

name: Clearwater Festival
desc: Pete Seeger's legacy folk and environmental festival on the banks of the Hudson River.
details: Founded by Pete Seeger to raise awareness for the cleanup of the Hudson River, the Great Hudson River Revival (Clearwater Festival) combines folk, roots, and world music with environmental activism. Multiple stages, workshops, a juried crafts fair, and family activities fill Croton Point Park on the Hudson.

name: Dawson City Gold Show / Discovery Days
desc: Celebration of the Klondike Gold Rush heritage in the historic gold rush town.
details: Discovery Days celebrates the anniversary of the 1896 gold discovery that sparked the Klondike Gold Rush. Events include gold panning, raft races on the Yukon River, a parade, live music, and immersion in the Gold Rush history of this frontier town.

name: KAABOO Del Mar
desc: Upscale 'hang-out' festival blending music, comedy, art, and culinary at the Del Mar Fairgrounds.
details: KAABOO offers a more refined festival experience with no camping — instead featuring top-tier music acts, A-list comedians, contemporary art installations, celebrity chef culinary experiences, and spa-like amenities at the Del Mar Fairgrounds by the beach.

name: Cherry Creek Arts Festival
desc: Premier juried fine arts festival in Denver's upscale Cherry Creek neighborhood.
details: Cherry Creek Arts Festival features 260 juried visual artists, interactive art experiences, live music, culinary programming, and children's art activities in Denver's premier shopping and dining district over Fourth of July weekend.

name: Souq Waqif Spring Festival
desc: Spring cultural festival in Doha's restored traditional marketplace.
details: Features cultural performances, art exhibitions, traditional crafts, and food events in the atmospheric restored souq.

name: ISEA 2026: International Symposium on Electronic Art
desc: A major international symposium on electronic and media art positioning Dubai as a laboratory for digital creativity.
details: ISEA 2026 positions Dubai as a laboratory for electronic and media art, with an international programme of exhibitions, public installations, and academic sessions. Works using code, sound, data, AI, and immersive environments rethink how audiences experience both galleries and urban space.

name: Global Village (Season 30)
desc: A massive cultural bazaar and entertainment park with 90+ country pavilions celebrating its 30th anniversary season.
details: A cultural phenomenon marking its 30th anniversary, Global Village combines food, music, shopping, and entertainment from 90+ countries in a huge themed park. Visitors can stroll between pavilions representing countries worldwide, watch folk performances, taste international street food, and enjoy carnival rides. Special anniversary programming marks this milestone season.

name: Dubai Food Festival
desc: Two-week culinary celebration spotlighting Dubai's diverse dining scene from street food to fine dining.
details: Features Restaurant Week, Beach Canteen, food truck events, and culinary masterclasses across the city. Celebrates Dubai's multicultural food heritage.

name: Duluth Dylan Fest
desc: Celebration of Bob Dylan's hometown heritage with tribute performances and tours of his birthplace.
details: Duluth celebrates its most famous native son with a festival of Dylan tribute performances, discussions, film screenings, and tours of the places that shaped young Robert Zimmerman before he became Bob Dylan.

name: Dunedin Fringe Festival
desc: New Zealand's original fringe arts festival celebrating emerging and experimental performance in the Edinburgh of the South.
details: Dunedin's Fringe Festival showcases emerging artists across theatre, music, comedy, dance, visual art, and experimental performance. The student city's creative energy drives a program of affordable, adventurous shows in venues across the city.

name: Tajikistan Independence Day
desc: National independence celebration with parades, concerts, and fireworks.
details: National independence from Soviet Union (1991) celebrated with parades, concerts, fireworks, and festivities nationwide. Major celebrations centered in Dushanbe.

name: Riverboats Music Festival
desc: Music festival on the Murray River featuring top Australian acts in a stunning riverside setting.
details: Set on the banks of the Murray River in the historic port town of Echuca, the Riverboats Music Festival combines great Australian music with a relaxed river-town atmosphere. Multiple stages host artists across folk, roots, rock, and blues.

name: International Buskers Festival
desc: Edmonton's beloved street performers festival attracting buskers from around the world.
details: The Edmonton International Street Performers Festival (Buskerfest) fills Sir Winston Churchill Square with acrobats, comedians, musicians, magicians, and artists from around the world. The free-to-watch outdoor festival is one of Edmonton's most beloved summer traditions.

name: K-Days (formerly Klondike Days)
desc: Edmonton's summer fair featuring concerts, midway, agricultural exhibits, and nightly fireworks.
details: K-Days transforms the Edmonton Expo Centre and grounds into a massive summer festival with a midway, nightly concerts, agricultural exhibitions, food vendors, and cultural programming. The 10-day event is Edmonton's premier summer celebration.

name: Foire Brayonne
desc: Festival celebrating Brayon (Madawaska-region Francophone) culture and identity.
