details: La Foire Brayonne is a celebration of the unique Brayon culture of the Madawaska region, with music, food, outdoor activities, and cultural events that celebrate this distinct Francophone identity at the intersection of Quebec, New Brunswick, and Maine.

name: Ehdeniyat Festival
desc: Summer cultural festival in the mountain resort town of Ehden featuring music and arts.
details: Features Lebanese and Arab music performances, cultural events, and family entertainment in the scenic mountain setting of northern Lebanon.

name: Cholita Wrestling (Indigenous Women Wrestling)
desc: Indigenous Aymara women wrestlers performing as trained theatrical performers in traditional bowler hats, braided hair, and multilayered polleras (skirts), representing female empowerment and challenging gender stereotypes.
details: These Fighting Cholitas originated in the mid-2000s when indigenous domestic violence victims began practicing as a way to relieve stress and regain empowerment. A wrestling promoter noticed declining attendance and recruited cholitas for training. Not long ago, "cholita" was a derogatory term, but an indigenous rights revolution has restored pride among marginalized communities. The Titans perform each Sunday for hundreds at El Alto's Multifunctional Center, routinely attracting over 1,000 spectators. Like WWE or Mexican lucha libre, these trained performers feature "good" and "bad" characters battling theatrically. The younger generation begins training as early as age 15. Cholita wrestling symbolizes female empowerment and a powerful platform challenging gender stereotypes.

name: National Cowboy Poetry Gathering
desc: Unique festival celebrating the oral tradition of cowboy poetry, music, and Western culture.
details: The National Cowboy Poetry Gathering brings together working cowboys, ranchers, and Western artists for a week of poetry readings, musical performances, workshops, art exhibits, and gear trade shows. This is no tourist show - it is an authentic celebration of a living oral tradition unique to the American West.

name: Date Festival
desc: Celebration of the date harvest in the desert oasis town of Erfoud.
details: The Date Festival in Erfoud celebrates the annual date palm harvest with exhibitions of over 30 varieties of dates, Berber music, fantasia horse shows, folklore performances, and a bustling market. The Tafilalet oasis is one of the world's largest date-producing regions.

name: Famagusta Arts & Culture Festival
desc: Arts and culture festival featuring music, dance, and visual arts in eastern Cyprus.
details: Summer festival with international and local performances, art exhibitions, and cultural events in the coastal resort area.

name: Fanø International Kite Fliers Meeting
desc: One of the world's largest kite-flying gatherings on the wide beaches of Fanø Island.
details: Every June, the vast beaches of Fanø Island fill with spectacular kites from around the world. From massive art kites to precision sport kites, the sky becomes a canvas of colour and movement. The event is free and draws kite enthusiasts and spectators from across Europe.

name: Fergus Scottish Festival
desc: One of the largest Scottish festivals in North America featuring Highland games and pipe bands.
details: The Fergus Scottish Festival and Highland Games is one of the largest Scottish events outside Scotland, featuring heavy athletics, pipe band competitions, Highland dancing, Celtic music, sheepdog demonstrations, and a Scottish marketplace.

name: Festa della Rificolona
desc: Festa della Rificolona — children's procession with lanterns, street performances, parade
details: children's procession with lanterns, street performances, parade

name: Nguon Festival
desc: Biennial royal festival of the Bamoun people at the Sultan's palace in Foumban.
details: The Nguon Festival is the most important celebration of the Bamoun people, held at the magnificent Sultan's Palace in Foumban. It features the Sultan receiving tributes, traditional warrior dances, horse parades, artisan exhibitions, and ceremonies honoring Bamoun royal heritage and Islamic traditions.

name: Fuheis Festival
desc: Traditional cultural festival in the Christian town of Fuheis featuring music, food, and handicrafts.
details: Celebrates the heritage of Fuheis with traditional foods, music performances, artisan crafts, and community gatherings in this historic town.

name: Reggae on the River
desc: Legendary reggae festival in the redwoods of Humboldt County.
details: Set along the Eel River in the majestic redwood forests of Humboldt County, Reggae on the River brings together reggae, world, and roots artists for a weekend of music and community in one of the most beautiful natural settings in Northern California.

name: International de montgolfieres de Gatineau
desc: Hot air balloon festival in the Ottawa-Gatineau region with concerts and family activities.
details: The Gatineau Hot Air Balloon Festival features over 100 hot air balloons, evening balloon glows, concert headliners, and family activities in the national capital region.

name: Gilroy Garlic Festival
desc: Celebration of all things garlic in the self-proclaimed Garlic Capital of the World.
details: The Gilroy Garlic Festival is a unique culinary celebration featuring garlic-infused dishes from garlic ice cream to garlic fries, cooking competitions, live entertainment, arts and crafts, and the crowning of Miss Gilroy Garlic Festival. The pungent aroma of roasting garlic fills the air across Christmas Hill Park.

name: Gimli Icelandic Festival (Islendingadagurinn)
desc: Celebration of Icelandic heritage in the heart of New Iceland on Lake Winnipeg.
details: Gimli's Icelandic Festival celebrates the unique Icelandic-Canadian community of New Iceland with Viking reenactments, traditional Icelandic food (vinarterta, kleinur), music, art, sandcastle competitions, and the crowning of the Fjallkona (Lady of the Mountain) on the shores of Lake Winnipeg.

name: Gorée Island Festival
desc: Festival commemorating the history of the slave trade on UNESCO-listed Gorée Island with music and discussion.
details: The Gorée Island Festival at this UNESCO World Heritage site commemorates the transatlantic slave trade's history with music, dance, discussions, and artistic performances. It provides a powerful space for reflection and cultural exchange on the African diaspora.

name: Abissa Festival
desc: New Year festival of the N'zima people featuring wild dancing, costume parades, and social critique.
details: The Abissa Festival is the N'zima people's New Year celebration in the UNESCO-listed former colonial capital of Grand-Bassam. It features wild dancing, costume parades, satirical performances critiquing social issues, and purification ceremonies. The entire community participates in this week of catharsis and renewal.

name: Green River Festival
desc: Intimate indie and folk festival on a hilltop farm in the Pioneer Valley with hot air balloons.
details: Green River Festival takes place on a scenic hilltop at Greenfield Community College with hot air balloon launches at sunrise and sunset. The lineup features indie, folk, rock, and world music, with the beautiful Pioneer Valley landscape providing a stunning backdrop.

name: Festival Cultural Guadalajara May 2026 (28th Edition)
desc: Cultural festival with Canada as guest country

name: Fieracavalli (Mexican Charreada Championships)
desc: National charreria championships in the birthplace of Mexican horsemanship tradition.
details: Guadalajara hosts national charreada championships celebrating Mexico's national sport. Expert charros compete in events including lassoing, bull riding, and trick riding, preserving the equestrian traditions that define Mexican ranching culture.

name: Cervantino Callejero (Street Cervantino)
desc: Free street performances and art in the alleyways of Guanajuato during the Cervantino festival.
details: While the main Cervantino festival fills theaters, the Cervantino Callejero brings free performances to the streets, plazas, and iconic alleyways of Guanajuato. Buskers, theater troupes, and musicians create spontaneous artistic encounters throughout the colorful hillside city.

name: Independence Day celebrations
desc: Parades, marching bands, and civic celebrations commemorating independence.

name: Hillside Festival
desc: Eco-friendly arts and music festival on an island in Guelph Lake.
details: Hillside is a pioneering green festival on Guelph Lake Island, featuring indie, folk, and world music alongside workshops, artisan markets, and environmental programming. The festival is 100% powered by renewable energy.

name: Halifax Pop Explosion
desc: Halifax's premier indie music festival showcasing Canadian and international emerging artists.
details: The Halifax Pop Explosion is an indie music festival that transforms venues across Halifax into showcases for emerging and established artists. The festival has been instrumental in launching Canadian music careers.

name: Blissfest
desc: Grassroots folk and bluegrass camping festival in Northern Michigan.
details: Blissfest is a grassroots camping music festival in the beautiful Petoskey area of Northern Michigan, featuring folk, bluegrass, Celtic, and world music alongside workshops, dancing, and community building.

name: Havana Summer Festival
desc: Summer cultural festival in Havana featuring music, theater, and cultural performances.
details: Annual summer celebration featuring various cultural performances and activities throughout Havana's venues and streets.

name: Hemis Festival
desc: Tibetan Buddhist festival featuring masked dances (cham) at Hemis Monastery.

name: Fiestas Patronales de Nuestra Señora de la Altagracia
desc: Pilgrimages and masses honoring the country’s patroness.

name: Tulip Time Festival (Holland MI)
desc: Dutch heritage festival with millions of tulips, klompen dancing, and windmill tours.
details: Tulip Time celebrates Holland Michigan's Dutch heritage with millions of blooming tulips, traditional klompen (wooden shoe) dancing, Dutch marketplace, a parade of historical Dutch costumes, and tours of the only authentic Dutch windmill operating in the US.

name: Hong Kong Food Festival
desc: Year-end food celebration showcasing Hong Kong's legendary Cantonese cuisine and global dining scene.
details: Hong Kong's Food Festival celebrates the city's status as one of the world's greatest food cities. Events showcase everything from Michelin-starred Cantonese dining to legendary street food, dim sum culture, and the city's unique East-West fusion cuisine traditions.

name: Art Basel Hong Kong
desc: Major international contemporary art fair drawing galleries, collectors and exhibitions.

name: Aloha Festivals
desc: Hawaii's largest cultural celebration honoring the aloha spirit with parades, hula, and music across the islands.
details: The Aloha Festivals celebrate Hawaiian culture with events across all major islands throughout September. Highlights include the Floral Parade down Kalakaua Avenue, the Waikiki Hoolaulea (Hawaii's largest block party), and performances of hula and Hawaiian music. The festivals preserve and promote Hawaiian traditions, arts, and values.

name: Waikiki Spam Jam
desc: Quirky Hawaiian street festival celebrating SPAM, which has iconic cultural status in Hawaii.
details: Hawaii consumes more SPAM per capita than any other US state, and this beloved Waikiki street festival celebrates that passion with SPAM-inspired dishes from top restaurants, live entertainment, vendor booths, and a festive atmosphere along Kalakaua Avenue. It is a uniquely Hawaiian cultural experience.

name: FotoFest
desc: The first and longest-running international photography biennial in the United States.
details: FotoFest is the premier photography biennial in the Americas, presenting exhibitions, portfolio reviews, public art installations, and educational programming that transforms Houston into a photography destination.

name: Hawaiki Nui Va'a
desc: Epic three-day outrigger canoe race across open ocean between Huahine, Raiatea, Taha'a, and Bora Bora.
details: Hawaiki Nui Va'a is the world's most prestigious outrigger canoe race, covering 116km over three days across open ocean between four islands. Over 100 teams from across Polynesia compete in an extraordinary display of strength, navigation, and traditional Polynesian seafaring culture.

name: Ojude Oba Festival
desc: Colorful Ijebu Yoruba celebration where age groups pay homage to the Awujale (king) on horseback.
details: Ojude Oba (meaning 'in front of the king's palace') is an annual festival celebrated two days after Eid-el-Kabir. Different age groups (regberegbe) compete in elaborate traditional outfits, parading on horseback before the Awujale of Ijebuland. It recently went viral globally on social media for its spectacular displays.

name: Cure Salée (Festival of the Nomads)
desc: Massive gathering of Tuareg and Wodaabe nomads at the end of the rainy season with camel races and beauty contests.
details: The Cure Salée (Salt Cure) in Ingall is one of the last great nomadic gatherings in Africa. Tuareg and Wodaabe herders converge after the rains to water their livestock in mineral-rich pastures. The festival features the Gerewol male beauty contest, camel races, music, and traditional ceremonies.

name: Innsbruck International
desc: A biennial of contemporary art utilizing historical and contemporary venues.
details: Innsbruck International is a biennial of contemporary art that invites international artists to make use of Innsbruck's extraordinary historical and contemporary venues in the presentation of their works of visual art, film, and sound as well as performances and installations.

name: Istanbul Coffee Festival
desc: Lifestyle event focused on coffee culture, tastings, workshops, and brand showcases.
details: One of Istanbul's best-known lifestyle events with professional tastings, educational workshops, brand showcases, and strong social and music programming elements.

name: Zeytinburnu Culture & Arts Festival
desc: District cultural festival showcasing local and traditional arts in Istanbul.
details: Features traditional music, handicraft exhibitions, and community cultural events in the Zeytinburnu district.

name: Festival de la Sierra Gorda
desc: Cultural festival in the Sierra Gorda biosphere reserve celebrating Huastec traditions.
details: The Sierra Gorda UNESCO Biosphere Reserve hosts cultural events celebrating the Huastec indigenous traditions of this biodiversity-rich mountain region, with traditional music, dance, crafts, and ecological tours.

name: Jecheon International Music & Film Festival
desc: Unique festival combining music-themed films with live performances in a lakeside mountain setting.
details: The Jecheon International Music & Film Festival is the only festival in Asia dedicated to music-themed films. Screenings take place at Cheongpung Lake and throughout the mountainous city, combined with live music performances and workshops. The natural setting adds a special dimension to the film and music experience.

name: Hutzot Hayotzer Arts & Crafts Fair
desc: Annual arts and crafts fair near Jerusalem's Jaffa Gate with artisan displays and performances.
details: Features local artisans displaying crafts alongside evening music performances near the historic Jaffa Gate of the Old City.

name: Oud Festival Jerusalem
desc: Multi-cultural music festival celebrating the oud and Middle Eastern music traditions in Jerusalem.
details: Features oud masters and Middle Eastern musicians performing alongside jazz, classical, and world music artists in Jerusalem's cultural venues.

name: Festival de Lanaudiere
desc: Classical music festival in the Quebec countryside, one of the largest in Canada.
details: The Festival de Lanaudiere presents classical music concerts in an outdoor amphitheater surrounded by Quebec countryside. The festival features Canadian and international orchestras, soloists, and chamber ensembles in an intimate pastoral setting.

name: National Storytelling Festival
desc: The premier storytelling event in the US, held in America's oldest town in Tennessee.
details: Jonesborough, Tennessee's oldest town, hosts the National Storytelling Festival featuring master storytellers from diverse traditions. Under large tents, audiences are transported by tales spanning Appalachian, African American, Native American, and world storytelling traditions. The intimate setting and power of live narrative make this a truly unique cultural experience.

name: Afghanistan Independence Day
desc: Celebration of independence from Britain (1919) with traditional atan dance and military parades.
details: Celebrates Afghanistan's independence from Britain (1919). Features military parades, official speeches, traditional atan dance performances, rubab and dhol music, national costume displays, and street food stalls.

name: Mongolian Horse Festival
desc: Celebration of Mongolia's horse culture with wild horse catching, racing, and equestrian games.
details: Mongolia has more horses per capita than any country, and horse festivals celebrate this bond. Events include urtiin duu (long song) performances, horse-catching demonstrations, endurance races, and mounted archery. The Khentii region, birthplace of Chinggis Khan, provides a historically resonant setting.

name: DRC Independence Day
desc: Celebration of the DRC's independence from Belgium in 1960.
details: The Democratic Republic of the Congo's Independence Day features parades, cultural performances, Congolese rumba and soukous music concerts, and celebrations across this vast Central African nation.

name: Qurain Cultural Festival
desc: Premier Kuwaiti cultural festival with theatre, music, visual arts, and literary events.
details: Features theatre performances, concerts, art exhibitions, and literary discussions at venues across Kuwait City.

name: Cajun & Creole Heritage Festival (Festivals Acadiens et Créoles)
desc: Free three-day celebration of Cajun and Creole music, food, and culture in the heart of Acadiana.
details: Festivals Acadiens et Créoles is a joyous free celebration of the living Cajun and Creole cultures of Southwest Louisiana. Six stages of Cajun, zydeco, and roots music, plus exceptional Cajun and Creole cuisine from local restaurants, make this one of the most authentic cultural festivals in America.

name: Lagos Photo Festival
desc: West Africa's largest international photography festival showcasing contemporary African photography.
details: LagosPhoto is an international arts festival of photography held annually in Lagos, the first and largest of its kind in West Africa. It features exhibitions, workshops, artist talks, portfolio reviews, and public installations showcasing contemporary African and diaspora photography.

name: Lamu Yoga Festival
desc: Wellness retreat and yoga festival on the scenic UNESCO-listed island of Lamu.
details: The Lamu Yoga Festival brings together yoga practitioners and wellness enthusiasts on this UNESCO World Heritage island. It features daily yoga sessions, meditation, wellness workshops, and cultural experiences in the serene Swahili island setting.

name: Festival del Globo
desc: Mexico's largest hot air balloon festival with 200+ balloons filling the Guanajuato sky.
details: The Festival Internacional del Globo in Leon features over 200 hot air balloons in mass ascensions, night glows, and aerial displays. The festival includes concerts, food stalls, and cultural activities, creating Mexico's answer to Albuquerque's Balloon Fiesta.

name: Lewes Bonfire Night
desc: Britain's most extreme and spectacular Guy Fawkes Night celebration.
details: Lewes Bonfire Night features six bonfire societies parading through narrow streets with flaming torches, burning effigies, fireworks, and 17 burning crosses commemorating Protestant martyrs.

name: Limassol Marathon
desc: Major Mediterranean marathon along Limassol's scenic coastline.
details: The Limassol Marathon attracts 14,000+ runners from 70+ countries along the coastal promenade with music, entertainment, and Mediterranean scenery.

name: Cyprus Wine Festival
desc: Annual wine festival celebrating Cyprus's 5,000-year winemaking heritage with tastings and entertainment.
details: Features wine from local producers, traditional food, live music, and dance performances. Celebrates the ancient Commandaria wine tradition dating back to the Crusades.

name: Liverpool Biennial
desc: The UK's largest festival of contemporary visual art, held biennially in even-numbered years since 1999.
details: Liverpool Biennial is the UK's premier contemporary visual art festival. Typically held in even-numbered years, a 2026 edition is expected but specific details have not yet been announced. The festival spreads across galleries, public spaces, and unconventional venues throughout Liverpool.

name: Fiesta de San Mateo
desc: Fiesta de San Mateo — between Pamplona and Burgos; grape-harvest festival with free-flowing sangria, food fights, traditional cuisine, parades, bullfights, fireworks; smaller festivities across Spain around September 21 — St. Matthew's Day
details: between Pamplona and Burgos; grape-harvest festival with free-flowing sangria, food fights, traditional cuisine, parades, bullfights, fireworks; smaller festivities across Spain around September 21 — St. Matthew's Day

name: Togo Voodoo Festival
desc: Traditional voodoo celebrations in Togo with ceremonies similar to those in neighboring Benin.
details: Togo's voodoo celebrations, closely related to those in neighboring Benin, feature traditional ceremonies, trance rituals, drumming, and offerings at sacred shrines. Togo has a significant voodoo-practicing population and the celebrations are an important part of national identity.

name: Sunfest (London ON)
desc: Canada's premier free world music celebration in downtown London, Ontario.
details: Sunfest is the largest free world music festival in Canada, presenting artists from every continent on stages in Victoria Park. The festival celebrates cultural diversity through music, dance, food, and art from around the world.

name: LACMA David Geffen Galleries
desc: Unveiling of Peter Zumthor's expansive museum redesign.
details: A highly anticipated and debated architectural overhaul of the Los Angeles County Museum of Art, spanning over Wilshire Boulevard.

name: Umhlanga (Reed Dance)
desc: Annual ceremony where thousands of young women dance before the Queen Mother and King.
details: The Umhlanga Reed Dance is one of Eswatini's most famous cultural events. Tens of thousands of young women from across the kingdom gather reeds and dance before the Queen Mother and King in a colorful eight-day ceremony celebrating womanhood and cultural heritage.

name: Macau International Music Festival
desc: Classical and world music festival in Macau's historic Portuguese and Chinese venues.
details: The Macau International Music Festival presents classical, jazz, and world music in the city's atmospheric venues—from Baroque churches to Chinese temples and the stunning Macao Cultural Centre. The festival's unique East-meets-West character mirrors Macau's own cultural identity.

name: Festival du Bois
desc: Francophone cultural festival in BC's oldest French-Canadian community.
details: Festival du Bois celebrates Francophone culture in Maillardville (Coquitlam), the oldest French-Canadian community in western Canada, with traditional music, dance, sugar shack, poutine, and cultural events that connect to Quebec and Acadian roots.

name: National Arts Festival
desc: Africa's largest arts festival encompassing theatre, dance, music, jazz, comedy, and visual arts.
details: The National Arts Festival in Makhanda (formerly Grahamstown) is Africa's largest annual arts festival, running for over 11 days. It features more than 500 productions including theatre, dance, music, jazz, comedy, visual arts, and crafts. The Main programme features curated work while the Fringe is open to all.

name: Grahamstown SciFest
desc: Africa's largest science festival with interactive exhibits, shows, and workshops for all ages.
details: SciFest Africa in Makhanda is the continent's largest science festival, attracting tens of thousands of visitors with interactive exhibits, science shows, workshops, and lectures covering everything from astronomy to zoology. It makes science accessible and fun for all ages.

name: Asafo Festival
desc: Military-heritage festival of the Fante warrior companies featuring flag-waving and competitive displays.
details: The Asafo Festival celebrates the military heritage of the Fante Asafo (warrior) companies. It features competitive displays of flags and banners, traditional military formations, drumming, singing, and mock battles between rival companies.

name: Mapungubwe Arts Festival
desc: Arts festival at the UNESCO site of Mapungubwe, ancient African kingdom.
details: The Mapungubwe Arts Festival takes place near the UNESCO World Heritage site of Mapungubwe, an ancient African trading kingdom. It features music, theatre, visual arts, and cultural performances celebrating the heritage of the Limpopo region.

name: Mardin Mesopotamia Festival
desc: Cultural festival in the ancient city of Mardin celebrating Mesopotamian heritage.
details: Celebrates the multicultural heritage of Mardin with traditional music, dance, food, and arts reflecting its Assyrian, Kurdish, Arab, and Turkish communities.

name: Singapore National Day
desc: Singapore's independence celebration featuring the National Day Parade, air shows, cultural performances, and fireworks over Marina Bay.
details: Singapore celebrates its independence with a spectacular National Day Parade, featuring military displays, air shows with jet formations, cultural performances representing the nation's multicultural heritage, and evening fireworks over Marina Bay. The entire nation watches the live broadcast, and the celebrations create a patriotic atmosphere across the island.

name: Sagra dell'Uva Marino
desc: Wine festival where fountains run with wine instead of water.
details: During Marino's grape festival, the town's fountain flows with free wine. Historical pageants, food stalls, and grape-themed celebrations fill the streets.

name: Medjugorje Youth Festival
desc: One of Europe's largest Catholic youth gatherings, drawing young pilgrims from around the world.
details: The Mladifest youth festival brings together over 50,000 young Catholics for prayer, music, catechesis, and community at the famous Marian pilgrimage site. Multilingual services and cultural exchanges create a unique spiritual atmosphere.

name: Ashenda/Shadey Festival
desc: Tigrinya girls' festival celebrating the end of the Filseta fast with singing, dancing, and traditional dress.
details: Ashenda (or Shadey) is a unique girls' and women's festival celebrated in Tigray and northern Amhara regions. Young women dress in their finest traditional clothes, adorn themselves with flowers and grass, and go house to house singing and dancing. It is one of Ethiopia's most colorful celebrations.

name: Fiesta de la Luz y la Musica
desc: Merida's cultural festival celebrating Yucatecan heritage with music and light installations.
details: Merida hosts a vibrant festival of light and music highlighting Yucatecan cultural identity with projection mapping on colonial buildings, live trova yucateca music, jarana dance, and gastronomic events featuring authentic Yucatecan cuisine.

name: Sealine Season
desc: A seasonal outdoor programme featuring desert camping, dune bashing, cultural activities, and family entertainment.
details: A seasonal outdoor program at Sealine in Mesaieed featuring desert camping, dune bashing, cultural activities, and family-friendly entertainment at one of Qatar's most popular desert destinations. It captures the essence of Gulf desert culture and outdoor recreation.

name: Festival de la Luz
desc: Spectacular illuminated parade along Paseo de la Reforma with light floats and performances.
details: The Festival de la Luz is a dazzling illuminated parade along Mexico City's grand Paseo de la Reforma boulevard. Giant light-covered floats, LED-adorned performers, and laser shows create a river of light stretching for kilometers through the heart of the capital.

name: Festival de Cine de la Ciudad de Mexico (FICM)
desc: Mexico City's international film festival presenting Mexican and world cinema.
details: The Festival de Cine de la Ciudad de Mexico presents contemporary Mexican and international cinema in venues across the capital, from art-house cinemas to outdoor screenings in public plazas.

name: Feria de la Mole (Mexico City Comic Con)
desc: Mexico's largest pop culture and comic convention with cosplay, gaming, and artist exhibitions.
details: La Mole is Mexico's premier pop culture convention, drawing tens of thousands of fans of anime, comics, sci-fi, and gaming. Massive cosplay competitions, celebrity guests, artist alley, and merchandise halls fill the Centro Citibanamex.

name: MUTEK Mexico
desc: Mexico City edition of the Montreal-born festival of electronic music and digital creativity.
details: MUTEK Mexico brings the same spirit of sonic and digital innovation as its Montreal parent to venues across Mexico City, featuring cutting-edge electronic music, audiovisual performances, and digital art in intimate clubs and larger venues.

name: Mexican Independence Day
desc: Mexico's most celebrated national holiday featuring El Grito, fireworks, and celebrations in every town square.
details: On Sep 15 night, the President reenacts Father Hidalgo's Grito de Dolores from the National Palace balcony. Massive crowds fill the Zócalo for fireworks and live music. On Sep 16, military and civilian parades march through Mexico City. Every city, town, and village holds its own Grito ceremony.

name: Miami Modern + Contemporary
desc: A newly launched fair demonstrating Miami's year-round art market strength.
details: Co-directed by Nick Korniloff, featuring over 70 international galleries displaying blue-chip contemporary, post-war, and modern masters outside the traditional December window.

name: Midrand International Jazz Day
desc: UNESCO International Jazz Day celebration in Midrand with live jazz performances.
details: South Africa participates in UNESCO International Jazz Day with celebrations across the country, including notable events in Midrand featuring live jazz performances by local and international artists.

name: Molde Jazz Festival
desc: Europe's oldest annual jazz festival, where world-class jazz permeates every corner of this Norwegian fjord town from morning to night.
details: Since 1961, the Molde Jazz Festival has drawn thousands of visitors to this small Norwegian town set against a stunning fjord backdrop. World-class jazz performances fill venues from grand concert halls to intimate clubs from morning until late night. The festival has hosted legends from Miles Davis to modern jazz icons. The midnight sun and fjord scenery add a uniquely Nordic dimension.

name: Festival de Blues de Tremblant
desc: Blues festival in the Laurentian Mountains resort village of Mont-Tremblant.
details: The Tremblant International Blues Festival fills the European-style pedestrian village with free blues concerts featuring Canadian and international blues artists, with the beautiful Laurentian Mountains as a backdrop.

name: Montreal Fringe Festival
desc: The largest Fringe festival in Canada, with 700+ performances across dozens of venues.
details: The Montreal Fringe presents over 700 performances of theater, comedy, dance, music, and spoken word in venues across the Plateau Mont-Royal neighborhood. As with all Fringe festivals, there is no jury selection — any artist can participate, creating an eclectic and democratic celebration of performing arts.

name: Festival du Nouveau Cinema
desc: Montreal's cutting-edge festival of new cinema and new media.
details: The Festival du Nouveau Cinema presents avant-garde, innovative, and boundary-pushing films alongside new media arts and digital experiences. The festival has been a champion of emerging filmmakers and innovative storytelling for over 50 years.

name: Île Soniq
desc: Montreal's premier electronic music festival on Île Sainte-Hélène.
details: Île Soniq brings top international DJs and electronic producers to Parc Jean-Drapeau for a two-day celebration of house, techno, bass, and electronic music against the Montreal skyline.

name: Mutek Montreal
desc: Cutting-edge festival of electronic music and digital creativity.
details: MUTEK presents forward-thinking electronic music and digital art across multiple venues in Montreal. The festival features A/V performances, immersive installations, daytime conferences, and nocturnal club events, positioning Montreal at the forefront of digital creativity.

name: Pop Montreal
desc: Alternative music and art festival spread across Montreal's Mile End neighborhood.
details: POP Montreal is an eclectic festival featuring independent music, art exhibitions, fashion shows, and film screenings across venues in the creative Mile End neighborhood. The festival champions emerging artists and underground culture.

name: Festival Nuits d'Afrique
desc: Celebration of African, Caribbean, and Latin music and culture in Montreal.
details: Festival Nuits d'Afrique presents the best of African, Caribbean, and Latin music with indoor concerts and free outdoor shows in the Quartier des Spectacles. The festival also features dance workshops, film screenings, a market of African goods, and culinary events.

name: Stoney Nakoda Powwow
desc: Traditional Stoney Nakoda First Nation powwow in the foothills of the Canadian Rockies.
details: The Stoney Nakoda First Nation hosts an annual powwow near the Rocky Mountain foothills west of Calgary, featuring traditional dancing, drumming, indigenous crafts, and traditional feast in one of the most dramatic mountain backdrops of any powwow in North America.

name: Momentum 13 – Nordic Biennial
desc: The Nordic Biennial of Contemporary Art, celebrating sound and resonant ecologies.
details: Momentum 13, titled 'Between/Worlds: Resonant Ecologies,' explores sound and natural/cultural worlds of Moss, Norway. Curated by Morten Søndergaard. Next edition (14th) expected in 2027.

name: Concours d'Elegance
desc: Premier vintage car show and lifestyle event in East Africa attracting motoring enthusiasts worldwide.
details: Now in its 52nd iteration, the Concours d'Elegance in Nairobi attracts motoring enthusiasts from across the world with vintage cars, classic motorcycles, live bands, fashion shows, and entertainment at the Nairobi Racecourse.

name: Namhae German Village Oktoberfest
desc: Unique Korean Oktoberfest at Namhae's German-Korean settlement village.
details: Namhae's German Village—built by Koreans who worked in Germany as miners and nurses in the 1960s-70s—hosts a quirky Oktoberfest with Korean and German food, beer, music, and cultural performances. The coastal German-style village on a Korean island creates a wonderfully surreal cultural fusion.

name: Urkult
desc: Three-day celebration of folk and world music with workshops, children's theatre, poetry slams, and the spectacular Night of Fire.
details: Urkult is a deeply humanistic festival guided by values of peace, love, and inclusivity. It features folk and world music, enriched with workshops, children's theatre, and poetry slams. The Night of Fire opening ceremony, reimagined by different artists each year, is a spectacular highlight. The festival fosters meaningful cross-cultural connections.

name: Nashville Hot Chicken Festival
desc: Celebration of Nashville's iconic hot chicken with competitions and tastings on Independence Day.
details: The Music City Hot Chicken Festival celebrates Nashville's most famous culinary contribution - hot chicken - with tastings from top restaurants, an amateur competition, live music, and Fourth of July festivities in East Park.

name: Bahamas Summer Events and Festivals
desc: Summer festivals and cultural celebrations throughout the Bahamas.
details: Junkanoo Summer Festival (July) is held alongside various summer celebrations and community events throughout the islands. Cultural celebrations, music festivals, and family events take place across the archipelago during summer months.

name: InDnegev Festival
desc: Alternative music and arts festival in the Negev Desert during Passover.
details: Multi-day desert music and arts festival featuring Israeli and international alternative, indie, and electronic artists in a unique desert setting.

name: Nelson Arts Festival
desc: Diverse arts festival in New Zealand's sunniest city spanning theatre, music, visual art, and literature.
details: The Nelson Arts Festival brings two weeks of arts and culture to one of New Zealand's most creative communities. The program includes theatre, music, dance, comedy, visual art, and literary events in venues across the sunny city at the top of the South Island.

name: Bayou Boogaloo
desc: Free New Orleans music festival along Bayou St. John with local food and art.
details: The Bayou Boogaloo is a neighborhood festival along the banks of Bayou St. John featuring New Orleans brass bands, funk, soul, Cajun, and zydeco music on multiple stages. Local food vendors and craft booths complete this beloved community celebration.

name: 7th AIM Biennial
desc: Showcases artwork from The Bronx Museum's AIM Fellowship program.
details: This exhibition, in its seventh iteration, showcases artwork from the most recent two cohorts of The Bronx Museum's AIM Fellowship program, which supports emerging artists based in New York City.

name: Future Fair
desc: A forward-thinking, community-focused exhibition in Chelsea.
details: Championing curatorial vision and access, featuring a mix of local New York galleries and international participants to highlight undersung players in the art industry.

name: San Gennaro Feast - Little Italy NYC
desc: 11-day Italian-American street festival on Mulberry Street in Manhattan's Little Italy.
details: The Feast of San Gennaro transforms Mulberry Street in Little Italy into an Italian celebration with food vendors serving sausage and peppers, cannoli, zeppole, and other Italian-American favorites. The festival includes religious processions, live music, carnival games, and the famous cannoli-eating contest.

name: New York City Pride March
desc: One of the world's largest and most iconic LGBTQ+ Pride celebrations, marching through Manhattan.
details: NYC Pride March is one of the largest and most historic Pride events in the world, commemorating the 1969 Stonewall uprising. Hundreds of floats, marching groups, and community organizations parade down Fifth Avenue and through Greenwich Village, with millions lining the route. The broader PrideFest includes rallies, a street festival, and events across all five boroughs.

name: Newport Jazz Festival
desc: The legendary jazz festival founded in 1954, held at Fort Adams State Park overlooking Narragansett Bay.
details: Founded by George Wein in 1954, the Newport Jazz Festival is the original outdoor jazz festival and has hosted virtually every major jazz artist of the last 70 years. Set at Fort Adams State Park with stunning water views, the festival continues to present both legends and cutting-edge jazz artists in this historic seaside setting.

name: Nyem-Nyem Festival
desc: Traditional festival of the Nyem-Nyem people celebrating their ancestral resistance to colonial forces.
details: The Nyem-Nyem Festival celebrates the Nyem-Nyem people's historical resistance against colonial German and French forces. It features reenactments of ancestral battles, traditional dances, music, and cultural displays that honor the warrior heritage of this Adamawa community.

name: Grey Fox Bluegrass Festival
desc: Premier Northeast bluegrass festival on a scenic farm in the Catskill Mountains.
details: Held on a beautiful farm in the northern Catskill Mountains, Grey Fox is one of the finest bluegrass festivals in the Northeast. The festival features top bluegrass and acoustic artists on multiple stages, late-night picking under the pines, workshops, kids' programs, and a warm community camping atmosphere.

name: Oklahoma City Festival of the Arts
desc: Six-day outdoor arts festival in downtown OKC with 150+ artists and performance stages.
details: The Festival of the Arts fills Bicentennial Park in downtown Oklahoma City with 150+ visual artists, multiple performance stages, international food courts, and interactive art experiences, making it Oklahoma's premier arts celebration.

name: Mariposa Folk Festival
desc: One of Canada's oldest folk festivals, set on the shores of Lake Couchiching in cottage country.
details: Founded in 1961, the Mariposa Folk Festival is one of North America's oldest folk festivals. Held at Tudhope Park on the shores of Lake Couchiching, the festival features folk, roots, and world music alongside workshops, a craft market, and family activities in a beautiful lakeside setting.

name: Night of Joy (Walt Disney World)
desc: Christian music festival at Walt Disney World's Magic Kingdom.
details: Night of Joy brings top contemporary Christian music artists to Walt Disney World's Magic Kingdom for two nights of live performances alongside access to the park's attractions. The unique setting and spiritual atmosphere make it a one-of-a-kind event.

name: Canadian Tulip Festival
desc: Celebration of the gift of tulips from the Netherlands, with a million blooms across the capital.
details: The Canadian Tulip Festival commemorates the 1945 gift of 100,000 tulip bulbs from the Dutch Royal Family, grateful for Canada's role in liberating the Netherlands. Over a million tulips bloom across Ottawa, with the festival featuring musical performances, art shows, and Dutch cultural events.

name: Ottawa Folk Festival (CityFolk)
desc: Ottawa's premier folk and roots music festival at Lansdowne Park.
details: CityFolk (formerly Ottawa Folk Festival) presents top Canadian and international folk, roots, Americana, and indie artists across multiple stages at Lansdowne Park. The festival is a cornerstone of Ottawa's fall cultural calendar.

name: Egungun Festival
desc: Spectacular Yoruba ancestor masquerade festival with elaborately costumed figures.
details: The Egungun Festival features elaborately costumed masquerades representing ancestral spirits who emerge to bless the community and settle disputes. The spinning, twirling egungun figures in their layered fabric costumes are among the most spectacular sights in West African culture.

name: Independence Day / Separation from Colombia parades
desc: Parades, bands, and civic ceremonies commemorating separation from Colombia.

name: Paris Gallery Weekend
desc: A coordinated opening of Paris's top contemporary art spaces.
details: Encourages gallery walks and direct engagement with artists, further consolidating the resurgence of the Parisian art market in the global ecosystem.

name: Fiesta de la Vendimia Parras
desc: Wine harvest festival in the Americas' oldest winery town.
details: Parras de la Fuente, home to Casa Madero (the oldest winery in the Americas, est. 1597), celebrates the grape harvest with wine tastings, grape-stomping competitions, live music, and cultural events in this charming desert oasis town.

name: Festival of the Sound
desc: Three-week classical and jazz music festival on the shores of Georgian Bay.
details: The Festival of the Sound presents classical, jazz, and folk concerts overlooking the beautiful waters of Georgian Bay in Parry Sound. The intimate venue and natural setting create a unique combination of world-class music and Ontario cottage country charm.

name: Pendleton Round-Up
desc: One of the largest and most prestigious rodeos in the world, a celebration of the American West.
details: The Pendleton Round-Up is one of the country's most storied rodeos, featuring top PRCA cowboys, a spectacular westward ho parade, happy canyon pageant, and a genuine small-town western celebration. The town's population of 17,000 swells to over 50,000 as rodeo fans, cowboys, and Native Americans gather for this century-old tradition.

name: Peterborough Folk Festival
desc: Intimate folk festival in the heart of Ontario's Kawarthas lake country.
details: The Peterborough Folk Festival presents folk, roots, and singer-songwriter performances in the heart of the Kawarthas, with the beautiful Otonabee River and surrounding cottage country providing a serene setting for music appreciation.

name: Luminara di San Ranieri
desc: Pisa illuminated by 100,000 candles along the Arno River.
details: On the eve of Pisa's patron saint day, 100,000 candles (lumini) illuminate the Lungarni, the Leaning Tower, churches, and palaces, creating a magical reflection on the Arno.

name: 6FEST Street Arts Festival
desc: Contemporary circus, puppet theatre, living statues, and fire arts in Plovdiv.
details: 6FEST fills European Capital of Culture 2019 Plovdiv with contemporary circus, puppet theatre, living statues, and fire performances in outdoor and indoor venues.

name: Autostrada Biennale (6th edition)
desc: Kosovo's only contemporary art institution, curated by Lucia Pietroiusti for its sixth edition.
details: Located in a former German KFOR military base, Autostrada Biennale operates as both a biennial and permanent art center (Autostrada Hangar). The 5th edition ran in 2025; the 6th edition curated by Lucia Pietroiusti is confirmed for 2027.

name: WaterFire Providence
desc: Enchanting fire installation on Providence's three rivers, combining flame, music, and public art.
details: WaterFire is a breathtaking fire sculpture installation on the three rivers of downtown Providence. On selected evenings, nearly 100 bonfires are lit on the surface of the water as music fills the air and thousands of visitors walk the riverwalk. The installation transforms the city into a magical, contemplative space.

name: Feast of San Giorgio
desc: Feast of San Giorgio — processions, fireworks, mostly on final day
details: processions, fireworks, mostly on final day

name: Pemmican Trail Pow Wow
desc: Saskatchewan powwow celebrating First Nations culture on Treaty 4 territory.
details: The Pemmican Trail Pow Wow in Regina brings together First Nations dancers, drummers, and community members for a celebration of Indigenous culture, with competitive dancing, traditional food, and craft vendors on Treaty 4 territory.

name: Reno Tahoe International Art Show
desc: An ambitious fair transforming Reno into a serious cultural destination.
details: Notable for featuring monumental post-Burning Man sculptures, bespoke furniture, and an Indigenous Artists Pavilion, leveraging the unique geography of the Sierra Nevada.

name: Xerox Rochester Fringe Festival
desc: The largest fringe festival in the US with 500+ shows across downtown Rochester.
details: The Rochester Fringe Festival has rapidly grown to become the largest fringe festival in the United States, presenting over 500 performances of theater, dance, comedy, music, and spoken word in venues throughout downtown Rochester.

name: Salmon Arm Roots and Blues Festival
desc: BC interior's beloved roots and blues festival on the shores of Shuswap Lake.
details: Set on the shores of Shuswap Lake, the Salmon Arm Roots and Blues Festival features an eclectic mix of blues, roots, world, and folk music. The lakeside setting and warm community atmosphere have earned it a devoted following.

name: Salt Lake Art Show
desc: A new fair targeting the rapidly growing wealth of the American West.
details: Debuting in Sandy, Utah, featuring diverse segments including First Nations art, bespoke furniture, and monumental sculptures, capitalizing on regional demographic shifts.

name: Luminaria
desc: Free contemporary arts festival illuminating the grounds around the San Antonio River.
details: Luminaria is San Antonio's free contemporary arts festival featuring large-scale art installations, live music, dance performances, theater, poetry, and film screenings. The riverfront and surrounding parks come alive with light-based art and interactive experiences.

name: Ocean Beach Street Fair
desc: Largest single-day event in San Diego's laid-back beach community.
details: The OB Street Fair captures the free-spirited bohemian vibe of Ocean Beach with live music, artisan vendors, a chili cook-off, and a distinctly Southern California beach town atmosphere. One of San Diego's most beloved community events.

name: Festival Casals (Classical Music Festival)
desc: The gold standard for classical music in the Caribbean, honoring cellist Pablo Casals and featuring symphonic masterpieces and chamber music.
details: Founded in 1956 by the famous cellist, conductor, and composer Pablo Casals, the festival annually welcomes outstanding musical talents. The Sala Sinfónica Pablo Casals is the official venue for this Caribbean's foremost classical music event. Held annually between February and March, its current artistic director is Maximiliano Valdés. Significant figures such as Yo-Yo Ma and ensembles like the New York Philharmonic have been among the festival's guests. Tickets often sell out weeks in advance due to high-profile performances.

name: Feria del Mole
desc: Mexico's premier mole festival in the town that produces most of Mexico City's mole paste.
details: San Pedro Atocpan, just south of Mexico City, produces over 90% of the mole paste consumed in the capital. The month-long Feria del Mole celebrates this iconic Mexican sauce with tastings of dozens of mole varieties, cooking competitions, cultural events, and the crowning of the Mole Queen.

name: International Folk Art Market
desc: World's largest folk art market with 160+ master folk artists from 60+ countries.
details: The International Folk Art Market brings together over 160 master folk artists from more than 60 countries to Santa Fe's Museum Hill. Visitors can purchase directly from artisans selling traditional textiles, ceramics, metalwork, beadwork, and other folk art forms from around the world.

name: Bayfest
desc: Lakeside music festival on the shores of Lake Huron featuring major Canadian headliners.
details: Bayfest presents major Canadian and international music acts on the shores of Lake Huron in Centennial Park, creating a lakeside festival experience.

name: Sardinia Cavalcata Sarda
desc: Magnificent parade of 3,000+ participants in traditional Sardinian costumes.
details: Cavalcata Sarda features horseback riders, musicians, and dancers from across Sardinia in stunning traditional costumes, showcasing the island's diverse folk traditions.

name: Savannah Book Festival
desc: Free literary festival in Savannah's historic squares featuring 40+ bestselling authors.
details: The Savannah Book Festival brings bestselling authors to speak in venues across Savannah's historic district. The free festival features author presentations, book signings, and panel discussions in one of America's most beautiful cities.

name: Festa delle Madonna delle Milizie
desc: Festa delle Madonna delle Milizie — processions, Norman battle reenactments
details: processions, Norman battle reenactments

name: Scottsdale Art Week
desc: An expanding fair capturing immense wealth in the American Southwest.
details: Located at WestWorld of Scottsdale, hosting 120 galleries from 15 countries with a particular thematic emphasis on regional and indigenous artistic expression.

name: Provinssirock
desc: Finland's longest-running rock festival since 1979.
details: Provinssi in Seinäjoki brings together rock, pop, and electronic artists in a welcoming Finnish festival atmosphere with a strong community spirit.

name: Sharjah Architecture Triennial
desc: A major architecture and urbanism exhibition exploring spatial practices and built environments in the Global South.
details: Sharjah's architecture-focused triennial examines spatial practices and built environments with a focus on the Global South, featuring installations, talks, and workshops. It positions Sharjah as a hub for critical architectural discourse beyond conventional Western frameworks.

name: Vermont Cheesemakers Festival
desc: Celebration of Vermont's artisan cheese tradition with tastings from 40+ cheesemakers.
details: Over 40 Vermont cheesemakers gather at Shelburne Farms for a day of tastings, pairings with local wines, spirits, and foods, plus cheese-making demonstrations. Vermont produces more cheese per capita than any other state, and this festival celebrates that tradition.

name: Festes de Santa Tecla
desc: Festes de Santa Tecla — processions featuring costumed kids; "Nit de Foc" street fireworks and revelry held weekend prior
details: processions featuring costumed kids; "Nit de Foc" street fireworks and revelry held weekend prior

name: Festival of the Crane
desc: Celebration of the annual sandhill crane migration at Bosque del Apache National Wildlife Refuge.
details: Each November, tens of thousands of sandhill cranes and snow geese arrive at Bosque del Apache, creating one of the most spectacular wildlife displays in North America. The festival includes guided tours, photography workshops, art shows, and educational programs.

name: Spirit of Speyside Whisky Festival
desc: The world's premier whisky festival with 600+ events across 51 distilleries in Scotland's whisky heartland.
details: Set in the Speyside region of the Scottish Highlands—home to more than half of Scotland's malt whisky distilleries—this festival offers over 600 whisky-related events. Distillery tours, tastings, food pairings, ceilidhs, and outdoor activities provide total immersion in Scotland's most famous export.

name: Festival Western de St-Tite
desc: Quebec's surprising and popular western festival, one of the top 10 rodeos in North America.
details: The Festival Western de St-Tite transforms a small Quebec village into a cowboy capital for 10 days. One of the top 10 professional rodeos in North America, it features bull riding, barrel racing, country concerts, line dancing, and a unique Franco-Western atmosphere.

name: Stellenbosch Harvest Parade
desc: Iconic parade honoring the start of the wine harvest season in Stellenbosch.
details: The Stellenbosch Harvest Parade honors the start of a new harvest season and gives thanks to wine farmers and workers. A colorful procession winds through the oak-lined streets of South Africa's oldest wine town.

name: Stellenbosch Triennale
desc: A non-commercial multidisciplinary art platform hosting artists from Africa and the diaspora.
details: The Stellenbosch Triennale held its second edition in 2025 themed 'BA'ZINZILE: A Rehearsal for Breathing.' Hosted every three years. Next expected in 2028. Free of charge at Oude Libertas, Rupert Museum, and Stellenbosch University Museum.

name: Zanzibar Food & Cultural Festival
desc: Celebration of Zanzibar's legendary street food culture at the historic Forodhani night market.
details: The Zanzibar Cultural Festival is a week-long celebration of the island's rich artistic and cultural heritage. It features exhibitions, traditional music, dance performances, storytelling, and culinary events that showcase the unique Swahili-Arab-Indian cultural blend of Zanzibar.

name: HebCelt Festival
desc: Celtic music festival on the Isle of Lewis in the Outer Hebrides, combining world-class folk and Celtic music with island culture.
details: The Hebridean Celtic Festival brings world-class Celtic, folk, and roots music to the stunning Isle of Lewis. Against a backdrop of white sandy beaches and ancient standing stones, the festival creates an intimate connection between music and landscape that is impossible to replicate on the mainland.

name: Stuttgarter Weindorf
desc: Stuttgart's beloved wine village with 120 stands in the market square.
details: Stuttgart's Weindorf fills the Marktplatz and Schillerplatz with 120 decorated wine stands offering 350+ Württemberg wines alongside Swabian food.

name: Pasola Festival
desc: Ritual spear-fighting on horseback tied to local Marapu traditions.

name: Onbashira Festival
desc: Once-in-six-years death-defying festival where men ride massive logs down mountainsides. Next in 2028.
details: While not in 2026 (next in 2028), the Onbashira at Suwa Taisha is worth noting as one of Japan's most extraordinary festivals. Massive fir trees are felled and dragged down mountains, with men riding atop them during the terrifying kiotoshi (log drop). Held every six years since 804 AD, it's considered one of Japan's most dangerous festivals.

name: Taipei International Flora Exposition
desc: Major horticultural exhibition showcasing botanical wonders and landscape design in the capital.
details: Taipei's Flora Expo features elaborate botanical gardens, landscape design installations, and rare plant exhibitions across multiple venues. The event combines Asian and Western horticultural traditions with cutting-edge eco-design, attracting garden enthusiasts and families. Taipei's subtropical climate enables diverse tropical and temperate plant displays.

name: Taipei Vegetarian Food Festival
desc: Taiwan's vegetarian culture—one of the world's highest per-capita—celebrated with festivals and temple food.
details: Taiwan has one of the highest proportions of vegetarians globally, influenced by Buddhist traditions. The Vegetarian Food Festival showcases temple cuisine, innovative vegan restaurants, and Taiwan's unique vegetarian street food culture. Demonstrations, tastings, and sustainability talks highlight Taiwan's leadership in plant-based dining.

name: Tan-Tan Moussem
desc: UNESCO-recognized gathering of 30+ nomadic tribes celebrating Saharan heritage with camel races and poetry.
details: The Moussem of Tan-Tan is a UNESCO Masterpiece of Intangible Heritage, gathering more than 30 nomadic tribes from across the Sahara region. It features camel races, poetry, traditional music, games, and artisanal crafts, showcasing the vibrant identity of Morocco's nomadic communities since 1963.

name: Tashkent Centre for Contemporary Art
desc: First permanent contemporary art institution in Central Asia.
details: Designed by Studio KO to act as a primary platform for local Uzbek and international contemporary art.

name: Art-Gene Folk Festival
desc: 19-year tradition of Georgian folk culture at the Open Air Museum with regional ensembles and food producers.
details: Features evening concerts from folk ensembles of all Georgian regions plus international guests. Day markets showcase food producers, winemakers, brewers, and craftspeople. Sukhishvili ensemble typically performs. Set in the Open Air Museum of Ethnography.

name: Telluride Horror Show
desc: Genre film festival in the mountains of Telluride dedicated to horror, sci-fi, and dark fantasy.
details: The Telluride Horror Show combines the intimate mountain town atmosphere of Telluride with the thrill of genre cinema, screening cutting-edge horror, science fiction, and dark fantasy films in a stunning alpine setting.

name: Telluride Bluegrass Festival
desc: Premier bluegrass and Americana festival set in a stunning box canyon in the Colorado Rockies.
details: Set against the dramatic backdrop of a box canyon in the San Juan Mountains, Telluride Bluegrass is one of the most beautiful festival settings in the world. The festival features legendary bluegrass, folk, and Americana artists, with late-night picking sessions in Town Park campground. The intimate mountain town atmosphere and world-class music make it a bucket-list event.

name: Telluride Blues & Brews Festival
desc: Three-day celebration of blues, funk, and soul music with craft beer in Telluride's Town Park.
details: The Telluride Blues & Brews Festival combines world-class blues, funk, soul, and roots music with a curated craft beer experience in the stunning mountain setting of Town Park. The festival features 56 craft breweries, chef demonstrations, and sets from blues legends and rising stars.

name: Feria de Texcoco
desc: Major agricultural and cultural fair near Mexico City celebrating the horse and rural traditions.
details: The Feria del Caballo in Texcoco is one of the largest fairs in the Mexico City metropolitan area, celebrating equestrian traditions with charreadas, horse exhibitions, agricultural shows, concerts, and carnival.

name: Año Viejo (Burning of Effigies) - Nationwide
desc: Ancient tradition burning life-sized Año Viejo effigies made from clothes/newspaper symbolizing leaving behind past year's hardships and regrets.
details: Families craft effigies from old clothes stuffed with newspaper/sawdust, wearing masks (superheroes, cartoon characters, satirical public figures, personal grievances). Burned at midnight on December 31 in massive bonfires symbolizing letting go of past year's hardships, regrets, negative energies. Other traditions: eating grapes with each midnight chime (twelve wishes for year), filling shoes with bills (worn all night for financial prosperity). Men dressed as women humorously "ask alms" to help departing year leave. Conversion of Ecuador's galería of monigotes (effigies) celebrates cultural memory and hopes for new year.

name: Thunder Bay Blues Festival
desc: Major blues festival on the shores of Lake Superior in Northwestern Ontario.
details: The Thunder Bay Blues Festival brings top Canadian and international blues artists to the shores of Lake Superior, creating an unforgettable combination of world-class blues music and the dramatic natural beauty of Ontario's northwest.

name: Timgad International Music Festival
desc: A week-long music festival set against the stunning Roman ruins of Timgad featuring traditional Algerian rai music and international acts.
details: Located in the ancient Roman city of Timgad, this week-long festival features world-famous musicians across genres from rock to rai (Algerian folk music). Concerts, art exhibitions, theater, dance performances, and film screenings take place against the spectacular backdrop of well-preserved Roman ruins. It's one of North Africa's most unique musical settings.

name: Toronto Light Festival
desc: Free outdoor light art exhibition in the Distillery Historic District.
details: The Toronto Light Festival transforms the cobblestone streets of the Distillery Historic District with immersive light installations from local and international artists. The free exhibition runs nightly throughout the winter months.

name: Toronto Chinatown Festival
desc: Celebration of Chinese-Canadian culture with lion dances, food, and cultural performances.
details: The Toronto Chinatown Festival fills Spadina Avenue and surrounding streets with Chinese cultural performances, authentic street food, lion and dragon dances, martial arts demonstrations, and a vibrant marketplace celebrating one of the largest Chinatowns in North America.

name: Canadian Music Week
desc: Major music industry conference and multi-genre festival across Toronto's live music venues.
details: Canadian Music Week is a multi-faceted event combining a major music industry conference with a live music festival across dozens of Toronto venues. The festival showcases emerging and established artists spanning every genre, with showcases, award ceremonies, and industry panels.

name: Winterfolk Blues & Roots Festival
desc: Free three-day folk, roots, and blues festival in Toronto's Danforth/Broadview area.
details: Winterfolk is a free annual folk, roots, and blues festival held in multiple venues along Danforth Avenue in Toronto, bringing warmth and music to the depths of the Canadian winter.

name: Tucson Festival of Books
desc: One of the largest book festivals in the US, held on the University of Arizona campus.
details: The Tucson Festival of Books attracts over 100,000 visitors to the University of Arizona campus for author presentations, panel discussions, book signings, and workshops. Over 350 authors and 200+ exhibitors participate in this free celebration of literacy.

name: Tucson Rodeo (La Fiesta de los Vaqueros)
desc: Major PRCA rodeo and western celebration with a parade of historic horse-drawn vehicles.
details: La Fiesta de los Vaqueros is one of the top 25 PRCA rodeos in the country, featuring bull riding, barrel racing, steer wrestling, and more. The Tucson Rodeo Parade is the longest non-motorized parade in the world, with historic wagons, stagecoaches, and mounted riders.

name: Tucson Celtic Festival
desc: Celebration of Celtic music, dance, and culture in the Sonoran Desert.
details: The Tucson Celtic Festival brings together Celtic musicians, dancers, and cultural performers from Ireland, Scotland, Wales, Brittany, and Galicia for a celebration of Celtic heritage in the unlikely but welcoming setting of the Sonoran Desert.

name: Feria de la Pirotecnia
desc: Mexico's fireworks capital hosts a spectacular pyrotechnic festival honoring San Juan de Dios.
details: Tultepec, known as the fireworks capital of Mexico, hosts a spectacular festival featuring massive castillos (tower fireworks), toritos (bull-shaped fireworks that runners carry through crowds), and elaborate pyrotechnic displays. The tradition is deeply woven into the community's identity and economy.

name: Tunisia Independence Day
desc: Celebration of Tunisia's independence from France in 1956.
details: Tunisia's Independence Day commemorates gaining sovereignty from France in 1956. Events include official ceremonies, military parades along Avenue Habib Bourguiba, cultural performances, and public celebrations across the country.

name: Turpan Grape Festival
desc: Annual celebration of Turpan's grape heritage with tastings, Uyghur performances, and traditional weddings.
details: Held annually for approximately 30 years, commemorating the 2,100-year Silk Road history. Features grape tasting, local performances, traditional Uyghur wedding ceremonies, and traditional singing/dancing.

name: Vallenato Legend Festival
desc: Colombia's most important folk music festival celebrating UNESCO-listed vallenato — the accordion-driven genre.
details: The most important celebration of vallenato (UNESCO Intangible Cultural Heritage). Musicians compete in accordion, caja, guacharaca, and piqueria (lyrical improvisation). Founded in 1968 in the heartland where vallenato was born. Keeps alive the oral storytelling tradition of the Colombian Caribbean.

name: Redentore Regatta Venice
desc: Gondola regatta on the Grand Canal following the Redentore festival.
details: The morning after Redentore's spectacular fireworks, gondoliers race on the Giudecca Canal in decorated boats, continuing centuries of Venetian rowing tradition.

name: Mercat Medieval Vic
desc: One of Catalonia's largest medieval markets transforming the old town.
details: The Mercat Medieval de Vic fills the historic centre with 300+ stalls, medieval craftspeople, jousting, fire shows, and traditional food in full medieval atmosphere.

name: Victoria Fringe Festival
desc: The oldest fringe festival in Western Canada, presenting 50+ shows across downtown Victoria.
details: Victoria's Fringe Festival presents over 50 shows across multiple downtown venues, featuring theater, comedy, dance, and spoken word from local and international artists. The charming garden city setting and walkable downtown make it a delightful festival-going experience.

name: Victoria Ska & Reggae Festival
desc: West Coast ska, reggae, and dub festival in BC's capital city.
details: The Victoria Ska & Reggae Festival brings together ska, reggae, dub, and related genres for a weekend of music in the beautiful capital city of British Columbia.

name: That Luang Festival
desc: Buddhist festival centered on the national stupa with processions and merit-making.

name: Vilnius Street Music Day
desc: Vilnius transforms into an open-air concert hall with hundreds of musicians performing across the Old Town.
details: On Street Music Day, over 500 musicians perform simultaneously on streets, courtyards, and rooftops throughout Vilnius UNESCO World Heritage Old Town. The event turns the entire city into a musical journey.

name: Cape Epic Mountain Bike Race
desc: The untamed African mountain bike race - an 8-day stage race through the Western Cape.
details: The Absa Cape Epic is an 8-day mountain bike stage race through the Western Cape of South Africa, considered the Wimbledon of mountain biking. Teams of two navigate approximately 700km of challenging terrain through mountain passes, wine lands, and forests.

name: Wichita Riverfest
desc: Nine-day festival on the Arkansas River with concerts, food, sports, and fireworks.
details: Riverfest transforms the banks of the Arkansas River into a nine-day celebration with national and local music acts, food vendors, sporting events, art installations, and spectacular fireworks. A beloved Wichita tradition that marks the start of summer.

name: Winnipeg Comedy Festival
desc: Major Canadian comedy festival featuring stand-up, sketch, improv, and one-person shows.
details: The Winnipeg Comedy Festival is one of Canada's premier comedy events, presenting over 100 shows featuring Canadian and international comedians in stand-up, sketch, improv, and theatrical comedy performances.

name: Winnipeg Fringe Theatre Festival
desc: Second-largest fringe festival in North America with 180+ shows.
details: The Winnipeg Fringe Festival presents over 180 shows in the Exchange District, featuring uncensored theater, comedy, dance, and musical performances. The outdoor site includes buskers, food vendors, and a beer tent.

name: Xalapa Feria de las Flores (Flower Fair) 2026
desc: Celebration of flowers and spring

name: Xiaoliuqiu Sea Turtle Festival
desc: Celebration of the green sea turtles that inhabit the coral island south of Taiwan.
details: Xiaoliuqiu (Lambai Island), a tiny coral island south of Taiwan, is one of the world's best places to swim with wild green sea turtles. Summer festivals celebrate turtle conservation with snorkeling events, environmental education, and coral reef awareness programs in the crystal-clear tropical waters.

name: Cameroon National Day
desc: Cameroon's national unity day with grand parades and cultural displays from all 10 regions.
details: Cameroon's National Day on May 20 features grand military and civilian parades, with each of the country's 10 regions represented by dancers and musicians in traditional costumes. The celebrations highlight Cameroon's remarkable cultural diversity with over 250 ethnic groups.

name: Golden Apricot Film Festival
desc: International film festival showcasing Armenian and global cinema at Moscow Cinema.
details: International film festival showcasing Armenian and global cinema at Moscow Cinema. Named in reference to Armenian cultural heritage.

name: Great Southern Nights
desc: Multi-venue live music initiative across NSW supporting artists and venues across genres and regions.
details: Great Southern Nights spans 17 nights across NSW, presenting hundreds of gigs in venues from Sydney to regional towns. The initiative supports local music, helping artists and venues thrive while giving audiences diverse live music experiences.

name: Fiestas del 20 de Julio - National
desc: National independence celebration with parades, cultural events, and festivities commemorating Colombia's 1810 independence declaration.
details: July 20 marks Colombian independence. Celebrated nationwide with patriotic parades, concerts, cultural performances, and community events. Different cities host unique festivities combining historical commemoration with modern celebrations.

name: Cyprus Independence Day
desc: National day celebrating Cyprus's independence from British rule in 1960.
details: Features parades, cultural events, and celebrations across the Republic of Cyprus.

name: Ethiopian Coffee Ceremony
desc: The ritual Ethiopian coffee ceremony performed across the country as a central social tradition.
details: The Ethiopian coffee ceremony is the country's most important social ritual. Green beans are roasted over charcoal, ground by hand, and brewed in a jebena clay pot while frankincense fills the air. The three-round ceremony (abol, tona, bereka) symbolizes community bonding and is performed daily across Ethiopia.

name: Réttir (Sheep Roundup)
desc: Iceland's centuries-old autumn tradition of gathering free-roaming sheep from the highlands—a communal event open to visitors.
details: Each September, Icelandic farmers ride into the highlands to gather sheep that have roamed free all summer. The communal roundup (réttir) is followed by sorting in circular stone pens, where families reclaim their animals. Open to visitors, it offers an authentic glimpse into Iceland's agricultural heritage, often accompanied by singing, food, and celebration.

name: Holi Festival
desc: The vibrant Hindu festival of colors.
details: Celebrates the arrival of spring and the triumph of good over evil with massive powder-throwing gatherings.

name: Ascension; biggest event is Venice's Festa della Sensa
desc: Ascension; biggest event is Venice's Festa della Sensa — parade of traditional boats and ritual of Venice's "marriage" to the sea); also Florence's Cricket Festival (Festa del Grillo; music, entertainment, food, crickets sold in cages
details: parade of traditional boats and ritual of Venice's "marriage" to the sea); also Florence's Cricket Festival (Festa del Grillo; music, entertainment, food, crickets sold in cages

name: Eid-Ul-Fitr (Mauritius)
desc: End of Ramadan celebrations in multi-cultural Mauritius with mosque prayers and communal feasting.
details: Eid-Ul-Fitr in Mauritius is a public holiday marking the end of Ramadan. Muslims attend mosque prayers, share festive meals, exchange gifts, and celebrate with family. The multicultural island's celebration reflects the harmonious coexistence of its diverse communities.

name: Yennayer (Amazigh New Year)
desc: The Amazigh New Year celebration marking the start of the Berber agricultural calendar with traditional attire, henna, and communal feasting.
details: Celebrated across Amazigh-majority areas including the Middle and High Atlas villages, Draa Valley, Agadir, and Tafraoute, Yennayer marks the renewal of nature and community among Berbers. Villagers wear traditional Amazigh attire adorned with silver jewelry, apply henna, and gather for communal meals. It represents the start of the agricultural year and is increasingly recognized as an official national celebration.

name: Te Matatini National Kapa Haka Festival
desc: New Zealand's premier Maori performing arts competition featuring elite kapa haka groups from across the country.
details: Te Matatini is the pinnacle of Maori performing arts, held biennially. Elite kapa haka groups from across Aotearoa compete in spectacular displays of haka, waiata, poi, and other traditional Maori performing arts. It's one of New Zealand's most powerful cultural experiences.

name: Suriname Independence Day (Srefidensi)
desc: Suriname's National Day marking its independence from the Netherlands on November 25, 1975.
details: Independence Day is a national holiday with air shows, parades, and festivals throughout the country celebrating important milestones in Suriname's history. The celebrations showcase national pride and cultural heritage with various festivities and public demonstrations.

name: Lucia Festival
desc: Sweden's beloved festival of light featuring candlelit processions.
details: Saint Lucia Day features girls in white gowns and candle crowns leading singing processions through schools, churches, and public spaces, bringing light to Sweden's darkest month.

name: Abuja Carnival
desc: National carnival in Nigeria's capital featuring cultural troupes from all 36 states.
details: The Abuja Carnival features cultural troupes from all 36 Nigerian states performing traditional dances and music. It is designed to promote national unity through cultural exchange in the purpose-built capital city.

name: Accra Carnival
desc: Street carnival celebrating Ghanaian culture with parades, music, and costumes.
details: The Accra Carnival brings colorful parades, costumed bands, and live music to the streets of Ghana's capital, celebrating the country's diverse cultural heritage and growing creative industries.

name: Ethiopian Great Run
desc: Mass participation road race at altitude in the running capital of the world.
details: The Great Ethiopian Run is the largest road race in Africa, with over 40,000 participants running 10km through the streets of Addis Ababa at 2,400m altitude. The city that has produced more Olympic distance champions than any other hosts this carnival of running.

name: Artankara
desc: The primary contemporary art fair in the Turkish capital.
details: Serving the bureaucratic and diplomatic classes of Ankara, the fair focuses heavily on domestic galleries, traditional Turkish modernism, and emerging artists from the Anatolian interior.

name: Aswan International Sculpture Symposium
desc: International sculpture symposium where artists create works in Aswan granite.
details: International sculptors create large-scale granite works in open-air workshops overlooking the Nile at Aswan, contributing to an growing sculpture park.

name: Black Sea Jazz Festival
desc: International jazz and genre-crossing festival in the Black Sea resort of Batumi.
details: The Black Sea Jazz Festival has expanded beyond jazz to include rock, R&B, soul, and funk. Past performers include Snoop Dogg, Robert Plant, and The Prodigy in the resort city of Batumi.

name: Beirut Art Week
desc: Week of art exhibitions, gallery openings, and cultural events across Beirut's vibrant art scene.
details: Features gallery exhibitions, art talks, studio visits, and cultural events showcasing Beirut's dynamic contemporary art scene.

name: Belize Carnival (Independence celebrations)
desc: Colorful parade season linked to Belize’s September celebrations.

name: Crystal Bridges Expansion
desc: Major expansion of the American Art museum.
details: Significantly increases the physical footprint and gallery space of the state's most prominent cultural institution.

name: Bobo-Dioulasso Mask Festival
desc: Mask ceremonies of the Bobo people featuring towering fiber masks in Burkina Faso's second city.
details: Bobo-Dioulasso's mask festivals feature the Bobo people's towering fiber masks that can reach several meters in height. The masks emerge during agricultural ceremonies and rites of passage, performing dramatic dances in the city's old quarter.

name: Artefiera Bologna
desc: Italy's longest-running modern and contemporary art fair.
details: Artefiera provides the most comprehensive overview of 20th-century Italian art, heavily featuring Arte Povera and Transavantgarde movements, alongside a robust section dedicated to contemporary Italian project spaces.

name: Blues on Broadbeach
desc: Free open-air blues festival across multiple stages in the heart of Broadbeach on the Gold Coast.
details: Blues on Broadbeach is one of Australia's largest free music festivals, transforming the streets and parks of Broadbeach into a blues and roots wonderland. Multiple outdoor stages host hundreds of performances over four days.

name: Bucheon International Fantastic Film Festival (BiFan)
desc: Asia's premier genre film festival specializing in horror, fantasy, and sci-fi cinema.
details: BiFan (Bucheon International Fantastic Film Festival) is Asia's leading genre film festival, specializing in horror, fantasy, thriller, and sci-fi cinema.
