The festival screens hundreds of films, hosts industry events, and has launched the careers of many Asian genre filmmakers. Late-night screenings create an electric atmosphere.

name: Obama Presidential Center
desc: Opening of the Obama Foundation's campus.
details: A massive catalyst for civic engagement and urban renewal located in historic Jackson Park.

name: Copenhagen Christmas Markets (Tivoli)
desc: Tivoli Gardens' magical Christmas transformation.
details: Tivoli Gardens transforms into a Nordic winter wonderland with millions of lights, Christmas markets, ice skating, and the world's oldest amusement park's festive charm.

name: Enter Art Fair
desc: Scandinavia's largest and most progressive international art fair.
details: Enter Art Fair is noted for its strong integration of digital art and NFTs. It provides a vibrant, highly curated overview of the Nordic contemporary scene alongside progressive international galleries.

name: Fête des Masques de Dédougou
desc: Fiber and leaf mask festival in Dédougou with Bwa and Nuna mask performances.
details: The mask festival in Dédougou features stunning fiber and leaf masks of the Bwa and Nuna peoples performing in the dusty streets. The masks represent bush spirits and animals, and their energetic dances are some of the most spectacular in West Africa.

name: Katara European Jazz Festival
desc: Jazz festival at Katara Cultural Village featuring European and international jazz artists.
details: Hosted at the stunning Katara Cultural Village amphitheatre. Features jazz performances, workshops, and cultural exchanges.

name: Dubai Jazz Festival
desc: Annual jazz festival bringing top international artists to Dubai Media City Amphitheatre.
details: Multi-day festival at Dubai Media City Amphitheatre featuring international jazz, soul, R&B, and pop headliners. One of the region's premier music events.

name: Gulfood
desc: The world's largest annual food and beverage sourcing event.
details: Reflecting Dubai's role as a global logistical gateway, Gulfood hosts over 5,500 exhibitors. It heavily influences global food retail, hospitality trends, ingredient innovation, and the processing sectors, attracting massive international purchasing power.

name: Durban July
desc: Africa's greatest horseracing event and a glamorous fashion spectacle.
details: The Vodacom Durban July is the biggest and most prestigious horse racing event in Africa, held at Greyville Racecourse. Beyond the racing, it is a massive social and fashion event where attendees compete for best-dressed honors. It attracts celebrities, socialites, and racing enthusiasts from across the continent.

name: Red Sea Jazz Festival Eilat
desc: Premier jazz festival on the shores of the Red Sea featuring international jazz artists.
details: Four-day jazz festival on the Eilat waterfront featuring world-class jazz, blues, and fusion artists against the backdrop of the Red Sea and desert mountains.

name: Ferrara Buskers Festival
desc: World's largest street music festival with 1,000+ performers.
details: Ferrara Buskers Festival fills the medieval city centre with 1,000+ street musicians from 30+ countries performing every genre imaginable across squares, courtyards, and alleys.

name: Fujairah International Arts Festival
desc: International arts festival on the Gulf of Oman coast featuring visual arts and performances.
details: Showcases international and regional artists with exhibitions, performances, and workshops in the mountainous emirate of Fujairah.

name: Göteborg Film Festival Biennial
desc: Scandinavia's largest film festival, held annually with biennial special programming.
details: The Göteborg Film Festival is one of Europe's leading film events, showcasing Nordic and international cinema. While annual, it incorporates biennial special sections and retrospectives.

name: Festival Internacional de Cine de Guanajuato (GIFF)
desc: Traveling film festival screening in multiple UNESCO World Heritage cities across Guanajuato state.
details: GIFF is unique in presenting films across multiple historic cities in Guanajuato state - including Guanajuato City, San Miguel de Allende, and Leon. Screenings take place in colonial theaters, outdoor plazas, and mine shafts, creating extraordinary cinematic experiences.

name: Viking Festival Hafnarfjörður
desc: Annual Viking festival celebrating Norse heritage with reenactments, combat demonstrations, crafts, and feasts.
details: The Viking Festival transforms the town of Hafnarfjörður, just south of Reykjavík, into a Norse encampment. Viking reenactors from across Europe set up camp, demonstrating traditional crafts, combat techniques, and cooking. Visitors can try axe throwing, watch staged battles, and feast on Viking-inspired food.

name: Sidama Coffee Ceremony Festival
desc: Festival celebrating the Sidama people's deep coffee culture and ceremonial traditions.
details: The Sidama region is one of Ethiopia's premier coffee-growing areas, and this festival celebrates the deep connection between Sidama culture and coffee. Events include elaborate coffee ceremonies, cupping sessions, farm tours, and cultural performances.

name: Istanbul Design Biennial
desc: International design biennial exploring design's role in contemporary society.
details: Organized by IKSV, showcases international design projects, installations, and exhibitions exploring how design shapes everyday life.

name: Joburg Day
desc: Heritage Day celebration with music, food, and cultural activities in Johannesburg.
details: Joburg Day is a Heritage Day celebration featuring live music performances, food stalls representing South Africa's diverse cuisines, cultural activities, and family entertainment. It celebrates the Rainbow Nation's unity in diversity.

name: Joy of Jazz
desc: South Africa's premier jazz festival attracting top international and local jazz artists to Johannesburg.
details: Joy of Jazz is Johannesburg's premier jazz festival, bringing together world-class international and local jazz artists across multiple stages. The three-day event features a mix of traditional jazz, contemporary fusion, and Afro-jazz.

name: Pahlavon Mahmud Strongmen Games
desc: International strongman tournament at Itchan Kala honoring 13th-century wrestler and Sufi master.
details: International tournament honoring 13th-century wrestler, poet, and Sufi master Pahlavon Mahmud Khorezmi. Features extreme strength competitions including atlas stone lifting and anchor dragging. Supported by World Federation of Strongmen with international athletes from 10+ countries.

name: Knysna Oyster Festival
desc: Ten-day celebration of oysters, sport, and culture on the Garden Route.
details: The Knysna Oyster Festival is a ten-day celebration on the scenic Garden Route featuring oyster eating and shucking competitions, marathon running, cycling, golf, food and wine events, and family entertainment in the beautiful Knysna lagoon setting.

name: Felabration
desc: Week-long music festival celebrating Fela Kuti's legacy at the New Afrika Shrine in Lagos.
details: Felabration was conceived in 1998 by Yeni Anikulapo-Kuti in memory of her father Fela Kuti, the pioneer of Afrobeat. The week-long event at the New Afrika Shrine in Ikeja features musical performances, art exhibitions, symposiums, and discussions honoring Fela's musical and political legacy.

name: Lahore Biennale 04
desc: The fourth edition explores cross-border connectivity on the 80th anniversary of Pakistan's independence and Partition.
details: Curated by Nav Haq from Museum of Contemporary Art Antwerp. Focuses on the vitality of society and culture across borders, poignant in the 80th anniversary year of Partition. Founded in 2014, held in Lahore's historic heart.

name: Larnaca International Festival
desc: Summer arts festival featuring international music, dance, and theatre performances.
details: Features performances by international and local artists in music, dance, and theatre at various venues around Larnaca including the medieval fort.

name: Fiesta de Santa Marta de Ribarteme
desc: Fiesta de Santa Marta de Ribarteme — a.k.a. As Neves, on Portuguese border in Galicia; coffin parade celebrating those who had brush with death in previous year
details: a.k.a. As Neves, on Portuguese border in Galicia; coffin parade celebrating those who had brush with death in previous year

name: Lille Art Up!
desc: A major regional contemporary art fair in Northern France.
details: Capitalizing on its proximity to Belgium and Paris, the fair provides a strong commercial platform for regional galleries and introduces contemporary art to a broad, highly engaged local public.

name: Forecastle Festival
desc: Waterfront music and arts festival celebrating the 'Port of Louisville' with bourbon, beer, and indie music.
details: Set on the Ohio River waterfront, Forecastle blends indie rock, hip-hop, electronic, and Americana music with a distinctly Louisville flavor. The Bourbon Lodge features premium Kentucky bourbon tastings, and local food vendors highlight the city's culinary scene. The beautiful riverfront setting and mid-size scale create an accessible, enjoyable atmosphere.

name: Carnival of Luanda
desc: Vibrant carnival in Angola's capital with Angolan musical styles and colorful parades.
details: The Carnival of Luanda features colorful parades, elaborate costumes, and performances celebrating Angola's diverse musical styles including kizomba, semba, and kuduro. It is one of the largest carnival celebrations in Southern Africa.

name: Lucca Summer Festival
desc: Major summer concert series within Lucca's medieval walls.
details: Lucca Summer Festival presents individual headline concerts by major international artists in the atmospheric Piazza Napoleone within Lucca's Renaissance walls.

name: Luxor Cultural Nights
desc: Evening cultural performances at Luxor's ancient temples illuminated by sound and light shows.
details: Luxor's temples come alive at night with sound and light shows at Karnak and Luxor temples, creating spectacular cultural experiences amid 3,000-year-old monuments. Traditional Nubian and Egyptian music and dance performances are also regularly held.

name: Sunwaves Festival
desc: Marathon electronic music festival on Romania's Black Sea coast.
details: Sunwaves' legendary editions feature non-stop minimal/tech-house music from Friday to Monday on the Black Sea beach, attracting dedicated electronic music fans worldwide.

name: Djemaa el-Fna Storytelling
desc: Traditional Halqa storytelling circles in Marrakech's UNESCO-listed main square.
details: The Halqa (storytelling circles) of Jemaa el-Fna are an ancient Moroccan tradition where storytellers captivate crowds with tales from Thousand and One Nights, local legends, and contemporary satire. This oral tradition is part of the square's UNESCO recognition.

name: Red Dot Miami
desc: A contemporary fair running alongside Spectrum in Wynwood.
details: Features specific 'Art Labs' and the 'Discoveries Collection' (works under $5,000), democratizing access to the intense buying frenzy of Miami Art Week.

name: Burning Man-style: Nowhere Festival
desc: European Burning Man regional event in the Spanish desert.
details: Nowhere is Europe's answer to Burning Man—a participant-driven festival of art, music, and radical self-expression in the Monegros Desert of Aragon, Spain.

name: Monterey Jazz Festival
desc: The longest continuously running jazz festival in the world, showcasing jazz legends and rising stars on the scenic Monterey Peninsula.
details: Founded in 1958, the Monterey Jazz Festival is a cornerstone of American musical heritage. Held at the Monterey County Fairgrounds, it features multiple stages, panels, and educational programs alongside performances by the world's top jazz artists. The festival has hosted Miles Davis, Thelonious Monk, Billie Holiday, and every major jazz artist of the past 65+ years.

name: Carnival of Montevideo
desc: The world's longest carnival (40+ days) featuring candombe drum parades and murga theatrical performances rooted in Afro-Uruguayan traditions.
details: Montevideo's Carnival is the world's longest, stretching roughly 40 days. The heart is candombe — Afro-Uruguayan drum ensembles (comparsas) that parade through barrio streets. Murga groups perform satirical musical theater combining chorus singing, percussion, and political commentary. The Desfile de Llamadas (Parade of Calls) is the highlight with dozens of candombe comparsas in the Sur and Palermo neighborhoods.

name: Carnival (Uruguay) season
desc: Longest Carnival season in the world by duration, featuring murga and candombe traditions.

name: Muscat International Theatre Festival
desc: International theatre festival featuring Arab and world theatre productions.
details: Showcases diverse theatre productions from across the Arab world and internationally at venues in Muscat.

name: Immergut Festival
desc: Intimate indie festival in the lakeland region.
details: Immergut presents carefully curated indie and alternative music in the scenic Mecklenburg Lake District with a warm community atmosphere.

name: New York Musical Festival / SummerStage
desc: Free outdoor performing arts festival in Central Park and parks across NYC featuring music, dance, and spoken word.
details: SummerStage presents over 100 free performances in Central Park and parks across all five boroughs, spanning genres from hip-hop and Latin to jazz and classical. It is the largest free outdoor performing arts festival in New York City and one of the most significant in the country.

name: Syttende Mai (Norway Constitution Day)
desc: Children’s parades, bunad traditional dress, music, and flags celebrating Norway’s constitution.

name: Palm Beach Modern + Contemporary
desc: A premier winter art fair presented by the Art Miami group.
details: Catering to serious collectors and museum directors, offering an intimate look at significant post-war and pop era works within the affluent South Florida market.

name: FIAC/Paris+ by Art Basel
desc: Major international art fair at the Grand Palais in Paris.
details: Paris+ by Art Basel (successor to FIAC) presents 150+ leading galleries at the Grand Palais, with satellite events across the city during Paris Art Week.

name: Carniriv (Port Harcourt Carnival)
desc: Oil-rich Port Harcourt's answer to the Calabar Carnival with parades and cultural displays.
details: Carniriv is Port Harcourt's annual carnival, featuring colorful parades, traditional masquerades, contemporary music performances, and cultural displays from the diverse communities of the Niger Delta region.

name: Punakha Drubchen & Tshechu
desc: Festival featuring masked dances and a dramatic reenactment of historic battles (drubchen).

name: DesignMarch
desc: Reykjavík City Festival showcasing the best of Icelandic design with exhibitions, talks, and studio visits.
details: DesignMarch has been elevated to a permanent Reykjavík City Festival. It showcases the Icelandic design scene—fresh, exciting, and intimate enough to meet the stars of local design. Expect exhibitions, studio visits, talks, and pop-up installations across the city.

name: Food and Fun Festival
desc: International chefs collaborate with Reykjavík's restaurants to create dishes celebrating Icelandic ingredients.
details: This five-day culinary festival brings international chefs to Reykjavík where they team up with local restaurants to create special menus using Icelandic ingredients. It is a celebration of Iceland's unique produce—from Arctic char and lamb to wild herbs—through creative, cross-cultural cuisine.

name: Dark Music Days
desc: Annual progressive music festival illuminating Iceland's darkest winter with high-quality new music and world-class performers.
details: Dark Music Days (Myrkir Músíkdagar) has lit up the darkest period of the Icelandic winter in Reykjavík for over 40 years. It showcases contemporary and experimental music, including new Icelandic compositions, performed by world-class musicians. The festival has been designated an official Reykjavík City Festival for 2026-2028.

name: Riga City Festival
desc: Annual celebration of Riga's founding with open-air restaurants, arts markets, fireworks, and free public transport.
details: The Riga City Festival marks the capital's anniversary with free events across the city. Highlights include an open-air restaurant at Spīķeri Creative Quarter, local arts and crafts markets at Vērmanes Garden, concerts, and spectacular fireworks. Free public transport operates during the festival weekend.

name: Regata delle Antiche Repubbliche Marinare
desc: Historic boat race between Italy's four ancient maritime republics.
details: Amalfi, Genoa, Pisa, and Venice compete in a spectacular rowing race in period galleons, preceded by a magnificent historical pageant with 300+ costumed participants.

name: Rotterdam International Film Festival
desc: Major international film festival focused on independent and experimental cinema.
details: IFFR Rotterdam champions independent, experimental, and innovative cinema from emerging filmmakers worldwide, with the Tiger Award as its top prize.

name: Fiesta Nacional del Poncho
city: San Fernando del Valle de Catamarca
desc: Provincial showcase with concerts, parades, and cultural events.

name: Sanremo Music Festival
desc: Italy's most-watched music competition and cultural phenomenon.
details: The Festival di Sanremo is Italy's premier music competition broadcast to 12+ million viewers nightly. It has launched international stars and its winner represents Italy at Eurovision.

name: Festival Presidente de Música Latina
desc: One of Latin America's most important music festivals and the largest in the Caribbean region, making its comeback after a decade-long pause.
details: President Luis Abinader announced the Presidente Festival's return in 2026 after a decade hiatus (last held in 2017). Organized by Cervecería Nacional Dominicana (CND), the festival is likely to be held at the Felix Sanchez Olympic Stadium. The 2026 edition is envisioned as a collaborative, countrywide effort supporting businesses, entrepreneurs, and creative talent. Features major international music acts and celebrates Dominican spirit through art and culture.

name: Sanya International Film Festival
desc: Tropical beach film festival establishing China's answer to Cannes on Hainan Island.
details: The Hainan International Film Festival in tropical Sanya aims to become Asia's premiere beach-side film event. Featuring international and Chinese films, the festival combines screenings with red carpet events against stunning tropical beach backdrops. China's growing film industry makes this an increasingly significant event.

name: São Tomé Carnival
desc: Colorful carnival celebrations in the tiny island nation with Portuguese-African cultural fusion.
details: São Tomé's carnival features colorful parades, music, and dance reflecting the island's unique Portuguese-African cultural heritage. Costumed groups perform traditional tchiloli theatre and auto de floripes alongside carnival music and dance.

name: Sarajevo Film Festival
desc: Southeastern Europe's premier film festival born during the siege.
details: Founded during the 1992-95 siege, the Sarajevo Film Festival has grown into the region's leading cinema event, screening 250+ films in the rebuilt city.

name: Saskatoon Jazz Festival
desc: Saskatchewan's premier jazz festival featuring Canadian and international artists in riverside venues.
details: The Saskatchewan Jazz Festival brings world-class jazz, blues, and world music to multiple stages in Saskatoon, with a beautiful main stage along the South Saskatchewan River. Free outdoor programming complements ticketed concerts.

name: Savannah Music Festival
desc: Georgia's largest music festival, presenting jazz, classical, Americana, and world music in Savannah's historic venues.
details: Over 17 days, the Savannah Music Festival presents over 100 performances in intimate historic venues throughout one of America's most beautiful cities. The programming spans classical, jazz, Americana, bluegrass, and global traditions, with an emphasis on cross-genre collaborations and world premieres.

name: Burns Night celebrations
desc: Robert Burns suppers featuring haggis, poetry recitations, and traditional music and dance.

name: Bumbershoot
desc: Seattle's iconic arts and music festival at Seattle Center, one of the longest-running urban arts festivals in the US.
details: Bumbershoot transforms Seattle Center into a multi-disciplinary arts festival featuring music, comedy, film, visual art, theater, dance, and literary arts. The festival has featured everyone from Jimi Hendrix to Billie Eilish, and its emphasis on the full spectrum of creative expression distinguishes it from purely music-focused festivals.

name: South African Cheese Festival
desc: Premier culinary festival highlighting artisanal cheeses, food, and wine in the Stellenbosch Winelands.
details: The South African Cheese Festival at Sandringham Farm in Stellenbosch is the country's premier cheese event, showcasing hundreds of artisanal cheeses alongside fine wines, craft beers, and gourmet food from across the country.

name: Stellenbosch Wine Festival
desc: Three-day festival featuring 180+ wine producers, masterclasses, and a natural wine pavilion.
details: The Stellenbosch Wine Festival is a premier wine event featuring over 180 wine producers with expanded masterclass programming, a young winemaker showcase, natural wine pavilion, and food truck village. Three-day passes cost R800 with single-day options at R350.

name: Up the Creek
desc: Beloved riverside music festival in the Breede River valley with camping and water activities.
details: Up the Creek is a beloved South African music festival set along the Breede River near Swellendam. Campers pitch tents under trees along the riverbank while enjoying diverse music acts, river tubing, and the relaxed outdoor atmosphere.

name: Tbilisi Jazz Festival
desc: Georgia's premier jazz festival with an illustrious history dating to 1978.
details: The Tbilisi Jazz Festival has hosted legends including Chick Corea, Herbie Hancock, and Gregory Porter. It brings international and Georgian jazz to Tbilisi Concert Hall and venues across the capital.

name: MoN Takanawa
desc: Museum of Narratives opens in Tokyo.
details: An experimental space successfully blending traditional Japanese kabuki culture with manga and digital science.

name: Art Fair Tokyo
desc: The largest art fair in Japan, uniquely blending antiques, crafts, and contemporary art.
details: Reflecting Japanese collecting habits, the fair juxtaposes highly refined ancient ceramics and Nihonga paintings with cutting-edge anime-influenced contemporary art, drawing massive domestic crowds.

name: Ubud Writers & Readers Festival
desc: A pilgrimage for literature lovers bringing together powerful voices for four days of cross-cultural dialogue and artistic exchange.
details: Southeast Asia's premier literary festival brings together international authors, thinkers, and performers for meaningful exchange and cross-cultural dialogue. Set across Ubud's cafes, galleries, and cultural venues, the festival features panel discussions, readings, workshops, book launches, and cultural performances spanning four enriching days.

name: Tjungu Festival
desc: Celebration of Indigenous culture at the base of Uluru with music, art, film, and bush tucker.
details: Tjungu Festival celebrates Aboriginal culture at the iconic Ayers Rock Resort near Uluru. The three-day event features Indigenous music, art workshops, bush tucker tastings, film screenings, and storytelling, all in the shadow of one of the world's most sacred sites.

name: Boun Bang Fai (Rocket Festival)
desc: Traditional rocket launches and festivities to encourage rainfall for the farming season.

name: Namibia Annual Music Awards
desc: Namibia's premier music awards ceremony celebrating the best in Namibian music.
details: The Namibia Annual Music Awards (NAMAs) celebrate the best of Namibian music across multiple genres. The ceremony features live performances, award presentations, and a showcase of Namibia's growing music industry.

name: Falls Festival
desc: Multi-city camping music festival spanning New Year's with major international and local acts.
details: Falls Festival is a beloved Australian New Year's tradition, held at multiple stunning locations including Lorne (VIC), Marion Bay (TAS), and Byron Bay (NSW). The multi-day camping festival features international and Australian headliners across rock, electronic, hip-hop, and indie.

name: Sankthansaften (Denmark)
desc: Danish midsummer celebration with bonfires on beaches, witch effigies burned, singing, and community gatherings nationwide.
details: On the evening of June 23, Danes light bonfires across the country, often on beaches. A straw witch effigy is traditionally placed atop the bonfire to 'send evil spirits away to Bloksbjerg.' Communities gather for speeches, singing of 'Midsommervisen,' food, and socializing as the long Nordic twilight stretches into the night.

name: Isle of Light Festival
desc: Island-wide celebration of light and culture across Dominican Republic.
details: Part of the Caribbean festival calendar celebrating Dominican cultural identity and heritage. Combines religious, cultural, and artistic elements reflecting the island's diverse traditions.

name: Eid al-Adha in Egypt
desc: The Festival of Sacrifice with communal prayers, street celebrations, and charitable meat distribution across Egypt.
details: Eid al-Adha honors Prophet Ibrahim's willingness to sacrifice, celebrated with morning prayers at mosques, new clothes, and the ritual sacrifice of livestock. Much of the meat is shared with the poor. Streets fill with colorful celebrations, children play with balloons, and families gather for festive meals. It's one of Egypt's most vibrant public celebrations.

name: Eid al-Fitr in Jordan
desc: The end of Ramadan celebrated with feasting, gifts, cultural performances, and community celebrations across Jordan.
details: Marking the end of Ramadan, Eid al-Fitr in Jordan is celebrated with much feasting, gift-giving, and cultural performances. Public celebrations take place across the country with markets, street festivals, and community gatherings. It's a joyful time when Jordanian hospitality is at its warmest.

name: Festival Maya de las Americas
desc: Celebration of Maya cultural heritage across Yucatan with ceremonies, dance, and traditional arts.
details: Festivals celebrating living Maya culture take place across the Yucatan Peninsula, featuring traditional ceremony, dance, language preservation events, and artisan markets showcasing the continuation of Maya traditions in the modern world.

name: Feast of St. John (Sânziene)
desc: Romania's mystical midsummer celebration blending Christian and pre-Christian traditions.
details: On the night before Sânziene, Romanians celebrate with bonfires, flower crowns, and ancient rituals. Young women weave wreaths of Lady's Bedstraw flowers and toss them onto rooftops—tradition says the wreath that stays brings good luck.

name: Saint Lucia Jazz & Arts Festival
desc: A multi-genre Caribbean festival showcasing jazz, pop, R&B, gospel, roots reggae, soca, and salsa.
details: The 2026 performances include the Brandford Marsalis Quartet, Esperanza Spalding, Billy Ocean, TEMS, Capleton, Ella Mai, Tye Tribbett, and Ada Ehi. The festival celebrates Caribbean musical heritage across multiple genres with international and regional artists.

name: Aarhus Jazz Festival
desc: Eight days of 300+ jazz concerts across 30 venues in Aarhus, with most daytime concerts free.
details: Aarhus hosts an extensive jazz programme with local and international talent performing all genres of jazz on big stages and in intimate cafés. The festival runs for eight days and presents around 300 concerts at 30 different venues. Most daytime performances are free to attend.

name: Aseer Season
desc: Seasonal festival in the mountain city of Abha featuring culture, nature, and entertainment.
details: Mountain region festival with cooler summer temperatures featuring cultural events, nature activities, and entertainment in the scenic Asir highlands.

name: MASA (Marché des Arts du Spectacle Africain)
desc: Pan-African performing arts market and festival showcasing African theatre, dance, music, and comedy.
details: MASA is one of Africa's most important performing arts events, serving as both a festival and market for African theatre, dance, music, and comedy. Producers, programmers, and artists from across Africa and the diaspora converge on Abidjan for showcases, networking, and deal-making.

name: Tidal Rave Festival
desc: Ghana's premier beach music festival celebrating its 12th edition at La Palm Royal Beach Hotel.
details: Tidal Rave Festival celebrates its 12th edition with two days of music at La Palm Royal Beach Hotel in Accra. It features top Ghanaian and international Afrobeats, hip-hop, and dancehall artists in a beachside setting that has become a highlight of Ghana's entertainment calendar.

name: AfroFuture Ghana
desc: Multi-day Afrocentric celebration of music, fashion, art, and innovation at El Wak Stadium.
details: AfroFuture Ghana returns for its eighth installment at El Wak Stadium in Accra, featuring a concentrated celebration of fashion, futurism, music, art, innovation, and Afrocentric imagination. It draws diaspora visitors and locals for an epic year-end cultural experience.

name: Aldeburgh Festival
desc: Prestigious music festival founded by Benjamin Britten at Snape Maltings.
details: Aldeburgh Festival at the Snape Maltings Concert Hall and Aldeburgh parish church presents world-class classical music, opera, and new commissions on the Suffolk coast.

name: FourE Eco-Ethno Festival
desc: Open-air festival blending ecology, ethnicity, emotions, and evolution in the Zailiysky Alatau foothills.
details: Four E's = Ecology, Ethnicity, Emotions, Evolution. Multiform open-air festival with music/dance, spiritual practices, yoga, master classes in psychology/business/art, modern and ethnic music concerts, healthy cuisine, creative workshops, sports classes, hiking lectures, craftspeople market, kids zone. 24/7 operations including cosmic electronic music platform, campfires, drum jams.

name: Almaty Apple Festival (Alma Fest)
desc: Celebration of Almaty's rich apple-growing heritage with picking, cider making, and traditional performances.
details: Celebrates the region's rich apple-growing tradition. Features apple picking, cider making, traditional Kazakh music and dance performances. Attracts visitors celebrating apple heritage at First President's Park.

name: Tomorrowland Winter
desc: The winter edition of the legendary electronic music festival, set in the French Alps.
details: Tomorrowland Winter brings the magic of Tomorrowland to the slopes of Alpe d'Huez. Festival-goers ski by day and dance to world-class DJs by night in an immersive alpine wonderland with spectacular stage designs.

name: Aqaba Traditional Arts Festival
desc: A month-long celebration of Bedouin culture and traditions in the Red Sea port city of Aqaba.
details: Hosted in the port city of Aqaba, this festival celebrates the culture and traditions of the Bedouin people with handmade crafts for sale, market stalls with sumptuous local food, and folk music groups. It runs throughout February, providing a warm-weather cultural experience along the Red Sea coast.

name: Arusha Cultural Heritage Festival
desc: Cultural festival at the gateway to Tanzania's safari circuit celebrating Maasai and other local cultures.
details: The Arusha Cultural Heritage Festival celebrates the diverse cultures of northern Tanzania's peoples, including Maasai, Chagga, and Iraqw communities. It features traditional dance, music, crafts, and cultural demonstrations at the gateway to Tanzania's famous safari circuit.

name: Bele Chere (Asheville Street Festival)
desc: Asheville's largest outdoor street festival with live music, food, and arts in the Blue Ridge Mountains.
details: This free street festival fills downtown Asheville with live music on multiple stages, food vendors showcasing the city's acclaimed culinary scene, artisan crafts, and street performers. The festival celebrates Asheville's creative spirit and mountain town charm.

name: Badagry Coconut Festival
desc: Celebration of the coconut harvest in the historic slave port town of Badagry.
details: The Badagry Coconut Festival celebrates the coconut harvest in this historic town west of Lagos, known as a former slave trade port. Events include coconut-themed food, cultural performances, historical tours of slave relics, and boat rides on the creek.

name: Gambia International Cultural Festival
desc: Week-long celebration of Gambian and West African culture with traditional wrestling, music, and dance.
details: The Gambia International Cultural Festival features traditional wrestling (a hugely popular West African sport), music, dance, masquerade performances, and arts exhibitions celebrating the rich cultural heritage of The Gambia and the wider West African region.

name: Banyuwangi Ethno Carnival
desc: Ethnic-themed carnival showcasing regional costumes and performances.

name: Barossa Vintage Festival
desc: Australia's oldest wine festival celebrating the Barossa Valley's vintage with a week of food, wine, and heritage events.
details: The Barossa Vintage Festival is one of Australia's most prestigious wine events, celebrating the completion of the grape harvest. Held biennially, the week-long festival features wine tastings, vineyard dinners, the famous grape-treading competition, concerts, and community events.

name: Liste Art Fair Basel
desc: The world's premier fair for discovering new, highly experimental contemporary art.
details: Occurring alongside Art Basel, Liste is restricted to young galleries and emerging artists. Housed in Messe Basel, it is an absolute necessity for global curators seeking the next generation of museum-level talent.

name: Affordable Art Fair Berlin
desc: The third edition of the accessible art market in the German capital.
details: Fosters a new collector class in Berlin, featuring over 65 galleries and capping artwork prices at €10,000 to encourage widespread market participation among younger demographics.

name: Christopher Street Day Berlin
desc: Berlin's massive Pride celebration and political demonstration.
details: CSD Berlin features a spectacular parade through the city centre with floats, music, and political messages, followed by a huge open-air party at the Brandenburg Gate.

name: Positions Art Fair Berlin
desc: An official partner of Berlin Art Week, focusing on emerging galleries.
details: Housed in the historic Tempelhof Airport, Positions offers a more accessible, discovery-oriented alternative to the blue-chip Gallery Weekend, emphasizing young artists and affordable contemporary art.

name: Printemps de Bourges
desc: Major French new music festival discovering tomorrow's stars.
details: Printemps de Bourges has been launching French music careers since 1977, presenting emerging and established artists across chanson, rock, hip-hop, and world music.

name: Mountain Song Festival at Brevard
desc: Intimate folk and roots festival in the mountains of Western North Carolina near Pisgah National Forest.
details: Set in the charming mountain town of Brevard, gateway to Pisgah National Forest, this intimate festival celebrates folk, roots, and Americana music against a stunning Blue Ridge Mountain backdrop. The small-town setting, craft beer, and exceptional music create a uniquely welcoming experience.

name: Upfest
desc: Europe's largest street art festival with live mural painting and workshops.
details: Upfest transforms Bristol's Bedminster and Southville neighbourhoods with 400+ artists painting live murals, plus workshops and exhibitions celebrating street art culture.

name: Mundi Mundi Bash
desc: Massive outback music festival set against the stunning Mundi Mundi Plains near Broken Hill.
details: The Mundi Mundi Bash brings thousands to the remote outback plains west of Broken Hill for a three-day music festival featuring top Australian acts. The vast flat landscape creates an unforgettable setting, with camping under the stars and a true outback community atmosphere.

name: Affordable Art Fair Brussels
desc: The 18th edition of the approachable European contemporary fair.
details: Hosting over 85 Belgian and international galleries, maintaining a fun and friendly atmosphere that has generated immense cumulative sales for the franchise over decades.

name: Europalia Arts Festival
desc: Major biennial international arts festival spanning Belgium and Europe.
details: Europalia presents a multidisciplinary programme exploring a guest country's culture through exhibitions, concerts, dance, theatre, film, and literature across Belgium and Europe.

name: Les Nuits Botanique
desc: Brussels music festival in the greenhouses of the Royal Botanic Garden.
details: Les Nuits brings indie, rock, electronic, and world music to the stunning greenhouses and gardens of Brussels' Botanique cultural centre.

name: Balkan Beats Bucharest
desc: Three-day celebration of Balkan sound, dance, and culture.
details: Balkan Beats brings the biggest names in Balkan pop, trap, and turbo-folk to Bucharest's Romexpo for three days of high-energy Balkan music and dance.

name: Budapest Christmas Fair
desc: Charming Christmas market on Vörösmarty Square.
details: Budapest's Christmas Fair fills Vörösmarty Square with Hungarian handicrafts, chimney cake, mulled wine, and folk performances against the backdrop of the illuminated city.

name: Cairo Design Week
desc: A massive celebration of Egyptian creativity spanning multiple historic districts.
details: The week integrates contemporary product and interior design into Cairo's dense, ancient urban fabric. It highlights the resurgence of Egyptian craftsmanship married to modern industrial capabilities.

name: San Juan Camagüeyano (St. John festivities)
desc: Traditional celebrations and street events linked to St. John’s Day.

name: Cape Town Pride
desc: Cape Town's annual LGBTQ+ pride festival with parades and cultural events.
details: Cape Town Pride features a colorful parade through the city streets, parties, cultural events, film screenings, and community gatherings celebrating diversity. The Mother City is widely regarded as Africa's most LGBTQ+-friendly destination.

name: Taste of Cape Town
desc: Premium food festival featuring Cape Town's top restaurants and chefs.
details: Taste of Cape Town is the city's premier foodie event, where top restaurants set up tasting stations and celebrity chefs demonstrate their skills. Attendees sample dishes from the city's finest establishments alongside craft drinks and artisan products.

name: Carnaval Turístico de Carúpano
desc: One of Venezuela’s best-known carnivals with parades and music.

name: Chamonix Unlimited Festival
desc: Electronic music festival at the foot of Mont Blanc combining skiing and dancing.
details: Chamonix Unlimited brings electronic music to the mountains with DJs performing at altitude venues, combining skiing by day with dancing at night under Mont Blanc.

name: Changsha Mango Music Festival
desc: Major Chinese indie and rock music festival in the entertainment capital of central China.
details: Changsha, known as China's 'Entertainment Capital' for its vibrant media and music scene, hosts a major music festival featuring Chinese rock, indie, and electronic artists. The city's young, creative energy and famous nightlife culture make it an ideal festival host.

name: Changsha Orange Isle Music Festival
desc: Major outdoor music festival on Changsha's iconic Orange Isle in the Xiang River.
details: Changsha's Orange Isle Music Festival takes place on the famous island in the Xiang River, immortalized in Mao Zedong's poetry. Multiple stages host Chinese rock, pop, electronic, and indie artists. The island setting and Changsha's vibrant nightlife culture make it one of central China's premier music events.

name: Cheltenham Jazz Festival
desc: Leading UK jazz festival with international and British jazz artists.
details: Cheltenham Jazz Festival fills the Regency town with jazz from traditional to contemporary across multiple venues and free stages in Montpellier Gardens.

name: Thantawan Festival
desc: An intimate music and lifestyle festival set against blooming sunflower fields in northern Thailand.
details: A boutique festival combining live music with arts, community engagement, and Chiang Mai's stunning natural beauty. Set against blooming sunflower fields, the vibe is relaxed, artistic, and family-friendly — perfect for those seeking an intimate festival experience with diverse music from folk to electronic.

name: Appalachian String Band Music Festival
desc: Premier old-time music gathering featuring competitions, camping, and campfire jam sessions at Camp Washington-Carver.
details: Known simply as 'Clifftop,' this festival is the premier gathering for old-time string band music in America. Held at the historic Camp Washington-Carver in the mountains of West Virginia, it features competitions in fiddle, banjo, and string band, but the real magic happens at the all-night campfire jam sessions where hundreds of musicians gather to play.

name: Vesak Festival
desc: Buddhist festival with lantern displays (vesak koodu), alms-giving and illuminated streets.

name: Carnaval (nationwide; many coastal cities)
desc: Pre-Lent street parties, parades, costumes and music; biggest days align with Mardi Gras.

name: Gobi Desert Marathon & Festival
desc: Ultra-marathon through the Gobi Desert combined with nomadic cultural experiences.
details: The Gobi Desert Marathon combines extreme running through one of Earth's most remote landscapes with Mongolian cultural experiences. The route passes through dinosaur fossil sites, sand dunes, and nomadic settlements. Participants experience the raw beauty of the Gobi and the hospitality of herder families.

name: Darling Voorkamerfest
desc: Unique arts festival where residents open their living rooms as performance venues in the quaint town of Darling.
details: The Darling Voorkamerfest is a uniquely South African arts festival where residents of the charming West Coast town open their voorkamers (front rooms) as intimate performance venues. Artists perform everything from theatre to music in these domestic settings.

name: Detroit Jazz Festival
desc: The world's largest free jazz festival, held in downtown Detroit's Campus Martius and Hart Plaza.
details: Taking over several blocks of downtown Detroit, this four-day festival presents over 60 performances on four stages with no admission charge. The festival has featured legends like Herbie Hancock, Wayne Shorter, and Ron Carter, alongside rising artists. Its location in Detroit — a city with deep musical roots — adds cultural resonance.

name: Durga Puja (Bangladesh)
desc: Hindu festival with temples and pandals hosting rituals, music and community events.

name: Dublin Theatre Festival
desc: Ireland's premier theatre festival presenting world-class drama.
details: Dublin Theatre Festival presents the best of Irish and international theatre with premieres, co-productions, and acclaimed touring shows across the city's venues.

name: Edinburgh Science Festival
desc: One of Europe's largest science festivals with interactive exhibits and talks.
details: Edinburgh Science Festival makes science accessible and fun with interactive workshops, talks, exhibitions, and hands-on experiments for all ages.

name: Erfoud Date Festival
desc: A Saharan celebration of the date palm harvest with competitions, traditional culture, and camel racing in desert Erfoud.
details: Located in the Sahara region, this festival celebrates the date palm harvest with music, dancing, competitions, local culture, camel racing, and over 30 varieties of dates on display. It brings together communities from across the desert region and showcases the importance of date cultivation to the local economy and way of life.

name: Maggio Musicale Fiorentino
desc: Florence's prestigious music festival featuring opera, concerts, and ballet.
details: The Maggio Musicale Fiorentino presents opera, symphonic concerts, and ballet at the Teatro del Maggio, continuing a tradition dating to 1933 as one of Italy's most important music festivals.

name: Avignon Festival
desc: Avignon Festival — theater, dance, music
details: theater, dance, music

name: Bastille Festival
desc: French-themed winter festival celebrating Franschhoek's Huguenot heritage with food, wine, and entertainment.
details: The Bastille Festival embraces the village's French Huguenot heritage with French-themed food, fine wines, and vibrant street entertainment. This popular annual winter festival transforms Franschhoek into a slice of France in the heart of the Cape Winelands.

name: Sasquatch! Music Festival
desc: Iconic indie music festival at the Gorge Amphitheatre with one of the most spectacular natural backdrops in live music.
details: Set at the Gorge Amphitheatre overlooking the Columbia River Gorge, Sasquatch offers one of the most breathtaking concert settings in the world. The festival combines indie rock, electronic, hip-hop, and comedy performances across multiple stages with camping under the vast Washington sky.

name: Amani Festival
desc: Peace-themed music festival on the shores of Lake Kivu showcasing Congolese rumba, soukous, and contemporary acts.
details: Amani (meaning 'peace' in Swahili) brings together Congolese rumba and soukous, traditional drumming, and contemporary hip-hop/electronic acts in Goma near Lake Kivu. The festival promotes peace and reconciliation in a region affected by conflict, making it a powerful statement of resilience.

name: Goychay Pomegranate Festival
desc: UNESCO-recognized celebration of pomegranate culture with food, performances, and local traditions.
details: UNESCO Intangible Cultural Heritage celebration. Annual festival timing varies based on pomegranate harvest readiness. Features pomegranate-themed food, cultural performances, and local traditions.

name: Steirischer Herbst
desc: Graz's avant-garde arts festival pushing boundaries since 1968.
details: Steirischer Herbst (Styrian Autumn) presents experimental art, theatre, music, and film that challenges conventions, making Graz a hub for contemporary art discourse.

name: Rustival
desc: A boutique electronic festival at a former refugee camp on a remote Taiwanese island for dedicated techno purists.
details: Now entering its fifth year, Rustival is curated by passionate techno purists on a remote island that was formerly a refugee camp. The intimate setting focuses on high-quality underground electronic music, with regional and international DJs playing alongside local Hong Kong and Taiwanese talent. The experience is aimed at truly dedicated festivalgoers.

name: Guadalajara International Film Festival 2026
desc: 41st edition of major international film festival
details: Features independent and international cinema.

name: Haifa International Film Festival
desc: Major film festival in the mixed Arab-Jewish city of Haifa showcasing Israeli and international cinema.
details: Features diverse programming reflecting Haifa's multicultural character with Israeli, Palestinian, and international films.

name: Reeperbahn Festival
desc: Europe’s biggest club festival platform for pop culture, combining showcases and industry exchange.
details: Reeperbahn Festival turns Hamburg's legendary red-light district into a multi-venue showcase with 600+ concerts, readings, art, and film across 90+ venues and clubs.

name: Schützenfest Hannover
desc: The world's largest marksmen's festival and funfair, a tradition spanning nearly 500 years.
details: Hannover's Schützenfest features the world's longest funfair parade with over 10,000 participants, massive fairground rides, shooting competitions, and traditional festivities dating back to 1529.

name: Harare International Festival of the Arts (HIFA)
desc: Multi-disciplinary arts festival dubbed the Glastonbury of African festivals.
details: HIFA encompasses theatre, music, dance, fine art, and poetry over a week in Harare. Dubbed the Glastonbury of African festivals, it is an important healing space for Zimbabweans and shows a Zimbabwe that works to visitors. It ranks among the eight major festivals in Africa.

name: Somali Week Festival
desc: Week-long celebration of Somali art, music, poetry, and literature.
details: The Somali Week Festival celebrates Somali cultural heritage through art exhibitions, poetry readings, music performances, film screenings, and literary discussions. It provides a platform for Somali artists and writers from across the diaspora.

name: Shaker Village Craft Fair
desc: Traditional crafts demonstrations and sales at a restored Shaker community, celebrating American craft heritage.
details: Pleasant Hill Shaker Village hosts artisan demonstrations and sales showcasing traditional crafts in the beautifully preserved buildings of America's largest restored Shaker community. Visitors experience woodworking, weaving, blacksmithing, and other heritage crafts.

name: Harrogate Flower Show
desc: One of Britain's great horticultural shows featuring spectacular floral displays and show gardens.
details: The Harrogate Autumn Flower Show fills the Great Yorkshire Showground with award-winning gardens, giant vegetable competitions, celebrity gardeners, and flower arranging displays in a celebration of British gardening culture.

name: Helsinki Design Week
desc: The largest design festival in the Nordic countries, focusing on urbanism and daily life.
details: Integrating architecture, fashion, and product design, the festival engages citizens in discussions about how design can improve urban living. It reflects Finland's deeply ingrained societal appreciation for functional, democratic design.

name: Affordable Art Fair Hong Kong
desc: Asia's primary destination for entry-level contemporary collecting.
details: Provides a critical stepping stone for young Asian collectors, offering thousands of artworks priced between HK$1,000 and HK$100,000 in a highly engaging atmosphere.

name: Pitchfork Paris (connection) / Day for Night Houston
desc: Immersive art and music festival combining cutting-edge electronic and indie music with massive installations.
details: Houston's art and music scene hosts festivals combining cutting-edge electronic and indie music with massive light and art installations in industrial spaces, reflecting the city's growing cultural ambitions.

name: Vendimia (Ica grape harvest)
desc: Grape harvest celebrations featuring pisco culture, parades, and performances.

name: Wodaabe Gerewol (Niger)
desc: Male beauty contest where Wodaabe men wear makeup and compete for female attention through dance.
details: The Gerewol is the Wodaabe people's famous male beauty contest at the annual Cure Salee gathering. Young men spend hours applying red ochre face paint, kohl eyeliner, and elaborate jewelry before performing the Yaake dance, rolling their eyes and flashing white teeth to attract female judges.

name: Galungan & Kuningan
desc: Bali's most important Hindu celebration when ancestral spirits visit Earth, with streets adorned in spectacular penjor bamboo decorations.
details: Galungan celebrates the victory of dharma over adharma and occurs every 210 days in the Balinese calendar. The island transforms as families erect towering penjor (decorated bamboo poles) along every road, prepare elaborate offerings, and visit temples in their finest traditional dress. Kuningan, ten days later, marks the spirits' return to heaven with feasting and prayers.

name: Ismailia International Festival for Documentary & Short Films
desc: One of the oldest documentary film festivals in the Middle East and Africa.
details: Showcases documentary and short films from around the world with competitions, workshops, and industry events in the Suez Canal city.

name: 27th Izmir Intl Short Film Festival
desc: International short film festival celebrating the best short films from around the world.
details: Held annually showcasing the best short films from international filmmakers across competition and special screening sections.

name: Ethno-Festival Teskek Jjeek
desc: Celebration of Kyrgyz national traditions with sports, yurt-building, and folk performances.
details: Features sports competitions, yurt-building contests, folk performances, horseback games, crafts fair, and traditional Kyrgyz cuisine.

name: Festival de Jerez
desc: Premier flamenco and Spanish dance festival in the birthplace of flamenco.
details: Festival de Jerez presents the finest flamenco artists in the city considered the cradle of flamenco, with performances, workshops, and masterclasses.

name: Johannesburg Pride
desc: Africa's largest and longest-running LGBTQ+ pride celebration.
details: Johannesburg Pride is Africa's longest-running and largest LGBTQ+ pride event, with a colorful parade through the streets of Sandton or Johannesburg followed by concerts and festivities. South Africa is the only African country with constitutional protections for LGBTQ+ rights.

name: The Folklore Festival
desc: Heritage Month celebration of cultural connection through music, storytelling, and heritage preservation.
details: The Folklore Festival is a celebration of cultural connection and belonging through music, storytelling and heritage preservation during Heritage Month, headlined by the legendary Mahotella Queens. It honors South Africa's rich oral and musical traditions.

name: Bayimba International Festival
desc: Kampala's premier multi-arts festival featuring music, film, spoken word, and visual arts.
details: The Bayimba International Festival is Kampala's leading arts event, bringing together musicians, filmmakers, visual artists, and spoken word artists from across East Africa and internationally. It promotes contemporary African arts and provides a platform for emerging talent.

name: Kashgar Apricot Blossom Festival
desc: Spring celebration of apricot blossoms across the Yarkand River valleys with snow-capped mountain backdrops.
details: Spring celebration integrating flower appreciation, cuisine, culture, and folklore. Apricot blossoms bloom across Yarkand River and Taxkorgan River valleys. Snow-capped mountains, canyons, and expansive flower seas.

name: Tauron Nowa Muzyka
desc: Electronic and experimental music in Katowice's former mining district.
details: Tauron Nowa Muzyka presents cutting-edge electronic and experimental music in the post-industrial landscape of Katowice's Nikiszowiec mining district.

name: Kinshasa Rumba Night
desc: Vibrant nightly rumba music scene in Kinshasa's legendary bars and clubs.
details: Kinshasa, birthplace of Congolese rumba, comes alive every night with live music in clubs and bars across the city. From the legacy of Franco and OK Jazz to modern ndombolo, the Kinshasa rumba scene is one of Africa's most vibrant and enduring musical traditions.

name: Kotor Art Festival
desc: Performing arts festival in the UNESCO World Heritage town of Kotor.
details: KotorArt presents theatre, music, and visual arts in the stunning medieval bay town of Kotor, with performances in churches, squares, and fortification walls.

name: Unsound Festival
desc: Acclaimed festival of experimental and electronic music in Kraków.
details: Unsound presents cutting-edge electronic, experimental, and sound art in Kraków's unique venues—from underground caves to synagogues—with a focus on audio-visual experiences.

name: Jewish Culture Festival
desc: Celebration of Jewish culture in Kraków's historic Kazimierz quarter.
details: The Jewish Culture Festival fills Kazimierz—once the centre of Polish Jewish life—with klezmer music, film, art, workshops, and discussions culminating in the Shalom on Szeroka Street concert.

name: Umhlanga Reed Dance (South Africa Zulu)
desc: Zulu reed dance at the KwaZulu royal palace, distinct from the Eswatini version.
details: The Zulu Umhlanga ceremony at KwaNongoma is the South African counterpart to Eswatini's reed dance. Thousands of Zulu maidens present reeds to the Zulu monarch in a colorful display of cultural pride, virginity testing traditions, and community celebration.

name: Les Francofolies
desc: Celebration of French-language music in the Atlantic port of La Rochelle.
details: Les Francofolies brings the best of Francophone music—chanson, pop, rap, rock—to La Rochelle's scenic old port, championing French-language artists since 1985.

name: Flytime Fest
desc: Nigeria's biggest and longest-running indoor music festival at Eko Convention Center.
details: Flytime Fest returns for its 21st edition at the Eko Convention Center in Lagos. It is Nigeria's biggest and longest-running indoor music festival, featuring top African and international music acts over multiple nights.

name: Gidi Culture Festival
desc: Lagos's premier music and arts festival dubbed 'Coachella in Lagos' with top Afrobeats artists.
details: Gidi Culture Festival, co-founded by Chinedu Okeke and Oriteme Banigo, is often dubbed Coachella in Lagos. This one-day music and arts festival features top Afrobeats, hip-hop, and pop artists performing on the beach alongside art installations, food, and fashion.

name: Bachfest Leipzig
desc: Annual festival celebrating J.S. Bach in the city where he worked for 27 years.
details: Bachfest Leipzig presents 100+ events in the churches, concert halls, and venues where Bach himself performed, attracting Bach enthusiasts from around the world.

name: Zwarte Cross
desc: The Netherlands' largest festival combining music, motorsport, and comedy in rural Gelderland.
details: Zwarte Cross is a uniquely Dutch festival blending rock and pop music with motocross, monster trucks, and comedy performances. Over 220,000 visitors create a wild weekend atmosphere in the Dutch countryside.

name: Lijiang Snow Mountain Music Festival
desc: Electronic and world music festival at the foot of Jade Dragon Snow Mountain in the Naxi heartland.
details: The Lijiang Snow Mountain Music Festival combines electronic, world music, and Chinese indie acts at the stunning foot of Jade Dragon Snow Mountain (5,596m). The ancient Naxi culture city of Lijiang—a UNESCO World Heritage site—provides a unique festival setting where contemporary music meets one of China's most scenic and culturally rich destinations.

name: Liverpool Sound City
desc: Multi-venue music festival and conference showcasing new talent across Liverpool.
details: Sound City transforms Liverpool's Baltic Triangle with 300+ artists across 20+ venues, combining new music discovery with industry networking.

name: Lake Turkana Festival
desc: Cultural festival at the Jade Sea uniting diverse pastoralist communities of northern Kenya.
details: The Lake Turkana Festival brings together 14 communities from Kenya's remote north, including Turkana, Rendille, Samburu, El Molo, and Gabbra peoples. They showcase their distinct cultures through dance, music, and traditional arts on the shores of the world's largest desert lake.

name: Collect Art Fair London
desc: The leading international fair for contemporary craft and design.
details: Organized by the Crafts Council, Collect elevates materials like glass, ceramics, wood, and textiles to the highest levels of fine art collecting, challenging the traditional hierarchy of artistic mediums.

name: Clerkenwell Design Week 2026
desc: An annual design festival in London's Clerkenwell district celebrating architecture, interiors, and creative practice.
details: Clerkenwell Design Week activates showrooms, cultural venues, outdoor spaces, and workshops across the neighbourhood. Offers architects and designers insight into material innovation, spatial trends, and design thinking.

name: Felix Art Fair
desc: An intimate, hotel-based art fair at The Hollywood Roosevelt.
details: Prioritizes community and conversation over massive convention aesthetics, featuring galleries exhibiting around the hotel pool and suites, providing a relaxed counterpoint to Frieze LA.

name: Lubumbashi Biennale (8th edition)
desc: One of Africa's most experimental artistic events, exploring the library and archive of philosopher Valentin-Yves Mudimbe.
details: The 8th Lubumbashi Biennale, organized by Picha, takes as its starting point the library of Congolese philosopher Valentin-Yves Mudimbe, titled 'Towards an Antidote to Toxicity.' Open call for projects announced in 2025. Founded in 2008 as Rencontres Picha, it has become one of the most dynamic art events on the African continent.

name: Luxor Egyptian Marathon
desc: International marathon through ancient Egyptian monuments with over 36 nationalities participating.
details: The Egyptian Marathon in Luxor takes runners past the Valley of the Kings, Hatshepsut's Temple, and the Colossi of Memnon. With over 36 nationalities participating, it combines athletic achievement with one of the world's most extraordinary archaeological landscapes.

name: Art Fair Philippines
desc: An incredibly popular, locally-driven fair set in a multi-level carpark.
details: The fair transforms a brutalist parking structure into a vibrant showcase of Filipino contemporary art. It is famous for its massive public attendance, democratic atmosphere, and intense local pride.

name: Bahrain Food Festival
desc: Annual culinary celebration showcasing Bahraini and international cuisine with cooking competitions.
details: Features local restaurants, food trucks, cooking demonstrations, and cultural entertainment celebrating Bahrain's diverse food scene.

name: Manchester International Festival
desc: Biennial arts festival commissioning new works across music, theatre, and visual art.
details: MIF commissions original work from the world's leading artists across music, theatre, dance, and visual arts at venues across Manchester including Factory International.

name: Maralal Camel Festival
desc: Cultural festival featuring camel races, traditional Samburu music, and pastoralist celebrations.
details: The Maralal Festival celebrates the pastoralist cultures of northern Kenya with camel races, traditional Samburu and Turkana music and dance, warrior jumping competitions, and cultural exhibitions in the dramatic semi-arid landscape.

name: Caftan Fashion Show
desc: Premier showcase of Moroccan haute couture caftan designs by top designers.
details: The Caftan Fashion Show in Marrakech is a glamorous celebration of Moroccan fashion heritage, showcasing elaborate caftan designs by Morocco's top couturiers. Models parade in stunning handcrafted gowns embroidered with gold thread, silk, and precious stones.

name: Morocco International Comedy Festival
desc: International stand-up comedy festival in Marrakech featuring Arabic, French, and English comedians.
details: The Marrakech International Comedy Festival brings together comedians from Morocco, the Arab world, France, and internationally for stand-up performances in Marrakech's theatres and cultural venues.

name: Jemaa el-Fna Nightly Festival
desc: The world-famous nightly spectacle of storytellers, musicians, snake charmers, and food stalls.
details: Jemaa el-Fna, Marrakech's legendary main square, transforms nightly into one of the world's great cultural spectacles. A UNESCO Masterpiece of Oral and Intangible Heritage, it fills with storytellers, Gnawa musicians, acrobats, henna artists, snake charmers, and hundreds of food stalls serving traditional Moroccan cuisine.

name: Alegria Festival
desc: Electronic music festival in the desert outside Marrakech blending international DJs with Moroccan culture.
details: Alegria Festival brings international electronic music to the outskirts of Marrakech, with stages set against the Atlas Mountains. It combines world-class DJs with Moroccan hospitality, local cuisine, and desert camping for a unique fusion experience.

name: Melbourne Art Fair
desc: Australasia's premier commercial showcase for contemporary art and ideas.
details: Working in tandem with the region's biennials, this fair provides a strong commercial backbone for Australian and regional galleries, emphasizing solo presentations and large-scale installations.

name: Saharan Tent Music Sessions
desc: Live Gnawa and Berber music sessions in desert camps near the Erg Chebbi dunes.
details: Desert camps near the spectacular Erg Chebbi dunes of Merzouga offer nightly Gnawa and Berber music sessions around campfires under some of the clearest night skies in Africa. The combination of soaring dunes, starlight, and ancient music creates pure magic.

name: Feria del Libro Infantil y Juvenil
desc: Major children's and young adult book fair in Mexico City.
details: Mexico City's children's book fair celebrates literature for young readers with author visits, storytelling, workshops, theater performances, and exhibitions from publishers across the Spanish-speaking world.

name: AfriKin Art Fair
desc: A vital fair focused exclusively on contemporary African and Black diaspora art.
details: Occurring during Miami Art Week, AfriKin highlights the profound aesthetic and intellectual contributions of Black artists, providing a crucial counter-narrative to the overwhelmingly Euro-American blue-chip fairs.

name: Golden Mask Festival
desc: Russia's top theatre awards and festival showcasing the year's best productions.
details: The Golden Mask presents nominated productions from across Russia's theatrical world, from drama and opera to ballet and musical theatre.

name: Kilimanjaro Marathon
desc: Scenic marathon running in the shadow of Africa's highest peak, Mount Kilimanjaro.
details: The Kilimanjaro Marathon in Moshi attracts runners from around the world who race with the spectacular backdrop of Africa's highest peak. The route passes through Chagga villages and coffee plantations while Mt. Kilimanjaro towers above.

name: Tollwood Festival
desc: Munich's free culture and environmental festival in Olympiapark.
details: Tollwood runs twice yearly with free concerts, theatre, art, and a sustainable organic market. The summer edition in Olympiapark features world music, circus, and culinary delights.

name: Skulptur Projekte Münster
desc: A legendary decennial sculpture exhibition that transforms the city of Münster every ten years.
details: Skulptur Projekte Münster is held approximately every 10 years (1977, 1987, 1997, 2007, 2017). The next edition is expected in 2027. One of the most influential outdoor sculpture exhibitions globally, leaving permanent works throughout the city.

name: Hatch Show Print Block Party
desc: Celebration of the legendary Nashville letterpress print shop with live printing, music, and poster art.
details: Hatch Show Print, one of the oldest working letterpress shops in America (est. 1879), hosts this annual celebration of poster art and printmaking. Located in the Country Music Hall of Fame complex, the event features live printing demonstrations, local music, and the chance to see artisans create the iconic concert posters that have defined Nashville's music scene.

name: Biscuits and Jam Festival
desc: Nashville celebration of Southern cuisine and music with biscuit competitions and live performances.
details: Nashville's food and music scenes come together in celebrations of the iconic Southern biscuit, with competitions, tastings from top Nashville restaurants, and live country and Americana music. Represents the intersection of Nashville's two great passions.

name: Zorba Festival
desc: Ecstatic dance and movement festival in the Israeli desert combining music, dance, and wellness.
details: Features ecstatic dance, yoga, meditation, live music, and workshops in a desert setting focused on movement and mindfulness.

name: Festival del Bambuco (San Pedro)
desc: Regional folk festival with dance competitions and parades tied to Andean traditions.

name: Affordable Art Fair New York (Spring)
desc: Democratizing the art market with highly accessible price points.
details: Capping prices at $12,000, this fair successfully captures the millennial demographic, offering original contemporary works from local and international galleries in a low-pressure environment.

name: Outsider Art Fair New York
desc: The definitive fair for self-taught, visionary, and vernacular art.
details: Held at the Metropolitan Pavilion, this highly respected niche fair celebrates art created outside the boundaries of the traditional art-historical and academic canon.

name: Hideout Festival
desc: Electronic music festival on Zrće Beach with boat parties and club takeovers.
details: Hideout Festival transforms Croatia's famous Zrće Beach into a five-day electronic music paradise with beachside stages, boat parties, and late-night club sets.

name: Heilala Festival
desc: Tonga's premier cultural festival celebrating the King's birthday with dance, beauty pageants, and sailing.
details: The Heilala Festival is Tonga's largest annual event, held around the King's birthday in July. Named after Tonga's national flower, the week-long celebration features traditional dance performances, a beauty pageant, torch-lit flotillas, yacht races, and Tongan feasting.

name: Oaxaca Textile Museum Events
desc: Year-round textile exhibitions and demonstrations at the Museo Textil de Oaxaca.
details: The Museo Textil de Oaxaca hosts rotating exhibitions and cultural events celebrating the extraordinary weaving traditions of Oaxaca's indigenous communities.

name: Oaxaca Mezcal Festival
desc: Celebration of Oaxaca's artisanal mezcal tradition with tastings, tours, and educational programming.
details: Oaxaca is the heartland of mezcal production, and this festival celebrates the spirit's artisanal traditions with tastings from dozens of small-batch producers, distillery tours, educational seminars, pairing dinners, and cultural events exploring mezcal's deep connections to Oaxacan identity.

name: Ofala Festival
desc: Royal festival of the Obi of Onitsha featuring the king's public appearance in traditional regalia.
details: The Ofala Festival is a celebration of the Obi (king) of Onitsha's authority and heritage. The festival climaxes with the Obi's emergence in full royal regalia, accompanied by elaborate traditional dances, masquerades, and the ceremonial display of Igbo cultural artifacts.

name: Palm Springs International Film Festival
desc: A massive, star-studded event that heavily influences the Academy Awards race.
details: Held in the desert oasis favored by Hollywood elites, the festival focuses heavily on international feature film Oscar submissions. Its Film Awards Gala is a crucial, highly publicized stop on the awards season campaign trail.

name: Festival Primata (FLIP Complementary Program)
desc: Poetry presentations and pocket concerts accompanying FLIP literary festival programming.

name: Boi-Bumbá Festival
desc: Spectacular Amazonian folk festival where two rival ox teams compete at the 35,000-seat Bumbódromo.
details: On a remote Amazon River island, two teams — Caprichoso (blue) and Garantido (red) — compete over three nights with elaborate performances combining indigenous mythology, massive floats, thousands of dancers, and dramatic storytelling. The 35,000-seat Bumbódromo splits in half for the rivalry. Reached only by boat or small plane from Manaus.

name: Festival d'Automne à Paris
desc: Paris's major contemporary arts festival spanning four months.
details: Festival d'Automne presents cutting-edge theatre, dance, music, film, and visual arts across Parisian venues, championing international contemporary creation since 1972.

name: Salon du Chocolat
desc: World's largest chocolate festival with fashion show and tastings.
details: Salon du Chocolat at Porte de Versailles features a chocolate fashion show, 500+ exhibitors, workshops, and tastings from the world's finest chocolatiers and cocoa producers.

name: Pasadena Doo Dah Parade
desc: Irreverent parody of the Rose Parade featuring outrageous entries, satirical floats, and anarchic creativity.
details: The Occasional Pasadena Doo Dah Parade is the wacky, anything-goes antithesis of the stately Rose Parade. Featuring absurd entries, political satire, bizarre costumes, and marching kazoo bands, it celebrates creative anarchy and free expression. There are no corporate sponsors, no entry fees, and no judges — just pure fun.

name: Bluegrass Underground / The Caverns
desc: Unique concert series held 333 feet underground in a natural cave, featuring bluegrass, Americana, and roots music.
details: The Caverns in Grundy County, Tennessee presents live music 333 feet below ground in a spectacular natural cave amphitheater. The subterranean venue creates an acoustically extraordinary and visually stunning setting unlike any other music venue in the world. Artists from across bluegrass, Americana, and roots music perform in this otherworldly underground chamber.

name: Bon Odori Festival (Malaysia)
desc: Japanese-influenced summer dance festival with food stalls and community performances.

name: Perugia Chocolate Festival (Eurochocolate)
desc: Italy's largest chocolate festival with tastings, sculptures, and workshops.
details: Eurochocolate fills Perugia's historic centre with chocolate tastings, giant chocolate sculptures, live demonstrations, and workshops from Italy's and the world's finest chocolatiers.

name: Electric Daisy Carnival (EDC) Thailand
desc: The massive neon-drenched rave empire expands into the heart of Southeast Asia.
details: EDC brings its signature massive kinetic stage designs, fireworks, and theatrical performers to Phuket. It capitalizes on Thailand's legendary nocturnal party culture, merging global EDM with a massive tourist destination.

name: Pistoia Blues Festival
desc: Italy's premier blues festival since 1980 in Piazza del Duomo.
details: Pistoia Blues has hosted B.B. King, Buddy Guy, and ZZ Top in the stunning Piazza del Duomo, making it one of Europe's most respected blues events.

name: Malta Festival Poznań
desc: International theatre and performing arts festival in Poznań.
details: Malta Festival presents boundary-pushing theatre, dance, music, and visual arts from international and Polish artists in venues across Poznań.

name: High Sierra Music Festival
desc: Intimate mountain music festival in the Sierra Nevada featuring jam, funk, bluegrass, and Americana.
details: Nestled in the Plumas County Fairgrounds in the Sierra Nevada mountains, High Sierra brings together jam bands, funk, soul, bluegrass, and Americana artists in an intimate mountain setting. The festival's small size and remote location foster a tight-knit community of music lovers who return year after year.

name: Revelstoke Mountain Culture Festival
desc: Celebration of mountain culture with film, photography, and adventure storytelling in the Canadian Rockies.
details: Revelstoke hosts events celebrating mountain culture through adventure film screenings, photography exhibitions, speaker series, and community events that reflect the spirit of this mountain town in the heart of the Columbia Mountains.

name: Rheingau Musik Festival
desc: Classical music in Rhine Valley castles, churches, and monasteries.
details: The Rheingau Musik Festival presents 150+ concerts in stunning venues including Eberbach Monastery (of 'The Name of the Rose' fame) and Rhine Valley castles.

name: Uba Chants Ethnic Folk Festival
desc: Multicultural folk festival showcasing Kazakh, Russian, Uighur, and Dungan traditional performances.
details: Vibrant showcase of Kazakhstan's multiculturalism featuring traditional dances, choral performances, and music from Kazakh, Russian, Uighur, Dungan communities. Teams sing in Kazakh, Russian, Ukrainian, preserving the chanting legacy of old believers from Poland who moved to Rudny Altai 200 years ago.

name: King Abdulaziz Falconry Festival
desc: A global falconry event celebrating the ancient art of hunting with falcons through competitions and cultural programming.
details: Organized by the Saudi Falconry Club, this annual global event focuses on falconry, falcon protection, and celebration. It attracts falconers and hunting enthusiasts from across the GCC through traditional competitions such as al-Mallouah and Mazayen (beauty), reflecting the deep cultural importance of falconry in Arabian heritage.

name: Wacky Wine Weekend
desc: Family-friendly wine festival with tastings at over 40 estates and live music in Robertson Wine Valley.
details: The Wacky Wine Weekend in Robertson Wine Valley is a family-friendly wine festival featuring tastings at over 40 wine estates accompanied by live music, food stalls, and vineyard activities. It's one of the most accessible wine events in the Western Cape.

name: Xerox Rochester International Jazz Festival
desc: Nine-day jazz festival with 1,500+ musicians in 200+ shows across downtown Rochester venues.
details: The Rochester Jazz Festival has quickly become one of the premier jazz festivals in North America, featuring over 1,500 artists from around the world performing in clubs, theaters, and outdoor stages throughout downtown Rochester over nine days.

name: Ruhr Triennale
desc: Performing arts festival in the Ruhr's spectacular former industrial sites.
details: Ruhr Triennale transforms decommissioned coal mines, steelworks, and power stations into venues for theatre, music, dance, and installation art.

name: Festival International de Jazz de Saint-Louis
desc: One of Africa's most prestigious jazz events in the atmospheric UNESCO city of Saint-Louis.
details: The Saint-Louis Jazz Festival transforms this atmospheric UNESCO city on the Senegal River into a jazz paradise. International and African jazz musicians perform in colonial-era buildings, along the riverside, and in intimate courtyards over several magical nights.

name: San Francisco Art Fair
desc: A curatorial-focused fair highlighting Bay Area and global voices.
details: Produced by AMP and directed by Kelly Freeman and Nato Thompson, hosting 85 leading galleries and extensive public projects reflecting the experimental nature of the region.

name: International Festival of Santander
desc: Prestigious performing arts festival with concerts, opera, and dance.
details: The Festival Internacional de Santander presents classical music, ballet, and theatre in the Palacio de Festivales and open-air venues along the Cantabrian coast.

name: KEXP Concerts at the Mural
desc: Free summer concert series hosted by iconic radio station KEXP at the Mural Amphitheatre at Seattle Center.
details: KEXP, Seattle's beloved independent radio station, hosts free outdoor concerts throughout the summer at the Mural Amphitheatre. The curated lineups feature indie, world, and emerging artists, and the intimate outdoor setting captures the spirit of Seattle's music community.

name: Tango Festival
desc: Finland's unique Tango Festival celebrating the country's passionate tango tradition.
details: Finland has the highest number of tango dancers per capita. Seinäjoki's Tango Festival crowns the Tango King and Queen with passionate performances and mass tango dancing under the midnight sun.

name: Serengeti Cultural Festival
desc: Festival celebrating Maasai culture adjacent to the Serengeti with traditional dances and cattle ceremonies.
