details: The Serengeti Cultural Festival celebrates the Maasai communities living alongside one of Africa's greatest wildlife areas. It features traditional jumping dances, cattle ceremonies, beadwork exhibitions, storytelling, and demonstrations of Maasai warrior traditions.

name: Bienal de Flamenco
desc: World's premier flamenco festival held biennially in Seville.
details: The Bienal de Flamenco presents the finest flamenco artists across dance, guitar, and cante in Seville's theatres and outdoor venues, celebrating this UNESCO Intangible Heritage art form.

name: Shaoxing Yellow Rice Wine Festival
desc: Celebration of Shaoxing's 2,500-year-old yellow rice wine tradition—China's most famous rice wine.
details: Shaoxing's yellow rice wine (huangjiu) has been brewed for 2,500 years and is China's most celebrated rice wine. The festival features wine tastings, brewery visits, wine-pairing dinners, and traditional culture events in this atmospheric water town. Shaoxing is also the birthplace of writer Lu Xun.

name: Sharjah Biennial 16
desc: A leading platform for contemporary art in the Middle East, organized by the Sharjah Art Foundation.
details: The Sharjah Biennial, organized by Sharjah Art Foundation, is one of the most important recurring exhibitions in the Middle East. Previous editions have been major events on the global art calendar. Specific details for a 2026 edition are still being announced.

name: Festival Músicas do Mundo
desc: World music festival on the Alentejo coast where Vasco da Gama was born.
details: Festival Músicas do Mundo brings global music traditions to the historic port of Sines, birthplace of navigator Vasco da Gama, with free and ticketed performances on the castle and beach stages.

name: Hamptons Fine Art Fair
desc: The largest cultural event on the East End during peak summer.
details: Features a relaxed, sophisticated ambiance catering to immense seasonal wealth, strongly highlighting the Abstract Expressionist movement and its historical ties to the Hamptons.

name: Eid al-Fitr
desc: Spectacular Eid celebrations in the predominantly Muslim island of Zanzibar with communal feasting.
details: Eid al-Fitr in Zanzibar is celebrated with exceptional fervor in this predominantly Muslim island. Stone Town comes alive with communal prayers, festive markets, traditional Taarab music, elaborate feasts, and celebrations that spill into the narrow alleys and waterfront.

name: Newtown Festival
desc: Vibrant community fair celebrating the eclectic culture of Sydney's most diverse inner-city suburb.
details: The Newtown Festival transforms Camperdown Memorial Rest Park into a one-day celebration of Newtown's creative, diverse community. Live music across multiple stages, art, market stalls, food from dozens of cuisines, and a colourful parade reflect the suburb's bohemian spirit.

name: Tropfest
desc: World's largest short film festival with outdoor screenings and celebrity judges.
details: Tropfest is the world's largest short film festival, presenting finalists' films on giant outdoor screens to audiences of thousands. Launched in a Sydney cafe in 1993, it has become a launching pad for filmmakers and a beloved free cultural event.

name: Taos Solar Music Festival
desc: Solar-powered music festival in the high desert of Taos celebrating sustainability and diverse music.
details: The Taos Solar Music Festival is powered entirely by photovoltaic solar panels and features an eclectic mix of rock, blues, world, and electronic music in the stunning high desert setting of Kit Carson Park. The festival combines great music with environmental consciousness.

name: Taraz Fest
desc: Celebration of Taraz's 2,000+ year history as an ancient Silk Road trading hub.
details: Vibrant celebration of Taraz's history, culture, traditions featuring historical reenactments, traditional music/dance performances, and authentic Kazakh cuisine. Showcases the ancient Silk Road trading hub's heritage.

name: Farm Aid
desc: Annual benefit concert founded by Willie Nelson, Neil Young, and John Mellencamp supporting family farmers.
details: Farm Aid is an annual benefit concert featuring its founding board members Willie Nelson, Neil Young, John Mellencamp, and Dave Matthews along with guest artists. Beyond music, the event includes a HOMEGROWN Village showcasing sustainable farming practices and farm-fresh food.

name: Tbilisi Art Fair
desc: A crucial platform for contemporary art from the Caucasus and Eastern Europe.
details: TAF shines a spotlight on the fiercely independent and politically engaged art scene of Georgia, serving as a hub for artists and collectors from a region historically underserved by major Western fairs.

name: Old Settler's Music Festival
desc: Texas Hill Country roots music festival featuring Americana, folk, blues, and gospel under the stars.
details: Set in the scenic Texas Hill Country, Old Settler's is a beloved camping festival featuring top Americana, folk, blues, and roots artists. The laid-back atmosphere, excellent sound quality, and communal camping experience under vast Texas skies make it a favorite for music purists.

name: Timbuktu Literary Festival
desc: Celebration of Timbuktu's scholarly heritage and the legendary ancient manuscripts.
details: Timbuktu's literary heritage is celebrated through events focusing on the city's hundreds of thousands of ancient manuscripts dating from the 13th century. The festival features lectures, manuscript exhibitions, and discussions about African intellectual history.

name: Timbuktu Manuscripts Festival
desc: Festival celebrating Timbuktu's legendary scholarly heritage and ancient manuscripts.
details: The Timbuktu Manuscripts Festival celebrates the legendary scholarly heritage of this UNESCO World Heritage city, which houses hundreds of thousands of ancient manuscripts dating from the 13th century. The festival features lectures, exhibitions, cultural performances, and guided tours of manuscript libraries.

name: Feria del Alfeñique
desc: Sweets, sugar skulls, and seasonal crafts market tied to Day of the Dead traditions.

name: Festival Puccini
desc: Opera festival celebrating Puccini including the centenary of Turandot.
details: Festival Puccini at Torre del Lago presents Puccini's greatest operas including the centenary celebration of Turandot, with world-class singers including Jonas Kaufmann.

name: Midnight Sun Marathon
desc: Marathon run under the midnight sun in the Arctic.
details: The world's northernmost marathon takes place under 24-hour daylight, with runners circling the island of Tromsøya in spectacular Arctic scenery.

name: Bukta Open Air Festival
desc: Rock-driven festival by the sea in Arctic Tromsø, offering stunning views and midnight sun vibes.
details: Set by the sea in the Arctic city of Tromsø, Bukta offers stunning coastal views, midnight sun vibes, and a relaxed yet energetic rock-driven atmosphere. The combination of world-class rock music and Arctic summer light creates an unforgettable experience.

name: Tunisian Medina Festival
desc: A festival in the Tunis municipal theater during Ramadan featuring international films, musical performances, and religious ceremonies.
details: Held during the Muslim holy month of Ramadan in the municipal theater of Tunis, this festival features international film screenings, musical performances, and cultural events that complement the religious ceremonies. It livens up the holy month with arts and entertainment that respect the spiritual atmosphere.

name: Carthage Film Festival (JCC)
desc: One of Africa's oldest and most prestigious film festivals founded in 1966.
details: The Journées Cinématographiques de Carthage, founded in 1966, is one of the oldest film festivals in Africa and the Arab world. It celebrates cinema from Africa, Asia, and Latin America, championing voices from the Global South.

name: Splashy Fen Music Festival
desc: South Africa's oldest outdoor music festival in the Drakensberg mountains.
details: Splashy Fen is South Africa's oldest outdoor music festival, held in the stunning Drakensberg mountains near Underberg since 1990. It features a diverse lineup of folk, rock, electronic, and African music alongside hiking, mountain biking, and camping.

name: Viña Rock
desc: Spain's largest rock and alternative music festival, attracting a massive young crowd.
details: Viña Rock draws over 200,000 rock, punk, ska, reggae, and electronic music fans to the flatlands of Castilla-La Mancha for three days of non-stop live music across multiple stages.

name: Lovefest
desc: Electronic music festival in Serbia's most popular spa town.
details: Lovefest brings techno, house, and electronic music to the resort town of Vrnjačka Banja, creating an unusual juxtaposition of spa culture and rave.

name: Walla Walla Sweet Onion Festival
desc: Quirky celebration of the famous Walla Walla Sweet Onion with cooking contests, music, and onion-themed fun.
details: This charming small-town festival celebrates the region's prized sweet onions with cooking contests, eating competitions, live music, craft vendors, and family activities. The festival showcases the agricultural pride of the Walla Walla Valley in a warm community atmosphere.

name: Muskoka Chautauqua
desc: Summer ideas festival in Ontario's cottage country combining arts, culture, and intellectual programming.
details: Muskoka Chautauqua presents speakers, performances, and workshops in the beautiful lake setting of Ontario's Muskoka region, inspired by the original Chautauqua movement.

name: Winnipeg Music Festival
desc: One of Canada's oldest performing arts competitions featuring classical music, voice, and speech arts.
details: The Winnipeg Music Festival is one of the oldest performing arts competitions in Canada, with young musicians and vocalists competing across classical music, speech arts, and choral categories.

name: Winter Park Jazz Festival
desc: High-altitude jazz festival at 9,000 feet in the Rocky Mountains featuring top jazz artists.
details: Set at 9,000 feet elevation at Hideaway Park, the Winter Park Jazz Festival presents top national jazz acts against a backdrop of snow-capped peaks. The intimate alpine setting and world-class musicianship make this a highlight of Colorado's summer festival season.

name: Jorvik Viking Festival
desc: Viking heritage festival with combat reenactments, crafts, and living history.
details: The JORVIK Viking Festival brings York's Norse heritage to life with Viking combat reenactments, saga readings, living history encampments, and the legendary Strongest Viking competition.

name: Ten Days on the Island
desc: Tasmania's biennial international arts festival presenting global art, music, and performance across the island.
details: Ten Days on the Island is Tasmania's premier international arts festival, presenting works by Tasmanian, Australian, and international artists in venues across the island. The program spans theatre, dance, music, visual arts, film, and literature.

name: Krampusnacht
desc: Terrifying Alpine tradition where Krampus demons roam the streets.
details: On the night before St. Nicholas Day, fearsome Krampus figures in elaborate demon masks and fur costumes parade through towns chasing and swatting bystanders with birch branches.

name: Gelede Masquerade Festival
desc: UNESCO-listed Yoruba masquerade honoring female ancestors and the power of mothers.
details: The Gelede masquerade, inscribed on UNESCO's Intangible Heritage list, uses elaborate carved masks and costumes to honor the spiritual powers of women, especially elderly women known as 'our mothers.' Performances feature satirical commentary on social issues through song, dance, and spectacle.

name: Tswana Dikgafela Harvest Festival
desc: Traditional Tswana first-fruits ceremony thanking ancestors for the harvest.
details: Dikgafela is the traditional Tswana harvest thanksgiving festival where communities present the first fruits of the harvest to their chief. It features traditional Tswana music, dance, communal feasting, and prayers of thanksgiving to ancestors.

name: Dia de Tiradentes (April 21)
desc: National commemorative day honoring Tiradentes, executed in 1792, celebrating Brazilian independence and freedom ideals.
details: Tiradentes' Day on April 21 commemorates the execution of Joaquim José da Silva Xavier (Tiradentes), a national hero who became a symbol of courage and the struggle for liberty. He was hanged on April 21, 1792, for leading the Inconfidência Mineira, a rebellion against Portuguese colonial rule. The day features patriotic ceremonies and public events across Brazil with schools and most businesses closed, celebrating Brazilian independence and freedom.

name: Chinese New Year (Spring Festival)
desc: The world's largest annual human migration and celebration marking the Lunar New Year with fireworks, dragon dances, and family reunions.
details: China's biggest and most iconic festival marks the beginning of the Year of the Horse. Streets glow with red decorations, temple fairs come alive with performances and food, and cities transform with dragon dances and fireworks. Beijing's temple fairs, Xi'an's lantern displays, and Guangzhou's flower markets are especially spectacular. Over 3 billion trips are made during the Spring Festival travel rush.

name: Diwali Fiji
desc: Festival of Lights celebrated by Fiji's significant Hindu community with fireworks, prayers, and feasting.
details: Diwali is a major celebration in Fiji, reflecting the country's large Indo-Fijian Hindu population. The Festival of Lights features prayers, oil lamp ceremonies, fireworks, feasting, and cultural performances. It is a national public holiday in Fiji.

name: Diwali
desc: The Hindu Festival of Lights.
details: Celebrated by millions lighting diyas, setting off fireworks, and exchanging gifts to signify spiritual light.

name: Feast of Saint Rosalia
desc: Feast of Saint Rosalia — "U Fistinu"), Palermo, Sicily (huge processions on last two days; fireworks on July 14
details: "U Fistinu"), Palermo, Sicily (huge processions on last two days; fireworks on July 14

name: Kwanzaa Celebrations (East Africa)
desc: Pan-African holiday celebrations adopted by some East African communities and diaspora visitors.
details: Kwanzaa celebrations in East Africa attract diaspora visitors and local Pan-Africanist communities who celebrate the seven principles (Nguzo Saba) through candle-lighting ceremonies, cultural performances, storytelling, and communal feasting.

name: Pirecua Festival
desc: Celebration of pirecua, the UNESCO-recognized Purepecha song tradition unique to Michoacan.
details: The pirecua is a traditional song form of the Purepecha indigenous people of Michoacan, recognized by UNESCO as an Intangible Cultural Heritage. Festivals celebrating this tradition feature performances in the Purepecha language, traditional instruments, and community gatherings in lakeside villages.

name: Día de Reyes (Three Kings Day) Celebrations 2026
desc: National celebration honoring Three Wise Men with gift-giving and Rosca de Reyes bread
details: Not official public holiday but widely celebrated, especially by families. Night of Jan 5: children place shoes by door/tree. Morning of Jan 6: toys, sweets, gifts. Families gather for Rosca de Reyes (round sweet bread with hidden baby figurines). Finder hosts tamales celebration on Feb 2 (Día de la Candelaria).

name: Aïd el-Kébir (Eid al-Adha Morocco)
desc: Morocco's most important religious celebration with family gatherings and traditional lamb feast.
details: Eid al-Adha (Aïd el-Kébir) is Morocco's most significant religious holiday. Families gather for communal prayers and the ritual sacrifice of a sheep. The celebration spans several days of family visits, feasting on traditional dishes like mrouzia and mechoui, and charitable giving.

name: La Candelaria
desc: La Candelaria — Candlemas), across Spain but particularly big in Madrid (processions, pageantry, mock bull fights
details: Candlemas), across Spain but particularly big in Madrid (processions, pageantry, mock bull fights

name: 27th Alexandria Biennale
desc: Returning after a 12-year hiatus, focusing on the Mediterranean basin.
details: Curated by the artist Moataz Nasr, the show takes as its title 'This Too Shall Pass', and will feature artists mainly from the Mediterranean basin, with performances, music and lectures running alongside the exhibition across historical venues.

name: International Shyrdak Festival
desc: UNESCO-recognized festival of traditional felt carpet making in the high-altitude Naryn region.
details: UNESCO-recognized celebration of traditional felt carpet (shyrdak and ala-kiyiz) making featuring master classes, craftspeople competitions, exhibitions, and traditional cuisine. Organized by Crafts Council of Kyrgyzstan.

name: Affordable Art Fair Austin
desc: The third edition of the fair penetrating the booming Texas market.
details: A strategic expansion to capture the tech-driven wealth of Austin, showcasing diverse original contemporary artworks tailored to a new demographic of young buyers.

name: Festes de Gràcia
desc: Barcelona's most charming neighbourhood festival where residents transform streets into fantastical worlds.
details: Each August, the residents of Gràcia compete to create the most elaborately decorated street. Using recycled materials, they transform entire blocks into underwater worlds, jungles, space stations, and more. Live music and dancing fill every corner.

name: International Truffle Festival Buzet
desc: Istrian truffle celebration featuring the world's largest truffle omelette.
details: Buzet's truffle festival features the preparation of a giant truffle omelette in the main square using 2,000+ eggs and truffles, plus tastings, markets, and culinary workshops.

name: Petronio Álvarez Pacific Music Festival
desc: Major festival of Afro-Colombian Pacific music, dance, and gastronomy.

name: Design Week South Africa Cape Town
desc: The coastal iteration of the national design week, emphasizing sustainability and lifestyle.
details: Leaning into Cape Town's natural beauty, the focus here is often on eco-conscious design, luxury interiors, and the integration of the built environment with the dramatic coastal landscape.

name: The Other Art Fair Dallas
desc: An accessible, artist-direct fair returning to the Dallas Market Hall.
details: Challenges elitism by featuring 135 independent artists, interactive installations, and unique collaborations like the Balcones Distilling artist residency program.

name: Rocking the Daisies
desc: Eco-friendly outdoor music festival near Cape Town featuring rock, electronic, and hip-hop.
details: Rocking the Daisies is one of South Africa's premier outdoor music festivals, held on Cloof Wine Estate near Darling. Known for its eco-friendly practices, it features a diverse lineup of rock, electronic, hip-hop, and indie acts alongside camping and outdoor activities.

name: Rubaiya Qatar Quadriennial
desc: The inaugural quadrennial cementing Qatar's museum supremacy.
details: A sprawling, highly funded initiative designed to showcase major international contemporary art, further diversifying the Gulf nation's economy through massive cultural tourism.

name: Ghardaia Carpet Festival
desc: Traditional carpet exhibition and festival in the UNESCO-listed M'zab Valley.
details: The Ghardaia Carpet Festival celebrates the ancient carpet-weaving traditions of the M'zab Valley's Mozabite Berber communities. The UNESCO World Heritage setting of Ghardaia provides a stunning backdrop for exhibitions, demonstrations, and sales of traditional hand-woven carpets.

name: Fiesta de Cascamorras
desc: Fiesta de Cascamorras — both near Granada; "battle" between rival towns involving liberal throwing of paint
details: both near Granada; "battle" between rival towns involving liberal throwing of paint

name: Guam Micronesia Island Fair
desc: Festival celebrating the diverse cultures of Micronesia with traditional performances, food, and crafts.
details: The Guam Micronesia Island Fair brings together representatives from across Micronesia — Palau, FSM, Marshall Islands, and the Marianas — for a celebration of their diverse cultures through traditional dance, food, handicrafts, and storytelling.

name: Design Week South Africa Joburg
desc: Johannesburg's dedicated week for architectural, interior, and product design.
details: Reflecting the gritty, industrial aesthetic of the city, the week focuses on raw materials, urban regeneration projects, and the unique challenges of designing for a rapidly expanding African metropolis.

name: Kallaste Fish & Onion Fair
desc: Charming lakeside festival celebrating the renowned Peipus onion and Lake Peipsi's fishing culture.
details: Every August, the lakeside town of Kallaste transforms into a bustling late-summer festival celebrating the famous Peipus onion and local fishing traditions. A marketplace features local produce, while a diverse cultural programme includes handicraft workshops, traditional cookery demonstrations, boat trips on the lake, and children's entertainment.

name: Arabian Horse Show
desc: Africa's largest Arabian horse show featuring a 5,000-year-old breed heritage with racing, shows, and a craft fair.
details: No known horse breed has a longer history than the 5,000-year-old Arabian horses showcased during this June festival. The ancestors of today's Arabian horses carried conquering armies across ancient Mesopotamia. The event features horse racing, an international show, and a craft fair with artisans from across Tunisia.

name: Ashanti Funeral Celebrations
desc: Elaborate Ashanti funeral ceremonies with traditional music, drumming, and colorful kente cloth.
details: Ashanti funerals are among the most elaborate cultural celebrations in West Africa. Mourners wear distinctive black and red kente cloth, fontomfrom drums create thunderous rhythms, and the entire community participates in days-long celebrations of the deceased's life. They are an important part of Ashanti social life.

name: Blue Water Film Festival
desc: An environmental film festival highlighting stories at the intersection of water, innovation, and human impact.
details: The festival presents features and shorts focused on ocean conservation and climate awareness. In 2026, it honors marine conservationist Dr. Janet Gibson and humanitarian Jon Rose with prestigious eco-awards.

name: Alasitas Fair
desc: Miniature goods market celebrating Ekeko; blessings for prosperity.

name: Design Week Lagos
desc: A major showcase of West African design talent and architectural innovation.
details: As Lagos rapidly expands, DWL highlights indigenous architectural solutions, sustainable materials, and the booming Nigerian luxury design market, providing a critical counter-narrative to Western design dominance.

name: Gritería Chiquita
desc: Call-and-response celebrations with candies and fireworks honoring the Virgin Mary.

name: Swaziland Cultural Village Experience
desc: Traditional Swazi homestead experiences with cultural demonstrations, dancing, and traditional cuisine.
details: The Mantenga Cultural Village offers weekly cultural experience days where visitors can immerse themselves in traditional Swazi life, including sibhaca dancing, traditional cooking, brewing of marula beer, and learning about Swazi customs and beliefs in a reconstructed homestead.

name: Levitt Shell Summer Concerts
desc: Free concert series in Overton Park's historic shell where Elvis first performed in 1954.
details: The Levitt Shell in Memphis's Overton Park — where Elvis Presley gave his first paid concert in 1954 — hosts a free summer concert series featuring diverse musical genres. This historic bandshell in a beautiful park setting offers a magical Memphis music experience.

name: Milan Design Week (Fuorisalone)
desc: The city-wide celebration of design occurring simultaneously with the Salone del Mobile.
details: Fuorisalone features thousands of installations, pop-ups, and parties in palazzi, courtyards, and industrial spaces across Milan. It is the ultimate global gathering for designers, architects, and brands to showcase experiential, avant-garde concepts.

name: Stihia Electronic Music Festival
desc: Electronic music and art festival on the surreal ship graveyard of the dried Aral Sea.
details: Festival of electronic music, art, and science held on the post-apocalyptic ship 'graveyard' of the dried Aral Sea. Features #BackToMuynak Open Deck and Lighthouse Open Deck stages with electronic music, live performances, and artists selected through open calls. Conceived to contribute to revival of Muynak through art, science, and cultural unity.

name: Festival de las Bolas de Fuego
desc: Traditional ‘fireball’ tossing event commemorating a volcanic eruption legend.

name: Innibos Arts Festival
desc: Lowveld arts festival with Afrikaans music, theatre, and children's entertainment near Kruger Park.
details: Innibos is the Lowveld's premier arts festival held in Nelspruit (Mbombela), gateway to the Kruger National Park. It features Afrikaans music, theatre, dance, comedy, children's entertainment, and artisan markets in the subtropical setting of Mpumalanga.

name: Fridge Art Fair
desc: A radically inclusive fair operating under the mission 'Art is for everyone.'
details: Utilizing pop-up spaces like doggie daycares and thrift shops, explicitly encouraging LGBTQ+ artists and providing a chaotic, joyous alternative to corporate mega-fairs.

name: The American Art Fair
desc: Focused exclusively on American art from the 19th and 20th centuries.
details: Held at the Bohemian National Hall, featuring masterworks by artists such as Andrew Wyeth and Thomas Hart Benton, drawing specialized historical collectors.

name: Oppikoppi
desc: Iconic South African rock and alternative music festival in the bushveld.
details: Oppikoppi is one of South Africa's most legendary music festivals, held in the dusty bushveld near Northam in Limpopo. Known for its raw, unpretentious atmosphere, it features rock, electronic, hip-hop, and alternative acts across multiple stages.

name: Fiestas de la Calle San Sebastián
desc: Huge Old San Juan street festival with music, vejigante masks, artisan stalls, and parades.

name: Carnival
desc: Colonial streets fill with frevo dancers and bonecos gigantes (giant puppets).

name: Chamberfest (Ottawa International Chamber Music Festival)
desc: The world's largest chamber music festival, held in historic venues across Canada's capital.
details: Chamberfest is the world's largest chamber music festival, presenting over 90 concerts in stunning venues including churches, museums, and the National Gallery of Canada. The festival features internationally acclaimed ensembles and soloists performing classical, contemporary, and cross-genre works.

name: La Nuit Blanche
desc: Paris stays up all night for a free citywide contemporary art festival transforming iconic spaces.
details: On the first Saturday of October, Paris opens its museums, galleries, parks, and public buildings for free art installations, performances, and projections from dusk till dawn. The concept has spread to over 30 cities worldwide.

name: Fête des Vendanges de Montmartre
desc: Annual grape harvest celebration in historic Montmartre.
details: The Montmartre Grape Harvest Festival celebrates the tiny Clos Montmartre vineyard with parades, wine tastings, art exhibitions, and concerts in the artistic quarter.

name: Royal Ploughing Ceremony
desc: Traditional ceremony marking the start of the rice-growing season with auspicious predictions.

name: Aardklop National Arts Festival
desc: Major Afrikaans arts and culture festival with theatre, music, dance, and visual arts.
details: Aardklop is one of South Africa's major Afrikaans arts and culture festivals held annually in Potchefstroom. It features a rich programme of theatre, cabaret, music, dance, and visual arts, attracting performers and audiences from across the country.

name: Fiestas de Noviembre
desc: Month-long coastal festivities including international surf competitions and coastal Guelaguetza.
details: Combines beach culture with Oaxacan traditions. Includes the International Zicatela Mexican Pro surf competition, a coastal Guelaguetza performance, motocross, and fishing tournaments. Transforms this surf town into a cultural hub.

name: Réveillon (New Year’s) Copacabana
desc: All-night beachfront concert and fireworks one of the world’s largest NYE crowds.

name: Giant Lantern Festival
desc: Competition of giant illuminated lanterns (parols), a hallmark Christmas spectacle.

name: Startup Art Fair San Francisco
desc: A hotel-based fair providing direct access to unrepresented artists.
details: Transforming the Hotel Del Sol into an immersive gallery space, offering an unpretentious environment for discovering bold new works during SF's primary art weekend.

name: Openair St. Gallen
desc: Switzerland's oldest open-air music festival since 1977.
details: Openair St. Gallen presents rock, pop, and indie music in the Sittertobel canyon, a unique natural amphitheatre that has hosted legendary performances since 1977.

name: Stavanger Nuart Festival
desc: One of the world's leading street art festivals, transforming Stavanger's walls into gallery spaces.
details: Nuart invites international street artists to create large-scale murals and installations across Stavanger. The festival includes talks, workshops, films, and guided walks of the city's growing outdoor gallery.

name: Odambea Festival
desc: Northern Ghanaian celebration marking the birth of Prophet Muhammad with horseback durbars and drumming.
details: The Damba Festival is celebrated by the Dagomba, Mamprusi, Gonja, and other peoples of northern Ghana. It marks the birth and naming of Prophet Muhammad with spectacular horseback durbars, traditional drumming and dancing, and displays of chiefly regalia and authority.

name: Victoria International Jazz Festival (JazzFest Victoria)
desc: Multi-day jazz festival in BC's capital city with concerts across downtown Victoria venues.
details: TD Victoria International JazzFest presents over 300 musicians in 80+ concerts across downtown Victoria venues and outdoor stages. The festival combines world-class jazz with the charm of BC's garden city capital.

name: Chang'e 7 Lunar Launch
desc: Chinese lunar south pole exploration mission.
details: Deploys an orbiter, lander, rover, and hopping robot to hunt for water ice in permanently shadowed craters.

name: Whistler Film Festival
desc: Mountain resort film festival screening Canadian and international films in a world-class ski village.
details: The Whistler Film Festival combines independent cinema with the stunning setting of a world-class mountain resort. The festival screens Canadian and international films alongside industry panels, talent programs, and networking events in the village of Whistler.

name: Pow Wow Trail (Canadian Prairies)
desc: Series of powwows across the Canadian prairies celebrating First Nations culture.
details: The Canadian prairie provinces host dozens of powwows throughout the summer, with First Nations communities from Manitoba, Saskatchewan, and Alberta gathering for traditional dance competitions, drumming, and cultural celebrations. Major events include the Manito Ahbee Festival.

name: Gerewol Festival
desc: Extraordinary celebration where Wodaabe men compete in elaborate beauty contests to attract female partners.
details: Each year the semi-nomadic Mbororo/Wodaabe people gather for a week of incredible celebrations. Young men decorate themselves with makeup, jewelry, and elaborate costumes, performing the Yaake dance while displaying wide eyes and white teeth to attract young women who choose their partners.

name: Independence Day celebrations
desc: Parades and civic celebrations marking independence.

name: Mittelalterlich Phantasie Spectaculum
desc: Europe's largest travelling medieval festival, bringing history vividly to life across Germany.
details: MPS tours German cities with a massive medieval market featuring jousting knights, fire breathers, medieval crafts, period-accurate food, mead, and live medieval and folk-rock music. Each location creates an authentic time-travel experience.

name: Independence Day celebrations
desc: Marching bands and civic parades across the country.

name: Giro d'Italia (Festival Atmosphere)
desc: Italy's grand cycling tour creates festival atmosphere in every town it passes through.
details: Each stage start and finish of the Giro d'Italia creates a massive street festival with music, food, and celebration as the peloton passes through Italy's most scenic roads.

name: Cherry Blossom Festival (Hanami)
desc: Japan's iconic thousand-year-old tradition of celebrating the arrival of spring under blooming cherry trees.
details: Hanami is practiced nationwide with peak blooming dates varying by latitude. Top locations include Ueno Park and Shinjuku Gyoen in Tokyo, Maruyama Park in Kyoto, and Osaka Castle Park. Japanese families and friends gather under the blossoms for picnics with sake, bento boxes, and traditional sweets. Evening illuminations (yozakura) create a magical atmosphere.

name: Eid al-Fitr (Morocco)
desc: End of Ramadan celebrations across Morocco with communal prayers, feasting, and family gatherings.
details: Eid al-Fitr in Morocco is one of the most important celebrations in the kingdom. Families gather for communal prayers, prepare elaborate feasts, exchange gifts, and celebrate with music and festivities. Each region adds its own cultural flavor to the celebrations.

name: New Yam Festival (Iri Ji)
desc: Igbo harvest celebration marking the end of one growing season and the beginning of another.
details: The New Yam Festival (Iri Ji or Iwa Ji) is one of the most important Igbo celebrations, marking the end of one growing season and the beginning of another. Yams are central to Igbo culture and diet. The festival involves thanking the earth goddess Ani and ancestors for a successful harvest through dancing, masquerades, and feasting.

name: Eid al-Adha (Nigeria)
desc: Major Islamic celebration across Nigeria with prayers, animal sacrifice, and community feasting.
details: Eid al-Adha in Nigeria is marked by communal prayers, the ritual sacrifice of rams, and community feasting. In the north, it coincides with spectacular Durbar festivals. In the south, Muslim communities celebrate with family gatherings and charitable giving.

name: Cow Ball
desc: Cow Ball — Kraviji Bal), on Lake Bohinj in Ukanc (procession of decorated cows, with traditional alpine sports, dancing, music, costumes
details: Kraviji Bal), on Lake Bohinj in Ukanc (procession of decorated cows, with traditional alpine sports, dancing, music, costumes

name: Melodifestivalen
desc: Sweden's beloved national music competition to select its Eurovision Song Contest entry, held across the country.
details: Melodifestivalen is a pop culture institution in Sweden. Five qualifying rounds travel to different cities before the grand finale in Stockholm. Expect glitter, feather boas, and an inclusive, enthusiastic atmosphere. The competition has launched global pop careers since ABBA's era and draws millions of TV viewers.

name: Festa Junina (Brazilian Festival - US)
desc: Brazilian harvest festival celebrations in US cities with significant Brazilian diaspora communities.
details: Brazilian communities across the US celebrate Festa Junina with traditional quadrilha dancing, forro music, typical foods like canjica and pao de queijo, bonfires, and colorful decorations. Major celebrations occur in cities with large Brazilian populations like Newark, Boston, and Miami.

name: Ake Arts and Book Festival
desc: Literary and arts festival celebrating African literature, art, and culture in Abeokuta.
details: The Ake Arts and Book Festival, founded by novelist Lola Shoneyin, is one of Africa's most prestigious literary events. Held in Abeokuta, the birthplace of Wole Soyinka, it features author readings, panel discussions, art exhibitions, film screenings, and musical performances.

name: Festival International du Rire d'Abidjan
desc: International comedy festival in Abidjan featuring African and French comedians.
details: The International Comedy Festival of Abidjan is one of Francophone Africa's biggest comedy events, bringing together comedians from across Africa and the French-speaking world for stand-up, sketch comedy, and improv performances.

name: DISCOP Africa
desc: Major African entertainment content market for film, TV, and digital media.
details: DISCOP Africa is the continent's largest entertainment content market, bringing together broadcasters, producers, distributors, and digital platforms from across Africa. It is a key venue for deals in African film, television, and streaming content.

name: Festival des Grillades d'Abidjan
desc: Massive street food festival celebrating Ivorian grilling culture and braised dishes.
details: The Festival des Grillades (Festival of Grills) in Abidjan is a celebration of Côte d'Ivoire's legendary braised and grilled food culture. Street vendors, restaurants, and chefs compete to serve the best grilled fish, chicken, and meats alongside attiéké and alloco.

name: Accra Bookworm Festival
desc: Literary festival celebrating Ghanaian and West African literature and storytelling.
details: The Accra Bookworm Festival brings together Ghanaian and West African authors for readings, discussions, and workshops celebrating the region's rich literary tradition from Ama Ata Aidoo to contemporary voices.

name: Toukoul Literary Festival
desc: Ethiopian literary festival featuring African authors, poetry, and book discussions.
details: The Toukoul Literary Festival brings together Ethiopian and international authors for readings, panel discussions, poetry performances, and workshops. It highlights Ethiopia's rich literary tradition and the growing contemporary African literature scene.

name: Ethiopian Honey Wine (Tej) Festival
desc: Celebration of Ethiopia's ancient honey wine tradition.
details: This festival celebrates tej, Ethiopia's ancient honey wine (mead) that has been brewed for thousands of years. Tastings, brewery visits, and traditional tej bet (honey wine bar) experiences showcase this quintessentially Ethiopian drink.

name: Great Ethiopian Run (Women's Edition)
desc: Women's edition of Africa's largest road race celebrating Ethiopian women's running excellence.
details: The Women's Edition of the Great Ethiopian Run celebrates Ethiopia's extraordinary female running talent, from Tirunesh Dibaba to Letesenbet Gidey. Thousands of women run through Addis Ababa in a celebration of female athleticism and empowerment.

name: Ajman Heritage Festival
desc: Heritage festival celebrating traditional Emirati culture in the smallest mainland emirate.
details: Features traditional crafts, food, cultural performances, and heritage activities showcasing Ajman's cultural identity.

name: Antalya Film Festival (Golden Orange)
desc: Turkey's oldest and most prestigious film festival awarding the Golden Orange.
details: Known as the 'Golden Orange Film Festival,' Turkey's oldest film festival features national and international competition sections, premieres, and industry events.

name: Asilah Arts Festival
desc: A renowned international arts festival transforming the whitewashed coastal town of Asilah with murals, exhibitions, and cultural events.
details: Since 1978, this festival has turned the charming coastal town of Asilah into an open-air gallery. Artists from around the world create murals on the medina walls, while exhibitions, workshops, and cultural programming celebrate visual arts, music, and literature. The festival has transformed Asilah into one of Morocco's most artistically vibrant towns.

name: Comic Con Astana
desc: Central Asia's largest pop culture convention featuring anime, cosplay, K-pop, and esports.
details: Kazakhstan's flagship anime, comics, cosplay festival features Otaku Zone exhibition (anime, manga, J-pop, K-pop), autograph sessions, screenings, esports tournaments, sponsor lotteries. International cosplay contest with significant prize fund. 140+ professional cosplayers participate.

name: Aswan Nubian Culture Festival
desc: Festival celebrating the Nubian culture and heritage of southern Egypt.
details: The Aswan Nubian Culture Festival celebrates the distinctive Nubian culture of southern Egypt with traditional music, dance, handicrafts, henna painting, Nubian cuisine, and cultural exhibitions in the colorful Nubian villages along the Nile.

name: Atlin Arts and Music Festival
desc: Remote music festival in one of BC's most beautiful and isolated northern towns.
details: The Atlin Arts and Music Festival takes place in the tiny historic town of Atlin, surrounded by mountains, glaciers, and pristine lakes in far northern BC. The remoteness adds to the magic as artists and audiences gather in one of Canada's most spectacular wilderness settings.

name: Ananda Pagoda Festival
desc: Pagoda festival and local market fair centered on Ananda Temple in Bagan.

name: Bamako Rencontres de la Photographie
desc: Africa's premier photography biennale showcasing contemporary African photography.
details: The Rencontres de Bamako is Africa's most prestigious photography event, held biennially in the Malian capital. It features exhibitions of contemporary African photography in museums, galleries, and public spaces across Bamako, attracting international curators and collectors.

name: Belgrade Dance Festival
desc: International contemporary dance festival in Serbia's capital.
details: Belgrade Dance Festival brings world-renowned dance companies and choreographers for a month of contemporary dance performances and workshops.

name: Belgrade Beer Fest
desc: One of Europe's largest beer festivals with free concerts.
details: Belgrade Beer Fest at Ušće Park combines craft and international beer with free concerts by major Serbian and international acts, drawing 600,000+ visitors.

name: Fjordsteam
desc: Europe's largest gathering of living cultural heritage, bringing together historic ships, vehicles, trains, trams, and aircraft.
details: Fjordsteam is a unique heritage festival in Bergen that assembles historic ships, vintage vehicles, trains, trams, and aircraft in one city. It is Europe's largest celebration of living cultural heritage and maritime history, offering a spectacular gathering of preserved transport from across the continent.

name: Bisket Jatra
desc: New year festival with chariot pulling and community rituals in Bhaktapur.

name: BIME Live
desc: Bilbao's music industry conference and festival.
details: BIME combines a music industry conference with live performances across Bilbao's BEC venue, presenting electronic, indie, and pop artists.

name: Macufe Comedy Festival
desc: Comedy showcase as part of the larger Mangaung African Cultural Festival.
details: The comedy component of MACUFE features South Africa's top comedians performing stand-up sets alongside emerging talent. It is one of the largest comedy events in the Free State.

name: MACUFE (Mangaung African Cultural Festival)
desc: Free State's flagship cultural festival featuring gospel, comedy, sports, and traditional arts.
details: MACUFE is the Mangaung African Cultural Festival, the Free State province's flagship cultural event returning after a hiatus. It encompasses gospel music, comedy shows, sporting events, traditional arts, and a variety of performances celebrating African culture.

name: Macufe Gospel Festival
desc: Gospel music component of the Mangaung African Cultural Festival.
details: The gospel component of MACUFE features South Africa's top gospel artists performing to thousands of devoted fans, reflecting the deep spirituality that underpins much of South African culture.

name: Le Corso Fleuri
desc: Le Corso Fleuri — traditional flower parade in coastal Provence
details: traditional flower parade in coastal Provence

name: White Night (Nuit Blanche) Brussels
desc: All-night contemporary art and culture event across Brussels.
details: Nuit Blanche Brussels opens museums, galleries, and unusual spaces for free all-night art experiences, performances, and installations across the Belgian capital.

name: Gorilla Highland Coffee Festival
desc: Coffee and culture festival near Bwindi Impenetrable Forest, home to mountain gorillas.
details: The Gorilla Highland Coffee Festival celebrates the coffee culture of western Uganda's highlands near Bwindi Impenetrable Forest. Events include coffee cupping, farm visits, traditional Batwa cultural performances, and gorilla trekking opportunities.

name: Bukhara Gold Embroidery Festival
desc: Biennial showcase of Bukhara's world-famous zarduzi gold embroidery and traditional jewelry.
details: Celebrated in even-numbered years, showcasing Bukhara's world-famous zarduzi (gold embroidery) and traditional jewelry. Features presentations, exhibitions, musical theater shows, craft demonstrations, scientific conferences on traditional gold art development, and international artisan participation.

name: Bulawayo Arts Festival (Intwasa)
desc: Zimbabwe's second city hosts a multi-arts festival celebrating Ndebele and national culture.
details: The Intwasa Arts Festival in Bulawayo celebrates Zimbabwean arts through theatre, music, dance, film, and visual arts. It is particularly strong in showcasing Ndebele cultural traditions alongside contemporary artistic expression.

name: Buraydah Date Festival
desc: One of the world's largest date markets and festivals, showcasing over 30 varieties of dates with cultural programming.
details: Considered one of the largest date festivals in the world, Buraydah's annual celebration focuses on date manufacturing, processing, and byproducts including molasses, sugar, jam, and chocolate. It's a major economic and tourism event offering more than 30 varieties of dates, drawing buyers and visitors from across the region.

name: Pickwick Vintage Show
desc: Southern California's premier vintage fashion, art, and collectibles market with live music and retro culture.
details: The Pickwick Vintage Show brings together vintage fashion dealers, antiques collectors, retro enthusiasts, and mid-century modern fans in a celebration of all things vintage. With curated vendors, live DJ sets, and a vibrant community of style-conscious collectors.

name: Bursa Silk Road Festival
desc: Festival celebrating Bursa's heritage as a Silk Road trading center with arts and cultural events.
details: Celebrates the city's silk production heritage with exhibitions, cultural performances, and artisan displays.

name: Festival de Cap Roig
desc: Concerts in a stunning Costa Brava botanical garden.
details: Cap Roig presents major international artists in the spectacular botanical gardens overlooking the Mediterranean on the Costa Brava.

name: Panafest
desc: Pan-African cultural festival dedicated to the African diaspora held at historic slave trade sites.
details: PANAFEST (Pan African Historical Theatre Festival) is a biennial cultural festival for Africans and people of African descent. The two-week festival at Cape Coast and Elmina Castle includes traditional ceremonies, performance arts, workshops, and emotional Atonement rituals. It addresses the transatlantic slave trade's legacy.

name: Calabash Arts and Culture Festival
desc: Music and arts festival celebrating South African cultural diversity.
details: Calabash Cape Town features a diverse lineup of South African music acts alongside art installations and cultural activities celebrating the country's Rainbow Nation identity.

name: Jazzablanca
desc: Casablanca's premier jazz and world music festival with 40+ concerts across nine days mixing pop, rock, hip-hop and jazz.
details: An eagerly awaited festival making jazz accessible to everyone, Jazzablanca features 40+ concerts spread over nine days with both well-known and emerging Moroccan and international artists. The program mixes jazz with pop, rock, hip-hop, folk, and modern mash-ups, with some free concerts included. The cosmopolitan setting of Casablanca adds a creative, urban energy.

name: L'Boulevard Festival
desc: A seven-day urban music festival in Casablanca discovering Morocco's emerging music scene and young talent.
details: A festival for young urban talent over seven days, L'Boulevard has made a name for itself in the continent's urban festivals calendar. Bands and musicians compete for visibility, showcasing Morocco's vibrant emerging music scene from hip-hop to rock to electronic music in Casablanca's contemporary cultural spaces.

name: Casablanca Festival
desc: Music and cultural festival in Morocco's largest city featuring international and Moroccan artists.
details: The Casablanca Festival brings together international and Moroccan musicians for concerts across the city's venues. As Morocco's economic capital and largest city, Casablanca offers a vibrant backdrop for this celebration of music and culture.

name: Concours d'Élégance Villa d'Este
desc: World's most prestigious classic car show on the shores of Lake Como.
details: The Concours d'Élégance at Villa d'Este and Villa Erba showcases the world's most beautiful and rare classic cars on the stunning shores of Lake Como.

name: Chefchaouen Arts Festival
desc: Arts festival in Morocco's famous blue-painted mountain city.
details: The Chefchaouen Arts Festival takes place in one of Morocco's most photographed cities, famous for its blue-painted buildings in the Rif Mountains. The festival features visual arts, music, and cultural events inspired by the city's unique aesthetic.

name: Pitchfork Music Festival
desc: Curated indie music festival in Union Park, known for eclectic and critically acclaimed lineups.
details: Presented by the influential music publication Pitchfork, this festival in Union Park is known for its expertly curated lineups featuring a mix of established indie acts and rising stars. With three stages and a more intimate feel than larger festivals, Pitchfork offers a tastemaker's music experience complemented by a Record Fair, art installations, and food vendors.

name: Transylvania International Film Festival
desc: Romania's leading international film festival in the heart of Transylvania.
details: TIFF presents international and Romanian cinema with open-air screenings in Cluj-Napoca's squares, industry events, and the energetic festival atmosphere of Transylvania's cultural capital.

name: Djembe Drum Festival
desc: Celebration of the djembe drum's origins in Guinea with master drummers and dance workshops.
details: Guinea is the birthplace of the djembe drum, and this festival celebrates the instrument's cultural significance with performances by master drummers, intensive workshops, dance classes, and the showcase of Guinea's legendary percussion and dance traditions.

name: Cosquín Folklore Festival
desc: Argentina’s best-known folklore music festival featuring major national artists.

name: Dahab Festival
desc: Beach and water sports festival in the Red Sea diving town of Dahab.
details: Combines diving, snorkeling, windsurfing, and music events in the laid-back Sinai coastal town popular with adventure travelers.

name: Dakar Surf Pro
desc: International surfing competition on Senegal's Atlantic coast.
details: The Dakar Surf Pro brings international surfers to Senegal's powerful Atlantic waves for one of West Africa's most exciting surfing competitions. It combines world-class surfing with Senegalese hospitality and beach culture.

name: Dawson City Music Festival
desc: Intimate music festival in a Klondike Gold Rush town under the midnight sun.
details: In the historic Gold Rush town of Dawson City, this intimate festival presents Canadian folk, roots, and indie artists in venues from the historic Palace Grand Theatre to outdoor stages along the Yukon River. The 24-hour summer daylight and frontier town atmosphere create an unforgettable setting.

name: Dead Sea Ultra Marathon
desc: Ultra marathon at the lowest point on earth along the dramatic Dead Sea shoreline.
details: Features multiple race categories along the Dead Sea shore at 400m below sea level. Dramatic desert landscape attracting international runners.

name: Diani Reef Beach Festival
desc: Beach festival at Kenya's premier beach resort combining water sports, music, and cultural events.
details: The Diani Beach Festival combines water sports competitions, live music performances, DJ sets, and cultural events at Kenya's most famous beach resort. It attracts both local and international visitors during the festive season.

name: Passover Festival (El-Ghriba)
desc: Passover pilgrimage and celebrations at the El-Ghriba Synagogue.

name: Djerba International Festival
desc: A summer festival on the 'island of lotus eaters' with local performances, children's day, sports day, and the Guellala Pottery Festival.
details: On the legendary island of Djerba, Houmt Souk fills with performances by local actors, musicians, and visual artists. The festival dedicates one day entirely to children's entertainment, another to sports, and a third to women's arts and crafts. The 10-day Guellala Pottery Festival also occurs during this period, celebrating the island's UNESCO world heritage status.

name: Qatar Airways Festival of Motoring
desc: Automotive festival showcasing luxury and classic cars with entertainment and lifestyle activities.
details: Displays of supercars, vintage vehicles, and motorsport demonstrations combined with lifestyle and entertainment programming.

name: Ajyal Film Festival
desc: Youth-focused film festival by Doha Film Institute engaging young people through cinema.
details: Features film screenings, multimedia art installations, and interactive experiences designed to inspire the next generation of filmmakers and audiences.

name: Durban International Film Festival
desc: Africa's longest-running film festival, now in its 47th year, showcasing African cinema.
details: The Durban International Film Festival (DIFF) is Africa's longest-running film festival. It screens a diverse selection of African and international films across multiple venues in Durban, accompanied by industry talks, masterclasses, and networking events.

name: Festival de la Trucha
desc: Seafood and wine festival in Baja California's coastal wine country.
details: Ensenada hosts seafood and wine festivals that celebrate the bounty of Baja California's Pacific Coast alongside its award-winning wines.

name: Erbil International Festival
desc: Summer festival showcasing Kurdish music, contemporary acts, cultural performances, food, and art.
details: Features food stalls, art exhibitions, and workshops. Showcases traditional and contemporary music. Check local tourism authorities for exact dates.

name: Essaouira Art Festival
desc: Visual arts festival in Essaouira's atmospheric medina and galleries.
details: Essaouira's art scene comes alive during its annual arts festival, with exhibitions in the medina's galleries, studios, and public spaces. The windswept Atlantic port city has long attracted artists drawn by its light and bohemian atmosphere.

name: Tanana Valley State Fair
desc: Interior Alaska's agricultural fair with giant vegetables, entertainment, and northern culture.
details: The oldest fair in Alaska showcases interior Alaska's agricultural heritage with oversized produce grown under the midnight sun, livestock exhibitions, carnival rides, concerts, and Native Alaskan cultural demonstrations.

name: Fez Culinary Festival
desc: Culinary celebration in the gastronomic capital of Morocco with cooking workshops and food tours.
details: Fes is considered the culinary capital of Morocco, and this festival celebrates the city's extraordinary food traditions with cooking workshops, guided food tours through the ancient medina, chef demonstrations, and themed dinners in traditional riads.

name: Firenze Rocks
desc: Florence's major rock festival at Visarno Arena.
details: Firenze Rocks presents international rock headliners in a festival setting within Florence's Visarno Arena in the Cascine park.

name: Isle of MTV Malta
desc: Free MTV music event bringing international pop stars to Malta.
details: Isle of MTV is a free annual music concert in Malta's Floriana Granaries square, broadcast across Europe and featuring major international pop and electronic artists.

name: Franschhoek Literary Festival
desc: Literary festival in the Cape Winelands featuring South African and international authors.
details: The Franschhoek Literary Festival brings together South African and international authors for readings, panel discussions, book signings, and literary conversations in the scenic Franschhoek valley, accompanied by wine tastings and gourmet food.

name: Franschhoek Cap Classique & Champagne Festival
desc: Sparkling wine festival celebrating South Africa's finest Méthode Cap Classique wines.
details: The Franschhoek Cap Classique & Champagne Festival celebrates South Africa's premier sparkling wines in the picturesque French-inspired wine valley. Attendees taste méthode cap classique from the region's best producers alongside canapés and live entertainment.

name: Botswana Maitisong Festival
desc: Botswana's premier performing arts festival featuring music, theatre, dance, and comedy.
details: Maitisong is Botswana's largest performing arts festival, featuring a diverse programme of music, theatre, dance, comedy, and spoken word performances by local, regional, and international artists over 10 days.

name: Garana Jazz Festival
desc: Intimate jazz festival in a mountain forest clearing in Romania's Banat region.
details: Gărâna Jazz brings world-class jazz musicians to a natural amphitheatre in a forest clearing in Romania's Semenic Mountains, creating one of Europe's most atmospheric jazz settings.

name: Ghadames Festival
desc: Tuareg and Berber celebration in a historic Saharan oasis town with camel races, music, and date markets.
details: In the Saharan town of Ghadames, locals return to ancestral homes for three days of camel races, Tuareg songs, and bustling markets. The old city pulses with celebration as the heart of the ancient oasis is transformed into a vast market for newly-harvested dates.

name: Yennepa Cultural Festival
desc: Cultural festival in the royal city of Gondar celebrating Amhara heritage.
details: The Yennepa Festival in Gondar celebrates the cultural heritage of the Amhara people with traditional music, dance, horse riding, and feasting near the Royal Enclosure (Fasil Ghebbi), a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

name: Splash! Festival
desc: Germany's biggest hip-hop festival at Ferropolis.
details: Splash! at the spectacular Ferropolis venue presents the best of hip-hop, rap, and urban music amid colossal mining machinery. Germany's premier hip-hop gathering.

name: Bele Chere Street Festival
desc: Community street festival celebrating arts and culture in the Piedmont Triad.
details: Greensboro hosts vibrant community arts and music street festivals showcasing local and regional talent.

name: Winterdance Dog Sled Festival
desc: Dog sledding experiences and winter activities in Ontario's Haliburton Highlands.
details: Winterdance Dog Sled Tours hosts winter festivals and events featuring dog sled rides, winter camping, and northern outdoor experiences in the beautiful Haliburton Highlands of Ontario.

name: Harare Gardens Arts Festival
desc: Open-air arts market and music festival in Harare's central gardens.
details: Harare Gardens hosts regular arts markets and music festivals featuring Zimbabwean shona sculpture, paintings, live mbira and chimurenga music, and craft vendors in the green heart of the capital.

name: Festival Internacional Jazz Plaza
desc: Cuba’s flagship jazz festival with international and local artists.

name: Lux Helsinki
desc: Light art festival illuminating Helsinki's winter darkness.
details: Lux Helsinki transforms the dark Finnish winter with light art installations across the city centre, attracting hundreds of thousands to experience art in the cold.

name: Tuska Open Air Metal Festival
desc: Finland's biggest metal festival in central Helsinki.
details: Tuska brings heavy metal to the heart of Helsinki with three days of Finnish and international metal, from extreme to melodic, in the Suvilahti industrial area.

name: Toubkal Mountain Festival
desc: Mountain festival at the foot of North Africa's highest peak with Berber cultural activities.
details: The Toubkal Mountain Festival celebrates the Amazigh (Berber) mountain culture at the foot of Mount Toubkal (4,167m), North Africa's highest peak. Events include traditional music, trekking, Berber cooking workshops, and craft demonstrations.

name: Diwali / Deepavali 2026 (main day)
desc: Festival of lights with lamps, fireworks, and family rituals; celebrated across South & Southeast Asia.

name: Carnival of Jacmel
desc: Famed papier-mâché masks and street theater in a coastal art city.

name: Vinoble
desc: The only international exhibition dedicated exclusively to noble, fortified, and special sweet wines.
details: Held in the historic Alcázar of Jerez, the fair celebrates the complex, highly traditional art of producing sherry, port, madeira, and other fortified wines, attracting specialized sommeliers and serious wine collectors.

name: Feria de Abril Jerez
desc: Jerez's horse fair with flamenco, sherry, and equestrian shows.
details: Jerez's Feria del Caballo celebrates Andalusian equestrian culture with horse shows, flamenco dancing in casetas, sherry tastings, and carriage parades.

name: Jimma Coffee Festival
desc: Festival in the birthplace of coffee celebrating Ethiopia's most famous export.
details: Jimma, in the Kaffa region considered the birthplace of coffee, hosts an annual festival celebrating Ethiopia's most famous export. Events include coffee farm tours, cupping competitions, traditional Oromo ceremonies, and the ritual of the buna ceremony.

name: Nile River Festival
desc: Adventure and culture festival at the source of the Nile featuring white water rafting and music.
details: The Nile River Festival at the source of the Nile in Jinja combines world-class white water rafting and kayaking competitions with live music, cultural performances, and adventure activities. It celebrates Uganda's growing reputation as East Africa's adventure capital.

name: Soweto Wine & Lifestyle Festival
desc: Wine festival bringing South African wine culture to the iconic township of Soweto.
details: The Soweto Wine & Lifestyle Festival brings South African wine culture to the iconic township, featuring wine tastings, food pairings, live music, and lifestyle exhibitions. It is part of a movement to make wine accessible to all South Africans.

name: Mzansi Fela Festival
desc: South African celebration of Afrobeat legend Fela Kuti's music and political legacy.
details: The Mzansi Fela Festival pays tribute to Afrobeat pioneer Fela Kuti with live performances by South African and West African musicians, art exhibitions, and panel discussions about music as a tool for social change.

name: Kampala International Theatre Festival
desc: East Africa's premier theatre festival showcasing contemporary African performance.
details: The Kampala International Theatre Festival brings together theatre-makers from across Africa and beyond for a week of performances, workshops, and exchanges at the Uganda National Theatre and other Kampala venues.

name: Kampala Laugh Festival
desc: Uganda's biggest comedy event featuring East African standup comedians.
details: The Kampala Laugh Festival is Uganda's largest comedy event, featuring top comedians from Uganda, Kenya, Tanzania, and the broader East African region performing standup comedy to packed audiences.

name: Kampala Street Dance Festival
desc: Street dance and urban arts festival in Kampala featuring breakdancing and hip-hop culture.
details: The Kampala Street Dance Festival celebrates Uganda's growing breakdancing and urban dance scene with competitions, workshops, and performances. Uganda has produced several continental breakdancing champions.

name: Kampala Restaurant Week
desc: Culinary event featuring discounted menus at top Kampala restaurants.
details: Kampala Restaurant Week invites diners to explore the Ugandan capital's growing restaurant scene with specially priced tasting menus at top restaurants serving everything from traditional Ugandan cuisine to international fare.

name: Durbar Festival
desc: Royal cavalry parade showcasing the rich history of Northern Nigeria during Eid celebrations.
details: The Durbar Festival dates to the 14th century, originally a military parade showcasing cavalry strength. Now a royal event during Eid-el-Fitr and Eid-el-Kabir, the Emir of Kano leads elaborately dressed horsemen through the streets in a spectacular display of Northern Nigerian cultural heritage.

name: Caramoor Music Festival
desc: Classical and jazz festival on a Mediterranean-style estate in Westchester County.
details: Caramoor presents classical, jazz, and world music on a beautiful 90-acre estate featuring a Venetian theater, Spanish courtyard, and Mediterranean-inspired gardens. The setting and programming make it one of the most distinctive summer music experiences in the Northeast.

name: Harbin-style Ice Festival Kemi
desc: SnowCastle and ice sculptures in Finnish Lapland.
details: Kemi's SnowCastle is rebuilt each winter as a hotel, restaurant, and chapel made entirely of ice and snow, alongside ice sculpture exhibitions.

name: Roof of the World Festival
desc: International music and dance festival in the Pamir Mountains celebrating Pamiri traditions.
details: International music and dance festival in the Pamir Mountains celebrating Pamiri traditions. Brings together performers from across Central Asia and beyond in the stunning Pamir setting.

name: FESPAD (Pan-African Dance Festival)
desc: Pan-African dance festival bringing together dance companies from across the continent.
details: FESPAD is one of Africa's premier dance events, bringing together dance companies and choreographers from across the continent and the diaspora. It features performances, workshops, and exchanges celebrating the diversity of African dance traditions.

name: Kigali Comedy Festival
desc: Comedy festival featuring East African and international standup comedians.
details: The Kigali Comedy Festival brings laughter to Rwanda's capital with performances by East African and international comedians. It reflects Kigali's growing reputation as a cultural hub in the region.

name: Jamaica Music Festivals and Events
desc: Multiple reggae and music festivals throughout Jamaica including Lost In Time Festival and Rebel Salute.
details: Island Music Conference (February 25-28), Reggae Fusion (February 28), Lost in Time Festival (February 28-March 1) in Kingston featuring Protoje and Chronixx headlining with Tessanne Chin, D'yani, Naomi Cowan, and Lila Iké. Sly Dunbar O.D. Tribute (March 6-7). Rebel Salute traditionally exposes proponents of roots-reggae genre including dancehall acts.

name: Nuits Atypiques de Koudougou
desc: Alternative music festival in Koudougou celebrating African and world music.
details: Les Nuits Atypiques de Koudougou is a week-long alternative music festival bringing together musicians from across Africa and the world. It features outdoor concerts, workshops, and cultural exchanges in Burkina Faso's third largest city.

name: Kuwait International Book Fair
desc: Annual international book fair featuring publishers from across the Arab world and beyond.
details: One of the oldest book fairs in the Gulf region featuring publishers, author talks, and cultural programming.

name: Carnaval Internacional de La Ceiba
desc: Huge carnival parade celebrating San Isidro with floats, dance and music.

name: Carnaval Vegano
desc: Mask-filled carnival Sundays culminating near Independence Day.

name: Lagos Fringe Festival
desc: Independent theatre and performing arts festival showcasing emerging Nigerian talent.
details: The Lagos Fringe Festival is an independent performing arts festival featuring theatre, dance, spoken word, and comedy from emerging Nigerian artists in various venues across Lagos.

name: Lagos Theatre Festival
desc: Week-long theatre festival with free performances in public spaces across Lagos.
details: The Lagos Theatre Festival brings free theatrical performances to public spaces across Nigeria's largest city. From bus stops to markets to beaches, actors perform everything from classic drama to contemporary devised work, making theatre accessible to all Lagosians.

name: Nigerian Food Week
desc: Celebration of Nigeria's diverse culinary traditions from jollof rice to suya.
details: Nigerian Food Week celebrates the country's extraordinary culinary diversity, from the famous jollof rice wars to suya grills, pounded yam, and egusi soup. Restaurants across Lagos offer special menus, and cooking competitions celebrate regional specialties.

name: Basant (Kite Festival)
desc: Kite-flying season historically celebrated with rooftops, music and street food (often regulated).

name: Catskill Chill
desc: Boutique camping music festival in the Catskill Mountains featuring jam, electronic, and funk.
details: Catskill Chill is an intimate camping festival at Camp Minglewood in the beautiful Catskill Mountains, featuring jam bands, electronic artists, and funk acts in a close-knit community atmosphere. The fall foliage setting adds natural beauty to the experience.

name: Lamu Donkey Sanctuary Festival
desc: Festival celebrating Lamu Island's iconic donkeys who serve as the main transport.
details: Lamu Island has no cars - donkeys are the main form of transport. The Donkey Sanctuary festival celebrates these essential animals with races, best-dressed donkey competitions, and educational events about animal welfare.

name: Commandaria Festival
desc: Festival celebrating Commandaria wine, the world's oldest named wine still in production.
details: Celebrates the unique Commandaria dessert wine with vineyard visits, tastings, traditional grape-stomping, and cultural events in the mountain villages.

name: BIO 29 (Ljubljana Biennial of Design)
desc: The world's oldest design biennial, operating as a testing ground for experimental and sustainable design.
details: Organized by the Museum of Architecture and Design (MAO), BIO has shifted from a traditional exhibition of industrial objects to a collaborative platform addressing complex societal and environmental challenges through design thinking.

name: Festival International Nuits d'Afrique
desc: Pan-African music festival in Lomé featuring artists from across the continent.
details: This pan-African music festival in Lomé brings together musicians from across Africa and the diaspora for concerts and cultural exchanges in Togo's vibrant capital.

name: Affordable Art Fair London (Battersea)
desc: The flagship UK location for the global AAF franchise.
details: Hosted in Battersea Park, providing an entry point for thousands of new collectors to acquire original contemporary art starting at just £100 in a highly engaging atmosphere.

name: The Other Art Fair London
desc: A boundary-pushing event presented by Saatchi Art.
details: Held at The Truman Brewery, this edition strongly highlights gender equality with a 69% female artist lineup, alongside unconventional programming like life drawing with sex worker collectives.

name: Photo London
desc: Leading international photography fair at Somerset House.
details: Photo London presents 100+ galleries at Somerset House alongside a curated programme of exhibitions, talks, and the Master of Photography award.

name: Volto Santo
desc: Volto Santo — procession and fair
details: procession and fair

name: Lucerne Festival
desc: World-class classical music festival on Lake Lucerne.
details: Lucerne Festival attracts the world's finest orchestras, conductors, and soloists to the Jean Nouvel-designed KKL concert hall and other venues by the stunning lake.

name: Zambia Music Awards
desc: Annual celebration of Zambian music featuring live performances and award presentations.
details: The Zambia Music Awards celebrate the best of Zambian music across genres including Zamrock, Kalindula, and contemporary pop. The ceremony features live performances from top Zambian artists and recognizes achievements in the country's music industry.

name: Opera Festival Macerata (Sferisterio)
desc: Opera in the remarkable open-air Sferisterio arena.
details: Macerata's Sferisterio Opera Festival presents opera in a stunning neoclassical arena with 2,500 seats and remarkable acoustics, creating one of Italy's most atmospheric opera experiences.

name: Malindi Cultural Festival
desc: Coastal festival celebrating Malindi's Swahili, Portuguese, and Arab cultural heritage.
details: The Malindi Cultural Festival celebrates the diverse heritage of this historic Kenyan coastal town, which has welcomed traders from Portugal, Arabia, and China for centuries. Events include traditional Swahili music, dance, food, and cultural exhibitions.

name: Bahrain Spring of Culture
desc: Bahrain's premier arts festival featuring international musicians, exhibitions, theater, and cultural programming.
details: Bahrain's flagship cultural festival brings world-class musicians, artists, and performers to the island kingdom. The program spans classical music, contemporary art exhibitions, theater, and literary events, reflecting Bahrain's historical role as a cultural crossroads in the Gulf.

name: Azgo Festival
desc: Maputo's biggest music festival featuring Mozambican and international artists.
details: The Azgo Festival is Maputo's largest music event, bringing together Mozambican artists with performers from across Southern Africa and beyond. It celebrates Mozambique's vibrant music scene including marrabenta, pandza, and contemporary genres.

name: Moriones Festival
desc: Holy Week tradition featuring Roman-soldier masks and dramatizations in towns across Marinduque.

name: Marrakech Popular Arts Festival
desc: A vibrant showcase of Moroccan folk arts featuring fire-eaters, acrobats, snake charmers, and traditional performers at El Badi Palace.
details: One of Morocco's oldest cultural events, this festival fills Marrakech with fire-eaters, fortune tellers, storytellers, snake-charmers, acrobats, comedians, and musicians. Held at the historic El Badi Palace gardens, it combines traditional music and dances from diverse Moroccan regions with contemporary entertainment, creating a visual and auditory feast against the red walls of Marrakech.

name: Wadi El Gemal Festival
desc: Cultural festival celebrating the Ababda Bedouin people's heritage in the Eastern Desert.
details: The Wadi El Gemal Festival celebrates the culture and traditions of the Ababda Bedouin people who inhabit the Eastern Desert near Marsa Alam. It features traditional music, camel races, handicraft exhibitions, and Bedouin cuisine in the stunning setting of Wadi El Gemal National Park.

name: Maun International Arts Festival
desc: Arts festival at the gateway to the Okavango Delta celebrating Botswana's creative talent.
details: The Maun International Arts Festival at the gateway to the Okavango Delta features live music, poetry, dance, theatre, visual arts, and film. It is Botswana's most prominent cultural event, promoting local creative talent alongside international artists.

name: Melbourne Food and Wine Festival
desc: Major culinary festival celebrating Melbourne's world-class food scene with events across the city and regions.
details: Melbourne Food and Wine Festival is one of the world's leading food festivals, spanning the entire month of March. Hundreds of events include long lunches, masterclasses, wine tastings, restaurant collaborations, and food experiences celebrating Victoria's diverse culinary landscape.

name: Beale Street Music Festival
desc: Premier Memphis music festival on the banks of the Mississippi, the kickoff to Memphis in May.
details: Opening the Memphis in May International Festival, the Beale Street Music Festival features major rock, soul, hip-hop, blues, and Americana acts on multiple stages at Tom Lee Park along the Mississippi River. Memphis's unmatched musical heritage provides the perfect backdrop for this celebration of diverse American music.

name: Merzouga International Music Festival
desc: A three-day concert in the middle of the Sahara on the world-famous Erg Chebbi dunes under the stars.
details: Nothing is more enchanting than attending a concert in the middle of the desert at night. This well-attended Saharan celebration lasts three days on the world-famous Erg Chebbi dunes, bringing together musicians from across the globe for performances under the vast Saharan sky.

name: Folklorico Nacional
desc: National showcase of Mexican folklorico dance traditions from all 32 states.
details: Mexico City hosts national folklorico dance showcases bringing together troupes from all 32 Mexican states. Each state's distinctive dances, costumes, and musical traditions are presented in a celebration of Mexico's extraordinary regional cultural diversity.

name: Festival Cervecero de Mexico City
desc: Mexico City's craft beer festival celebrating the country's booming cerveza artesanal scene.
details: Mexico's craft beer revolution is celebrated with festivals in Mexico City featuring dozens of Mexican microbreweries alongside live music, food pairings, and educational tastings showcasing the creativity of Mexican brewers.

name: Festival Taco
desc: Celebration of Mexico's beloved taco with competitions, tastings, and culinary demonstrations.
details: Mexico City hosts festivals celebrating the taco in all its glorious variations, from street-style al pastor to gourmet reinterpretations. Taco competitions, eating contests, cooking demonstrations, and live music create a festive atmosphere.

name: I-Days Milano
desc: Milan's major rock and pop festival at Ippodromo SNAI.
details: I-Days brings major international rock and pop headliners to Milan's former racecourse for individual concert dates over several weeks.

name: Mission Folk Music Festival
desc: Intimate folk festival on the banks of the Fraser River in BC's Fraser Valley.
details: The Mission Folk Music Festival takes place at Fraser River Heritage Park, offering folk, roots, and world music on multiple stages with camping, workshops, and family activities. The intimate riverside setting and community atmosphere make it a beloved BC tradition.

name: Poutine Fest
desc: Celebration of Canada's iconic dish with creative poutine variations from top chefs.
details: La Poutine Week and various poutine festivals celebrate Canada's beloved dish with creative variations from restaurants across the country. Chefs compete to create the most inventive poutine using premium curds, creative toppings, and innovative presentations.

name: Morija Arts and Cultural Festival
desc: Lesotho's premier cultural event featuring traditional Basotho music, dance, and heritage.
details: The Morija Arts and Cultural Festival is Lesotho's most important cultural event, held in the historic village of Morija. It features traditional Basotho music (including Famo), dance performances, horse racing, craft markets, and literary events celebrating the Mountain Kingdom's heritage.

name: Mostar Summer Festival
desc: Music and culture in the city of the famous Stari Most bridge.
details: Mostar's summer festival features concerts, theatre, and film screenings in the spectacular setting around the rebuilt Old Bridge over the Neretva River.
