name: Kachin Manaw Festival
desc: Kachin cultural festival featuring the Manaw dance and traditional attire.

name: Mzuzu Literary Festival
desc: Literary festival promoting Malawian literature and storytelling traditions.
details: The Mzuzu Literary Festival celebrates Malawian literature and oral storytelling traditions through author readings, poetry performances, book discussions, and creative writing workshops in Malawi's third largest city.

name: Mount Kenya Mountain Festival
desc: Adventure and culture festival at the foot of Mount Kenya with trail running and cultural events.
details: The Mount Kenya Mountain Festival combines trail running events, mountain biking, and climbing with cultural celebrations of the Kikuyu, Meru, and Embu communities who live around Africa's second-highest peak.

name: Art on Paper New York
desc: A medium-driven fair focused entirely on paper-based art.
details: Returning during Armory Art Week, featuring 100 galleries and unique performance pieces demonstrating the extreme creative potential of paper as a primary medium.

name: NY Antiquarian Book Fair
desc: The world's leading fair for rare books, manuscripts, and ephemera.
details: Sanctioned by the ABAA and ILAB, this highly prestigious event draws serious bibliophiles to the Park Avenue Armory to acquire historically significant documents and literary artifacts.

name: Niamey Cultural Week
desc: Week-long cultural celebration in Niger's capital featuring traditional performances from all ethnic groups.
details: Niamey Cultural Week brings together Niger's diverse ethnic groups including Hausa, Zarma, Tuareg, Fulani, and Kanuri for a week of traditional dances, music, crafts, and culinary exhibitions in the capital.

name: Festival sur le Fleuve Niger
desc: Music and cultural festival on the banks of the Niger River in Niamey.
details: The Festival sur le Fleuve Niger in Niamey features musicians, dancers, and artists performing along the banks of the Niger River. It showcases the cultural diversity of Niger's various ethnic groups including Hausa, Zarma, Tuareg, and Fulani.

name: Festival del Centro Historico de Oaxaca
desc: Arts and culture festival in the UNESCO World Heritage colonial center of Oaxaca.
details: The Festival del Centro Historico fills Oaxaca's magnificent colonial center with live music, theater, dance, visual arts exhibitions, and culinary events celebrating the rich cultural heritage of one of Mexico's most creative cities.

name: Noche de Rábanos
desc: Radish-carving competition and street fair in Oaxaca’s main square.

name: SIAO (International Arts and Crafts Fair)
desc: Africa's largest arts and crafts fair showcasing artisans from across the continent.
details: SIAO (Salon International de l'Artisanat de Ouagadougou) is Africa's largest arts and crafts fair, held biennially in Ouagadougou. It brings together thousands of artisans from across Africa to exhibit and sell traditional and contemporary crafts, textiles, jewelry, and decorative arts.

name: STRAB Festival
desc: Long-running beach music festival on Mozambique's southern coast.
details: The STRAB (Subterranean Rhythm and Blues) Festival has been running for decades at Ponta Malongane, a campsite on the beach in southern Mozambique. It features local and regional musicians performing rock, blues, reggae, and Mozambican music in a relaxed beachside setting.

name: Portland Saturday Market
desc: The largest continuously operating open-air arts and crafts market in the US.
details: Portland Saturday Market is the largest continuously operating outdoor arts and crafts market in the United States, with over 250 vendors selling handmade goods along the waterfront and under the Burnside Bridge every weekend.

name: Mercosul Biennial
desc: One of Latin America's most significant contemporary art events, promoting integration between Mercosul region countries.
details: The Mercosul Biennial, established in 1996, brings together artists and audiences in Porto Alegre. The 14th edition just concluded in mid-2025. Distinguished by strong educational focus and social responsibility. A 15th edition in late 2026 is possible but not yet announced.

name: Procesión Jesús del Gran Poder (Good Friday)
desc: Dramatic penitential procession through Quito’s historic center.

name: Palestine International Festival
desc: Cultural festival featuring Palestinian and international music, dance, and visual arts.
details: Showcases Palestinian culture and arts with international collaborations in music, dance, theatre, and visual arts across various venues in Ramallah.

name: Rethymno Renaissance Festival
desc: Renaissance heritage celebration in Rethymno's Venetian-era old town.
details: Rethymno celebrates its Venetian heritage with concerts, theatrical performances, and exhibitions in the Fortezza fortress and old town streets.

name: Reykjavík International Film Festival (RIFF)
desc: Prestigious international film festival screening diverse global cinema across Reykjavík's venues.
details: RIFF presents an exciting programme of international independent and art-house cinema. The festival screens films across multiple venues in Reykjavík and has earned a reputation for bold programming and discovering new talent. It is a key cultural event in the Icelandic autumn calendar.

name: Riviere-du-Loup Folk Festival
desc: Intimate folk music festival in the picturesque Lower St. Lawrence region of Quebec.
details: This charming festival presents folk and traditional music in the scenic town of Riviere-du-Loup on the south shore of the St. Lawrence River, where the river begins to widen into the Gulf.

name: Noor Riyadh (Light Art Festival)
desc: A stunning light and art festival transforming Riyadh's skyline into an open-air gallery of illuminated installations.
details: Noor Riyadh transforms the Saudi capital into a canvas of light-based art, with installations spanning from metro hubs to the city center. International and Saudi artists create celestial and immersive light installations that are free to the public, making the city itself the exhibition space. The festival is part of Riyadh Art, the city's ambitious public art program.

name: King Abdulaziz Camel Festival
desc: A massive celebration of Arabian camel culture with races, beauty pageants, and heritage activities drawing enthusiasts from across the Gulf.
details: This annual global event celebrates the camel in Arabian culture through traditional camel racing, beauty competitions (Mazayen), and heritage activities. Organized by the Saudi Camel Club, it attracts breeders and enthusiasts from across the GCC, with enormous prize money and elaborate cultural programming.

name: Riyadh Spring Festival
desc: A large spring festival celebrating nature with thousands of colorful ornamental plants and flowers on display.
details: This ten-day festival celebrates nature and the spring season in Riyadh. Thousands attend to experience mesmerizing flower breeds, with a focus on showcasing colorful and fragrant ornamental plants. The festival creates a green oasis in the desert capital, offering a refreshing contrast to the typical landscape.

name: Reunion Island Grand Raid
desc: Ultra-trail mountain race across volcanic terrain, one of the world's toughest endurance events.
details: The Grand Raid de la Reunion (Diagonale des Fous) is one of the world's most prestigious ultra-trail races, crossing 165km of volcanic terrain across Reunion Island. Thousands of runners from around the world tackle extreme elevation changes through tropical forests and mountain passes.

name: Saint-Louis Jazz Festival
desc: World-class jazz festival in Senegal's UNESCO-listed colonial city of Saint-Louis.
details: The Saint-Louis International Jazz Festival brings world-class musicians to Senegal's UNESCO-listed city of Saint-Louis. Hosted in the atmospheric colonial city on the Senegal River, it attracts world-renowned jazz musicians while staying rooted in Senegalese musical traditions. Tickets average $40-70.

name: Sharq Taronalari Music Festival
desc: One of Central Asia's largest music festivals at Registan Square with musicians from 80+ countries.
details: 'Melodies of the East' - one of the largest music festivals in Central Asia bringing together approximately 300 representatives from 80+ countries. Features traditional and contemporary music performances at the iconic Registan Square. Recognized by UNESCO International Cultural Events list. Biennial event (held in even years).

name: Festival de Otono
desc: Autumn cultural programming in one of Mexico's most artistic colonial cities.
details: San Miguel de Allende's autumn season features gallery openings, concerts, literary events, and culinary festivals in this UNESCO World Heritage city beloved by artists and cultural travelers.

name: Festival de Primavera San Miguel de Allende
desc: Spring cultural festival in one of Mexico's most beautiful colonial cities.
details: San Miguel de Allende celebrates spring with art openings, music performances, garden tours, culinary events, and cultural programming in one of Mexico's most picturesque and artistic colonial cities, a UNESCO World Heritage site.

name: San Pedro Lobster Festival
desc: Seafood-forward summer festival celebrating lobster season with music and events.

name: Santa Cruz Beach Boardwalk's Friday Night Bands
desc: Free summer concert series at the historic seaside amusement park, a California coast tradition.
details: Every Friday evening in summer, the Santa Cruz Beach Boardwalk hosts free concerts featuring classic rock, tribute bands, and popular acts on the beach stage. The combination of live music, vintage amusement rides, and Pacific Ocean setting creates a quintessential California summer experience.

name: Santa Fe Bandstand Summer Concert Series
desc: Free outdoor concerts on the historic Santa Fe Plaza throughout the summer.
details: Santa Fe Bandstand fills the historic Santa Fe Plaza with free live music every evening in summer, featuring jazz, blues, folk, Latin, and world music under the stars in one of America's most atmospheric plazas.

name: Bali Kite Festival
desc: A spectacular offering to the gods with enormous traditional kites shaped like fish, birds, and deities soaring above Bali's beaches.
details: When the trade winds arrive, Balinese kite teams take to the fields near Sanur with enormous traditional kites shaped like fish (bebean), birds (janggan), and leaf shapes (pecukan). Originally an offering to the gods for bountiful harvests, it has become a friendly competition between villages. The sky fills with colorful kites of extraordinary size and design.

name: Gawai Dayak
desc: Dayak harvest celebration with longhouse visits, music and traditional rituals.

name: Peach Music Festival
desc: Multi-day jam band festival at Montage Mountain curated by the Allman Brothers Band legacy.
details: The Peach Music Festival at Montage Mountain features jam bands, rock, blues, and Americana acts with camping and waterpark access. Founded in the spirit of the Allman Brothers Band's legacy, it has become one of the premier jam band festivals in the Northeast.

name: Festival sur le Niger
desc: Vibrant cultural festival on the banks of the Niger River celebrating Malian arts and music.
details: The Festival sur le Niger in Segou is a celebration of Malian culture featuring music, puppet theatre, visual arts, and literary events on the banks of the Niger River. It promotes cultural exchange and supports local artisans and performers in one of Mali's most historic cities.

name: Affordable Art Fair Singapore
desc: Celebrating its 19th edition at the F1 Pit Building.
details: Features a hand-picked selection of over 95 galleries, catering to Southeast Asia's rapidly expanding middle-class art consumers with works strictly priced below S$15,000.

name: Sitka Summer Music Festival
desc: Classical chamber music festival in a stunning Southeast Alaska coastal setting.
details: The Sitka Summer Music Festival brings world-class chamber musicians to the stunning coastal town of Sitka for a month of concerts in an intimate hall. The combination of outstanding musicianship and Alaska's breathtaking scenery creates a rare cultural experience.

name: Festival of Lights (Taziry Ecolodge)
desc: Three-day festival at Siwa Oasis celebrating Amazigh culture with music under the stars.
details: The Festival of Lights at Siwa Oasis, Egypt's most remote settlement, celebrates the local Amazigh (Berber) culture with traditional music, dance, and feasting under the full moon. The desert setting and ancient traditions make it a truly unique experience.

name: Semana Santa processions
desc: Holy Week processions and carpet art traditions across western El Salvador.

name: Sousse International Festival
desc: Summer cultural festival in the UNESCO-listed coastal city of Sousse.
details: The Sousse International Festival is one of Tunisia's premier summer cultural events, held in the atmospheric medina of this UNESCO World Heritage coastal city. It features music, theatre, and dance performances from Tunisia and the Arab world.

name: Split Summer Festival
desc: Cultural festival in the UNESCO-listed Diocletian's Palace.
details: Split Summer Festival presents opera, drama, dance, and concerts in the remarkable setting of Diocletian's 4th-century Roman palace.

name: Squamish Constellation Festival
desc: Multi-genre music festival set between ocean and mountains in Squamish.
details: The Squamish area between Vancouver and Whistler hosts music festival events that take advantage of the spectacular Sea-to-Sky corridor setting with coastal mountains and ocean views.

name: Scene Festival
desc: Multi-arts festival in Niagara wine country celebrating music, theater, and visual arts.
details: Scene Music Festival transforms downtown St. Catharines in the heart of Niagara wine country with multi-genre music performances, art installations, and culinary events celebrating the region's cultural and agricultural richness.

name: LouFest / Music at the Intersection
desc: St. Louis music and culture festival celebrating the city's diverse musical heritage.
details: Music at the Intersection celebrates St. Louis's rich musical history at the crossroads of blues, jazz, R&B, soul, rock, and hip-hop. Multiple stages in the Grand Center Arts District feature national and local artists alongside visual art, food, and cultural programming.

name: Strandkorb Open Air
desc: A unique beach concert where thousands of iconic German beach chairs face a stage on the North Sea sand.
details: Strandkorb Open Air creates a surreal scene: rows of traditional Strandkörbe (hooded beach chairs) face a concert stage directly on the vast beach of St. Peter-Ording, with the North Sea as a backdrop.

name: Zanzibar Stone Town Heritage Festival
desc: Festival celebrating the UNESCO World Heritage architecture and history of Stone Town.
details: This heritage festival celebrates Stone Town's extraordinary architectural and cultural heritage as a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Events include guided heritage walks, conservation talks, traditional craft demonstrations, and Taarab music performances in historic buildings.

name: Zanzibar Dhow Race
desc: Traditional sailing dhow race in the waters off Stone Town celebrating maritime heritage.
details: The Zanzibar Dhow Race celebrates the island's ancient maritime heritage with traditional ngalawa and jahazi dhows racing in the turquoise waters off Stone Town. It is accompanied by festivities on shore with music and seafood.

name: Mawlid
desc: Elaborate Prophet's birthday celebrations in the Muslim islands of Zanzibar with processions and chanting.
details: Zanzibar celebrates the Mawlid (Prophet Muhammad's birthday) with elaborate festivities including Quran recitations, religious processions through Stone Town's narrow streets, traditional Taarab music, communal meals, and charitable giving.

name: Zanzibar Music Festival
desc: Celebration of Zanzibar's famous spice heritage with tours, cooking demonstrations, and tastings.
details: Zanzibar's Spice Festival celebrates the island's legendary spice heritage. Events include guided spice plantation tours, cooking demonstrations, spice-infused food tastings, and exhibitions about the historical spice trade that shaped Zanzibar's identity.

name: Namibia Wildlife Festival
desc: Festival celebrating Namibia's remarkable wildlife and conservation efforts.
details: Namibia's Wildlife Festival celebrates the country's extraordinary wildlife and pioneering community-based conservation efforts with film screenings, photography exhibitions, talks by conservationists, and guided wildlife excursions.

name: Festival de Tabarka
desc: Summer jazz and music festival in the coastal resort town of Tabarka.
details: The Tabarka Jazz Festival in this picturesque coastal town features jazz, Latin, and world music performances in outdoor venues with views of the Mediterranean. It is one of Tunisia's most popular summer cultural events.

name: Tafraoute Almond Blossom Festival
desc: A celebration of blooming almond trees in the Anti-Atlas with blue-rock landscapes, Berber music, and local markets.
details: When the almond trees bloom in the Anti-Atlas mountains, Tafraoute celebrates with folklore performances, traditional music, regional cuisine emphasizing almond-based treats, and outdoor activities like trekking. The blue-painted rocks and blooming trees create a stunning natural backdrop for this intimate local festival.

name: Talas Equestrian Games Festival
desc: Traditional nomadic equestrian games including Ulak Tartysh, Kyz Kuumai, and Er-Enish.
details: Celebration of traditional nomadic heritage featuring national equestrian games: Ulak Tartysh (goat polo), Kyz Kuumai (chasing game), Er-Enish (horseback wrestling), folklore shows, and authentic Kyrgyz cuisine. Ticket: 2,000 KGS.

name: Sahra Festival
desc: Tuareg cultural festival in the deep Sahara featuring traditional music and camel racing.
details: The Sahra Festival in Tamanrasset brings together Tuareg communities from across the Sahara for traditional imzad music, tifinagh calligraphy workshops, camel racing, and cultural exchanges in the dramatic setting of the Hoggar Mountains.

name: Tampere Film Festival
desc: One of the most important short film festivals in the world, running since 1970.
details: The Tampere Film Festival is an internationally acclaimed short film festival that has been running for over five decades. It screens competitive and non-competitive programmes of short films from around the world, alongside industry events and workshops.

name: Tazaungdaing Festival of Lights
desc: Festival featuring lanterns, offerings and Taunggyi hot-air balloon competitions.

name: Tbilisi Open Air
desc: Largest music festival in the Caucasus region with electronic and rock focus.
details: Tbilisi Open Air is the Caucasus's premier music festival, bringing international and Georgian artists to outdoor venues in Georgia's vibrant capital.

name: DocAviv International Documentary Film Festival
desc: Israel's premiere international documentary film festival with screenings and industry events.
details: One of the leading documentary film festivals worldwide, showcasing documentary features and shorts with industry talks and events.

name: Perang Pandan (Pandanus War)
desc: A unique coming-of-age warrior ritual where men duel with thorny pandanus leaves in one of Bali's oldest villages.
details: A mass coming-of-age ritual unique to Tenganan, one of Bali's oldest and most preserved villages. Male villagers battle each other armed with a rattan shield and packets of thorny pandan leaves, dedicated to the Hindu god of war. The village follows its own calendar, making dates unpredictable but the experience unforgettable.

name: Testour Malouf Festival
desc: Festival of malouf Andalusian music in the historic Moorish town of Testour.
details: The Testour Malouf Festival celebrates the Andalusian musical traditions brought to Tunisia by Moorish refugees from Spain. The historic town of Testour, with its distinctive Andalusian architecture, provides an atmospheric setting for this refined musical heritage.

name: Thessaloniki International Film Festival
desc: Southeastern Europe's leading film festival.
details: TIFF is Greece's leading film event, showcasing international and Greek cinema with industry events, retrospectives, and the Golden Alexander award.

name: Festival de la Cerveza Artesanal
desc: Tijuana craft beer festival celebrating Baja California's thriving craft beer scene.
details: Tijuana has emerged as one of Mexico's craft beer capitals, and its beer festivals showcase dozens of local breweries alongside live music and Baja street food in the vibrant border city.

name: Moussem of Sidi Ahmed ou Moussa
desc: Acrobatic moussem featuring the famous Sidi Ahmed ou Moussa acrobats.
details: This moussem in Tiznit features the famous acrobats of Sidi Ahmed ou Moussa, who perform spectacular pyramid formations and tumbling acts. The tradition dates back centuries and combines religious devotion with extraordinary physical performance.

name: Feria de Todos Santos
desc: Arts and culture festival in the bohemian Pacific coast town of Todos Santos.
details: The magical town of Todos Santos hosts arts and cultural events celebrating its reputation as an artist colony, with gallery openings, music, culinary events, and Day of the Dead celebrations in this charming Baja California Sur pueblo.

name: Luminato x Pride
desc: Intersection of Toronto's arts festival and Pride celebrations creating a month of cultural events.
details: When Luminato arts programming overlaps with Pride Month in Toronto, the city becomes a nexus of art, culture, and celebration, with exhibitions, performances, and events that celebrate both artistic innovation and LGBTQ+ identity.

name: Grand Magal de Touba
desc: Senegal's largest religious pilgrimage with millions converging on the holy city of Touba.
details: The Grand Magal de Touba is Senegal's biggest annual religious event, a Mouride Muslim pilgrimage that draws 3-5 million devotees to the holy city of Touba. Pilgrims visit the Great Mosque, pray, recite religious texts, and share communal meals in an extraordinary display of faith.

name: Tucumcari Rattlesnake Roundup
desc: Quirky New Mexico tradition featuring rattlesnake displays, Route 66 culture, and western heritage.
details: This small-town festival along historic Route 66 celebrates the unique intersection of desert wildlife and western culture with rattlesnake handling demonstrations, arts and crafts, live music, and quintessential Route 66 Americana.

name: Sea Star Festival
desc: Dance music festival on the Adriatic coast in Umag.
details: Sea Star brings electronic and dance music to the beautiful Stella Maris lagoon in Umag, with international DJs and the Adriatic Sea as backdrop.

name: Nits d'Estiu Valencia
desc: Summer nights festival of music, cinema, and performance in Valencia's gardens.
details: Valencia's Vivers gardens host open-air concerts, cinema screenings, and performances through the warm summer nights.

name: Notte Bianca Malta
desc: Malta's White Night cultural celebration in Valletta.
details: Notte Bianca opens Valletta's museums, churches, and cultural venues for a free night of art, music, and performance in the Baroque capital.

name: Vancouver Folk Music Festival
desc: Three-day folk festival at Jericho Beach Park with ocean and mountain views.
details: Set at Jericho Beach Park with stunning views of the Pacific Ocean, mountains, and city skyline, the Vancouver Folk Music Festival features diverse folk, roots, and world music on multiple stages. The festival's beachside setting, daytime workshops, and evening concerts create a uniquely West Coast folk festival experience.

name: Vogalonga Regatta
desc: Vogalonga Regatta — noncompetitive rowing "race" celebrating traditional Venetian boats
details: noncompetitive rowing "race" celebrating traditional Venetian boats

name: Festival Afro-Caribeño Veracruz
desc: Celebration of Veracruz's Afro-Caribbean heritage with music, dance, and culinary traditions.
details: Veracruz celebrates its Afro-Caribbean roots with festivals featuring son jarocho, danzón, cumbia, and other musical traditions that reflect the port city's multicultural identity. Traditional food, dance workshops, and cultural exhibitions highlight the African influence on Mexican Gulf Coast culture.

name: Tomàtec de Vic
desc: Catalan market town festival featuring the Mercat del Ram spring fair.
details: Vic hosts traditional festivals throughout the year, including the Mercat del Ram, one of Catalonia's oldest fairs, alongside its famous medieval market.

name: Vienna Jazz Festival
desc: Jazz in Vienna's historic venues from the State Opera to open-air stages.
details: Jazz Fest Wien presents jazz, blues, and world music in Vienna's most prestigious venues including the State Opera, Konzerthaus, and atmospheric outdoor locations.

name: Jazz à Vienne
desc: Major jazz festival in a Roman amphitheatre seating 7,000.
details: Jazz à Vienne hosts world-class jazz, blues, and soul artists in the spectacular Théâtre Antique, a Roman-era amphitheatre, creating one of Europe's most atmospheric jazz experiences.

name: Vogan Drums Festival
desc: Traditional drumming festival in Vogan celebrating Ewe percussion heritage.
details: The Vogan Drums Festival celebrates the extraordinary Ewe drumming traditions of southern Togo. Master drummers perform complex polyrhythmic patterns on agbadja, atsimevu, and other traditional drums in one of West Africa's richest percussion cultures.

name: Wangaratta Jazz Festival
desc: Premier Australian jazz festival attracting national and international artists to northeast Victoria.
details: The Wangaratta Festival of Jazz has been a cornerstone of the Australian jazz calendar for over three decades. Held across multiple venues in the town, it showcases established and emerging jazz artists in intimate settings.

name: Wellington Jazz Festival
desc: Wellington's celebrated jazz festival showcasing NZ and international jazz artists across the capital.
details: The Wellington Jazz Festival brings world-class jazz to the compact capital city. Multiple venues across Wellington host performances ranging from traditional jazz to contemporary fusion, with both established international artists and rising New Zealand talent.

name: Namibian Arts Association Annual Exhibition
desc: Namibia's oldest and most prestigious visual arts exhibition.
details: The Namibian Arts Association Annual Exhibition, running since 1947, is the country's oldest and most important visual arts showcase. It features paintings, sculpture, printmaking, and mixed media by Namibian and Southern African artists.

name: Winnipeg International Writers Festival (Thin Air)
desc: Literary festival featuring Canadian and international authors in Winnipeg's Exchange District.
details: Thin Air: Winnipeg International Writers Festival brings Canadian and international authors for readings, conversations, and workshops in the historic Exchange District, celebrating the written word in one of Canada's most literary cities.

name: Yokohama Triennale (9th edition)
desc: One of Japan's premier international art festivals, held triennially since 2001 at Yokohama Museum of Art.
details: The Yokohama Triennale is held every three years since 2001. The 8th edition was in 2024, making the 9th expected in 2027. Features internationally prominent and emerging artists across video, installation, and performance.

name: Día de la Tradición
desc: Celebration of Argentine gaucho culture and heritage honoring author José Hernández.
details: Celebrated November 10 each year, marking the birth of José Hernández (1834), author of "El gaucho Martín Fierro," Argentina's most representative literary work. Traditional gaucho activities and commemorations throughout the country honor gaucho culture. Not yet a national holiday but significant cultural date with many celebrations.

name: Rendez-vous de la Francophonie
desc: Pan-Canadian celebration of French language and Francophone cultures.
details: Les Rendez-vous de la Francophonie is a month of events celebrating French language and culture across Canada, with concerts, theater, film screenings, and cultural events in communities from coast to coast.

name: Double Ninth Festival (Chongyang)
desc: Autumn festival for climbing heights, drinking chrysanthemum wine, and honoring elders.
details: The Double Ninth Festival falls on the 9th day of the 9th lunar month. Traditions include climbing mountains or high places for good luck, drinking chrysanthemum wine, wearing zhuyu (dogwood) branches, and eating Chongyang cake. The festival is also designated as Senior Citizens' Day in China. Mountain parks and scenic lookouts host special celebrations.

name: Fête de la Saint-Jean
desc: Traditional midsummer bonfire celebrations across France.
details: Saint-Jean fires are lit across France on the evening of June 24, with communities gathering around bonfires for music, dancing, and celebration of the summer solstice.

name: Icelandic National Day
desc: Iceland's independence day celebrated with parades, live music, street performances, and family festivities across the country.
details: June 17 marks Icelandic independence (1944) and is celebrated nationwide with parades, speeches, live music, and street festivities. In Reykjavík, the celebrations centre on the city centre with performers, food stalls, and family-friendly activities throughout the day.

name: Good Friday
desc: Good Friday — processions across Italy, including Procession of I Misteri in Trapani, Sicily
details: processions across Italy, including Procession of I Misteri in Trapani, Sicily

name: Ivrea Carnevale
desc: Ivrea Carnevale — orange-throwing free-for-all on last three days; smaller festivities in week prior
details: orange-throwing free-for-all on last three days; smaller festivities in week prior

name: Sts. Peter and Paul Day
desc: Sts. Peter and Paul Day — most fervently celebrated in Rome with fireworks and flower carpet in St. Peter's Square, and with three-day festival in Modica, Sicily
details: most fervently celebrated in Rome with fireworks and flower carpet in St. Peter's Square, and with three-day festival in Modica, Sicily

name: Sabantuy
desc: Traditional Tatar and Bashkir festival marking end of spring sowing with wrestling and folk music.
details: Traditional festival marking end of spring sowing season. Features wrestling (crown jewel), traditional games, competitions, sports, music, dance with Tatar folk songs on traditional instruments (qobyz, kurai). Celebrations progress from villages to districts to major cities.

name: Baltica International Folklore Festival
desc: Week-long celebration of Baltic cultural traditions rotating among Estonia, Latvia, and Lithuania—a UNESCO heritage event.
details: The Baltica Festival brings together musicians, dancers, and craftspeople from across the Baltic region. Performances unfold in historic squares and public spaces, offering a concentrated look at regional folk traditions from all three Baltic states. This UNESCO-recognised event rotates host countries.

name: Igbo Landing Festival
desc: Cultural celebration of Igbo heritage with masquerade displays, wrestling, and traditional ceremonies.
details: Igbo cultural festivals across southeastern Nigeria feature elaborate masquerade displays (mmanwu), traditional wrestling competitions (mgba), new yam ceremonies, and vibrant cultural performances that celebrate the rich heritage of the Igbo people.

name: Assumption Day
desc: Assumption Day — Assunção de Nossa Senhora; religious processions, closures
details: Assunção de Nossa Senhora; religious processions, closures

name: Holy Week
desc: Holy Week — Semana Santa; religious processions, especially in Braga and Óbidos
details: Semana Santa; religious processions, especially in Braga and Óbidos

name: Noche de San Juan
desc: Midsummer eve bonfires across Spanish beaches and towns.
details: On the shortest night of the year, Spaniards light bonfires on beaches, jump waves for good luck, and burn written wishes. Major celebrations in Alicante, Barcelona, and A Coruña.

name: Nit de Sant Joan/Hogueras de San Juan
desc: Nit de Sant Joan/Hogueras de San Juan — Festival of St. John the Baptist), primarily in Alicante, Valencia, and across Catalunya (bonfires and fireworks on June 23, closures in Catalunya and Valencia on June 24
details: Festival of St. John the Baptist), primarily in Alicante, Valencia, and across Catalunya (bonfires and fireworks on June 23, closures in Catalunya and Valencia on June 24

name: European Total Solar Eclipse
desc: First totality in mainland Europe since 1999.
details: The path of totality sweeps through Greenland, Iceland, and makes major landfall in mainland Spain.

name: Semana de Turismo (holiday week)
desc: Major domestic travel and event week; many local festivals and gatherings take place nationwide.

name: Folklorico Festival (Multiple US Cities)
desc: Traditional Mexican folk dance performances and competitions celebrating regional dance traditions across the US.
details: Folklorico festivals across the United States celebrate the vibrant tradition of Mexican folk dance, with troupes performing regional dances from Jalisco, Veracruz, Oaxaca, and other Mexican states. Major events take place in cities with large Mexican-American communities including Los Angeles, Houston, San Antonio, and Chicago.

name: Quema de Judas - Nationwide
desc: Easter Sunday tradition where effigies of Judas are hanged and burned in streets as symbolic punishment of betrayal and popular expression.
details: One of Venezuela's oldest folklorish traditions representing symbolic punishment of betrayal. Figure made of rags, newspapers, old clothes hanged and publicly burned on Easter Sunday evening in streets, plazas, corners. Original Christian meaning evolved to become powerful form of popular expression charged with social, political, humorous criticism. Modern practice: effigies represent unpopular characters, authorities, controversial figures, community-deemed offenders. Many carry names, last names, caricatures of real people. Local/neighborhood organized tradition.

name: Amman International Film Festival
desc: The sixth edition of Jordan's premier film festival with a special focus on Arab cinema and international selections.
details: Now in its sixth year, AIFF features films from around the world with a special focus on Arab cinema. Screenings, panel discussions, and filmmaker Q&As take place across venues in the Jordanian capital, supporting the region's growing independent film scene.

name: Amman Design Week
desc: Design festival exploring the intersection of design, technology, and social impact in Jordan.
details: Features exhibitions, talks, workshops, and installations showcasing Jordanian and regional designers at venues across Amman.

name: KARAMA Human Rights Film Festival
desc: Human rights-themed film festival showcasing documentaries and fiction films about dignity and justice.
details: Features films addressing human rights issues across the Arab world and internationally, with discussions and workshops.

name: Baku Jazz Festival
desc: Annual jazz festival with 'I AM JAZZMAN!' young talent competition (April 15-30).
details: Annual jazz festival in Azerbaijan's capital. Includes 'I AM JAZZMAN!' young talent jazz competition (April 15-30, 2026). Showcases international jazz performers and emerging Azerbaijani musicians.

name: International Mugham Festival
desc: Celebration of Azerbaijan's complex traditional vocal art combining singing, poetry, and improvisation.
details: Celebrates mugham, Azerbaijan's complex traditional vocal art form. Features performances by young and established musicians. Held at concert venues in Baku.

name: Ogoh-ogoh parade (Nyepi eve)
desc: Eve-of-Nyepi parades featuring giant demon effigies (ogoh-ogoh) carried through streets.

name: Beirut International Film Festival
desc: International film festival showcasing Lebanese, Arab, and world cinema in Beirut's cultural venues.
details: Features screenings, workshops, and industry events celebrating cinema from Lebanon and around the world.

name: Carnival
desc: Rapidly growing bloco scene with themed street parades.

name: Casablanca Biennale
desc: A contemporary art biennial in Morocco's largest city, contributing to the growing North African art scene.
details: The Biennale Internationale de Casablanca is part of Morocco's expanding contemporary art infrastructure alongside the Marrakech Biennale and 1-54 art fair. Morocco has emerged as an active artistic center.

name: Copenhagen Cooking & Food Festival
desc: Ten-day culinary extravaganza celebrating the best of Danish and Nordic gastronomy across the capital.
details: This premier food festival features tastings, cooking demonstrations, food markets, and unique dining events at restaurants throughout Copenhagen. It showcases the innovation and quality of the New Nordic cuisine movement, from Michelin-starred restaurants to street food innovators.

name: Battle of the Flowers
desc: Battle of the Flowers — major parade with flower-bedecked floats
details: major parade with flower-bedecked floats

name: Da Lat Flower Festival
desc: Spectacular floral displays, cultural performances, and art exhibitions in Vietnam's romantic mountain city.
details: Da Lat's biennial flower festival transforms the highland city into a floral wonderland. The event features massive flower displays, cultural performances, traditional craft exhibitions, and local gastronomy showcases. The cool mountain climate and French colonial architecture create a unique romantic atmosphere.

name: Rann Utsav (Kutch Festival)
desc: Desert cultural festival with crafts, music, dance and stargazing around the White Rann.

name: Dark Sky Discovery Center
desc: Major astronomical observatory and museum opens.
details: Includes a state-of-the-art tilted-dome planetarium dedicated to promoting global dark-sky preservation.

name: Apfelwein Festival
desc: Frankfurt's beloved apple wine festival along the banks of the River Main.
details: The Apfelweinfest transforms the south bank of the Main into a celebration of Frankfurt's signature drink. Dozens of stalls serve apple wine in the traditional Bembel pitcher alongside local specialties and live music.

name: UBS Digital Art Museum
desc: Europe's largest digital art institution opens.
details: Features permanent, boundary-dissolving interactive installations by the renowned collective teamLab.

name: Orange Blossom Festival
desc: Festival season centered on orange blossoms in the Cap Bon area.

name: Hatta Cultural Nights
desc: Heritage and cultural events in the mountain enclave of Hatta with traditional Emirati activities.
details: Features traditional Emirati performances, local crafts, heritage walks, and mountain-based outdoor activities in Dubai's mountain enclave.

name: Havana Biennial
desc: A pioneering biennial founded in 1984 that prioritizes artists from Latin America, the Caribbean, and the Global South.
details: The Bienal de La Habana was founded in 1984 by the Wifredo Lam Center, rejecting Western-centric models. The 15th edition ran November 2024 to February 2025. Given the biennial cycle, a 16th edition could occur in late 2026. Cuba's economic crisis and ongoing artist repression provide a challenging backdrop.

name: Hawaii International Film Festival
desc: The premier film festival in the Pacific region, bridging East and West cinema.
details: HIFF is the leading film festival dedicated to Pacific Rim cinema, screening films from Asia, the Pacific Islands, and the Americas. Its unique geographic position makes it a natural bridge between Eastern and Western filmmaking traditions.

name: Jaisalmer Desert Festival
desc: A magical celebration of Rajasthani culture in the golden sands of the Thar Desert with camel polo, folk music, and turban-tying contests.
details: Set against the stunning backdrop of Jaisalmer's golden sandstone fort and the vast Thar Desert, this three-day festival showcases Rajasthani folk music, camel polo, turban-tying competitions, Mr. Desert pageant, and traditional dance under the stars in the Sam Sand Dunes.

name: Makepung Buffalo Races
desc: A thrilling and muddy Balinese tradition of racing colorfully decorated water buffaloes through wet rice paddies.
details: Held in Jembrana, West Bali, Makepung features farmers racing colorful, decorated water buffaloes down wet, muddy racetracks. The main Governor's Cup finals in mid-November are the highlight. It's a vibrant cultural spectacle vastly different from the serene temple scenes typically associated with Bali.

name: Karlovy Vary International Film Festival
desc: The most important 'A-list' film festival in Central and Eastern Europe.
details: Set in a historic spa town, the festival possesses a unique, highly egalitarian atmosphere, drawing massive crowds of young backpackers alongside Hollywood royalty. It is the definitive showcase for Eastern European cinema.

name: Kishiwada Danjiri Matsuri
desc: Neighborhood teams pull heavy danjiri floats at speed through city streets.

name: Rann Utsav
desc: A seasonal festival on the white desert of Kutch featuring folk performances, handicraft exhibitions, and full moon nights on the salt flats.
details: The Rann Utsav celebrates the culture and traditions of the Kutch region against the otherworldly landscape of India's White Desert. Full moon nights on the vast salt flats are surreal, complemented by traditional Kutchi folk music, handicraft markets, adventure activities, and luxury tent accommodations.

name: Lagos Fashion Week
desc: West Africa's biggest fashion event showcasing Nigerian and African designers on the global stage.
details: Lagos Fashion Week is West Africa's most prestigious fashion event, featuring runway shows from Nigeria's top designers alongside emerging talent. It positions Lagos as a global fashion capital and showcases the creativity of African fashion.

name: Up Helly Aa
desc: Viking-themed torchlight procession and galley burning with costumes and community revelry.

name: Lewa Safari Marathon
desc: Marathon through a rhino conservancy with armed rangers as security against wildlife encounters.
details: The Lewa Safari Marathon takes place in the Lewa Wildlife Conservancy among rhinos, elephants, and lions. Armed rangers line the route for runner safety. Proceeds support wildlife conservation. It's considered one of the top 10 marathons in the world.

name: IndieLisboa Film Festival
desc: A vibrant festival focusing on independent cinema and discovering new directors.
details: IndieLisboa screens films outside the mainstream distribution circuit, offering a vital platform for young Portuguese filmmakers and bringing the global avant-garde to an enthusiastic, youthful audience in Lisbon.

name: 1-54 Contemporary African Art Fair
desc: Major contemporary African art fair held at La Mamounia hotel in Marrakech.
details: 1-54 (named for one continent, 54 countries) is a prestigious contemporary African art fair. The Marrakech edition, held at the legendary La Mamounia hotel, showcases galleries specializing in contemporary art from Africa and its diaspora.

name: Sacred Music Festival
desc: International sacred music performances in Morelia's magnificent colonial churches.
details: Morelia's stunning colonial churches and cathedral serve as venues for performances of sacred music from around the world, from Gregorian chant to gospel to Sufi devotional music, creating an extraordinary spiritual and aesthetic experience.

name: Clio Art Fair
desc: Dubbed 'The Anti-Fair for Independent Artists' in NYC.
details: Targeting artists without exclusive gallery representation, this Chelsea-based event provides a crucial platform for marginalized or independent voices to reach major collectors.

name: Hong Kong Dragon Boat Festival in New York
desc: Large dragon boat racing weekend celebrating Chinese culture with performances and family activities.

name: Ohrid Summer of Culture
desc: Summer cultural programme in the UNESCO lakeside town.
details: Ohrid's summer programme includes music, theatre, and art events in the ancient theatre and churches of this UNESCO World Heritage site on Europe's oldest lake.

name: Paris Book Festival (Festival du Livre)
desc: Major literary festival at the Grand Palais bridging literature and arts.
details: The Festival du Livre de Paris at the Grand Palais brings publishers, authors, and readers together for readings, signings, and literary discussions.

name: Paso Robles Wine Festival
desc: California's Central Coast wine celebration with 200+ wineries, concerts, and gourmet events.
details: The Paso Robles Wine Festival showcases over 200 wineries from one of California's fastest-growing wine regions with grand tastings in the charming downtown park, winemaker dinners, vineyard tours, and live entertainment.

name: Festival de Invierno (Winter Festival)
desc: Cultural festival featuring local music and dance groups and traditional foods in the mountainous eastern region of El Salvador.
details: The Festival de Invierno (Winter Festival) takes place year-round in Perquín, El Salvador in the eastern mountainous region. The festival features local music and dance groups, traditional food, and cultural celebrations. This event showcases the region's authentic character and heritage. Perquín is located in the cooler highlands, offering a different experience from coastal festivals, with mountain scenery and community-centered celebrations.

name: Bon Om Touk (Water Festival)
desc: Boat races and night festivities celebrating the river current reversal on Tonlé Sap.

name: Feast of St. Ranieri
desc: Feast of St. Ranieri — illuminated facades, candles on the Arno, fireworks, regatta
details: illuminated facades, candles on the Arno, fireworks, regatta

name: Portland International Film Festival
desc: Oregon's premier film event screening 100+ films from 40+ countries.
details: The Portland International Film Festival screens over 100 international films, documentaries, and shorts from 40+ countries in theaters across Portland. The festival is known for championing world cinema and providing access to films that might not otherwise reach American audiences.

name: Prince Edward County Jazz Festival
desc: Jazz festival in Ontario's charming wine country.
details: The Prince Edward County Jazz Festival combines world-class jazz performances with the pleasures of Ontario's premier wine region, with concerts in wineries, galleries, and outdoor stages among rolling vineyards.

name: Chernobyl 40th Anniversary
desc: 40 years since the devastating nuclear reactor meltdown.
details: Solemn memorials emphasizing the severe long-term ecological and human costs of the world's worst nuclear energy disaster.

name: Carnival
desc: Frevo music, giant puppets, and citywide street parties.

name: RIBOCA – Riga International Biennial
desc: A forward-thinking art platform founded in 2016 exploring contemporary concerns in the Baltic context.
details: RIBOCA creates opportunities for artists to engage with Riga's cultural context through newly commissioned works. RIBOCA3 was disrupted by the Russian invasion of Ukraine. A fourth edition has not been announced but the platform continues to operate.

name: World Creole Music Festival
desc: Three nights of zouk, compas, cadence-lypso, and global creole music celebrating Francophone Caribbean identity.
details: Celebrates Francophone Caribbean creole identity through explosive music — zouk, compas, cadence-lypso, bouyon, creole jazz from the Caribbean, Africa, and Indian Ocean. Part of Dominica's Creole Day celebrations emphasizing distinct French-influenced Caribbean culture.

name: Super Bowl LX
desc: The championship game of the NFL and the largest annual television event in the United States.
details: Hosted at Levi's Stadium, the Super Bowl is an unparalleled cultural phenomenon combining elite sports with massive corporate advertising and musical spectacle during the halftime show.

name: Santa Fe Film Festival
desc: Independent film festival in the arts capital of the Southwest.
details: The Santa Fe Film Festival screens independent and international films in venues across the culturally rich city of Santa Fe, with filmmaker Q&As, industry panels, and special events celebrating cinema in the heart of the American Southwest.

name: Sapporo Yosakoi Sōran Festival
desc: High-energy dance festival blending yosakoi choreography with Sōran-bushi music.

name: Savannah Film Festival
desc: Film festival presented by SCAD showcasing features, documentaries, and animated films.
details: The Savannah Film Festival, presented by the Savannah College of Art and Design (SCAD), screens over 150 films and hosts industry panels, workshops, and celebrity tributes in the beautiful historic district of Savannah.

name: Sedona International Film Festival
desc: Independent film festival set among the stunning red rock formations of Sedona.
details: The Sedona Film Festival screens over 160 films from 30+ countries against the backdrop of Sedona's magnificent red rock landscape. Filmmakers mingle with audiences in an intimate small-town setting that fosters genuine connections between artists and viewers.

name: Shandur Polo Festival
desc: High-altitude polo tournament and cultural gathering with music and camping.

name: Borneo Cultural Festival
desc: Multi-ethnic cultural performances, food stalls and heritage showcases in Sarawak.

name: Angkor Sankranta
desc: New Year celebrations near Angkor with performances, games and cultural showcases.

name: Thaipusam
desc: Tamil Hindu festival with kavadi processions and temple rituals; major pilgrimage to Batu Caves in Malaysia.

name: Cap Go Meh Singkawang
desc: Chinese-Indonesian festival with parades and Tatung spirit-medium performances.

name: Le Infiorate
desc: Le Infiorate — giant flower-carpet competition near Assisi; similar infiorate are also common elsewhere in Italy this weekend
details: giant flower-carpet competition near Assisi; similar infiorate are also common elsewhere in Italy this weekend

name: Sur Sailing Festival
desc: Traditional sailing festival celebrating Oman's dhow-building and maritime heritage.
details: Features traditional dhow races, maritime heritage displays, and cultural celebrations in the historic port city of Sur.

name: Tanjazz (Tangier Jazz Festival)
desc: Jazz festival in the legendary cosmopolitan city of Tangier.
details: Tanjazz transforms the legendary city of Tangier into a jazz hub with performances in intimate venues, open-air stages, and historic buildings. The festival celebrates Tangier's cosmopolitan heritage as a meeting point between Africa and Europe.

name: Heritage Classic (Outdoor NHL Game)
desc: Outdoor NHL hockey game in a stadium or iconic setting, a Canadian cultural experience beyond sport.
details: The NHL Heritage Classic series stages regular season games outdoors in Canadian cities, transforming football stadiums or unique venues into open-air hockey arenas. The combination of Canada's national sport played in winter elements creates a uniquely Canadian cultural spectacle.

name: Thrissur Pooram
desc: Famous Kerala temple festival known for caparisoned elephants, percussion ensembles and fireworks.

name: Tripoli International Fair
desc: Historic trade fair in Libya's capital, one of the oldest in Africa when held.
details: The Tripoli International Fair is one of Africa's oldest trade exhibitions when conditions allow it to be held. It showcases Libyan and international businesses, cultural exhibits, and entertainment, though its operation depends on the political situation.

name: Tromsø International Film Festival
desc: International film festival with a unique Arctic atmosphere, screening diverse global cinema during the polar night.
details: The Tromsø International Film Festival screens films from around the world in a uniquely Arctic setting during the polar night. The combination of world cinema and the dark, snow-covered Arctic city creates an atmosphere found nowhere else. It draws both industry professionals and enthusiastic local audiences.

name: Waterford Spraoi Festival
desc: Ireland's premier street arts festival featuring spectacular outdoor performances and pyrotechnics.
details: Spraoi (Irish for 'fun') transforms Waterford's Viking Triangle with giant puppets, aerial performers, pyrotechnic shows, and international street theatre companies. The free festival culminates in a spectacular fireworks finale.

name: Finger Lakes Wine Festival
desc: Celebration of New York's premier wine region with 80+ wineries, live music, and culinary events.
details: The Finger Lakes Wine Festival brings together over 80 wineries from the Finger Lakes region for tastings, seminars, and culinary pairings at Watkins Glen International raceway. Live music stages, artisan vendors, and hands-on wine experiences complement the tastings.

name: Festival of India (Multiple Canadian Cities)
desc: Hindu cultural festival celebrations featuring music, dance, and vegetarian cuisine across Canadian cities.
details: Festival of India events across Canadian cities celebrate Hindu culture with classical Indian music and dance performances, vegetarian feasts, yoga demonstrations, and spiritual teachings, reflecting Canada's vibrant South Asian community.

name: Avocado Festival
desc: Celebration of New Caledonia's avocado harvest with food, music, and Kanak cultural activities.
details: The Avocado Festival celebrates the local harvest with cooking competitions, tastings, traditional Kanak cultural performances, and markets showcasing New Caledonia's unique blend of French and Melanesian culture.

name: Feria de las Flores (Medellin-style in US)
desc: Colombian flower festival celebrations in US cities with significant Colombian diaspora communities.
details: Colombian communities across the US celebrate Feria de las Flores with flower-themed events, Colombian music and dance, food festivals, and silletero (flower-carrier) displays honoring the famous Medellin tradition.

name: Adana Golden Boll Film Festival
desc: Major Turkish film festival in Adana known for promoting Turkish cinema.
details: One of Turkey's important film festivals promoting Turkish cinema with competition screenings, workshops, and industry events.

name: Djibouti Afar Dance Festival
desc: Traditional Afar dance performances featuring the distinctive dague warrior dance.
details: Afar cultural celebrations in Djibouti feature the distinctive dague warrior dance, where men leap and bob while women clap and sing. The performances celebrate Afar identity and traditions in one of Africa's least-visited countries.

name: Star of Asia
desc: Open-air music festival at world's highest-altitude skating rink Medeu.
details: Open-air music project continuing Asia Dauysy traditions at Medeu skating rink, the world's highest altitude rink. Features diverse music styles, flash mobs, and dance battles.

name: AZIMUTH Festival
desc: An electrifying music festival against AlUla's stunning desert backdrop featuring international and Saudi artists curated by MDLBEAST.
details: Set against the dramatic Thanaya rock formations, AZIMUTH brings together local and international artists for jaw-dropping stage designs, roaming performances, and art installations. Curated by MDLBEAST, it combines music with pop-up restaurants, immersive art, and Instagramable moments under AlUla's cinematic desert sky. Past lineups included Christian Löffler and London Grammar.

name: Amman Jazz Festival
desc: Annual jazz festival featuring regional and international jazz musicians in Amman's cultural venues.
details: Features jazz performances at venues including the Roman Amphitheatre and cultural centres, bringing together regional and international jazz talent.

name: Bele Chere / Mountain Oasis Electronic Music Summit
desc: Electronic music events in Asheville's vibrant music scene.
details: Asheville's thriving music scene hosts electronic music events and summits that reflect the city's creative and countercultural spirit, bringing DJs and electronic producers to venues across this Blue Ridge Mountain arts haven.

name: Calendimaggio
desc: Calendimaggio — medieval-themed celebration of spring
details: medieval-themed celebration of spring

name: Athens Street Art Festival
desc: Ongoing street art scene in Athens' vibrant Exarchia and Psyrri neighbourhoods.
details: Athens has become a global street art capital, with murals covering buildings across Exarchia, Psyrri, and Metaxourgeio. Walking tours and organised events showcase this living gallery.

name: Lim Festival
desc: Traditional quan họ folk singing performances and village festivities.

name: Cape Verde Music Festival
desc: Free three-day music festival on the beach celebrating Cape Verdean music and culture.
details: The Baia das Gatas Music Festival is a free three-day event held on a beautiful beach near Mindelo, São Vicente. It features live performances of morna, coladeira, funaná, and batuque music styles alongside international acts, drawing thousands of music lovers to this stunning Atlantic setting.

name: Nestinari
desc: Nestinari — fire-walking rituals
details: fire-walking rituals

name: Dogon Mask Festival (Dama)
desc: Sacred Dogon funeral masquerade ceremony on the Bandiagara Escarpment.
details: The Dama ceremony of the Dogon people is a sacred funeral masquerade held on the spectacular Bandiagara Escarpment (UNESCO World Heritage Site). Masked dancers representing different animals and spirits perform to guide the deceased's soul to the afterlife. It is one of Africa's most visually striking ceremonies.

name: Bangkok International Festival of Dance & Music
desc: Performances by international dance companies, orchestras and cultural ensembles.

name: Bangui Cultural Festival
desc: Cultural festival in the CAR capital showcasing the country's diverse ethnic traditions.
details: Bangui's cultural festival brings together representatives from the Central African Republic's diverse ethnic groups for performances of traditional music, dance, and crafts, promoting unity through cultural expression.

name: International Puppet Festival
desc: International puppetry and visual theatre festival.
details: Barcelona's puppet festival showcases traditional and contemporary puppetry from around the world, with street performances and theatre shows for all ages.

name: Radici del Sud
desc: A focused exhibition highlighting the native grape varieties and olive oils of Southern Italy.
details: This event fiercely champions the unique terroir of regions like Puglia, Sicily, and Campania. It brings international journalists and buyers to taste indigenous wines that are often overshadowed by Northern Italian giants.

name: Singapore Night Festival
desc: Night-time arts festival with projection mapping, performances and street programming.

name: Sufi Mawlid al-Hussein
desc: Cairo's largest Sufi celebration with mystical chanting, whirling, and devotional processions.
details: The Mawlid al-Hussein in Cairo is one of Egypt's biggest Sufi celebrations, honoring the Prophet Muhammad's grandson. Streets fill with processions, devotional chants (dhikr), ecstatic Sufi dancing, food sharing, and carnival-like festivities around the Al-Hussein Mosque in Islamic Cairo.

name: Decorex Cape Town
desc: Africa's premier interior design and décor exhibition.
details: Decorex Cape Town is Africa's leading interior design, décor, and lifestyle exhibition, showcasing the latest trends in home décor, architecture, and design from South African and international designers.

name: Suidoosterfees
desc: Afrikaans arts festival on the slopes of Table Mountain.
details: The Suidoosterfees is an Afrikaans arts festival held in various venues on the slopes of Table Mountain in the Southern Suburbs of Cape Town. It features theatre, cabaret, music, comedy, and visual arts.

name: Carinthian Summer
desc: Carinthian Summer — traditional and contemporary music festival
details: traditional and contemporary music festival

name: Sufi Music & Cultural Festival
desc: A spiritual and musical journey through Sufi traditions in Morocco's famous blue city.
details: Held in the enchanting blue-washed city of Chefchaouen, this festival offers mesmerizing Sufi music performances, spiritual workshops, and cultural exchanges. The magical setting of blue-painted buildings provides a contemplative backdrop for this deeply moving musical and spiritual experience.

name: Chemainus Theatre Festival
desc: Professional theater in the famous mural town of Chemainus on Vancouver Island.
details: The Chemainus Theatre presents professional productions year-round in the famous mural town of Chemainus on Vancouver Island, combining live theater with the town's remarkable outdoor mural gallery.

name: Chiang Mai Flower Festival
desc: Flower floats, parades and floral displays marking Chiang Mai’s cool-season bloom.

name: Chuncheon International Mime Festival
desc: Street performances and mime/theatre events in venues and public squares.

name: Semana Santa (processions)
desc: Colonial Comayagua hosts notable Holy Week processions and street carpets.

name: Guinea Arts Festival (FARI)
desc: West African arts festival showcasing Guinea's legendary musical and dance traditions.
details: Guinea's annual arts festival celebrates the country's legendary musical and dance heritage, which has been recognized globally through the Ballet Africain. It features traditional drumming, dance performances, visual arts, and contemporary music in Conakry.

name: Currumbin Wildlife Festival of Flight
desc: Month-long celebration of migratory shorebirds with guided walks and conservation education.
details: The Festival of Flight celebrates the annual arrival of migratory shorebirds at the Currumbin Wildlife Sanctuary. Guided dawn walks, photography workshops, bird-banding demonstrations, and conservation talks highlight the extraordinary migration journey.

name: Dak'Art Design Week
desc: Design festival showcasing African product, fashion, and interior design alongside the creative economy.
details: Dak'Art Design Week brings together designers, architects, and creatives from across Africa for exhibitions, workshops, and talks exploring contemporary African design and its role in the creative economy.

name: Schlossgrabenfest
desc: One of Germany's biggest free open-air music festivals.
details: Schlossgrabenfest fills Darmstadt's castle moat area with free concerts across multiple stages, drawing 750,000+ visitors over the Whitsun holiday.

name: Durban Curry Festival
desc: Celebration of Durban's legendary Indian curry traditions.
details: Durban is famous for having one of the largest Indian populations outside India, and its curry culture is legendary. The Durban Curry Festival celebrates this heritage with cooking competitions, tastings of bunny chow and biryanis, and chef demonstrations.

name: Jazz Plaza Festival connection (US-Mexico jazz events)
desc: Jazz festival events in Baja California wine country.
details: Ensenada and the Valle de Guadalupe host jazz events pairing world-class jazz performances with Baja California wines and culinary experiences in a Pacific coast setting.

name: Timbuktu Festival (Festival au Desert - Exile)
desc: Continuation of the legendary Festival au Desert held in exile due to ongoing security concerns in northern Mali.
details: Since the suspension of the Festival au Desert in Timbuktu in 2012 due to jihadist occupation, organizers have held smaller 'in exile' editions in Burkina Faso and other locations to keep the spirit of Tuareg desert music alive.

name: Sundance Square Festival
desc: Year-round outdoor entertainment and cultural events in Fort Worth's vibrant downtown plaza.
details: Sundance Square in downtown Fort Worth hosts year-round cultural events including outdoor movie nights, live music series, art exhibitions, holiday celebrations, and community festivals in the beautifully designed public plaza surrounded by restaurants and theaters.

name: Galway International Oyster & Seafood Festival
desc: The world's longest-running oyster festival, featuring the World Oyster Opening Championship.
details: For three days, Galway celebrates its famous native oysters with the World Oyster Opening Championship, a seafood trail, a masquerade Mardi Gras, live music, and Guinness pairings in the festive Galway spirit.

name: Saharan Nights Festival
desc: Desert music and cultural festival in the M'zab Valley UNESCO World Heritage Site.
details: The Saharan Nights Festival in the UNESCO-listed M'zab Valley brings together musicians from across the Sahara for concerts under the stars amid the striking Mozabite architecture of Ghardaia.

name: Festival de Otono
desc: Autumn cultural festivals across Guanajuato state preceding the Cervantino.
details: Guanajuato state hosts autumn cultural events in its colonial cities - San Miguel de Allende, Leon, Guanajuato City - leading up to the major Festival Cervantino, with music, art, and culinary events.

name: Hue Festival
desc: A royal spectacle in Vietnam's former imperial capital featuring traditional court music, grand parades, and world art performances.
details: Held biennially in even years, the Hue Festival celebrates the cultural heritage of Vietnam's former imperial capital. Traditional Nha Nhac court music (UNESCO-recognized), grand parades, ao dai fashion shows, martial arts demonstrations, and international art performances unfold across Hue's historic citadel and imperial monuments.

name: Huế Festival
desc: Cultural festival showcasing imperial heritage, performances, parades and international arts.

name: Jakarta Fair (Pekan Raya Jakarta)
desc: Large trade fair with concerts, food, rides and exhibitions celebrating Jakarta’s anniversary.

name: Jekyll Island Shrimp & Grits Festival
desc: A massive, beloved celebration of the iconic Southern culinary dish.
details: Combining family-friendly entertainment, live music, and massive quantities of seafood, the festival pits top Southern chefs against each other in fierce cooking competitions, drawing huge crowds to the historic coastal island.

name: Joburg Film Festival
desc: Johannesburg's main film festival showcasing South African and international cinema.
details: The Joburg Film Festival screens a curated selection of South African, African, and international films at venues across Johannesburg. It includes industry panels, masterclasses, and networking events for filmmakers.

name: San Bushmen Trance Dance
desc: Ancient healing trance dance of the San people, one of humanity's oldest surviving rituals.
details: The San Bushmen trance dance is believed to be one of the oldest continuously practiced rituals on Earth. Healers dance around a fire for hours until entering a trance state to heal the sick and commune with the spirit world. The experience is deeply powerful and primal.

name: Kazimierz Dolny Film and Art Festival
desc: An atmospheric arts festival in one of Poland's most picturesque medieval towns.
details: Kazimierz Dolny's annual gathering brings together filmmakers, painters, photographers, and musicians in a stunning Renaissance-era town on the Vistula River. Open-air screenings and gallery exhibitions fill the cobblestoned streets.

name: Musandam Festival
desc: Heritage festival in the remote Musandam peninsula celebrating maritime and mountain traditions.
details: Features traditional boat displays, mountain heritage activities, cultural performances, and local crafts in the dramatic fjord-like landscape of Musandam.

name: Kinshasa Fashion Week
desc: Central Africa's largest fashion event showcasing Congolese and African designers.
details: Kinshasa Fashion Week is Central Africa's most prominent fashion event, featuring collections from Congolese and international designers. It highlights Kinshasa's legendary Sapeur fashion culture and emerging design talent from the DRC.

name: Ngoma Africa Dance Festival
desc: Pan-African dance festival celebrating the diversity of dance traditions across the continent.
details: The Ngoma Africa Dance Festival in Kinshasa brings together dance companies from across Africa to celebrate the continent's extraordinary diversity of dance traditions. From Congolese soukous dancing to contemporary African dance, the festival promotes cross-cultural artistic exchange.

name: Festival of Masks (Ivory Coast)
desc: Secret society mask ceremonies of the Senufo people featuring elaborate wooden and fiber masks.
details: The Senufo people of northern Côte d'Ivoire hold powerful mask ceremonies as part of the Poro secret society initiation process. The masks, representing animals and supernatural beings, are among the most artistically accomplished in all of Africa. Access is by invitation.

name: Coke Live Festival
desc: Kraków's major urban music festival.
details: Coke Live brings international rock, indie, and electronic headliners to Kraków's venues for a high-energy urban festival experience.

name: Bulgarian Cherry Festival
desc: Bulgarian Cherry Festival — procession, fireworks
details: procession, fireworks

name: Corpus Christi traditions
desc: Masses and processions; some regions feature dance and street fairs.

name: Nigeria International Book Fair
desc: The most attended book fair in all of Africa, showcasing publishers from across the continent.
details: The Nigeria International Book Fair is the most attended book fair in Africa, bringing together publishers, authors, and book lovers from across the continent for exhibitions, author talks, book launches, and literary discussions at the University of Lagos.

name: Gaudeamus Baltic Student Song and Dance Festival
desc: 20th edition of the tri-national Baltic student festival, with 3,000-4,000 performers celebrating through choral music and folk dance.
details: The Gaudeamus festival is a cornerstone of Baltic student culture, rotating among Estonia, Latvia, and Lithuania. The 20th edition in 2026 takes place in Latvia and features mass singing, folk dance, instrumental performances, and grand processions involving thousands of university students. The event embodies Baltic cultural identity and the tradition of the Singing Revolution.

name: Deepavali Light-Up
desc: Street light installations and bazaars around Deepavali celebrations in Little India.

name: Loango National Park Cultural Festival
desc: Cultural festival in one of Africa's most biodiverse coastal parks.
details: The Loango cultural festival combines wildlife viewing in one of Africa's most remarkable coastal parks with traditional cultural performances from Gabon's diverse ethnic groups. Visitors might see elephants on the beach alongside traditional dance.

name: Festa delle Camelie
desc: Camellia flower festival on the shores of Lake Maggiore.
details: Locarno's Festa delle Camelie celebrates 1,000+ camellia varieties in bloom along Lake Maggiore with gardens, flower arrangements, and exhibitions.

name: BAFTA Film Awards
desc: The British Academy's massive celebration of global and domestic cinema.
details: Operating as a highly accurate bellwether for the Oscars, the BAFTAs bring intense international focus to the British film industry, acting as a crucial networking and validation event for European filmmakers.

name: Luminarias at the LA River
desc: Arts and culture events along the revitalized Los Angeles River.
details: The LA River has become a focal point for arts and culture events, with luminaria walks, outdoor concerts, art installations, and community festivals celebrating the river's ecological restoration and cultural significance.

name: Luanda Biennale
desc: Contemporary art biennale in Angola's capital showcasing Lusophone African art.
details: The Luanda Biennale features contemporary art from Angola and other Lusophone (Portuguese-speaking) African nations. It provides a platform for Angolan artists alongside creators from Mozambique, Cape Verde, Guinea-Bissau, and São Tomé.

name: Leopolis Jazz Fest
desc: Major jazz festival in Lviv's UNESCO-listed old town (conflict-dependent).
details: Leopolis Jazz Fest presents world-class jazz in the stunning baroque squares of Lviv's UNESCO old town. 2026 status depends on the situation in Ukraine.

name: Macau Grand Prix
desc: Street circuit motor racing event and major tourism draw in Macau.

name: Feast of the Almudena
desc: Feast of the Almudena — processions, music
details: processions, music

name: Bahrain International Music Festival
desc: International music festival featuring diverse genres from classical to contemporary Middle Eastern music.
details: Showcases regional and international musicians at venues across Manama including the Bahrain National Theatre.

name: Manama Gold Souq Festival
desc: Festival celebrating Bahrain's famous gold souq with special promotions and cultural events.
details: Features gold and jewellery promotions, traditional crafts, and cultural events in Bahrain's historic gold market.

name: Maputo Special Reserve Cultural Festival
desc: Conservation and cultural festival at Mozambique's premier wildlife reserve.
details: Maputo Special Reserve hosts cultural events combining wildlife conservation with local Ronga cultural performances, traditional music, and community-based tourism activities.

name: i Light Singapore
desc: Sustainable light-art festival with installations across waterfront and city sites.

name: Formula 1 Singapore Grand Prix
desc: Night street race weekend with concerts and large tourism draw.

name: Satellite Art Show
desc: An aggressively alternative, performance-heavy satellite fair.
details: Known for its chaotic, anti-establishment energy, attracting celebrities and featuring radical immersive experiences, music acts, and boundary-pushing independent collectives.

name: Milano Wine Week
desc: An immersive, city-wide celebration designed to modernize the storytelling of Italian wine.
details: Breaking away from stuffy traditional tastings, the week integrates wine with Milan's fashion, design, and tech sectors. It features massive masterclasses, digital symposiums, and high-end pairing events across the city.

name: 2026 Winter Olympics
desc: The pinnacle of global winter sports competition, returning to the Italian Alps.
details: Featuring 16 disciplines from alpine skiing to ice hockey, the Games will drive massive infrastructural investment in Northern Italy. It serves as a powerful instrument of national pride and a highly lucrative global broadcasting property.

name: Bluebird on the Mountain
desc: Intimate songwriter sessions in the Nashville tradition hosted on a mountain retreat in Monteagle.
details: An extension of Nashville's legendary Bluebird Cafe, these songwriter-in-the-round events bring the intimate listening room experience to a mountaintop retreat, where songwriters share stories behind their songs in an up-close setting.

name: Carnaval de Montevideo (season)
desc: Longest carnival season with murgas, candombe and theater competitions.

name: Festival de Musica Antigua
desc: Early music festival in Morelia's colonial venues.
details: Morelia hosts early music performances in its magnificent colonial churches and theaters, featuring Renaissance, Baroque, and medieval music performed on period instruments in acoustically perfect historic spaces.

name: At Chabysh Horse Races
desc: Long-distance traditional horse races on the Pamir Highway.
details: Long-distance horse races (22km) in the Kyrgyz tradition held in Murghab, eastern Pamirs. Traditional equestrian sport with local and regional participants.

name: N'Djamena Cultural Festival
desc: Cultural celebration in Chad's capital featuring Sara, Arab, and other ethnic group traditions.
details: N'Djamena's cultural festival showcases Chad's remarkable ethnic diversity with traditional performances from the Sara, Arab, Toubou, and other groups, alongside contemporary music and cultural exhibitions.

name: Narooma Oyster Festival
desc: Celebration of the NSW South Coast's famous oysters with shucking competitions and farm tours.
details: The Narooma Oyster Festival showcases the region's pristine oysters with high-speed shucking competitions, oyster farm tours, cooking demonstrations, wine pairings, and live entertainment on the beautiful South Coast.

name: New Colossus Festival
desc: A massive, multi-venue festival in the Lower East Side dedicated to emerging indie bands.
details: Acting as an East Coast precursor to SXSW, the festival crams hundreds of raw, unsigned, and independent bands into small, sweaty clubs, providing a crucial platform for A&R discovery and grassroots musical energy.

name: Performa Biennial
desc: The leading performance art biennial in the US, founded by RoseLee Goldberg in 2004.
details: Performa is held in odd years in New York City. The 2025 edition is the current cycle; next expected 2027. Features performance across visual art, music, dance, and digital media.

name: Festival de Nuits de Maure
desc: Cultural festival celebrating Moorish music, poetry, and traditions in Mauritania's capital.
details: The Festival de Nuits de Maure in Nouakchott celebrates Mauritania's rich Moorish cultural heritage through traditional music, poetry recitals, storytelling, handicraft exhibitions, and cultural discussions reflecting the nomadic Saharan traditions.

name: Hamar Bull Jumping Ceremony
desc: Dramatic coming-of-age ritual where young men must run across the backs of cattle.
details: The Hamar people's bull jumping ceremony in the Omo Valley is one of Ethiopia's most dramatic cultural events. Young men must run naked across the backs of a line of cattle four times without falling to prove they are ready for marriage. Women voluntarily receive ritual whippings to show their devotion.

name: Voodoo Zangbeto Night Ceremony
desc: Mysterious nighttime ceremony featuring the Zangbeto straw guardians patrolling villages.
details: The Zangbeto are the traditional voodoo guardians of the night in the Ouidah region. Large revolving haystacks, believed to be inhabited by spirits, patrol villages at night accompanied by drumming and chanting. Witnessing a Zangbeto ceremony is one of West Africa's most mysterious experiences.

name: Snowball Musical
desc: World premiere of a highly anticipated new musical production.
details: Set against the striking backdrop of the Northern Lights, exploring themes of winter magic, isolation, and local folklore.

name: Hundred Flowers of Chakan (Suzani Festival)
desc: Traditional embroidery competition in the UNESCO World Craft City of Panjakent.
details: Traditional embroidery competition celebrating Tajik suzani (embroidered textiles). Panjakent is a UNESCO World Craft City. Features artisans and designers from across Tajikistan.

name: Xcaret Mexico Espectacular
desc: Spectacular nightly show presenting 500 years of Mexican history through music, dance, and theater.
details: Xcaret's Mexico Espectacular is a nightly performance featuring over 300 artists recreating Mexican history from pre-Hispanic civilizations through modern times. Traditional dances, music, re-enactments of the Mesoamerican ball game, and a spectacular finale of regional dances from across Mexico.

name: Pohang International Fireworks Festival
desc: Fireworks performances and beachside events with international pyrotechnic teams.

name: Carnaval Ponceño
