desc: Masked vejigante characters, parades and concerts in Puerto Rico’s south.

name: Prague Quadrennial of Performance Design and Space
desc: The world's largest event for performance design and space, held every four years in Prague.
details: The Prague Quadrennial brings together set designers, theatre architects, and performance artists from around the world every four years. The last edition was in 2023; next expected in 2027.

name: Noche Mexicana
desc: Weekly celebration of Mexican culture on the Malecon with mariachi, folkloric dance, and fireworks.
details: Puerto Vallarta's weekly Noche Mexicana on the Malecon features live mariachi music, Aztec dancers, folkloric dance performances, traditional food, and fireworks over the bay. This free event captures the essence of Mexican celebration.

name: Rendez-vous des grandes voiliers (Tall Ships Quebec)
desc: Gathering of international tall ships in the old port of Quebec City.
details: When tall ships gather in the historic port of Quebec City beneath the ramparts and the Chateau Frontenac, it creates one of the most photogenic and historically evocative maritime festivals in the world.

name: Tahiti Pearl Regatta
desc: International sailing regatta through the stunning Leeward Islands of French Polynesia.
details: The Tahiti Pearl Regatta is a spectacular sailing event through the turquoise lagoons and open waters of the Leeward Islands — Raiatea, Taha'a, Bora Bora, and Huahine. Sailors from around the world compete amid some of the most beautiful scenery on Earth.

name: Baltics Pride
desc: Rotating Pride celebration across the three Baltic States.
details: Baltic Pride rotates between Tallinn, Riga, and Vilnius, featuring parades, cultural events, and celebrations of LGBTQ+ rights in the Baltic region.

name: Rovinj Jazz Festival
desc: Jazz by the Adriatic in the picturesque fishing town of Rovinj.
details: Rovinj hosts intimate jazz performances in the charming cobblestoned old town, with outdoor concerts overlooking the turquoise Adriatic.

name: Réunion Sakifo Music Festival
desc: Three-day music festival on Reunion Island blending French, Creole, African, and Indian Ocean sounds.
details: Sakifo is Reunion Island's premier music festival, held outdoors in Saint-Pierre with views of the Indian Ocean. It features a diverse lineup blending French chanson, maloya and sega music, reggae, world music, and contemporary acts from across the Indian Ocean region.

name: Shanghai Tourism Festival
desc: City-wide celebrations, parades, performances and tourism-focused programming.

name: Sharjah Biennial (if scheduled)
desc: Major contemporary art biennial in Sharjah known for its focus on non-Western perspectives.
details: One of the most important art biennials in the Middle East, featuring international artists and curators exploring contemporary themes.

name: Singapore International Festival of Arts (SIFA)
desc: Flagship arts festival featuring theatre, dance, music and multidisciplinary works.

name: Chingay Parade
desc: Large multicultural street parade featuring floats, dance troupes and performances.

name: Counterpublic Triennial
desc: A civic exhibition embedding contemporary art into the daily life of St. Louis neighborhoods.
details: Titled 'Coyote Time', the 2026 edition features new commissions by 50 artists situated across key city locations. It focuses heavily on racial equity, urban history, and community reparations, pushing the boundaries of what public art can achieve.

name: WinterWonderGrass Colorado
desc: A highly spirited bluegrass and craft beer festival held in the freezing Rocky Mountains.
details: The festival celebrates the authentic roots of American acoustic music and regional brewing. Attendees brave extreme winter weather, creating a uniquely intense, communal, and massive party atmosphere.

name: Tabuk Arts & Heritage Festival
desc: Heritage and arts festival in the northwestern region celebrating local Bedouin culture.
details: Features traditional arts, Bedouin heritage, cultural displays, and entertainment in the scenic Tabuk region.

name: Taiwan Pride
desc: Large LGBTQ+ pride parade and related cultural programming in Taipei.

name: Festival of the Ksour
desc: A celebration of Berber fortified granaries in the mountain villages of Tataouine, showcasing rural gatherings and traditional architecture.
details: This festival celebrates the unique fortified granaries (ksour) of southern Tunisia's Berber heritage. Set among the mountain villages of Tataouine—locations famous as Star Wars filming sites—it features rural gatherings, traditional music, and celebrations of the region's distinctive architecture and culture.

name: World Acadian Congress (when applicable)
desc: Massive gathering of the global Acadian diaspora celebrating culture, genealogy, and community.
details: The World Acadian Congress brings together Acadians from around the world for family reunions, cultural celebrations, music, historical events, and the exploration of Acadian genealogy and identity. Held every five years in Acadian communities.

name: Sumidagawa Fireworks Festival
desc: Large fireworks display along the Sumida River drawing major summer crowds.

name: Tokyo International Film Festival
desc: Major film festival showcasing international and Japanese cinema, industry events and screenings.

name: Light Art Festival Trenčín
desc: Immersive outdoor festival of illumination and lasers.
details: Features intimate encounters with European authors, theatrical readings, and the celebrated return of the Month of Author Readings.

name: Tulum Todo El Año 2026 - Year-Round Programming
desc: Monthly cultural, musical, wellness events by Zamna Group
details: Jan: global electronic music; Feb: romance/event tourism; Mar: electronic/global pop; Apr: art/gastronomy/wellness; May: world music/Latin rock; June: wellness/Eastern culture; July: global rap/hip hop; Oct: cinema/culture; Nov: music/culture/gastronomy; Dec: electronic music.

name: Ubon Ratchathani Candle Festival
desc: Elaborate wax candle sculptures paraded for Buddhist Lent.

name: Victoria Falls Marathon
desc: Marathon alongside one of the Seven Natural Wonders of the World.
details: The Victoria Falls Marathon takes runners through game reserves past elephants, giraffes, and zebras, with the spray of Victoria Falls visible throughout. It is regularly voted one of the world's most scenic marathons.

name: Boat Racing Festival (Boun Suang Heua)
desc: Longboat races on the Mekong with temple fairs and community celebrations.

name: Kwita Izina (Gorilla Naming Ceremony)
desc: Week-long ceremony to name baby mountain gorillas, tied to conservation and Rwandan naming tradition.

name: Wadi El Rayan Sand Festival
desc: Desert festival in the Fayoum oasis featuring sand sculpting, desert safaris, and Bedouin culture.
details: Celebrates the desert landscape of Wadi El Rayan with sand art, camping, off-road activities, and traditional Bedouin hospitality.

name: Wadi Rum Desert Festival
desc: Cultural festival celebrating Bedouin heritage in the spectacular desert landscape of Wadi Rum.
details: Features Bedouin traditions, camel racing, traditional music, poetry, food, and storytelling in the UNESCO World Heritage desert landscape.

name: Smithsonian American Art Museum Renwick Gallery Wonder Exhibition
desc: Immersive art installations at the Renwick Gallery adjacent to the White House.
details: The Renwick Gallery, part of the Smithsonian American Art Museum, hosts rotating immersive art exhibitions that transform its grand 19th-century galleries into extraordinary sensory experiences. Past exhibitions have drawn record crowds and social media attention.

name: Waza National Park Festival
desc: Cultural festival at Cameroon's premier wildlife park combining conservation and local culture.
details: The Waza Festival combines wildlife viewing in Cameroon's most famous national park with celebrations of local Fulani, Mandara, and Kotoko cultural traditions including music, dance, and traditional crafts.

name: Weinfest Würzburg
desc: Wine festival in the heart of Franconian wine country.
details: Würzburg's Weinfest celebrates Franconian wines with tastings, concerts, and festivities below the Marienberg Fortress, one of many Franconian wine festivals.

name: Festival National des Arts et de la Culture (FENAC)
desc: Cameroon's national arts festival bringing together artists from all 10 regions.
details: FENAC is Cameroon's premier national arts festival, bringing together artists, musicians, dancers, and craftspeople from all 10 regions of the country. It features performances, exhibitions, and competitions celebrating Cameroon's extraordinary cultural diversity.

name: St. Lazarus Day
desc: St. Lazarus Day — teen girls in traditional costume roam their towns singing folk songs
details: teen girls in traditional costume roam their towns singing folk songs

name: Pchum Ben
desc: Ancestral remembrance festival with offerings at pagodas over a multi-day period.

name: Islands Folk Festival
desc: Intimate folk music events across BC's beautiful Gulf Islands.
details: The Gulf Islands host intimate folk and roots music events throughout the summer, with performances in community halls, farms, and outdoor stages on these idyllic islands accessible only by ferry.

name: Acadian World Congress Connection Events
desc: Events celebrating Acadian diaspora identity in Maritime provinces.
details: Acadian cultural events across New Brunswick celebrate the resilience and joie de vivre of the Acadian people through music, food, and heritage.

name: Fiesta de San Pedro y San Pablo
desc: Fishermen’s patron saint processions, boat parades and seafood fairs.

name: Dominican Republic Fiestas Patronales (Various)
desc: Patron saint festivals held at various times in multiple towns celebrating local saints with food, live music, and community celebrations.
details: Fiestas patronales are held in every city and town, some hosting several festivals yearly. These are often preceded by a novena (nine-day run-up) of mini celebrations and processions before the big day. Each town's Fiestas Patronales honor local saints, blending Catholic rituals with African-influenced voodoo practices. Celebrations last a little over a week with nonstop partying.

name: Liberation Day
desc: Liberation Day — parades across Italy, particularly big in Rome; some closures); also St. Mark's Day, Venice (traghetto races, concerts
details: parades across Italy, particularly big in Rome; some closures); also St. Mark's Day, Venice (traghetto races, concerts

name: Puerto Rico Fiestas Patronales (Various)
desc: Yearly celebrations in each Puerto Rican municipality lasting ten days with food, live music, drumming, and all-night partying.
details: Every municipality of Puerto Rico holds its own fiesta, with some places hosting several. Festivities last ten days including the listed date, with activities held evenings on weekdays and all day on weekends. Examples include: February - Fiestas Patronales de Nuestra Señora de la Candelaria (Lajas, Coamo, Manatí, Mayagüez); July - Fiestas Patronales de Nuestra Sra. del Carmen (Cidra, Morovis, Caguas, Culebra, Rio Grande, Vieques, Cataño, Hatillo), San Germán Euserre (San Germán), Santiago Apóstol (Fajardo, Santa Isabel, Guánica); August - Fiestas Patronales de San Joaquín & Santa Ana (Adjuntas), Santa Rosa de Lima (Rincón), Nuestra Señora de Asunción (Cayey), Santo Cristo de la Salud (Comerio); September - Nuestra Señora de las Mercedes, San Miguel Arcángel (various municipalities).

name: Dos de Mayo/Madrid Day
desc: Dos de Mayo/Madrid Day — closures in the city, street parties centered on Plaza 2 de Mayo, fireworks on evening prior
details: closures in the city, street parties centered on Plaza 2 de Mayo, fireworks on evening prior

name: Dia de los Reyes Magos
desc: Dia de los Reyes Magos — Epiphany/Three Kings Day parades on night before; closures on January 6
details: Epiphany/Three Kings Day parades on night before; closures on January 6

name: Assumption
desc: Assumption — fairs, parades, general revelry throughout Spain, most notably Madrid's Verbena de la Paloma festival; closures
details: fairs, parades, general revelry throughout Spain, most notably Madrid's Verbena de la Paloma festival; closures

name: Gambia Bird Festival
desc: Birdwatching festival in one of Africa's premier birding destinations.
details: The Gambia is one of the top birdwatching destinations in Africa with over 560 species in a tiny country. The Bird Festival features guided birding excursions, photography workshops, and conservation talks alongside cultural activities.

name: Fest for Beatles Fans
desc: World's largest Beatles fan convention featuring tribute bands, memorabilia, and celebrity guests.
details: The Fest for Beatles Fans brings together thousands of Beatles enthusiasts for live performances, celebrity guest appearances (former band members, associates), vendor markets of memorabilia, film screenings, and panel discussions about the Fab Four's enduring legacy.

name: Abidjan Jazz Festival
desc: Jazz festival in Abidjan featuring local and international jazz musicians.
details: The Abidjan Jazz Festival brings together Ivorian and international jazz musicians for concerts and jam sessions in the Ivorian economic capital. It celebrates the jazz traditions of Francophone West Africa.

name: Kora Jazz Festival
desc: Jazz festival in Abidjan featuring West African jazz traditions and international artists.
details: The Kora Jazz Festival in Abidjan celebrates West African jazz traditions alongside international jazz artists. It highlights the kora (West African harp) and other traditional instruments alongside contemporary jazz fusion.

name: Accra Fashion Week
desc: West Africa's premier fashion event showcasing Ghanaian and African designers.
details: Accra Fashion Week is one of West Africa's most important fashion events, featuring runway shows from Ghanaian and international designers, textile exhibitions, and industry networking in Ghana's dynamic capital.

name: Addis Ababa Fashion Week
desc: East Africa's premier fashion event showcasing Ethiopian and African designers.
details: Addis Ababa Fashion Week is one of East Africa's most prestigious fashion events, showcasing collections from Ethiopian and international designers. It highlights Ethiopia's rich textile heritage, including the iconic shemma cloth, alongside contemporary African fashion.

name: Tuareg Camel Market
desc: Vibrant weekly gathering of Tuareg nomads trading camels, livestock, and goods in the Sahara.
details: The Tuareg camel markets of the Sahara, particularly around Agadez, are vibrant weekly gatherings where blue-robed Tuareg nomads trade camels, goats, and goods. The atmosphere of haggling, tea-drinking, and storytelling offers an authentic glimpse into Saharan nomadic life.

name: Almaty Jazz Festival
desc: Annual jazz festival attracting renowned musicians from Kazakhstan and worldwide.
details: Features concerts, workshops, jam sessions providing platforms for established and emerging artists. Supported by EverJazz Club. Part of Almaty's growing international music scene.

name: San Juan Ára (San Juan festivities)
desc: Bonfires, traditional games and street food rooted in June saint days.

name: Bamiyan Silk Road Festival
desc: Cultural event at the historic Silk Road hub near the former Buddha cliff sites.
details: 3-5 day cultural event showcasing Bamiyan's role as a historic Silk Road hub. Features concerts with traditional and contemporary music, folk dances, photo exhibitions, and handicraft displays near the Buddha cliff.

name: Bergen Food Festival
desc: Culinary journey through Norway's fjord cuisine, set between majestic mountains and deep fjords.
details: The Bergen Food Festival celebrates the bounty of Fjord Norway with local producers, chefs, and artisan food and drink. Set at Festplassen in the heart of Bergen, visitors enjoy tastings, demonstrations, and meals celebrating the region's seafood, game, and produce. The Norwegian Cider Festival runs alongside.

name: Festival Internacional de Teatro
desc: Multinational cultural theater event held in Caracas since 1973 celebrating international and Venezuelan performing arts.
details: Officially biennial festival (though schedule has varied). Major cultural event showcasing international theater, dance, performance arts. Involves multiple Venezuelan cities. Official website: www.fitcaracas.blogspot.com. 2026 edition details not yet publicly announced; check official sources closer to event date.

name: Chonburi Buffalo Racing Festival
desc: A 100-year-old tradition of racing water buffaloes over 100 meters at surprising speed.
details: Visitors discover how agile and fast water buffaloes can be during this century-old festival. Jockeys race their decorated buffaloes down a 100-meter course while spectators cheer from the sidelines. The event celebrates the buffalo's importance to Thai farming culture, combined with music, food stalls, and cultural entertainment.

name: Carnival of Cologne (Kölner Karneval)
desc: Major Rhineland carnival with costume parades, street parties, and satirical floats.

name: Spring Fair
desc: Spring Fair — smaller version of Sevilla's April Fair; kicks off with midnight fireworks
details: smaller version of Sevilla's April Fair; kicks off with midnight fireworks

name: Dakar Fashion Week
desc: West Africa's most prestigious fashion event showcasing Senegalese and African designers.
details: Dakar Fashion Week is one of Africa's most important fashion events, featuring runway shows from leading Senegalese and international designers. It highlights the rich textile traditions of West Africa alongside contemporary African haute couture.

name: Swahili International Fashion Week
desc: East Africa's leading fashion event showcasing Tanzanian and regional designers.
details: Swahili Fashion Week is East Africa's oldest fashion platform, showcasing Tanzanian and regional designers alongside international guests. It highlights the vibrant kitenge and khanga textile traditions alongside contemporary African fashion.

name: Gárdonyi Days
desc: Gárdonyi Days — free open-air concerts celebrating local writer
details: free open-air concerts celebrating local writer

name: Early Music Days
desc: Early Music Days — concert series put on by the Hungary Philharmonic
details: concert series put on by the Hungary Philharmonic

name: Fires de Sant Narcis
desc: Fires de Sant Narcis — procession, human-tower building, fireworks
details: procession, human-tower building, fireworks

name: Festival Internacional de Cine de Guadalajara (FICG)
desc: Major film festival and industry market in Latin America.

name: Harare Chitown Jazz Festival
desc: Zimbabwe's premier jazz event featuring local and international jazz musicians.
details: The Harare Chitown Jazz Festival is Zimbabwe's foremost jazz event, bringing together local and international jazz musicians for a weekend of performances. It celebrates Zimbabwe's rich jazz tradition and provides a platform for emerging Zimbabwean jazz artists.

name: Festival de Rumba
desc: Festival celebrating Cuba's iconic rumba music and dance traditions.
details: Rumba is one of Cuba's most authentic musical traditions, blending African and Spanish influences. The festival typically features performances by renowned rumba groups, dancing competitions, and cultural exhibitions showcasing the history and evolution of rumba throughout Cuba.

name: Landshuter Hochzeit
desc: Spectacular medieval wedding reenactment held every four years.
details: Every four years, Landshut reenacts the 1475 wedding of Duke Ludwig and Princess Hedwig with 2,000 costumed participants. Not scheduled for 2026 (next: 2027) but worth noting.

name: Lethbridge Jazz Festival
desc: Southern Alberta jazz festival featuring Canadian and international jazz artists.
details: The Lethbridge Jazz Festival presents Canadian and international jazz artists in venues across this southern Alberta city, bringing world-class jazz to the prairies.

name: Luanda International Jazz Festival
desc: Jazz festival in Angola's capital celebrating the growing jazz scene in Lusophone Africa.
details: The Luanda International Jazz Festival brings together Angolan, Portuguese, Brazilian, and international jazz musicians for concerts in Angola's vibrant capital. It reflects the growing jazz scene across Lusophone Africa.

name: Maputo Jazz Festival
desc: Jazz festival in Mozambique's capital featuring regional and international jazz musicians.
details: The Maputo Jazz Festival brings together jazz musicians from Mozambique, Southern Africa, and internationally for concerts and jam sessions in the vibrant Mozambican capital.

name: Citywave Milan Completion
desc: BIG-designed office buildings with massive photovoltaic canopy.
details: An ecological architectural landmark utilizing deep groundwater cooling to drastically cut energy demand by 40%.

name: Milano Olympic Village Completion
desc: Completion of SOM-designed communal housing and infrastructure.
details: Will serve as the athlete village for the Winter Games before immediately transitioning into a permanent urban residential and civic asset.

name: Donia Nosy Be Festival
desc: Island festival mixing Malagasy cultures with music, carnival and sports events.

name: Oulu 2026 - Arctic events
desc: European Capital of Culture Arctic programming (already noted).
details: Part of Oulu 2026 programme highlighting Arctic creativity and cultural exchange.

name: Sana'a Summer Festival
desc: Cultural festival celebrating Yemeni heritage in the UNESCO-listed Old City of Sana'a.
details: When held, features traditional Yemeni music, dance, crafts, and cultural displays in the historic old city. Subject to security conditions.

name: Kastelruther Spatzen Open Air
desc: Kastelruther Spatzen Open Air — concert series featuring hometown Schlager group
details: concert series featuring hometown Schlager group

name: Feria de San Miguel
desc: Feria de San Miguel — bullfights
details: bullfights

name: 73rd Palio horse race
desc: 【73†Palio horse race】.

name: Sitges Film Festival
desc: World's premier genre film festival for fantasy, horror, and sci-fi.
details: Sitges Fantastic Film Festival is the world's leading genre film festival, premiering horror, fantasy, and sci-fi films in the charming coastal town south of Barcelona.

name: Swakopmund Oktoberfest
desc: German-inspired beer festival in Namibia's seaside town reflecting its colonial heritage.
details: Swakopmund's Oktoberfest celebrates Namibia's German colonial heritage with traditional Bavarian food, local craft beers, oompah bands, lederhosen, and dirndls in this quirky seaside town where German architecture meets the Namibian desert coast.

name: Tanjazz Festival
desc: A three-day jazz festival in Tangier with free concerts and performances in the streets of this cosmopolitan Mediterranean city.
details: Tangier hosts this three-day jazz festival annually with a mix of paid and free concerts spread across indoor venues and outdoor street performances. The cosmopolitan city, long a magnet for international artists and writers, provides the perfect atmospheric setting for jazz.

name: Nowruz (Persian New Year)
desc: Spring equinox new year celebrated with haft-seen tables, family visits, and public festivities across Iran and neighboring countries.

name: Feast of Our Lady of Good Health
desc: Feast of Our Lady of Good Health — religious festival, bridge built over Grand Canal
details: religious festival, bridge built over Grand Canal

name: Victoria Falls Bungee Jumping Festival
desc: Adventure tourism experiences at one of the world's premier bungee jumping sites.
details: Victoria Falls Bridge, spanning the gorge between Zimbabwe and Zambia, is one of the world's most spectacular bungee jumping sites. The 111-meter jump with the thundering falls as backdrop attracts adventure seekers year-round.

name: Tour du Faso
desc: Africa's most prestigious professional cycling race through the landscapes of Burkina Faso.
details: The Tour du Faso is Africa's most important professional cycling stage race, covering approximately 1,200km through Burkina Faso over 10 stages. International and African teams compete across diverse terrain from Sahel to savanna.

name: Festival of Trees
desc: Holiday charity events featuring elaborately decorated trees, galas, and community celebrations.
details: Festivals of Trees in cities across North America feature lavishly decorated Christmas trees displayed in convention centers, with galas, family events, and tree auctions benefiting local charities.

name: Taste of Addis Food Festival
desc: Food festival celebrating Ethiopian culinary traditions and the growing restaurant scene.
details: Taste of Addis celebrates Ethiopia's extraordinary culinary heritage, from injera and kitfo to regional specialties. Top Addis Ababa restaurants offer tasting portions alongside cooking demonstrations, coffee ceremonies, and traditional music.

name: Addis Ababa Marathon
desc: Marathon at altitude in the world's running capital.
details: The Addis Ababa Marathon offers runners the unique experience of racing at 2,400m altitude in the city that has produced more Olympic distance champions than any other. The energy of running alongside some of the world's fastest runners is unforgettable.

name: National Festival of Contemporary Dance
desc: An international contemporary dance festival bringing together performers from across Africa and the Arab world to Algiers.
details: This festival attracts contemporary dancers and choreographers from Algeria, the broader Arab world, and internationally. Two weeks of performances, workshops, and cultural activities take place across venues in Algeria's capital, promoting contemporary arts in a country with rich artistic heritage.

name: Almabtrieb processions
desc: Almabtrieb processions — cows come down from the mountains dressed in their finery
details: cows come down from the mountains dressed in their finery

name: Ankara Intl Music Festival
desc: Annual international music festival established in 1984 with chamber music, jazz, and dance.
details: Established by the Sevda-Cenap And Music Foundation featuring chamber music, jazz, nostalgia, vocal, modern dance, and Flamenco.

name: Belize Carnival (Carnival Road March)
desc: Costume bands and soca/dancehall parades in Belize’s largest city.

name: Bodrum Intl Jazz Festival
desc: One of Turkey's most important international musical events in the coastal city of Bodrum.
details: Combines stunning coastal nature with distinctive musical atmosphere featuring international jazz artists.

name: Fespam (Pan-African Music Festival)
desc: Pan-African music festival in Brazzaville celebrating the continent's diverse musical heritage.
details: FESPAM (Festival Panafricain de Musique) in Brazzaville is one of Central Africa's most significant cultural events, bringing together musicians from across the continent to celebrate Africa's diverse musical heritage through concerts, workshops, and cultural exchanges.

name: George Enescu Festival
desc: Prestigious classical music festival named after Romania's greatest composer.
details: The George Enescu Festival is one of the world's largest classical music events, bringing top orchestras and soloists to Bucharest's Athenaeum and Palace Hall.

name: Buenos Aires International Book Fair
desc: One of the world’s largest Spanish-language book fairs with talks and cultural programming.

name: Cartagena International Film Festival
desc: Latin America's most prestigious film festival set in Cartagena's stunning colonial walled city.
details: FICCI is one of Latin America's most prestigious film events. Showcases Colombian and Latin American cinema alongside international works — features, shorts, documentaries, animation, and experimental. Set against Cartagena's UNESCO World Heritage walled city. Attracts filmmakers, actors, and cinephiles worldwide.

name: St. Lucia Jazz Festival
desc: Premier Caribbean jazz festival set against St. Lucia's dramatic Piton mountains.
details: One of the Caribbean's most prestigious music events with world-class jazz, R&B, soul, and Caribbean artists performing against the backdrop of the twin Piton mountains. Combines headliner concerts at Pigeon Island with free community concerts and intimate jazz sessions.

name: Rabin Ajau (Indigenous ‘daughter of the king’ pageant)
desc: Indigenous culture showcase with dance, textiles and ceremonial presentations.

name: Fiesta de la Vendimia (wine harvest)
desc: Grape-stomping, tastings and folk music celebrating harvest season.

name: Cph:dox
desc: Major international documentary film festival.
details: Famed for blurring the lines between documentary, visual art, and political activism through immersive storytelling.

name: Whale Worship Festival
desc: A unique maritime cultural tradition honoring the Whale God, especially vibrant in coastal Vietnamese communities.
details: The Whale Worship Festival is a distinctive maritime tradition found in Vietnamese coastal communities, particularly vibrant in Da Nang and fishing villages. Communities honor the Whale God (Ca Ong) with elaborate temple ceremonies, boat processions, traditional music, and communal feasts. The festival reflects the deep spiritual connection between Vietnamese fishermen and the sea.

name: Senegalese Wrestling Grand Prix
desc: The biggest bouts of Senegalese wrestling with elaborate mystical pre-fight rituals.
details: The Grand Prix fights of Senegalese wrestling (la lutte avec frappe) fill Dakar's Demba Diop stadium with 60,000 fans. Fighters perform elaborate mystical rituals with marabouts before bouts, dousing themselves in potions and amulets. The atmosphere rivals any sporting event on the planet.

name: Dar es Salaam International Film Festival
desc: Film festival in Tanzania's largest city screening African and international cinema.
details: The Dar es Salaam International Film Festival screens a selection of African and international films alongside workshops and industry talks, promoting East African filmmaking talent.

name: Americas Biennial
desc: A cultural festival celebrating the ideas, culture, and people of the Western Hemisphere.
details: The Biennial of the Americas uniquely blends visual art with high-level geopolitical and economic symposiums. It fosters collaboration and cohesion among the 35 nations of North, Central, and South America.

name: Diriyah Biennale
desc: Major contemporary art exhibition in the Middle East.
details: Represents Saudi Arabia's aggressive cultural diplomacy and investment in the global arts ecosystem.

name: Djemila International Music Festival
desc: Music performances amid spectacular Roman ruins in the UNESCO site of Djemila.
details: The Djemila International Music Festival hosts concerts in the magnificent setting of the Roman ruins of Djemila (Cuicul), a UNESCO World Heritage Site in northeastern Algeria. The combination of ancient architecture and modern music creates an unforgettable experience.

name: Bestival
desc: Boutique music and arts festival known for fancy dress themes and eclectic lineups.
details: Bestival combines major music acts with elaborate fancy dress themes, art installations, and a party atmosphere. It's a uniquely British celebration of creativity and music.

name: Andorra Land Art
desc: An international biennial inserting massive land art into the Pyrenean landscape.
details: The biennial aims to build a 'country-scape' by embellishing Andorra's natural and urban environments with outdoor installations. It is a strategic effort to boost cultural tourism during off-peak seasons.

name: Essaouira Andalusian Music Festival
desc: Festival celebrating the Andalusian musical heritage shared between Morocco and Spain.
details: The Essaouira Andalusian Music Festival celebrates the shared musical heritage between Morocco and Spain. Performers present classical Andalusian (Al-Ala) music alongside flamenco and contemporary fusion in the atmospheric setting of Essaouira's medina.

name: Freetown Music Festival
desc: Music festival celebrating Sierra Leonean music including palm wine guitar and Bubu music.
details: The Freetown Music Festival celebrates Sierra Leone's distinctive musical heritage including palm wine guitar, Bubu music, and contemporary Afro-pop. It features live performances, DJ sets, and cultural activities in the capital's vibrant nightlife district.

name: Hargeisa International Book Fair
desc: East Africa's largest book fair celebrating Somali literature and oral traditions.
details: The Hargeisa International Book Fair is one of East Africa's most significant literary events, celebrating Somali literature, poetry, and oral traditions. It features author talks, book launches, panel discussions, film screenings, and music performances.

name: Harhoura Atlantic Music Festival
desc: Beachside music festival on Morocco's Atlantic coast near Rabat.
details: The Harhoura Atlantic Music Festival features local and international musicians performing on the Atlantic coast near Rabat. The beach setting combines Moroccan hospitality with diverse musical genres.

name: Cuasimodo (Huaso tradition)
desc: Horseback riders escort communion to the sick the Sunday after Easter.

name: Kigali Design Week
desc: Design festival showcasing Rwandan and East African creative talent.
details: Kigali Design Week brings together architects, product designers, fashion designers, and visual artists from Rwanda and across East Africa for exhibitions, talks, and workshops exploring contemporary African design and its role in shaping the continent's future.

name: Kigali Up Music Festival
desc: Kigali's largest outdoor music festival showcasing Rwandan and East African talent.
details: Kigali Up is Rwanda's biggest outdoor music festival, featuring local and regional artists performing across multiple stages. It celebrates Rwanda's growing music scene and creative economy in the heart of Kigali.

name: Beneath the Baobabs Festival
desc: Multi-stage East African music festival set near the coast beneath baobab trees; eco-friendly ethos.

name: Kuwait Music Festival
desc: Music festival featuring Arab and international artists at Kuwait's cultural venues.
details: Showcases diverse musical genres at venues including the Sheikh Jaber Al-Ahmad Cultural Centre.

name: Eyo Festival
desc: Colorful masquerade procession of white-robed figures through Lagos streets honoring departed souls.
details: The Eyo Festival, or Adamu Orisa Play, features processions of masquerades dressed in flowing white robes and broad-brimmed hats through Lagos Island. Each Eyo group represents a prominent Lagos family and the festival celebrates the passage of a soul to the afterlife. It is not held annually but on special occasions.

name: Limassol Wine Festival
desc: Cyprus's premier wine festival in the Municipal Gardens.
details: The 65th Limassol Wine Festival celebrates Cypriot winemaking with tastings, live music, traditional dancing, food stalls, and workshops in the Municipal Gardens.

name: LFW Fall 2026
desc: British designers present autumn collections.
details: A mix of established British heritage brands and provocative new graduates from Central Saint Martins.

name: LFW Spring 2027
desc: The most avant-garde of the major fashion weeks.
details: Known for highlighting radical new talent, sustainable practices, and subcultural sartorial shifts.

name: Luanda Music Festival
desc: Music festival celebrating Angola's diverse musical heritage from kizomba to kuduro.
details: The Luanda Music Festival celebrates Angola's extraordinary musical diversity, from the romantic kizomba and classic semba to the high-energy electronic dance style of kuduro that has gone global. International and local artists perform across multiple stages.

name: Gabonese Mask Festival
desc: Traditional forest-peoples mask ceremonies in Gabon's equatorial forest.
details: Gabon's equatorial forest peoples, including the Fang and Punu, perform elaborate mask ceremonies tied to initiation, healing, and spiritual practices. The Punu white-faced masks and Fang reliquary figures are among the most important in African art.

name: Maputo International Music Festival
desc: International music festival celebrating Mozambican and global musical traditions.
details: The Maputo International Music Festival brings together musicians from Mozambique and around the world for concerts, jam sessions, and cultural exchanges. It showcases Mozambique's unique musical styles including marrabenta, timbila, and contemporary pop.

name: Marrakech Food Festival
desc: Culinary event celebrating Moroccan cuisine from tagines to pastilla in the Red City.
details: The Marrakech Food Festival celebrates Morocco's extraordinary culinary heritage with cooking demonstrations, food tours through the souks, chef competitions, and tastings of traditional dishes from tagines to pastilla in the atmospheric setting of the Red City.

name: MFW Fall 2026
desc: Italian luxury houses unveil winter collections.
details: Features the heavy use of luxurious textiles, furs, and heavy leathers signature to Italian winter fashion.

name: MFW Spring 2027
desc: Showcase of Italian luxury and craftsmanship.
details: Dominated by legacy brands emphasizing leather goods, immaculate tailoring, and high-glamour aesthetics.

name: Swahili Cultural Centre Events
desc: Year-round cultural programming showcasing Swahili music, dance, and traditions.
details: Mombasa's Swahili cultural centres offer year-round programming featuring traditional Taarab music, ngoma dances, Swahili cooking classes, henna art, and storytelling evenings that celebrate the rich cultural heritage of the East African coast.

name: Mombasa Food Festival
desc: Celebration of Swahili cuisine and coastal Kenyan food traditions.
details: The Mombasa Food Festival celebrates the rich Swahili culinary heritage of Kenya's coast, featuring biryani, pilau, samosas, mkate wa nyama, and fresh seafood prepared by local chefs and home cooks.

name: Semana Criolla
desc: Rural traditions, payadas, rodeo-style events and artisan markets.

name: Nairobi Half Marathon
desc: Major road race in the home of distance running legends.
details: The Nairobi Half Marathon attracts world-class Kenyan runners competing at altitude (1,795m) in the capital of the world's greatest distance running nation. It draws elite athletes alongside thousands of recreational runners.

name: Setouchi Triennale
desc: An art festival across islands in Japan's Seto Inland Sea, combining contemporary art with island culture.
details: The Setouchi Triennale transforms islands of the Seto Inland Sea into art destinations. Held triennially since 2010 across Naoshima, Teshima, and other islands. The 2025 edition is current; next expected 2028.

name: NYFW Fall 2026
desc: Unveiling of American designer autumn collections.
details: Braves the winter weather to set the tone for the upcoming fall retail cycle across the Americas.

name: NYFW Spring 2027
desc: Unveiling of American designer spring collections.
details: Dictates global retail and editorial fashion trends for the subsequent calendar year with a focus on commercial viability.

name: Donia Music Festival
desc: Major music festival on the tropical island of Nosy Be celebrating Malagasy and Indian Ocean music.
details: The Donia Music Festival on the tropical island of Nosy Be is Madagascar's biggest music event, featuring local Malagasy artists alongside performers from across the Indian Ocean region. Set against white sand beaches and turquoise waters, it combines world music with island paradise vibes.

name: Earworm Media Art
desc: Media art curated from the Finnish National Gallery.
details: Running all year at Oulu City Hall, exposing the general public to highly experimental video and audio art.

name: PLAY Fotografiska Exhibition
desc: Fotografiska Tallinn's first major exhibition in Finland.
details: A year-round, world-class photography exhibition deeply exploring the ECoC's core theme of cultural climate change.

name: PFW Fall 2026
desc: The finale of the winter fashion circuit.
details: Major French conglomerates dictate the overarching silhouettes and color palettes for the global winter season.

name: PFW Spring 2027
desc: The climax of the fashion month circuit.
details: The most prestigious global fashion houses present their ready-to-wear collections to the industry elite.

name: Paris Haute Couture Summer
desc: The absolute pinnacle of bespoke fashion craft.
details: Only officially designated houses may show these incredibly labor-intensive, custom-fitted garments.

name: Festival de Música de Pomerode (festival Música Variada)
desc: Regional music festival showcasing Pomeranian musical traditions alongside contemporary music performances.
details: Pomerode has become known as a music destination with various festivals celebrating both traditional German-influenced music and modern genres. The town's cultural heritage combines with contemporary programming.

name: Praia Music Festival
desc: Music festival in Cape Verde's capital celebrating the islands' rich musical heritage.
details: The Praia Music Festival on Santiago island features live performances of morna, coladeira, funaná, and contemporary Cape Verdean music alongside international acts in the capital city's venues and public spaces.

name: Subsonic Music Festival
desc: Boutique electronic music festival in a stunning river valley setting.
details: Subsonic brings electronic music lovers to the beautiful Riverwood Downs for a weekend of techno, house, drum and bass, and experimental electronic music across multiple stages in a pristine natural amphitheatre.

name: Kaamatan (Harvest Festival)
desc: Sabah harvest festival with cultural competitions, dances and community celebrations.

name: San Miguel de Allende Festivals 2026
desc: Colonial artist town with multiple festivals celebrating literature, film, art, religious holidays
details: Feb 10-14: San Miguel Writers' Conference & Literary Festival; Feb: Feria de la Candelaria (flower/garden fair); March: Festival de Cine SMA (independent film); April: Friday of Sorrows with decorated altars; June: Día de los Locos (costumed parade honoring St. Anthony); Sept: Independence Day celebrations, Michaelmas (La Alborada); Oct-Nov: Día de Muertos Catrina Parade.

name: São Paulo Biennial of Architecture
desc: Brazil's architecture biennial exploring urban design and spatial innovation.
details: The São Paulo Biennial of Architecture complements the city's art biennial. While specific 2026 details are not yet confirmed, the event contributes to São Paulo's position as Latin America's cultural capital.

name: Carnival of Awussu
desc: Parade-style summer carnival in Sousse.

name: Zanzibar Food Festival
desc: Celebration of Zanzibar's unique spice-infused cuisine and culinary traditions.
details: The Zanzibar Food Festival celebrates the island's renowned spice-infused cuisine, a unique blend of African, Arab, Indian, and Portuguese culinary traditions. Chefs and food vendors showcase traditional dishes like pilau, biryani, Zanzibari pizza, and fresh seafood.

name: Zanzibar Marathon
desc: Scenic marathon through the spice island's historic towns and tropical landscape.
details: The Zanzibar Marathon takes runners through the atmospheric streets of Stone Town, along white sand beaches, past spice plantations, and through fishing villages in one of Africa's most exotic running destinations.

name: Suzhou Museum of Contemp. Art
desc: A 60,000-square-meter complex on the Jinji Lake waterfront.
details: Designed by BIG, featuring twelve interconnected pavilions under a continuous roof inspired by local traditional garden architecture.

name: Thimpu Festival

details: The Toronto Small Press Book Fair brings together independent publishers, zine makers, comic artists, and literary artists for a celebration of DIY publishing culture, with readings, workshops, and sales of independent publications.

details: Part of the 'Waiting Places' project, demonstrating that high culture belongs even in unexpected, sterile clinical environments.

name: Carla Rebelo: Barbora's Thread

details: Weaves together fragments of original wooden floors from a local textile factory using delicate threads and shifting shadows.

details: The Journées Cinématographiques de Carthage (JCC) is the oldest film festival in the Arab world and Africa, founded in 1966. It screens films from Africa, Asia, and Latin America, providing a platform for cinema from the Global South.

details: The Ubud Food Festival has grown into Indonesia's premier food event, bringing together renowned chefs, local food artisans, and culinary storytellers. The multi-day event features cooking demonstrations, tastings, workshops, panel discussions, and long-table dinners, all celebrating Indonesia's incredibly diverse food heritage.

Notable patron saint festivals include Day of Altagracia in Higüey, Day of Mercedes in La Vega, and celebrations in other provinces. Festivities last ten days including the listed date with activities held evenings on weekdays and all day on weekends.

details: Sahara desert camps across Morocco, Tunisia, and Algeria offer overnight experiences with traditional Berber/Tuareg music around campfires, stunning stargazing in zero-light-pollution skies, camel trekking, and authentic desert cuisine. These are among Africa's most magical cultural experiences.

details: The Bori cult of the Hausa people features spirit possession ceremonies where practitioners enter trance states accompanied by specific musical rhythms. Each spirit has its own song, costume, and personality. These dramatic healing rituals are one of West Africa's most intense cultural experiences.

name: Artwalk (Multiple US Cities)

desc: Grand gatherings of historic tall sailing ships in port cities offering tours and maritime culture.
details: Tall Ships festivals bring majestic sailing vessels to port cities across North America for public tours, sail-pasts, maritime demonstrations, and waterfront celebrations. Major events occur in ports like Boston, Baltimore, Norfolk, Duluth, and Halifax.

name: Cochon555 Heritage BBQ Tour
desc: Touring culinary competition celebrating heritage breed pigs with top chef nose-to-tail cooking.
details: Cochon555 is a traveling culinary competition where five chefs each receive a heritage breed pig and prepare a nose-to-tail feast. Events across major US cities celebrate responsible farming and culinary artistry.

name: WOMAD Caceres (connection festivals in North America)
desc: World music festival events inspired by the global WOMAD movement celebrating world music and arts.
details: WOMAD-inspired world music events across North America present traditional and contemporary musicians from diverse global cultures, fostering cross-cultural understanding through music, dance, and art.

name: Addis International Film Festival
desc: Film festival showcasing Ethiopian and African cinema alongside international selections.
details: The Addis International Film Festival screens a diverse selection of Ethiopian, African, and international films with an emphasis on storytelling that highlights social issues, cultural heritage, and emerging artistic voices from the continent.

details: The Brazza Jazz Festival in Brazzaville features jazz musicians from Central Africa and internationally. The twin-city setting across the Congo River from Kinshasa creates a unique cultural corridor between the two Congos.

name: Shashmaqom Music Festival

details: Republican Festival of Young Performers celebrating Shashmaqom, a UNESCO-inscribed Intangible Cultural Heritage form of Uzbek music. Features soloists under 30 and ensembles performing instrumental and vocal traditions.

name: Old Mutual Kirstenbosch Craft Beer Festival
desc: Craft beer festival in the beautiful Kirstenbosch Botanical Gardens.
details: The Kirstenbosch Craft Beer Festival combines South Africa's thriving craft beer scene with the stunning setting of the botanical gardens. Over 50 breweries pour their finest alongside food stalls and live music.

name: Senegal Wrestling (Lutte) Season
desc: Senegal's national sport of traditional wrestling, more popular than football, with enormous cash prizes.
details: Senegalese wrestling (la lutte avec frappe) is the country's national obsession, more popular than football. Fighters perform mystical rituals before bouts in packed stadiums. The biggest fights draw 50,000+ spectators and prize money of hundreds of thousands of dollars.

The festival attracts large crowds who come to dance and celebrate.

details: The Bujumbura Music Festival features Burundian and East African musicians performing on the scenic shores of Lake Tanganyika, celebrating the country's musical traditions alongside contemporary genres.

name: Día de la Independencia celebrations
desc: Civic events, parades and concerts for independence day.

name: Festival Mondial des Arts Noirs (FESMAN)

details: FESMAN is one of the most historic Pan-African cultural events, first held in 1966 under Senegal's first president Léopold Sédar Senghor. When held, it brings together artists, musicians, writers, and intellectuals from across the African diaspora.

name: Death Valley Superbloom
desc: A rare explosive blooming of desert wildflowers.
details: Triggered by anomalous winter rainfall, turning the barren desert into a vast floral carpet for a brief, highly photographed window.

name: Glastonbury Abbey Extravaganza

details: A one-day concert in the atmospheric ruins of Glastonbury Abbey, featuring major artists in an intimate historic setting.

name: Fiesta Nacional del Surubí

name: Feria de Jocotenango (Virgin of the Assumption fair)

name: Isfahan International Film Festival for Children & Youth

details: Established in 1982, this festival is one of Asia's oldest and most respected children's film festivals. Held in the magnificent historic city of Isfahan, it showcases animated, live-action, and documentary films for young audiences from around the world, with workshops and cultural programming.

name: Festival del Ñandutí

name: La Gigantona & El Enano Cabezón (season)

name: PINTA (Contemporary Art Fair)

details: Held at Casa Prado in Miraflores, Pinta serves as an essential meeting point connecting artists, galleries, curators, and collectors from the region with the international art scene. Known for experimental and ambitious programming plus careful gallery selection, it stands as the region's most attractive international cultural event and a window to Peru's essence intertwining historical richness with contemporary influences. Pinta continues global expansion with three annual contemporary art fairs in 2026.

name: Dataland Opening
desc: The world's first museum dedicated to AI digital arts.
details: Created by Refik Anadol, it merges physical architecture with generative artificial intelligence exhibits and massive immersive data visualizations.

name: Fiestas de San Isidro Labrador

details: 43rd edition. Occupies 55,000 m² of commercial space. Brings together food industry leaders, restaurateurs, chefs from across Latin America.

name: Independence Day celebrations (Grito)
desc: Nightly ‘Grito’ ceremony, fireworks and civic parades.

name: Aichi Triennale

details: The Aichi Triennale has been held every three years since 2010 at venues throughout Aichi Prefecture including the Aichi Arts Center. Cycle suggests 2025 edition, with next in 2028, not 2026.

name: Blankets and Wine

details: Blankets and Wine is Nairobi's beloved monthly outdoor music experience where attendees picnic on blankets while enjoying live performances from top East African and international artists. It has become a cultural institution and a must-do for visitors to Nairobi.

name: Koroga Festival

details: The Koroga Festival (meaning 'to stir' in Swahili) is Kenya's premier outdoor experience combining music, food, and drinks. It features top African artists performing live alongside curated food experiences from Nairobi's best restaurants, held at scenic venues around Nairobi.

name: Fiesta Nacional del Inmigrante
desc: Immigrant communities present food, dance and traditions in themed pavilions.

name: Tombuctou Music Festival (Exile)

details: With the Festival au Désert suspended since 2012, exile editions keep the tradition of Saharan music alive through concerts in Ouagadougou and other cities, featuring Tuareg guitar bands, Songhoy blues, and traditional Malian griot music.

name: Hailuoto Theatre Festival

details: Utilizes the stark, unique maritime environment of Hailuoto island for highly immersive, site-specific storytelling.

name: Kuusamo Nature Photo Festival

details: Combines history, large-scale art, and ecology to tell the story of the river's immense impact on regional industrial development.

name: Tuira Sauna Art of Steam

details: Explores the intense social and philosophical importance of the sauna experience in extreme Arctic climates.

details: The Biennale de la Danse en Afrique at the Ecole des Sables in Toubab Dialaw is a major pan-African dance event bringing together choreographers, dancers, and companies from across the continent for performances, workshops, and exchange.

details: Biennale Jogja has been running since 1988 in Yogyakarta. The 17th edition (2023) began a new Equator series round running 2023-2027 under director Alia Swastika. Held in odd years, so 2025 or 2027 are expected, not 2026.

name: Carnival celebrations throughout Italy

details: street parties

name: Maasai Eunoto Ceremony
desc: Major Maasai warrior graduation ceremony where moran (warriors) transition to elderhood.
details: The Eunoto is one of the most important Maasai ceremonies, marking the transition of young men from junior warrior to senior warrior status. Participants shave their long ochre-dyed hair, their mothers perform traditional blessings, and cattle are sacrificed. The ceremony can last several days.

name: Tihar (Deepawali)

name: Sharo/Shadi Festival
desc: Fulani coming-of-age ceremony where young men endure flogging to prove their manhood.
details: The Sharo (or Shadi) Festival is a dramatic Fulani rite of passage where young men must endure being flogged by peers without showing pain. The young men are decorated and must smile through the beating to prove their courage and worthiness for marriage.

name: Dondo Masquerade Festival
desc: Secret society masquerade performances featuring elaborate costumes and spiritual rituals.
details: Sierra Leone's masquerade festivals feature the Dondo and other secret society masked performances. Elaborately costumed masqueraders perform spiritual rituals, dances, and community ceremonies that play a vital role in Mende, Temne, and other Sierra Leonean cultural traditions.

name: Alpine cattle descent

details: Alp- or Almaufzug...

details: The Grand Mariage (Anda) is the most important social event in Comorian culture. These elaborate multi-day wedding celebrations involve the entire community with traditional music, dance, feasting, and gift exchanges. A man's social status depends on having completed this ceremony.

details: The Himba people of Kunene region maintain ancient wedding traditions including the bride being rubbed with otjize (ochre butter), the preparation of a sacred fire, and communal singing and dancing. The ceremonies reflect the Himba's distinctive red-ochre culture.

details: The Royal Drummers of Burundi (Ingoma) are UNESCO-recognized masters of their craft. Their thunderous performances on sacred karyenda drums have toured the world. In Burundi, they perform at national events and cultural celebrations with extraordinary power and precision.

details: The Moroccan fantasia (tbourida) is a spectacular equestrian tradition where groups of horsemen in traditional dress charge at full gallop before simultaneously firing muskets skyward. These dramatic displays take place at moussems across Morocco throughout the year. The tradition is UNESCO-listed.
